text:
I'd been hearing about this place for forever, so when I was planning a trip to Portland, I knew I'd have to pop in and try them, overrated or not. So I did - popped in mid-day on Sunday, saw a line around the block, and said yeah, seriously, *screw* that. Definitely not worth it. 

Then we gave it another shot Monday mid-morning before we left for our flight back home, and there were only a few people in line - night and day different. So we grabbed a few things to take back with us, and they were all fantastic. We tried: a Mexican chocolate cake donut, which was glorious (pretty simple donut, but perfect consistency for a cake donut, tons of flavor, and the perfect amount of kick), a cream-filled donut (also the perfect consistency, not too oily like donuts of that sort often are, and in my opinion, a much creamier and less processed-tasting filling than is typical), the famous maple bacon bar (basically just a basic-but-excellent maple bar, with a couple slabs of bacon processed to be crumbly but still basically taste like bacon, which absolutely did add great flavor while still being surprisingly easy to eat without it falling apart), and an apple fritter (my wife insisted on that one - it was a great fritter, and giant, but I wouldn't get it again, being that it isn't a donut, and donuts are clearly their forte.)

I was expecting that such a famous tourist destination would've jacked up their prices sky-high, so I was very pleasantly surprised to discover that they're actually pretty reasonable. I mean, they're not *cheap*, but they're not crazy, either. I thought the prices were completely sane, and I would absolutely come back any time I was in Portland - but only if there *wasn't* a line out the door and around the block. They weren't *that* good. I'd totally wait a few minutes in line for them, though.
Had to act like a tourist and stop by voodoo today before heading back to bend. Donuts were good my daughters face lit up when she saw the oreo donut. It was a good time
Fun store.  Cool ambience.  Weird.  We got cock and balls, very funny donut.  We also got the delicious Memphis Mafia!  Definitely worth visiting if you're in Portland

I think the people here are smoking something - and that's fine with me!

The fruit loop doughnut is my all time fav!  I know that people like the bacon one, but to me, thats just wrong. But please keep making the cereal ones!

"I got VD in Portland"

A. You had an interesting night and need to go to get that looked at.
B. You should ride your bike for 5 hours to work off that delicious frosting.
C. More than likely both as you stumble out of Old Town at some unholy hour of the morning.

Everything about this place is awesome.

NOM NOM NOM NOM

I'm a fan of the Voodoo Doll, ODB, and Bacon Maple.

Sure wish they would expand to Seattle.

A Portland landmark fo sho. We landed in Portland on a rainy Thursday night, and after a late dinner, mustered the strength to walk through the Pearl to Voodoo. Well, guess what. There's no sign of that infamous long line when you go at 4am on a weeknight in the rain. We got to stand there and weigh our options, pick the cashier's brain on the pros and cons of certain flavors, AND when we finally decided on a few, they gave us a dozen. Because it was the time when they bake new ones for the day.

So we got to try just about everything on the menu. The elvis fritter was really good, so I imagine all the fritters are delish. The maple bacon is amazing, "tastes like breakfast," I said. Then I was like ew this is so many donuts (which I don't even really like) and just ate all the rest of the bacon. MMMM BACON!

Extra star for the lovely voodoo/donut artwork.

A fabulous must see if you are in Portland.  I've seen the shop featured on shows but never thought I would actually get a chance to check it out.  I treated myself to a Homer Simpson donut that featured pink icing and little colored sprinkles. mmmm donut!

These guys are absolutely phenomenal. I brought my desktop in on Saturday and back on the internet by Wednesday afternoon the following week. They are great listeners and on the top of their field.

Without question or doubt, Justin and the 12:01 staff will see me again if a computer need arises. I couldn't ask for a friendlier and more competent group of people. 

My computer is now humming along beautifully. Thank you for your dedication and caring attitude. 

Jerry
Loved it! Great creative and inventive donuts, fair prices and more than friendly staff!

This is the world's spookiest donut place. Whenever I'm in the great state of Oregon I take the MAX line downtown and walk up to Voodoo donuts. Even though I almost never eat donuts, you gotta have a voodoo donut. You just gotta. They are open 23 hours a day. (I'm guessing the one remaining hour of the day is when they close so that the employee behind the counter can shoot up to stay awake for the other 23 hours of the day.) They are right next to a guitar shop-all the more reason for me to come and visit them. They have all kinds of crazy donuts. I couldn't name them all. They have a wall dedicated to dead b rated movie performers-it has old newspaper articles on the death of the guy who played Mike Brady in the Brady Bunch for example. Another wall when I was there, was dedicated to other horror movie characters, and some local roller derby team. The whole store is so small but even still, there is a little stage above what i think is a closet or a restroom where I'm told bands will perform. Whoever thought you could market donuts in such a spooky way? It must be the place to be on Halloween in Portland or on Kurt Kobain's birthday. Whoever owns this place must be making a killing. Why couldn't I have thought of this first?

So what makes one doughnut better than another?  Unless they're stale, it's hard to find a bad one and most are pretty much the same, everywhere you go.  And then there's Voodoo.  Provocative bordering on offensive to some (you might not take your kids on cock-n-balls day), always a little quirky, and unbelievably packed with sugar and other bad-for-you-but-oh-so-tasty things.  My personal favorite is the bacon maple bar but there are lots of other great options.  I can't eat the ones with sugary cereal topped with more sugar but my kids thought they were the greatest thing ever.  Definitely worth trying out if your in the neighborhood!

No hype here.  I actually was preparing for disappointment but nope.  This place is legit!   Lines are long on weekends but if you are visiting and happen to be in a downtown hotel it's very walkable so you can come anytime since they are open for at least 21 hours/day!

All I can say is: be prepared for a line... be willing to wait.... and ENJOY!!!!!

YUM!!!
I love the interesting combinations in the doughnuts. Haven't been there in a while but never had a complaint.
Some of the best doughnuts you will ever eat. If your in town and don't hit up voodoo doughnuts, you're missing out on a great experience.
I'm not even sure why Yelp prompted me to review Voodoo - everyone knows it's amazing!

I'm not a huge doughnut fan but this place made me want to believe again that there are better doughnuts in the world... everything I tasted was wonderful... if you ever in Portland Oregon check this place out... the lines do not lie.. it's worth the wait!!
Definitely worth the 45 min wait in the rain! The grape ape and Homer Simpson were our faves!!!
Best doughnuts in the world. Punk but I took my Mom there & she loved it. Its that kinda place. AWESOME.
OMG! I love this place and can't imagine a week without one of their delish donuts!  Makes the week worth working downtown.

Who cares about a line when you get donuts at the end. This was an experience not just buying donuts. We tried several and got them to last the weekend. The bacon maple bar was hands down the best one we tried. All of the donuts were moist and soft and flavorful. The building was funky and the interior was full of quirky bits and pieces. It did not take itself too serious and played up the fun vibe. The person who waited on us was all about helping first timers pick a good mix and was very friendly. We expected higher prices since there is no "mixed dozen" but based on the individual donut however, it was priced great for such tasty donuts.

I was here at around 4 pm on Memorial Day and the line was crazy.  It was going to be about an hour line, so we decided to come back the next day.

When I got there today at around 6 am, there was only one group ahead of us.  But they took over 10 minutes to order!  That was because they chose every donut for their 2 dozen and also bought t-shirts.

Then it was our turn, and we kindda did the same.  Chose all 12 different donuts for our dozen.  It was about $15, which wasn't bad.  Each donut was pretty good, a bit sweeter then most, and definitely pretty.  The voodoo donut was really good, so was Portland cream.  I tried Oh Captain my captain a bit too late so the captain crunch was not so crunch anymore.  Didnt try the bacon donut.. What you can do is look behind the counter, and they have all the different donuts on the tray.  Ask them to grab you whatever looks appetising to you.  Or you can do my way, which was going through the menu above the girl and read off whatever sounded good.

My suggestion 1: Go early in the morning, avoid the crowd.
My suggestion 2: Get only the interesting and unusual ones here coz the normal types are similar to other places.  Not worth the wait!

Interior was really pretty too.  Definitely a place to visit!
Finally got to go to my dream donut shop!! Other than the Copper Kettle in Campbell Ca. These are some of the best I have ever had!!

The line was long but quick. The vegan doughnuts... What can I say? Tears. So good, good variety and great names. Careful with the jelly filled ones because are REALLY filled. Like... Jelly bombs. 

The voodoo shaped ones are funny, but I rather the regular ones. 
The triple penetration is my favorite. 
The triple penetration doughnut it's my favorite too.

During my day trip in Portland, I knew that one necessity destination for me was going to have to be Voodoo Doughtnut.  Thankfully I chose a Monday afternoon to see the Beavers and do my touristy crap; when I got to Voodoo, there was less than a five minute wait for me.  Unfortunately, they happened to be out of Voodoo dolls, by that time of the day, so I "settled" for a Maple-Bacon doughnut.

Now I'm not a religious person, by any stretch of the imagination, but I'm pretty sure that I saw no less than four different religious deities after I was finished the Maple-Bacon.  Despite the fact that the Beavers are done after 2010, it's almost worth another trip to Portland for another Voodoo Doughnut.

I was going to give 4 stars because the line to get in is always ridiculous...sometimes the cereal on the donuts in stale...and sometimes the service sucks. But I can't...I love them. My favorite is The ol' dirty bastard (chocolate glazed donut covered in crushed oreos and peanut butter), followed closely by the maple bacon bar (sweet and savory? yes, please!). Also, the $5 boxes are worth the 5 stars.    Oh, and 5 stars for having vegan options! And 5 stars for being a sponsor of the Rose City Rollers :)
Really good and funny theme donuts really sweet. Line is usually out the door but totally worth it
so good and actually very fun and normally priced -- when you're waiting in line, it's like you're waiting in line for a club.. very interesting and nice... clean? :/

Unbelievable Donuts.  Especially the Bacon Maple Bar.  I was skeptical, but really, it was the best donut I've ever had in my life.

Neighborhood's scary, but no worse then any big city.  If I lived in Portland, I'd be plenty heavier on account of the bacon maple bar.

So I know there's a great variation in reviews of this spot. And i have to tell you... it's a great place to come and really feel the #keepportlandweird vibe. The donuts are good and grimey. They're fresh, fun and creative. Plus, the story of how it got started is pretty funky. My favorite donut is the Cap'n crunch donut! It's some kind of magic! So bring your cash(literally....they don't take cards) and bring your appetite for sweet treats! Totally check this place out! I went at night to avoid the lines!!! They are open 24/7 after all!!!

Maple bacon bar was delicious. Bacon was cooked perfect for putting on the doughnut. Not too crunchy or chewy. The maple frosting was awesome. The doughnut itself was good as well. Also had the Portland cream doughnut and it was good. The chocolate frosting and cream filling were both good as was the doughnut.

I am not a doughnut fan. But, this was great!! Its not your everyday, run of the mill, Krispy Kreme doughnut shop. This things are delicious. You must stop at this place if you are in the area. I drove an extra four hours on a recent trip to Oregon just to get some of these. The line outside wasn't too bad (about 10 people). My favorite was teh apple fritter and the oreo cookie one.

Stopped by tonight after dinner and a few drinks to get dessert.  No line, so that was a plus, but we didn't get very long to decide.  Luckily, the cashier was super helpful and gave us some recommendations.

We ordered 3 doughnuts - the captain crunch, oreo, and a chocolate cake doughnut. All were delicious, but my boyfriend and I both agreed the captain crunch was the best.

This is only our first night in Portland, so we will be back!

We could NOT go to Portland and miss visiting this place! Our timing was great because there was a short line when we arrived (we were there in April). Certainly not enough time to choose from the PLETHORA of crazy donuts they have! 
We opted for a mango filled,a maple bacon eclair (with bacon strips on top!), a vanilla frosted cruller, and one topped with crushed oreos. Sooo crazy fun and good! Almost put me in a diabetic coma, which I tried to mellow out with a good cup o' joe. 
I'm glad there's not one anywhere near me, though! ;)
This place is awesome.   So many different types of doughnuts.  You really should try the Arnold Palmer (cake doughnut covered with lemon and tea powder) - its scrummy.

Nothing else screams Portland like Voodoo Doughnuts. The donuts are good but I think you are there for the experience of how weird a donut shop can get. The flavors that are mixed or the designs of the donuts themselves. Its worth stopping in for at least a dozen and do yourself a favor and try as many different flavor or style donuts as possible, you won't regret it.

Ever want to be the envy of the town? Walk around downtown Portland with a bright, pink Voodoo Doughnut box! 

Customer service- patient and friendly, despite the line and crowd

Old Dirty Bastard- chocolate donut with Oreo crumbles and peanut butter drizzle- my favorite!

Maple Bacon Bar- two great tastes...! 

The Loop- Fruit Loops added pizazz to this one!

Peach Fritter- big, peachy, frosting-capped mountain range. A beast!

'wife wanted to buy me a t-shirt, but I think I'll just walk around San Francisco with my bright pink (donut) box!

I got married here, so my opinion is clearly pretty high.

That said: amazing! delicious! try the mango tango! I've never had a bad Voodoo Doughnut experience.

I've always been a fan of Voodoo Donuts, they are a Portland tradition.  The dough nuts are delicious and come in many original varieties.  At the downtown location, there will always be a line whether is 9 in the morning or 3 in the morning.  While you are in line, be sure to look and see what you will be ordering.  Also, cash only...

The line is sometimes a bit much sometimes.. Well worth it, however! Good spot to venture to with friends.

Secret tip, ask for the $10 bucket. As many donuts as one could ever want.

This place was great.  It was worth the hype.  Super touristy, but I didnt care.  We were tourists.

Everyone visiting Portland MUST go.

Absolutely the best donut shop I have ever been to and it is a sight to see if you are in Portland I would almost say it is a must that you stop by there if you like talking about you didn't get cock and balls or you can get the Portland cream Keep Portland Weird man enjoy it this is definitely a highlight of Portland
Crazy good, world famous, a must to try in Portland
I'm really not a big donut guy, but these donuts are pretty damn good. Major plus, this place is open 24 hours. Let the party begin

I've only been here once a few months back and I am hooked! If I lived in portland i would come here every other day (over exaggerating, maybe once a week). I had the infamous maple bacon bar that so many people have raved about and it was amazing. My friend ordered an apple fritter of some sort and even that was amazing! I need to come back soon! Best doughnuts ever.
Freaking amazing doughnuts.  The peach fritter was the favorite of our group samples.
What else need be said? The epitome of decadence you can hold in your hand and eat!

WORD OF ADVICE. Be prepared to stand in line. I think no matter what day you go, there would always be a long line. It's worth the wait though!

You will be overwhelmed with how many kinds of doughnuts they have so I suggest you get the combo...where they give you the top doughnut flavors they have all in one box! 

My favorite is the bacon and maple doughnut! Delicious! Great creativity when it comes to decorating the doughnuts...great flavors also! They have almost everything on a doughnut....cereal...cookie crumbs...candies. YUM! So if you a big doughnut fun, a trip to Oregon and visiting Voodoo doughnuts is a must!!!
There was a huge line but it was definitely worth it. Some of the best vegan donuts I have ever had!

Last weekend we were in Portland for a Wedding.  Since my daughter watches Portlandia, Voodoo Doughnut's was one of our must see for the weekend.  We pulled up and no line!  This was Thursday, 8/14/14 around 1pm.  By the time we parked there were about 15-20 in line. The line moves very fast.  This place is adorable!  The sweets were good, but what made this a WOW experience was our server Shane.  He went above and beyond in his service, demeanor and a joy to watch and speak with.  He was generous and gracious in the time he spent with us milling over our choices.  When we were asked by friends and family if we went to Voodoo, we were not talking about the doughnuts, but instead about Shane!  Thank you Shane and Voodoo!

It seems fitting that this innuendo and not-so innuendo infused establishment gets my 69th review. Ahem. Hehehe!

The Old Dirty Bastard is by far my favorite. That single donut has ruined donuts for me. Not that I even eat them all that often, but when I do, all I can think of is Voodoo. Of course all our PDX visitors must go there, and have donuts ruined for them, too. 

As the other couple thousand reviewers largely agree on - just go!

Don't be fooled!  If you are looking for vegan donuts in Portland, you have to get them from Voodoo.  Blue Star only has 3-4 vegan selections and they are all (relatively) boring and seldom change flavors.  I suspect people just pretend to like Blue Star better so they don't have to wait in line for Voodoo.

This place is in one of my food bucket list to go to. I've been waiting for a chance to go here, since I lived in California. This doughnut joint pops up in every food shows in TV, so it really has the hype. My girlfriend and I went straight here from the airport; It didn't disappoint and it lives up to its hype. The ambiance is weird and really took up the quote, "Keep Portland Weird" in its back. They have all kinds of decorations in the wall and the most iconic thing I remembered is the art window in front of the store, which is awesome and creative. The servers are friendly and they will literally accommodate you even if the line is long. Our server, Johnny is really helpful and have a great personality towards costumers, so say hello if ever you met him. Anyway..... donuts...

The donuts are extraordinary to say the least. They have the most imaginative donuts that I ever seen. I have a hard time eating my donuts because it is so artistic, that it belongs to a museum or something. My girlfriend and I ordered their classic voodoo donuts; chocolate glazed voodoo figure with raspberry blood in it.. yummmm! My girlfriend likes their double bubble donuts; it literally taste like a bazooka gum. I ordered their famous the diabetically evil Memphis Mafia; based on the taste it is an apple/ banana fritter with chocolate chip and peanut butter icing on the top. Damn it is so good, I would eat this for breakfast everyday in a week. They sell merchandises, too such as a t- shirt and a sweat

48 hours later.... We came back  here before going to the airport because we want to buy our family and friends these donuts. One of my close friend asked me if I can bring him a Chuckles donuts and a Pothole donuts. Of course, I ordered those to myself, too and wow that's why he is my friend because he has good taste. My girlfriend and I ordered 4 pink boxes for to go.. at least 6 donuts inside each boxes.. why not :) Overall, I would definitely go here again, no doubt about it! 

PS: They sell one day old bucket of donuts for just $10

I didn't want to believe the hype. I can enjoy a good donut and I am a big fan of humor and whimsy when it comes to food, but I have more often than not been dissapointed when trying an over-hyped place. SO NOT THE CASE AT VOODOO! 

While visiting my cousin, in Portland from Denver, she did a great job showing me some of the awesome things that Portland is so loved for. Voodoo was one of those.

I had heard that the lines could sometimes be a nightmare, but on a Thursday night around 9, we walked right in and were back outside enjoying our chosen pastries on the picnic table in the nearby street, in a few minutes.

My cuz suggested we get a few different donuts so that we could sample a wider variety than just one each.  Brilliant idea.  We walked out with a maple bacon bar, a voodoo doll and a mafia something or other (can't remember the exact name).  All were amazing.  The raspberry filling in the voodoo doll? yummy. But my favorite was the mafia. A banana fritter topped with chocolate and peanut butter? Yes, please.  This one was so large that I actually ended up taking most of it home with me and eating it over the next few days.  Still good.

I can't wait to get back to Portland-loved it! And I'll be hitting up Voodoo when I return!

Loved this place sooo much. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I got the Portland Creme (I think that's what it was called. Regular doughnut, chocolate icing, cream filling and two little white eyes) and my husband got the Old Dirty Bastard. Even the coffee was really good. 

*CASH ONLY*

V Candy R. is a hater.

If you go to PDX, go to Voodoo. Yes, it IS that good. Legendary doughnuts! Crazy mix of fun flavors. Expect to wait in line, but know it will be worth the wait. I don't even like doughnuts but I had 3 the day I went.

5 stars for the experience. This place has been all over the food channels so we had to make a pit stop to check it out. The line was past the rope and wrapped around the building but we only waited about 30 minutes to get in the door and place our order. 

Get a dozen!! (At least). The donuts are huge but worth it. However, they aren't great the next day. We went a little overboard but couldn't eat it all. The next day the cereal was soggy and the donuts were a little hard. 

$18 bucks for a dozen.. not bad. A few people have told me that the "other" Portland location has a shorter line.

CASH ONLY.
During the day it has short lines and amazing freshly made donuts! Love love love!! When I come to Portland I must come and get my dessert/ breakfast! It always makes my trip!

Best doughnuts I have ever had...hands down.  Never in my life did I think I would wait in line for an hour and a half for a doughnut, but wait I did, and it was worth every minute.  Lots of fun doughnut options with delicious toppings such as the ODB with chocolate icing, oreos, and peanut butter.  The inside of the shop is very small, so once you make it to the doors your wait is almost over, so just focus on getting to the doors. To help speed the wait along for everyone, peruse the menu before getting inside and to help make a quicker decision, k, thanks.

Came here while on vacation and after seeing it on TV. Don't be intimidated by the line. It moves fairly quickly and is worth the wait. My favorite was the bacon maple bar. Sounds gross but something about the sweet and salty taste was mouthwateringly delicious! Highly recommend. Bring cash.

The old dirty bastard donut is my absolute fave. If you're visiting Portland, you HAVE to stop by voodoo before leaving. Donut commit the crime of not trying this place. The line moves fast and remember, cash only!

Five stars for the concept alone.  The voodoo doll doughnut comes complete with pretzel sticks to torture and berry filling which looks like blood and guts.  Are you getting hungry?!?  It is way too sweet for my taste.  But the sight and smells of their other doughnuts makes me drool.  It's a walk-up window during the day.  The other part of the space opens at 10 p.m.
My fav was the golden graham topped donut with the blue cream inside! soooo good out of all the ones i tried
Totally awesome donuts you wouldn't find at Dunkin. Very tasty, but so sugary you need an insulin shot afterwards.

Awesome and inventive.  There is a reason so many people are carrying pink boxes around in the airport - they want to share these bad boys with their friends!  I usually have the cashier pick the dozen - it is cheaper, and gets some interesting picks that I might not have made otherwise.  Anything that doesn't have cereal on it freezes pretty well - so if you have the room in your freezer but not your stomach, you may want to consider that as an option.  Bring cash, because they don't take credit.

Yeah it's just doughnuts but It's a funny bit of Portland history with some funny doughnuts. It's reasonable because hey it's doughnuts. Sometimes you can buy sooo many day old doughnuts y'all should ask! The hours are great !

These donuts (doughnuts?!) are INCREDIBLE.  I have never, ever in my life tasted donuts as exceptionally delicious as these.  

I got the Voodoo Dozen (a steal at $8.50), which is an assortment of different donuts that they choose for you.  There were actually 13 when we got home, so I'm not sure if it was a baker's dozen or a mistake (either way, I am not complaining!!!). 

To make it clear:  If you expect incredible, unbelievably delicious donuts from Voodoo Doughnut, you will not be disappointed!
VEGAN donuts! They have so many options and they're as tasty as any amazing donut can be! It's trendy and can be a bit crowded at peak hours, weekends expect long lines. But seriously, vegan donuts!
Yummy and fun experience! Loved the creative donuts and the unique atmosphere. Everyone leaving seemed happy.

Woohoo! is the word!

I would break my healthy diet just to eat their doughnuts! If i visit Portland again, I will come back to this place. My mouth was drooling, my eyes were glowing and my body was dancing... YESS!! got excited to see these doughnuts!!  I really like how they have a lot of different, unusual kind of doughnuts. Maple bacon, Oreo and peanut butter, etc etc..  

Line could be long so make sure you bring someone with you! 

I love how they also decorated the place with old school theme and play the 80s song..

Don't care if it touristy! Had a great Voodoo Doll doughnut. My other half also enjoyed the original glazed. Short 15 min. wait time. Friendly staff. Cold hard cash buys you all the doughnuts you can eat.

I happened to come here on some kind of anniversary, on a sunny (you read that right) day in June. The line was long. It was really long. I don't know how long I waited, but it couldn't have been more than a half hour. Anyway, who cares about the line when there are amazing donuts at the end of it?! 

If you're going to Disneyland you wait an hour and a half for a three minute ride. If you're going to Portland you wait in line for food. I don't understand all the complaining about the wait, tourists wait for things... imagine being a local and having to wait in that line! If you're going just to say you went, maybe it's not that important to go. If you like or love donuts, give it a try. The donuts are delicious and fun- and donuts are fun by nature so these are extra fun. 

P.S. donuts are sweet... isn't that the point?

I don't know pinot noir from film noir. But as a verified carbo connoisseur, I can tell you undoubtedly that Voodoo is among the best donuts you're ever going to have. Period. But nonetheless, here's a couple of things to keep in mind:

-You have to order properly by ordering something special. You know what, just make sure you have plenty room in your stomach, and go for the maple bacon bar the fist time around. 
-Keep in mind that this isn't high-minded "cuisine". It's not low brow dishes executed with the Michelin star culinary technique. It's good, old fashioned, guilt inducing comfort food. If that's what you're looking for, go to Blue Star Donuts.
-Don't go to the Old Town (3rd Ave) location unless you're looking for the "seedy side of Portland" experience. Now, the seedy side of Portland is like Disneyland compared to the seedy sides of LA or NY, but it's a grimy part of town with bums and bars. Instead, go to the east side location, Voodoo Too http://www.yelp.com/biz/voodoo-doughnut-too-portland.

The line is ridiculous! I didn't know what I was getting myself into but the wait was
worth it. The Memphis Mafia is probably the best fritter I've ever ate in my life! Fried dough with banana chunks and cinnamon sugar covered in a glaze with chocolate frosting, peanut butter, peanuts and chocolate chips on top!! What more can you ask for in a fritter!! I will definitely be back!!
Best donuts in town. Very generous with the icing. Vegan options. Usually a long line, but it can move quickly.
Can't go wrong with these doughnuts at 1 am.. Must try the ODB if you're a fan of chocolate and peanut butter
What can I say about these amazing doughnuts.....loved the Miami Vice.  Interesting place with very clever names!  The doughnut world was boring and needed a change...this is it!!
Donuts are a personal thing.  I think they're great here.  But eating here is also an experience -- part of the Portland experience.  Line can be long, but it goes fast.

The best doughnut place in the world, hands down. The first time I visited Portland was just so that I could try the maple bacon bar. Now every time I visit my friends in Portland I stop by Voodoo every day.

My favorite doughnuts are the Ol' Dirty Bastard, the Cock n' Balls, and the Maple Bacon Bar.  

They have great doughnuts and awesome staff. But, the best thing about Voodoo is that they're open 24 hours. Am I the only one who thinks this is freaking awesome?!!?!?!?

I've always been a fan of Voodoo Doughnuts, they are a Portland tradition.  The doughnuts are delicious and come in many original varieties.  At the downtown location, there will always be a line whether is 9 in the morning or 3 in the morning.  While you are in line, be sure to look and see what you will be ordering.  Also, cash only...

So I pretty much made a trip to Portland from Southern California for these doughnuts, and thankfully they lived up to the hype!! As expected, there was a humongo line outside of Voodoo. We went on a Thursday night, and the wait was about 25 minutes! There is a large variety of doughnuts to choose from ranging from your typical donut shop donuts to some crazy, adventurous, but delicious ones! Good thing there was a long wait, or else I wouldn't have had enough time to decide what to get :) I was supposed to only buy one donut that night, but I left with four. Whatever, YOLO! I left with the memphis mafia, portland cream, voodoo, and grape ape donuts. The memphis mafia is seriously HUMONGOUS. It was pretty much my breakfast for 2 days. I don't recommend getting this one simply because you should save up your appetite for other donuts! Portland cream is very similar to Boston cream donuts. Grape ape is literally just grape jelly. And Voodoo donut is the one you gotta try! It's not only cute but also scrumptious :) 

All in all, totally worth the trip!
Soooo Amazing !!! There was a line but it moved fast.  All the doughnuts I bought were soft and delish!!

Yes the bacon maple bar is good, but that's not what this place is about If you really want to waste some calories, it's ALL ABOUT Memphis baby! Husband and I had a long night of wondering the streets of Portland after dinner and I spotted the famed Voodoo Donuts. It was about 1:30 AM or so and there were a few in line inside so we jumped in. Is it grimy like other reviewers say? Sure, it bothered me for a second, and then I saw the spinning donut display and it was ON! We ordered the bacon maple bar, the Memphis Mafia (banana, peanut butter, chocolate goodness), and a buttermilk bar (no-nonsense bizness). Totally worth it blowing all kinds of caloric restrictions (diet). 

A few things to know:
-Cash Only
-Kind of annoying when you, your husband, grandmother, 4 kids, and dog show up, keep it simple. 
-Don't expect it to be like Dunkin', it's not
-Go at an off time if possible. We went late night/early morning, but happened to walk by on a Monday afternoon and the line was through the kazoo. 
-No need to giggle for 30 minutes when ordering the "Cock-n-Balls", just be about it

What else can I say that hasn't already been said? It's a Portland staple, and it's finally reached cult status. I remember coming here at 2am in high school after a night of partying, chowing down on doughnuts to refuel. Back then you could still snag a seat on one of the benches. Last time I came here with an out-of-town friend, we waited for 45 minutes to get our doughnuts. Luckily, the quality hasn't diminished.

My personal favorites are the captain crunch, the bacon maple bar and, of course, the mango tango. I don't eat much sugar, but for Voodoo I'll make the exception.
crazy good. had an apple fritter with all kinds of goodness allover the top.  Cant go to portland with out a visit.

Voodoo is a well known Portland place, and I know it catches a lot of flack from people saying it's too touristy. And it is touristy. But sometimes you need to experience some of the touristy things. 

In the 6 days we were in Portland while visiting in September, we had Voodoo 3 times. Only once did we have to wait in line more than 5 minutes, and even then it was maybe 15 minutes tops. The staff are very efficient and try their best to keep the line moving. The prices are perfectly fine for me, because of the quality of the doughnuts being provided. I suggest trying their raised doughnuts, particularly the Captain, My Captain, but they're all delicious.

Both the original store and Voodoo Too will be visited many times over by us as soon as we move in March. :)

Best doughnuts I ever had, and I had my share... :-)
This place is really worth the line. They have a really neat selection, we had the voodoo doll of course, one with peanut butter and Oreo and one with chocolate and Bavarian cream. all were excellent.

Be prepared to wait, but trust me it's worth it! Whoever came up with the idea for VooDoo is genius. They have some of the craziest concoctions and yeah, sometime it doesn't work but surprisingly most of their doughnuts are delicious! Definitely worth it if you are in town or just haven't been.
Aghhhh so amazing! I got the old dirty bastard and captain crunch donut and they were divine! The had a long line, but the wait was well worth it!

Why am I reviewing a place with 2610 reviews? Perhaps it is simply because I should let it be known how delicious this place is. I had the Memphis Mafia, baked fresh as a banana fritter with chocolate chips and drizzles of peanut butter and chocolate. Excellent. The menu also includes a mexican hot chocolate donut, a neapolitan donut, and a raised yeast donut with frosting and oreos. Homer Simpson would be proud.
Freaking yummy!!!! Go and wait in the line. It is a must! Wow, it's like you died and went to heaven. Absolutely AMAZING!!!!

Tasty and fun! The line is worth the wait. If you like interesting new experiences, more unique that visiting your average safeway and picking up donuts you'll love this. Plus? it's open 24/7 so when you're looking for that late night snack you'll know where to find it.
Great doughnuts!  Very innovative, trendy, lots of changes.  A Portland classic.  Get your pink box!

I was married at the Voodoo Too location in May 30, 2010. Aside from getting married, the owners staff and patrons that day made it one of the greatest experiences of my life. I will always be a supporter of this company.
Love the different and unique variety of doughnuts. The names are priceless. My favorite is the maple bacon.
If you haven't been to Voodoo Doughnuts then you have never had a doughnut.  The maple bacon bar is the closest thing to heaven you can put in your mouth without going to jail.

I had the famous bacon maple bar but did not actually go to Voodoo to get it, so I have been torn about whether or not I can justify a review.  I can't attest to any wait times or the general scene, but I can say that the bacon maple bar was crazy good and inspired.  Granted, I was pretty sauced at the time that I had the doughnut but either way, it hit the spot.  Next time I'm in Portland I'll have to go to the shop to try more and update the review.

Delicious doughnuts here! It is definitely a tourist spot so be prepared for a 45 minute line. PLEASE know what you want to order BEFORE you get to the front of the line. Also it is CASH ONLY, so be prepared. My favorite doughnuts I got were the Maple Bacon Doughnut and the Cock and Balls Doughnut. The cock and Balls doughnut is way too much doughnut for one person- so bring friends to share it with. The bathroom here also smells horrible and had no toilet paper- so be sure to use the bathroom before coming here. Overall GREAT doughnuts!

I ate the cock and balls and loved every minute of it! Although there is a fair amount of custard on my chin, remember to grab napkins! But now my belly is full of giant cock and sweet custard! There is a huge smile on my face! Mahalo Voodoo! I am under your spell forever!!

Trying to figure out why the scores are lower from other reviews. Here's my assessment. Yes it is a place for tourists! Note to anyone who scored it low for this reason.... duh! That's why you went!!
Loved the crazy options. The staff was great and made solid recommendations. Despite a line was friendly and didn't make us feel rushed. Memphis Mafia was fantastic. Never had a banana fritter before but it was memorable. The chocolate on the voodoo didn't taste artificial at all. Mango tango was oddly and surprisingly good. If you actually like fun and adventure and are in Portland, it is worth the visit. Yes, embrace the cheesy tourist in you and go for the experience. Cash only.

CASH ONLY. Atm inside. Open 24/7

One of the popular tourist spots in Portland. The shop is tiny so expect long lines and waiting. Inside is covered with interesting and wild decor, something to look at while you wait.

Service was great! The person that helped me with my order was super nice and didn't seemed bothered by the crowd of people at 10pm. 

The doughnuts themselves are great! I got the Voodoo dozen (they pick 13 of their choosing). The cake is soft and moist. The glazes and icings are pretty interesting and come with fun toppings like cereal. For $16.75 It's a good deal.

Overall: every part of my visit was great! Didn't wait too long, geart service, tasty doughnuts, and you get to be part of that tourist atmosphere. Would recommend and will return!
Interesting place.  There were Cocoa Puffs on my doughnut. Pretty tasty. It's a good local flavor spot.

Well worth a long wait in line.  The choices are many, so I recommend you look on their website and choose ahead of time.  Also make sure you have cash.  I won't recommend a specific doughnut as we bought a variety and they were all excellent and interesting.  This is definitely a destination while in Portland.

Ordered:  bacon maple bars, blueberry doughnut, and the one with Oreos and peanut butter

Positives:  best doughnuts I've eaten!  They're so soft inside and not too cakey.  The bacon is good, thick bacon, not cheap thin stuff.

Negatives:  the lines are wayyyyy too long but so worth it.  Parking isn't great either, but again, so worth it.

I don't care what people say...this place is still my favourite doughnut place in Portland. The flavour balance is fantastic whatever you order (ok, prob haven't tried everything, but still)...these cheeky cats totes deserve our love.

Incredible donuts with a traditional and exotic selection of choices. So many choices.  Long lines are the norm. Great coffee too.  I had a peach fritter which was really good and was a nice change from the usual apple fritters most donut shops have. We were there in the evening and the place and area was really active with a lot of people. I watched a few limos pull up and people get out just to get a box of donuts. When I am in Portland next, I will return to Voodoo Donuts. To bad they were out of the bacon maple bars.

Omg...this was the best donut I've ever had! It wasn't overly sweet or greasy. It was so soft and had just the right amount of chewiness. If I lived nearby, I would come here often.

The line was long, but it moved pretty fast.

I will be back!
OMG the Maple Bacon bar is soooo good. And the Mafia Madness? Double OMG. Serious. Why don't we have one of these in the Bay Area in CA? It's just plain wrong.

Yes I will be the 760th reviewer for this place.....but Holy Shmoly!  What  Fabulous doughnuts!  What's the big deal about a doughnut place that offers zany flavors? I must say, I am not a big fan of 'Scooby food'.  You know, bizarre food combinations like chocolate on your pizza etc...) probably the edge that this place has is that they do your basic stuff really, really well.  The honey dipped crueller is fantastic! nice, light and eggy on the inside.  The honey bar, incredible!  substantial cakey interior and nice ample glaze.  From the basics, Voodoo ups the ante and does get creative.  The much touted maple bar with bacon, yes, it does sound weird but it is fantastatic.  The sweet maple glaze is tempered by the salty crispy bacon topped off with a yeast raised donut which has an ever slight crispness with a nice fluffy interior.  Do I sound like I a voodoo donut evangelist yet?  It is a 24 hour establishment  which is very convenient to mortals and vampires alike.  It also means that they may run out of items so have plenty of back up requests ready just in case.  The place is beyond tiny so don't expect to sit inside to enjoy your prize. Prices are reasonable and are well worth every cent.  Yes, I came here twice in less than 24 hours and ate 5 donuts which have undoubtedly taken a few years off my lifespan....so worth it!

Best doughnuts in the town, state and the whole wide world! If you visit PDX, go here at all costs. 

Hit it up after Blazers games and you'll find the opposing team players getting their fill of the best doughnuts in the world!

Best  place in Portland. I had blue star donut while in portland on day 1 and that was overly sweet and didn't have the freshness and right amount of sugar for me.  I went on Monday around noon and there wasn't much of a line. I ordered the Marshall mathers, voodoo doll and the chocolate caramel nut donuts and all were so good. One of them i had the next day and still tasted fresh.

I never thought that any doughnut could sway me from Krispy Kreme, but then I tried...  Oh Captain My Captain.  My God- a glazed raised doughnut, with vanilla frosting on top and Captain Crunch cereal stuck to it.  Yeah.

The staff is truly unique, and you can pretty much tell how the R&D must go- "Dude, what if..."

They are currently closed for remodeling/expansion at this location, but they should be open again sometime in May 2011.  Go for it- you won't be disappointed.  As a parent, I should warn you that there are plenty of drug & sex references in the doughnut names, and some interesting wall art.  Not saying it's inappropriate, just saying that you might have some 'splaining to do...  :-)  Cash only.  T-shirts, stickers, underpants, hoodies and patches are also available.
By far the best donuts in the game Voodoo Doughnuts is an experience you must have whenever you are in Portland. My favorite was the Mango filled doughnut.

Yeah, the line is full of tourism, and us locals don't like them. But they have great taste in doughnuts. They're properly priced and great tasting. They make the best maple bar in the city.

I do recommend their other location. This isn't even the original. But it's close to my work and the MAX, so waiting for twenty minutes is usually worth it.

Don't go to B.S. Donuts to eat BS. Eat at the original!

YUM!!!!!!!!!! And I'm local, not a tourist. I love the glazed french crullers and often stop by for them after a nice dinner at veritable quandary or the leaky roof, etc. They do have a lot of crazy stoner special type doughnuts but some great classics also.
Ok, so we go there, wait in line, and get a dozen vegan doughnuts.  What a treat.  My fav is still the apple fritter.  My special spouse like the bacon maple bar.

hands down, best doughnuts ive ever had.
not only do they have a good selection of about anything you can think of, but they have an awesome selection of vegan doughnuts too (which dont live up to acutal doughnuts but can still be tasty)
This world famous doughnut shop is home to the most inventive varieties of rediculous pastries you will ever find. I mean come on.. cock and balls? perfect for bachlorette parties.
They dont only have doughnuts though, they also have a chapel and have been marrying people since February 2003. 
I wouldnt go anywhere else if I had a choice... but I live in washington...
its worth the three hours and fifty to a hundred bucks in gas
Oh my gosh are these donuts delicious!  Very imaginative, too!  The lines can be daunting, however, if you go early or late, much shorter of a wait.  The wait staff fun and friendly!

So, when I heard I was going to be going to Portland and heard about Voodoo Doughnuts I knew where I had to go.  I knew I was there when I saw the pink door and heard their blaring music.  Walking into the shop I encountered a place with tremendous character, from the giant doughnut on the wall to the 12-foot high stage.  Not many doughnuts seemed to be available at the time but luckily more doughnuts were on their way.  As you probably know they have many unique doughnuts such as the cock-n-balls, bacon maple bars, and a doughnut that looks like a voodoo doll with a pretzel stick through it's jam filled heart.  After trying many of their creations I found love in their doughnut dipped in Cap'n Crunch.  I even had to smuggle some home on the plane.  For two days I would like to say I was a regular.  In fact, if I do ever move to Portland I probably will be a regular.  This place is much different then any other doughnut shop and for that it stands out from the rest.  If you happen to be in Portland, I would recommend you head on over to Voodoo Doughnuts, look for the pink door and a good experience.

Really enjoyed this place!  Donuts are interesting and good. Line moved fast. It's worth a visit if you've never been. We had the voodoo, the ODB and the pothole. Really good and very filling. I am probably good on donuts for a while!

Located in the Red Light District, this one of a kind donut shop lures people in from all walks.  The shop is small, usually with a line.  They play spooky music to get you in that gothic mood, just before you sink your teeth into a voodoo shaped donut, about to spill it's jelly blood out onto your lips.  My favorite flavor was the cereal captain crunch donut.  The best.  Prices ranged from $1.25 to like $5.95, they take cash only.  If they took credit, I would have gotten a tee-shirt.  Oh best thing of all this place is open 24/7.  All the cashiers was hip people with tats and piercings.

The absolute best donuts I have ever eaten. I had to take an extra dozen home with me to California in my luggage. Perfection in a beautiful casing. miss this place already. Tried everything they had to offer on my visit.
I just had my first Voo Doo Doughnut!!!  OH MY GOODNESS...TOO GOOD!  I can't wait to go into the shop and get some more!!!

Great Donuts! Can you say long lines. LONG LINES! Everybody and their mama waiting on Voodoo donuts. Voodoo Donuts is Portland's number one sugar high drug house.. lol  We normally go at 4am to avoid the long lines. Beware homeless people asking for money. If you have trouble finding it, just look for people walking around with big pink boxes.

Amazing doughnuts!!! Worth the wait! I went on a Friday morning to Voodoo. The line was around the corner but only took about 15 minutes. I couldn't believe how cheap the doughnuts were. And they were a good size! Apple fritter and maple bacon were delicious!! Highly recommend if your a doughnut lover.

I had the maple bacon and it was delicious! The combination of sweet-salty-soft-cruchy really works. I had a bite of the mango filled doughnut too and it was yummy. We got a box of various other doughnuts that went quick so those must have been good too. Bring cash.

Not gonna lie, waited in line for seriously an hr/hr 1/2. buuuut has a super delicious and artistic selection of amazing Doughnuts!! Great roadtrip snack. Super friendly staff. I think about this place every time i eat a regular boring doughnut lol

I was worried this place would be over-hyped, but it really wasn't! The aesthetics and atmosphere are definitely very Portland (i.e., quirky). The wait wasn't too long, and people were enjoying standing in line (though some of the cashiers were less-than-patient with customers who were still trying to narrow down their picks from the large menu). The voodoo doll and Portland Cream were my favorites, as they were fun, sweet, and surprisingly flavorful. There isn't enough seating here, though, if you want to sit down and enjoy your donuts, and there are more than a couple homeless people hanging outside begging. However, those small negatives don't overshadow how fun and delicious this place is, so be sure you go when you're in Portland!

If you haven't experienced Voodoo Donut yet, go get drunk one night and come here after. You'll like it, I promise. I'm not really one to ever eat donuts while sober or before 1 AM, so I think this place is brilliant. Actually, when I was debating whether or not to move here, I think it was hearing "24 hour donut shop located downtown" that sealed the deal. 

Which donuts to try? I like the one with peanut butter in it, but donut preference is a very personal thing. Get whatever looks good to you at the time, if you followed the advice above I'm pretty sure you're going to like any of them.

I was in Portland about a month ago for work and all my co-workers kept telling me about this place and how I had to go here if I was going to be in Portland.  Let me tell you they were not wrong.  I was in Portland for two nights and I went here 3 times (don't tell my wife).  I had the original Voodoo Doll first.  Of course had to go with the classic.  It did not disappoint.  Very well decorated with raspberry jelly on the inside and a little pretzel stake through it.  I also had the ODB and the No Name doughnut.  I must say I think the No Name was my favorite, can't go wrong with chocolate, peanut butter, and rice crispys.  And yes I was a good friend and brought back some for my co-workers and family.  I must say when you get on the plane with that bright pink box everyone becomes your friend.  I mean everyone, I thought the flight attendant was going to offer me a first class upgrade for one of these doughnuts.  Which I would have gladly taken.  Next time I am in Portland I will be going back.

Stopped off for the Voodoo Doughnut experience & boy did we have a wonderful experience. 
Doughnuts were so tasty! I ordered the maple bar & loved every bite. My daughter ordered the captin' crunch topped doughnut & it was good... super super sweet!!!  
It's truly a "must" experience.
Went on a snowy day.  3 people in line.  Really great doughnuts.  Liked the Grape/Lavender, Mango Tango, and the Cock and Balls were really good.

When I lined up 5 feet behind the door amongst a string of onlookers, I expected nothing more than a novelty experience. Voodoo doughnuts dazzled me impressed.

I may have had a lucky experience, but these doughnuts were fresh, soft, doughy,  delectable, deliciously deep fried, sugary, fatty goodness. I'm not a doughnut person. I'd rather have a cupcake. These doughnuts, however, were the best doughnuts I've ever had in my life, and it goes beyond the captain crunch and bubble gum frosting.

Speaking of toppings, Voodoo delivers the quirky, eclectic experience it promises. The sexual references, double entendres and pop cultural references will impress those with an affinity for wordplay. The unique innovation and creative craftmanship will satisfy the starving artist. There's bacon doughnuts for the carnivores, candy and sugar cereal encrusted doughnuts for the kiddos, risque and obscene doughnuts for the adults, blunt doughnuts for the stoners,  and gaybar doughnuts for the activist in us all. If you're conservative, your standard favorites are by your side. This is a place for everyone. You can even bring your vegan friends!

Not every doughnut will suit your palate. I'm not a fan of the cereal doughnuts, but that's not the point. Part of the fun is the experimentation. You're not meant to enjoy these doughnuts. You're meant to savor a unique experience. If you hate your grape dusted or M&M coated pastry, at least you can say you've tried. My personal favorite is the Voodoo doughnut. As a toy and food product, it's the ultimate two-in-one. Every Voodoo doll doughnut is a box of chocolate; with a unique design each time it's frosted, you never know what you're gonna get. The fact my Voodoo doughnut came with a vagina made it even better.

This was better than I expected. Frenetic insanity that doesn't skimp on taste. Such a unique creation could be excused with a crappy product, but the flavor makes this place even more worth the while. If you're too impatient to wait for your chance to open the gates to hell, this is not the place for you. If 20 minutes of stalling is no big deal, you've found your heaven. The only downfall is Voodoo is unique to Portland, but that's what makes Portland Portland.

The original and seems to be getting hated for the hype and fame.  I love 'em but not enough to wait in line more than 5 minutes.  I remember the days when this was only open from 10pm to the early morning through a hole in the wall.  Those were the days....

Seriously, if you are ever in Portland, Voodoo Donuts is a great "whole in the wall" type of place that has the most random donuts you will ever see.  Bacon on maple bars, dirty snowballs, cap'n crunch, voodoo doll, ect....I think the place is best after you have been to a few bars and have the munchies.

FYI...this place is always crowded to be prepared to know what you want and wait in line.

Memphis Mafia is as good as it gets. Open 24 hours. My nieces came and visited me and we went about 11 at night. I am now their new fav hip aunt..........
What can I say but Portland has the best of everything and Voodoo donuts can not be toppled!!!!! I say to those donut dealers out there....Bring it on!!!!
You know those "Keep Portland Weird" stickers. This is what they mean. A hole in the wall donut shop, open late, that has weddings, and serves bacon donuts, as well as my favorite the Captain Crunch.

Really tasty donut, and a variety to chose from. Their signature jelly is fresh and delicious. I Lao bought a cool shirt and stickers. Btw, it's a smaller joint and seems to always have a line so be prepared for the 15 minute wait that is well worth it
The best donuts ever, bar none. The line was longish but moved quickly and the donuts made the wait worth it.

Delicious... And that is that I tried the vegan doughnut (grape ape flavor) wife got the hibiscus one, which was good but taste was too strong for my preference. Definitely will go back when in Portland. Only cash through and seems that on good weather days there can be long lines outside.

Standing in a short line along glittery gold bricks lining the side of the donut shop, taking in the donut-scented air billowing out of the vents that turn onto the sidewalk, I knew that this place was going to be epic.  During our long weekend in Seattle we went here twice, resulting in a total of 4 meals that I DO NOT regret.  Cock and ball donut was everything it promised to be, being the size of 4 donuts in one and including a bit of cream in the balls and tip.  YUM!  Voodoo donut was very cute: a little jelly-filled voodoo doll with a pretzel through the heart.  The maple-blunt donut was a delicious as it looked: covered with cinnamon-sugar and dipped in maple and red sprinkles.  The best has to be the old dirty bastard donut.  Oreo cookies and peanut butter.  YUM.  These people know what they're doing.  This place, alone, would bring me back to Portland in a heartbeat.

Holy Amazing Doughnuts!

Bacon Maple Bar, yes please.

Voodoo Doll, well you better like blood and guts, I mean strawberry jelly which I don't. But it was hysterically cute. And if I liked jelly stuffed dolls, I'm sure I would have loved this one. 

The building is glittery, literally has glitter all over it. So awesome! And the "magic is in the hole..." really? That just says it all.

Oh, and don't forget the Cock and Balls with cream filling. Yup, they went there.

If you're looking for wild creation donuts, this is the place to go.  As you can expect from being one of Portland's most popular tourist stops, the line is almost always out the door.  Make sure to try the Bacon Maple, the Cookies n Cream, and the Old Dirty Bastard (Oreo and Peanut Butter).

Great donuts but I wouldn't wear a rolex to the burnside location. Lots of homeless people nearby. Definitely worth the mugging possibility (That was a joke). They were out of the voodoo dolls so I got a maple bacon bar. That was the best doughnut I ever had! If you want faster service and a larger location hit up the voodoo on Sandy.

On a recent work trip to Portland, my coworker and I decided we had to find our way to Voodoo Doughnuts, after being told about it by our one true chef love, Anthony Bourdain.

We walked on over from our hotel in the early hours of a Friday, through the wet and quiet streets of downtown. It's SO awesome that Voodoo's open 24 hours - we went inside the tiny, tiny store and our eyes danced from doughnut to doughnut - which to choose?? 

I knew from the start I'd be getting the Fruit Loop - glazed with white frosting and topped with bunches and bunches of glorious Fruit Loops - it was a sugar coma from heaven. My coworker had the Oreo peanut butter - crazy! Neither of us braved the maple and bacon, but I have regretted it ever since.

A really fun little shop, totally pleasant folks working...huzzah!

After having a cheese plate, burger, and sushi, it was time for dessert. 

Stop #3 of the night was at the now infamous Voodoo Doughnut. The inside was tiny, only room for a short line with no tables or chairs to speak of. The menu was vast with great names for all their treats. You vegan hippies would love this place due to their extensive list of vegan doughnuts. After staring at the spinning display case, I settled on the biggest "fritter" looking doughnut I've ever seen. Topped with peanut butter chips, peanuts, peanut butter,  and chocolate, I knew a single bite could give me diabetes. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=g-Q7e9gD8TFv6NIDUnJpPA

The shocking thing was that it was probably the best doughnut I've ever had! The edges were perfectly crisp, as any good fritter should be, and the toppings were simply decadent. Because it was so big, biting into it was difficult. I ended up ripping it apart and saving most of it for my healthy breakfast the next morning. Inside the beast, there seemed to be a layer of some unidentifiable filling. I have no idea what that was, but it helped keep the monster moist and delicious. 

My friend got the fruit loops doughnut and I got a mango filled one for seconds. The fruit loops were sadly on the stale side, but my mango filled doughnut was great! It had this kind of chewy, marshmallow like topping, that was a nice contrast to the soft gooey innards. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=S8dp2QCACZx840cwHCG0qw

I enjoyed the doughnuts so much that I went back the next day for a maple bacon bar to take home and a Tang topped doughnut. The bacon maple bar lived up to its hype and was so good! Nice crisp bacon and sweet maple topping was a match made in heaven. The Tang doughnut was interesting, but not my favorite. 

Voodoo Doughnut is a must when in Portland.

Okay, so I have to admit, I have a feeling that if I lived in Portland, I wouldn't really go here that often.  I mean, I like doughnuts, don't get me wrong, but I'm not the type to go out of my way to buy a doughnut.  The thing is, Voodoo serves up some pastries that go way beyond the limitations of your average honey glazed ring of adult-onset diabetes inducing boredom.  Thus, when I heard about this place, I sure as hell knew I had to go out of my way to check it out.  And i was just dying for a reason to get out of this weird Tube shaped bar I had somehow ended up in, filled with just the type of people I figured a blue collar city like Portland was void of.  Ah, I'm a judgemental fuck.  Anyways, yes, the rumors are true.  Captain crunch on a doughnut!  Pepto-Bismol flavored doughnuts!  Doughnuts of weird shapes and sizes! Vegan doughnuts!  And they're even really good, like all light and melty in your mouth.  It's seriously some next level shit.  And I LOVE places that are open weird hours, like it's the best.  This place is genius.  It's so genius, it's almost too good--I feel kind of scared that some fucking dot-com yuppie from the marina in SF is going to move to Portland and somehow figure out how to make a chain out of this place somehow and ruin the quirky charm.  Portlanders, resist the yuppifacation of your city!  And eat VOODOO DOUGNUTS!  Gotta love a place with the slogan "The magic is in the hole"

Pros:
Variety of unique flavors and shapes of doughnuts. They get very creative with the decorations, shapes, and names, but I just stuck with good old glazed bar and apple fritter. These doughnuts are made fresh (the day of) and you definitely get quality and quantity for your money. 

Cons:
Remember that this place is cash only, and that there is limited seating. It is also not in a great part of Portland, but I do believe that there is another location. You are almost guaranteed to find a line during normal business hours (especially in the morning), but that is also a good sign that you picked the right place.
Great donuts that live up to the hype. The line moves fast. The donuts can be overwhelming so I recommend buying one of each.

Throwing our bags into the rental car, we concluded our trip to Portland.  But before we left town we headed over to Voodoo Doughnut.  No road trip is complete without junk food, and Voodoo Doughnut was just the place to indulge while saying goodbye to our favorite city.   

Thanks to yelpers, we knew to prepare for a line and to bring cash.  The list of doughnuts was impressive, the line actually moved faster than I could take in the menu.  Skipping breakfast was a bad idea as we order way too many doughnuts, picking up an Old Dirty Bastard for the relatives we were visiting on the way home.  

Paired with a fresh black cup of coffee, the doughnuts were yummy.  The place was kitsch, cool and perfect treat to enjoy before hitting the road.  We refilled our coffee, grabbed our stash of doughnuts and headed south.   

As I sit here in San Francisco on a Sunday morning, I wish I was in Portland and Voodoo Doughnut was down the street.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? The donuts are unique and Delicious.
I ate here every single morning for over 3 months. The coffee is also the best.

A must-have if you're in Portland, and three reasons why...

1. They have vegan doughnuts. VEGAN doughnuts! For all you vegan's out there who have not had a Krispy Kream in years say "Hello!" to your new found friend! Oh, and btw, these are waay better than Krispy Kream!

2. For all you non-vegan's, your doughnut world has been opened to a plethora of never seen before treats. There are dozens upon dozens of choices too include but not limit...
                   Bacon Maple
                   Cock-N-Balls (My favorite haha)
                   & of course, Voodoo Doll!

3. Open 24 hours for your pleasure. Sometimes on rare occasions (and rare Holiday's) they close but rest assure they will be open the next day.

It is a cash only place, but you can always use their beat-up ATM machine that has seen better days. After all, it's Portland... Gotta keep it weird right?

What a fun and wild place!!  I had heard stories about this donut shop, and I was glad to experience it...if you are in the downtown Portland area it is a MUST to stop here.  Even if you don't like donuts, you should still stop in and see all the different varieties of donuts that they have here.  I had the Captain, oh my Captain...which was a round donut with thick glaze and covered in captain cruch cereal.  My boyfriend had the maple bar with bacon on it.  There was so much to choose from, and crazy stuff!  When I go to Portland, I will go out of my way to stop in here again.  Oh and they ONLY take cash!
Best doughnuts I've had in a long time! Was visiting Portland and I heard so much about it. Went early in the morning and there was no line. Love the cool atmosphere and crazy doughnut names.
Loved the plain glazed donut. Maple bacon... Voodoo donut... The line moves fast. Certainly worth the trip.

A must try is the Grape Ape, I believe it's called. If you like grape flavored sweet things, you'll love this doughnut. I got some for Mother's Day! Best present ever! You really can't go wrong with any doughnut here
Best doughnuts in the west coast you have to visit this place when in Portland. Get the Bacon Maple Bar. You will love it.

Dear lemon chiffon crueller at Voodoo Donuts,

I'm coming back for you next week.  I promise.

Love always,
Kelsey

May I please have another!

Freshly made. Fluffy dough. Delectable toppings. Get the Maple Bacon Bar... trust me, it's good.  Their Chocolate Oreo and Peanut Butter is also fabulous.  I think I could eat a whole box of their doughnuts on my own! 

There is a line out the door for a reason people!  Bring your cash because they don't take plastic, and wait as patiently as possible because you will be rewarded!

I didn't know vegan donuts like this could exist!!! A lot of places have vegan donuts, and they do them well. But I still have flashbacks to my first bite of an oreo peanut butter vegan raised donut at Voodoo. It was truly blissful. 

If you can get over the line (which is pretty much almost always there), you will not be disappointed in the end result. And if you're thinking you'll only get one, don't. Get as many as you can carry.

After seeing this place on every Portland featured travel show, this was on the top of my list of places to visit. I wish I could've taken home a dozen of maple bacon bars. Those were soooooooo good! I got that and a classic VooDoo doughnut. The Voodoo doughnut was just ok for me, and I probably would've liked it more if I was a fan of raspberry but I'm not. It's so small inside there, and I was very lucky that my friend and I got there where there was NO line.

A must when in Portland. Donuts are delish and beyond unique and the pink box is a keeper. We ordered a big variety. A bit hard to order if you are a novice, but needed up with the rice crispie peanut better, a true voodoo, Oreo topped creation. I'm sure they have great named but it was point and describe for us.

Coming from the Midwest, I know my donuts.  This shop makes the best donuts I have ever eaten.  

The peach fritter was the size of a paper plate with frosting on it.  Delicious.  The apple fritter and the bacon maple bar also look great and are popular.  The magic really is in the hole!

If you visit Portland, you must get a Voodoo donut!
If you go on a weekday afternoon, you won't have to wait in a crazy line! Amazing Doughnuts!

In the wacky city of Portland, a legendary doughnut shop lies on 22 3rd Avenue. With a line that has people backed up outside the shop, just for a few doughnuts. I will warn you: the pink box holding the doughnuts is well-known, and you may get mugged carrying one walking down the street. Voodoo Doughnuts may very well have the craziest, most exotic doughnut flavors you will ever encounter. I recommend the "Vicious Hibiscus" for a tangy, berry-like sort of taste. Also, the people working there are as sweet and colorful as the doughnuts. Unfortunately, these doughnuts are exclusive to Portland, so you'll have to catch a flight there to get that epic taste.

This place is as good as it gets (in terms of donuts anyway). Ah-mah-zing. Get the one with the Oreos on it. They should call it the Ultra Mega Happy Cookie Bomb Donut because that's exactly how I felt until the sugar crash. But hey, it's a f*ckin' donut, what do you expect?
So much goodness going on here! So many creative donuts & variety it blows my mind! Don't forget to bring cash.

Forget Dunkin Donuts.. This is the place to go. The lines are long but well worth the wait. They have the best donuts I have ever had with great selections and variety. The staff and crowd are the typical Portland weird types so you will find entertainment while you wait!!

A must visit if you're coming to Portland - fun decor, organized line area, prices not overly expensive, plenty of seating, crazy and pretty decent (although very sugary) donuts. We split a mango tango - fluffy, fresh (although ours wasn't hot). Difficult to compare to blue star since blue star is more gourmet, voodoo more crazy sugary fun (like a kids dream manifested as a donut shop)

My family was in Seattle for Father's Day weekend and asked my brother what he wanted to do for his special day....he said: lets go to Portland. 

My immediate thought was: "Lets get some donuts!"

We woke up early for the drive and arrived in gloomy Portland around 11am to a LINE I've never seen in some lounges in Vegas....no, really!!?!!!!!!!

I gave my brother $40 for donuts while the rest of the family sat leisurely on the benches next to Voodoo :) 
We looked over their menu, pics, and tips on Yelp and made a list for him to order. 

We enjoyed the scenery, people, and even roamed the farmer's market near by. 
Let me say that Portland is verrryyyyyy different. lol 
Not a negative thing; just different ;) 

An hour+ later, he came out with 16 donuts.  
We ordered such donuts as the captain crunch, voodoo doll, fruit loops, triple choco penetration, Marshall matters, cock n balls, Memphis mafia, etc. 

The star of the show was, obviously, the maple bacon donut. Maaaaaan, I really need to find a maple bar donut and make my own. It was stellar. I had 2 in 1 sitting and a stomach ache during the ride back to Seattle --- SO WORTH IT! 

The Grape Ape was the unexpected 2nd favorite. Not that sweet, with a hint of lavender sprinkles. You'd think something lavender wouldn't taste so uh-maze!


I even packed some in a ziplock to bring back to Vegas. Even when it was a melted maple bar with bacon; it was delicious ;):):)
awesome.... beware your hips will not lie LOL what more can I say..... everything is fresh & yummy..... love the pink boxes... they are just a nice touch ----

I've still never actually been inside.  My only time having the doughnuts was the night before I left Portland.  We rolled up to Voodoo only to find they were closed, but my friend Debra was so insistent that I try the doughnuts that she banged on the window and managed to get the bakers to sell us their leftover vegan doughtnuts from earlier in the day.  We got 12 for like $2, and holy fuck they were amazing.  I'm almost glad Voodoo isn't in my city because I would be the size of a house right now.  Amazing.

Riverside,CA to Portland,OR. That was my epic journey to get to these mythical donuts I had heard so much about. And mind you this was a driving trip. I drove through fog, mountains, freezing temperatures, desolate trails and sleepless nights. 1010 miles one way. It really felt like a quest to get these darn things.

Now the location is pretty small that the line went outside but they were so efficient that the wait was no longer than 10 minutes. They had 4 registers open taking orders. The donuts all range in size and variety from the dirty snowball (chocolate doughnut with coconut and peanut butter on the top) to the Memphis mafia(fried with banana chucks, chocolate and peanut butter icing, peanuts, chocolate chips). Now the Memphis mafia was AMAZING. All three of my favorite flavors majestically combined into a large doughy vessel of greatness. The Cock'n'Balls (Yes thats the name of it) is essentially 3 Bavarian creme donuts combined together in the shape of a.....well you can guess by the name of the doughnut. Another glorious tribute to the doughnut gods. 

All in all I was not disappointed with my super random trip and all the hype was well deserved. It's really a shame that their isn't one closer to me here in LA because I would live there.

Oh did I mention that they do weddings too? Legitimate weddings. Something to consider for the true doughnut lovers out there or those that want to be crazy unique.

Great donuts! Yes, it's fun and some of the donuts are crazy - so I don't need to describe that here - but the staff was helpful in describing all the different options and we got in and out quick and easy. It helped that it was raining on a Sunday morning, so the line was only to the door, not out the door.

Not unlike the Bermuda Triangle, there's something magically aligned going on here: 

Location: Nearby strip clubs! Tiny! 

Personality: Semi-drag server, all pink chipped nail polish and haphazard ponytails, mid-drift exposing pink Voodoo baby-doll T. 

Decor: Straight up linger worthy, a jewel box to discover. A gaggle of photos and flyers.

Flavor: Bacon makes everything better after all...even doughnuts.
Fun! A must do in Portland!!  We went at 11pm and had to wait 30 Min.. but worth it.   Lots of good people watching!!  The donuts were yum... but you have to go more for the experience

My roommate brought back a pink box of gluttony on his last jaunt from Portland.  The hype had been built to a fever pitch by some of my other friends and this lived up to it.  He brought back a dozen and four of us sample through the majority of the menu ranging from cereal infused, cookie topped and more traditional fair. 

Highlights that of this assortment for me were:  The Old Dirty Bastard (choco frosting, Oreo's and peanut butter), Dirt Donut, No Name (another peanut butter, chocolate mix this time with rice krispies) and the Chocolate Coconut (basic but really awesome).

Even after a day and a half the remnants of our selection still taste great with little/no signs of drying out.  I'm impressed Voodoo.  I'll see you again this summer.

I missed out on eating a Prince Themed Doughnut after he passed! I really LOVE Voodoo Doughnuts' Doughnuts! I could eat one everyday! The front counter staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There was even a Photo Booth at the Downtown Voodoo Doughnuts for a while. I wonder if it's still there? Great place to visit, or take family and friends, if you don't mind a wait in a sometimes long line. There are usually PLENTY of different types to choose from when you arrive mid day, as well. And... the Bus and MAX lines are really close by! Yay! Don't forget to get a Milk when you're there. I even purchased a Mug with the Voodoo Donuts' slogan " The Magic is in the Hole! " I use it frequently at my house. It would make a great gift for your closer family members, maybe? I got the Black Mug. There is also a Pink Mug with a " Hole " built into it for a little more money. I look forward to coming back to get more Doughnuts again sooner than later!
No real review needed, this place is awesome.

I had a dream last night that I finally went and got Voodoo Doughnuts again, and got a Cap'n Crunch doughnut and an Oreo doughnut.

Woke up and it wasn't real, cried.

I'm not even really a huge doughnut fan, but when in Rome, right?  The ambiance was a great experience and the quirkiness of the place was simply a trip just to ...take it all in.  The doughnuts appear to be on steroids!  I didn't go all weird in my choice (again not a huge doughnut fan), but instead went with basic maple bar and lemon filled powder sugar.  Huge.  Had to eat one and save the other for later.  Was here with my son and one of his friends while we were on college tours and it was fun people watching while in line... which was pretty late at night btw.  The only thing I would say I would change or suggest on is.... it's CASH ONLY.  We had just come from dinner and this sign is up closer to the front (so you don't know this while getting in line all the way in the back).  Fortunately I had enough cash left, but seriously... most people use debt cards for everything so I would suggest stepping up your game for convenience on that note.

Line out the door. Cool
Decor.
Great
Selection, very funky selection. But overall
A good donut. Open 24 hours crazy it's this busy

This is truly a Portland institution. I've been going to this place since forever, but you have to be patient at times because there can be long lines, filled with tourists and donut-lovers. I usually go early in the morning when there's hardly anyone there. My favorite is the orangegutan and no one can say no to the voodoo doll my second favorite... oh heck, i love them all, alright?!

I know this place has a reputation of being all hype but I was pleasantly surprised! Yes there was a long line like always, but once you are actually inside the workers really move the line along fast. I didn't like how I couldn't find any prices for the doughnuts (I looked al over the internet before going!) and I also couldn't find anyone's personal opinions on any of the specific doughnuts so I thought I'd share some tips on what to order. 

Double bubble: Any kid would love this! Loved the appearance and the frosting was very yummy and tasted a lot like bubble gum
Miami berry vice: One of my favs! This is the prettiest doughnut I have ever laid my eyes on. Very fruity and delicious! 
Voodoo doll: Its just an average jelly doughnut but still pretty good and very cute
Arnold Palmer: Bleh! Worst one I had! No taste, kinda dry.. 
Dirty old bastard: I'm not a peanut butter person but besides that great doughnut!
Lemon chiffon crueler: I wish there was more of a lemony taste to this but the texture was spot on
Portland cream: Average
