Mango Tango: The BEST! No doubt my favorite! The frosting was amazing and the jelly was to die for. If you like tang and mango jelly get this doughnut I insist!! 
Aint that a peach fritter: This doughnut is HUGE! It was about $3 so pricier than the others but well worth it. I couldn't taste any peach but very nice fritter with wonderful cream cheese frosting. 

These doughnuts range in price but most were around a dollar which I think is a steal for these delicious and unique doughnuts! I hate to see these negative reviews because voodoo is a Portland must! 

P.S. all these doughnuts were shared amongst 6 people and just a tip, eat them as fast as you can but some have lasted about 3 or 4 days (the fritter of course)

Best late night snack after a night of drinking or doing anything really. 
They do run out of donuts so watch out. It is very disappointing when they do.

Craving doughnuts of every shape, size, color, and flavor? Voodoo is the right place for you. Their doughnuts are always fresh and there's so many different types that I rarely order the same thing every time. Prices are pretty good and although the line may be long at times, it is most definitely worth the wait.

I frequently visit Portland and was finally able to make a stop at Voodoo. I went around 9pm after dinner and the line actually wasn't that long, not even out the door. i guess i was just lucky. i actually appreciated the line because it allowed me to read all of the flavors and look around. I choose the BlueMoonPie. Chocolates glazed topped with Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal and a Blue Moon (as in the beer) flavored filling. It was out of this world. The other donut i had was basically a colossal chocolate and peanut butter overload. Trust me, i ate the later that night and was beyond full with how rich it was. The other was one of the best breakfast treats ever!

Seriously, I can't even believe you're reading a review on Voodoo Doughnuts!

Don't think, just GO.

Soft, melt in your mouth donut super fresh ('cause they're super busy)... We went on a Wednesday- no line!!

Just went through a breakup Voodoo was a super sweet pick-me up!

Tiny, original, perfect.... The originality is mighty inviting! 

Toppings are so delicious, I thought they may be too rich... BUT I WAS WRONG! :-)

If you're diebetic stay clear.... Resistance is hardly possible!

Why would you come to Portland and NOT come here? Delicious. So many odd flavors and combos it's hard to choose just one. A little pricey but the experience is worth it. When else can you get donuts like this? FYI- cash only, so come prepared!
Delicious way to spend your calories! They work 24/7 too.

Wasn't sure if I should believe the hype about these donuts but was told it's a must while in Portland. Arrived on a Monday night expecting to have a line out the door as it had been the previous nights we had passed by. To our surprise there was a very short line! Purchased a few donuts to try and took them back to the hotel expecting to have some with the next mornings coffee. The room smelled amazing and we couldn't wait! Holy moly they were good!!!! Wish we had gone back before coming home and brought a pink box of happiness home boooo! But why haven't they opened an airport location?

We had heard all about Voodoo doughnuts but wondered if it was just weird toppings on a less than stellar doughnut. We had the Maple Bacon Bar, Chuckles Doughnut, Apple Fritter, and a plain glazed doughnut. They were all amazing. It's not just the topping folks. The base doughnut is spectacular.

Good thing I don't live in Portland. I would have to eat these donuts after every night of drinking.

I am a big fan of the rice crispys peanut butter combination...

As promised, I came back in May for another go and there were no stale cereals this time around!

I ate the incredibly delicious and fluffy but uber-sweet Memphis Mafia (Banana fritter filled with real banana and covered with peanut butter, chocolate, and chocolate chips).  It was huge and hugely satisfying.  We also ordered a maple blunt and a vegan doughnut.

I want to keep coming back just to try all the silly combos, especially now that they are all so delicious.  Next time, I'm getting a cock n balls for sure!
Maybe the coolest doughnut place ever. Bacon on a maple bar? Sure. Pumpkin spiced filling in a cinnamon Sugar doughnut? Fantastic. Go weird and you'll love it.
Overall this is a great place to get a delicious doughnut. I live for bacon maple bars

I'm from California. Before I went to Portland, I kept hearing about the best doughnut place in the world. I was completely skeptical until I heard they made a maple doughnut with bacon on top. Then I said to myself, "self, any doughnut shop that puts bacon on a doughnut has to be good." So I was excited to go there. Then I went to Portland and did. At first they didn't have the bacon maple doughnut. I was sad. To console myself, I ate a cock 'n balls (delicious all in its own). A couple mornings later I went back to get the bacon doughnut. They had some! Sweet delicious doughnut. So amazing and delicious.

Oh, and they aren't one of those new-y shops that have a ridiculous spelling for their items. You've seen them around. The horrid spelling of 'donut.' Gah. It hurts me just typing it. Voodoo Doughnut has the spelling that I prefer, which was the make or break. Ergo, they are perfect all around.

Let me start off by saying, I'm not a fan of donuts. I never have been, but while I was in Portland I had to try Voodoo Doughnuts and I was not disappointed. We bought a box of donuts for our road trip and the girl behind the counter chose which ones we got because we were having a hard time deciding. Of course there were a few in there that weren't my cup of tea, but the majority of what we got was fantastic and deserves all of the hype surrounding them. Now that I'm back on the east coast I'm bummed that there isn't anything like Voodoo Doughnuts near us. We are going to Arizona on vacation this September and I am sorely tempted to make a road trip to Colorado just so I can satiate my craving. We will definitely be making a stop at Voodoo Doughnuts on our next trip to the west coast.
I don't really like donuts, but this place is AMAZING! The donuts are named the most absurd like "cock and balls" and have toppings such as captain crunch, rice crispy treats, and cocoa crispies.

The longest lines! But worth it - the donuts are really neat looking - they're interesting to say the least. It may not be a place where you would frequent - but definitely a place to go once in your life - or with out of town guests.
Ya just gotta go there. You may only need to go there once, but if you are in Portland you have to go. Everything is worth trying. I always go for the Vegan ones!
best donuts ever, but the real review is - maple bar with bacon is a religious experience!
This is by far the Ultimate of all Bakery's!!  Awesome atmosphere and the late hours Rock!!

Swahili lessons on Monday nights, marriages performed, live music on the weekends, and both a maple bar topped with bacon, as well as a concoction that looks like, and thus is named, the "cock n' balls." (Marvel at my witty use of "concoction" in that sentence...it was pretty good). 

Various doughnuts topped with candy bar bits and sugary cereals is enough to impress anyone. Especially good choice if you are taking a dozen to the office, the doughnuts will gain a few laughs! And if they don't laugh, you can always mold your choice doughnut to their likeness and stab it with pushpins...it might work...

Worth a line of approx 50 people or less. If more than that then go to voodoo too.
Try the voodoo doll and the ol dirty bastard!

There are two voodoo dougnuts. One is located n downtown, the other is located across the bridge and is called Voodoo too. There are usually shorter lines at the other one. 

Doughnuts here are the best. People often say there is nothing special, they are wrong. All doughnuts are homemade, and they even make yummy vegan doughnuts that don't taste like a shoe! Go here!
Short wait, amazing service and the donuts were delish. It's a must go if you ever get the chance to.
absolutely....hands down.... the best doughnuts in the world.... bottom line.... refrigerator....
OH. MY. GOD. Bacon maple donuts?  Hell yeah! They were awesome, as was the Oreo-peanut butter one!
Love their doughnuts! The hibiscus one is my favorite  The doughnuts are also super inexpensive. They only take cash, but an ATM is located inside for convenience.

Felt like we had to stop here when driving through Portland after seeing it on TV so many times and am so glad we did, loved this place! They have so many different choices for doughnuts that you won't find other places. Tried the apple fritter, chocolate bar, and dirty old bastard all of them were delicious!
How can you not like the Voodoo?  I just went because you have to go if you're visiting West Portland.  Nice people, yummy treats.  Nuff said.

Every article I read about Portland says skip voodoo & go to pips or blue star BUT voodoo is amazing! 

I came here a few years ago and got a blue donut with pink sprinkles but I didn't think it was that great but last week we came back and tried it again! We got a fruity captain crunch donut. 

I recommend sticking to one of their cereal classic donuts because the frosting on it is delectable & very unique. 

The smell lures you in from the street. 

Very decent prices! Worth the experience! 
CASH ONLY!

I want to say it is all about the Maple Bacon Bar . . . I crave this doughnut, Plan road trips around this doughnut, Commit myself to the underbelly of Northwest nightlife for this doughnut, Revel in the pure foodie delight of this doughnut . . . Yet I have a mistress! Perhaps not my true love, but damn she's fine . . . and I can't stop thinking about her. She's a little trashy, but in Voodoo doughnut, she fits right in. When I pick her up at the counter, I can feel the wanton stares of slackers with munchies thinking they should be with her instead of me. I know I'm not her first . . . Hell, she's probably been with half this town, but when I'm with her, I don't care. She makes me feel alive, and in that moment, she's all mine . . . the orangutang doughnut. Raised, Glazed and Sprinkled with Tang, they aren't lying when they say the magic is in the hole!

Seriously, I may take my time savoring every bit of the Maple Bacon Bar, but I devour the Orangutang (sometimes twice.) These are my doughnuts . . . and DAMN they're good.

To round out an order I'm partial to (a custom take on ) the dirty old bastard -  a raised doughnut filled with raspberry jelly, glazed with chocolate, covered with crushed Oreos and then drizzled with peanut butter. I also like the Memphis Mafia - a banana fritter with peanut butter and  chocolate.

Next to a hentai (Japanese for anime porn) theater and in a slightly seedy part of town, you can't help but feel you are doing something wrong here. Its 2 am, you're shaking  . . . don't start a fight in the ridiculously long line . . . avoid the cops (you already know how they feel towards crime and doughnuts) . . . find a quite spot in the shadows under the bridge, or in the park along the river . . . and feed your addiction.

I'm not a tattoo man . . . but after a few drinks and a trip to Voodoo, I might make an exception . . . after all, Its Portland!

P.S. Cash Only, and if Voodoo is out of your particular fix, they have a Bigger, Commercially Pinker, Velvet Kenny Rogers Trailer Park Shrine across the river, just a mile or two away.
what else can i say but the maple bacon donut is BOMB!!!! the line looks line but goes pretty fast. for sure have to stop here whenever your in portland.
You have to try the maple bacon bars, which are ridiculous, but their cruller donuts are also really good!

They have an amazingly diverse menu, with choices for vegans as well as us meat eaters. We got a dozen of various dougnuts, and even the vegan options are great (I tried a vegan devils food, and it was awesome). The original location is crazy busy, but there is more than one, so drive around and go to the one with the shortest line. A must-visit if you're in town. 

Bring cash!

After reading Tony L's review of the place, I knew it had to be added to the road trip list!  I happen to be a love of all things donuts - and I spell it the lazy man's way because I can :p

This will be stop #2, methinks...
I would recommend trying the lemon filled donut, it was so delicious. I would recommend this place to anyone. The lines can get big but it is worth the wait.

Fun Fun donuts.

The donuts are not the best quality donuts, but their flare more than makes up for it.

My two favorites are the furit loops donut and the marshmallow donuts.  The Colossus, the tang donut and the maple bacon are pretty good too.

Surprisingly, they taste even better when you're drunk.

Love this spot, donuts here... One of a kind. I had to come through this spot even with the lines being long. Its the O.G... Thee Original Original Voodoo! Decor was pretty swanky, looks exactly like my apartment minus the cash register. Who wouldn't want a big pink sprinkled doughnut in their living room? I would.... Dang, should of bought a tee shirt! Love this place!
The best thing you ever put in your mouth. Absolutely worth the long line. These doughnuts are amazing. Come try one soon!!!

Delicious donuts! That's all that really needs to be said. I will be so sad when I go back home and can't eat these donuts anymore. .  But I have a couple more days to try more flavors. This place is great!

Do you like penis-shaped foods? Well then this place is for you! They even have a cream-filled penis-shaped donut complete with a set of balls. The line for this place is usually out the door and down the block, no matter what time of day it is. Go get yourself a pink box filled with happiness.
Amazing selection and even better taste. This is a doughnut that is well worth the wait. It's cash only so keep that in mind and order one of each.
Everything is cool about this place. The variety, the atmosphere, the service. Loved it.

Since I was in Portland, I had to make a stop here. I would recommend getting there early in the morning since it looked like the line was quite long later in the day. They have a nice selection of Vegan doughnuts. Which is kind of a rare thing for me to see.

Seriously, I had been totally happy with donuts in my area (and they're still holding up my standards) but after having Voodoo's maple glazed bacon bar ... I was so sad that I don't live in Portland and wished I could get some more of maple glazed bacon bar on the way back!  

The donut was just perfect; soft, moist, sweet and savory (if you try the maple bacon bar).  Every bite was worth waiting in line with a bunch of high school students from prom at midnight (yes, they open 24 hours a day!).  They were all wearing tuxedos and dresses with heavy make-up on but were all hungry for donuts ... ah, the youth ... 

The place was so small and it was packed with people.  Slightly buzzed, yet I was able to smell the bacon in the store from the minute I walked in; it was heavenly!

I was hoping to see the donut selection a bit more clearly from the display shelf, but too many donuts are cramped together inside.  I guess locals already know what to order?  I just followed what my friends recommended.  

Ah, another thing which has been mentioned by others ... you should have cash before you go in there.  Even though there is an ATM inside the store, it's just easier to carry some cash with you.

It is a must-visit place when you go to Portland.  You won't regret it.  It is really really good.

The doughnut shop has become a portland landmark like Powell's books or Starry Night. 

captain crunch on a doughnut. only in PDX
I love the music, and the mango tango is phenomenal. My son was in awe at the selection.

Yummy donuts, don't let the long line fool you it goes by really fast. Give it a shot. I suggest you pick what you want before you get in there. There is so much to choose from. My personal Fave was The Memphis Mafia followed by Neapolitan.

SUGAR HIGH!! Ever since seeing Parker eat one of these doughnuts on Leverage, I've wanted one! So while i was in town I stopped by and got me the same fruity loops donut. SO FUN! There was a line outside and people were getting the 'best sellers dozen' for $19.90. What a deal for awesomely cool donuts! 

The dough is so soft, airy and light. Yummy. I'm so happy!
Love their vegan options, especially their apple fritters.  Be prepared to wait in line though.

Voodoo donut is so infamous that we were TOLD to go there by a dude we met during a wine tasting trip in Napa.
Boy, were we glad we made it!! opened from 10pm - 10am, this donut shop sells the most FUNKY donuts you can EVER imagine. My hunnie got the bloodfilled and the cereal-topped donut. They were so good, he didn't even share!!! 

The atmosphere of the place is way cool with a wide combination of folks  lining up patiently (for up to 15 minutes) all the way out of the shop just so they could make a grab for their donuts. 

yeah, it was THAT good.
No but Iv'e seen and tasted their awesome doughnuts.... It's on my list to visit Iv'e heard a lot of great comments on them from family and friends who visited.

holy shit sugar in all its karnations!  tarnations! darnations! damnations??  the line around the block speaks of the sorcery these  little apprentices  cast on unsuspecting diabetics.  resist! resist!    remember .....thou art mortal!

I wanna know where they are holding my Voodoo doll hostage!!! They probably dangle my doll right over the oven to ensure that I'm always getting punched in the tummy with an insatiable craving everytime they pull out a fresh batch of those crack-o-licious donuts! 

When visiting some family in Oregon, they already know to put this place on the itinerary.  Since the secrets of this place have been featured on tv, there is a bit of a wait to get some donuts. 

This isn't a "pick up some quick donuts for the meeting" sorta place.  It's a donutters' destination spot, so once you understand that, you'll see that the wait is actually quite tolerable.  Just use that time to catch up with your friends, or play some Angry Birds or Draw Something, or be a good neighbor and take photos for the tourists in line, who want the perfect pic of themselves and the Voodoo Donuts signage.  

People wait in way longer and more ridiculous lines at some donut spots here in the OC, and yet their donuts could never dream of holding a rainbow sprinkle next to Voodoo Donuts's creations (Yep, I'm talking to you M&M Donuts and your overly fried blueberry donuts!)

The shop is quite small, so they let people in by one small group at a time. Once your group is allowed entrance to the donuts' den, you'll immediately fall into a hypnotic trance from the spinning donut display. Cap'n Crunch, Oreo, Peanut Butter Chocolate, Maple Bacon, Ghost Jelly...the deliriously indulgent concoctions go on and on!  

Whether you like light and yeasty or dense and cakey donuts, sweetly tart fruit-filled or deliciously decadent topped donuts, tried and true, traditional or adventurous Food Network feature flavored donuts, Voodoo's got the donut spells for any and all of your donut needs, that even Harry Potter would jealous of :p
I LOVE Voodoo, Just wish they took Visa/Debit. It is a must to have voodoo anytime you visit Portland

This place is awesome. it's right off of the rail. you get off the rail of of chinatown. Given that there are so many reviews i'll try to make this easy:

+ Get the portland cream
+ Get the maple bacon bar
+ Avoid lines by going later in the day

Enjoy!

Being in Portland for the first time we knew we had to come here at least once! The line was long when we went, but not ridiculous, we waited for about 15 min. People are right when they say, "a donut is a donut" but I still thought voodoo was very tasty and I enjoyed the novelty over anything! 

TIP: don't get overly excited and buy too many donuts. If you are going to save the leftovers use an air tight bag/container. Also, this place is CASH ONLY.
Cast restraint to the wind and go for it.  We all could have died if the Mayans were correct and, what, you haven't experienced Voodoo still?    Gotta live, people!

Best doughnut place EVARRRR. Where else can you get these perfect combinations on fried dough?!

We went here twice during our trip to Portland. The first time we didn't really know what to get/couldn't decide, so we got the voodoo dozen. It came with a good combination and she even threw in an extra one. We started eating them right when we got out of the shop, all the way back to our hotel. They were so delicious and the flavors were so original.

After doing research and making a list of the ones we wanted, we went back a second time to buy them to bring back home. I really like the Ol' Dirty Bastard and I think the McMinnville Cream is my favorite one. The lemon crueller is really good too! They also have vegan ones, but they are so good that you wouldn't even be able to tell that they're vegan.

The 2nd time, I got 10 donuts and paid $18. The first time when we got the voodoo dozen (when they choose for you) it only costs $10.50. You save a lot of money getting the voodoo dozen but you don't get to choose what you want. If it's your first time I think getting the voodoo dozen would be a good choice since it's really hard deciding!

Oh yeah, I felt like a celebrity at the airport both in Portland and back in Sacramento holding that box of doughnuts! So many people commented on them...that's how popular they are!
This place is totally Bitchin'.  Period.

It was December 26 and I was coming off a BAD stomach flu.( Merry Christmas to me, woohoo!) I didn't get to go to the 24 Hour Hotcake House for a giant pile of carbs, so I settled on having a donut. I guess that says a lot about me that I went from gatorade and oatmeal directly to fried dough. Ha! I had Vegan Lemon Chiffon, which was tasty and would fool any non-vegan in a heartbeat. My friend had a lovely blueberry one that was like a fried version of a blueberry muffin. All together now...YUM! 

If I had been feeling better, I would have had to sample many more...the Arnold Palmer, Memphis Mafia...there's always next time!

I'm not usually a huge donut fan, but if I ever make my move to PDX, Voodoo would finally get me to stop eating plain cake donuts, for sure!

It was nice experience for refreshing mind and a new adventure of road trip! I like they're open 24hours, serving pretty big size of doughnuts and it was nicely chewy & soft and they served the vegan doughnuts as well. I waited for 30mins to make an order while I'm waiting they have so many things to see of their interiors, scenery of outside and I've been watching people drawing and sprayed painting in the street. That 30 mins went so fast cuz most likely I keep took snapchats and recorded a live video on Facebook for my friends and families to show how amazing it is lol I'm definitely coming back for sure :)

The bacon maple bar is to die for...the rest of the doughnuts are a little pricey for what they are but the appeal to Voodoo Doughnuts to me personally is the novelty of it all. They have a large variety of cleverly named and decorated doughnuts, the staff is nice and they are open 24 hours! They also do weddings and vow renewals, which are actually really fun. I renewed my vows the last time I visited and it was magical. I recommend it for couples who like silliness and fun!
vegan doughnuts taste great. the customer service was very friendly. awesome place

What can I say about Voodoo donuts that hasn't already been said. The Maple Bacon gets a lot of hype but The Memphis mafia and Dirty Doughnut are much better in my opinion. Just wish those lines weren't so damn long.

Thanks to Anthony Bourdain, VooDoo Doughnut has all the reviews it needs. It's not necessary for me to go on and on about this place. 

The maple bacon bar. Orgasm. Multiple orgasms.

This surpassed my expectations. I visit many donut places and expected it to be packed, with half-ass donuts that only impressed people for their design. I was wrong. 

I came in on a Wednesday morning around 730 and nobody was there. I was able to take my time choosing a dozen donuts from their rotating display. The donuts were perfect and the added toppings and creams were just a bonus. I enjoyed the cream filled donut with chocolate frosting and he original glazed the most, but all of the others were great. I ordered one of the voodoo ones thinking it had normal cream inside, but turns out it was jelly. 

The only donuts I probably wouldn't get again are the original and the original with chocolate frosting. They were small, didn't taste as fresh, and generally disappointing.

B-O-M-B!

Had the Maple Bacon Bar, the Cock 'n Balls (triple filled with Bavarian cream), and the Dirty Old Bastard (peanut butter and oreos on top).

Totally worth the wait.  Just go at an odd time and there will basically be no waiting.  The doughnuts easily keep until the next day.

Our favorite of all the tempting selections is easily the Maple Bacon Bar....and everybody who comes to visit us out here in the Pacific Northwest agrees!  A stop at Voodoo Doughnuts is a must for the great atmosphere and smiles.
The place is eclectic which is fun. The donuts are excellent. Made of high end ingredients.

Cool selection of really good
Donuts in Portland, Oregon where it started. Every time we visit Seattle we drive down to Voodoo donuts. Live in San Diego and we now have a Voodoo at universal studious Hollywood but nothing is as great as the original.

This place is awesome!! I was visiting Portland from San Diego and Voodoo Doughnut was a must on my list of things to do. We sampled six different types and they were all to die for!!!  (The captain crunch doughnut is amazing!!) Definitely recommend this place:)

I had to try this place! I did! Ordered the box of 12. Beware: The cayenne doughnut can mess up your box I wish they would have boxed it separately because my wife is very sensitive to spicy food and it got on her maple bacon bar so she couldn't eat it.  Worth the wait tho! Get there early!

Delicious!.......

 And that is all that needs to be said. But unfortunately yelp disagrees. I loved all the donuts, my favorite wad the blueberry.

Voodoo Donuts is a must-see for anyone not from Portland. They have so many amazing customs donuts and pastries. The donuts are just as amazing as the people that works there. Thank you so much for giving me excellent customer service every time and every Voodoo Donuts I've ever been in. I hope this company go strong forever. Don't go unless you have time because sometimes the lines can get a little long but only in the downtown one. If you go outside at the downtown Voodoo Donuts you'll get no lines. I personally like going Downtown because I can walk around at the cute shops afterwards. Delicious hands down best I've ever had. Try the Oreo

If you want the true VooDoo experience, go late on a Saturday night during the summer. You'll wait in line for at least a half an hour, all the while the line is moving and you will make tons of new friends. Don't go looking for customer service, go looking for doughnuts!  There will be people everywhere.  The food trucks across the street will be open, playing loud music.  It will be fabulous.

I've been hearing about this place for years and I finally tried one of their creations, okay I tried five, so what? ;) Talk about one amazing doughnut! I've never been one to really be able to turn a doughnut down, it's a worth it good thing in my book. 
There actually wasn't even a whole lot of guilt as they are so big, you can eat half and share with someone and still feel satisfied. The maple bacon bar is by far a fave. Totally worth standing in line for 45 minutes and schlepping them back on the flight home.

Great doughnuts. Many flavors! Cash only. Line will vary throughout the day but worth the wait! Tables outside and you can go down the street to stumpton coffee to eat them and enjoy a cup o joe (which is also sold at voodoo). At least have to try then if you're in town.

A doughnut shop with a Horror Punk theme. I love it. Always creative and worth the wait. Unique doughnuts with unusual names (Triple Chocolate Penetration, Dirty Ol' Bastard and TexASS to name a few). A PDX staple. Great for late night.

If you are visiting you MUST try voodoo. Been here several times since I started college, but some of my favorites include: old dirty bastard (chocolate pb oreo fix), orange filled (citrus and very sweet, vanilla frosting), maple bacon (perfectly sweet and salty)!  Lots of calories, but worth it if you're ready to splurge.

Yummmmm!!!! I love voodoo doughnut. Definitely the most touristy place in portland; expect long lines wrapped around the building at any time of the day. Still it is more than worth it. Their doughnuts are proofed fresh in house (no instant yeast here) and the cake doughnuts are to die for. Flavor combos are unique. Don't try the imitations, come here and get the real deal!
What a spectacular place for the weird! Love all the variety's! A MUST for the visitor from our of town! I see these pink boxes at the airport all the time of people bringing them to other states!
Bomb donuts! You must get multiple kinds because they are all amazing! Even the simple chocolate covered donuts are to die for!

Employees are friendly and personable. Long lines but it's exactly what you'd expect to get. The donuts are over the top and as good as they look. We make it up here about twice a year and it's a nice treat for my kiddos.
Awesome doughnut for the price.... Maybe not always worth the wait, but if there isn't much of a line totally worth it. Triple chocolate penetration is my jam.

Visited Portland last summer and was very excited to try one of the most famous doughnuts in the country...............and it was great ! I loved these doughnuts because they are not greasy ! It is so damn hard to find a nice fluffy, buttery doughnut. I had the Maple Bacon Bar and the Bubble Gun. The icing was nice and thick........and moist! The icing on the doughnuts I have had in the past have had a hard shell of frosting that tastes old. These doughnuts also taste very fresh compared to other places I have been too. I waited in line for at least half an hour at this location and had I known about that, I probably would have visited a different location, like the others in Portland or the one in Eugene while on my way back to California.
Food Quality 0-5:5
A nice fluffy doughnut that isn't greasy what more could you ask for :)
Cleanliness 0-5: ?????
It was to crowded for me to notice the cleanliness, honestly.
Customer Service 0-5: 3
She seemed rushed and I cant blame her, but you don't come here to get a chipper barista either.
I would recommend going to a different location or during a slow hour of the week day.
Voodoo doughnuts ruined me, and I can no longer eat a doughnut unless it is from them. Everything else is disgusting. I make anyone who visits me from out of town try them. BEST doughnuts EVER

Stopped by here on a road trip from Seattle to LA. It's awesome! I don't eat a lot of doughnuts, but if they're in front of me I would definitely eat a lot of them. I guess that's what happened with Voodoo Doughnuts. Shared a dozen + a few more with my boyfriend, and they were all delicious with the perfect texture. I'll admit, we only dropped by here because of the TV exposure it received, and it probably is overrated but how would I know? If it's good then it's good.

My favorite one was probably the bear claw with the banana filling? And the oreo with chocolate and peanut butter doughnut, that one was also bomb. Actually they were all good.
Hands down the best donuts I've ever had. We got the most popular donuts and it was worth every penny. Will definitely be visiting again when I'm back in town!

Why does this brilliant place need yet another review?! Because some of you just aren't getting it right.

Give Voodoo 5 stars!

Nobody else has ever indulged me with a maple bacon bar.

I am from AZ but travel to Portland several times a year and I always go out of my way to make sure I end up at the voodoo at some point. Anyone who is from Portland or has visited there knows how eclectic the city really is. There is actually a half way house right next door to the voodoo and the voodoo actually donates food and proceeds to the place regularly which I find to be amazing and a great reminder of what a great place Portland really is. I will always visit the voodoo when I'm in Portland!
Fun place if you love donuts.  Don't have a plan donuts.  Make sure you try the special ones. They do run out

Why not another star? Wait a minute, it's hiding in the donut hole of that little-big glazed creation I just downed. Insanely finger-lickin" good. And then the maple bar. It didn't last long either. The icing on the cake: Voodoo's patented pink box--one part carry-out luggage, and one-part musem fine art piece. Hey Yelpsters, I'm just warmin' up.

***CASH ONLY*** Although there is an ATM inside, no one likes service fees, even if it's $2.50.
Always enjoy visiting here. Their doughnuts are both creative and delicious.
Their Voodoo donut doll cracks me up. It's a guy with a pretzel stuck through his heart and raspberry jelly filled.
The Homer is my favorite. Dont ask why, it just tastes good. Also got Mango Tango and Grape Ape which are all amazing.

Well damn. Another uber popular place that I was reluctant to try but wound up loving. These were more like the donuts I grew up with than Blue Star, and alot more whimsical. I had the guava coconut and my wife had the voodoo child donut. Both are super sweet, injected with jam. The novelty of all their donuts is impressive and it's hard to make a decision. Don't be fooled...unless you enjoy diabetic coma's, JUST GET ONE! your belly and ass will thank you later. 
there was a very short line at 3pm in the afternoon on a weekday, and it moved fast. The staff were very friendly despite people having plenty of time to choose and then not knowing what to get, or busy taking pictures...I guess their use to their infamy by now. 
Some outside seating, and lots of homeless people milling around asking for spare change. But don't let the hype deter you....I really enjoyed my sugary treat here. 
CASH ONLY!

A unique oregon experience, for some expensive doughnuts.  The donuts were like nothing I have seen or tasted before, and with enough sugar to last you for a week.

Expect loooooong lines.
Awesome! I was like a kid in a candy store! Picked up a few to eat later. Donut prices were reasonable! Cash only!
Best donuts in Portland. The whole atmosphere is very cool. And best of all it's open 24 hours

Happy to say I don't agree with the negative reviews! I am visiting from Dallas and was told "you HAVE to try voodoo donuts!" So, when I read the negative reviews I was a little disappointed. 
However, I tried anyway! 

We went at around 6:30 and there was no line. It's 24 hours. Still had tons of donuts and a large selection. We got 8 donuts for about $11. Pretty good for this type of unique donuts! 

The first one I ate was the M&M donut. YUM. A cake donut- the perfect consistency. That crunchy outside SOFT inside balance. With the perfect amount of m&ms. 
Next I had the Portland cream. Cream filled donut with chocolate on top. Highly recommend! Got a lot more that I have yet to try. My parents had the mango filled donut and also said it was delicious. 

Friendly staff and great donuts! Definitely a must-stop-by. 

Some people must have had a negative experience, or just got the basic donuts, but I was pleasantly surprised with mine!

Oh man oh man ohhhh man. 

I took a trip out to the PDX with a friend of mine and we made it a plan to try all the donuts. (Regret because by the time I got back, the SoulCycle classes got harder) But with that we agreed we HAD to go to Voodoo despite the "hype" and what the haters (aka Blue Star) said. 

The building is so pretty, with the glitter bricks! It looks like a unicorn threw up all over it. Trust me... IT'S PRETTY. We went around noon, on a weekend/holiday weekend and waited about 10 minutes in line. This is where my friend and I regret the trip. We only got ONE donut each... yeah... ONE. I got Captian, My Captain (my inner Dead Poets self was geeking out) - which was a basic donut with vanilla icing and of COURSE, CAPTAIN CRUNCH. It was delicious, not oily, and very fun. Can you taste fun? Well, I don't know - if you could it'd tastes like Voodoo. 

Overall, the donut was great - better than Blue Star, which I wish my dozen box was a pink one instead. The price is well worth it, I think it was around $1 - bless and overall made my PDX trip sweeter. 

Crunchy Tip: Cash only!
These are hands down the best donuts I've ever had. Sure, the wait was forever, but the donuts were worth it!! They're so light and fluffy and fresh. I wish we had one in Florida
OOHHH! Bacon and maple bar!! Fresh and delicious combination!

Unfortunately, I live on the West side of Portland and only get Voodoo donuts about 3x a year. They are the best! Everytime we have friends from out of town we head to Voodoo Donuts. Wish we had Voodoo in Beaverton... Luv them!

My friends and I found this place by accident one night and now it has become a late night tradition when we are in Portland.  I don't even like doughnuts very much, but these are amazing.    Crazy concoctions are cool to check out, but everything is tasty and cheap!  It is worth standing in line to just experience this place.

Have a sweet tooth? YUMMMM this place is super duper awesome! Line is a little long but worth the wait. We came from Washington and we're on our way to Cali, and decided to stop here for a quick snack before driving on. It was definitely worth it! DELICIOUS! I love the creative names! I love the vodoo donut, maybe because I like filled donuts, but i would love to come back here for more sweets!

Worth the hype! Don't listen to people when they say it's overrated... maybe it is overrated but the donuts are still DELICIOUS. You donut need that negativity in your life! What you do need is a delicious donut!

YUM YUM YUM YUM. For the past 5 months I have stopped eating fast food, and have turned into a total health freak.... but...... I would totally stuff my face here.......... if only I lived closer. If I lived closer that may be dangerous too.....

How does this place have 3 stars? Guessing the wait...

Service: The wait for us was about 45 minutes. I feel like there must be a quicker way to sell donuts.. but I guess this is part of it being somewhat famous. 

Donuts: We got 4 donuts (one each). We got the fruit loop, captain crunch, maple blunt, and a homer donut. My favorites were the fruit loop and the homer! These really were the best donuts I've ever had in my life. Perfect texture, yummy frosting, and just everything was amazing about them! 

Worth the wait I would say! :)
The donut's were to die for!well for me at least since I'm a big donuts fan! Was nice and fluffy and overall delicious.

This is one of my favorite places in Portland! I was on a work trip with some friends and we all decided to try it out for ourselves. I even remember seeing it as a place not to be missed on either the Food Network or Travel Channel.

Now, I RARELY get doughnuts, but I came back here -- twice! It was busy at all hours of the day with a steady flow of customers going in and out. I love the atmosphere and the workers' attitudes. I think the doughnut names say it all: The Dirt Doughnut, Tex-ass, Cock n Balls, Old Dirty Bastard... you get the idea.

There is nothing traditional about this place, right down to the Maple Bacon Bar. Which has been around long before the weird bacon dessert trend ever started rearing its ugly head... 

I tried a fruity doughnut with some coffee the first time, then the O.D.B., chocolate, peanut butter and oreo chunks, and subsequently needed to order a carton of milk. The flavors are rich and tasty, and I could feel my ass getting bigger with every bite. But it was worth it!

It's not something I'd do every day, but if in Oregon, it's a fun little stop. In fact, I plan on coming by later this summer with my boyfriend when I'm in town again! It's a fun experience and really gives you a good idea what the "Keep Portland Weird" slogan is all about! :)
Voodoo has the BEST damn donuts ANYWHERE!  You gotta check them out!
PERFECTION. The lines are bad, but the doughnuts are good. If the line at VD1 is crazy, go to VD2

Incredible creations and delicious donuts. 

Worth the stop and wait!

Even after a 10 hour drive back to Sacramento -the donuts tasted good.

After seeing Voodoo Doughnut show up on Yelp almost everyday I paid a visit, got the bacon maple bar and I have fallen under the spell now!

                         ^^^^^^^          
                       /             \      o Maple 
 Bacon o      I   ~    ~   I    /
                \      \      ^     /   /
                  \ __\ ------ /_/_                                  
                 /  \        m     /     \             VOODOOOOOOOO !!!!!!!!!!!          
                /  /| \      a   , /   I\   \                             
              (  (  |  \ ,   r     `   I  )  )          "Did someone just pinch me??''
                \_\|  `     k         I /_/                  
                    |         i          I                "Why do I suddenly crave something bacon-y??"
                     \========/                            
                      |        I        |           "Did someone just pinch me again??''
                      |       / \       |                    
                      |__ |   |__ |             "Why do I suddenly crave something maple-y??"
                       (_)     (_)                
                                                     "That's spooky!!!"

Lots of hype to visit Voodoo. What they offer is unquestionably unique! I personally like simple donuts, but I know my friends love their crazy ideas of what a donut can be. Definitely a place to bring friends who are visiting town here!

A little more expensive per donut but I believe they were worth it. Me and my friend has a variety of different ones and they were good for the most part. I didn't like the devil food one but that's my personal preference

This place should be near the top of the food list if you're visiting Portland especially because they serve vegan doughnuts, which I think tasted the best. My favorite vegan ones are the vanilla chicostick, grape ape, and the chocolate and/or maple frosted cream-filled. There's only one table and two benches inside, so it's more of a grab n' go place.

The line may have been long but it was totally worth the wait. I consider myself pretty well versed in donut culture and this place made it to the top of my donut list. Being a tourist, I didn't know what to expect but the guy who helped us was awesome and suggested a couple winners. He even gave me 2 free donuts! (I just so happened to be wearing a donut shirt that day and he liked it)
If I find myself in the area again, I will definitely make an appearance here again.

Yum! Yum! Yummy! First time here so I was excited to try it after my husband ranted on about how good they were and he knows I love donuts and sweets. So many to pick from! I had the viscous hibiscus, grape ape?, voodoo doll and the cinnamon crunch one. Line was out the door, but moved very quickly. The cashier I had was okay, not friendly, but not rude if that makes sense. I will be back to try others the next time I come back to Oregon.

I thought this place was really fun. 
Some of the donuts were a little too sugary for me but that said the voodoo jelly donut is one of the best donuts I've ever had!
I don't eat donuts often but if I were going to have one this would be the place 100%
This is really a Portland experience so for sure stop but and grab a donut when you are in town! I promise almost everything else you eat in Portland will be organic so you don't need to feel guilty ;) 
I would post the pic I have but it is eating one of the Cream filled so.... I'll keep that to myself. (you will see what I mean when you go)

I don't really care for donuts but decided to go late one night after an evening at Dantes right down the street.  I had the most amazing donut I have ever had (it had chocolate frosting, oreos and peanut butter)!  It is always open and everyone with me loved their donuts.
Worth the hour wait.... Amazing donuts.... Favorite was the chocolate coconut!  warning a lot of homeless in that area and a little scary in the evening.

Oh no, they have my favorite donut as the profile picture... They really ought to make the dirty old bastard cream filled! Then I could eat one and die happy. WTF, oreos and peanut butter on chocolate frosting. How about another bacon maple bar!

We were recommended by the hotel as well as friendly folks in town to try these donuts. We came late at night while bar hopping around town. I went for the Bacon Maple Bar, while my companions went for a Voodoo Doll and a Old Dirty Bastard. We were not disappointed. After having a bite of my Bacon Maple Bar, one of my companions got one also and saved it as breakfast for next morning.

CASH ONLY!

I'm actually pretty puzzled as to why Voodoo has 3 stars.

I might have lucked out given that I avoided waiting in line (I went around 1 or 2 on a rainy weekday), but I thought the donuts here were awesome. My friend and I shared the bacon maple bar donut and a marionberry filled jelly donut. They're not gourmet donuts, but 1) I thought both were pretty freakin' delicious, 2) it was fun looking at the spinning display of donuts, and 3) the donuts are cheap.

Yum!!! It was my first night in Portland so I had to come! I got the captain my captain and it was really good and fresh! Saw some reviews saying their doughnuts were stale but that was not the case for me! I really enjoyed my doughnut the icing pulled it all together. Plus, u get a good sugar high. If you're in town for a visit I recommend going for the experience. Went on a Friday night there was no wait. Thanks voodoo! \(=^.^=)/

It's as good as the hype says. It's staffed by a pretty hipster staff in already-hipster Portland, but we had great customer service, despite a 40-minute wait outside. The donuts are totally delicious - bacon maple bar, voodoo man, and every other cereal-chocolate-heaven-covered donut we ordered was just perfect. Don't miss it, it's worth the wait.

Besides the fact that these are world famous they also have my dream type of donut, raspberry jelly filled with chocolate frosting, which is also their main Voodoo Doll donut. I brought a box of these to my friends and they all found one they fell in love with! Although the line is long, the donuts are great and the people are very friendly. Would go again!

If you love Doughnuts and haven't been to Voodoo, you are missing out. 

Every single thing on their menu is so good. Cash only, so be prepared.

I love, love, love the Oreo cookies and creme doughnut. 

We always make sure to stop by when we are in town. So good!

This place is an institution, they sell Doughnut concoctions, not just doughnuts.  They are a little pricy if you're just looking for doughnuts, but the service their is genuinely nice.  They keep the line moving but aren't mean about it, and oh yes their is a line.  I just chalk it up to part of the experience. I mean c'mon waiting in line at 1 am for doughnuts...  but they are good tasting and well sized.  A must if you are a visitor to Portland.
Five stars for creativity and great fluffy goods! The line was long - but moved right along.the facade of the building is a beautiful covering of glittery bricks. Loved my maple, bacon!

You know what?  As a vegan, you just get used to going without certain foods... doughnuts, for example.  Then, one day your sister mentions that she found a bakery that does vegan doughnuts.  You're not expecting much, but you tag along to a hole-in-the-wall bakery to check out the vegan selection.  

How to choose?  They're all so pretty?

And really, really nice.  The consistency of the bread is spot-on, the subtle sweetness of the doughnut is perfectly complemented by the vegan frosting, and those sprinkles are so darn pretty.  My sister is coming to visit in June and she has specific instructions to come bearing Voodoo Doughnuts.

It blows my mind how many negative reviews there are here.  Voodoo is a must go as it is a Portland tradition.  I took some out-of-town friends there recently and they loved it.  It's unique and quirky and obviously very popular.  How can someone dislike Voodoo?  You might as well say you dislike Santa Claus.

Fantastic doughnuts!  It was worth the hour wait!  The second you drive into the parking lot, you can just imagine what the doughnut(s) are going to taste like.  The second you actually bite into the doughnut, you remember the smell and it's exactly what a doughnut should taste like!!!
I got the Voodoo Dozen.  I wanted to have a Bavarian Cream added.  The staff was awesome and added the doughnut I requested.  Hands-down the best Bavarian Cream I have ever had!!!  My kids loved the "fancy" treat doughnuts!!!  I can't wait to go back and try the maple bacon.
Only downside is, they need additional counter staffing.  That being said, it does not affect the taste or presentation of the doughnuts!!!

My family and I are visiting Portland for the very first time, and we had to visit Voodoo Doughnut while we are here. I'm not going to lie, the line was very long. It was also very, very hot outside and after about 45 minutes of waiting and sweating, we made it inside! We purchased 6 donuts and some tshirts. When we finally got back to our place, we then discovered what it was all about. The donuts were delicious, and the shirts were awesome too. I totally would recommend the Captain my Captian donut, with Captain Crunch on top! Great experience!!
Very creative! Scruptious donuts. The cock and balls was HUGE! TOOK ME 3 DAYS TO EAT IT! I love the voodoo donut too!

Fantastic donuts of inventive flavors! I loved the old dirty bastard donuts flavor because it had chocolate and peanut butter and Oreos! It was my favorite! Then I had to try the voodoo doll donut. The voodoo doll donut had jelly filled donut with chocolate frosting, and a pretzel stick for the pin. Yes there was a long line but the donuts were delicious! It may be a tourist spot but I loved the donuts and thought it was worth the wait.

Iconic, delectable, historic, timeless, delicious, and extremely fun! These donuts are not only made extremely well and are extremely high quality, but the atmosphere and decor, customer service and menu options are huge! A MUST for every Portlander or someone visiting!

Believe the hype. 

This is pure fat-ass gluttony at its finest. I had the traditional voodoo doughnut (shaped like a voodoo doll, dipped in chocolate, raspberry "blood" filled, with an adorable pretzel stake through the heart) and the mister had a No Name (covered in peanut butter and dipped in chocolate rice krispies).

You can even have a 100% legal wedding beneath the holy doughnut and a velvet painting of Isaac Hayes or Kenny Rodgers. I plan on renewing my vows here. Yes, I am totally serious.

These donuts are ridiculously good.  Went to this place in June 2014, got there early and the line was about 30 people.  So get there early!  The donuts are mostly specialty and not really breakfast food.  More like dessert food.  Customer service was great and they help you pick out what you like because the choices are immense.  The bacon maple is the best, hands down!

Now THESE are donuts. When in Portland this is THEE place to go for donuts. Here's the good news... or should I say great news -- AWESOME donuts, LOTS of choices, as FRESH as can be. I am going here EVERY TIME I am in Portland. Enough said, ya gotta go! 
The place is very small (no seating but who cares). Plenty of tables outside for seating. Even if there is a long line outside the door (it happens) just get on the line and wait. You will not be sorry. Can't say enough about this place or their donuts. And the price is right...and I'm from NY (see my Blue Star Donut review). Let these Voodoo photos speak for themselves. AWESOME and DELICIOUS.

Finally made it here on a trip to Portland Saturday Market. Very cute, inviting place with a huge donut hanging from the ceiling. The donuts are delicious! I had a Mango one, Portland Creme (similar to Boston but better) and Coconut Guava. All three were great! The fruit flavor of the guava and mango were present and not overwhelmed by just the sweet taste of sugar. As Arnold says..."I'll be back".

What can I say that hasn't been said before? Just a place you have to check out if ever in town. Yes, it's the novelty and not the best, most awesome donut I've had. But it's a donut...not Lobster Thermidor. Usually has a line and can be hot if you are in the sun, but the workers keep everyone moving at a fast pace so your not outside for an extremely long time. 

Oh yeah, bring cash, they don't accept plastic. I didn't know that when I got to the counter and if there was a sign I missed it. However they do have an ATM inside and will hold your place at the counter. :)

We waited in line for 10 minutes. There was a huge selection of flavors but we got the VooDoo doll, Viscous hibiscus, and Portland cream. They all had great fluffy texture. My favorite was the hibiscus one which had a nice tangy unique flavor and a good texture. The prices weren't too bad. There's community outdoor seating. Very crowded inside. This place is quite hyped but worth a visit!

On vacation with my wife and kids (7 and 4) - it was late night (for us) and the kids wanted dessert. We walked over here from our hotel based on a quick recommendation. I had no idea what to expect; only later did I find out that this place was on Food Network and fairly famous. Upon arrival, I thought the line might have been for live music next door. Nope - it was about a 20 minute wait to get inside the very small store. No complaint though. Totally loved the unique doughnuts. Of course, we couldn't announce the names of some doughnuts for the kids. They loved picking out "cool" ones, including the Voodoo man. 

I went for the maple bacon bar - OMG - freaking AWESOME. I now have to buy bacon and try to make my own with the standard maple bar from my local Chandler AZ donut shop. It's not the same...but close.

We held onto our pink box and reloaded it on the way out of town. We found the staff friendly and efficient. We made sure to be ready to order when it was our turn. 

The 5 stars is really 4 for the doughnuts, and 1 for the scene. Definitely worth the visit for out-of-towners.

OH MY GOD... the maple bacon bar... I know, sounds gross, but it is, and I quote my fiance now: the best breakfast ever... and may I add, lunch and dinner too! Damn, that's the best donut EVER invented! Their thick chocolate covered and raspberry jelly filled Voodoo Doll donut is pretty banging too. Ooooh Voodoo Doughnut, how I will miss thou!

Bacon Maple Bar. Need I say more? I made my mom fly up here from Los Angeles to come have a bacon maple bar.

The donuts are fabulous. The original Voodoo Doughnut is my favorite jelly donut ever. 

Oh yeah, and one day I'm gonna get married there.
I mean...a must when in Portland. Came in on a Friday morning and it was quick and easy. Cash only...apple fritter was delicious (and massive). Maple bacon was delicious as well.
What can I tell you that you don't know already? Best donut place in the world. Seriously. Just suck it up and wait in line, you won't be disappointed.
Voodoo will always have my heart as I was tied in a voodoo lovelock there.  Great donuts and a fun place to be.
The only doughnuts that I will ever wait in line for. Thank God for Voodoo

I get the dozen random assortment for 9.99. This time I got someone that picked out plain looking ones which I actually like. Some is too sweet. I come here because it's fun, different, weird, vulgar.

they need to make an adjoining museum for this art and art form.
how much shit can you put on a fuckin doughnut? all of it! just dont go when youre drunk or stoned,then youre guarenteed to get sick cause youll eat it all! :d love!

Definitely the obligatory place if you're visiting or a local. Fun atmosphere and of course a unique menu to match Portland's weirdness. If the line is out the door, don't worry -- it goes fast! They only take cash, so be ready.

Been here a bunch of times, the best bet is to get a dozen donuts and have them pick them out, because I can never decide and they're all good. Try the bacon one at least once! Its good! All this said, when they have their famous around the block line, I always throw it a hard pass.

Visiting Portland I obviously had to stop into Voodoo Doughnut and they did not disappoint. The names of the doughnuts are hilarious, but i wish they had a description so I could know what I was getting myself into. I ended up getting an apple fritter and plain cake doughnut and they were delicious. My sister got the vegan glazed and maple bar and said they were delicious. We were going to save one for the morning, but ended up eating them all that night. Definitely worth the hype. The line wasn't as long as we thought it'd be and moved quite fast. Definitely worth it.

There is always a line here but it is definitely worth waiting in! My boyfriend and I got half a dozen doughnuts: VooDoo doughnut that was absolutely amazing, Captain my Captain doughnut, Voodoo Bubble Doughnut,and the rapper's delight which are three doughnuts.  They were all amazing! my only regret is that i didn't try the mango one. I can't wait to come back here for more, everyone should definitely try this place at least once. throw your diet ot the window for one day, you won't regret it!
Good as it gets! OPEN 24 HOURS EVERY DAY! Original donuts and a trademark and signature stop in Portland.

This is a classic Portland staple. It is very hipster and trendy and really reflects the culture of Portland. They have tons of different doughnut flavors. The most famous being the Maple Bacon Bar and the "Voo Doo" doughnut. This shop is quirky and edgy and brings a whole new perspective to the concept of doughnut shops. You can even get married here!

OMG...bacon maple bar is da bomb.  My step-son and his girlfriend introduced us to this place after a good BBQ dinner.  A nice change to the typical ole dessert.  Want to switch up the routine?  This is the place.  

We're from the Bay Area so you stay away from the homeless or bums.  We were in line and I meet this homeless kid who was friendly and nice.  With his last penny, he wanted a bacon maple bar.  He found out that we weren't from Portland so he gave me pointers on his favorites.  He asked for 50 cents to buy 2...only had enough for 1.   I gave him a couple of bucks for obvivous reasons.  How can you go wrong when the homeless are raving about the donuts.

Voodod Donut needs to go national!!!!!!!  You can buy up the old Krispy Kremes as they close...HaaHaa.

My firs visit to Voodoo Doughnut was back when they were a single location, very small sort of hole-in-the-wall on the corner street in Portland near the farmer's market.  When we walked in, they were in between baking and there weren't many doughnuts available.  We browsed the farmer's market and came back to buy doughnuts later.  I loved them.

My visit yesterday was a little different, now over a decade later. When we first drove by at about 11AM on a Monday, the line out the door was very long.  We parked and did some other shopping and then hit up Voodoo closer to 1PM.  The line was pretty short and we were assisted quickly.  Unlike a decade ago, they have doughnuts at all hours.  Big giant bakery racks FILLED with decorative pastries were stacked up behind the cashiers.  The three or four cashiers were friendly and helpful.  They answered my questions expertly and filled my order with enthusiasm.  I tried to be quick so as not to hold up the line behind us, and bought some very pretty and awesome doughnuts.  

My mother and I enjoyed our doughnuts over the course of a couple days and I loved every one.  Very sweet, lots of sugar in the icing and great flavor combinations.  Not all of the treats are overwhelmed with sugar, but most of them are, so come with your sweet tooth.  I highly recommend the lemon-filled powdered sugar doughnut and the mini-M&M doughnut.  The apple fritter was intense and had lots of apples in it.  I had been hesitant about visiting upon seeing the long lines and fighting for parking in Portland, but I'm so glad I made it work.

When I saw a line, I wanted to turn back and I did. The lure of the famous doughnuts couldn't stop me though and I returned about an hour later. It was now or never; I would probably never come back to Portland ever again and this was my chance.

Despite how the line looked, it actually moved pretty quickly. Once inside the brick restaurant, I was treated to eclectic, funky and fun!

Cash is the only form of payment accepted at this shop that features over 100 doughnut varieties and coffee beverages so be prepared.

On a first visit, I had to try their namesake Voodoo Doughnut that is shaped like a voodoo doll and oozes blood red jelly when you bite into it.

If you are a candy or cereal freak, you will probably find your favorite covering one of the doughnuts. With that said, I had to get a M&M Doughnut and Oreo Doughnut.

While in Portland, you can't go wrong with the "Official City Doughnut", the Portland Creme, a take on a Boston Creme.

And, unless you have metal issues (or don't eat pork), a Bacon Maple Bar is a must.

WOW is all I have to say!!

Voodoo has reminded me that life is worth living.  

There is no truth, there is no beauty, there is no future.   There is just you and me and these sparkling doughnuts.  

Chew, swallow, inhale.  Repeat.

yeah, its gotten bigger than it used to be. 
yeah, its considered a tourist spot. 
but yeah, its good! 
I mean seriously, maple bars with bacon? 
voodoo doll shaped ones?  its pretty worth it, at least once. 
I recommend the maple bacon bars, and the capn crunch is a bit overrated. 
dont spring for the dozen, youll be in a sugar coma by the second donut. :)

oh yeah, I went on a Thursday morning around 11am and waited for maybe 8 minutes. the line was long but they are efficient!
(they should smile more. i know the job is probably stressful and busy but smile. we love you!)
Best bacon maple donuts on the planet!
Its voodoo dammit... you can't go wrong. Eat one and you will be a believer. Very awesome doughnut joint.

I absolutely loved the doughnuts here. It's on my list of best doughnut places.

So two tips for eating here.
1) Their menu changes every day, so if you want something in particular you need to call ahead (24 hrs in advance).
2) There's usually a line out the door and around the corner, but don't worry, it moves quickly. From what I saw, this place fills up and clears out in a cycle of about a half hour. 
3) MOST IMPORTANT: There isn't much space in the store to sit or read the menu. They ARE patient and do answer questions about what each doughnut is (we asked a bunch), but the faster you can order the better. The best option (keep in mind #1) is to look at the menu online and have a couple doughnuts that you want picked out. That way, you have some to order even if some aren't there that day. Better yet, just order one of each!
4) They have a little seating area shared by the neighboring business. My recommendation is to plan on sitting for a bit and grab some coffee to go with the doughnuts.

Doughnuts We Bought:
Captain My Captain - so yummy! My favorite of the bunch.
Voodoo Doll - really good, and gets my vote for easiest to share
Portland Cream - simple (in comparison), but delicious!
Triple Chocolate Penetration - chocolate overload, but oh-so-good
Tangfastic - a bit disappointing actually. The one I got was a doughnut with vanilla frosting. Half of it had sprinkles of Tang and half had orange sprinkles. I wish there was more Tang.

I'll definitely be going there again. I'm also thinking of framing the pink box and putting it on my wall - because it's that good.

Holy donut mojo Batman! Wow this place is an institution, the line was 30 minutes on a Monday night at  will give them a five star for creativity, my kids loved the dirt donut, buttermilk bar, apple fritter, and the Mc...something! The ODB was not our favorite.

If your in Portland you need to hit it up.

Who doesn't love voodoo doughnuts?? Of all the maple bacon bars I've tasted, they have the best.  I also love their oreo doughnuts! Their vegan doughnuts are quite comparable to their non vegan doughnuts. I think they should even veganize their maple bacon bars with fake bacon! 

Deliciousness! And the building is glittery! I've waited in all sorts of weather for these fried beauties.

If visiting Portland a visit to Voodoo Doughnuts is a must. Clearly a lot of other people think the same thing however, so be prepared to wait in line. Well worth it though. Besides the fact that this place just screams Portland and is part of the local flavor, there offerings are unique and delicious. I had the Memphis Mafia (best doughnut I've ever had) and the voodoo doll doughnut (also quite good).

This review has been long overdue! I've been meaning to write a review for so long but never got a chance to until now. I discovered Voodoo Doughnut's when I was scrolling through a friend's Instagram page and she took pictures and I was immediately drawn to it. I added this doughnut shop to my bucket list. Months later my friends and I took a trip to Portland and I told them that we should visit this place! 

Upon arrival, there was a line not too long. Waiting in line wasn't a hassle because we were so drawn to the art on the brick wall outside the shop. When we finally inside, my gawdddd I was blown away! The decor was so cute!

The toughest part - deciding which donut to get. Me being the most indecisive person on this planet, I decided to get a box of donuts because I couldn't just settle for ONE. I got the voodoo doll, Marshall mathers donut w/ M&Ms, the Homer donut, and the fruit loop donuts. Not to mention that the box was super cute! 

For all my donut lovers out there, I would definitely recommend visiting this awesome doughnut shop! Great news for my Cali residents - a few months after we got back from the trip I found an article that said they're opening up another location in LA at Citywalk. It's open now, but I'm definitely going to go visit!

The whole vibe of this place is fun, from the variety of donuts, their names, and uniqueness...to the long wait in line and getting the opportunity to people watch and await the sugary goodness... The first time I was ever here I didn't have a smartphone to check what kind of donuts they have to choose from, and I didn't like how we were rushed to make a decision (although I kind of ubderstand that they want the long line to move faster)... So I definitely recommend checking their donut menu online and making a note of which ones you want ahead of time... Must-tries in my opinion are the voodoo doll and maple bacon.... Too good! This is a place I hit up every time I visit Portland!

Epic.

Maple Bar.

Weird.

Long Lines.

Go here now - That's all that I have to say.

i think my husband consumed a dozen doughnuts from voodoo in our latest visit to portland.  he LOVES the peanut butter oreo and i cannot leave town without the maple bacon bar.  we actually introduced voodoo doughnuts to my aunt and uncle who have lived in portland for decades because they had never been.  my aunt took one bite of the peanut butter oreo doughnut and she was staring at me like she'd seen heaven--she was speechless!  and she's a theater person so that's really special.  we damn near go to portland for these frickin' doughnuts and from my other reviews and loves you will notice that sweet things aren't really my thing.  i prefer savory flavors.  but i make sweets my thing when it comes to voodoo.  i can't pack in as many as my husband, but i'll have a doughnut or 3 from voodoo and i literally don't eat doughnuts from anywhere else because i just don't enjoy them.  

the guy here who told everyone to just get a krispy kreme is insane.  crispy cremes are overly fried, overly sweet nonsense with no originality.  voodoo doughnuts are fresh (stop freaking out tourists, do you see how fast they sell?  they are not sitting out long) and innovative.  because they've been around a bit other folks are imitating voodoo (including cock-a-doodle doughnuts in port angeles, washington), so maybe for some people the novelty has worn off.  for us, they have just proven that their doughnuts are consistently good.  perhaps they will introduce more new doughnuts in the future, but i don't really care--what they got is good already.  we got a box of a dozen including specialty doughnuts for under $17--a basic dozen picked by the staff is around $8.  quit complaining and get some doughtnuts!

for those saying this is a terrible part of town--i'm not sure where you're from, but a few guys asking for spare change in the downtown does not make this a scary part of town.  if you don't know about portland bums then you don't know portland.  smile, give some change or do not, but you will not have a problem if you have common sense.  they are people too.  relax, go at an off time and get a frickin' doughnut.  some stumptown coffee locations sell voodoo too so if you're too afraid to go to the shop, just go to a stumptown coffee.

my husband says that it's the perfect texture of voodoo doughnuts that makes them and the fact that their toppings are sweet, but not overly, hurt your mouth sugary sweet.  i have to agree with this astute observation.

here's the trick folks--this location is open 24 hours.  why the hell are you all going between breakfast and dinner time?!?  go at at an off time and you will not have a wait.  my husband is a morning person so he gets up early and walks down (when we stay at the ACE hotel, between 6-8am) and gets doughnuts no problem.  get there at the right time and you'll see and meet the scruffy owners.  just know what you're going to order when you get to the front of the line if there is one--you'll save the other salivating people some aggravation.

Long line but worth it. The variety of donuts is just amazing and taste really good. I wish there's one near me. 

If your visiting the area you must go there open 24/7 and get as much as you can it will still be good 2 days after.

I live in Seattle and people where I work occasionally bring donuts from Voodoo when they go to Portland. All I have to say about that is: Oreo cookie crumbles, chocolate and peanut butter on a donut is GENIUS!!! BLARG! GENIUS!!!

My only complaint is that Voodoo will not ship their famous coffin full of donuts! That is NOT GENIUS, but the opposite of genius, whatever that may be . . .

I love this place. We have one in Denver, but I didn't realize that this was the original. It is cash only so be prepared! They have all sorts of fun flavors. I got a mountain coconut cream donut with sprinkles. absolutely delightful and good coffee too!

OMG - this place is amazing!  There is always a line around the corner, and when I say always, I mean 24 hours a day.  They have such unique and great tasting doughnuts - and not over priced.  I can't wait to go back to Portland for another round!

If you visit Portland, you have to visit this donut shop! I've lived here for a decade and I finally made it down there because we were there at 11 PM on a weekday and there was not a line around the block three times. We were able to walk right in and select our delicious donuts! They have so many crazy types of donuts that it's mind blowing but it seems the ever popular maple bar with bacon was what several people that were with me got. I got the Portland cream doughnut which is very much like the Boston cream donut and honestly, it was the best one I've ever had! They have donuts topped with cereals like Cap'n Crunch and Froot Loops as well as donuts topped with crushed Oreos and various other delights! And, it was fun to finally have my own pink Voodoo Donut box! Top it all off with a chocolate milk and call it a night!

Yum yum yum! I heard of VooDoo many years ago on The Food Network and I've always wanted to try it. I finally got the chance and it was every bit as wonderful as I dreamt it to be. We went late in the day for dessert, around 7pm and we only waited about 10-15 minutes. The line that forms outside is deceiving and you think it's like hours long but it moves quickly. There are so many choices that it was a little overwhelming to make a decision so we took a chance and ordered the VooDoo Dozen which means the employees pick the doughnuts for you. (We told them heavy on the chocolate) My favorite was the raised yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting. Oh heaven in my mouth! I want to go back and order a dozen of those!!

What can you say about Portland's dirty little not so underground doughnut secret, that hasn't been said before by a couple thousand other reviewers.  Yeah, they got maple bacon doughnuts, they got Texas sized doughnuts, they got doughnuts covered in your favourite breakfast cereal, and they're all served up by only the hippest and trendiest muthas you'd ever wanna meet.  Even now with their newly renovated shop (basically on the corner of the same block they started on), you still have to wait in line, a velvet rope no less.  

Yeah, Voodoo Doughnuts seems like it has out lived its coolness, but they still put out some pretty darn good doughnuts (or "donuts" if your into the whole brevity thing).  Is it really worth making the trek to the crappy part of downtown Portland to watch the employees roll their eyes at the tourist customers trying to decide which donut they want from the revolving glass doughnut case?  Hell yeah, cuz it's really all about the Donut and Voodoo still got the magic right!  So slip on your best Coldplay knit hat and pull your pants down off your butt and make sure to mumble your order while complimenting the employees new piercing, because the irony is never lost on the donut.

Totally worth the wait. Not overrated. Seriously. 

Okay, the line was not that long. We probably waited in line for like 15-20 minutes. If you want to complain about lines, I waited in like for 45 minutes for a bagel in NYC, that's ridiculous. 15 minutes for some amazing doughnuts, is completely justifiable. The line was out the door (and almost to the sketchy strip club/adult movie theater?) but went pretty quick. 

The menu posted inside the shop lists prices and doughnut names, but not much else. Spend the time you wait in line looking up the menu online for pictures and specific descriptions of every doughnut.

We ended up ordering the Old Dirty Bastard and the Memphis Mafia. Yes, it pained me a little to fork out $4 for one doughnut, but it was so worth it. The Memphis Mafia is a huge glazed banana fritter, covered in chocolate sauce, chocolate chips, peanut butter, and peanuts. OH MY GOD. Can you say amazing?

I'm pretty sure if you don't go, you'll regret it. You're not too good for a tourist trap. Go.

Giving it a five because that maple bacon bar is in my dreams and the insane uniqueness of their donut flavors.  Also a five because despite the line it was pretty quick.  Five for delicousness of every donut we got in the dozen that we shared.  Five for a good bang for your buck when it comes to a handmade baked good.

One or maybe a negative one for the snotty service we received from the gal when we decided to order a dozen and pick them out ourselves.  You would have sworn we asked her to plunge a plugged toilet! They should be happy with all the publicity they have been receiving lately and the spike in business during a recession.  Smile, you have a job!

Still the good prevails.

Really yummy donuts and a must do if in Portland. The place has so much character down to the glitter bricks of the building. The girl that helped me was super nice and let me geek out and take pictures of their rotating donut carousel(they had a game of thrones donut!). A long wait, but worth it. Try to go early to avoid the lines and get the Maple bacon. So yummy!

So bomb! Went to blue star first and it was disappointing. I guess I just like fluffy donuts with tons of frosting. Voodoo delivered on both! I had the voodoo doll and my gf got the princess crown one. Both were delicious and I cannot wait to get more in the future! We forgot to order a coffee inside so we went next door where there is a large sign that says COFFEE. DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT GET COFFEE AT THIS PLACE! Ordered an Americano and was asked we we wanted room, we were puzzled but said no. Well all she did was pour us a regular coffee with maybe water in it? So gross, tossed it after two sips. Get a coffee at Voodoo or down the street at Stumptown, good god!

Omg the best donuts EVER!  I was pleasantly surprised with how fluffy and delectable it was!!!  I had a plain glazed donut and it melted in my mouth.

The other donuts looked too sweet as it was covered in frosting and cereal, but my daughter who ordered the frosty ones said they were delicious as well!

The line is really long; however, it goes quick.  Sadly they are CASH ONLY which is disappointing and the side of the donut shop has an open window exposing the donuts (which anyone can potentially spit on them) and seems unsanitary.  But... I will give this little place 5 stars for pure deliciousness and fast lines!!!

Ummmmm... DELICIOUS! All types of odd creations and mixed flavored donuts. I'm not much for sweets, but this place was worth the hour wait. The line fills the building and continues outside. Better have patients and get a box or two.

Yes there was a line, but it was worth it.  Voodoo Doughnuts is a must when visiting Portland. We got a dozen mixed for $16 and they were beautiful and delicious.  Great prices, creative and fun and worth the wait.

Hey, 3000+ reviewers can't be wrong. Go. Get a doughnut. Pick one, they're all good. But, listen up: Get there in the early AM, before 8am. If you don't, there will be a line. If there in mid day, enjoy the wait. And remember: CASH ONLY, so plan ahead.
They say that Alzheimer's is Type 3 diabetes, so that means that Voodoo Doughnuts is where one goes to contract Type 4 (and I fully embrace it).

Totally deserves 5 stars and then some. Look, folks, it's not necessarily about the quality of the underlying donuts as it is the sheer variety of amazingly eclectic flavor/topping combinations on offer, the visual org*sm you get just by staring at the spinning case full of different types of donuts, plus the 24/7 experience in a funky neighborhood.

Despite the long lines, the servers were patient enough to explain which donuts were which. The only problem I had was making a decision and ordering. Recently, I showed up on my own, ordered 4 donuts, and wolfed them down all at once. Easily the most sugar high, food coma-inducing meal I've had in a long time. Wheeeeeeeeeeee!!!
You come here with your out-of-town guests because they saw it on the Food Network.  A Must Stop on the PDX tour.  Get the Voodoo Doll and the Bacon Maple Plank.....
