Flavors are amazing. If you like donuts these are the best I've ever had, highly recommend getting a dozen.

I think there are enough reviews for everyone to get the point so I will keep this short. 
Hands down, the best doughnut shop I have ever been to. Yes there will be a line, and yes that line will be there at literally at all times of the day, but there is a reason for it. So if you are ever in this area, do yourself a favor and go.
Long lines worth the wait. Doughnuts are so good not your typical dough flavor!

By my own rule, I am not a doughnut person. I do my best to try to be healthy and watch what I eat. Whole grain breads, no HFCS in my house (or less than five items total at the moment) and no soda or fast food. I also do my best to instill that in my kiddo. But she has a passion for doughnuts. Absofreakinlutly loves them. Thankfully she's a very, very, and I mean VERY active five year old. So on one of our last nights in town visiting we had been playing at a park down the street from my brothers place and Voodoo Too was a short walking distance and well, they are open at all hours and it was already around 9pm. 

We took a wander and surprised the kiddo. Was she surprised especially since she knows my opinion on the fried flour confection. She didn't know what to choose. And on my last visit to Portland, we visited the original location (before it's redue) and I didn't get a doughnut then. On this occasion, I made an exception. She had a chocolate frosted one, and I had one called the Doughnut with no name. Chocolate frosting, rice krispies and peanut butter. Not bad, not bad at all. The hype was lived up to and I had a happy, but sugar rush induced, child. Can't go wrong there.

I have been hearing about this place for a long time and it has taken me a long time to finally try some of their crazy donuts. For some reason I get deathly sick every time I come to visit for the holidays so I was bummed out that I was going to miss another chance to go to Voodoo Doughnuts. On the last day of my stay, my sister in law decided to run over and get an assorted box so we could each try a different one or three. Well they didn't cure my cold but they are pretty damn good. I had the maple bar with bacon because the world would be a better place if it were wrapped in bacon. It was bacolicious. I also had a few bites of the one covered in Cap'n Crunch cereal. I would have to say I liked the maple/bacon combo the best. I wanted to try the chocolate and peanut butter donut but after chowing down on more than one, I had reached maximum density and had to push away from the table. The actual donuts had a slight buttery flavor to them. I liked it. The next time I come up I will make sure I get my booster shots so I can finally make it to their actual shop.

Let me just jump on the bandwagon now because this place is freaking amazing!! I absolutely love the atmosphere (minutes the 10+ homeless people camping outside), the workers, the doughnuts, and overall I just love this place! Definitely jump right in and just get a dozen, choose one of every flavor! My favorite is the famous dozen or whatever it's called, basically, it's a dozen of their most popular doughnuts, get that for sure! The line is always long and you'll always wait 30+ minutes but it's totally worth it. A must stop for anyone in Portland!

"Would you like to personalize your cock and balls?", said the clerk after placing donut number six in our box. I didn't even know they would do that! I asked him to write my straight roommate'a name on the fallic donut in bright pink - after all, he was my airport shuttle back in LA. 

Hype is worth it! What a cool and unique donut shop with many crass names and interesting donuts. Tang and marshmallow, peanut butter Oreo, a glazed donut the size of my head, or a donut with fruit loops. Not only are the toppings interesting but the donuts themselves are solid. The maple bacon donut works somehow and was delicious. 

I've been to some cool donut places but nothing quite like this that embodies the spirit of Portland. Went around 9 on a Monday morning and there was no line. So, pick the right time and the line isn't always out the door. 

P.s. Portland airport is a-ok with carrying on an iconic box of pink. What a good present to take back home.
DONUTS OH THE DONUTS. They are worth the wait! Amazing service, selection and designs! Give them a go and you'll think you are a voodoo doll for the donuts !
If you dont mind waiting in line for, well, awhile, this is the place to be! bomb ass doughnuts

The best vegan donuts around!!! I have had about 5 or 6 different varieties and my favorite by far is the cock n' balls (it's like 2-3 donuts in one and cream filled) and the ol' dirty bastard. I recommend this to anyone, but especially my veggie friends who can't always get donuts just anywhere.

Voodoo doughnuts has forever changed my conception of what the donut  could be! The most astounding was the tart flavor of the tang-covered, jellied-filled creation... The presentation of the donuts themselves displayed a cylinder glass case... the seemingly messy, yet perfect sugar concoctions with things like captain crunch sprinkles with draw you in for a sure dozen!

The donut reborn!  A super-neon-rainbow-chocolate covered cake explosion!

The donuts here are worth the hype. Perfectly baked and chewy. Came here from Seattle just for the donuts.
The line to get in is a little confusing. And be ready to order when you get to the cashier.
And it's cash only. No pennies and No returns
Yum! We had the Bear Claw with Peanut Butter. And an Oreo Cream Donut! Such a bad ass spot! The line goes quickly so be ready to order.

First time in the downtown Portland area for work, so I knew I wanted to make a visit to Voodoo Doughnuts. Came here on a Thursday around 7 pm with a co-worker and was surprised to see that the line was not out the door (though it grew a bit longer while we were inside).

I knew I wanted to try a creme filled doughnut, so I asked for a recommendation. The guy helping us was very friendly and suggested the McMinnville Cream, which had maple frosting and Bavarian creme filling. I was sold. I don't normally eat doughnuts, but it turned out to be amazing. Incredibly sweet and delicious. My co-worker ordered the buttermilk bar doughnut, so I tried a piece and it was also very enjoyable.

We ordered a dozen assorted doughnuts for our co-workers, and I was also able to try the double chocolate, which is simply a chocolate cake doughnut with chocolate frosting. I didn't think the doughnut itself was anything special; however, the frosting is what makes it so tasty. My favorite is definitely the McMinnville Cream! 

Vegan options available. Friendly service. Cash only.

Alright! When the skinny European looking guy comes out of the bathroom reeking of B.O. so bad that you gotta hold your breath as he walks by, after snorting something (don't think we don't know what you were doing in there) and heads right behind the counter and says what can I get you?, by all that's holy in the doughnut world...I think we've found the promised land.

Loved the wild crazy bars with their music spilling outside and the people to match surrounding the place.  That and at 11 at night there is a line outside the door.  Parking is crazy to get. Don't waste time circling the block. Just pay for 30 mins at the lot a block down. 

Bacon Maple bar was surprisingly good. In fact next time I get a maple bar back home, I just may have to bring my own Bacon.

My boyfriend and I went here during our trip to Portland and had a blast. We recommend getting the Voodoo Doll doughnut and the bubblegum flavored one. 

The line can get pretty long, but they are pretty good at moving things along, so you likely won't be waiting too long. The time from when we got in line to when we got our doughnuts was under an hour.

So this ended up being a bit of a mistake, but a delicious mistake and one I would make again farther from meal time. I don't think we each needed a whole doughnut as they were pretty dense (and pretty sizeable). We had one maple bar and one bacon maple bar and you could easily split one between two people (unless you're going for an all doughnut meal). They weren't greasy even with bacon on top and the dough had a great fluffy-yet-dense texture. There were a ton of great sounding flavors and I'm sure I'll be back whenever I'm in Portland again. I'm not a huge doughnut fan, but this place definitely equals or betters the famous Donut Bar in San Diego and at a much better price.

It would be totally ludicrous for you to think I planned a trip to Portland just so I could visit "VooDoo Doughnut." 

That would be insane.  Or, batty, bizarre, cracked, crazed, crazy, cuckoo, daft, demented, derailed, deranged, fatuous, frenzied, idiotic, impractical, irrational, irresponsible, loony, lunatic, mad, maniacal, mental, moonstruck, nuts, nutty, of unsound mind, off one's rocker, out of one's mind, paranoid, preposterous, psychopathic, psychotic, rabid, raging, raving, schizophrenic, screwy, senseless, touched, unhinged, unsettled, and/or wild. 

Color me NUTS.
Very original and definitely a destination for anyone visiting Portland! My favorite is the Grape Ape doughnut (has grape pixi stix). Yum! :)

Unfreakingbelieveable.  I can't believe how good the donuts here are, especially at the price they are.  The hardest part was choosing which ones we wanted to try.  After some rigorous scientific testing, I've determined the Grape Ape doughnut is the best flavor they have.  I thought the grape would be overwhelming, but it was simply perfect.  All the other flavors we tried, while not as good, were still delicious - there wasn't anything we tried here that I didn't like.

We roll up into Portland a little past midnight and thought we'd get our Portland experience started with Doughnuts from Voodoo even though we were exhausted from a long drive. Why not? Voodoo Doughnut is open 24 hours and even at 12:30a.m. the doughnuts tasted fresh. We did not expect to encounter a line at this hour but, nope, there was a line out the door. I don't think the whole Voodoo Doughnut experience would be the same without a wait. There's something fantastic about being among other doughnut enthusiasts waiting together in line for a fix at weird hours of the night.

We chatted with the people in line. Everyone snuck in their personal photo's of the shop..trying to be inconspicuous and cool but so not working. It's ok, we are all here for the love of doughnuts. Surprisingly there were lots of locals mixed in with us tourists. That says a lot about the appeal of Voodoo, they aren't just hyped up doughnuts they have staying power.   

I couldn't resist ordering a Tang covered doughnut. Tang has extra vitamins right? It was delicious! Not too sweet. It was a great use of Tang. The bacon maple bar is legit. They don't skimp on the bacon or the glaze. That was one hearty doughnut.  Even the next morning the doughnuts we had in our possession  tasted amazing. Mmmmm, Voodoo doughnuts you can cast a spell over me anytime.
They certainly have some unusual donuts, and it is a great Portland thing. Sometimes I prefer Krispy Kreme, but it is fun to get Voodoo Donuts when I'm in town.

I think most of the people putting this place down are trying to be too cool for school. 

That being said, Portland really has so much great food. So it is odd when one place gets more attention than another. I think a lot of the hype around Voodoo Doughnuts is its location (next to the weekly open air market) and its uniquely Portland vibe. You just won't be listening to screaming punk rock while being served by a girl with a nose ring at Dunkin Donuts. 

However, what's most important is the doughnuts. They really are very good. I am from New England. So I had only had yeast donuts before VD. So that might be a big part of it. But wow, I am in love.

If you're visiting Portland go to Voodoo Doughnuts. The line really is bad. So maybe wait for a mid week afternoon, but go.
I understand why this place is so popular. Must try the maple bacon bar. It was so good! Luckily we came at a good time so the line wasn't too long.

bacon maple bar.........enough said :)
Ok real review......good doughnuts, fun atmosphere but be prepared to wait in a big line. Thanks to the travel channel and food network this place is a huge must visit tourist spot. So if you don't like lines head over to the east Portland one :)

After waiting in line for 45 minutes on a Saturday evening, my thoughts were that there was no way this place would live up to the hype. Who waits 45 minutes for some donuts and isn't disappointed that they wasted so much time for a donut? Boy was I wrong. This place absolutely lives up to the hype. These are simply the best donuts I've ever ate in my life. The bacon maple bar was a marriage of sweet and salty treats that my taste buds have been dreaming out for years. The dirt doughnut had probably a dozen Oreos on top of a sinfully delicious vanilla glaze. Oh, and the grape ape donut was like a grape symphony in my mouth. I had to stop and get more before returning to California as I knew I would want to partake in this dessert delight one last time. Now that I'm home I'm already thinking about the next time I can visit Portland so I can get my paws on more of those donuts! 5 huge stars!

Holy hell...or maybe not quite so holy... 

Either way...this place has the BEST donuts I have ever had in my life... 

Sure, it was a little before midnight, and I was mildly drunk...but the flavor cut right through the alcoholic haze to tantalize the taste buds. 

Allow me to describe my tasty treats... 

1) A soft, moist cake donut with a chocolate and peanut butter glaze topped with crushed Oreo cookies 

2) A plain ol' maple bar...topped with two stripes of freshly cooked, crispy bacon! 

That's right...you read that correctly...a donut topped with bacon! 

People...this place is open 24/7...and nestled in the center of a bar district...there's plenty of drunks coming here for snacks at the wee hours of the morning. 

So...if you're ever in Portland...there's always time to hit this place up. There's something for everyone...even if all you want is a novelty keepsake...donuts last forever  ::smile::

OMG.....Ultimate sugar fix!!  

I can't wait to go back....only 59 more days!!  :o)

Worth the wait!!
Very unique and delicious donuts. It's the next level of donuts with a Portland twist. Prepare for a sugar overload.... Gatta Love it.

This place is legit.  Donuts are awesome.

However, the marketing slogans on the boxes and the clothes are a bit passe.  Need to update and get with the times.

Also, the homeless people in the surrounding blocks are super annoying and could be be much more helpful to VooDoo customers.   Instead of harassing everyone in the surrounding blocks, they could stand in line and sell their spot (or take your order at the 'in' door in exchange for cash) so you don't have to wait in line when you show up.  They could easily do 5 or 6 turns a day and pocket some cash and add some value to the VooDoo scene.
Can't beat this place, they take the human imagination and form it into a donut Peer heaven

Wow! This place certainly lived up to its 'magical' reputation!  My fave was Maple bacon doughnut.  Also Mango and the Voodoo Boy with raspberry filling and a pretzel stake through his heart!
Great mugs too

I must admit, I am a second-hand user.  My partner purchased a Coco Puff and a Froot Loops, carefully tucked them in his carry-on, and flew across the country to Ohio so that I could experience what I had only seen on television.

I read most of the reviews after consuming the Coco Puff doughnut, and I laughed hysterically.  Ok, dig.  You're ordering a doughtnut.  That is glazed.  Then frosted.  Then maniacally covered in some kind of sugary cereal and/or candy and/or cookie because that, my friends, is the Voodoo gig.  And then you're going to take to the internet and sob that it's too sugary, and that it's just a basic doughnut with weird toppings.

For me, that is EXACTLY what the point of a Voodoo doughnut was supposed to be:  a ridiculous sugar bomb covered in a maniacal, ridiculous combination of sugar and toppings that bordered on death and possible need for resurrection HENCE "Voodoo."  You can call it a gimmick, but if it works, it works.  AND it tastes good, so Voodoo wins. 

In fact, I have a storage unit to unpack today, so I washed down the Fruit Loops with a Diet Mountain Dew.  Natch.

For those who say the cereal is stale, I invoke the name of science.  When you apply crispy cereal to wet frosting, the crispy cereal will absorb some of that moisture and become less than crispy.  Sorry.

I'm going full stars on this, because my Voodoo spent an entire day in a duffel bag, then overnight in a refrigerator, and I STILL got what the hype was about the next day.

I had to take mom to voodoo. There was NO line!! Who hoo!! Mom ordered the maple bacon donut and I got the voo doo donut. Mom ate the entire donut. Had to distract her from the menu when ordered (see picture) hahaa! I would come here just to come here. The atmosphere was super chill and the also had a seating area outside. I am sure during the summer it is packed

It's Voodoo Doughnuts. What more do I have to say. The whole world knows about this place thanks to the Food Network, Anthony Bourdain, and countless of other programs. The doughnuts are original and tasty. But how the hell do you fuck up a doughnut. Like for reals.

This place reminds me of Psycho Donuts in San Jose, although I'm sure Voodoo Donuts has been around much longer.

Each of the donuts is cleverly decorated and flavored. We had to try the Maple Bacon Bar, since they were known for that one. It was better than I expected, but we still only shared a couple bites each. We also, under the pressure of the long line, picked out two donuts quickly from the revolving display. We chose the Grape Ape, which I hated since I turn my nose up at anything with grape flavoring. We also had the No Name, which had the perfect combination of chocolate and cereal on top.

The place has stain glass windows shaped as their signature donuts and two people that I think might be their founders. Inside, the workers look pretty indie rock, and they try to shuffle you out fast since there is always a long line to order. 

I came back and got a souvenir shirt for my boyfriend. I would be back if I was in the area again, and didn't mind the calories.

Had the best VooDoo Doughnut experience!!! Waited about 15 minutes until I got in the front of the line and then I ordered two of the vegan donuts (maple and a VooDoo doll.) The nice man taking my order threw in another vegan donut that he recommended for free. 
When we stepped outside where there were quite a few homeless people. However, who could blame them  I would be standing outside of this place too asking for a donut. 
Donuts were beyond delicious (fluffy, perfectly frosted and fresh.) I saved whatever donut the nice man threw in there last  I have no idea what that donut was but I swallowed it whole! Soooo good! Will be back when I visit again!

This was a great place to get donuts! I tried there voodoo doll donut and it was delicious, my favorite parts about the donut were the pretzel sticking out of the donut and I also liked the jelly inside the donut. Overall I think it was a great place to get donuts

The pink boxes being carried around town are not really a coincidence. If you are looking for a sugar rush or some night time munchies n dont mind waiting in a long line any given time of day...you oughta grab a spot on that line and try the wackiest donuts in world! Voodoo donuts is awesome...if ur in portland and haven't tried this you definitely should!

Obviously we can't come to PDX without going to VooDoo. The line is long but it moves at a reasonable pace. The brick wall has glitter on it, the magic is all around. As you get closer to the door you're drooling with excitement. Which one? All of them? Yes. That sounds like a good idea. 

All the donuts sound really good. Then again, fried batter smothered in sugary frosting would titillate anyone's tastebuds. I'm a simple kind of gal though. I like their bubble gum, grape ape, and mango tango.

Ultimate freak show.  I fancy myself a donut expert.  My expectations were low but I was pleasantly surprised.  The donuts were unique and good.  Late night this location is surrounded by bums and bars.
Bacon Maple Bars. Is there anything else? Get your doughnut, go across the street and drink wine from a paper bag and smoke a bowl.
The best donut shop I've been to very unique and fun atmosphere down town Portland prices are very reasonable
come on! they're doughnuts! they are filled with and/or made with Voodoo! what more could you want?!?
The best glazed donut I have ever had... yes that have all kinds of other stuff... but wow simple glazed is AWESOME!
The line is always ridiculous, but the wait is worth it. I can't go anywhere near this place or I will end up gaining 500 pounds.

went to this place for the hype and boy did it live up to our expectations. the place itself is fairly small, but the decor is awesome and unique. no matter what time of day, there will always be somewhat of a line. the donuts themselves are huge and very reasonably priced for what you're getting. definitely worth it if you want a portland classic!
Have you ever sucked the jelly out of a jelly donut and replaced the filling with chocolate srwill ice cream? That is what voodoo doughnuts are like. Heaven on earth.

This place is famous for their original donut concepts, but they also do my old favorite, an apple fritter, really well.  I can't remember the name of it, but I highly recommend the one with peanut butter and oreos.  God, I miss this place.

I visited Portland in April 2017 for a 4 day trip. I had voodoo for the first time the first day of my trip. I ended up going back two more times, and took two doughnuts on the plane trip back with me. I have thought about the dirt doughnut since that trip more than I am willing to admit. It is my favorite baked good to date. I will forever be a huge voodoo fan and have contemplated booking a flight from Florida to Portland again just to experience this legacy . 10/10, would recommend.

these unique doughnuts are a wonderful way to spend a your day eating, and being at voodoo. the atmosphere is lively and hip which always makes you feel good. you would be mistaken to skip the trip to voodoo.

Never had voodoo for twenty years I've always heard about it but never went. Only problem is that I didn't come here sooner to buy some of the great doughnut selection honestly anything they got is the best. Try anything you won't regret it.

I always have to stop by Voodoo donuts when I' m in town.  I can't go here by myself, I have to take my significant other or she will throw a fit.  This the only place I will buy a donut or two or a dozen for myself.  Any other times I get my fix when someone from work bring donuts from a mom and pops store.

I've been dying to go to this place for over 2 or 3 years, I live on the east coast and went to Portland on a west coast adventure. Voodoo doughnut is the main reason I wanted to visit Portland. 
We waited maybe 10/15 minutes and the line went very quickly. We got a dozen which was definitely not necessary for the two of us but we had so many options to choose from. The guy who helped us was patient and friendly. He took his time with us even though there was an obvious line. 
I liked every single doughnut we got, some were thicker/heavier than others but that's just because of the base recipe of them (yeast or cake dough). 
Next time I'm in Portland, Voodoo is definitely on my list to revisit. 
Thanks for making my doughnut dreams come true!!!
This is the closest to donut heaven I have been so far in my 51 years on this earth. If I could beatify this place I would.
The peach fritter with cream cheese frosting is heaven on a plate. Size of your hand so easily serves two. YUM.
Best doughnuts in Portland. Been craving these since our last visit. Great service and friendly people. I totally recommend it.

The magic is in the hole! Haha. I love this place.  It's just like any donut shop but what separates this place from any other donut shop is the variety of flavors.  You can order anything from the traditional to the bizarre including the gay bar (donut filled with luscious cream and topped with fruit loops), bacon maple bar (donut with maple cream and topped with two strips of bacon), dirt bar (donut with vanilla frosting and crushed Oreos) or dozens of other unique flavors.  

Have fun with it and don't be afraid to try some crazy flavors.  They are pretty efficient but be prepared to wait up to over an hour for this place.  It's a huge tourist destination so just enjoy the anticipation.
It was delicious. If you want crazy, unique donuts, this is the place to go. Pictured here is old dirty basterd and fruit loop donuts

Went while on vacation. Got there at 6am, and there was NO line. AND they were selling buckets of donuts from the previous day for something like $7. BUCKETS! Their lemon donut was really yummy. You can tell the dough is homemade, it was soft and perfectly chewy. The Orangatang was also very tasty! And the Memphis Mafia was loved by many. It was HUGE!
ODB ya you know me get yourself a maple bar thats all baconey!!!! Best doughnuts in ptown hands down!

Ambiance def gives you that keep Portland weird feel which is definitely what we were looking for the selection of music was great and all the funky decorations customer service was very welcoming and helpful with decision making,  I never felt rushed even though the line was out the building. We ordered 4 doughnuts one voodoo doll, one old dirty bastard, one snicker, and one blueberry. Now we ordered the voodoo just for novelty but that actually turned out to be our favorite second was the blueberry then snicker then odb but all were amazing in flavor regardless of rank. Plenty of seating outside. FYI We also tried blue star up the street and we liked voodoo much better

I'm not really a doughnut kind of a girl however everyone raves about this place. They have a very cute theme inside. I chose the plain donut with pink frosting and sprinkles. It was delicious and soft/fluffy and not too sweet!!! Didn't taste stale at all like some places!

For fried doughy goodness I got to recommend this place. I've only been here twice, I usually visit Portland area in the winter, last year I grabbed some Donuts on New Year's Eve. A the maple bacon, the bear claw and an Apple Fritter and a couple of others. In total probably spent less than $15. Downside was I didn't get to try all of them fresh, I had to wait until the next day to try the rest. But when I did they still tasted fresh. Even sitting in a box over night they were really good. Can't say the same for blue star Donuts.

Stellar doughnuts!  We came here during peak hours, and waited for quite some time, but it was worth it!  The bacon maple doughnut was so delicious!  We had to come back to buy a dozen for the family in Hawaii, and hand carried it on the plane!  Those doughnuts are heavy!  Lol!

I'm one of the few people who visited this establishment and did not have to wait!  I walked past Voodoo several times while in Portland and each time, the line was out the door and at least 50 people deep.  It's very cramped inside, but they service is quick, so know what you want!

We bought 4 doughnuts and the voodoo doll doughnut won!  The oreo cookie crumble one was delicious too!  I was in a sugar coma for days.

You can sit on the picnic tables outside, while staring at the "Keep Portland Weird" art across from you, and sipping on a cup of joe from Stumptown next door.

Don't forget, they only take cash! Come prepared!

Holy delicious sinful indulgence! Voodoo Donuts does not disappoint. The quality of their product is magical-- thick dough, sweet toppings, & all around fresh. Really glad this place lived up to its reputation.

I saw this place on TV so i decided to take the 684mi, 12 hour drive 
from Morgan Hill, CA to Portland, OR 

The doughnuts here are the best i got the bacon maple bar and a McMinnville cream. 

The bacon maple bar may look nasty but it taste so good. so good i went back in and got two more. 

Just a tip for the tourist try to order quick

Love Voodoo. Nothing better than being a Portlander w a voodoo walking downtown!!  We go on off mornings during the week like Wednesday or early afternoon to avoid lines but the wait is always worth it!!!
Classic experience for Portland. Look up the donuts while you're online, that what once you get to the head of line, you can get exactly what you want & won't feel rushed.
Of course this place is amazing ! I'm not a big doughnut fan, but every time I visit Portland I will wait in line for their Oreo doughnut among many others.This place rocks!!
The best and most creative donuts you'll ever have in your life!!! You can get married here too!! Ah-MAZE-ing!!!

Fun place, but if you want to annoy all of the annoying tourists downtown then visit the one off NE Sandy. Great doughnuts and legendary worldwide for their novelties, definately one of a kind and the original which has spawned many an imitation.
Just plain awesome donuts. The apple fritter was the best I've ever had. Bring your cash and get yourself one more than you think you wanted because they're all good.

Though it's not all they serve the vegan doughnuts are what drew me to Voodoo.  My favorites were the oreo creme, butterfinger and chocolate covered but I didn't care for the bacon bits and maple one.  Yes apparently bacon bits are vegan.  I gained a few pounds while in Portland because these doughnuts.  It's impossible to find something like a vegan doughnut where I live (FL) so I stocked up.  I think I've had enough to last me until my next trip to Portland....
Voodoo Doughnut is an experience that everyone should have when visiting Portland. Doughnuts are creative and absolutely delicious.
So reasonable and yummy! I didn't realize how affordable the donuts would be. It's a little inconvenient that they're cash only, but it's worth it. Probably some of the best donuts I've ever had!

These doughnuts are the best I've ever tried.  Ordered about 8 dozens to bring back to hawaii. Went to the airport and a lot of people wanted a doughnut and they all said that's the best doughnuts!!! Drove 8 hours total just get these doughnuts and traveled thousands and thousands of miles to hawaii. My family and friends loves them!!! It was so worth it

Voodoo Doughnut is located in a shockingly tiny, dark, and dirty space, even by grungy Portland standards. My doughnut-loving husband took one look and refused to eat anything prepared in this store. I'm more brave so I took two cake dougnuts with chocolate icing to go. (Not that I had a choice about eating there as they don't provide seating). I took the doughnuts to a local coffee cafe where my husband could buy something to eat and I could stealthily eat my doughnuts purchased at Voodoo but consumed elsewhere.  Oh, my goodness, their vegan doughnuts are SO GOOD!!  Soon we will be moving away from Portland and I will be grieving the loss of these doughnuts.They tasted amazing - I'm giving this place 5 stars on taste alone. If you are vegan and you are in Portland, you have to try them. I want one right NOW...

Yum! Came in about 9am on a friday, line was quick (it was a weekday) and efficient. CASH ONLY FOLKS. Maple bacon was good, not any different from others I've had before though. The dirty doughnut was oh so dirty delicious!! And for the other sweet tooth candy bar crack junkies, the butterfingering was taste-y!

When I'm not yelping ummm I think I'm watching Food Network. They have a food challenge here, but we didn't try it. We did try their  famous bacon maple bar and fruit loop doughnut.  How can you not love maple and bacon together?  Couldn't justify or get the courage to try their cock and balls doughnut though.  

Ok so this was our first stop on our trip to Portland.  Our hotel was near Portland State so we walked nearly a 3 miles rt to try these doughnuts.  It didn't seem like it was in the best part of town and after finally reaching it at about 10am there was a line outside the door. So be prepared to wait for these doughnuts.  After the walk and waiting, I took my first bite and I was in food ectasy.  I quickly ate the whole bacon maple bar...yumm.  And who needs those nasty cereal bars when you can have a Voodoo doughnut, the fruit loop doughnut tasted identical to eating a bowl of fruit loops.
Outta this world delishhhh...super unique store and super cool employees..the best damn donuts ever

So unique... So exotic... So yummy... So voodoo!!!  That is right! If you want all that, Voodoo Doughnut is the place to check out.

That place is freaken awesome...they got so much weird exotic Doughnut to choose from... c'mon... bacon Doughnut!!!... oreo!!!... fruit loop!!!!... You name it.. they probably have it.

The place gets busy... heck.. we where there in 6ish in the morning n they got tons of customer already.

One of most check out place if you ever visit Portland!

The wait was 30 mins on a Monday. The customer service was impeccable! The donuts were fresh and the establishment was very punk and glitzy. I couldn't stop taking photos. The doughnuts were good but honestly I have had better.... however these doughnuts are special in their own little way. They are cute fought and very tasty. I love the blunt the marshal mathers  m&m I loved the coconut and guava donut and especially loved the cute voodoo doll doughnut.

I had the opportunity to stop at Voodoo Doughnut to try out a kooky doughnut concoction.  Make that three! Haha.  I was taken to this orginal location by my coworker who lives in Portland.  We went around 1pm and it was a drizzly day but nonetheless, we needed to make the trek to get doughnuts.  I noticed the shop is quite small and dark, but people in line were in an orderly fashion and seemed to be getting in and out with doughnuts fine.  I think there were about five or six people in the shop at the most while the others waited outside due to the small size of the shop.  By the time I got in the shop, I saw how wonderfully fun it was decorated.  Saw a Kenny Rogers portrait there too!  They have this rotating doughnut display so if you see the doughnut in the display case, that means they have it that day.  I bought three doughnuts which were the Vooddoo Doll, Neopolitan, and the Dirty Snowball.  The Voodoo Doll doughnut is a yeast doughnut covered in chocolate on top and has raspberry filling with a pretzel stake in the heart.  The Voodoo Dolls all look different from what is on the website.  Mine looked more like a ghost than Voodoo Doll.  The Neopolitan is a chocolate cake doughnut with strawberry icing and three marshmallows.  The Dirty Snowball is a chocolate cake doughnut with strawberry icing, coconut flakes, marshmallows, and peanut butter.  All the doughnuts I selected were yummy.  I never really eat many doughnuts and so, having three in one day was a new record.  

Aside from doughnut purchases, I also bought these black with pink stripe Voodoo Doughnut logo hot pants, i.e. short shorts for $20.  They were cute and feel really nice and comfy. I wore them to sleep in my hotel room that night, dreaming of more Voodoo doughnuts!

You can get all sorts of tshirts, hoodies, stickers, panties, etc. along with doughnuts at Voodoo Doughnut. Really cool stop for any tourist in town!
As Tempting as it may be... dont buy the bucket of doughnuts... you will probably end up eating one and throwing the rest out :/

You can't lose here.  This was my first stop in Portland.  As a mostly gluten-free eater, this was a huge step out of my norm, but I had to see what all the hype was about!  I had a Captain Krunch doughnut and enjoyed every last sugary bite.  The line can be long at times, but the staff is quick and the goods are worth the wait!  Voodoo is a must-do in PDX.
Another awesome place to visit but get there early, beat the lines and take advantage of the parking across the street.

Probably the most hyped and the most touristy business in the entire state of Oregon, but this is one overhyped tourist trap that is well worth your while.  We stopped here twice during our weekend stay in Portland - it was our first stop after leaving the airport and then our last on our way out of town.  On Friday evening we each got 2 donuts - my husband got the Mexican hot chocolate and an Old Dirty Bastard and I got a Mango Tango and Viscous Hibiscus.  My husband thought the Mexican hot chocolate was the best donut he'd ever had - he loved the chili powder mixed in with the chocolate.  I'm allergic to chocolate so I had to settle for the more Caucasian donuts...the Mango Tango was delicious and the Viscous Hibiscus was creative although the flavour of the hibiscus wasn't very noticeable.  The pastry of every donut I had was light and not greasy or oversweet.  On our way out of town we picked up 2 boxes of a dozen each to take to our respective offices, and also had a Grape Ape and a peach fritter on the way to the airport.  The Grape Ape was delicious, but the fritter was all fritter and no peach - I didn't find one single piece of peach anywhere in the donut.  But everything else I ate was so good I'll let this one slide.

The hot cider was delicious, and the vibe was about as quintessentially Portland as it gets.

After nearly 1,000 reviews what more could I possibly add here? Voodoo has become an institution in Portland. When the boyfriend and I visited a few years ago we walked right in. Nowadays, prepare to get in line. We went there on a Friday in the middle of the afternoon and the line was down the block. Although it wasn't as bad as the line around the corner on Saturday morning. You could say Voodoo has jumped the shark.

But as a true doughnut lover I say who care. It's worth the wait - their doughnuts are awesome. Not only are they unique with funny names, they actually taste really good. Get a maple bacon bar - it's sweet and salty heaven. 

Watch out for the bums begging for change. We saw one person give a bum a doughnut and the bum went right over to the outside counter and ditched it. Apparently, he wasn't hungry....

Just go and get a box full. You'll be glad you did.

A Portland institution. I go strictly for the bacon maple bar. 


The magic isn't always in the hole.
The apple fritter is the best.  I just have to time my visits right or there will be a line.

Arguably the most famous doughnut shop in the US. Yes the line is long, just relax and wait, you're in Portland. Had to try the maple bacon and it was a great balance of sweet and salty. Got the voodoo doll, ok, but I would save stomach space for something else. Peach fritter was massive, had a great cream cheese frosting. We have more, but after eating the equivalent of one doughnut. put a fork in me, I'm done.

Favorite doughnuts are blueberry, the one with the fruit loop cereal on top and just simple maple bars. You can never go wrong with ordering a bakers dozen, where they surprise you and pick a dozen ... Ive received a voodoo man every once in awhile, even though they are considered to be more expensive. I've bought a dozen for the staff at the elementary school for random staff lunch celebrations. I definitely take any friends who visit to the VooDoo in Portland or the store in downtown Eugene, Oregon because it is something everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime. Yes, they don't accept credit cards, so cash is a must and sometimes there aren't any lines and other times I know I've waited in line for maybe a half hour at most. It's pretty much hit or miss when it comes to waiting, but it is awesome that this location is open 24 hours a day, although I don't recommend walking to this place at 2 AM without others.

Wow! The selection is tremendous! At first my friends were like, "Why did we HAVE to come here?" when they saw the outside. Once inside, they GOT it! Ha-ha! Vegan Doughnuts! Yes, I said it! It is heaven sent! They're fresh and flavorful and cheap! I love Voodoo Doughnuts! The grape-ape was a delightful surprise! We got the dozen (they pick them) and it was super fun to take a bit and pass to friends...Great for our long road trip (back to San Jose, CA)! If you go to Portland and have never tried it and you like regular doughnuts, you have to go here!

It would be a crime to come to Portland and not go to Voodoo Donuts. So, I did come...twice.

The Voodoo Doll donut is good. The jelly is pretty much all in its belly, but I got a good mouthful of it when I took a bite.

The Grape Ape donut was also good although I was expecting a bit more grape flavor. 

The Miami Vice Berry was similar to Grape Ape and could have had a stronger berry taste.

The frosting on both of these was thick and very sugary. These were both thick donuts and reminded me somewhat of high quality grocery store donuts in terms of flavoring.

The Viscous Hibiscus was excellent. The frosting was very flavorful. It might have been my favorite of the batch.

I recommend eating them within 12 hours. There are no preservatives and putting them in the fridge doesn't do much to extend their freshness. 

It's a no brainer that I would come back again. It's cash only, but you are on a quick trip to sugary blissfulness for under $3.00 per donut.

Side note: panhandlers like to hang out here, and you will feel guilty if you sit at one of the picnic tables devouring your treat while they are nearby looking for handouts.

There is always a line. The nicer the day, the longer the line. No place to sit inside, so you're taking it all to go on a rainy day.

These people have created art in the form of a doughnut and I like eating to the tune of maple-bacon-bar. It is something that every person new to Voodoo must try and I guarantee that you will love it. I had family from Serbia in town over the summer and we ate 2 dozen doughnuts in one sitting and, while they were hesitant to try it, everyone agreed that maple-bacon was their favorite. 
Also, as someone who has completed a Big Texan Challenge in Voodoo, it is 100% worth is, as the whole shop stops for 80 seconds and employees go nuts over it. It was so much fun.

Ok I am giving this place 5 stars because of their business plan. Do I like doughnuts? No. Do I like standing in line for doughnuts? Hell no. The point is, this business has evolved organically into a cult following. Take pinks hot dog stand in LA. Apparently it isn't that good. But every day of every week there is a line for 4 blocks. You did something right and maybe you guys fooled us all. For those of you complaining that you stood in line for an hour for doughnuts. Your an idiot because you stood in line for an hour for doughnuts. Let the haters hate. The  hype is the hype. It's all quite simple. Keep working the dough Voodoo. I got your back.....

Bacon maple od fashioned donuts.  WTF?  No cpr units visible, so they must be hiding them behind the counter.  'Cause if they aren't, there's gonna be a lot of dead prople outside the door.  Heart attack on a little paper sheet.  What a way to go!  MFG!

It's an artery clogging must experience! Whoa. How can you say no to a maple bacon bar? Or the No Name (raised doughnut, chocolate glaze, rice crispies and peanut butter drizzle)? Kind of in stale beer smelling patch of street, but worth the wait. It will blow your mind. Not for those who count calories or the faint of heart.
Not much to add here but I will say that these fuckers really know how to make a donut.

Let me give you an idea of a perfect evening in my head.

Long hot bath with 3 drops of lavender oil, epson salt with candles lit and big fat apple fritter in both hands.

Sitting in my iJoy chair with my ipod blaring cool 80s tunes with an apple fritter in both hands.

Finally retiring to my comfy bed with my husband at my side with an apple fritter in both hands... and him covered in them.

I love apple fritters.  Yeah.  You're quick to pick up on that one.  The apple fritters at Voodoo are... how shall I say.... pure perfection.  Crisp enough that you know it was fried in fresh oil.  Fluffy enough to want to take a nap with your face in it.  Sweet enough to know that you are about to reach that sugar coma.

The maple bacon bar is quite delicious.  And don't give me shit that it sounds disgusting.  I know you dip your breakfast sausage in your maple syrup!  Same thing, asswipe!

Holy crap there is nothing like this anywhere!!  We had the voodoo doll doughnut, chocolate doughnut with chocolate frosting, and Coco Puffs, vanilla frosted plain doughnut with vanilla frosting and Fruit Loops, and another one plain doughnut with vanilla frosting and Captain Crunch.

This is in a tricky area, so if you have kids, like I do, go during the day.

Voodoo is just awesome every time I go. Depending on the location, there may be a line. I find that the Sandy Blvd. location is the best that tends to not be as busy. Can't go wrong with really any donut here!

My husband and I recently traveled to Seattle, WA to visit friends and while out in the PNW we took a day-trip down to Portland. Why? Voodoo Doughnuts. Honestly, that's the only reason I wanted to go! I've been wanting to check this off my food-bucket-list since seeing it on Man vs Food years ago. I absolutely love donuts and Voodoo did not disappoint! Delicious. We bought a dozen - all different flavors so we could try as many of their iconic donuts as possible. Entirely worth the rainy 3 hour drive from Seattle :)

I was born and raised in the Oregon and Washington states and had never made it to Voodoo until a visit home to see family!! We made the journey from Vancouver over the bridge to flavorful Fun at Voodoo!! The assortment is crazy wonderful and the display case is a feast for your eyes and yummy!! Had many of the favorites because we took a dozen home for the weekend!! It's definitely a fun place to take in the Portlandia Vide!! Enjoy!!

I don't even know the name of the doughnut I got, but it was rectangular and and covered in chocolate. And it may be the most heavenly doughnut I've ever eaten. Afterwards, when the husband had to tell me to stop "going on" about the doughnut, well ... you know it's that good.
Cheap, great donuts and fun atmosphere.

It's deep-fried dough with icing and other stuff if you want it. In other words, it's really hard to eff up. Voodoo took the idea and ran full-speed! 

Voodoo's hella crowded. If I HAD to have a doughnut, which is basically never, I would be more than pleased by one here.

My baby, Zoey, loved it in here! With the mad music, plethora of crazy smells, awesome visual stimuli and interesting people to look at, Voodoo Doughnut offered Zoey a piece of baby paradise.

About the doughnuts: instead of getting the cock-and-balls, because you're kind of an ass that thinks it's funny to order cock-and-balls, get the maple bacon bar, and 2 other donuts. The cock-and-balls is a chocolate-covered eclair arranged with other doughnuts to look like male genitals. I mean, you COULD get the cock-and-balls, but that's an S-Load of chocolate-covered doughnut and it's expensive-6$ and change.

For less than 10 bucks, we got 3 maple bacon bars, a glazed doughnut and an official Oregon doughnut. This is not bad at all for a tourist trap!

The maple bacon bar could have been better. There needs to be bacon in every bite. In contrast, I went nuts for Oregon's official creme-filled and chocolate covered doughnut. The official Oregon doughnut made me happy enough to award 5 stars.

The glazed doughnut tasted like a glazed doughnut. This is my husband's favorite kind of doughnut in case you were wondering. 

You gotta back in to park, and good luck! Carry baby inside, don't bring a stroller. We went at five and there were about 10 people ahead of us. Don't come here in a hurry, and don't be a hater. It is what it is. No cash, but there is an ATM inside.
I just loved everything about this place, worth waiting in line in the RAIN!!!  Must go and experience Voodoo you won't regret it!!!  aka donut lovers...

Voodoo Doughnut is a Portland punk icon. If you, like Marsha, experienced a "snotty" attitude from the staff, it's likely you're not the demographic they're marketing toward. My guess is you came off as a tourist and lacked a certain level of respect for their counter-culture. But I could be wrong.

When it comes to their product, there's nothing else like it. And that's a good thing. Nearly every doughnut is pure genius, not to mention the fact that the doughnuts themselves (regardless of wacky toppings) are amazing! If I could find a doughnut shop that could simply offer the quality of doughnut available at Voodoo, just as a regular doughnut, I'd be impressed. Unfortunately, I've never had that pleasure.

Seriously, these doughnuts are just that good.
Ok, so the line is long but who can resist this experience! and the donuts - well, just make sure you try the maple bacon bar.  yummy! (be still my cholesterol)

We traveled from California to go to Voodoo donuts! Well worth it! And worth the wait!
Perfect for a 10 year old vacation

o. m. g. doesn't even begin top describe this place. all of the hype is legit! so tasty and delish, i only wish i had the four stomachs of a cow so that i could try them all without getting ill. i will for sure come back again and again. until then, i can report on the old fashion (classic but solid choice), the maple cruller (wow!), and the portland creme (like bavarian cream, holy moly batman!!!). i need to try others...

I must start by saying "I am not a donut person". Like I almost never crave a donut. I can eat half a donut and leave the other half on a platter. A dozen donuts brought to a meeting and I eat one max.

So I was sort of cutting loose in Portland and wandering around at night with and without friends and one night me and my Portland friend went to Voodoo Donuts. I felt like a tourist but in a good way. It was fun to stand in line at midnight for a donut. I got 2! We walked all over heck so it was ok with all the extra calories. I had one cake one and one filled with custard. Both a bit sweeter than I would like but great for that time and place.

Great for when I need a maple bacon bar or a voodoo doll doughnut ! 
A friend of mine gave me a HUGE decorated glazed doughnut for my birthday and I almost ate the whole thing myself. It took me about a week but, yum! Even living in Portland for so long can't burn me out on all the great local spots we have and I love Voodoo Doughnuts!

Captain My Captain = greatest doughnut idea man has ever devised. Take a great doughnut, frost it, and put Captain Crunch on it and BAM, doughnut hall of fame.

No seating, hole-in-the-wall place, but totally worth a visit. Great stumptown coffee to go with it. Wish I lived in Portland just to get that doughnut...

Well worth the long line!! Beware, this is a very unique neighbourhood with lots of homeless people. Parking is cheap, however, there are homeless people who wait at the parking machine. If you pay by cash or take out your wallet, be prepared to be hassled. 

Donuts I got
- Maple bacon 
- Voodoo doll
- Chocolate coconut 
- portland cream 
- the massive one that has oreos on top, forgot what it's called.. 
- glazed jelly filled 

Maple bacon was by far the best one! The voodoo doll was also very good. The donuts are really affordable and it's fun to fill a pink box. I ate them all weekend, however they were a little stale by the end of the 2nd day.
Great, whacky donuts, but absolutely not worth waiting in line for.  What's wrong with you people?!?!?!

Oh My! I get giddy just thinking about this place. There are very few doughnut places that I love going to. Don't get my wrong I love doughnuts but not only are they good but they are also inventive. 

I liked the Captain My Captain with Captain Crunch on the top. It is sweet and crunchy at the same time. 
Their Double chocolate is simple but delicious and so are their apple fritters. 

Their prices are a bit high but for some of the doughnuts the price is justified. 

I am definitely looking forward to going back on my next trip to Portland.

Wooo Hoooo.

I've nver had better doughnuts in my life. Cooked to perfection and worth every minute of the 45 minute wait on a Saturday morning in the rain.

Fair warning they will be closed on April 10th for a period undetermined in order to do some remodeling and expansion

When i can distinctly remember my bite and taste of donuts from Voodoo, it's worthy of 5 stars for a donut shop. I live in the SF Bay Area and often think of voodoo donuts when I crave the sweet treat. It is an institution for Portland. Must visit to try.

Yeah, you wait a long time in line for these donuts, but that is just part of the experience. The donuts were delicious, and the atmosphere is just so fun that I can't wait to go back and wait in line again to try more.

Voodoo did not disappoint this LA girl! Top 3 donuts ranked: 

1) voodoo donut 
2) maple bacon 
3) the one with the oreo on top (forgot what it's called) 

I also tried the grape ape (not a fan), no name donut (pretty bland).

Not t just the everyday donut! Definitely lives up to keeping Portland weird! If you don't mind pan handlers right at the door while you wait in line. Oh and expect to wait! Fabulous donuts!! Cashier was nice...ink, nose ring and all!

Stop by on our way out of Portland. Free parking before 1pm on Sunday. Line wasn't that bad, but it was rain so we still got wet.. but getting wet was worth that bite of my apple fritter. It's a tourist attraction so if your passing through check it out!

What more can I say about this fabulous establishment that no one else has said? Not much. All I can add is what everyone else has been saying. GO TO THIS PLACE WHEN YOU ARE IN PORTLAND and you will not be disappointed with the delicious melt in your mouth raised yeast donuts and interesting experience!  Humorous adult innuendos and photo-ops await you HERE!

NOTE: Everyone is attempting to capitalize on the bacon craze. This place actually executes it very well with the delicious maple bacon raised yeast donut. Thanks for not skimping on the bacon! I love it, I love it!!!
Came here on a Friday after and we didn't have to wait in line! The maple bacon was fantastic! Another great place to visit in Portland !

so glad my daughter goes to school in Oregon so I get to have Voodoo Donuts. 
Portland is weird and the line you will most likely wait in is priceless....especially what is going on all around you. The donuts are amazing ---all of them! As a bonus, they also sell vinyl 45's and beer. They should open a kiosk at the airport. 
Loved Voodoo Donut!
I love this place.  What's not to like about a maple bar with bacon on it?!  Best doughnut in Stumptown hands down.  If you haven't gone then you need to go.
Donuts are absolutely delicious. It was my first time and the staff were friendly in letting me know what the specials were and what I should try. The Bacon Maple Bar is an absolute must try.

I have ordered boxes of doughnuts on several occasions. In fact, my son wanted Voodoo doughnuts for his birthday party rather than a cake.
There is always a line and waiting time is usually 20-30 minutes, but it's worth it. This business has some great imagination to create such a wide variety of flavors. If you have a craving for a unique doughnut, you should give them a try. Ten Stars.

Crazy concepts, crazy good. 

I've been there 3 times since first touching down in the (503) and tried the Bacon Maple Bar first, followed by the Ol' Dirty Bastard (R.I.P!) and never looked back, that's my Doughnut right there. 

Pricing is 3 times or more what you pay for Dunkin, Krispy Kreme, etc. but the Voodoo doughnut kills their product. They're delicious and they hold overnight- You can enjoy them in morning and they won't have hardened like a Cake doughnut from the other guys. If your diet allows you to, definitely visit this spot, the Doughnuts are amazingly good, get one, it won't kill your wallet, you'll be glad you did.
Noms. Definitely worth the 30-minute wait on a Monday afternoon.
Always amazing so lucky to live in the Greater Portland area.

Absolutely worth the wait! Better than an average donut, even if you just get plain chocolate. 
They are fresh and amazingly delicious! I had a bite of the Homer Simpson, the strawberry frosting was perfect! They do not disappoint, so grab a coffee and get in line!

Maple bacon bar?
leave inhibitions @ home
get counter (cultured)
Yeah I'm a tourist. Yeah I've been told to come here. Yeah everyone was right. No I don't care that there are better places. Yeah I ate 3 donuts and feel like I'm on crack.

I love  you, Voodoo Doughnuts.  I miss you.  I rarely see you anymore because of the crazy-ass line of tourists that now constantly snakes around the block at most hours of the day/night.  I know how to order.  I know what I like and it doesn't take me 15 minutes to decide.  

I know it's important to share with others, but I miss the convenience of our early morning hook-ups.  

Voodoo doughnuts are worth the wait and soooo delicious.  You'll never want any other doughnut once you've had Voodoo.

I recommend:  The Tex-Ass, It's a Jelly, Apple Fritter, McMinnville Cream and the nefarious Bacon Maple Bar.

I love their selections!! Although hey are famous for their bacon maple bar, I would actually pass on that!! But all my friends who've tried it seem to like that one the best.

I love their vegan doughnuts! haha although I'm not vegan, there have been plenty of times I've considered it and like choosing the vegan option if it is available. So I pretty much always order a vegan doughnut every time I go.

My favorite is the vegan one that looks like cookies and cream (don't know the name, I usually point and order). I also tried the gay bar and that was pretty yummy, basically a creme filled bar doughnut with fruit loops strategically placed on top to make a rainbow. 

It's always fun to come for a bachelor party and get the cock and balls. I came with my friend and they were nice enough to customize it for us!!

They are open pretty much all the time! My friends say they do close at some point in the day, but that they close during the time no one comes out for doughnuts so no one ever notices.... maybe they are 24hrs now...I'm not sure about their hours, but they are pretty much open all the time when you need them.

Price is pretty cheap, but remember that they only accept cash (they do have an atm inside). Line is usually pretty long and I remember those days when I waited hours for a doughnut, but their efficiency has changed and they are getting people in and outta there in no time. Lately I hardly ever even waited.

Five stars now because I have discovered bubblegum donuts. They are my absolute favorite. The flavor is strong and delicious. So sweet that one is certainly enough but the taste is perfect. If you are a fan of cotton candy or bubblegum flavors this donut is heaven. Plus it comes with a piece of double bubble!

What's not to love?  These sweet concoctions are famous (or maybe infamous) in PDX and your trip is not complete without that little pink box.  I love the voodoo doll donut with the raspberry center.  To die for!  I also love the white frosted donut with orange Tang and sprinkles.  It sounds weird, but the Tang adds just a little sour bite to the sweet donut.  Voodoo is always a good idea.

We waited in line for 45 minutes in the HOT sun, but it was totally worth it. We ordered the Bacon Maple Bar, Portland cream and The Voodoo Doll. After we bought our doughnuts we walked over to where the Blue's Festival was going on and ate our donuts while washing them down with beer. Seem's like a weird combo, but when it's a hot day a cold beer does wonders and the doughnuts were a Big Bonus!

Me & my husband are from California & we have never even heard of this place until we moved to Washington . We went to a basketball game at the Moda Center & on our way home we stopped my Voodoo Doughnuts for the first time the line wasn't too bad at all , everyone was in & out in a jiffy ! We ordered 2 captain crunch doughnuts , 1 cocoa puffs doughnut , a maple , a old fashioned doughnut , a regular chocolate doughnut , & an Oreo doughnut & let me just say AMAZING ! Even though after a couple bites half of one doughnut gave me a headache I do recommend trying this place at least once ! It was a great experience & apparently a pretty popular place . A must try :)
Absolutely, positively the most amazing donuts!!!  The maple bacon bar is off the chain!!  When you have friends visiting you simply MUST take them to visit, it's a Portland THING!  Soooo good!!
Love this place ! so much variety and fun to the doughnuts ! wish there were more of these around ! the long might be long but go with a group of friends and its fun and time passes by !

Can't go wrong with the Bacon Maple Bar. I've tried so many items here and they're really all good, but the best thing is the crazy Voodoo experience. If you're in Portland and you haven't been here, everyone must go at least once. This place is 1 part tacky 1 part crass and all parts awesome. Take some friends with ya too and you'll see why good things come in pink boxes!

So for years I have been wanting to try these donuts. I would see people traveling with them and think man they must be awesome. Let me tell you they didn't disappoint. We got lucky and stopped by Thursday evening after the basketball game and it was raining so we only had to wait 10 mins or so. My favorite was the basic chocolate covered yeast donut. I'm not a cake donut fan but the their chocolate cake was so light and fresh I might reconsider. 

I really wish they would open a location in the airport I so wanted to take a box back.
I have been here and there other close location. Both I love. I especially love their mango filled donut. I miss them and can't find them anywhere else.
Amazing donuts, wait was not that long either on a weekday morning. Had the Portland Cream and it was super tasty.

I have to give this place 5 stars just for the vegan donuts. They have quite a few options, cake as well as raised. They even have vegan maple bars! They are really good. They taste just like "regular" donuts. The "creme" in the creme filled ones is really good too. 

Vegan sweets tend to be pricey and these ones are pretty affordable. I have gone a couple of times on a week day during the morning and there was no line. Yay! Thanks Voodoo! Also, tip your counter person if you can. They work hard and have to deal with so many tourists.

I might be a health junkie most of the time, but I still tell my friends and family to go here. Voodoo has a unique selection of doughnuts that also taste amazing. My personal favorites are the bacon maple bar, the voodoo doll, and the apple fritter. Be prepared to wait a very long time...each time I've gone, there's a long line! I still say it's worth the wait.

I give nothing but the utmost respect to the people that work at Voodoo, and any other late night food establishment, b/c they put up with, day in and day out, annoying drunk people including myself.  Voodoo is always a great place to hit up after a night of drinking.  Any other time I've tried doughnuts after a night of eating it doesn't end well, however, somehow it always ends perfectly when you visit Voodoo.  The Chocolate Orange was like no other doughnut, and not really like a doughnut at all.  It seriously tasted like one of those chocolate oranges that you get in your stocking at xmas.  Plus you've gotta love any doughnut that is a "blood filled" voodoo doll...I mean come on.  They have the niche market of doughnuts pinned to a T.  Thanks Voodoo.

The Vegan Maple Doughnuts totally counteract the long line you wait in any night of the week.

Vegan Deliciousness is worth a wait.
We waited for 20 minutes in the rain for this place, and it was totally worth it.  Just know there is always a line and to bring cash.

Oh My Lord these little nuggets rock! My favorite is the Portland cream, but my buddy digs the Dirty Old Bastard. Good stuff and the line always moves pretty fast and there's usually some entertaining street things going on. Good to take visiting friends/family to after the Saturday market.

I am not from Portland, so ended up circling the block about 5 times before I finally figured out where this place was, but it was SO worth it for the sugar coma that ensued. 
I ended up with three different doughnuts- The Glazed with Vanilla Frosting dipped in Cap 'n Crunch, The Vanilla Glazed with Chocolate Frosting, Chocolate Cookie Crumbs and Peanut Butter Drizzle and the Vanilla stuffed Eclair with Maple Frosting and Bacon. 
Oh man, this place is so crazy. I think I could only take one bite every ten minutes or so because I did not want my stomach to hate me in the morning. But they were so yummy. I cant really say much more about this place.

I loved it. Anthony Bourdain loved it. Chuck Palahniuk loved it. How can you go wrong?

Welcome to Portland, dreary eyed from too many brews the night before, we stumbled down to our first stop, Voodoo Doughtnut.  And what wonders fall before my sleepy eyes?  I must be dreaming, phallic shaped doughnuts, donuts with fruit loops or oreos, chocolate and peanut drizzles everywhere.  I cannot take in all of the sweetie goodness before coffee (which blissfully they provided for me).  As Tim B. said, maybe the treatment was a result of acting a bit the "tourist" and not appreciating the culture of the place. The staff was polite and my sister was of sound enough mind to ask what their "specialty" was.

The shop closed right after we got our order to perform a wedding ceremony (unfortunately my sis and brother-in-law weren't down to renew their vows), which was a super cool sight to see.

They are open a proud 21 hours a day (6 a.m. to 3 a.m.) and I'd suggest going for dessert rather than for breakfast, but then I'm more a bacon n eggs kinda breakfast person.
Go here, wait in the ungodly long line, and get a somtimes inappropriate donuts. The wait is long, and the place is sometimes dirty. But it's that good: five stars.

This place calls me to it weekly - CRAVINGS.
Cool people, crazy doughnuts, cheap eats.
They make austom doughnuts too for any occasion for almost nothing.
There is often a line but its fun to meet locals and tourists alike.
Westside vacation is mich better than eastside.
The magic is in my belly.

Must go here at least once when you're in Portland! I visited twice with a friend visiting and we ordered the voodoo doll which is chocolate with raspberry jelly filling, no name which is chocolate with rice cripsies and peanut butter and something like a raised donut with oreos and peanut butter. 

Lines tend to be long, but they move quickly. The donuts itself were fluffy and fresh. The filled donuts seem to have A LOT of filling which may overpower the donut a bit, but overall if you squeeze some of the filling out it tastes pretty good. 

They also have vegan donuts as well, which I think is cool too.

Vegan Doughnuts!  My husband proclaimed "best doughnuts I've ever had".  We had a raised doughnut with chocolate on top and bavarian cream in the middle, the same but with maple on top, and a bear claw (over the span of a couple of days).  They are the most amazing doughnuts ever.  And, even the next day they were equally amazing.. usually I won't eat doughnuts that are a day old, but these are wonderful!  I am extremely glad don't live near a Voodoo Doughnut shop or I would probably weigh 200 lbs.

Fun names!  Cool place!  I know Portland is suppose to be odd but the guy outside singing go 1 hour almost ruined the experience.  I don't mind waiting in like but he was torture!  Everyone in line was commenting. They have his album inside.  Doughnuts were good! Ordered the special eclipse doughnut, void I man, homer, very Jerry, butterfingered and the Cock N Balls.
Went on sunday morning.. Line was short and indulged in very many yummy doghnuts!

I will always love Voodoo Doughnut.  I do get a sugar coma from ingesting too many when I go but my husband and I got married there and not many people can say that their wedding chapel is famous.  I would recommend Voodoo for BOTH weddings and the food :)

BTW.. if you get married here... Ask Catdaddy for the "crazy Catdaddy" wedding.  I wasn't wearing a wedding dress so he came out in one instead.  I loved it!
Wow. I don't even like donuts and was dragged here by my girlfriend and ohh buddy, these things are the bomb. Thanks for starting my day off in Portland right! Yum city.

Yeah, there's a a huge hype associated with Voodoo, but people stating this place is nothing special are wrong. The donuts are creative and different from your corner donut store. The place is open 24/7 so being a night owl is not a problem. The atmosphere in there is amazing as well. It's a super fun place to go and I personally see the hype making Voodoo an even better experience!

We love these guys!  Fun staff and good coffee.  Such a fun environment.  Donuts are donuts after all but they have such fun creative names, and some really creative donuts.  They are a little pricey, but its so yummy!  The lines can be slow, but that's only because most people don't know what the heck the donuts are.  I think to help this along they need to post names and pics along the wall so those waiting in line will have a chance to get better prepared.  Definitely a family favorite, and always a spot to stop when we have out of town visitors. We like to go to Voodoo Doughnuts Too because they have a parking lot.
Great doughnuts at a great price! Cash only which is stupid, and their atm charges $3 for withdrawals. Except from this, very good.

O Voodoo, 

How I do love you! Now you are open even longer hours, during the day, so that I am tempted by you each day on the way home from work.  We go in on a whim, telling ourselves that we will get only one. . . until the pink boxes call for us to take them home. How can I resist? Voodoo for breakfast. What could be better?

I've been wanting to visit Voodoo Doughnut since I first heard about it probably 6 or 7 years ago. When I finally made my way to Portland for a visit recently, I knew I had to stop by. Lucky for me, my hotel was right across the street. The line was long almost every time we went by. On Saturday night we decided the line was probably about as short as it was gonna get and we waited. Even though it seemed long, it moved pretty fast so don't be discouraged! When we finally got inside, it was a bit bigger than I thought it was going to be. They had 3 registers, which is why the line moved fairly fast, and display cases with rotating doughnuts so you can see clearly what you want to order. I ended up getting myself 4 doughnuts: Maple Bacon, ODB, Voodoo Doll, and Sprinkles. They all lived up to my expectations! I ate the ODB that night while fresh, and it was amazing. That was probably my favorite, however it was ridiculously sweet and would probably make me sick if I ate it too often haha. The other 3 made the trip back home with me and I have to say they held up super well. Even after a day or two the donuts still tasted really good. Maple Bacon was a lot better than I thought it might be; it really is a good flavor combo. The Voodoo Doll was  yummy and I liked the raspberry jelly but it also was really sweet. The Sprinkles, which I got so I could try one of their more traditional donuts, was just as delicious and wonderful as the crazy concoctions they're famous for. I'm so glad I got to try Voodoo Doughnut and I can't wait to visit again next time I'm in Portland!
For how much attention Voodoo gets, I was surprised at how cheap the donuts were! My girlfriend and I hit up Voodoo at 6am when there was no line and had donuts for breakfast.

As an out-of-towner, this was one of the highlights of my trip. The doughnuts are great - not to say they are the absolute, technically most perfect I've ever had - but great. And as far as culinary creativity and presentation are concerned, these cannot be beat. The 30 minutes in line is part of the experience. As is seeing employees climb a ladder into a back loft to get in to work. This joint is tiny.

My wife and I tried Voodoo Doughnut first, and then everyone said, "hey if you want an amazing donut, go to Bluestar." So we did. And it was good...but we like Voodoo better. The punky ambiance and general "Keep Portland Weird" vibe aside, Voodoo was, to us, more of what a donut should be--nothing fancy, just a delicious, good quality donut. 
My absolute favorite so far at Voodoo is the apple fritter (way better than Bluestar's in my opinion). Super cinnamony, enough apple to taste but not too much, and a nice satisfying crispiness on the exterior so that you know this donut is good and fried. 
We also tried a couple others: fruity pebbles, Oreo, etc. All good choices. I'm sure every donut is excellent.

Let me start by saying this is the first time I've been a dork and taken a picture INSIDE a restaurant.  

We went on a Thursday at 5:30 and there was no line.  

I had a Portland Creme and a Maple Bacon. Both were fantastic. 

If you're in from outta town grab a doughnut and walk up the street to Stumptown and enjoy a couple of the finer things in Portland at once.

I brought a box to a networking meeting and was the most popular person there!  If you go at 6am, which I did, there's no line.  Seriously.  I had the maple with bacon and it was A-mazing.  The other donuts went fast and we got a variety to satisfy the crowd.  I will definitely take out of state guests there.

This place is definitely a tourist place. Lines were long and the donuts were weird but totally worth it. Visiting from Hawaii, we don't have places like this on island and have to fly over to Maui just to get Krispy Kreme... So I can definitely appreciate a place like this.

Got the maple bacon donut and it was awesome! Bacon pretty much goes with everything so yeah!
Such a great part of the Portland culture and food scene. This is a must eat when in Portland! The atmosphere is everything you would expect out of the progressive Portland scene!

Beware: Voodoo Doughnut is not your usual doughnut!

But I mean that in the BEST way possible.

While Voodoo Doughnut peddles weird combos like maple-and-bacon bars or Fruit Loop laden classics, my favorite is definitely the doughnut topped with Oreos and peanut butter.

Only in Portland.

This hole-in-the-wall is open late at night until early in the morning, selling to club-going hipsters and people looking to learn Swahili (yes, someone actually teaches it and works there). It's the best-kept non-secret in Portland, and I'm always excited to bring newbies there, just because it's so...out-of-control awesome.

The store itself is pretty small, so there's normally a line out the door (for good reason, too!), but it moves fast. Inside, you'll see oddities like a giant plaster doughnut, and lots of Polaroids of celebs (like goddess Janet Weiss) inside the sugary kingdom.

Oh. God. Want. Some. Now.

ODB (Old Dirty Bastard) is my all-time favorite.
Skip the lines and come out to the North East Location in the middle of a weekday.
Also Buckets of donuts for cheap!
Yummy at parties.
This place gets a lot of flack for being busy and having lines, also people "Don't get it."
Cool. More doughnuts for me!!
I'm proud to say I've been eating Voodoo Doughnuts since 2003, and I live in Spokane, WA. Voodoo is a staple for all of my Portland visits. I try to have one bacon maple bar a day when I'm in town.

Tried two doughnuts here. The maple bacon doughnut, and the triple chocolate peanut butter doughnut. I have got say, this place gets five stars solitarly for how amazing the maple bacon donut was. This was simply one of the best doughnuts I have ever had. Voodoo doughnuts managed to make a doughnut with bacon that tasted amazing. Now I like doughnuts, and I like bacon. You are telling me I can have both at once!! Gosh Darn! Gimme gimme!

If I had just had the triple chocolate peanut butter, this place would have been a 3, but I didn't, and so this place has been re-deamed. Worth the hype if you are around. Just get bacon!

I don't get the reviews stating how it just a donut with a bunch of topping statements. Seriously....a bunch of toppings that have their own flavors on something changes the flavor of the item. Even a donut! But I guess everyone's taste buds are different. Anyways, with that being said. I went here a few times on my trip to Portland to visit and see some of my bfs family. Each time was delicious! My favorite was the Old Dirty Bastard, Bacon Maple, and the Voodoo Doll! Warning - Only get enough that you CAN eat. Don't try to save them for later because they don't have a long shelf life. They state that on the website. So get some for now and then go back and get some for later. : )

Love the unapologetic blasting of metal.  Love the employees that look like the Portland homeless that loiter outside the store.  Love the cash only policy.  And oh yeah, love the donuts.  

Voodoo donuts please do not change.

Bacon maple is all you need. if there was ever a food in the world that you have to try, its probably this. sweet with a bit of salt, this confection is truly a masterpiece. the fruitloops one is also a wild flavor bash that tastes like glazed donuts with fruitloops but somehow creamy tooo! this is a must stop by!

I did the tourist thing and had to come visit for my first time in Portland :p. I only got the blueberry cake donut and I wish I got more. It was really good! I tried a bite of the butter fingered and blue moon and they were okay, I liked mine more lol. Everybody ordered at least a dozen or more when they were there. The people working there are definitely efficient and we didn't mind waiting because we needed the time to decide what we wanted to eat lol. Lots of seating outside.

My only disappoint is that i don't live in Portland which robs me of the opportunity to strategically go down their vast menu of specialty donuts and try each one. When i say vast, I mean vast...  Super overwhelmed and confused as what to pick. Everything looks so darn good... 

I ended up picking two, I opted for a classic glazed donut and a Cap'n Crunch donut... Really Really Good Stuff. I'm no donut expert, but it was by far the best glazed donut i've ever had. It was soft, sweet... almost a donut/cake like texture.  My attempt at a description will do the donut a disservice. It was just GOOD, go get your hands sticky and grab one if you really want to know. The Cap'n Crunch donut was reflective of the glazed but with Cap'n crunch and Crunch Berries stuck to the top. Again, also really really good stuff... Straight sugar overload. 

The place is partly tourist attraction and local hotspot. You can't miss the paisley pink building with the long line of customers outside. You'll see tourist in the parking lot taking selfies with the building in the background and locals walking out with pink boxes of their favorite donuts. 

If you're from outta town you definitely have to stop here, and if you're from Portland and haven't been here... well then, you probably don't like donuts. 
Voodoo Doughnuts. Five Stars fa sure.
