Voodoo has an amazing atmosphere. They also have very clever names and boxes and clothing. The donuts are incredible. They all have their own radical flavors and concepts, and not one is the same as the other. From cream filled to jelly, old fashioned to cake...these donuts are great. Highly recommended, definitely worth battling the traffic to snack on!

The dough is what makes it here. Definitely get tthe old dirty bastard. Although some may say it's over hyped the dough is still just great, not over powering with a good fluff to it. It we ordered the Portland cream which is just a Boston cream but hey still good.

The great thing about this place is that despite being seemingly very sweet donuts all of them were not overly sweet, went well with the donut, all had great bites and DO NOT make you feel gross afterward. 3 donuts for 2 people was just right for a breakfast and we had a pleasant walk around town after
Some of the best most creative vegan doughnuts I've ever had come from here. I live in NYC and always make it a point to bring a couple dozen back with me when visiting Portland.
I have been to the downtown Portland and the Eugene locations!  Both places were friendly and fun!  The employees are a crack up and the donuts rock!

We were lucky and went during the day on a Monday when there wasn't a line, but even if there was it'd probably be worth the wait. I stared at the twirling donut case for like 20 minutes because I was mesmorized by all their tasty creations. The cocoa puffs donut was decent but the oreo vanilla donut was quite amazing. My boyfriend got the Memphis Mafia which was bigger than my face. It was so intimidating, we didn't even finish it all.
Constantly good - every time we have visitors from out of town we go here and it is the rave! Personal favorites: Dirty Bastard and the Voodoo!

I stayed in the Embassy Suites across the street for a few days. WIN! I stopped by here off-hours, and there was no line. I seriously stood in front of the donut display area for a good 5-10 mins deciding what i wanted. Everything looked so bizarre and creative. 

The voodoo donut - the one shaped like a voodoo doll with filling - is amazing.

Big fan of the Voodoo Doughnut!  This is the original location! Huge hype that is more than what this place offers, however, the sugary variety goodness and creative expression in the donuts are fun, the folks that work here are fabulous, and it's an iconic business of Portland.  When in Portland, you gotta have a Voodoo.

Cash only!  Be prepared so you are not standing in the freaking rain for an hour then discover this when you get close to the doors.  There is an ATM inside.

Be smart and show up when the crowd is not there and beat the line.  We last came in here on a Friday afternoon when most people are still working while on a mini vacay and there was virtually no line.  Open 24/7 except on major holidays and one bonus day off for staff in Feb.

Known for donuts that have cereal piled on them, unique flavor combos and shapes, and even naughty donuts, Voodoo has been featured on foodie shows and people have even been married here.  The donuts taste really great, same level as a Winchell's which is better than Krispy Kreme.  Will they make you sing from how good they taste?  Maybe, maybe not.  But the reasons why I give this place 5 stars is because of the creativity, the amazing customer service and the consistency of good, yummy, fresh donuts.

Donuts I like a lot:
*Pot Hole!  NEW guy!  He is a chocolate cream bar, stuffed with yummy chocolate with crushed Oreos on top of him with a dotted white line
*Regular ol' lemon filled jelly donut - I think theirs is the best
*Voodoo Doll!  Looks like an angry chocolate beast bar waiting to be devoured with raspberry jelly
*Coconutttttt - yeah yeah
*Memphis Mafia - chocolate, peanuts, peanut butter, chocolate chips, banana, cinnamon
*Husband's fave is their chocolate cake donuts, he drools just seeing them

They have a huge plain donut that is like the size of seven rolled into one!  If you can eat the sucker in less than 80 seconds they will refund your money!  I haven't tried it yet, I don't want to die from diabetes.

They have Jones soda, milk, Stumptown cold brew coffee, and a soda fountain.  

Last time we were here, the cashier was the friendliest, coolest employee I've seen in action at a place of employment in over two years.  

Place is decorated to match the weirdness - like a yuppie college freshman seeking attention, no longer a girl, not yet a woman, in hot pink and orange with random flashy things thrown about.

They do special orders.  Wish I lived in Portland so I could get the handmade coffin full of donuts.  Sigh.  What a cool 4th of July party that would be.

These nuts also have a record label.  Haven't checked it out yet, but I need to.

Parking is a beast; paid lots only around here.

Food: 4
Service: 5
Ambiance: 5
Parking: 2

A HAIKU REVIEW

Sweet mother of God!
Sweet doughnuts are so divine!
...and it's weird as hell.

Wow. If you're in Portland, this is a must-stop spot. These donuts were not only delicious and well made, but so creative! The atmosphere is just Portland in a nutshell. Yes, the line can get long, but  it moves fast and it's totally worth it. We even came back for more!!

This was worth a stop as a tourist, I don't know if I would eat there all the time. We went early, around 8 am on a rainy Saturday and beat the line. The place was super cool, donuts were above average and creative. I really liked the peach fritter with cream cheese frosting and the Memphis one with chocolate and peanut butter. Wish they had been warm, or there had been an option to warm them up as our hotel did not have a microwave.

First time in Portland and everyone said we had to check out Voodoo Doughnuts! We must have come at the right time around 11am because there was no line. We asked them to recommend their most popular which was the one with Oreos and peanuts butter on top. Really good but very rich. And got another one with a hibiscus icing, so delicious!! Doughnuts were very fresh and large too! Definitely worth stopping here when in town.

If you are in Portland, you must make the necessary stop at voo doo. As vegans, my friends and I had to stop because they have vegan donuts!! Delicious, wonderful, sweet and rich vegan donuts. I loved the cream filled one. 

You wait in the long line, at peak hours, it is a super long line, but it is fun and worth it. Once inside, make sure you have cash on you, you can choose your donuts and also pick up some apparel and gifts if you would like. 

We stopped in at voo doo twice during our 3 day stop in Portland, we played charades in line while we waited and enjoyed music being played by local street artists.

This place is a riot!   The donuts are good and their selection varies from the usual selection to the obscene.   Great place to grab a yellow cake doughnut topped with chocolate, rice crispy and peanut butter, maple bar topped with a couple of pieces of thick bacon, maple doughnut filled with Bavarian cream, the most obscene double chocolate twists, etc.  Well, you get the picture.   They have Stumptown coffee (a big plus) to wash all that goodness down.   The doughnuts were fresh, the cereal crispy and they were not overly sweet.

Absolutely delicious donuts! I've passed by this place so many times, but never bothered to hop in and buy some because the line to get in is always massive! Luckily, there was only one person in front of me when I walked in, so I figured I finally go in and see what the fuss was all about. While each donut varies in price, I can totally see why they do so. I picked out five, and I enjoyed every single one of them, hands down. Totally worth coming down just for some fresh donuts from here!

I love going to VooDoo Doughnuts because it is not just for the donuts, it is for the experience. I just took my husband for the first time and he loved the bacon maple bar.  It was well worth the wait in line.  Thank you for making such delicious donuts Voodoo!

It is a MUST DO when visiting Portland.  Prepare to stand in line (at least 40 minutes or so) but it is well worth the wait.  It is an experience just waiting in line for the doughnut with all of the people and it is fun when you get inside to look at the board and choose what you want.  We ordered 13 different doughnut for the whole family to enjoy over the next couple of days.  The Voodoo Doll is so cute, but we thought was the BEST doughnut we had. Other ones we suggest trying:  Old Dirty Bastard, Memphis Mafia, Grape Ape, Double Bubble and the Tangtastic.

Worth the hype and long wait? Absolutely!

I spent my birthday weekend in Portland, first time to the city and everyone one kept telling us that we had to go to Voodoo.

On the first day, we walk by it and skipped it due to the long line. 

Later that night, we waited in line for about twenty minutes with little progress. There were also sketchy people hanging out near the line. We left.

On the third day, we came in the afternoon and found a much shorter line. It took us about forty minutes to get inside.

The donuts are the best that I have ever eaten and even though this place is packed and trendy, the prices are way less than I had anticipated. 

We shared four donuts and spent around six dollars. We got a Voodoo Doll with raspberry filling, maple with vanilla filling, a froot loop topped and a lemon cruller. All of them were fantastic. 

One tip would be to go to their website and peruse the options before getting in line or on your smart phone in line. There are so many choices that it is good to have an idea of what they offer before entering the store. Help keep that line moving!

Also cash only. Apparently they have an ATM, but again, I think it's just better to come prepared. 

Don't let the line deter you, make sure to visit Voodoo Donuts.
Always pleases.  From my plain glazed raised to the stuffed doughnuts my kids eat we All enjoy our visit go voodoo!  Can't leave Portland without a pink box.  It wouldn't be a real visit.

Being in Portland for a weekend trip had to do voodoo... we waited in line for about 40min but it's quite entertaining with people watching and corner bands. Doughnuts well worth the wait and priced super reasonable

This is how doughnuts should be made, thoughtfully conceived and carefully crafted.  As with all doughnuts they must be eaten fresh to fully  appreciate the finished product.  Every variety I've tried has been sublime.  Even the ones with ingredients I do not like on their own (like mango or Froot Loops).  At first I was afraid of the Cock and Balls...I thought, well, I'll have a half a testicle, but the Bavarian cream was so smooth and sweet that I was able to finish the whole thing off.  The sugar coated frosted ones and the big horny ones like Captain My Captain while intimidating at first, are really just sweet little morsels.  The more exotic the better!  What else can I say that over twelve hundred people haven't already said?  Voodoo Doughnut really IS as good as it gets!

This place has a shtick and it works!  The doughnuts are also delicious.

I can see why there could be out of control lines on the weekends and it was even pretty packed there during the afternoon on a week day.

I got the marionjelly doughnut because I figured that was a pretty classic Portland, OR choice, my girlfriend go the oreo doughnut which was also good but a little stale.  We got mini versions of lemon chiffon cruellar, rainbow sprinkle and blueberry cake.

I wish they had more mini versions so I could try more and not feel too piggy, lol, but they were great and I think their marketing and branding is a hoot.

Me and some buddies decided to go to Portland for our little post-college reunion and one of the first things on our list to try was Voodoo Doughnut. So I'm meeting my friends and the first thing that I'm presented with when I step off the MAX is a box of a dozen donuts!! Yum! Of course, it's meant to be shared, so we all hunker down on a bench and take little bites of as many as we can. Pretty much all of them were delicious; if not delicious, at least it was interesting. I recommend you steer clear of the purple tang one (unless you really really love the taste of fake grape) and any of the cereal ones. The cereal always tasted way too stale and didn't contrast well with the donut, BUT I commend Voodoo for their efforts!

We went back nearly everday (5 day trip) for at least a couple donuts for all of us to share. The apple fritter and the vegan glazed yeast donut stole the show! For some reason, my friends never tried the bacon one. I'm a vegetarian, but it looked delicious!
Good donuts sometimes it's too much frosting for me but I can easily take it off and eat it the way I want it. Great donuts!

Ten minutes wait for us. Glitter on the brick walls outside and a fun and very "Portland" feeling experience. Service was quick with three registers. We got one voodoo doughnut and one regular cream filled doughnuts. We aren't regular donut eaters so my main requirement for a tasty donut is that it's fresh. No use eating a stale or old doughnut. This spot, churning out doughnuts 24 hours a day for boards of hungry donut lovers, definitely has fresh doughnuts.

Prices are normal, considering how crazy popular they are.

Decor is excellent. Jumped in the photo booth for fun, since we were there as tourists more than sweet addicts. They have donut fabric in the back. Heh. $5, they take cards for the photo booth. Bathroom in the back. 

Staff yells at you if you block the exit door. Can't help but think they could have organized the line better, but we debated what the best method would have been and had a few suggestions that also all had flaws. So \_()_/. Haha.

Old Dirty Bastard! 
You're welcome. 
(That's the name of perhaps the best doughnut on the menu, I'd say. Please don't be offended). 

This is: the only place I'll eat a doughnut. More like, the only place I'll eat fried food. No joke, it just doesn't appeal to me. EXCEPT THIS.
Vegan doughnuts are delicious. Delicious delicious delicious. Can't even recall all of the doughnuts I've had/tried/otherwise consumed here, but I have never had one I didn't like. Though I'm not a Huge fan of the candy-y ones (with, like, Tang on them), you just really can't go wrong.

Even if you're not hungry in the slightest, strategy says to go wait in line, Now. You'll be hungry by the time you get to the door. (Or, if you refuse! to wait, a trip at like 6:30 AM is no problem at all.)

Yum! I absolutely love this place! 

I went back to Portland to visit with my boyfriend recently & I just HAD to take him here. 

Okay, as "weird" as it might sound but yes I tried the maple bar with bacon on top for the first time & I have to admit it was DELICIOUS! The sweet & salty taste just works so well in your mouth & the crisp of the bacon was perfect!

My boyfriend had gotten the cock & balls (chocolate doughnut with cream filling inside)... & let me tell you, I have NEVER seen a heterosexual ever get excited for ordering a penis shaped doughnut before. HAHA, lets just say my boyfriend got "wet" over it. ;] 

All in all, if you live in Portland or if you're every there to visit I do recommend you go to VooDoo. Best place ever & the service was GREAT!

Worth the wait!  Yes, I had to wait 25 minutes to get doughnuts but they were fantastic.   There is a lot to look at to keep you entertained while waiting.   The place almost has an old record shop vibe to it. I got the voodoo doll and Rex Diablo doughnuts, in Voodoo Doughnuts' signature pink box of course!   The doughnuts were moist and the shop has some fun and yummy combinations at a reasonable price too.   A definite tourist destination.
Line was a little of a wait but well worth it!  Shamrock, butterfinger, bubblegum and donuts were all amazing so far!  Still need to eat our other 3 donuts we got .
I like their sense of humor! Donuts are really huge! Sales guys sometimes could look scary but that is weird Portland, so I definitely love how they present their brand.
Best apple fritters in USA.  Every time I come to Portland to see my family that is the first place I want to go. I have never had an apple fritter like that in my life. Voodoo is the best.

If you like doughnuts... if you like food... hell, if you are breathing... go to VOODOO in Portland! I first heard about it through a little show on the Food Network and I knew I had to go there while visiting the northwest. I was so excited that it lived up to the hype. There was no line at all when I went in (around 9:30am on a Thursday). Walked in and thought I'd get a doughnut or two but my girl and I ended up with a dozen because we couldn't decide. LOVED the no name. If you like peanut butter, you should totally try this one. It has chocolate glaze, rice crispies, and peanut butter. They really know how to marry taste and texture here. They aren't just fun doughnuts, they are amazingly good. Very moist, fresh, and homemade. I am so sad to now be thousands of miles away from their sinfully tastey goodness.

Things to know:

1) There will be a line. Portland likes to stand in a line. But this line is worth it.
2) You must have cash. This is actually a good thing, as sometimes the line thins out real fast when people realize they don't have cash.
3) Please don't be stupid. Buy more than one doughnut. Trust me. Get a pink box and load that sucker up. 
4) The vegan doughnuts will make you very happy if you're a vegan. 
5) See number 3. Seriously.

OMG...I stood in the POURING OREGON RAIN for THIRTY MINUTES in line yesterday....soaked through my purse even, but turns out they still take cash even if its soaked :)  FINALLY had my first maple bar with Bacon.  There is a heaven afterall.

Thank you Voodoo for making my soaking wet body, my sniffly nose, my hungry tummy, and my now feverish (due to the rain :( ) friend VERY HAPPY AND SATISFIED with your doughnutty yumminess....(TRUE LOVE)

P.S.  Dont forget that when you get up to the cash register, to check out their "The magic is in the hole" poster hanging up in the back above the doughnuts.....is that a package in those panties???

Saw this featured in one of those travel shows and wanted to try them out.  I ordered the voodoo doll, mango tango, and old dirty bastard.  They were all excellent.  These donuts are light and airy and not too sweet.  There was just a small line when we got there and we didn't have to wait very long.  The lady at the counter was very nice and friendly.

Voodoo Doughnuts is an institution and embraces the "Keep Portland Weird" idea whole heartily!
I have been to Portland a few times before, quite a few years ago but did not know Voodoo Doughnuts even existed back then. It wasn't until five or six years ago that I met some people that moved from Oregon and told me about Voodoo Doughnuts. They did not need to explain it very long. Instantly I wanted to go there.
Steven and I went on a train ride to Portland the other day. A 24 hour whirlwind tour of downtown Portland. We decided to keep our list of destinations small and simple so we could see our priority sites without getting in a wild race to get back to the train on time the next day. We both agreed that Voodoo Doughnuts was one of those priority sites that we had to go to.
We were overjoyed to see that the place was open 24 hours a day so we did not need to hurry. Even at 9 o'clock at night there was a line going outside the door but we figured that we were not getting the full brunt of the line since it was not during the day or the morning. 
Instantly Voodoo Doughnuts exhibited it's wild charms. Approaching the building and getting in line we could see their space that they occupied on the outside was painted in gold glitter on the bricks. Wonderful!
Voodoo Doughnuts only accepts cash so it is a good idea to bring some before getting in line. I think they have a ATM you can use on the inside of the store but don't quote me on that. 
Once we were inside, oh the choices! So much to pick from! I had to get a black Voodoo Doughnuts T-shirt in purple and green design and lettering. Steve said he would buy it for me. Happy Birthday! The cashier that got our doughnuts was bubbly and friendly. It seemed like she actually enjoyed working there despite the throngs of people constantly there. She advised me when I said I wanted a Large t-shirt that the sizes run small and that their shirts shrink some as well. So we went with an XL. Very nice to know! 
Now onto the dougnuts! I got the Mexican Hot Chocolate Doughnut under their Devil's Food category and the vanilla and coconut doughnut. Steve got the same vanilla doughnut and the Gay Bar which had Fruit Loops on it and filled with cream. All of doughnuts we ordered were great but I settled on the Mexican Hot Chocolate Doughnut as my favorite.  It had a wonderful complexity in flavor and tasted just like the drink with a nice touch of heat at the end of the bite.
We are definitely going back!
I read once about another Yelper that commented that Voodoo Doughnuts was too intimidating but all I can say to this particular situation from my own experience is

Go ahead Voodoo Doughnuts. Intimidate me.

Everyone loves this donut shop. It is one of Portland's biggest tourist spots because it's so famous. Because of this it is usually pretty busy, but that doesn't matter because the donuts are really good. There are a few different locations for it in Portland so if you are near one you should definitely stop by and get yourself a treat.

I ask you: where else can a vegan get a Chick-o-Stick donut and a meat eater get a maple bar with bacon on top? Okay, maybe the banana aftertaste in the vegan donuts gives away the egg replacer, but they are inspired. The voodoo donuts are "blood filled" and stuck with pretzels. They use things like grape powder, crushed up Butterfingers, or Cocoa Puffs as toppings. I want a place like this for every type of food - cool, clever, and with something for everyone.
Absolutely as amazing as everyone says! Not only great doughnuts, but the creativity is awesome!!
Here to pick up some donuts to bring home to raleigh NC.. The donuts are made fresh daily, they are open 24 hours a day.. A unique pink box.. Made to travel..

Believe the hype.  I may be a fat dude, but Doughnuts have never really been my thing.  If I lived in Portland, I'd be even fatter.  We got 5 doughnuts with the bacon maple as a well it was on food network choice.  IT WAS AMAZING!!! These doughnuts are legendary for a reason!  Long line at all hours, but worth the wait. If you are vegan, this may change your life...
love these eclectic, truly Keep Portland Weird donuts! My fav stop before the Rose Festival parade

I am not a doughnut fan. But when I finally tried voodoo doughnuts.. Ahhhhh i suddenly wanted to take it back! 

The line's ridiculous but its worth it! I love the bacon maple doughnut. Its to die for! 

They have a wide variety of selections that you want to try em all! Its a lil heavy but ohhh sooo yummmmy. Their dough is soooo soft it melts in your mouth!!! 

Make sure youre not on a diet when you buy a box of voodooo!

Got the Mexican hot chocolate and Old Dirty Bastard.  The cayane pepper on the outside was excellent and the Old Dirty Bastard was perfectly sweet.  The line is a little rough but definitely worth the wait.

The first day I approached Voodoo Doughnuts, I saw the line from a block away. It literally was like the line to an rollcoaster that wraped around and around. I left, not wanting to wait. 

But like Jimi Hendrix sang, "I'm a voodoo child baby, I don't take no for an answer". We wanted our doughnuts and we wanted them late night. Maybe it was the beer, but we were up for the smaller line and ready for it. BRING IT DOUGHNUT HUSTLERS! 

We made it up to the front and tried to concentrate as I'm watching the display of doughnuts spin round. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#NSiVdhdzHcfSz2IxMgZFnA, round and round, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#oZ2vcCjaWHGPaG5Rzny9ag, and round some more, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#Yk13SW2KgOr5fRKqVF0m2Q . Like the rollercoaster you were waiting for.

We ordered the Maple Bacon http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#3mS56lHr0b111xHTlDUZRA, Triple Temptation http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#Ydsq2F0BF2b73tukBZbM9Q, the Arnold Palmer http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#zhLAe4ajeUq8AEi93scKMw and the Old Dirty Bastard http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#7R_T7EZsnYYSA_NkOL3F-A. I also ordered a pair of the pink Voodoo Doughnut briefs, hells yeah. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=fsdnsh5IiFJHxYT0nVOUjQ#9hPhrWjHBzicChnThBL6VA

We had some for dessert that night with beer from Rogue and the leftovers for a pre-breakfast sugar jolt. They were VERY sweet, but cheap and tasty. Even though I don't eat many doughnuts, I'm glad I did.
Amazing amazing amazing is all I can say. Best Bavarian cream filled doughnut I've ever had. Worth the visit and wait!
What's not to love.  Creative donuts that are tasty.  Just wished there were more cash registers as lines are often brutally long.
We took some friends there from CA and they loved it.  I had forgotten how good they are.  Yummmmmmy!!

I'm socalian and missing voodoo donut right now- Absolutely my fav donut and the craving never be fufilled back in LA now- we care health too much so everything is glutenfree and baked- I WANT VOODOO!!!!! 

Mango flavor, portland cream filled one are my fav !!

I really wanted to try the triple chocolate penetration but they were out so I had the cock and balls instead. As I bit into the shaft, some cream oozed out. How fun! The taste was alright. Probably not the best TASTING donuts I've ever had, but definitely the most fun. The maple bacon was great, as I thought it would be, and the voodoo donut was filled with raspberry (or was it strawberry?) filling. Blood. I get it!!! HAHA. very fun.

My wife and I always make it a point to stop by here when we visit Portland.  Voodoo is more of an experience than just a doughnut at the end of the day.  My favorite is the maple bacon bar... I always explain this one as "if you like maple, if you like bacon, and if you like doughnuts, you will love it".  My wife loves the Cap'N Crunch one :)

It's in a hole in the wall and always has interesting characters hanging around, but some of the best places come in less than perfect locations.  It's not Krispy Kremes, but it's perfectly fitting to Voodoo.  If you're looking for some original doughnuts and a fun experience, this is the place to go.

A must on  your Portland visit! Not to be missed if you have a sweet tooth  Also great coffee next door at Cafe Vita. 
Cash only

What I'm about to say may shock you, but I stand by it: Voodoo is BETTER than Blue Star. That's right, hipsters. BETTER. Let me explain.

I've been in Portland for a week now and have tried several of Blue Star's flavors. I appreciate their concept...but really, only one of their flavors was really tasty to me. The others were throwaways (and I actually DID throw two away). 

To those reviews stating that Voodoo Donuts are "too sweet"...it's a DONUT, not a hoagie. Get over it. That the cereal on top is "stale"...I don't doubt this, but that's why I don't get the flavors with cereal on them. Everyone knows that cereals like Froot Loops and Cocoa Puffs go stale about 6.3 minutes after being left out. And to anyone that has mentioned the calories, I humbly request that you fuck off and get thee to the nearest vegan food cart. Clearly you don't "get" what donuts are about.

I appreciate that Blue Star is trying to elevate the humble donut into the gourmet stratosphere, but look, when I want a DONUT, I want a classic donut. I don't need an organic-lemon-with-poppyseeds-picked-by-blind-Himalayan-sherpas artisanal donut.

Enter Voodoo. Yes, they are over the top. Yes, they're in a shit-ass neighborhood teeming with derelicts. The cash only thing sucks. HOWEVER, the donuts are exactly what I want in a donut...overindulgent, sweet, cakey, perfect. 

My favorites? Diablos Rex (I want as much chocolate as I can possibly ingest in one sitting), Marshall Mathers (mini M&Ms over regular M&Ms ALL DAY) and the Ol' Dirty Bastard (plain raised donut smothered in chocolate frosting and Oreos,?drizzled with peanut butter...total heaven. ODB would be proud. He'd probably take his donut with a side of cocaine, but I digress.)

In conclusion...Voodoo is old-school Portland. Weird,  wild, funky, fun. Blue Star is new Portland: hipster, artisanal, put-a-bird-on-it, tasty. Both are good, but if you really want a classic donut, Voodoo wins every time.

AMAZING!
We went on a Saturday afternoon/early evening. The line was out the door, around the set up they have, and out onto the street. Surprisingly, I set a timer and from the moment we stepped in line, it took just under 30 minutes to get our order. It was well worth the wait. 
We ordered $6 donuts, at a total of $13.50. We got: 2 voodoo donuts (the jelly filled), 1 dirt (Oreo), 1 portland cream (like Boston cream), one bacon maple bar, and one captain crunch.
These were the freshest donuts I have ever had.They were even fresh and soft 24 hours later. You can literally smell them on the street! Every one of them was amazing!!! I would highly recommend this to anyone in Portland. 
I wish they shipped them across the United States because I would order them all the time!

Serious fun.  From standing in line next to a building built of sparkly bricks, to carefully snaking the waiting line so it doesn't block the door of the strip club next door, it's an experience you won't find in a strip mall bakery.

We bought a dozen (hand-selected) and took them home.  The surprisingly delicious one; a doughnut with grape flavored pixie dust sprinkled over the frosting.
Amazing for a reason. The flavors will knock your socks off!

now everyone has had a donut before, right?  but have you had a donut with rice crispies or cap'n crunch on it?  or bacon?  have you had a donut called the memphis mafia, butter fingering (teehee) or the cock-n-balls (more teehee)?  if you haven't, you're truly missing out.

voodoo takes donuts to "eleven", god love 'em.  everytime i visit friends in pdx, i make a special late night trip here.  i don't eat donuts anywhere else.  and they even have vegan ones.  bless you.

open 24 hours.  mmmmmm, donuts......
I love every voodoo doughnut. They're all so good. I don't think I could choose a favorite. All of the unique flavors are really good.
My friends and I were in Portland for 3 days and went there 3 times so we could try as many kinds as possible!! Best drunk food ever is the maple bacon bar!!!

I love Voodoo doughnuts and the smell wafting down the street would often draw me in. I know several people who do a friday night date night here on a regular basis. Ive come here again and again. Wish I lived closer... as the only similar place near me was just not the same as voodoo and has closed now anyway...  With weddings, and treasure chests full of doughnuts, and magic pink boxes, and doughnuts shaped like voodoo dolls and other crazy concoctions...  this is as much fun as you can have in a bakery. After the classic voodoo doll I think my fav is the vegan portland maple cream. yum yum.

I watched a show here once. They were crammed up above everyone on a high shelf above the bathrooms. The three of them were completely smashed together playing oddball instruments to a long line of doughnut-enthusiasts. People loved it. It fit the place completely. 

I like the Bacon Doughnut. This is nothing new. That's probably the only doughnut I can eat here, because I mostly go for the experience and not the doughnuts. It's generally the place you have to go to once. The neighborhood is hilarious and really messy. The lurkers are pretty intense and generally harmless. It's fun to eat doughnuts right out in front and talk with the random people who are also there.
Super awesome donuts 24 hours a day. Can't ask for more!

Woohoo, Voodoo!

You make me happy with your creative creations. Like ODB, Captain Crunch (with vanilla frosting which almost tasted like milk), Voodoo doll with raspberry filling, and Cock N Balls w/ creme filling. Hehe. You make me sad with your long waits outside that can reach upwards of 1+ hours.  You make me happy because you make my stomach happy. You make me sad with your long wait for the pink boxes. You make me happy because you're open 24/7. You make me happy because you're so cheap and satisfying. You make me happy because you're a donut.

You make me happy wins.

End.

On February 14, 2015 my wife and I renewed our vows here. Even though our anniversary is in October, we had to experience this. And what an experience it was. Coolest people. Fun atmosphere. It was something I'll never forget. The Voodoo gods gave us their blessings in front of the Isaac Hayes painting. And everyone on line witnessed this too. Oh. And the doughnuts were delicious.

Mmm... doughnuts... (Homer Simpson voice)

That pretty much sums this place up.

Doughnuts galore -- almost any variety you can think of, with creative names to boot. It's a must-see place when visiting Portland, and the doughnuts are pretty damn good as well.

You know I'll be coming back for more on my next visit!
Excellent variety of donuts from plain to creme filled to bacon topped and more. Really imaginative flavors. I hope to visit again next time I'm in town

How can you not love Voodoo Doughnuts!  Well, okay, the lines are long at all hours every day, but you know what...there is a reason for that:  The doughnuts!  And the lines move fast because they have a system to get your through them.  And if you don't have cash (Voodoo is a cash only business) there is a handy-dandy ATM machine inside.   It is hard to get out of Voodoo with just one.  We always take our out of town guests there and they are delighted.  The doughnuts are crazy.  Crazy names, crazy combined flavors, and crazy good prices.  All in all, if you are in Portland and you miss Voodoo, you have really missed.  Voodoo is only missing one thing...they do not have a bride and/or groom t-shirt for sale.  Their bride/groom doughnuts are crazy good and crazy good looking!  They need a t-shirt to match for keepsake!  Why haven't you thought of this, Voodoo?
I like to go in early before it gets crowded (usually before work). Grab a few donuts and I'm a happy man starting my day. Don't know what to add except that this place is awesome.

5 stars for the range of donuts/doughnuts and the experience of the line plus the walk around the area getting there!  If you want a smaller line and more family friendly location try the store in Eugene.

I was visiting Portland this past weekend, and these donuts were CRAZY good. I don't understand the weirdos here giving this place two, three, or four stars. Please, jerks, tell me about your magical five-star donut place? That's right, you can't.

Quirky spot, yummy donuts and a HILARIOUS saying. If you hate long lines, go on the weekdays. The line during the weekend is just ridiculous. The donut names are an absolute hoot and the tastes are unique in a delicious way. Out of the four donuts I bought, the Loop was my favorite. Mainly because I love cereal and Fruit Loops are coloured bites of unadulterated sugar heaven. If you are a bit more Plain Jane/James and not looking to go into a sugar coma, go for the Portland Cream.

Random tip: Look up when you enter. There is a giant bitten donut hanging from the ceiling.

Oh man, I wish Seattle had a Voodoo Doughnut. A coworker I used to work with in Portland would bring in these doughnuts to work every once in a while and they were gone within minutes. They have funky flavors and toppings. I remember one doughnut had fruity pebbles on it! They are so creative with their doughnuts and if you are ever in Portland you have to go to Voodoo Doughnut!!

I'm not a sweets person. I don't like cake. I don't like chocolate. I rarely eat cookies, cupcakes, or donuts. My child on the other hand is a sweets fanatic. Donuts being his ultimate, favorite sweet treat. So naturally, when I brought him to Portland for the first time I had to take him to the infamous Voodoo, where the magic is in the hole. I had to take him, in fact, each of the two mornings we spent exploring downtown Portland. 

We loved the shop. (Photos to come.) Its very urban feeling with lots of posters and bumper stickers everywhere. Amazing wall art. Rotating donut displays. Fantastic fun staff that makes you feel like, of course these are the best donuts you're ever gonna put in your suck. Even the donuts themselves are fun enough to make you want to try every single one. Of course we try the Mable Bacon Bar, the Voodoo doll donut, the chocolate chocolate, the Bubblegum, and several others over the course of a few days. Lucky our first morning was like on a Wednesday because the line was short and the donuts fresh and the next day it was only slightly busier. Let me say that starting the day with donuts makes eating ANYTHING the rest of the day a major challenge. 

I guess you could say I like this place. As far as donuts go, these are ace. Of course, only as a rare treat for myself, having Voodoo Doughnut donuts would be pretty amazing. Definitely the funnest donut place I've ever tried!
I've heard so much about this place that I had to come check it out while in town. Amazing corner doughnut shop. The crazy selection of doughnuts is so out of this world.

Delicious! My husband and I were beyond impressed with their doughnuts. The BEST maple bar I've ever had in my life. We stayed in Portland for two nights and bought two dozen doughnuts... they are THAT good. The only bummer is having to wait in line. BUT it is definitely worth it. I wish Portland wasn't a 3 hour drive!

Amazing doughnuts ... So creative ... I had a chocolate peanut butter with peep cookie ... Really flavorful ... I asked the cashier for her recommendation and she said it was her favorite ... Even just the donut without topping was delicious ... and it was hard to just get a bite of donut without topping because the toppings are so generous.  A can't miss Downtown Portland eatery!

Voodoo did not disappoint this LA girl! Top 3 donuts ranked: 

1) voodoo donut 
2) maple bacon 
3) the one with the oreo on top (forgot what it's called) 

I also tried the grape ape (not a fan), no name donut (pretty bland).
The Oreo peanut butter one was amazing! We also liked the captain crunch one.

Loved it - I was almost nauseous from all the sugar I had!   I have to say that my heart goes out to the many homeless that frequent this store-front area, and I could tell that the employees had a heart for them too, in a quiet/discreet manner.  A bit pricey, but tasty and unique donuts.  Fun place to visit.

Standing in line at Voodoo Doughnuts, waiting to fill up a pink box of your own, is a tradition in Portland. We were not ones to buck tradition. 

We first stopped by on Sunday afternoon. The line was well out into the street and we didn't feel like waiting that long.  Our hotel was close enough to enjoy the 24/7 convenience so we came back around 8 p.m. 

After 20 minutes, and one encounter with a clever homeless man (his sign read "Spaceship low on fuel") we made our way up the the counter to make our selections. 

It's really impossible to choose just one donut, so we got a box of four. Even that really wasn't enough to satiate us. I don't think you can go wrong with anything they have to offer. We got the traditional Voodoo (chocolate with raspberry filling), one with white frosting and Fruit Loops on top, one glazed with raspberry filling and (the best) one with Rice Krispies, chocolate and peanut butter. Everything was good, even the next day. I couldn't leave the box alone. I had to be picking at it constantly. 

These are just good donuts. And props to Voodoo for keeping prices reasonable. We appreciated it.

oh my gosh...i couldn't stop cracking up while we were here. the menu is so amusing. the donuts are a throwback to the days of carefree youth. it's very crowded and busy. so be prepared to wait in line and sometimes get heckled by a homeless person. the wait staff is as eccentric as the place. my boyfriend devoured the maple bacon bar. i had to come here after it was featured on the food network. it's an experience but i could live without it. which is good because i live in socal.

I went here thinking it was more of a tourist attraction than a place for a decent doughnut - but I totally underestimated them.  I have a love-relationship with doughnuts - because I actually love them SO MUCH that I find myself constantly frustrated by the fact that most dougnuts in the world are so pathetic.  So I'm not a fan of Voodoo because of the crazy flavors or the merch or the vibe (don't get me wrong, I think their slogan is pretty brilliant and I do like the punk rock grit of the place) - I love Voodoo Doughnuts because they're freaking delicious.   They make the absolute perfect glazed doughnut, which  is one of the greatest things in the world.  and I will definitely wait in line, even if that means waiingt outside,  for these little pieces of heaven..

So whether or not the novelty works for you - remember that they're doing the most basic things right.  So even if you think it's too cheeky to use bacon and candy, or if it offends you that they celebrate the magic in the hole - you should probably get over it and just enjoy an awesome doughnut already.

Really had fun standing in line for donuts.  You would not usually say that would you.  This is the tourist thing to do in Portland and we did not want to miss out.  Bought 11 donuts for 2 people and ate them over the next three days of traveling.  Go early in the morning to avoid the really long lines but go.
Great location but outside seating at original storefront is occupied by street people hustling or gleaning. It's a hassle

This is a touristy staple in Portland and worth a visit if you've got a sweet tooth, or are just feeling like making everyone jealous of your pink box on the flight home. My favorite is the dirty Oreo cookie, but other great choices include any with cereal on top (as fresh as possible), chocolate cake with Butterfinger, grape and bubblegum. Take the kiddos and freak them out with the original Voodoo Donut ;)
We got 13 free donuts here, we couldn't pick them however I have never in my life gorged so hard on donuts...it is amazing, and a true Portland staple. Fun decor too!

How often do I go to Portland, OR?  At least once every 5 years (unless the baby decides to go to college somewhere in the PacNW).  So, it looks like I have to wait another 5 years to try the maple bacon bar at this highly toted, quite bizarre donut hole-in-the-wall that's open 24 hours for those out of towners not quite acclimated to the time change.  The baby went bonkers over the Dirty Old Bastard donut.

So I visited my cousin in Astoria and we drove into Portland and the first place she took me to was Voodoo Doughnut. I'm so glad she did. We got a box of amazingness right away. The actual voodoo doughnut was sweet and delicious, but my personal favorite was the ODB. Definitely wish I had more time to try every single option they had. Amazingly fresh and unique doughnuts of all kinds. You're definitely not going to find another doughnut place quite like this anywhere else in the world. They have some interesting items to buy as well. I got a pretty cool mug that says the magic is in the hole. I would suggest going and getting a box to try while exploring downtown, it's quite an experience.

Cons: It is a pretty small building and once you get inside it's a little cramped especially because it's so colorful and interesting you're going to want to look around while you're there. That and there's always a line wrapped around outside. Can't say I blame them though.
Get the giant glazed one!  Waay good.  My family got a variety of the basic rise ones which cost about a buck a piece.  Be ready for a 15-20 minute line if you go before 2 pm.

You know this was on the list to hit up, When you're out here! The decor is beautiful, Staff are wonderful and Donuts are delish of course! The menu is out of this world but i love it! Out of all the donuts, My friend chooses C***and B**** lol... It was BIG! Voodoo Donuts is not stingy!
Introduce you one of my favorite doughnuts, voodoo doughnut, is so cute and yummy! Can't refuse its cutest appearance and tasty filling! Every time I came to Portland, this is a must buy task!

During my February weekender to Portland, the first thing I did was hopped off the Boeing plane and drove towards Voodoo Donuts. The reason why I frequented this joint was because of the endless recommendations I got. But I had no clue how famous and popular it is! Once I got there, there was a long line out the door at 9pm! Voodoo Donuts is featured on Times Magazine as one of the top ten things to do in Portland. Furthermore, it is featured on the dessert episode of "Man v. Food." And I learned on that episode is that you can satisfy both your sweet tooth and wed your honey at the Voodoo! This is just lovely. 

At my first destination in Portland, my ChemE partner-in-crime and I ordered three donuts - Memphis Mafia, Voodoo Doll, and Napoleon. All three of them were gigantic and deliciously magnificent. Memphis Mafia is a chocolate banana fritter that is to die for. It is my absolute favorite "donut" ever. The Voodoo Doll is good as well, but I'm slightly more attracted to the doll's adorableness than for its taste. It contains a yummy raspberry jam filling and a pretzel stick in its heart. The Napoleon is like a normal donut - nothing too extraordinary. 

If I were to visit Portland again, I would most definitely swing by Voodoo Donuts for a quick snack. Despite the long line, you can get in and out of the place with in 15 minutes. Currently, I'm somewhat craving the Maple Bar as Host Adam Richman of "Man v. Food" raved about it. Additionally, I'm curious about the Bacon Donut, despite the fact that I don't eat bacon.

Best doughnuts I've ever had! We got there around 9:30pm. There were plenty of people eating outside, but no wait in line. I think we just got lucky. I am glad that we walked 2 miles to get them! 
The Portland Cream: Delicious! 
The Maple Bacon: To Die For! 
The Bastard: Put A Fork In Me I'M Done!!!
Man this place is like Steroids for Doughnuts!  Holy Cow, the Choices and how over the top these goodies are!  Wow, it is so Worth it!
Voodoo is consistently delicious and the people working there are always friendly. Good prices and great donuts! I don't mind the tourists.

I came here a few years ago.  At that time, I don't remember it being open 24/7.  You can imagine my excitement and delight at 10:30 PM when I discovered that it wasn't too late.  True, it has been years since I last relished an old dirty bastard... but what intrigued me was two donuts I hadn't seen last time: 1) coconut guava jelly filled and 2) hibiscus.  We got the last ones that were left.  WOW! The flavors and innovation surely must have been inspired by the success of flavors from Blue Star!  Well, whatever the reason for the creativity, I want to say "you brought your A game and I thank you!"

Arrived in Portland on a Monday night and decided to check this place out on Tuesday morning for breakfast. Glad we did, there were no long lines just a few people hanging out checking out the place. We ordered a dozen of doughnuts. A few captain crunch doughnuts a few voodoo ones and so on. Plenty of space out back to eat at the tables. Doughnuts were delicious and best of all we still had time on our meter to go check out the keep Portland weird sign across the street and other things downtown. Will definitely come back next time I'm in this gorgeous city

After seeing this on Man vs. Food I had to stop by before going home.  Got there and the line was pretty long, but it didn't discourage me.  It moved pretty fast though which was nice.  

Outside there are a couple photo opps, first with the wonderful sign, second with the cool glittery brick walls and the cool things posted in and around the shop.  

Once we got inside, the woman that helped us was patient with us and had no problem explaining all the different flavors and fillings.

First bite = yum.  My favorite is the oreo and the voodoo dolls.

DO IT! You won't regret it.  Just make sure you aren't allergic to voodoo magic!

I realize this place got all hyped on Food Network, but that's not the only reason I went. I am a doughnut expert and I always end up at a doughnut shop in whatever city I'm in, because I LOVE DOUGHNUTS and these, well...I must say, are absurdly good! Apparently the place stays busy 24 hrs/day. We went at 8:30am on a Sunday morning and waited in line for about 20 mins, but I was so busy reading the menu and trying to decide what I wanted, that the line went by pretty quickly. I got the Portland Cream (all Boston cream doughnuts should aspire to be this good!), the Voodoo Doll (yummy berry filling inside and a LOT of it), Maple Bacon Bar (ridiculous!!!!!!!!!!), Tang Doughnut (has mango filling....what????....so good) and Old Dirty Bastard (cookies, chocolate, PB, and other stuff you can't go wrong with). All the chocolate is like a chocolate ganache, it's delicious! I was so sad when I had to throw away that pink box....This place was so good and I hope I get to come back to Portland in the future, cuz when I do, I am making a B-line for Voodoo doughnuts!!! 
Btw, they only accept cash, but there's an ATM machine like 20 feet away from the place!!

Yeah,  the hype is real...

Get up there and get you some...

Mad props to the waaaay sketchy porn theatre next door

Love stopping at the local favs when traveling and I couldn't help but run in for a second time in the last week.  The first time we waited for about a half hour to grab our donuts.  This time we ran in during mid afternoon and bo one was actually in line!  Total luck!  Donut was great, local people outside and down the road were a bit sketchy, but polite and just part of the local environment.
This place is awesome. They should have more locations across the city or at least other places that carry their doughnuts. Excellente!

I never realized what I have been told was a doughnut was total bullshit until I had a doughnut from here. Dunking doughnuts is a joke, and if someone from this shop ever wants to be a zillionaire they need to move to NJ and make these doughnuts over here. My life has been forever altered from this doughnut experience.

Really yummy! The doughnuts are cheap and tasty! It's a small shop though so chances are your going to have to stand outside in the rain. But it's kind of worth it! I got the old dirty bastard... It had chocolate frosting, with Oreo, and peanut butter. I also had a cake doughnut with frosting and sprinkles! Yum! I want to go again before I leave for the airport!!!

First timer! I've heard so many great things about Voodoo Doughnut, had to stop in while passing through! They have SO many options! I got a few different Vegan doughnuts & they were amazing esp the coconut one. I also got some cereal doughnuts for my mom she loved them! The staff was very friendly & pretty quick. Everything is decent priced as well

It was just FUN!  Creative crazy doughnut designs reasonably priced.  Woman who waited on me was fun; wore theatrical make-up.  These may not be the greatest doughnuts but I'm glad I went and had that experience. Makes me smile just thinking of it.  Nice memory.

These are really good donuts.  Everything tastes fresh.  I've been dipping my bacon and sausage in syrup for 20+ years so I knew the maple bacon donut was for me. It was delicious. If I could only choose one donut it would be the maple bacon. Cheers to VD on the perfect sweet and salty combo.

This is cash only! However, they have an ATM conveniently located inside. The staff is very friendly! It's all smiles at this place. I have to be honest. I haven't had a doughnut in 2 years. It was worth the wait! Ask the staff to make a recommendation, and take it! Delicious and beautiful to look at!

I had to write a review, I love doughnuts, I love Voodoo. I cant understand why people would knock off stars because there is a line, who's fault is it that you waited in line?!?! 

Yes they are open 24 hours.....unless they sell out.....which they often do. But they make more, and then they are open again. I know it may be hard to understand that they are so awesome that they sell every last crumb of doughy goodness, but, alas, it is true.

Is the service spectacular? No, generally the staff is actually not very friendly at all, but they don't really have time to be friendly, right? There are 80 people waiting in the friggin rain, beating off pan handling bums, swatting flies from the near-by garbage cans, and making sure none of the patrons from the adult thater next door are trying to make an upskirt movie starring them. They have to work quickly to get your magic in the pink box and move you along.

Yes the shop is small, but take a look around, if you don't have a sense of humor, and you are offended easily, just go to Winchell's, this isn't your grandpa's doughnut shop. There is easily enough crap hung on the walls to keep you entertained while you wait for your turn.

Does it stink outside on a hot afternoon? Yes. Not much I can say about that....

The doughnuts are not loved because they are the best doughnuts you will ever have, it's about the experience, its about standing in the rain, or the hot sun with the smell of a port-o-let that hasnt been cleaned in a hundred years creeping in to your nostrils, just so that you can feel that much better about eating something that you might usually deny yourself. 

Its not about the doughnuts, its about the magic!

Oh, and eff the Maple Baconator, its all about the McMinville/Portland cream, and most of all the Cock-n-Balls, come on! My mom even said it was the best cock she ever had!

All in all, it is kind of a bitch to get a doughnut from here, but that makes them all the better. The challenge makes the win that much sweeter!

great apple fritter. Greasy/crunchy just like an apple fritter should be. My go-tos are blueberry and chocolate bavarian filled.  They have endless flavors, and the maple bacon bar is good but u gotta be in the mood as that is one rich donut.

We passed by here on a Saturday around 2pm and heard someone announce that the line was a 2 hour wait, so we came back the next morning at 7am and barely had to wait at all! -- under 10 minutes. I was skeptical of this place because of the hype but ended up being pleasantly surprised. We ordered the No Name, the Portland cream, a plain and a peanut. The fancy donuts were all right, but the plain jane Plain and Peanut cake donuts are where it's at. These were the BEST cake donuts I've ever had. So soft and decadent. Also, for being such a touristy hot spot I assumed that these donuts would be incredibly overpriced but we got 4 donuts for $6.50, which I think is more than reasonable.

Before I even read any of the other reviews, I knew the comments would be something along the lines of 'over-hyped', or 'over-priced', or the line was too long.  You'll either hear that or 'you gotta go'. Often from the same people.  Well my experience was great.  Either I'm just lucky or I've found the perfect strategy.  Step 1 - Stay in a hotel down the street.  Step 2 - walk down to VD either on a Monday or Tuesday night, on a slightly cool, slightly wet night. Step 3 - don't get weirded out by the homeless folk along the way (they're all very polite). Step 4 - behold the short line and rejoice at the sight of many delicious doughnuts. Step 5 - GET THE MOCCA DOUGHNUT !!!  Step 6 - Get a maple krueller. Step 7 - Aw what the heck, get another doughnut ... maybe the Tex-ass.  Step 8 -  walk back to your hotel. Step 9 - eat your dang doughnuts. All of them!  You won't be able to help yourself.  Step 10 - fall asleep from a sugar-induced stupor, wake up at 4am realizing you fell asleep in your clothes and with your contacts still in. Step 11 - work off your sinful doughnut excess, go about your day, and then repeat steps 1 through 10.  Oh yeah,  did I mention ... GET THE MOCCA !! Yum!
Absolutely Portland Weird but very good donuts, good vibes and good place to pick up chicks in weird clothes.

WHAT! Voodoo on the eastside? It's true!

Voodoo just opened a new (extremely spacious) location on the eastside near the nearly as famous (and keeping a little of the grim we love on the westside over to the eastside) Sandy Hut. All those pink boxes in the window . . . and the tiny delivery truck . . . what could be better?

Hours are still nebulous.
Better than the hype and worth the wait no matter how long the line!

I've only ever had them once, on a business trip to Portland last year, and I curse the day.  Because I must think about these damn donuts on at least a weekly basis.  SO GREAT!  I'm desperately hoping one will magically open in Dallas (though this city is probably not nearly cool enough to deserve one), so I can have the choco pb one again.  Voodoo deserves to rule the world.

Voodoo Doughnuts is a wonderful place despite the wait on some nights.  I agree the place is over-hyped but it does have an interesting variety of donuts. My personal favorite doughnut is the Voodoo doll because it has jelly inside and it has chocolate. 
These donuts are better than Krispy Kreme donuts and it is worth the price payed because there are so many different kinds of donuts to try.  To the people that complain about the line there are other locations and it is best to go there when nobody else wants to go so you can avoid the nuisances in-front of you. As a local from across the river I am giving this place a high review because the donuts are delicious, it is clean, the Food Network has endorsed it and they have multiple locations if you do not wish to wait that long.

30min wait - great shapes and spread of flavors --- crazy sugar blast. 
Tried the Oreo, Maple bar and a huge Apple
Fritter

I came here during my visit to Portland with my goth friend. She loves the voodoo doll donut but I didn't understand if she was actually trying to harm someone. Cause she's goth. But I let it go. I am a Christian I don't do voodoo or black magic , that's a scary thing. I also noticed they have a cock and ball donut. I can laugh at that cause I'm getting married lol maybe I can buy one for my shower ?thank you !

Things I Have Purchased a Voodoo Dozen For:
*Potluck contributions
*Emergency Donut Parties
*Last-Minute Birthday Present
*Study Group Contributions
*Give A Hobo A Doughnut Night

Each time, eight bucks well spent.  

Favorite flavor: The Arnold Palmer
Least-favorite flavor: The ones with stale cereal all over them

I mean, it's Voodoo, what is there bad to say? Nothing. That's what. 
We drove from Everett, WA to get their famous doughnuts and did not leave dissapointed! Bought a box full to bring home and they where gone very quickly. So excited to live so much closer! Will be back!

Is it bad if I say Voodoo Doughnut was my favorite part of Portland??  

This was my first... and 5th... and last stop in Portland.  They were just TOO good.  I've been on a bit of a donut kick recently and Voodoo definitely fit the bill for what I was looking for.  

Though I didn't try their famous maple bacon bar, I don't eat bacon, I got a chance to try their Voodoo donut, the Chocolate Oreo and Peanut Butter donut (the old dirty bastard), and the Captain Crunch donut (captain my captain.)  All were delicious but the Chocolate Oreo Peanut Butter will seriously haunt me in my dreams.  So fresh, so fluffly, so peanutbuttery and chocolatey...........excuse me my stomach is growling. I'm almost thankful that I don't live in Portland because I can guarantee I'd be here standing in line everyday eating their donuts.  

If you're in town, just go.  Remember to bring cash though!
Delicious!  The line moved much faster than anticipated - worth the (short) wait.

If you're in Portland and cool with hitting up touristy spots then this is one of the place to visit tourist or local. All their donuts are very delicious and very creative with the many different ingredients. A favorite of mine is the maple bar with the bacon and the orange tangerine one. Even after a few days the donuts stay moist when most tend to feel dry and stale. I would recommend coming here early in the morning and there would be no lines. Going during the day, there will be lines but it goes by pretty quick. The place is open 24 hrs which is great. A definite must visit even with all the tourist lines.

It's sweet to have family think of you on their out of town trip w/ souvenirs or pics from the trip. But in my case, it's literally sweeter when they come back with donuts from Voodoo Doughnut in Portland, Oregon http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=cvB9RJlUHR5mSXv3zF9ZaA

LOCATION: Yeah...Portland, Oregon close to intersection of W Burnside Street (Hwy 30) & SW 3rd Ave or check out the map http://www.yelp.com/map/voodoo-doughnut-portland 

SHOP: Considering I didn't actually visit the location, the 3pgs of photos for this place are more than helpful!

*** courtesy shots ***
Store front http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=yFtcNks9Z80FQaT5_kEUWw
Found Matt G *tee-hee* http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=aHzcLcCCZu_fMepDA2pIOg
Donuts http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=G4JReTnZSzxcWgps9gcCLg
More Donuts http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=z7WVtztVG9F6ysuHj_wdxA

SWEET FAMILY LOVE: My sista & cousins went out of town for several days to Oregon & Washington. I don't know if they heard about Voodoo Doughnut from Food Network, Travel Channel, or locals, but glad they did & brought some sweets back for me on their flight home ^_^ 

Ridiculously XL Glazed Donut Hole
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=2z5mpsnBLUN9QVbvxGoebg
Voodoo Man Jelly Filled Donut ...funny, when I bit into him & realized filled w/ jelly kinda looked like I just murder him w/ the red ooozing from the inside
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=B6o_ZaoOcFi9WA7nx3vjVw
Cock & Balls Custard Filled Donut ...fyi I did NOT make that name up either
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4CxF8c3MB7VAdY8zFb2cZQ?select=C-OE1vHoaNVxyb-XVPDgvg

OMG RIGHT THERE, YEEES!: Now reflection of taste, SCRUM-DIDLY-UMPTOUS! Donuts were crazy thick & soft, jelly was sweet & I look for the seeds in my jelly... not much of a custard person but the custard was pretty damn good, & the chocolate icing was nothing like I expected. Not just sweet chocolate icing, but OMG thick...like melted Hostess chocolate or something. I mean I laughed to myself when I bit n2 the Cock & Balls, & of course I bit the head 1st...only to see white custard cream in the middle =o These donuts were a surprise on 1st site, & more of a surprise after 1st bite. Pleasureful all around! Visiting Portland, Oregon in the future...stop in @ Voodoo Doughnut ;-)

By far the best doughnuts on the planet.  I can't even complain about standing in the rain for 15 minutes while waiting for my turn at the counter, that's just part of the experience as far as I'm concerned.  The maple bacon bar is my personal favorite.  I brought family members from Denver to Voodoo last year and they were stoked when they found out they are opening shop in Denver.  This place is a must while living in or visiting Portland.

This is always a fun place to go. Voodoo Doughnut's aren't any better than other doughnut places but it's such a Portland Staple and landmark that anytime we have visitors from out of town we take them there.

Some times the people working there are super nice but most of the time they are brusque and have a bit of attitude. My favorite doughnuts are the Homer Simpson ones. Also the Chocolate clair ones are pretty good. My little one really likes the Voodoo Doughnut with the pretzel. He more likes to play with it than eat it but it makes him happy. Their cake ones are also pretty good.

Okay, I'm a tourist and was in town for a wedding. My friends were getting married at voodoo donuts. Although it was already hyped up in my mind from TV spots. I was disappointed to see the line so early, but dang........2 words - MEMPHIS MAFIA!! 

It's really the best Doughnut on earth. I challenge you to recommend better. The maple bacon bar was pretty good too, but there is nothing on earth that can compare to the Memphis mafia. 
Next time I come back to Portland, I'll be trying the Mexican hot chocolate, but for now I'm crying over not having the Memphis mafia here in my home town. I miss you doughnut....
Best donuts hands down! There is a line most of the time to get in so be prepared to wait. It is in an eclectic part of downtown and is always interesting to people watch so the line is not that bad.
Best doughnuts in the country!  Love the decor, love the idea that you can get married there, love the ostentatious names of the doughnuts,  and love the doughnuts!

We waited in a long line in sweltering heat but it was worth it. The options were amazing, the service was great, the prices incredibly low and most importantly, they were the best donuts I've ever had. We really enjoyed our visit. They sure know their stuff!

Amazing, creative, punk-rock doughnuts. Yay for the originality....The long lines say it all: People love voodoo doughnuts, and they are not afraid to wait for it! 

(But, a drive through, or pay by phone, pick up at window service would be amazing awesome, Voodoo Owners!)
i don't know if their doughnuts are worth standing in a line for 45 mins but it sure was exciting!

I'm extremely impressed with the young African American man, Justin, who works here. He is ALWAYS so friendly and goes out of his way to make sure his customer service is top notch!!  He is cordial, colorful and full of positive energy.  Oh, yeah, great donuts too!

Dirty Bastard and a Bacon Maple Bar. Mmmmmm....
Worth any line to get these.

What more can I say?  Anybody who comes to Stumptown, who happens to love doughnuts and not bound to any dietary restrictions, has an obligation to make a pilgrimage here.  Then again, I do not, truth be told, have an affinity for doughnuts.  I don't salivate like Pavlov's dog everytime I walk past my neighborhood Top Pot.  However, like love and the English language, there are exceptions.  This place happens to be one of them.   Whenever my husband and I have visited, we always go early in the morning to avoid the queue of people that can stretch around the block.  No, thank you.  It was worth it to make the bleary-eyed trek to this location on our most recent visit, which happened to be a 10-15 minute walk from our hotel.  

As for the doughnuts themselves, I can only speak for the few that we've gotten from past visits:  Voodoo, Bacon-Maple, Cock and Balls, Memphis Mafia and Portland Cream.  The first two are a must, especially for first-timers.  The third is sheer novelty in name and size--not being cheeky at all when I say that!!  I recall the MM being very sweet and filling, but if you are addicted to peanut butter like some people are addicted to crack, this is the doughnut for you.  The fifth because it looked cute.  (Don't remember the reason, but it was probably good.) Overall, they were tasty in terms of texture and sweetness (sometimes a little *too* sweet), but I am no doughnut connoisseur.  

After eating one of these beauties, I made sure I paid for it both in the gym and on the pavement.  Whoohoo!  I regret nothing!
It's a punk donut spot. I loved it. I split a maple bacon bar with a homeless addict, we enjoyed it.

This place is a magical must go place. The doughnuts are not your standard doughnuts and that is what makes it so amazing. If you ever drive through Portland or are visiting be sure to make time for Voodoo. A lot of time there is a giant line but it is definitely worth the wait.

If you're in Portland you HAVE to make a stop at Voodoo Doughnuts! There's such a huge variety of doughnuts, from cake doughnuts to bacon maple to jelly and so on, there's bound to be something everyone is interested in. I noticed they had quite a few vegan doughnuts as well. We ordered a pack that came with a t-shirt, stickers, postcards, and a dozen doughnuts and it was definitely worth it!

I'd been told that this place was overhyped so my expectations were pretty low. Came on a weekday so there wasn't a line! Got the hibiscus (raised), raspberry romeo (glazed and filled), and blueberry (cake based). The raised doughnuts were amazing!!! SO LIGHT AND FLUFFY, literally eating an airy pillow. The hostess recommended the hibiscus and raspberry because they were less sweet and she was so right. Very nice balance of flavors and tartness. The blueberry cake one was meh, very dense and lacking in blueberry flavor, but I also don't like cake based doughnuts so I'm biased. 

Just a heads up, there is no seating and it is veryyy hot inside.

Voodoo Doughnuts are a Portland staple food...Maybe not a food one should eat daily, but they are definitely a treat whether they show up on the conference table at work on Thursday morning, or if you stop in for one (or two) after a show at 3 a.m. on a random Saturday night. 

By all means, DO NOT wait for them to magically appear before your eyes! Make the trip to 3rd Ave and enter the tiny shop to select the fried delight of your choice. Choose from the unique shapes and flavors available; personally, I'm a fan of the peanut butter and chocolate cookie ones. 

Last time I was there, they accepted cash only. Oh, and make sure you check out the photos on the wall as you wait in line!

Is there really any doughnut better than Voodoo? I think not. Yes, there are lines and yes, it can be pretty hectic, both inside and out. But do you know what that tells me? That this place is everything and more. Visitors and locals alike will find a doughnut that they'll love at Voodoo. They're open 24 hours, so you have no excuse not to come!
Even though the line was crazy long, the guy working there was very nice and patient, and here's a shocker, the doughnuts were great!

Thank goodness I had cash on me as they while they most certainly put the, "voodoo", on donuts...they gots none for credit! 

Ok..on point...I am not prone to write reviews for one visit but man... once there and what Disney is for kids....that is what Voodoo Donuts is for the doughnut lover in me!!! 

Memphis Mafia Doughnut is the most creative I have ever eaten and so big that had too split it between two meals!! Thanks for terrific experience Voodoo Doughnut guys!

SW

I Love Voodoo Doughnuts!!! I am So. Lucky. I don't live in Portland. Lol
They are Absolutely worth the wait~ so come with the mindset to wait for at least an hour, and remember that it is CASH ONLY!!! 
The Dirt Donut (yeast donut with vanilla frosting & crumbled oreos) and the Bacon Maple Bar are my fav's, and the hubby's fav is the Grape Ape. The Apple Fritter is probably the best I have ever had, and the Memphis Mafia is something to try once; I recommend  tag-teaming it.

I don't even like donuts, honestly, and yet here I am. If your reference points for donuts include Dunkin Donuts and Krispy Creme, you'll probably need to create a whole new food group. One that rocks.
I know I did.

This place is a tourist destination in downtown Portland. You aren't there for only some yummy creative doughnuts, but the popularity of this low cost spot is a place that is a must-see location.

Made a cross country journey from Arizona to Vancouver and this Doughnut shop was on the way. Once coming there we got to see the port on the way over as well as walking downtown after we had parked. We got to see some of the street life and local businesses. 

As for the experience, once getting in-line we met some friendly tourist that resent design an art exhibit at the Portland art museum. They share with other other locations to check out not only in Portland, but on a way to Canada with other must see locations.

Once finally making it to the cash register I ordered 'Rappers Delight' and was charged $4.20. (: inside was a fun yet busy environment. Opening the pink VooDoo doughnut box was defiantly work the price and experience.

I don't really like donuts. There, I said it...now, let me review this place. I have heard about the mystique that surrounds the Voodoo Doughnut (henceforth referred to as VD) but had never had the pleasure of being a patron. I spent a good 20 years of my life with the VD name sprinkled throughout conversations of 'you have to try', 'have you ever had', 'man, they are so good'. Then I saw people getting married in this place on a Food Network show, met the maple/bacon bar over the airwaves, and whilst living 3,000 miles away, started to crave a donut. That I don't usually like. 

On my most recent trip to Portland we came upon the VD down an alley, with a pink pill shaped sign and a zombie with a steak in its heart, while going to the Portland Farmers Market. I was sold. There is was. Calling to me. No line, just the VD. When we approached the building, however, we were greeted with quite a long line and a 40 degree soggy PNW day. Thinking "it'll die down" we went about our business and returned a few hours later. Still with a line, but obviously worth the effort, we stood and waited for donuts. 

The line was pleasant. Not a phrase I am accustomed to proclaiming, by the way. It moved fast, the building shielded a bit of the cold, we were stationed outside the 'Keep Portland Weird' sign seen in Portlandia (and on the streets of Portland for those who are more familiar, of course), a funny man selling the homeless newspaper cajoled people in line--making them laugh with his sales tactics---, and the donuts were ahead. 

Less than 30 minutes later we were inside with a plethora of combinations to choose from, good smells, happy (if anxious) people waiting to try or get something their palates were craving. I decided amongst the stimuli which included pink walls, unique lighting, and crazy decor...I had to write (err...type on my iphone) our list. Otherwise we would appear (accurately) as VD virgins who were holding up the show. 

I made a list and handed my phone over. Five minutes and one large pink box later, we were out of there. Nearly a dozen treats to delight a little later in the day...though I would have loved to sit and try one right there, it was getting cold. I also regret not trying the Stumptown coffee, but I was in a bit of a rush to get the donuts and forgot about the classic companion. 

Of the donuts we got, the cereal coated was the least admired. I prefer dense, uncomplicated donuts, and also coconut, so I tried the vanilla coconut, a chocolate coconut, and a Mexican hot chocolate variety. All get thumbs up, with the Mexican hot chocolate being my favorite for the kick and surprise it provided. Yum! 

There were cream filled, jelly filled, bar shape, round shape, and colored concoctions in the box. So far no one has complained. 

As someone who would not claim to be a donut fan, these are well done and quite tasty. They are fresh, flavorful, and interesting. All good things. 

After all this writing, I think I'm going to rummage through that pink box to see what remains. Try the VD....it worth the wait, and your taste buds with thank you. 

Also, avoid the real VD by practicing safer sex, and have a nice day ;)

There are certain bites of food that make you close your eyes and say a silent prayer to the god of your choice. I pray to the god of round desserts with holes. Yes, the maple bacon roll is everything you think and more. I honestly don't think you need another reason to come here, but fine.

You might want to get a little drunksy at the nearest bars. They're open late, and it makes the sugary fat taste so much better. Then dive into the Cocoa Puffs donut. Or Cap'n Crunch. Or...hmmm starting to drool on keyboard.

I have been training all week for the "Tex-ass" challenge: Eat this huge donut in eighty seconds. Really? That's all? I could do that in my sleep, after an all-you-can-eat buffet at the Golden Corral. Bring it.

Long line and also worth the wait! got some crazy doughnuts of all different shapes and sizes! It appears to be over rated but, its a good nitch in Portland! Waiting in line really can from the looks of it stay the same length the entire duration of the say however, when we went around 1:00 and left at 1:45 was not the longest, the line stretched well into the other end of the road going the opposite direction of the place. However while standing in the on and off rain as well as getting harassed by the drunken homeless standing out side just put more pressure on us to stay in line! The doughnuts them selfs were amazing even though they are just doughnuts they do have Voo-Doo magic giving them a great taste and thats only half of the rating, the other half is the looks! The looks are amazing as well not giving you something that doesn't look how it did in the display case is never fun, however these looked identical to the display so no worries there. The moral of this review, they tasted as good as they looked.

I think I've been putting this review off because I want to do it justice... so here it goes:

The key to avoiding a line is going early on a weekday morning. The infamous pink box will be in the arms of many patrons as they complete their transaction. You will be chomping at the bit, but it's worth it's weight in calories.

The smell of breakfast entices you to move forward in line, even though your brain is telling you to run far away from the epicenter of anti-diets. Make sure you read the chalked billboard menu before you reach the front of the line, because locals know what they need and will be in a hurry. As a heads up, there will be choices for both vegans and carnivores alike.

My personal kryptonite is the Old Dirty Bastard (with chocolate frosting, Oreo pieces, and peanut butter)! Other doughnuts I could not live without = Bacon Maple Bar and the Maple Blazer Blunt. Yes... I'm a sucker for anything "maple" and delicious.

Thank you for selling a large variety of vegan donuts. I live in a liberal enclave in the south, and there are no vegan donuts to be found. Not even Whole Foods or Trader Joe's offers them. 

Please come to the south, the home of Krispy Kreme, and put them out of business with your superior product.

CASH ONLY! I love this policy since it stops AmEx and Visa from charging high swipe fee charges. They do have an ATM inside though..

Donut places that dont take cards means a good donut shop usually.

I still think Do-Rite and Dat Donut in Chicago are the best but I did love the donuts I had here when visiting a friend in Portland.

I did really like the best the Tang donut. I had a cruller type of donut and a buttery cake donut and both were decent.

Good stuff.

Many annoying people hassling you on the street however.

This place is awesome! Fun decor. Good music. Originality. And most importantly tasty ass doughnuts!
