I had the mini m&m and also a Rice Krispie/peanut butter/chocolate. Hit the spot! Definitely a place to visit!

Not usually a donut person but I've found the donut for me . Try out the Portland Cream Vegan styled. Really tasty .love that they offer vegan donuts it's really great . 
Also have tried the Chico stick vegan donut too . Mmmhhh so good and crunchy with the soft donut
My depression over lousy donuts in the US is over. Long live VD!
Get the Bacon Maple Bar, the Mango Tango and the Old Dirty Bastard! Make sure that you visit here after the Downtown Bars close!

VEGAN DONUTS FTW

they weren't only the best vegan donuts i've ever had, they were THE BEST DONUTS I'VE EVER HAD. they melt in your mouth.

Best doughnuts in Portland! Omgawddd i came here before my flight back to Oakland and i'm so glad i did! Even brought some back home to the fam bam and they enjoyed them just as much as i did. I first had tried blue star when i arrived and they did not hit the spot... too dry and tasteless. For the price, i thought they should have been bomb.com but they are nothing but hype. But damnn Voodoo doughnut i see you! Bomb.com in my book! Soooo fluffy, soft, and delishh... Believe the hype!
Creative genius culminating in sugary sweet perfection! The best things do come in pink boxes Virginia!

I was visiting Portland for a conference and had to go here. The Voodoo doll Donut will change your life! Really delicious and modestly priced for the amount of food you get. I think I waited in line for about 40 min or so, which really was not that bad. Well worth the wait to get your weird shaped donut fix!

Best donut ever!  This is the original location near Chinatown and is just so much better than the Davis street location.  I originally didn't think there would be a difference and headed to the Davis street location to avoid the long wait, but was disappointed.  The chewiness of the donut was slightly different and there was more greasiness to the Davis donut.  

After single-handedly eating over 3 dozen donuts from the original location and about 6 from the Davis location, I think I have a pretty good idea that the original is worth the wait.  I may give the new location another try to see if they were just a bit off that time.  

Oreo donut, maple bacon and old dirty bastard donuts are still my favorites.  The crunch of the oreo in addition to the chewiness of the dough is the perfect combination.  (Another reason the Davis street location let me down is that the oreos had NO crunch :( and the bacon was no as crunchy either.)  The cake donuts are pretty darn delicious as well and have a fluffier texture than most.  YUM! 

Definitely a 5 star donut for still tasting good at the end of the day.
The bacon maple is not probably the most healthy donut of choice, but you got to get one just once to say that you did it. It's sweet!
My favorite doughnut shop anywhere. They are always fresh, soft, and have the best flavors and creativity. Keep in mind they are just doughnuts, but they are the best doughnut shop out there.
Totally worth the wait on a nice day! The 'nuts are surprisingly cheap and the staff is super friendly and has a sense of humor.
i can never seem to get out of here without that whole dang pink box being full!! I love that little voodoo man

This place is just as good as everyone says it is. The lines are almost always a major pain, but you just deal with it.

The ODB is killer but my favorite is the voodoo doll with jelly. I got one with three heads one time which was extremely trippy. They have a ton of tees if you're in to that.

Cash only!
World famous!! Came all the way from NC & Jenn & I were not disapointed. We plan going back a few more times while we are in town. The only con is cash only no plastic.

i used to think i wasn't really a doughnut person.  
now i have just three words that have turned me around forever.
fruit.
loops.
doughnut.

all the doughnuts at voodoo are good, but it's the creative toppings and flavor combos that turn even a mild "doughnut, schmoughnut" into a ravenous monster that cannot be quelled by anything other than vanilla frosting and crunch-berries.
Best doughnuts I've ever had. You have to go early in the morning to beat the lines. There are never lines early and the mango doughnut is the best.

What is there to say that hasn't been said already about this wonderful place??

Voodoo Doughnuts has become one of the biggest local attractions for Portland, and rightly so. The store is open 24 hours and has a constant line of people waiting to buy that ensures doughnuts are always freshly made and delicious. 

What really sets this place apart from others is the huge variety of doughnuts and the flavors/toppings. The Bacon Maple Bar is absolutely the best, with tasty strips of salty crunchy bacon atop a thick layer of sweet maple goodness. 

I also adore their Voodoo doll doughnut, a raised doughnut shaped like a doll, filled with raspberry jelly and dipped in dark chocolate. So good!!

On Friday night the line was at least a half hour long. I returned Sunday morning to find that the line was only ten minutes. Also, CASH ONLY. The store has an ATM but I know some people don't like getting stabbed for extra fees.

I happened to be here when the line was relatively short so finally got to try this.  The voodoo doll donut tasted like a regular, decent chocolate topped and jelly filled donut except super^3 cute.  Totally kicka$$, concept but I still would never wait in line for over an hour for this or anything, really.    Still, I can see why this place is so popular, would be awesome having these cuties for parties or just to brighten your day.  I also really liked the cinnamon cruller --- very fluffy and light.  I prefer subtle and not heavy or over the top sweet and this was just perfect.  Was not adventurous enough to try the bacon or cereal crusted donuts but they sure are interesting concepts and would be fun to try even if they are not my thing.

what can you say! GO GET DOUGHNUTS at this shrine 
there was no line the day I visited but I saw pink ropes for busy days
friendly girl let me ask about the doughnuts going round in the glass case
big donuts little donuts purple donuts 
and they are all yummy
they will gladly make custom decorated doughnut cakes amazing with a capital A

I really don't know what else I can add to all the great Yelp Reviews that are already here. All I can say is the Maple Bacon Bar is even more amazing then I ever could of imagined. It might be one the greatest things I have eaten. 

If you're in Portland you have to go!

Do I have to review this place?  It is VooDoo doughnut!!  Doughnuts are great and great funky vibe. Always a long line outside rain or shine.  Outside of this place maybe weird, but that is what makes this place so unique. It is okay to have some big greasy food once in a while. :)
bacon maple bar and peach fritter, awesome.
A Portland staple - had to give it a shot.  Fairly short wait on a Sunday morning (15 min?) and fun, fresh donuts.

Voodoo doughnut is a big hype in Portland. Because its so popular, i was afraid that i was going to stand in a line for an hour or so, but nope! I've walked by twice and on both occasions there was maybe 1 or 2 persons before me. Also, the doughnuts are actually really good! Very fresh, big, and a big sugar rush. So yeah, it definitely lives up to the hype.
Even after the novelty wears off, the donuts stand the test of time. I love the creativity in the process as well as the richness in the flavors. Haven't had a bad one yet.

Perfect punkrokk donut shoppe serving such delicacies as the VooDoo blunt and the Arnold Palmer. Of course the baconmaple stick is the best thing since cough medicine. 

Must try this at home.

My brother in law who is from Oregon told me to stop by here at some point during our trip to Oregon.  The reviews are mixed and you see this shop in magazines all the time in the donut rankings, but we wanted to try it out!  He mentioned to know what we wanted before we go in, and he was right, although it doesn't seem like they have descriptions of all of their donuts online, they need to have that!  Yes, the customer service could be better, but I get that they want to get people in and out as quickly as they can.

We stopped in to Voodoo on a weekday evening probably around 6 or so, and only had to wait inside in line behind probably 2 groups, so not much of a wait!  We ordered three donuts - the bacon maple bar, dirt doughnut, and the no name doughnut.

They were all great!  My least favorite was the no name doughnut - doughnut with chocolate frosting, peanut butter, and rice krispies.  I noticed the peanut flavor more than the chocolate, so I was wanting more chocolate, but this was my husbands favorite!  We both liked the bacon maple bar, the maple frosting was awesome, but my husband felt it needed more bacon or the bacon to be chopped up so you get bacon in every bite as a huge chunk would come off if you had a bite.  My favorite was the dirt doughnut with oreos and vanilla frosting.  Loved it!

I wish we would have had more time to stop in again because there are so many interesting flavors - they really need a sampler!  Maybe next time!

The really only negative, is that it did not seem like it was in that good of an area, on the side of sketch, beggers out there in full force, so we got our donuts and quickly left.

Excellent donuts, I sampled:

The bacon donut - Excellent.  The bacon isn't too salty, and I think they add some maple, this donut worked very well, and I thought it was a smart choice to not use a chocolate icing.

The dirty donut - Possibly my favorite.  It's covered in crushed Oreo cookies.  

The voodoo doll - I should have eaten the bottom first, but even if I did, I was a little dissappointed.   It was still a decent donut, but I wished the top had filling as well as the bottom.

The Fruit Loop donut - This donut looked interesting since it was covered in Fruit Loops, but the Fruit Loops were a bit stale, which made the donut just OK.   

Based on the first two donuts though, I was very happy with the donuts I ate, and I ate them as much as I could.

Can not go here enough! there are some fantastic donuts here, my favorite being the caramel bacon bar! it is a absolute must have! There are two locations one downtown and another just off Sandy which is the one I have gone to. If you are visiting from out of town you must stop here for some fabulous donuts!
Amazing donuts!! One of the best I've ever had! Tried the lemon filled powdered doughnut, the peanut butter oreo, coconut double chocolate! They were demolished in seconds! Highly recommended!

I ate so much sugar at this place that it literally made me sick. But was it worth it? Hell yes!!! I loved this place. Can I go back?
FYI: If you go late at night, the line is not as bad.

Love it, love it, love it. We go every time we are in Portland. The maple doughnut is by far my favorite. But the Elvis one is good too. Actually, I didn't find one that I didn't like. There are some sketchy ones that I can't believe people actually order. Like the one my brother ordered for his kids with nasty colored cereal, but to each his own I guess. It is a cultural experience as well as culinary one. You can stand the line. Get over yourself.

It may be an over rated tourist attraction but my god these doughnuts are delicious.  I always get the Voodoo Doll which has chocolate frosting and raspberry filling.. yummmy.  Recently I tried the maple and bacon doughnut and it was actually amazing!  I highly recommend that everyone at leasts tries Voodoo while in Portland!

Be warned though Voodoo does not take credit card- CASH ONLY.  You will regret not having cash after you've been waiting in line in the rain for 20 minutes.

YUM YUM DONUTS!! Our last tourist brunch spot in Portland before we headed back to New York. A must-do AGAIN when we're in the area. 

- Bacon Maple Bar tastes like pancakes, maple syrup and crispy bacon on a donut!
- Mango filled donuts tastes like peach mango pie filling (from Jollibee's) in a scrumptious moist thick donut with an awesome frosting on top. 
-Capn crunch berry donut tastes so sweet that you might have a toothache from all that sugary goodness.

Well worth the wait. These donuts are truly the best you can get. It is so funny comparing their price to Dunkin Donuts. For less money, you get a far superior donut at Voodoo. I love the pothole, cookies & creme, Capn Crunch, and maple bar. Make sure you have cash, a good parking spot, and shoes that are sufficient for an hour or so on line.
Best vegan donuts on earth Be sure and come early or on a rainy day, if not be prepared to wait outside in line for 15-30 minutes. Also they only take cash.....

We were visiting this week, and everything I read said that you have to go here, but don't get too excited, because the donuts aren't anything special.  We went in the middle of the day on a weekday, and still got very fresh donuts.  The old fashioneds were SOLID - better than several places at home.   I was glad we went here.  (If you are watching calories though, this place isn't for you.)
Awesome specialty donuts and as unique and weird as Portland.  Must stop place.

Memphis Belle is perfectly awesome...banana fritter drizzled with peanut butter and chocolate!!?? These doughnuts are not only creatively visual but old school tasty!! My kids love going...have fun with it and BE A KID once in a while!!

So much hype around this place that at 11:30PM, there was still a long line out the door. Damn, people really want their donuts. After craning our necks to see the menu outside, we finally moved from the outside line to the inside line. It smells AMAZING. Granted, I was also suffering from the munchies and really wanted some doughy goodness ASAP.

Ordered the maple bacon, portland creme, cock and balls while my friends ordered more of the same along with a sweet mango tango. Overall, all of them were amazing, melt in your mouth donuts. I was afraid some would be too overwhelming in flavor (ie the mango tango), but Voodoo really goes the extra mile to make sure their donuts taste perfect and don't bog you down for the rest of the day. 

I'm not local to Portland, but I'd definitely come back when I'm visiting again.

A great place to go when you get that craving in the middle of the night for an iced donut with captain crunch on it. If you are really hungry you can get the Tex-Ass donut. I love this place, I have vistited it many times with my friends. The cock and balls is deliciouse! hahaha... It is a great place with kooky donuts. They also have vegan donuts!

"The magic is in the hole" is an understatement - it's in the delicious aroma of fried dough wafting all around the block, it's in the golden-glittered brick walls, it's in the glass-encased carousel of a display case, and it's in the eyes of the blue-haired, nose-pierced girl behind the register. If you're patient and have a couple bucks, you can put all that magic in your mouth. MMMM. 

Plus: Stumptown coffee on the premises! No need to add cream and sugar, it's perfectly brewed. 
Minus: Voodoo is open 24/7 but I'd aim to visit during the day; doughnuts can get slightly stale towards the evening.
Favorite: Old dirty bastard. 
Must get (if only for the novelty): Voodoo doll. I'm not usually a fan of filled pastries, but the raspberry filling is surprisingly balanced, not too sweet, and reminiscent of raspberry preserves.

I heard about VooDoo Doughnut way before moving to Portland and always intended on checking it out, mostly for novelty sake. Goofy eats, quirky help and constant reminders on the Travel Channel.  Even Anthony Bourdain gave it a thumbs up.  From what I have heard, Tony still has flashbacks to the Maple Bacon wonder.

Well the hype is true.  VooDoo is more than a doughnut shop; it is a shrine to the sublime,  a temple to the taste buds, and Mecca for the fans of this culinary masterpiece. A trip to VooDoo on your first visit is more like a pilgrimage, a wonderful convoluted combination of Portland Hipster culture and a true 5 Star doughnut experience.

Describing VooDoo is a moving target because it is a constant state of flux where the owners never are satisfied with conventional wisdom and relentlessly pursue the unique and the delicious.  Every visit to VooDoo is, an essence, a flipping of the bird to large corporate doughnut chains that forgot why they got in the business in the beginning.  Sure, Krispy Kreme has a wonderful assembly line approach to cranking out the crispy critters.... and they have heart.  VooDoo doughnuts has soul.

Trying to capture the essence of VooDoo is like digging a hole in the sand in the beach.  Just as you start digging, the waves crash and hole you were digging magically fills up.  The magic is truly in the hole.  Embracing the existentialist nada, every day is filled with great opportunity and unlimited possibilities.  Do not fear the whole.... embrace it my friend.  Embrace it and never let go.

The line was long but clearly worth the wait. Was told by Native Portlanders that a trip to Voodoo Doughnut''s was a must do. Cool Concept with great doughnuts.  Nothing better than a Half Dozen glazed doughnuts at 1am.

Voodoo Doughnuts is the REAL happiest place on earth.  I used to wake up at 4 am with a jonesing and go for a run (which of course, ended here with a cocoa puff encrusted chocolate donut and some Stumptown.  Mmm, Stumptown.)

Last I checked (which is last year - before I had a kid, which has ended my 4 am trots to the donut shop) they were cash only and gave you pitying looks if you asked for decaf.

Favorite donut shop in the entire world! I adore this place and all it's strange delicious goodness. I gained 5 pounds last time visiting and plan to do the same next time I visit. The Easy Peasy Lemon Kesey was my favorite hands down. Although every one I sampled was heavenly. Easy parking, nice staff, loooooooong lines.
The Maple Bacon bar is the best Doughnut ever!! This joint is great for that late night munchie or that morning when you just need a great start.

Donut shop that's open late, is near bars, and has vegan donuts? What else could you ask for?

Last time I stumbled through this place my friend picked up a pair of panties that said "the magic is in the hole."

I guess that's one way to raise the bar. NOW what else could you ask for?
Haters be damned- I've been to a ton of donut places in Portland, and these really are, in my opinion, the best. Dense, sweet, creative. Skip the bacon maple, get a McMinnville cream instead!

Hipster, cash-only donut bar with eclectic music that hosts good donuts. Wish they did gluten free, but the dough is soft and moist, and the filling and glaze are sugary goodness. Attracted by tourists this place can get packed quickly. A must try in Portland.

Saw this bakery on the food channel and said one day I'll leave Hawai'i and experience this place. I saw a maple bar with bacon on it!

Well, a few months later work took me to Oregon and I went to voodoo.... mentioned that I saw the place on the food channel and showed my Hawai'i ID and I got a free jelly glazed donut on the house!  What cool people these guys and gals are. Excellent service, excellent presentation, their products and pure sweet love!!  Amazing, simply sweet fucking perfection. It was a privilege to experience voodoo.  Major respect!

Amazing doughnuts. Couldn't decide, so got a dozen haha. So far all have been delicious. I love that they're always open! Best doughnuts ever and made the trip to Portland so worth it! Now excuse me while I have a sugar coma and look at the box for which one will be consumed next!!
Delicious way to spend your calories! They work 24/7 too.
Pretty much a sweet tooth heart attack waiting to happen!  Delicious and one of a kind.  If you come to visit make sure you bring these things home to friends!!!

Went on a Friday morning - no line! This is a must-visit place if you're visiting Portland. The doughnuts are great and the atmosphere is like no other! The cashier was very helpful in narrowing down our choices and gave rest recommendations. The doughnuts were very heavy so we just got one each and I could barely finish mine! Sooo good!!

The magic is in the hole. I am from Seattle & in my recent trip to Portland experiencing fresh Voodoo doughnuts was the highlight of my trip. I felt like a pig ordering but literally I think I promised every person in my life that I would bring them back a doughnut- I bought 2 dozen of goodness. Bacon Maple, Voodoo doll, captain my crunch, Cock N balls, triple chocolate penetration.. those are just the ones i remember- literally every single donut that i tried from the box was just perfect. I've never experiences doughnuts as good as Voodoos- Krispy Kreme can suck it!

Went to voodoo after having a late dinner and drinks at Kell's. Was surprised and excited to see that they are open 24 hours. Practically no line when we went at 11pm. Couldn't decide on a donut so we got the you pick dozen which means the staff picks for you and you get a great variety of classics and voodoo specialties such as the triple chocolate penetration (chocolate donut chocolate frosting cocoa puffs). All of the donuts were fresh and the taste lives up to their fame. I had a "bite" of most of them that night. Warning that they only accept cash!

Have I been here? Well you could say that. When you land in Portland, you learn about and visit several places in the first few week.  You even end up some places as if a vortex swirled you into their epicenter That is Voodoo donuts. If you haven't somehow wondered in, go get you chocolate peanut butter captain crunch froot loop goodness!

VooDoo is an awesome place.  Although service is sometimes faster on the east side of the river, nothing beats the experience downtown.  This place is 'tourist friendly' - and we love taking our out-of-town guests there - it gives them a great taste of the Portland Zeitgeist.  

Of course the doughnuts are awesome as well - I think they must inject them with some secret awesomeness - they really can't be beat. We have taken VooDoo to friends in Texas - and the next time I go to New York I'll be taking them there as well.

Whether you're a local and just want awesome snacks - or a tourist and want to see how much of what you've heard about Portland is true - you have to stop here.
Lives up to the hype. The highest-quality doughnuts we've ever tasted, and inventive designs that make you sorry to eat them. Patrons actually pull out their phones to photograph the offerings.
The line looks intimidating, but it goes by fairly quickly. This is such a photogenic place and so fun and quirky. Obviously, a Portland destination. Make sure to have cash on you. It is cash only.

Got a special order from here with a unicorn center piece I was asked if I would like anything specific on it I mentioned it was for my birthday and they could go crazy and let me say they didn't disappoint they went above and beyond what I imagined I almost couldn't bring myself to eat it since it was so beautiful all the donuts were delicious!!!!! The dough is beyond any other donuts I've had and I'm quite the fan of donuts so I've had a lot! The store itself is clean welcoming and in a nice area I loved all the decor so nice I'm not from portland but will definitely be driving up a few times a month to get my voodoo fix !!!
So yummy, wish there was a closer one to where I live now
Really nice donuts. And half a dozen is good for 2 people. The place is cash only, so do not forget to bring cash along, unless you don't mind paying extra for the ATM.

I have never had a vegan yeast donut until now. The ambiance is crazy and fun, but it is loud so be aware. The line was fairly short and moved very fast but I have heard it can get crazy-long. I asked the clerk to recommend the best vegan donut in his opinion and he said the Peanut Butter and Jelly. I don't really like Jelly but I went for it. I was not disappointed. It was fluffy, soft, nutty and delicious. The only thing I regret was I ate half it and and put the rest back in the bag for later and forgot it in the bathroom at The Yardhouse.

Would definitely go again if I didn't live 10 hours away.

While visiting Portland we had to make a stop at the original Vodoo donut! The line here can get very long and I would recommend going later at night or VERY early in the morning. The building its self if very small and had a lot of bright colors. The staff is very friendly and they love helping people pick out what is good. I would recommend going to a Vodoo if you are in Portland. They 3 locations but If you want to wait in the long line to say you have been to the first one I would recommend doing so!

A Portland classic that we refused to miss on our first trip to the city despite the huge line.

The doughnuts are pretty good, but the vibe is obviously what people come for and I can't blame them. Hilarious menu, fun staff and good doughnuts.

Three words:
Legen-waitforit-dary.

Worth the hype, this place is amazing, some of the best donuts I've ever had in my life. A must stop in Portland, perfect munchie food after a night of bar hopping. I recommend the voodoo doll donut, the no name donut, and the bacon maple bar. Definitely deserving of a perfect 5 stars from Hit and Run Travel :)

A long line, but they move it along pretty quickly. Do not plan on ordering vegan donuts based on the menu, just ask from the start what they have available. The first three items that I asked for they did not have. Overwhelmed at that point I got a plain chocolate, plain maple, and the peanut butter oreo. OMG the peanut butter oreo donut is freaking amazing. The best I have had. The maple was okay and the plain chocolate I could have gotten anywhere, but the oreo peanut butter combo was freaking amazing!

Surprisingly tasty donuts! Mexican chocolate was wonderfully warm with spice. Front Loop donut is everything you love to hate, sugary, carby, fluffy goodness. Happened to go around 11pm in a weeknight and a guy was painting a mural, super fun!
Omg.  These. Donuts are really orgasmic.  The penis donuts actually taste delicious with the yummy chocolate and the special cream.  Def worth the wait
AWESOME!  Worth every weird experience that comes with Portland's downtown corridor.  The lines are long for reason, it is that good.

OMG and LOL in my experience there's no other place like this.  I brought my wife and kids by late one weekday morning and the place was packed!  Packed!  When we left it was busier than when we arrived.  Crazy.

This is the premiere do-nut spot.  Imagine a smaller well lit head shop-like corner spot that looks like it might be on Bourbon Street with club music blasting your eyes as you try to take in the rotating tower of fare and you're t/here.

The only thing that could enhance this might be somehow adding burlesque.

Hell yeah I want peanut butter, rice crispies and chocolate on a doughnut. I don't think I need to say much more than that. 

Oh yeah, it's cash only.

Sometimes you just have to go places that you see on TV. I'm a sucker for a food network experience.. and don't lie, I know you are too ;) I just never want to be disappointed... and in this case... I was not.

I was warned that the line would be long. It was about 15-20 people deep, but since were there about 3-4 I think that time frame helped the line issue. And it went quickly ! 

Their options are creative and amazing. I love Portland, and places like this make me love it even more. It's almost hard to choose from their selection because everything looked delicious. So I chose three and had the person helping me choose one. The one that stands out is the mango jelly filled donut. It shouldn't be legal to make something that delicious and refreshing. Seriously. How does that exist ?

I'd definitely suggest going. Pro tip. Go at a weird time. And get enough for a snack and breakfast the next day ;) because you'll want more once you finish one.

I don't really like donuts, but Voodoo is one of the coolest places I have ever been. Saw it time and time again on the Travel Channel on various shows. Finally got a chance to check it out while on vacation in Portland Fall 2009. My sister and I wandered over there after leaving the bar one night and got a dozen of Voodoo pick. We ate those donuts for the rest of our several day vacation, and even stale they were still kick ass good. 

In our mix, we had a glazed crawler, Capt. Crunch, Coconut, another glazed, some kind of chocolate glazed cream filled, fruit loop (my favorite), M&M, an orange one, an oreo, powdered sugar, one I can't remember nor identify, and a few other plain-ish type ones. They were all awesome. 

My sister went back and got a maple bacon another day, but I'm not a big fan of maple. She loved it though.
I haven't had a donut in 20 years.  I ate a vegan peanut butter and jelly and truly thought I died and went to heaven.  Good thing I don't live here!  I'd be there all the time.

Although overrun by tourists on our midday stop, we were pleased to find that Voodoo lived up to all the hype and was not a mere tourist trap. Plus the vegan friendly options and the patio seating perfect for the dog were huge pluses!

Heavenly Circles of love..... Little halos brought down to keep my tummy entertained with obscure toppings and imaginative designs. 

First time walking in Voodoo with all the hype to push me in I was not let down one bit.. To sit and stare at the illuminated cylinder of ringlets left of the counter and decide only one was the hardest part about my journey. Each packed pastry to the next appeared both appetizing and odd all at the same time. 

Could I get a donut with a pretzel sticking out of it that had been stabbed into this little Voodoo Doll and still manage to sleep tonight? Of course the answer is a resounding yes! Man, was the little guy good and filling!! Oreo, cereal, bacon, custards, creams, candies, jellies, jams, the list goes on and on!!! Even if I chose the road less traveled and succumbed to veganism Voodoo would be there to comfort me through my trials of lacking meat, dairy and dare I say it... cheese as well... Come one come all, big and small, Carnivore, as well as herbivore! The Magic is in the hole... and waiting for you to consume these spherical delights!
Wish they didn't have a line, the bacon donuts are awesome...my favorite are the captain crunch donuts!
What more can I say than it is VooDoo Doughnut.  A go to spot every time we come to Portland.

There are so many things I could write about this but I will keep it simple.  Went  around 7 pm...the line wasn't very long...tried many and all were so delicious....staff was pleasant...that is all. 


As a tourist the only negative think we encountered is down the street there was an extremely large homeless population (prob about 40 people hanging on one block) who kept begging for our donuts, money, booze, etc.  It was dark and I could see some people being frightened by them.
makes me wish i lived in portland! maple bacon was aawwweeesssooommmmeeee!

4.5 stars 
Awesome hipster/eclectic atmosphere!!! Very sugary and perfectly raised dough... Maple bacon. Gluten free hubby HAD to taste as well!!!
The selection is very overwhelming. And I wish they had simple maple on a glazed donut. But the sugary maple glaze more than makes up for it!!!
A little pricey for donuts (almost $2 for some!!) and cash only!!!

Better than Blue Star on a bad day!
The No Name is my favorite!!! But I'd eat them all!

Fun place.  Worth checking out.  We were entertained by the doughnut names and designs.  Tasty too.  Cash only so keep that in mind.  Not going to say it was the best doughnut I have ever had because we have some yummy ones in LA that are low key. That being said, we waited in line without complaint and had fun making jokes about the names.  Both of our teens insisted on bringing the rest of the dozen to Seattle with us so must have been pretty good.

Voodoo Doughnut is an experience, from the building exterior with a unique sign, lavender theme and bricks painted with rainbow glitter, to the large variety of doughnuts of different styles with witty descriptive names. We enjoyed The Loop (covered with marshmallow frosting and Fruit Loops), Viscous Hibiscus, Mango Tango (frosted, Tang-dusted, mango-filled), Guava Colada (frosted, tender coconut-covered, guava-filled), Bacon Maple Bar because bacon makes everything better, Voodoo Doll which is a must-have, and the Memphis Mafia which is a huge cinnamon banana fritter with cinnamon, peanut butter and chocolate drizzles and chips. Delights and sugar highs await... you gotta love sweets!

As soon as my friends found out I was in Portland they insisted I visit Voodoo Doughnuts. Let me just say it put a spell on me.  Where I live, in the land of plastic, we don't have that many donut stores, let alone donut stores that I feel compelled to write odes to. We have a 24 hour donut place in my neck of the woods but the flavor is no where near the intense pleasure I got from Voodoo donuts. Hi, I'm Christine and I'm a sugar-holic. 

Voodoo doughnuts was my first stop when I arrived in Portland. (aka PDX by the locals. Fine, I call my land The OC, so we're even). When I arrived the line wasn't bad, since it was drizzling out, or maybe I just got lucky?

The pressure to choose which donuts I was gonna have was intense. NOTE TO OWNERS: I wish there was a menu posted outside so I could be thinking about what I want before I stepped in the door.  Choosing just a couple donuts from 90 on the menu cranked my anxiety level up to 11. Some reviewers left notes about the service. It's a Doughnut Store, people! The girl that helped me was great, she took the time to find me the right size of shirt, and knowing I was a tourist, she even asked me if I wanted a pink box. I don't expect 3 Star Michelin service in a doughnut store. (And it's not like the employees were like the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld.) 

I chose the Portland Cream, a Maple Bar, Chocolate Cake and the Peach Fritter. The Peach Fritter is like an apple fritter, except, well, you get it. Slightly crisp on the outside and soft, melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness on the inside. Then, to take you completely over the edge, they cover it with luscious white frosting. I was in a complete sugar and carb coma after I ate it, but it was the best doughnut I've ever eaten!  I seriously had to restrain myself from not eating all of my sweets at once, but days later, the Chocolate Cake doughnut still tasted awesome. 

My theory is that not only do these people REALLY know how to make yummy doughnuts, but the fact that they are making them 24/7 means you get the freshest donuts possible. 

The names of the donuts are risque, so I'd advise that you not take children in who can read the menu and have any bit of smarts about innuendo! Need a dozen donuts for a Bachelorette Party?  Then the "Cock and Balls" are for you.  Over-the-Hill party sweets for an aging man?  How bout the "Old Dirty Bastard"?

Decor inside is twisted. No really. Don't forget to check out their T-shirts. My teen son LOVES his shirt with the Voodoo Doughnut logo. 

I can't wait to go back to Portland so I can go back to Voodoo Donuts.

A total must if you're in Portland. The line is long but the staff gets everyone through quickly. It helps if you have your cash and order ready. We tried a lot of donuts. Of course we got the famous voodoo donut with raspberry filling. And we got the Oreo donut and the maple bacon donut. I also insisted on the pin15 donut with creme filling. That one was a great photo op :). 

I liked all of the donuts but the next time I go I will just get the voodoo donut (my fave). Even though we got 4 donuts they were all huge. We were cutting them into pieces but we still had leftovers. Definitely recommend!

Merry Christmas to the VooDoo team.  Christmas Eve (around 10) they handled themselves really well with a full line of people and some really loud CRAZEE dude who wouldn't shut up.  

Staff was fun and friendly and donuts were terrific, especially the Bavarian Creme with white frosting and a blue snowflake!

Thanks for topping the night off.
heaven in a donut. and they are coming to denver. just go. and their vegan donuts are amazing.
Best creativity when it comes to coming up with doughnuts keep Portland weird for sure

Haters gonna hate. Is there a more polarizing business in Portland than Voodoo? I think not. 

I feel as if you need to judge Voodoo on a different level. You should understand that in terms of pure doughnut goodness, Voodoo will not get top marks. That is not their shtick. This is not some old man who has made doughnuts for 50 years and slowly perfected them. If you want that, you can find that elsewhere. This is a hip, trendy place that serves creative doughnuts. Part of the fun and excitement of going to Voodoo is that you can get 'alternative' styled doughnuts. I feel that if you combine that with a reasonable amount of good taste, then this place deserves 5 stars. There's a reason it has 3000+ reviews.

I think people are just bitter about waiting in a line. There is another location, yanno.

Go! It's worth the wait. I was sad that they advertised some souvenirs but they were out and did not note that on their boards. But that is splitting hairs, I was there for doughnuts and those were by no means disappointing. They were pretty cool about my dog being in line and hanging lot as we waited for sweets. This was an awesome stop.

Let's be honest.  No trip to Portland is complete without a stop at the famous Voodoo Doughnut!  Whether you saw it on the Food Network, the Travel Channel, read about it here on Yelp, or got a rec the ol' fashioned way (i.e., word of mouth), you know you'll find yourself there, patiently waiting in line, debating with your friends as to just what kinds (and how many!) doughnuts you'll order.

The question then becomes, how do you avoid waiting in an hours-long line to get your hands on a precious maple bacon bar?  Easy - Voodoo is open 24/7 - so pick an off hour, and hope for the best.  Our group mosied up around 9:30 p.m. on Memorial Day, and were pleasantly surprised to find a line of only about 20 people.  We made the queue, and patiently waited for about 20 minutes or so.

When we finally entered the sacred pink storefront, our senses were overloaded.  What to order?!  What to order?  We opted for a do-it-yourself dozen, which included the famous maple bacon bars, a raised oreo ring, some good ol' glazed, a Bavarian creme, and some assorted others.  There are no price breaks here - each doughnut is individually priced, so our dozen was about $24.

While the maple bacon bar was phenomenal, I have to give my "personal favorite" vote to the oreo raised ring.  It was sweet but not too cloying, the doughnut was light and airy, and the oreo crumbles gave it a nice crunch.

An important thing to remember - Voodoo is cash only - so come prepared!

Quite well known, this is yet another must-do in Portland. I have gone here several times, there is normally a line winding out the door. No one seems to mind the wait because the product is worth the wait. Served in a beautiful pink box these donuts are one of a kind. The donut artists are quite imaginative as they decorate each donut. It is so much fun to take home a dozen donuts, they will all be different, sit around the table and cut each donut in enough pieces so everyone can get a taste of each. Next try to decide the best donut, kinda hard to do cause they are just that good. Enjoy when you visit, I always do,!
What do I need to say. The peanut butter fritter is my favorite! ! Knock over a couple people to get in line and go now!!
Awesome and amazing experience.  A must see if you're in downtown Portland!!! I recommend the maple bacon donut!!!

Spending time with my wife and two little boys on road trips. My family have to drop by Voodoo Donuts, since its popular on Yelp, and decided to give a try. We are so lucky the time we went there were no lines built up yet. Once we got in couldn't image of all value customers has built up so fast and waited just to get a Donuts. Voodoo Donuts, are so yummy and you get the feelings and taste are so different then others regular donut shops. My family's, loved so much and great taste and job well done Voodoo Donuts, and thank you all Voodoo Team Members!!!!!!..........Lol Your Donuts been casted by Voodoo.....
I got the assorted donuts to take back with me to Ohio tomorrow. The staff was friendly and the donuts look so yummy!!
Awesome donuts! While visiting Portland I went here twice in two days and I want to come back again!

This is a touristy staple in Portland and worth a visit if you've got a sweet tooth, or are just feeling like making everyone jealous of your pink box on the flight home. My favorite is the dirty Oreo cookie, but other great choices include any with cereal on top (as fresh as possible), chocolate cake with Butterfinger, grape and bubblegum. Take the kiddos and freak them out with the original Voodoo Donut ;)
You wanna donut, here's the place to go! Best of the best in the NW nuff said...
So good, and so bad for you!  Maple bacon doughnut tastes like pancakes and syrup, with a side of bacon. Insane!

We took a trip to Portland this passed weekend and I glad we made this our first stop! Everything was amazing, from the atmosphere to the customer service and of course the donuts were exactly what I imagined !
Employees are friendly and personable. Long lines but it's exactly what you'd expect to get. The donuts are over the top and as good as they look.

These donuts were amazing! I was worried that I would be let down but I definitely was not! They have a lot of interesting donuts here. I was really happy that the actual donut itself is pretty light and not the dense breads kind of donut that a lot of places have. 

I  had the old dirty bastard and the captain my captain and both were amazing! The oreos on the old dirty bastard were softer than usual but I actually preferred that. However both of them were really hard to finish. If you plan on getting multiple donuts be prepared to only eat one per day because they really fill you up!!!

Voodoo Doughnut has always been a go to place to take out of town visitors, but it's also a great place for an early Sunday morning treat - especially at Voodoo Doughnut Too! We also enjoy seeing the pink van at local events such as Sunday Parkways or Movies in the Park. Keep up the good work, your doughnuts are always delicious.

Seriously guys...four stars is the aggregate score for Voodoo Doughnuts?  Five stars...hands down.

I have tried doughnuts throughout the country and have made it a mission to try every city's "best donut shop" that I go to (yes, you can see the donuts around my belly) and Voodoo Doughnut rates in the top two that I have ever tried.  The raised glazed have only one equal and that's in Texas.  The raised chocolate glazed have no equal, period.  The chocolate is slightly bittersweet, dark, not crusty, and the whole shebang melts in your mouth.

Wow! the line was long, but the wait was worth it. This place is so cool. It felt like being at an event. Large selections and unique varieties of donuts to choose from. Since this was my first time at Voodoo, we decided to get all popular choices. We picked the mango, maple bacon, voodoo man, cock n balls, oreo, rice krispies, captain crunch, peanut butter and triple chocolate penetraion. They were all so delicious, but my favorite had to be the maple bacon and triple chocolate penetration. 

I would definitely come back here again on my next trip to Portland. Since there is no place like Voodoo donuts in LA, I would rank it 5 star for weirdness and originality. Also, the donuts were delicious and not just for show.

I was in Portland for 4 days and went everyday for doughnuts. The apple fritters are huge. The jelly filled were pure heaven. Yes, the line is long but 100% worth the wait. The place is cash only so prepare accordingly. You need to go here and try everything on the menu.

NO CREDIT CARD TRANSACTIONS! UGH 

Other than that, this is and forever will be my favorite donut shop! Its open 24/7, employees are cool and hipster! My favorite donut for some reason is the sour orange one i forgot what its called! They are always freshly made!
Very good donuts with incredibly unique flavor combinations and a funky vibe.
Amazing vegan donuts, wonderful ambiance, great staff!  Love this place!
If you are a Portlander and have not been here, shame on you.  If you are from out of town, go.  Voodoo Doughnut is quintessentially delicious.

We waited an hour in the sun for donuts & it didnt dissapoint. There were some pretty cool flavors to choose from. My fave was surprisingly the grape ape. It tasted like grape bubblicious gum meets buttercream. Cash only, btw. There's an ATM inside before the register. Don't be that person who decides after they pass it they should get cash. We took advantage of the photobooth which is $5. You get like 5 photo in 2 strips in black/white & color. Oh! As we were leaving there was a vow renewal. The voodoo king sprinkled sprinkles on the ground, yelled something with a feather & had randos including myself sharing this moment with the world. 

Oh! If you're looking for the Keep Portland Weird sign, its across the street. You're welcome ;)

"Guys. These doughnuts are so good that people from CALIFORNIA come HERE to buy these doughnuts!" The kid behind me wasn't lyin doe LOL! We heard the hype and wanted to try it out. They were standard good doughnuts, but you buy it for the crazy designs and the experience itself.
Waiting in line for 30 minutes for a maple bacon bar is so worth it!!! This is by far the best tasting doughnut that I have ever had in my life. I heart Voodoo!

Came through Portland as a weekend trip. After dodging the bums and the surprisingly polite clientele lined up for the strip club down the street, two of my buddies and I made our way into the shop and were immediately confused by the dual-line setup. 

Being college students, we put our problem-solving skills to the test and after ten minutes of intense brainstorming, dropped in behind a German family inquiring about every item on the menu. This gave us plenty of time to do the same within ourselves, and for me to form a puddle of drool on the floor as a direct result of staring at a particular donut revolving in and out of the spotlight.

This was, in my eyes, the holy grail of donuts: the Old Dirty Bastard. Slathered with chocolate glaze, peanut butter, and crushed Oreos. While my friends debated between the blueberry cake and the Arnold Palmer, I knew what I wanted.

Long story short, walked out, took a bite, and turned around to go buy fifteen more but the line had already boomed to midnight-showing-of-Harry-Potter proportions.

I still have dreams about that donut.

Oh yeah, they're a bit on the expensive side. But when you're craving sugar at 10PM and happen to be walking by Chinatown... you really just have to.
Such a fun, unique environment! A Portland must! Maybe someday there will be an Oregon bikini donut;)
Awesome place!! Great donuts! Waited about 20 minutes in line. I've heard people wait longer but this place is cool! Definitely worth stopping by!

Where the magic is in the hole. VooDoo Doughnut was/ is an amazing place to buy doughnuts. 
The problem is that the doughnuts are packed with sugar, so be careful on how fast you eat them. Plus, the line was short when my party arrived, but it got longer as we got closer to the inside. 
I don't know why so many people are saying that it was hot in the store or that the registers weren't manned, because the workers were really fast on getting our orders & the store was refreshing due to the sun outside.

Overall it was a great experience. I suggest getting a VooDoo Doll Doughnut, it's a classic one, shaped as a person/thing that's been stabbed through her "heart". It's also filled with raspberry jelly, which tastes like heaven, but can be really heavy.

Long lines but they move fast, the doughnuts are delicious, love the unique varieties they have and a friendly staff. Wish they were in Cali but anytime I can get there or have someone bring me some back I will. Maple bacon is one of my favorites.

I come here to hang out with ODB. Sometimes street kids outside let me smoke their weed.

Can't go wrong.
Amazing...... like always! 2nd voodoo doughnut I have been to and they are all consistent! A small coffee and maple doughnut to get your day started.
This is the best place for doughnuts, but you should come here early if you want a dozen before the crowd comes. I love their doughnuts!

Honestly, I'm a fan.  I'm not afraid to say it.  My favorites: Old Dirty Bastard, Maple Bacon Bar and the Portland Cream filled one (forgot the actual name).  My kids beg me to get VooDoo all the time.  And the last couple times I went here, the line was actually not that long!  A very nice surprise!

this is a MUST place to go...this place is where you go to heaven!!!! Portland's best doughnut joint ...no match. Try everything ...walk out with a pink box...lock yourself in a closet with a giant glass of milk and do it to it !!!!! Don't stress the lines..get in line shut up and wait your turn and you shall be rewarded !

Truly one of the must-visit places in Portland. They got put on the map with their untraditional donuts (NyQuil glazed, Cock n Balls, voodoo doll donut), but dang if they don't earn the hype. I had to go with the Maple Bacon and the Portland Cream (chocolate cream-filled donut). I've had maple bacon donuts from other places before, but this is by far the best. All of their ingredients and flavors just taste "REAL." You can really taste the maple in the maple icing, and the bacon strips are thin and crispy, just the right amount needed to counterbalance the maple. I think most other places tend to go crazy with the bacon, but there is such a thing as too much. The chocolate on the Portland Cream donut tasted like real chocolate, not just chocolate-flavored sugar, and the cream part had a nice dense consistency. Best of all, the "dough" part was soft and didn't taste greasy at all. The store is small but chock-full of all kinds of fun things to look at. My friend and I'd gotten there around 9am on a Saturday so there was no crowd--it was the perfect donut run :)
Busy place but tasty and unique donuts. We got the Voodoo dozen and all were delicious. Cool place to see inside too.

Overall this place is awesome. The one thing that you need to know if you do go, is that the lines are always long. Only on some occasions are the lines short, but very rarely.

The best donuts there don't cost too much ranging from a little than $1, to some being a little under $5, but for some donuts, the price you pay reflects on the quantity you get.

If you do go, expect to be in line for about 11-20 minutes. If all the cashiers are upfront it can go really quick!

Recommendations: Cock-N-Balls, Old Dirty Bastard, Bacon Maple Bar, and of course the Voodoo doll.

VERY IMPORTANT: THIS PLACE IS CASH ONLY. IF YOU NEED MONEY, THERE IS AN ATM MACHINE INSIDE, BUT BE EXPECTED TO BE CHARGED $2.50 TO USE IT, SO BRING CASH AND COINS ONLY!!!!

THE HOLY GRAIL OF DOUGHNUTS
Just go! You totally won't regret it!

I have never had a more perfect doughnut. All of the doughnuts have their own unique flavor and I love them all! My favorite BY FAR is the MAPLE BACON "BAR". I actually went to Voodoo today and asked for a maple bacon bar and the girl said "can you wait 10minutes because the bacon is still hot" and I said "no, not really, I am kind of in a hurry (I had to pick up Thai food- I'll write a review for that next!)". The hot bacon made the maple glaze gooey and even more delicious! I really, really, really recommend Voodoo to ANYONE. Even if you don't eat doughnuts, it's still a fun experience. 

I went to the Voodoo Doughnut downtown at around 12:30am on a Friday night and there was a line around the building...My local Portlander friend reassured me that "don't worry babe, you will love this shit, it's sooooo worth the wait, you have no idea." At first I was extremely skeptical- flashbacks from when I used to live in NYC and Magnolia Bakery was said to be "the best thing since sliced bread" and I waited in line for an hour for a damn cupcake, only to be disgusted by the not even worth the "tasted like cardboard" description came to mind. However, I trusted my friend this time and we stood in line, surrounded by drunks and tourists..and drunk tourists, enviously watching the people exiting the store and taking pictures, doughnuts in hand, with huge smiles on their faces. We finally got inside and got our doughnuts. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. You just have to try it yourself. There is also another location on 12th and Davis that is a lot bigger than the one downtown. The doughnuts taste the same, the people are just as nice and you rarely get any drunk tourists in there. I have never had to wait in line there, but I could be lucky.

There is a doughnut for everyone at Voodoo! There is even a HUGE cream filled doughnut that is shaped like a penis...and for a buck more you can have them draw crabs and write someone's name on it in icing! It's pretty funny if I do say so myself!

Anyway, it's obvious that this doughnut place is like no other and if you spent the time to look up the reviews on here, you should DEF spend the time to go there and give it a try!

Since when do people complain about too much sugar? Since Voodoo Donuts first opened!

I've heard sky's the limit recommendations about Voodoo from multiple people, and it met my expectations. I used to work at a cake bakery that also sold donuts, so I know a good donut when I taste one. Voodoo has the best donuts I've ever tasted. Before I walked in, my Wu-Tang appreciation unexpectedly kicked in when I saw the menu, so I ordered the Ol Dirty Bastard. It's a combination of a chocolate glazed donuts, crushed up oreos, and peanut butter. If I could create a desert that perfectly symbolized me, I would aspire to make an ODB donut. Now that I think about it, I'd eat anything called Ol Dirty Bastard! The reason Voodoo donuts are so great is because the consistency and texture of the glaze is perfect. Most donut glazes become more solid and a bit crumbly after an hour, but the glaze at Voodoo had the texture of butter cream frosting you'd find on a chocolate cake. THIS IS THE KEY TO MAKING AMAZING DONUTS.

If you're the type of person who likes to dip their donuts in coffee (aka a disgusting animal), don't come here. As far as I know, they don't serve coffee.

Is there anything else that needs to be said about Voodoo? Probably not, but here goes.

1. If you brave the line, make sure to get an ample amount of donuts. You will love them, but won't want to go back in line for more.

2. The bacon maple is donut god; bow before him/her.

3. The banana fritter can feed a family for a week. A good thing and a bad thing?

4. You may find yourself angry and jealous when you see someone else with a pink Voodoo box around town or at the airport. This is natural.

Ok, I'll shut up now.
Great donuts!!! Variety is all over the place. The 2 donuts we had were fantastic. Great atmosphere as well.

Yum yum yum.

I always get the voodoo doughnut, or the one with captain crunch. It's sooooo good omg. omg omg.

Yummy donuts with a ton of choices and unique offerings. Want a donut stuffed with mango jelly or how about with maple bacon on top? You've got it! You wont be able to leave with just one. Go early to avoid the lines and cash only! Brought some home for the family in Cali and they loved it wish we had it here!
Very amazing tasting and fun landmark to visit. Love they have Vegan options too!

Part of my Portland Tradition is a visit to Voodoo doughnut whenever I'm in town.  I recommend making it part of your trip as well.

Voodoo offers a ton of unique flavor options that make it a little hard to choose.  Personally I like the Dirty Snow Ball and Ol' Dirty B@stard (Wu-Tang!!) but it's hard to go wrong.

The biggest downside is the popularity of Voodoo makes for some EPIC lines especially on weekends.  Out of necessity the staff tries to get you in/out quickly so if your looking for a leisurely breakfast this may not be the place for you..

Best. Donut. Ever. Love the staff. Love the atmosphere.
If you don't appreciate a f-ing great donut then this place is not for you.
A must try when in Portland.
Great experience and worth the stop.  A little pricer than a normal doughnut place but these are not your normal doughnuts

I wish we had one of these in San Diego...I want to try them all! 
Best of all, donuts are so cheap! only $2 for a voodoo doll shaped donut with choc frosting and raspberry filling!
Best doughnut place in the United States of America. No further needed, just try all of them.

I don't know what they do to their doughnuts, but they are magical. They make me want to get drunk just so I have an excuse for a 'Sober Me Up Doughnut." 

I'm a Plane Jane when it comes to doughnuts, glazed or nothing. This was by far the best glazed doughnut I've ever had. The inside was light and moist. The glaze was the same as all the other doughnut shops in the world, just a little better. 

Sure, you could get a maple bacon or Fruity Pebbles doughnut, but I think these strong tastes would overwhelm the simple, delicate taste of the perfected doughnut.

I can't actually remember the last time I had a doughnut, I am really not a fan.  But, when I heard that Voodoo Doughnuts has vegan flavors that have toppings like sugary cereal, candy bars, coconuts, nuts, and other delicious things I knew that Paul and I would go there!  I figured I would just convince myself that I was eating a flattened cupcake rather than a doughnut, which I don't normally eat.

Paul was really excited about the maple bacon doughnut, he had been waiting to try it for weeks and weeks, since I first heard about it.  I heard Anthony Bourdain just visited there too and was a fan of the bacon doughnut, so that made us want to check it out also.  

I tried a vegan cupcake...errr, doughnut that had crushed butterfinger topping on it.  It was really great, the flavor was fantastic.  I really enjoyed it although it took me several hours to finish it, it was really sweet, too sweet to eat at once.

Paul, of course got the maple bacon doughnut which he really liked.  It was quite the funny looking doughnut, I figured the bacon would somehow be wrapped around the doughnut but there were just these two random strips of bacon on top of a maple doughnut!  HA HA!  It was hilarious.  He really liked it though, he said it was quite the good doughnut.

Now, I can't really assign stars to this one, as I mentioned I cannot remember eating a doughnut in the past ten years or so but Paul loves those darn things and he said to give it five stars so there it is!
A Portland must! Don't let the long lines scare you. Line moves fast and really really good donuts! Don't know how they taste better but they do!

So we went to Voodoo just for the experience (Lord knows nobody really NEEDS doughnuts) the day we were flying home to California.  I really wanted to buy a c@ck-n-balls for a friend of mine but was afraid there'd be some TSA regulations about triple cream stuffed desserts shaped like genitals ... so I didn't. 

We got a selection of whatever they had left, (many things were sold out by mid-afternoon) thinking that we'd eat 'em before heading to the airport.  Well, we didn't eat them and now I was really panicked about having to throw my precious doughnuts in the trash at security. 

At PDX I approached a big grouchy looking TSA guy and inquired about doughnut policy and whether I could take them through security. He glared at me and then snarled, "Ha! We eat them!" Then he broke into a grin and said it should be fine, "as long as they x-ray okay."  (I guess they can tell if someone decides to fill a doughnut with, say ... plastique.)  So we ended up eating our doughnuts the next morning, home in CA and they were still pretty good.

there are 2 things to get: Bacon maple bar, or Apple fritter. They are both the best of the best. And the best time to get any of these is at MIDNIGHT! That's right, don't wait until the unwashed masses show up at 10am on Saturday or Sunday. Get them first, at night, right as they're making them! Rub elbows with drunks, prom queens, and regular people as the line winds around the store, out the door, and down the block. These doughnuts are good. And some of them are even vegan! Probably not the bacon maple bar, though.

In this case, you should believe the hype. There is a line for a reason, and that reason is that they are some of the most creative, or maybe just evil, bakery devils I have been to. It's best to get your coffee first at one of the food wagons one block down the street.

They were once featured on a food network show many years ago, and ever since then Voodoo had been on my bucket list.  This past May, I was able to check it off as we made our way to PDX!  The voodoo man donut was everything I had imagined and more.  The donut was so delicious, and between myself and my fiance, we had about 5 or 6 different donuts in total in just 2 days!  The lines move quick, the prices are cheap, and the variety is manifold.  Definitely smack this onto your itinerary when visiting Portland for the first or 50th time.
Addicting, I couldnt stop.  Seriously, after waiting 15 min in line and devouring my first doughnut, I got back in line for seconds!

Voodoo Doughnut was featured on Man vs. Food.

I loved my Voodoo Doughnut experience. 

I went to Voodoo on a Saturday afternoon around 4pm, which is what I thought would be the off peak doughnut time. I quickly found out that there is no off peak time at Voodoo Doughnut. I had to wait in line for about a half hour before I could get in and select my doughnuts. Although waiting in line typically sucks, it added to the experience. 

I decided to pick six of the 70+ doughnut options and went with the following choices;

Triple Chocolate Penetration, Voodoo Doll, Memphis Mafia, Maple Bacon Bar, The Old Dirty Bastard, and the Loop.

Here are my grades for each;
Triple Chocolate Penetration- Chocolate devil's food cake doughnut, chocolate frosting, Cocoa Puffs.
Grade- C
Extreme chocolate flavor, the only negative is that the Cocoa Puffs were a little bit soggy.

Voodoo Doll- Voodoo doll shaped doughnut with raspberry jelly filling and chocolate frosting.
Grade- A
If you like jelly doughnuts, you'll love this one. The chocolate and raspberry combination was very tasty. 

Memphis Mafia- Apple fritter with peanut butter and chocolate toppings with chocolate chips and banana chunks.
Grade- B
This was an enormous treat that I could barely finish. The combination is not one that I would have ever thought about, but it tasted really good. 

Maple Bacon Bar- Maple bar topped with bacon.
Grade- A
Amazing! Tasted like French toast with bacon on top. 

The Old Dirty Bastard- Doughnut topped with chocolate, Oreos, and peanut butter.
Grade- A
My second favorite, after the Maple Bacon Bar. That great chocolate/peanut butter flavor that everyone loves.

The Loop- Doughnut with vanilla frosting and covered with Fruit Loops.
Grade- A
I love Fruit Loops, so I loved this doughnut.


Great doughnuts, unique menu, cool experience, friendly and helpful service, give Voodoo Doughnut five stars.
Every good thing you have heard about this place on tv is true. Best doughnuts I have ever had.

Lives up to the hype. It doesn't hurt that we stayed a block away from it, so it was super easy to walk to and we could look out the window to determine how long the lines were. Thankfully it's open 24 hours a day which means you can fulfill that donut crave at any time. 
It's a relatively small store with two registers and spinning carousels of donuts. They come in a bright pink unmistakable box. Creative flavors like captain crunch or their signature voodoo doll filled with raspberry jelly are sure to pique your interest. To be honest maybe more than one is too much sugar for a daily intake but it's great to share and save for another day (though fresh is better). 
There's a photo booth in the back and a Jones soda fountain. Of course there's coffee too. Only a bar to stand up and eat and a few tables outside if it's not raining.

I am not a huge sweets person but it was worth the wait AND the massive sugar rush. The doughnuts are very generously sized for the price with fun ideas for flavors. I ordered the maple bacon bar, the voodoo doll, and a peach fritter. The fritter was by far my favorite, not overly sweet and with big chunks of fruit. It came with a lot of icing, however, and I removed some of that to avoid being totally comatose afterward. 
The staff was friendly and although the line was long it moved quickly and I felt that there was plenty of time to review the menu while I was waiting. 
Definitely a fun experience. 
For those who have said the doughnuts were average I would like to know where you all are getting your other doughnuts. I live in TX where Krispy Kreme (aka glazed air) dominates the scene. I was glad to have something with flavor and creativity for a change.
Five stars from me.  Read the other reviews for atmosphere, creativity, and taste.
Excellent dounuts pick whatever takes your fancy, don't mind the glittery wall - it's kind of entertaining when you line up.. Be patient and you will get that burst of amazing donut Ness! Enjoy

Great vibes, quirky store, and killer doughnut! The downside is this place is CASH ONLY. But they have ATMs available inside to help ya out. 
I had the GrapeApe flavor, and loved it! Sounds like it would be kind of gross, but it was actually amazing. And only $1.95! Not too shabby!
Mmmm. Love the box, interesting and funny flavors, would prefer if the donuts were warm or something but they were still good. Got a discount on my donut because they were closing.

Black magic bakery?? You bet your beans I'm checking that out!

This place is open 24/7, but there will probably be a line, and they may sell out of one of your donut choices (the maple bacon, in our case). It's still worth checking out, and a "must see" if you're visiting from out of town and have a sweet tooth. Bring cash, although they do have an ATM inside their bakery.

They don't claim to have the best-tasting donuts on the planet, nor should you come here seeking the best-tasting donut on the planet. That being said, the donuts taste great and they DO have the most creative, funky, unique donuts I've ever seen on the planet:

- Anatomically-shaped donuts (C&Bs).
- A glazed donut bigger than your head (Tex-ass).
- Huge fruity fritter donuts that are the perfect combo of crunch and fruit.
- Their "normal" donuts are great too! I loved the cruellers!

Altogether, we were thoroughly charmed by the donutty voodoo in our mouths!
Literally the best doughnuts I have ever had! It was a must stop place we had to try on our road trip from California to Washington! The donuts were so amazing!

Omg! Amazing doughnuts! So fresh! I liked the "old dirty bastard" it was chocolate glaze with Oreos and peanut butter on top! Sounds like a lot but it really was amazing! And I'm not even a huge doughnut fan! I can't wait To go back. Definitely worth it, especially after a night of drinking!

I was in Portland for a weekend and had absolutely put voodoo on my list of things to do. I was going to come to voodoo no matter what. My first attempt was on Sunday evening around 10:30 pm. Yes, I had heard about the long lines and had set my mind on waiting in them but I decided to turn back and attempt a voodoo donut run the following day. 

I came on Monday morning around 10:30 am and had better luck. I arrived to a line of about 30 people ahead of me. Most of them appeared local and a few like myself were snapping away and taking pictures. I could feel my heart beating fast with excitement at how close I was to having my first voodoo doughnut. As I looked all around in anticipation I finally made it in into the little pink store. I enjoyed the turning samples of donuts. So many to choose from in such little time. 

We we're assisted by Josh. He was awesome. We told him it was our first time here and our last stop before heading home. He recommended some delicious looking donuts and he was very polite and helpful. 

Even though it was super packed the awesome vibe of voodoo made it go fast. I loved the atmosphere, colors, and the donuts taste and look amazing!! Try the chuckle it their new one!

Yes it's EXACTLY how great everyone raves about. This hands down the best doughnut place I have ever been to! You have so many options, SO MANY. You most likely will stand in line with some dance music playing in the background and just a place full of young people! The energy when you enter is like no other! Word of advice is start figuring out what kind of doughnuts you want because the line moves really fast!! I'd recommend looking for the flavors online and make a decision because once you get to the front there is a sense of hurry in taking your order and rightfully so because there are so many customers even if this place is open 24 hours a day! Or you be the cool guy/girl and say surprise me!

Anyways I ordered the Dirt, old dirty bastard, captain crunch, grape ape, voodoo bubble,  the homer, Portland cream,  voodoo doll, maple blazer blunt (no it's not a edible ), diablos Rex, triple chocolate penetration (and yes I got i because of the name also), aquamarine. passion fruit jam

Dirt is the oreo with vanilla frosting. Tastes like Oreo in donut form
Old dirty bastard is the same as dirt but with chocolate frosting and peanut better
Captain crunch is just as you imagine it, the beloved cereal on top of a doughnut
grape ape is that grape taste on the doughnut (more like candy grape flavor as opposed to natural grape)
The homer is a must have for any Simpsons fan which is the iconic doughnut brought to life with strawberry frosting with sprinkles
Portland cream is Bavarian cream with chocolate frosting with some cute eyes
Voodoo doll- The most popular doughnut with raspberry jam. While the doughnut was good , the jam was okay.
Maple blazer blunt- Looks like a blunt with maple flavoring and no you cannot smoke it
Diablos Rex- Is a doughnut with a pentagram for those who like to summon a partner eating with them. Although this doughnut was also okay, not great
Voodoo bubble- Of you love bubblegum, Just get it, don't argue with me. Frosting with bubblegum dust on it
passion fruit jam- It was just like a jelly doughnut except it had passion fruit!! very unique flavor!
aquamarine- Looks like a star from Super Mario except orange and tastes like orange! Mamma orange!
Triple chocolate penetration-Great flavor, just like coco puffs with chocolate frosting!

That's it folks, If I come by Portland I will try all the flavors I can!
Highly recommend this place!

Side note, be careful of the crazies and sidewalk bums. They will talk to you but don't give no attention at all! and keep your voodoo donuts close!
Come on... it's voodoo. you can't go wrong! Just eat them that day-- they don't last too long in the box!

The weirdest little donut shop in town, and a major favorite of mine. When the bars close head over to the itty bitty shop, wait in line, and get your goodness on. I'm a fan of the Tang coated donuts, or try the Captain Crunch covered donut. 

To arrive at a party with serious style, swing by Voodoo first for a bucket of donuts--a large plastic bucket filled with whatever they have left over. I think it's $8, and you get enough donuts to feed all your drunk friends and then some.
These guys do donuts right - in addition to a marvelous, tasty variety - they are committed to their kookiness at VooDoo!

you do

we do

we all do for voodoo!!!

Seriously, amazing, and they open wicked late!!!!!!

bacon doughnut is where it's at!!! I am definitely a bacon connoisseur, so I literally drove to portland for these damn delicious doughnuts! THANKS FOOD NETWORK CHANNEL!!

Like seriously, any type of doughnut you can imagine they have there! even cereal type doughnut to whatever you can think of. they will even make you whatever you'd like if they had the ingredients! now that's awesome!!!!! seriously?!!! that's amazing!!! obviously, they are not going to make you one doughnut of your choice, but if they are making them, just buck up and ask if you can special order it! trust me, they have the coolest stuff there! definitely a big kids doughnut shop!!

 Side note : they also own an amazing food truck too!!! - brunchbox - do try that out. Think of that place as a glutenous dream!!!! my mouth is watering, I can't describe it.. but it's damn gooooooooooooodddddddd... if you are doing the biggest loser challenge, then forget on going to these two establishments!!!

A lot of local people like to give voodoo donuts crud for being overrated, but whatever the heck honey! They make some of the best vegan donuts in Portland, with an array of different, creative flavors. Even their regular donuts are delicious. If you've seriously never tried this place, I highly recommend it. Enduring the long lines, even on hot summer days, is totally worth it.

Life changing.

I stayed in downtown Portland a year ago for a conference.  Spent the nights at the awesome restaurants and bars.  One night at about 2am, it was decided we would go to the famous Voodoo Doughnuts.  The place was hoppin' a bit and the line quickly disappeared and I was at the counter.

My goodness... what to do... what to get?  There's a donut with bubblegum on it, there's one with tang on it, there's one with crushed Oreos on it, over there is one topped with Captain Crunch cereal, down there is a massive one shaped like a penis, oh my god that one has bacon on it!

This my friends is what happens when people decide to just have fun and make something the way they want to.  People had always thought things like this could be done, dreamed about it, perhaps even amateurly attempted it themselves at home... and now here at Voodoo Doughtnuts, they've perfected it.

I ended up getting the maple bacon, fruit loop, and old dirty bastard donuts.  The fruit loop donut was very sweet, but if you like fruit loops, it was awesome.  The Old Dirty Bastard is chocolate, crushed Oreos, and drizzled peanut butter, it was amazing.  The Maple Bacon donut... you may have seen this at other places, but they don't cheap out here and they make it right.  Anthony Bourdain showed it best.  Once you have this, you'll only want it again.  You will never be able to eat a standard donut from down the street ever again.

In the end... come here.  Eat the donuts... find your favorites... dream about them and always get them... and always try the different ones to see just what each one is all about.  Every time someone I know goes to Portland, I have them bring me a box.  They arrive slightly smooshed and half a day old, but just as amazing.

Amazing! I love donuts and these are far better then anything I have ever tasted! There was not a huge line, only about three or four people in front of me and it went by fast. It was hard to choose a donut so I recommend going with a friend and splitting them so that you can try multiple. My best friend and I just visited Portland and tried the bacon and peanut butter Oreo donuts. The donuts  are delicious, and they have a delightful taste and consistency. There are no words, they are just WOW.

Drove to Portland in September.  Walk around chinatown - very disappointed then headed to Voodoo.  

Each doughnut is a meal all by itself!  I tried the Bacon Maple Bar.  I compare this to Dynamo's bacon maple donut in SF and Voodoo won by a landslide!  First bite, you get the salty oily crispy crunchy bacon plus the sweet silky smooth maple and the airy creamy fluffy doughy center.  Go next door to Stumptown, get the drip.  Perfect combo!

At lunch, i ate the old dirty bastard.  Pretty good - lots of peanut butter.
Love these donuts. A must go to spot for anyone visiting Portland who has a sweet tooth!

I see why this is a must visit place when in Portland.  The line was long and that stinks, but everyone in line was friendly and the donut I had was delicious ... mind you I love all donuts so I'm a bit biased in that regard.
5 stars for vegan donuts.  my husband's had the reg's and he raves about them, too.  i usually eat one with sprinkles or choc/coconut but i plan on branching out soon.  always delicious!!!
The most unique and delicious donuts!!!  They are very tasty and fun.  Don't go on the weekends, the line will be around the corner, yea, they are that good.  #1 Donut shop!

When we landed in Portland I knew we HAD to get voodoo! I didn't get any until the last day of the trip so luckily, I got a nice pink box to munch on for the flight home :)

There was a line out the door on a Monday afternoon, but it moved by quickly! They have so many donuts it's crazy, but everything is always fresh! I got the maple bacon bar, voodoo doll donut, Memphis Mafia, Apple Fritter, blueberry donut, and maple old fashion!

Vodoo doll donut - It's such a cute donut and they say don't play with your food, but I looked like a little kid having the time of my life stabbing the donut w/ the little pretzel stick that comes with it LOL. It's a raspberry jelly filled donut w/ chocolate frosting. Yeast raised so it was nice and airy. Very good jelly to donut ratio and the perfect amount of frosting! Really good donut, I wouldn't mind ordering another one of these.

Memphis Mafia - Think of a banana fritter w/ glaze, drizzled PB & chocolate, sprinkled w/ peanuts and chocolate chips on top! HEAVENLY!!!!! Damn why can't they make something like this back in the OC? Very good and I liked it more than regular apple fritter.

Maple Bacon Bar - Notice in my picture there's 2? Hell I should've got a half dozen of them! They were so good!! The bacon was so crispy and I'm not sure what bacon they used, but the flavor paired well w/ the maple frosting and donut. It was the perfect sweet and salty mix. The donut was really fresh...I'm drooling thinking about it

Yea yea I get it ppl may say get blue star blah blah, but voodoo is iconic! You can't compare it to blue star, cause they both sell different types of donuts. It's a fun little donut shop and just a warning...If you end up taking a box on the flight home be prepared to get at least 10 people asking you about the donuts. So many ppl wanted to have some and the flight attendant even wanted it lol.
I love going to all of the Voodoo locations. I always have a great time and the staff is always so welcoming and personable. Never a let down! :)
Coolest doughnut place! Their was a long line at 12am, which says a lot about their yummy delights. This joint has funky doughnut names and has a lot of character.
As there are 68 people ahead in line ... better skip the order of a dozen of these sugar cakes and make it TWO dozen!

Without a doubt the best doughnuts in the Universe! Dirt Donut, Dirty Little Bastard, Bacon Maple Bar, and a variety of other doughnuts that one might only concocted during some altered state of mind!  

These guys are geniuses!

The place is a bit run down and the block that it's on may have a homeless person or two asking for money on it, but who cares!  Give them a buck or two, everyone can use a hand once in a while!
