Needless to say the doughnuts are worth it! They have great toppings, but they really nailed the dough. That's what makes them great!

Are you kidding?  This place doesn't need a review.  They kick ass, take names, and then do it all over again EVERY. DAMN. DAY.  I'm very glad there isn't one in Corvallis because I'd find a way for them to be my 4 food groups. Seriously.

I am used to waiting in line for good food. Whether it be Hot Doug's, Xoco, or Kuma's Corner, I have never been disappointed by the food after a long wait. 

I headed over to Voodoo Doughnuts arriving after dinner. I was hoping to miss the afternoon tourist crowd and beat the late night crowd. I did neither. It took me about 1 hour and 15 minutes to get through the line but it was well worth it.

The place is tiny and cash only. It is filled with merchandise including shirts that state "The Magic is in the Hole". After much deliberation, including ogling over pictures and descriptions of the donuts online, I picked up 3 donuts the Voodoo Doll, the Bacon Maple Bar, and the Old Dirty Bastard. If I wasn't leaving until the next evening I probably would have bought a dozen. The toppings are great but the donuts are even better, I don't think I have tasted a fresher donut. 

What surprised me the most was the price which I thought was very reasonable. With the exception of three to four special donuts most donuts were between .95 cents and $1.50. 

At Voodoo Doughnut you will find an unbelievable donut, at a reasonable price and while it might take a while to get it, it is definitely worth the wait!
Best apple fritter I have ever tasted.  I would go to the Voodoo at 1505 NE Davis St rather than standing in line on SW 3rd.  Although you  meet some great and interesting people standing in line.

We were driving from the Sasquatch Festival to the Redwoods Ntl Forrest in a 31foot RV through the streets of Portland when it occurred to us that Anthony Bourdain had once reviewed this little doughnut shop. Good thing we stopped by as with most Bourdain promoted establishments. I don't even like sweets but this place was CRACK. The colors on the doughnuts are as psychedelic as you can get and the flavors are just as intense. The bacon doughnut (thought to myself WTF???) tastes amazing! It was like you wrapped your pancake and bacon from breakfast, covered in maple syrup and injected it into a crepe which was then deep fried. Sounds unhealthy? Probably is... but we enjoyed every single bite. Oh I forgot to mention... we confused the crap out of the guy at the counter on what is included in the special and he ended up charging us way less and gave us extra change. lol
Tried the chocolate glazed and jelly donut. Soooo good!!
nom nom nom - heaven in pink box. The person(s) that created this frankenstein of dough and perfection - I love you. Eat, rub belly, eat more. I love this comfort food in all its decadence.

If you can handle sugar overload, then Voodoo Doughnut is for you.  

Before you get in line, read the menu and look at the options.  My fiance and I just got in line and waited for our turn.  Man, we felt pressured by other people waiting behind us.  We were like...."let's get this....no, this.....no, this one.....and that one....honey, I already got that one....oh, this one!"

We got different kinds that included a Voodoo ghost donut, cock-and-balls donut, grape ape donut, mango-flavored donut, cereal topped donut, etc.  Yes, I saw the bacon topped donuts.  Dafuq?!?!?!?

Anyways, expect people to ogle you as you carry a large pink box in your hand.  Everyone knows that that box is.

Whether you like donuts or not, you have to stop by this place!

*This place is cash only!
Fruit Loops & Maple Bacon are my Favorite!!
Sugary goodness, great atmosphere and attitude, worth the hype. Not for donut snobs.

Donut lover's heaven! There is literally something for everyone. From simple glazed to fancy maple bacon...if you can't find something you like, there is something wrong with you. Quick service and super cheap for how delicious they are! 11/10 would recommend!

Yes there is a line, yes they are sometimes out of what you waited so long for. DEAL WITH IT! Great Donuts and always a good time. Its a fun place to go and bring friends that have never been. Yes huge hope and other fun stuff but when it all comes down to it they are good and you do wait. But like any good place once people find out about it they go. If its good they come back = a line. I enjoy the wait give me time to think of what I will get!

Heading  to Voodoo Doughnut? Be sure to have some time on your hands. This is a popular spot and with just one visit you'll see why. The atmosphere is great. It has a New Orleans vibe to it and a lot of local street talent is always hanging around out front. One thing to remember is that you better bring some cash because they don't accept anything else.

The doughnuts are awesome and the variety is there for almost anyone to find something that they will like. 

One word of warning, there are a lot of street folks hanging around that are bound to ask you for one of your doughnuts so be ready. That's one of the curses of Voodoo being so good.

If you want to get totally stoned on sugar and eat specialty doughnuts named "old dirty bastard" or "cock and balls" then this is the spot for you. I never eat doughnuts, but make an exception when I visit Portland and go to Voodoo....so good!!!

You don't get better doughnuts than this!  Maple bar with stips of bacon on them?  Glazed doughnut with trix on them?  Suicide girl types serving them?  Ahh...if and when I go back this is a must see.

Wonderful service and there wasn't a line,  
The doughnuts were amaaazing as you've probably heard. 
A homeless woman stole some tips from the jar, I felt super bad for the employees. 
So I'd watch out for sneaky thieves. But over all the service was excellent

OM NOM incarnate!
Awesome doughnuts, though if you've got a Krispy Kreme, or Dawn Doughnuts near you, they're quite similar in quality. Although the main difference is the creativeness of the varieties.
My biggest issue with them is that if you order a dozen, they'll stack them on top of each other in two layers.
This means that the icing will stick to the paper they use to separate the layers. = less than nom.

Totally worth the wait.

I had a last minute business trip to Tualatin and had a couple hours in the morning to hangout in Portland. I was gonna just hangout at Stumptown Coffee, and then I saw a massive line outside of Voodoo Doughnut.

So many choices. I wish they had their menu posted on the window by the line, so I could decide before I got to the front. I ended up getting a bacon maple bar and a portland cream. Mmm...so good.

The rotating case by each register is really cool, so you can see what each doughnut looks like before you buy it.

I am mainly giving it a 5 star rating for the creativity in the assortment of donuts to choose from. They tasted great as well. Came to Portland for a visit on a Saturday morning and was recommended here by a friend and the wait was not terrible (20 min tops), and the prices are not bad either. The donuts we got were definitely worth the wait, but it's not necessarily a place we will come every single time we visit Portland. But you should at least try this place once while you're here!

Any place that has doughnuts that look like actual voodoo dolls (and a pretzel stick in which to stab your voodoo recipient) is a good one.

And that would be Voodoo Doughnuts. When I first moved to Portland, it took me a while to find this hole-in-the wall kind of establishment, but once I did, I was in a sugar-high nirvana.

Standing outside in the rain to wait my turn at drooling over that lighted revolving case of their selection is worth it anytime.

Especially when a doughnut shop has a doughnut called the C*ck N B@lls....and it is SO good. Seriously. Try it. I told them they need to make boob-shaped doughnuts to even it out for the men.

My hubby loves the Bacon Maple Bar, and if I was the type who let my breakfast food mingle with one another, I would probably love it, too. 

The line may be long, but it's part of the experience and hype, and the line goes fast. My experience with the doughnuts with bits of cereal on them have been stale ones. Stick with the classics. Like the Tex-Ass. 

I even took visiting family during the day, and the experience was still as good as the late-night drunken stumble to confectionary goodness.

Oh- and come with cash. Come on, Voodoo, take the plastic!

The wait wasn't bad at all on a Thursday afternoon, and the simple glazed yeast doughnut is 110% the BEST glazed I've ever eaten.

Our vacation in Portland ended over a month ago, and I'm still dreaming about those glazed doughnuts...
If you  bacon and maple bars, put these together and guarantee you will be coming back for more!  and that's just the start!! YUMMY

There's a REASON for the line. Best doughnut place, EVER!!!! How did they manage to make the line move so quickly and yet make me feel like I was the ONLY person in the place? MUST BE MAGIC! Most efficient, PATIENT (so much deliciousness to choose from -OH MY!), pleasant & helpful staff I have ever encountered - for such a busy place. What a fun spot in an interesting area. Of note, cash ONLY - there is an ATM, if you forget. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

Yes, it was all it was billed to be.  

I waited in line for the required 45 minutes, only to hear the rumor that they are open 24 hours a day.  What is this paradise.  I'll definitely make my next visit at 3 AM, when all the fun happens.  After the wait I anticipated what the doughnuts would look like, only to be completely amazed once I saw them in person.  Huge, decorated works of art.  Voodoo Doughnut was the creation of an artist.  Every single doughnut has its own sense of style, and most definitely taste. 

I preferred the doughnut with the peanut butter and oreos, but do not skip out on the classic voodoo doughnut or the apple fritter.  Hell, try anything and all.  I am sure you can not go wrong.  A Portland staple, come ready to wait in line and to have a good time.  I made some friends in the line who were more than eager to take pictures of us.  

PS.  Make sure to walk across the street and take a touristy photo with the Keep Portland Weird mural.  Keep Portland Weird!

Voodoo Rocks !!!  I have been here maybe like 6 times, and I never expect to enjoy it as much as I do !  I have only tried a few of their doughnuts cause for me, some of them look WAY to sweet, I love their signature bacon maple bar, the maple blazer blunt and the Mexican hot chocolate.  They have very good maple frosting, hence the two maple doughnuts, they don't skimp on the bacon, and its good bacon, and the Mexican hot chocolate.......who doesn't like cayenne on their doughnut ?????  The place is kinda divey, it use to be REAL divey before, the music can be odd to abrasive, you can't work there unless you have 80 % of you body tattoos, and that is the fun of this place !!!  If you go, prepare to wait in line, when you get in they have a couple display cases with all the doughnuts in them, plus all the doughnuts listed on a chalk board overheard, and its hard to match up the two, so go online before you go and decide what you want or just point to the ones you want in the cases.   Remember, your coming here cause its an institution and its different, if your expecting a French Patisserie you might want to go somewhere else.

Always a good choice. Great donuts that never disappoint. Don't forget to bring some cash as they are a cash only business. Tons of options to choose from. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The location on the eastside of Portland on Davis is not nearly as long of a wait as the downtown location.

Great donuts. 

Fun atmosphere.  Definitely do not come here unless you can wait in line. 

Definitely understand why people wait. Donut flavors are awesome. Prices are good too. 

Will be back

Anyone can make a doughnut but only Voodoo Doughnuts includes an experience. Hand crafted selections of yummy goodness await you here. 
A delightfully quirky business that is all Portland has to offer in one place.
 Chances are your going to have a problem on your first visit here. Seriously so many choices  to make so allow me to guide you through it. 
Classic are built upon here and some may surprise you. The trend setting Voodoo, the  Bacon and Maple bar ,Coco Puffs  and Fruit Loops to name a few. 
I'm partial to the Pentagram Coconut cake doughnut ahhh doughnuts. Enthusiasts swear by the maple bacon and I agree. Definitely add these to your dozen.
If you caint find one you like then you do like Doughnuts. 
Easy to find and worth the time. So head on down and enjoy the Portland experience. Maybe I will see you there soon!

They could set nuns on fire, kick my cat, or ruin the ending to Game of Thrones, but for the fact that their bacon maple bar tastes like a little bacon man having sex with Mrs. Butterworth in my mouth, I will award you 5 stars Voodoo Donut

p.s. The little bacon man and Mrs Butterworth taste even better after having been dunked in "the nice n' toasty coffee hot tub of love"
Love it! The decorations are fantastic and everything is so cool. Nice price and really popular.
So tasty! And fun! A must go for out-of-towners! Make sure you bring cash though because they don't accept any cards!

I was never a fan of doughnuts but this place broke me! I have to try and avoid it for the simple fact I'd blow up if I ate there every time I went into the city. Best Doughnuts I've ever eaten in my life. Very eclectic staff. Even took my 75 yr old parents and they loved it! I'd never seen my dad smile so big when they showed him his box of doughnuts. Definite must stop for anyone w/a sweet tooth or not...

I was in Portland for a few days so of course I had to go to Voodoo Doughnuts! I went twice while I was there including right before I went to the airport. I got the Froot Loops Doughnut and the Miami Vice Berry and they were both AMAZING. They weren't busy so we got in an out very quickly. The price is great for the quality!

Guess where I ate breakfast today ?  Finally.  
They have huge buckets of day old doughnuts for $5 !
Hella nice person works here.

I had 2 vegan donuts.  One was chocolate with coconut and the other was glazed.  Chamomile tea.

Awesome and big dang donuts.
Yeah it's a tourist thing, but I was willing to wait 45 minutes in the rain and it was worth it!!!!!

I really dig this place. It's fun, funky, and always open. I love all the stuff on the walls, it's neat to just go in there and gawk, and I really love the arnold palmer doughnut. It's fun, funky, and a little bit unexpected.

Voodoo Doughnut is why I miss portland.  It is weird and great and just full of all the sweet things in life that make it interesting. I miss the late night drive downtown to get a midnight maple bar topped with bacon. I remember the days when they still had  NyQuil Glazed and Pepto donuts. The health department stepped in on those, but I always passed on the drug filled ones.  Preferring, my bacon maple bars and the occasional cream filled cock-and-balls to get my suger high.

I'm not much of a doughnut fan but in all the times I've visited beautiful Portland I've never really done anything touristy.  Voodoo is pretty much the only specific Portland thing I ever hear about (if Portland is mentioned on a traveling show this is where they are) so Voodoo it is for my Doing-what-Everyone-Does-when-They-Come-to-Portland-Adventure.  I didn't really know what to expect not particularly liking doughnuts and not being hungry when we came here, except that I knew I was going to order the infamous bacon maple bar that I've seen everyone from Bourdain to Brown to Palahniuk mouthgasm over.
But then, whilst waiting in a line way too short for my indecision, I saw the sad, cold-looking maple bar sitting there like it'd been there longer than any doughnut should have to wait in a place like this and I just wasn't feeling it.  In a moment of panic I gaped at the cashier and pointed to a violently orange specimen sitting between a cock-and balls and a dirty bastard.
I had squandered my Portland moment on what I later found out to be Mango Tango- a mango jam filled doughnut iced and covered in tang powder.  Still cloyingly sweet like every other doughnut that has ever disappointed me, this one had a wonderfully bright, citrus acidity to counter the sweetness.  The jam had a great, fresh mango taste that I wouldn't think possible for a gooey, neon-orange substance jammed into a doughnut and the powder set everything off better than I could imagine.
It was motherf.cking delicious and honestly, the first satisfying doughnut I've ever eaten.
In my spare time I may just try to buy my own maple bars and lay bacon hot out of the pan over them.  I feel like the melting icing and fresh bacon will do for me what Voodoo's just didn't seem to be able to do.

When I think of my trip to Portland, I think of Voodoo doughnuts (no offense to my friend, Melissa, who I was visiting).  I was a little surprised at how small the place was, but I loved the dark and goth decor. 

I was a little overwhelmed at first because I had no idea what I wanted, but then I saw it in the glass case:  the OLD DIRTY BASTARD.  It's a yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, crumbled oreos, and peanut butter drizzle.  MMMMMM...it was fantastic!

I also had the Captain My Captain, which is a yeast doughnut with frosting and captain crunch on top.  I LOVE cereal and I LOVE doughnuts, so this was a perfect combination.

A very hip donut shop with a wide variety of tasty treats! Slighty spendy, but worth at least one visit.

I went with the Memphis Mafia, which is a giant banana fritter with nuts and drissled peanut butter and chocolate on top.

Monday at 445p there is 30-45min line (they make enough money to expand there counter or order taking system, but don't). 
The doughnuts are AMAZE-BALLS!! Well worth the lbs you're going to gain. These are must have, which sadly means, you must wait! Oh...the Voodoo wizard magic that must go in to producing these flour cakes of addiction!  Anyways.. They're really good!!!

Side note (late edit): you'll burp it for the rest of the day... Hahaha!!

I think I finally understand why there are ridiculous lines out the door for this place. I've tried the one in San Jose and it was terrible. While in Portland, it just seems wrong not to come and try one myself, even though I know it's a tourist trap. I was fortunate enough to come both times when the lines were short, and I didn't have to wait more than 30mins. Phew! 

The sheer variety of the donuts and their toppings seems overwhelming, yet very intriguing. I can't help but to wonder how the other ones I did not buy, taste like. Be warned however, all of these donuts are pure sugar bombs! While here, I took full advantage and tried the voodoo donut (with jelly filling), the mango tango (mango filling), the dirty of bastard (oreo on top of peanut butter), captain my captain (captain crunch topping), no-name donut (rice krispies topping with peanut butter), and a good old fashion glazed donut. I have to say that their donuts are definitely more on the doughy side, and super fluffy. I love my fluffy donuts! The toppings were NOT stale at all (unlike the one in San Jose), it tasted very fresh and as I warned you above, they were all super sweet- get that cup of coffee ready when you indulge in these delightful donuts! Personal favorites were the dirty old bastard and no name donut. Not sure what my waiting threshold would be, so the question of "is it worth the wait?" really depends. But I would definitely recommend trying if you are in Portland (if you don't mind waiting).  How can you not?

Best Donuts in Portland.... Period!  Long Lines and Cash Only are a little inconvenient, but the dough nuts are yummy and the staff does a good job of handling the crowd. Go first thing in the morning (better yet in the middle of the week) for much much shorter lines.

The very best, and if you don't believe this, check out the normal 'out the door lines' always around the downtown Portland location near the Burnside Bridge and Third. 

Fresh, and creative!   The two-piece bacon maple bar is to die for, and it may also be that 'you can't just eat one!'  

If you like fresh, yummy donuts, this is your spot!   The wait is worth it.  If you don't like to wait, sometimes the one on NE Sandy, and about 10th or so, might be a faster situation for Voodoo's yummy goodies.  

Remember, counting money can be rewarding, but counting calories when you are eating a Voodoo donut is ridiculous!  Enjoy!

Finally made it down to PDX to check out Voodoo doughnuts after seeing it on tv numerous times.  The doughnuts live up to their hype. I loved the maple bacon bar.  Had 3 over the course of the weekend.  Other favorites were the apple fritter.  

I was a little disappointed in the Memphis Mafia fritter (banana fritter topped with peanut butter and chocoloate).  I was hoping for so much more, and it was just average.  Now the maple bacon bar, ohh so tasty.  The maple bar is great and the bacon just makes it even better.

Definitely will be stopping by on my next trip.

The pink box is great, but it is the flavors that really get you going.  Where else can you get bacon and capt-n-crunch on a doughnut at the same place?  I like going to the SE location because the lines are shorter.  Keep up the good work guys.

Get the Portland Creme! I would wait in that long line all day if I could get another one. It was filled with the most delicious cream ever and topped with gooey chocolate sauce. Part of me wanted to get back in line just to get another one. We also tried the Maple bacon bar, blueberry glazed, apricot fritter, and vegan pb&j. 

Voodoo Doughnut just oozes Portland charm. From the eclectic people who work there to the sparkly paint on the outside to the highly inappropriate doughnuts, there was so much to look at that the wait felt a lot shorter than it really was. Be prepared to wait though, there never seemed to be a shortage of people in line. Its well worth the wait. You will be sad as you see everyone walking around Portland with those cute pink boxes if you don't get your own!

Came here at around 9 am on a Saturday morning and there was already a line, although it does move pretty quickly. My friends and I shared the Voodoo Sample box with 12 doughnuts.

Doughnuts included:
- Chuckles: risen doughnut with a chocolate and caramel drizzle, mocha powder and peanuts
- Portland Cream: A chocolate iced doughnut injected with a creamy custard
- Loop: Doughnut with Fruit Loops on top - beautiful
- Mango Tango: Doughnut with a fluffy apricot/peach-y fluffy frosting with a sweet mango jelly
- Dirt Doughnut: doughnut with vanilla frosting and a pile of crushed Oreos
- Marshall Mather's: Vanilla cake doughnut with mini M&Ms atop
- Butterfingering: Chocolate cake doughnut with butterfinger on top - literally tastes like the candy
- Sprinkle: Vanilla cake doughnut with colorful sprinkles
-Chocolate Coconut: Chocolate doughnut with shredded coconut flakes
- Cinammon Sugar: Basically churros but more doughnut
- Blueberry cake : glazed blueberry cake doughnut 
- Doughnut with chocolate, peanut butter and rice krispies - don't recall the name though

After taste testing all of the flavors, we each picked our favorites: Butterfingering, Chocolate/PB/rice krispies, Portland Cream, and Mango Tango.

Please doughnut be mad if we didn't include your favorite.

Voodoo Doughnut is one of very few things I miss about being in Portland. Hence, the picture of me consuming my favorite maple bacon bar graces my Yelp profile. This is to remind me of the good times to be had whenever V.D. is around. The times when bar-hopping until wee hours of the morning only compels you to consume a donut topped with cocoa puffs or perhaps you'd want to get your special friend a cock and balls combination (cream filled!) for a rockin' surprise! Yay Voodoo Doughnut. I miss you.....

I love this place!

Anytime I venture into Portland I make it a rule to get something at VooDoo!

Can't go wrong with any of the selections:

VooDoo
Maple Bacon
Gay Bar
Cock and Balls

You name it, it's good.

Many encounterhave passed since I wrote of our first meeting.  Though the flames haven't waned, my love for you has gained much depth and maturity. Scary that I say this regarding an establishment that sports a velvet painting of Kenny Rogers- but it is so.

To avoid the street theater and long lines go to Voodoo Too.

Sure, it can be a cheesy tourist trap. And sure, the lines can be long (shorter if you go to the one on the East Side), but the bottom line is that 1. Voodoo doughnuts are delicious; and 2. They (helped) make Portland a household name. Why not show some love for some of Portland's orginal weird food conneseurs.

i will be the 2000th person to review this location, so i am not sure what else i can say that others haven't said. go visit it, order something, you can't go wrong with any selection. whatever your mood is, there is a doughnut out there for you. 

i personally can't seem to try the maple and bacon doughnut, it just doesn't seem right but my boyfriend, mother, friends and everyone i know whos tried it loves it. i personally could also eat the oreo or coco puffs one...sigh...im hungry now.

long lines for sure so be prepared. the voodoo too location has an express line for non picky customers who don't mind a prepacked box ready to go.

Far and away the best doughnut I've ever had. I had the ODB and my girlfriend had the bacon maple bar. Mine was an opulent  feast of dessert foods. Hers was like bacon on top of pancakes, wonderful. Also, very inexpensive, about four dollars for both. It was worth the trip here just for these.

I think I love this place.  Everything about it is awesome, the bacon maple bar, the decor, the donuts, and the bacon maple bar.  Aside from the awesomeness that is bacon, the maple bar itself is seriously the best I've ever had.  Add bacon and it's heaven.

I also tried the mexican chocolate donut.  Perfect. Love the cinnamon, sugar, spicy goodness.

I'm usually not a huge donut fan, I live about 2 blocks from Top Pot Donuts in Seattle and I rarely ever go there...but if I lived anywhere in Portland I would be here all the time.  It's probably a good thing I don't live around here otherwise I'd be a fat blimp with maple and bacon oozing out of my pores.

Listen to the hype about this place, it's one of the few places where it actually rings true.

Such a good thing I do not live anywhere near Portland. We stopped here on the drive home to CA and bought a dozen mixed donuts. By the time we got home there were 0 left. They are so, so, so, good and interesting! Definitely a place to visit  and pig out while in Portland.
Artistic doughnuts that actually taste good. Really good coffee too.

Love this place it's always awesome and delicious everyone is so friendly every time,I come they're welcoming and even though the wait is long they still aren't pushy if you can't decide. The bathrooms were surprisingly clean and the doughnuts are outstanding wish they had one of these where I live! Yum!

When you go to Portland, you go to Voodoo Doughnut. 

I first heard about Voodoo Doughnut from the facebook post of a friend. I was intrigued. And then I kept hearing about it and hearing about it. We saw it on the food network. Of course it was one of our stops when we visited Portland in January.

Since the food network show we saw they have renovated or expanded and so the interior was not quite what we'd seen photos of. The staff was friendly.

Gosh we had troubles picking our doughnuts. There are so many choices from the standard to the unique! Every body was happy with their choice, especially the person who got the bacon maple bar - with his protein and his sweet. We'd definitely be going by regularly if we lived in the area, just to try the new doughnuts. It was clearly a special stop for many who were coming through.

Delicious, inspired doughnuts that are far from normal and outrageously mouth-watering. Worth the wait. I went on a rainy weekday morning and there was no line. If you have a few minutes during a walk around the city, this is a mandatory culinary stop. You know you want to anyways, you've seen it all over the Food Network for years, just go already and stop making excuses.

As good as a donut place can be! If you're visiting Portland, this place is a MUST! 

I came in on a Tuesday night, and there's tons of parking on the street. No wait at all. The girl helping us was friendly and patient. I recommend: maple bacon, voodoo, and the devil star. They also have stickers for $1.50 each. 

TIP: bring cash, know what donuts you want, get a hot chocolate. Bring a camera - The outside is pretty dope for taking pictures, especially at night. The neon signs and pink door make for a good ig pic!

This place serves 'em up fresh and weird!  

Here's my haiku homage:

Lustful pink boxes
spinning tower of doughnuts
Old Dirty Bastard

The Old Dirty Bastard is one of my favorites... A raised doughnut with chocolate frosting, Oreo crumbles, and a drizzle of peanut butter.  Heavenly sinful!
Delicious donuts, cash only, fast service so make up your mind before making it to the counter to order!
The Mabel Maple and Bacon Maple Bars are awesome! Great experience and the line moved quickly. Especially loved carrying the big pink box back to where we were staying.
This is an experience any way you look at it.  The donuts are delicious and the ambiance quirky!  Long waits are worth it, get to know your neighbor as you wait...
Everything I hoped for and more...Huge variety great staff and best of all it was drizzling outside so 2 minute wait yay!!!

That bacon maple donut is just insane. The sweetness of the frosting, mixed with the saltiness of the bacon is just unreal! My wife likes trying all the different doughnuts whenever we go. This past trip she got the rice Krispy donut that had chocolate, rice krispy, and peanut butter. Flavor explosion!

Long line but moves quick
Good. Long selection for all and even the vegan choices are delicious. Nice place to visit while in the area. Opens late

I hate this place!!! I hope Zeus knocks it the fuck out with a big, fat, thunderbolt. 

Just kidding, just trying shorten my wait for that Ol' Dirty Bastard.

Try the new location on the east side too. 

And, keep your eyes peeled for the Hot Pink Doughnut Truck bouncing about town. Flag it down, proceed to stuff Cock and Balls in your mouth.
So good! Waited in line for about 45 minutes but it was worth it. I thought my boyfriend just wanted to wait in line for some regular donuts but they were so delicious
Kinda weird.  Bright pink building.  Donuts to die for. We stop every time we are in Portland (which isn't often).

What makes the doughnuts great is the unusual and creative things added to them. Seems like a place one must experience while in Portland. Just try to go during some OFF time, so that you don't have to wait in a crazy long line.

What can be said that hasn't already been said.  Maple Bacon Doughnut was good enough to make me swear off diets forever!  Every doughnut we ordered was delightful.  If I had stayed in Portland long enough, I'd have tried them all!  I may have them cater my wedding... or at least my funeral as they offer caskets (!!) full of doughnuts for catering.

I love this donut place! There's a reason there's a line out the door! They are also open 24/7, making it even better! My friend and I came here on our trip to Oregon and it was the perfect late late night snack! They also have a good selection! 

I had the Oreo cookie donut and a maple glazed cream filled one. They were amazing! I want one as I write this....
My friend had the Homer Simpson donut, which is as yummy as it is funny, and a blueberry one! 

They were out of milk when we went, which was very sad, but nothing too earth shattering. The counter workers were very efficient and we didn't have to wait in line too long! 

Overall, great place to come for donuts if you're in the area! Especially if you want a late night snack!

Thank you for the renovations!  More spacious and long line seems to be easier to handle.  Line moves pretty quickly. 

 Funky toppings, non-traditional types, and F. my world good!

Maple bacon bar.  Need I say more?

My only negative thought is that they are cash only.  They should accept credit cards and charge the consumer the fee (just like Arco gas stations do.)

No visit to Portland is complete without stopping here.

We only came here once but it was a very very enjoyable 
and worthwhile visit.

I got the Voodoo guy--a donut lovers' dream come true.
A yellow cake donut filled with strawberry( (?)  jam and covered with a 
   chocolate frosting and a pretzel stick stake.  Luscious!

I also got a cake donut with chocolate frosting and peanuts----yum!
(For the next day's  bfast)

Son got a donut with white frosting and fruit loops---colorful and tasty!
He got a maple bar --thumbs up! (For next day's bfast)

Huzby got a plain vegan donut which he enjoyed but didn't get a second one........sheesh what a party pooper!

The staff was friendly and patiently waited for me to become un-mesmorized by the enticing donuts rotating in the glass case.

Most of the people in line and seated on the many picnic benches were twenty  somethings.  Ahhhh I remember those days of my youth when I could devour three donuts and not gain an ounce. 

I really wanted to get a pink box and fill it with at least a dozen donuts----but I mustered up some restraint........after all I have to maintain my girlish chubby figure right?  If we lived in Portland I'd probably go here so often I would become the new poster girl for the Pillsbury Dough-Woman ads.

Needless to say we will stop by again when we return to PDX

Amazing donuts! Will be thinking of these long after I return home. Hopefully one day they will have a voodoo donuts in Southern California . The maple bacon donut was delicious , my husband loved the old dirty bastard donut. The ones with the cereal on top , very good and love the crunchiness it adds

This place is a living legend in Portland. I've never tried their Cock-n-Balls doughnut, but I've been tempted whenever that sweet con-COCK-tion stares me in the eye. They also have doughnuts topped with Cap'n Crunch or Cocoa Puffs. When people hear about the maple bacon bar, their instinct is either to recoil or fall in love. I love the hard-to-find raised doughnut with Tang on top. Incredible. The Grape Ape, with artificial grape sugar sprinkled on top, is another of my favourites. Hell, even a simple maple bar there is mindblowing. Best doughnuts in town.

The big downside of Voodoo is that it has become a legend, which makes the line way too long to suffer through if you're a local.  People make the pilgrimage from all over to pay homage to our great little doughnut shop.  It's like being a hot girl; the attention is both flattering and annoying.

The donuts are delicious, the prices aren't bad, and the some of the names are hilarious. 

We had an old dirty b, a peach fritter, and a plain chocolate. The peach fritter was one of the most delicious things I have tasted and the old dirty with peanut butter and oreos is genius. The plain chocolate was even better than your average donut. We went on a weekday in the afternoon so there was really no line. Good amount of space outside to eat. Would definitely recommend. Also, just because something is "touristy" doesn't make it bad, unless you are some sort of hipster.

One word: AWESOME! I love the bacon maple bar. Delicious! I also had the regular glazed and the apple fritter. They were also tasty. The consistency/texture of the dough was just right, fluffy and chewy. It is also super busy no matter what the hour you go. I went late night and there was always a line. I would definitely head back here when I go to Portland, one of the best donut places I have ever tried! Plus the prices aren't too bad depending on what you order.
Great service and an incredible selection of donuts.  Do the choice of dozen and you will be very happy.

How could you not like a place with the slogan "The magic is in the hole?" Oh wait... yes, I can think of some unsavory possibilities. Anyway, their donuts are delicious. I love the Triple Chocolate Penetration, which is chocolate with chocolate icing and cocoa puffs. Mmm. I admire but eschew the Tang, Bubblegum, and Bacon/Maple Syrup donuts, which are amusingly inventive but not necessarily to my taste. Also I love that they have a donut shaped like a voodoo doll and impaled with a pretzel stick. And there's one that looks like a blunt. How charming!
Very much an awesome, fun, & delicious place. Can have long lines but worth It. Some events are so crazy!!

Fantastic doughnuts! The toppings can be a little overkill to the sugar sensitive due to the generosity of them, but I can't complain. I enjoyed the experience of the original, but Too is a little more laid back and has actual parking on site.

If you have someone visiting, you have to take them here at least once.

The doughnuts are sweet, (love my Grape Ape and the Coconut topped Chocolate one). Had the apple cider recently and enjoyed that with a doughnut one chilly night.

I like this place at night tho, because the neon sign is lit up, can really appreciate the stained glass around the top and there's not that big long ass line/crowd.

Where do I start? OMG, I LOVEEEE THEIR DOUGHNUTS! Fresh, big, and fluffy! The only reason I complained is because the line is around the corner and we were leaving town! I whole heartedly recommend the BACON MAPLE BAR!!! It's my fav by far! If you can brave the line go ahead...it's so worth it!
Saw it on the Food Network and the 20 Year Anniversary Simpsons Documentary (for the simpsons inspired Bacon Maple Bar!) Had to wait in line for about 10 minutes but the wait was worth it!

I've always had a good experience at voodoo. The doughnuts are fantastic. 

The downside:

The wait at the main location. For tourists, builds anticipation. For locals, can be avoided by going to secondary location. 

The doughnuts are not great after the first day. Lifespan of the doughnuts is maybe 12-24 hours after purchase. 

The cereal on the doughnuts like the cap'n crunch or the Rice Krispies seem to always be stale. Doesn't ruin the doughnut, but fresh cereal could make it THAT much better.

Voodoo is cash only. So be prepared. Doughnut prices average to $3/doughnut.

Great flavorful donuts been getting for years - that don't give me the typical indigestion after eating them. ( as all store and most shop donuts) The I asked the secret - told it was the oil - the good stuff !!
Great classic flavors with a Portland twist along with their own styles. 

Can get them a little further south on I-5 on trips to Cali. Heck a friend even told me the opened on years ago in Colorado before I knew it here or was on boxes. When I eventually see him will have a Great tastes from my hometown - Yahoo!!

Excellent donut spot in Downtown Portland. This is a cash only spot, so be prepared. The donuts are awesome looking! You most definitely would want to buy every single one.  Since I couldn't decide what to get, I had the cashier pick out a dozen for me. It ran me about $16.75. Not bad considering I got some regular and some super fancy ones. The donuts are fluffy and the perfect sweetness. 

This is a must stop when visiting Portland.
Ummmm maple bacon donuts? Helloooooooo teh awesome!
Wow long line! Came in the morning and it was already crowded. The staff is friendly and the donuts are really soft and fluffy.. The perfect donut :) the blueberry cake donut is really yummy :D

As soon as I regain my vision from my diabetic comma, I'm going to finish this review.....


Ok, there we go.

I think they should change they're name to "Fat Guy Heaven". Do you like to dip, or "accidentally" get, your bacon into your pancake syrup? Of course you do! Voodoo has taken in one step further. They put bacon on top on maple bars. GENIUS!

I know I could stop this review there. That alone is WELL worth 5 stars, but they offer so many more doughnut options. Voodoo truly knows how to put the special into specialty doughnut. Imagine this... a doughnut with chocolate rice crispys, and peanut butter. Wait... don't imagine it. Just go pick yourself up a No Name from Voodoo!

Voodoo has only let me down one time. I had a few friends from a touring band crash at my apartment. I thought I would treat them to some of Portland's finest. I got up at 5am to get some Voodoo before my friends had to take off. I drove out from Beaverton only to find a sign that they were sold out. Sold out at 5am on Sunday morning?! Isn't that against the doughnut shop code of conduct? Oh well. I forgive them.

Now, if you'll excuse me... I need to go make some sweet sweet love to a Coco Puff Doughnut.

First time here.  Although I have lived in PDX, I felt like being a tourist so my wife and I went to Voodoo today.  She suggested we bring magazines and it was a good idea as the line stretched around the door.  We waited about 20 mins on a Wednesday at 1030 am. I find the comments about service lacking shocking as we had an amazingly attentive cashier.  He chatted with us about the vegan donuts and despite the line outside we never felt rushed.  The donuts were good, but not amazing.  But I went there for the experience so I wasn't let down.  Worth the wait, the time, and the money. Thanks to the dark haired male cashier who switched out our donuts for vegan ones.  You rock!

Duh. It's a donut!
Decisions, decisions ... If you have to make one - Maple Bacon Bar.

Does this place really need another review?  Probably not, but I'll say my little bit.

Line wasn't too long, but once we got inside we had to get as many as would fit in that perfect pink box!  The guy loaded up the counter with all of other choices; my mouth was watering right then and there.  He piled them into the box and off we went.

We, of course, had one in the car before we got home and it was perfect.  Ah, pure doughnut bliss!  You must try all of them!

Awesome awesome awesome. I was asked if they're better than Krispy Kreme.. Not even comparable but they're still delicious. I was shocked they have several kinds of vegan doughnuts. I stopped by three times. The first two, the line was out the door and doubled back so I opted to come later. I ended up back there around midnight on a Saturday night, managed to snag a spot right on the corner and was in and out in 15 minutes. Super nice staff and cute themes. I'll definitely be back.

This place is addicting! Hands down Voodoo Doughnuts are the best doughnuts that I've ever tasted! I just moved to Portland four weeks ago and I've already lost track of how many times I've stopped in here! The first time that I came here, I was shocked that they had a long line outside of the establishment. Don't let the line intimidate you, it moves rather quickly.
If you look up "Donut" in the dictionary you will see "only truly found at Voodoo Donuts."  If you want to experience a culinary art that is in the form of a donut, then get your butt to Voodoo

5 stars for the maple bacon doughnut alone.  It very well may have turned me off any other doughnuts, which is probably a good thing.  I love the kitschy decor and the sparkly glittered gold bricks.  The voodoo doll doughnut is adorable and tasty, but that maple bacon one will be remembered for a long time!
Definitely worth the wait. Not a tourist trap. A must when visiting Portland. The doughnut was delicious.

3 words....dirty old bastard. i am from LA which has its fair share of doughnut havens (i.e. Stan's), but Voodoo is on another level. It's not just the taste, but the creativity, insanity and personal touches (like a pretzel stabbing a gingerbread man-like figure in the heart) that sets this joint apart from other places. The people that work there are what you can expect of Portlandians (?) that live and work around Burnside: out there. Over all it is just a fun place to go.

This place is just as advertised, fun, eclectic, and totally different. After asking for recommendations I ended up trying the maple bar with bacon and another sprinkled with Oreos and drizzled with peanut butter. I'll admit that the donuts aren't the most amazing pastries I've ever had but I have to give this place 5 stars for it's unique creativity that has embodied my short visit to Portland. 

If I lived here, this wouldn't be a regular stop but for tourists and visitors, it's a total home run!

Best donuts hands down. Everything from the regular maple bar to the cock n balls. Always a line, just deal with it bc its worth it. Awesome donuts!

Voodoo Parvisoo

Anyone who tells you that the lines are too long at Voodoo Doughnut, hasn't tried one.  I would camp outside the store for four days if that's what it took to satisfy my fix.  If you're the type of person that can't tell the difference, then go home, open a box of grocery store pastries and watch American Idol.  We don't want you taking up space in our holiest of shrines.

I saw this on Man Vs. Food and had to try it.  There seems to be a stigma and arrogance of the locals around here against spots that have been on TV shows.  Well this place lives up to the hype!  The doughnuts are delicious.  All the flavors I tried were excellent.  I ordered the Maple Bacon, Miami Vice, and Captain My Captain.  All three were awesome and super rich!  YOU WILL LEAVE HERE FEELING STUFFED.  Don't forget the ice cold milk to wash them down.  

Sidenote...Portland is so cool and dog friendly.  Seriously, dogs everywhere.  A lady in line ordered me randomly to "hold my dog" while she went it to get her doughnuts.  The dog sat and whined and she was back before I was called in to place my order.
They had an amazing variety of vegan doughnuts and the service was fast and friendly. Remember to bring cash!

YESSSSS. This place is the best!! Omg their doughnuts are to die for, and I don't even really like doughnuts! Not being able to have dairy makes vegan options my best friend, so I was super excited to see so many of their vegan options. I enjoyed the most amazing vegan/dairy free Boston cream doughnut and was in heaven. There is always a line, but they move everyone through quickly, and the price is pretty cheap. A must visit if you are in the area!

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G

Don't let the line fool you, it goes by fast. Delicious and extravagant doughnuts that will change your Portland adventure.
amazing and a must have experience in portland! Best glazed donut ever and the variety was insane. You have to see/taste it for yourself to believe it!

Don't listen to the haters: it's a must go! Even if you don't like donuts that much, even if the line is 30 mins and it's super hot outside, even if the idea of a greasy donut on a hot summer day grosses you out... I had a vegan Portland cream: it was delicious! There are plenty of vegan options, but probably it's not the best play for people with peanuts allergies.

Theeee BEST donuts evvaaarrr. We ordered the sample box (I think that's what it's called) and not one was disappointing. Old dirty bastard (choco-frosting, peanutbutter, & oreos) grape ape (vanilla frosting, grape dust & lavender sprinkles) are my favorites! Pure food orgasm. Yuuuuummmm!
Good donuts at a fair price. If you want to try them out, its best to go super early in the morning and get there before all of the lines.

Vodoo is king
Just time it right, there can be long lines
I hit the one by Benson High.
Good peeps and tasty treats

I'm a huge fan of there maple bacon doughnut!! I tell everyone I meet to go there and try them. Also ever time I'm in town I have to stop by and pick up as many as I can. They do only take CASH so please do be prepared for that before you go. There other doughnuts are amazing as well. They have decorated both locations with there voodoo flair. They also perform wedding at both locations!!! how amazing is that.

My favorite and "go-to" doughnut at Voodoo is the Fruit Loop Doughnut.  It is smothered in sugary white icing and topped with fresh Fruit Loops.  I've been getting it religiously for years and still love it.

Visited from Chicago and Voodoo definitely lived up to the hype for me. I bought several unique doughnuts to go and it was still delicious days later. There was one with blueberry glaze that I especially liked.
Come on its voo doo doughnuts!  Enough said.

It's Saturday night in Portland and the wife and I were on the search for Voodoo doughnut. She apparently had seen Anthony Bourdain's show and he visited this place. When he says 'go', we go. 

We get there and my first instinct was, "we're gonna get thrown out." On that particular moment, the homeless (which were few and far in between in Portland), the punk rockers, the pierced and tattoo'd were all there this evening. It's a small space about 10ft x 8ft. My wife and I just came back from a nice homely dinner at Mother's. We were dressed 'out-of-place' nice which is unusual for me. I don't like feeling like the 'suit' in the room. Regardless, our sugar craving can withstand any obstacles. We proceed. We're 2nd in line and before I even look up at the menu, the guy in front has placed his order... crap... pressure. The guy behind the counter wasn't the type to wait around to see what we want. There was also a line starting to form behind us... shit, pick something damn't. F--- it. "I'd like a chocolate donut with the creamy filling." Apparently, they come in a few shapes and I was told rather rudely. "Shit... okay, just the round filled doughnut." Whew... pressure's off. In the meanwhile, I look at my wife. She's still looking up at the menu. She's smiling, taking her sweet, ole' time. I can tell Mr. Voodoo on the other side of the counter isn't going to take anymore of this. But my wife's sweet and cute, he can't possibly snap at her. And he didn't. But I can feel his brewing impatience about to errupt. Stressful seconds later, she finally makes a gesture to order. Semi rudely, he says "So you made up your mind?"  I sort of giggled inside. This place rules, I think to myself. What a relief to find a place that's just 'real'. It's refreshing to walk in a place and get some honesty for a change. This place isn't even close to trying to be a comfy, feel good, let's-all-hug, kind of place. It's a little angry, in-your-face actually. So we get our doughnuts, we pay and to my surprise the man behind the counter became just the nicest guy. I forgot his words exactly, but it was genuine. We were so full that night that we actually had to wait to eat our doughnuts until the next morning. Bad idea, right? Wrong! The doughnut was excelent! Yes, even bagged and a day old. That should say a lot about what it could be fresh with your Stumptown Coffee. I highly recommend this place. Don't be intimidated by it's "locals only" vibe. It might feel that way, but they're genuine, unlike what you'll find in the pre-packaged, pre-screened, pre-pared customer service you'll get at Starbucks. (ok, not fair to Starbucks, but shit... there was seriously one in every freaking corner of Portland.)

Voodoo takes donuts to a completely different level. Anything goes at this hole in the wall establishment. From bacon maple to captain crunch flavored all the the way to cock and ball shaped donuts,  you're not going to find your average plain donut covered in sprinkles here. You'll also never encounter a stale donut as the deep fryers are on constantly during the 24 hours that this place is open. I'm really glad I live three hours away, otherwise, I'd definitely gain at least 15lbs from these delicious  pieces of deep fried dough.

We went to Portland this pass weekend and went to this famous Voodoo Doughnut.  My kid has dairy allergies and cannot eat a lot of deserts because of the allergy issue but Voodoo Doughnut makes incredible delicious vegan doughnuts.  We ordered a bunch of different kinds of doughnuts for ourselves and the amazing thing is that the vegan one with cream inside was THE best.  At least per my personal taste.

I just want to say thank you to Voodoo Doughnuts for making such delicious vegan pastries and I sincerely hope that in the near future you create more variety of flavors in the vegan department.  There are thousands of people with dairy allergies and it is awesome to find things like this that we can eat for our loved ones that cannot eat dairy.

Voodoo Doughnut: Raised yeast doughnut filled with raspberry jelly topped with chocolate frosting and a pretzel stake for $1.95. There are some different variations of the voodoo character, but generally it looks like a character crying for help and being stabbed with a pretzel stick.

There are all kinds of interesting doughnuts/toppings, including ones with cereal on top (see below), some even have weird names like No Name,Tex-Ass, Cock-N-Balls, Memphis Mafia, etc. There's even a mini coffin they will fill with doughnuts if you want, although if you're eating that many doughnuts, the coffin may be a hint that you should beware of the consequences...Be prepared to be caught in a super long line because this place is very popular!

On Wednesday I wanted to visit my pals that now live in the Portland Metro area and I immediately said, 'We have to go to Voodoo" and I need to pick up two donuts for my boo. So there we went and it was so worth it. I got the Butterfingerling. A chocolate donut caked with Butterfinger topping. The donut was not overly sweet but moist. Loved it. So I purchase the maple bacon donut and coco puff donut for

This is probably the most epic doughnut shop i've ever been to hands down. Their creations are something out of a large adult child's imagination. When you combine doughnuts, frosting and cereal you're definitely awesome in my book.

Went here for the first time a year ago on a trip home to Oregon. Of course because of it's widespread celebrity now there is almost always a line at this location so be prepared to wait...but let me tell you what....it's worth it. Upon entering the door your nose is pleasantly greeted by the sweet smells coming from the back. Once your eye hits the menu and the glorious doughnuts you're gonna have a hard time choosing I promise you that. It would benefit you to make your choices via their online menu before visiting because not only do they have great descriptions but awesome pics of each treat. 

My personal favorite the Captain my Captain followed by the Cock n Balls and the Miami Vice Berry. Each doughnut special in it's own right and none of them lacked in any aspect. I even went so far as to visit the Eugene location to pick up a couple boxes of tasty goodness to bring home once I was ready to hit the road on my way back to Vegas.  I will be visiting again in a couple weeks on another trip home and again will be filling orders that i've already received to bring home. Can't wait!
I got the bacon maple doughnut and it was amazing. line was long and you wait in the sun but if you go early it's short. Cute shop too.
Great Donuts! Don't pay attention to the weirdos who trash this place from their moms basement.

This place was so good, we came here every night when were in Portland! Also, I was informed that on top of all your carry-on luggage, a box of Voodoo donuts is the only additional thing you can bring through the Portland International Airport (PDX) as an extra item to all your carry-ons.

This is where the cool kids go to eat junk food. If you love doughnuts, you'll LOVE Voodoo...the mecca of doughnut shops. The owners are so talented that they can even marry you if you become intoxicated with the doughy goodness. The staff is patient as you decide which item to choose. There are chocolate-covered voodoo-doll doughnuts, ones with bacon, creme filled varieties, cereal covered doughnuts, plus dozens of other types of goodies. It's a wonder how anyone makes up their minds. I particularly like the huge raspberry-filled doughnut. If you want to partake in the goodness offered, get to Voodoo Doughnut at a semi-normal hour. While the shops are open 24/7, they'll close once they sell out of treats. You snooze, you lose. The shop only accept CASH, so hit the ATM before you get there.
Was not expecting to eat the best apple fritter I'd ever have. Thought a place in San Francisco would surpass this. I was wrong, very wrong.

Such a great expierence with the kids. We loved the variety and the ambiance of the place. The line was crazy long but it was worth the wait. The bacon maple was amazing! We had such a great time and can't wait to visit again.

It is safe to say that the bacon maple bar is one of the greatest inventions in the world. At first, when we were first introduced to this shop, ordering and eating a bacon maple bar was simply an obvious joke. However, two years later, we have found ourselves stopping at Voodoo Doughnut on each of our trips to and from Seattle. The atmosphere is what you would expect from one that is catered to the eclectic hipster character of Portland covered, literally from wall to wall, with strange pieces of art.

The doughnut is not the best doughnut in the world, but it is such a great alternative to the classic doughnut that your taste buds would have to be nonexistent to not get excited. As for the bacon maple bar, simply imagine eating a breakfast dish in which the maple syrup that you poured onto your pancakes have encroached into the territory of your bacon. If that doughnut is beyond your comfort range, we would suggest the doughnut with the Oreo topping which are highly addictive though may cause immediate diabetes.

Lastly, if you are able to catch one of the staff a bit before last call, you may be able to score yourself a bucket of doughnuts for five bucks. Yes, an entire bucket of Voodoo Doughnut doughnuts for only five dollars.

I'm not much of a donut person but these donuts are pretty delicious. What a great way to start your day. This bakery is so creative with their donuts they have bacon and cereal topping.  There display case even rotates. The line was pretty fast it was worth the wait.

I don't even like donuts and while I wanna hate tourist friendly places in big cities I have to say they have some exciting donut options that are better for the taste buds than the belly.

We stopped here twice on our visit to Portland and am looking at a third experience. Good stuff...

This was one place we had to check out while in Portland. Definitely worth waiting in line for. The doughnuts are delicious and very fun experience. So many to choose from. We took ours to a local park and enjoyed while sitting near a beautiful water feature. We bought 6 different kinds and shared amongst our group. Fun experience.

I'm not a huge doughnut person. However, every now and then, I will get that craving and want to get one. I have to say, out of all of the doughnut shops I've been to, this one has the largest selection available. Pretty much anything and everything you can think of and haven't even thought of, they will have it. 

The staff is friendly, helpful and patient. The main and only drawback to this place is the long line every time (pretty much no matter the hour in the day). The wait is extremely long and takes a very long time to make that tough decision on which one to go with. 

The wait however is definitely worth it! The doughnuts are outstanding! I can't even begin to imagine the amount of work that goes into making sure there's enough for all clients, at all times. In any event, unfortunately I could only try a dozen, of which there was not a single one that wasn't nearly perfect! If you're a doughnut connoisseur, this is not a store you want to walk by without stopping in.

Yes the lines are long, yes this place might be overrated, but who cares? We stopped by on a Friday night around 10:30PM and waited around 30 minutes. For the amount of people, the workers were able to shuffle the line through very smoothly.

The apple fritter was by far the best fritter I've ever had. Maybe I haven't had a lot of fritters, but holy wow... this thing was literally bigger than my head and tasted like heaven. I'd highly recommend getting a variety of doughnuts - try everything. Try the crazy, try a "normal", try it all (DEFINITELY THE BACON MAPLE BAR). Buy them all at 10PM and eat them until you're in a sugar coma. You won't regret it.

Word for the wise - it's true that the pink box makes you stand out as a tourist. You'll draw attention to yourself, and people WILL comment on it. Don't let them get to you or scare you - smile and continue on your way with your deeelicious doughnuts.

I don't know how they make the doughnuts so they're so fluffy and moist. Seriously, they did a good job researching and making quality dough.

And their doughnuts are fun, and cool, and some are gross but most are yummy. It's different, it's weird, but it's also really, really good. You gotta give it 5 stars because it makes itself memorable by both being kitzchy and delicious at the same time.

You need to know when and when not to go to avoid a line. And their doughnuts actually keep pretty well - they are still delicious about three days later.

This is, without a doubt, the best donut shop I have ever been to. I go to every city in hopes of finding donuts just like the ones they serve here. Needless to say, I have regularly been disappointed. The only place close was Strange Donuts in St. Louis. There is always a bit of a line at Voodoo which might deter many, but once you've had a maple bacon donut, you'll wait in line with glee. I've tried about 20 different donuts here and can't stop trying new one. But if I'm getting 4-5 of them in that adorable pink box, there will be at least 2-3 maple bacon donuts. No joke, no one even comes close to Voodoo regarding this donut (the maple bacon). The best gift I ever gave to someone was when we flew in to O'Hare and were picked up by my brother; he received two maple bacon donuts from Voodoo that I picked up for him that day. He couldn't have been more pleased.
I dream of Voodoo doughnuts. If I lived in Portland, I would weigh a lot more, so maybe it's good I only get these every now and then.
Folks behind the counter are always very willing to give suggestions whether you are a returning customer or a rookie, they will always make a great recommendation...and they have tons to choose from, all of which equal ecstasy.

This is a joint review from Ben and Sonia, written by Sonia! We wanted to do a destination Indian wedding, and chose Portland, Oregon. We had donuts from them on 4 separate occasions throughout our wedding weekend. Worked with Steven (mobile food truck unit) and Janni (over at the store). They had all our donuts ready to go for each event, and they were delicious and fresh! For our food truck lunch- Steven was ready to go and made sure all the details and information was covered before our event. We had a super successful weekend filled with donuts because of you guys, thank you for everything! Love, Ben and Sonia
Love love voodoo doughnuts.  Fun to check out the designs but donuts are good too.  Plan to wait in line but a must do when in Portland

With over 5,000 reviews already I'm not sure what more I can add. I was there 5/18 around 9am. There wasn't a long line when we were there maybe 5-7 people. Did see a long line there on Sunday afternoon. More time for me to plan my donut buying strategy. I'm thinking soup Nazi  from Seinfeld from previous reviewers experience. I got 3 vegan and 3 regular doughnuts -Old Dirty Bastard, Maple bar, Toasted coconut, Chocolate peanut. They were super delicious. Everything you could expect from a donut. Pleasantly surprised that the staff was very friendly and patient and even gave me an extra donut to make up for a tiny one. Overall a fun experience.

The actually donut is truly great. People working there are edgy and lines are long, but move fast. Knowing this, you'll be treated to great food. Bacon maple, captain crunch are amazing. Many imitations but these are the originals and best

I've been waiting to try their doughnuts forever! Finally made it to Portland. Nice little fancy shop! A big variety of donuts to choose from, you can't go wrong. I bought 4 : the peanut butter Oreo, capt n crunch, the famous voodoo donut and the maple bacon. I'll tell you what, the maple donut bacon has easily won me for the best donut I've ever had in my life. The quality of the dough and everything is just perfect! Do yourself a favor and make this a must go to destination on your Portland trip!!!!

This is AWESOME! If ever in Portland, line up and get some Voodoo Doughnut. The 'donuts' are worth the wait, they are big and very tasteful. I highly recommend the guava collada and the mango. 

Here's the video review of Voodoo Doughnut with Stumptown Coffee. They also serve Stumptown brand coffee at Voodoo.
https://youtu.be/lMLQIL6pAWE

How could someone not like this place? Fun to go inside and admire the quirkiness & cool stuff. Allow enough time to look at all the donuts in the case to decide which one(s) to buy. I've tried most, and they are TASTY. Usually I go to the NE Portland (vs downtown) because it's less busy.  Mmmmm mmmm, wonderful place!  Donuts can get spendy, but what do you expect? Have you seen how awesome the donuts look?
While some of Voodoo's doughtnuts are obviously more for novelty than others, the majority of the doughnuts actually are delicious! Great variety and awesome employees.

I was visiting the west coast in April and this was on my list of "tourist-y" places to visit. All I can say is that the donuts were AMAZING. I actually planned my trip around going back here. I visited three times and wish I would have gone more! The jelly donuts were Fawesome.

The hood is rather icky.

YES the wait is worth it & totally part of the Voodoo experience. Means that donut your gunna get is about to be WICKEDLY DELICIOUS! My all time favorite is the Dirty Old Bastard.....I mean Oreos, Chocolate, and peanut butter ON A FRIED PIECE OF AMERICA?? Just screams taste-bud orgasm. I have tried nearly all the donuts and they are all delicious the ones I won't touch though are the ones covered in tang...I never liked tang as a kid soooo not happening!

Hello and Goodbye Voodoo Donut :( until I cross the Cali-Oregon state-line again!

The doughnuts are glorious. People always complain about a crazy long wait but when I went there was maybe 10 people ahead of me, which is not crazy. The old dirty bastered is the best in my opinion. When ordering just be ready to have a very sweet but yummy treat.
Worth it. Bacon maples are so so good! Trying to get some more but the line is long so bring your patience with you and you will be rewarded

Worth the hype! I had my doubts that a doughnut shop packed with tourists would actually have amazing doughnuts....but they do! The glazed doughnut (a classic) is worth getting. Might sound lame to get a glazed doughnut at a place that serves something like the ODB, but this classic is worth it that being said, the ODB is actually quite amazing too!

Be prepared to wait in line virtually all hours of the day (and night), and come with cash.
Great donuts.  The fritters are massive and weigh a ton.  Cash only!!!

So fun and so delicious!  We waited maybe 20 minutes tops to get in and out with our delicious donuts.  I got the Maple Bacon bar and a seasonal Pumpkin donut, then my hubby also got the Maple Bacon bar and a VooDoo Doll Donut. They were all spectacular. The bacon on the bar was cooked perfectly for donut consumption. I was afraid that it would fall apart or it would be difficult to chew and I'd end up not being able to bite off just one bit, but nope! It was perfect! My pumpkin donut was wonderful. It was a cake donut that was nice and dense :D The voodoo doll was adorable and the hubby let me have a bite. Also delicious!  We can't wait to come back and try everything else!

I walked through Portland today (not all of it, for it is chilly and I was without scarf). My boyfriend and I started out over by PSU and traveled over to Pearl District, Old Town and Chinatown, then back again. We wanted to see that area and armed with my two cameras, I wanted to photograph what Portland had to offer. I acquired some decent shots along the way and I remembered reading Yelpers' reviews about a doughnut shop. That was our destination and we eventually found it. 

Yes, Voodoo Doughnuts. I was surprised at the fact that it was only a small waiting area and a huge kitchen in back with no available seating. The line was long, reaffirming their popularity and tasty product. I got the doughnut for which the shop is named and there was something so sweet and satisfying about eating something so sinful in the shape of a person. The pretzel it came with was well used in my case. I had a blast stabbing its little icing heart and watching the raspberry goo spill out. The experience of eating a doughnut here is unique and entertaining. My guy even said longingly (before my little doughnut person was entirely consumed), "I have this strange urge to bite off his other arm." To which I responded, "That's the first thing I went for!"

In all honesty though, these doughnuts are fun and delicious; an experience like no other I've had before. There aren't many places where kids and adults alike are encouraged to play or even be a little spiteful with their food! The only doughnuts that come close to this for me are Rocket Doughnuts in Bellingham, but even theirs aren't as fun to eat as this.

Huge tourist trap but I couldnt help myself last Monday afternoon when there was not a single person in line. The girl who helped us was super gracious and directed us to a cafe around the corner - Stumptown Coffee, a cute place to enjoy your donut because for whatever reason there is no seating at the donut shop. 

We got the voodoo dozen for 10.95 and it was a great way to try a bit of everything. They have tons of fun ingredient combinations like chocolate icing, peanut butter and rice crispies, cake donuts covered in mini m&ms, and yummy cream filled ones too. We also got a maple bacon bar on the side which was amazing. Three of us ate a dozen of these in 36 hours, 'nough said.

As seen on FoodTV, there is nothing to prepare you for this place.  Its morbid and heavenly all at the same time.  Their signature Voodoo Donut is a cute little voodoo doll shaped donut dipped in chocolate, filled with raspberry filling and stabbed with a pretzel.  Like I said, morbid and heavenly.  

But Ohhhhhh!!!!  The Maple Bacon Bar.  Makes me shiver in glee!!  Add bacon to just about anything and it makes it 10x better.  Voodoo donut has done just that to their already perfect pillowey mapley (sweet but not too sweet) heavenly Maple Bar by adding at least 2 strips of crispy bacon.  After waiting in line halfway down the block, it was all worth it.   The line can wrap around the block, but the Maple Bacon Bar would make up for it.  

I got VD in Portland!!

This was a fun experience.  I got 3 dozen doughnuts here to take to my daughter's dorm hall when she was moving out at the University of Portland.  1 dozen regular, 1 dozen Voodoo choice, and 1 dozen vegan.  Went back when visiting with my good friend Adrian.  His son was looking at UP and we made a weekend of it.  I like the concept.  Fun doughnuts.  I will be back so they get 5 stars.  The people at the counter are nice, too.  If you visit Portland you got to experience this place.  Why not?

This place has over 300 reviews and a four stars average for a reason. Holy crap, kids-- VEGAN DOUGHNUTS!

Of course vegan doughnuts are only part of what Voodoo Doughnuts has to offer, but it's the most important part, damn it! I walked in not all that hungry and graciously let a vegan powdered jelly doughnut pass my lips, but a few minutes later I ran back for a chocolate covered doughnut in a panic. I mean, when am I going to be this close to a vegan doughnut again?! Three stars for the powdered doughnut that was a little firm and not squishy enough. Five stars for the orgasm inducing chocolate doughnut. It was totally worth the weird looks from my friends as let my eyes roll back into my head as the Voodoo spirit possessed me.
Best donuts you can get. Just go there. In town for the weekend? Go there. Never been to PDX? Must go there. Bring Cash.
Mmmm donuts. There's something about themmmm...  Vegan and gluten free,  and a portland institution!

While on vacation, we had to stop at one of the most popular donut shops in the PNW. It did not disappoint. The atmosphere was awesome, the cashier was very helpful, and even though the lines were long, people we still nice and friendly. The donuts were delisshhhhh!!!!

Love the doughnuts at Voodoo!  I've been here many times and have to say that the Dirt Doughnut is my personal favorite!  The mixture of plump, pillowy soft cloud with the crisp, chocolaty Oreo fragments is del del!  I've crammed many in the cram-hole in my face and will hopefully cram many more.
Heaven in a Doughnut.  Its sad news when you go and they are not open, which is rare.
Sugary, sweet fatness. These people make the best PMS remedy! Or if your hubby is in trouble and he needs to apologize, he walks in with The Pink Box and all is forgiven.

Does California have one of these? Such a simple + great idea, I wouldn't see why not!

The ambiance: Quirky goth. Small little donoughut shop on a non-busy street! (Next to an adult theatre no less!) 

The food: Lots of different doughnuts! I ordered the raspberry cotton candy  + oreo cookie ones and my traveling companions ordered avoodoo doll, mudslide and lemon chiffon. I think I liked the raspberry one the best! I picked my donughnut NOT by looking at the menu but just looking at the donughnut themselves! :) It was the most interesting and colorful one I could find! 

The price: $1-2 per doughnut...a bit pricey but... it's good and worth the try! :)

The service: Quickly and friendly. There are probably 2 workers there..so the line can be quite long (we waited 20 minutes).
Very cool store! Expect a line. The donuts are great tasting as well as fun to look at. Friendly staff. Cash only so be prepared.  Some vulgarity with item names so be careful with young children.

Voodoo Doughnut has some pretty interesting and tasty donuts.  I first heard about this place through my Dad, and since we were in downtown Portland, we figured we could go in and pick up some donuts and try them out.  As we turned the corner to get to the store, there was line of about 10 or so people, and the line was outside the donut shop.  We waited no more than 10 mins until we actually got into the shop, and waited about another 5 mins.  Once I stepped into the place, the smell of sugar filled my lungs, and my eyes wandered all around the teeny shop, first looking at the kitchen as the workers busily bake, and up to the hand-written list of donuts, and to crazy-looking random artwork on the walls, and lastly to an ATM machine (since they don't accept cards for payments) that obviously looked like it had been completely tattooed with sharpie.  

I wanted to try all the donuts, but because that would put me at risk for diabetes in the future, I figured 1 donut would be good enough.  We ended up buying 6: Two bacon donuts, 1 fruitloop, an oreo donut, and oreo donut with peanut butter (aka 'Old Dirty Bastard'), and one that had some sort of white filling in it.  All were delicious, but my favorite was the Old Dirty Bastard, and then the Bacon donut.  The bacon might not look so great on the donut, but it definitely gives a smoky taste to it, which was not bad at all!

For 6 pretty, tasty, and interesting donuts, it totaled to about $11.50.  The service was efficient and friendly.  Definitely have to visit again.

I have Driven & Flown to Portland from Seattle just to get my Voodoo Doughnut craving fulfilled...Whatever Voodoo mysterious magic spell they have placed on me, I don't want it to go away!  =P

I always seem to leave with a rather Large Good Things Come in Pink Box! 

This is what I fill my Pink Box with: 

Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Bacon Maple Bar
Captain my Captain 

Heres a link to the many Flavors of Voodoo Doughnuts - 
http://www.voodoodoughnut.com/menu.php

"The Magic is in The Hole"
Love this place! The atmosphere is awesome and the doughnuts are all sorts of crazy good!
Amazing!!!! Only here could I get an m&m cake donut. Yummy!!! Worth the wait just to check out the place.

When visiting Portland this place is a must! The line is really long so be prepared to stand for a long time. I went there on a Saturday night around 9pm and the line was still really long. I waited over an hour. The donuts are very unique and tasted great. They also have some cool souvenirs. Check it out if your ever in the area!

Best chocolate raised donuts in Portland. 

I love donuts, Voodoo makes the tastiest chocolate raised donuts in town. That's enough for a five star rating. 

Never go on weekends because it's filled with tourists and they order slow. Waiting in line for a donut on a drunken Friday or Saturday night must be done at least once. 

I'm not a fan of the crazier options. The toppings on the cereal and oreo covered ones sometimes taste stale to me, but the chocolate raised donuts are the very best in town. 

The donut is light and fluffy like a cloud. They cover it in chocolate. There's just enough room to safely hold the donut. One is enough, but you'll want a second one.
I ate a maple bacon and I think I saw Jesus.

Voodoo Doughnut was one of the big reasons I wanted to visit Portland.  I have seem their products on travel shows, food shows, and even in a partnership with Rogue Beer.  This really is a Portland experience.  
Voodoo has a hip local flair to their restaurant.  Their tagline is "The Magic is in the Hole".  You can get doughnuts topped with Cereals, filled doughnuts, or their signature voodoo doughnut.  It was blazing hot, and we were not terribly hungry, so my wife and I split 3 between us.  The classic Voodoo Doughnut is really good.  The glaze and raspberry filling are good while the doughnut itself remains light and fluffy.  I have to show off a little bit by saying I got a free doughnut for wearing a Bowie shirt.
The downside to a local institution like Voodoo Doughnut is there will always be a line.  Be prepared to wait.  Also, they are cash-only.

I'm not going to lie, I generally HATE HATE HATE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Donuts. Lots of reasons why, but lets face it, VooDoo donuts are the shit. Its a scum fuck gnarly joint, but the people who work there are fucking awesome, their donuts, though simple, are extremely creative and delicious, and the prices are pretty rad ( a teensy bit expencive, but I bet they're the best donuts you've ever had )

This place has my infinite respect and patronage. I just cant get enough of those damn mustached cream filled bits of heaven!  Open 24/7 and now they have a second shop! ( rad parade btw )

Keep it up you sexy bunch of Donut wizards.

Imaginative, quirky, tasty doughnuts...in that order.
