Voodoo Doughnuts is a Portland must-do. I am reading the other review horror stories, and count myself lucky. I've been to Voodoo twice and the longest I think I waited in line was a half hour. (My tip would be to try back another time if the line looks too long...if that's a possibility for you.)

I've tried a few of their doughnuts (my wife had to cut me off due to health concerns), but my favorite is the maple bacon bar. 

I would stop in again when in Portland, but I wouldn't wait 2 hours.

What can I say?  Voodoo Doughnut is Amazing!!!  Feel like a little kid all over again!  I have tried ALMOST ALL of their doughnuts and its not disappointing!!!!! Its a MUST to visit when you are in Portland!  Word of advise: Bring Cash! and the only time there is a long line, which I have experienced, is on any holidays.  Oh! you can always take a box of these donuts and bring it to the airport! I've seen it!  My suggestion: Enjoy and don't forget to buy a souvenir to remember by, I did! I bought a mug :))))

Maple Bacon. That's all I have to say. No need for anything else for breakfast except for a cup of tea or coffee in the other hand. After watching Anthony Bourdain's episode of Portland I was craving a bite of that famous doughnut. We went on a Tuesday morning at 10am and there was still a line. Definitely expect to wait, but it's well worth it. And there's so many treats to taste. If you're one who needs to check out these freaky-sounding morning bites, there's a case to display them all so you can choose what you want. I'll take another trip to Portland just to go back to Voodoo.

I love doughnuts, and this spot is the best of the bests. Bacon maple bar is a must, tastes kinda like maple bacon, very good. Also had the butterfinger. If your a fan of butterfinger, you need to try one of these. Big selection of doughnuts, and fair pricing. Funny names and shapes of doughnuts like cock n balls are used. Seating outside only, bathrooms are inside. You must try this doughnut spot!
First time here. Couldn't imagine a maple donut with meat on it, but I'll say that the bacon made it great. When I'm in Portland, it's a go-to place any time of day.
Super excited that I didn't have to wait in line.  Crazy fun donuts. A landmark with visiting. Good times.
This place is awesome, let's face it! The most cleverly named and tasty doughnuts for your belly. Just be ready to wait in line.

I don't eat doughnuts regularly.  But I visit Voodoo probably once every couple months as a treat.  I love the uniqueness.  Apparently they are too popular for the hardcore Portland hipsters.  Who cares?!  They are successful because they do what they do well.

Past reviews complain about the loud music and the aggressiveness of the staff, but folks, that only adds to the persona that is Voodoo Doughnut. Their menu items include "cock rings" for god sake... stop taking yourself and this place too seriously. 

In short, Voodoo Doughnut is a high-energy, 24/7 machine of sugary awesomeness. The music is loud, the staff can be bitchy, and the atmosphere is awesome. Yes, there are homeless folks outside (it's their city too), and they are non-threatening, and will strike up polite conversation. 

The line was to the door, but very fast (thanks to aforementioned aggressive staff). I had the Ol' Dirty Bastard. I'm not 100% sure of all the ingredients, but my best guess would be unicorn sweat, laughter of children, and Oreos. The first bite nearly sent me in to sugar shock. By the third bite, I had full blown Diabetes. Perfect. It was cold and rainy outside, and we stood in the middle of the shop eating our doughnuts, senselessly bumping into people, listening to the music, and watching what seems like production chaos to the untrained eye, but is really a well-oiled machine of happiness. 

It's not that my standards are lower than some of the other petty reviews. To the contrary, they likely much higher, but I get what's going on here. Like me, you may be skeptical because of the insane amount of press Voodoo Doughnut has received. In this case though, it's completely warranted, and the doughnuts live up to the reputation. I have officially converted to Voodoo.

Absolutely amazing donuts and unique experience.
Best donuts in the USA - and very creative and funny - including the Gay Bar - a long-john with cream filling, covered with pink and purple Froot Loops.   Awesome!
An eye-opening experience for my 8-year-old son.
i don't think he had ever seen so many tattoos and so much graffiti.

And message to the yutz reviewer from Chicago that gave this place only 3 stars - after eating a batch of stale donuts brought up to Seattle for his important business meeting.  I'm from Chicago and this place beats the best in Chicago (Donut Vault) hands-down.
The King! Love this place. Apple fritter donut is heaven (and diabetes) in your hand. Excellent variety. Long queue but well worth it. My only gripe--they don't take credit cards.

Amazing and one of a kind doughnuts! I have never seen a shop so busy! Delicious selection and vegan options as well! Such a friendly and inviting atmosphere. I heard one has or is about open in Studio City in Hollywood and I definitely plan on going! The hibiscus doughnut was my favorite!

Maple Bacon bar

Old Fashioned Blueberry

Two best doughnuts I've ever had, the rest were good, but good lord those two are just the best
A "must see" in Portland. Had the Voodoo doughnut. Pretty good, but felt it later.

Today is one of those days I wish I could teleport so I could pop into Portland for a little after work voodoo treat. Sigh. This place is the best. Can't go wrong with the Texas glazed. They're all good. Until I visit again I pay tribute w/ my little Dino bike wheel sticker on my window. I heart you voodoo donuts!

The best Donuts in PDX. 
Must experience if you visit our fair city.

The cock and balls doughnut (this is the real name lol) is the best of the best!
This place is legit and be ready to wait at least half an hour in line to get served :-)
This place is open 24-hours a day and even has vegan donuts!

The Maple Bacon Bar

- purchased on a "sounds weird, let's give it a try" whim. I was wrong. It's not weird, it was AMAZING!! Perfectly crunchy thick sliced bacon on a big fluffy donut with teeth achingly sweet gooey maple icing! 

Enjoyed on a bright sunny day on a picnic table with a cold carton of milk, 
This was definitely a little slice of 'I'll walk off the calories heaven'!!

I'm in love. The is a portland must!! Wish I lived in the area. Phx dosent have doughnuts the awesome. Of course I had to get the voodoo doll.. it was good. My fav combo red jelly with choc frosting.. mmmm.. ill be back next year
Bacon Maple Doughnut, It is a must.  As well as the " I got VD in Portland" bumper sticker.
Get the Voodoo dozen- they'll randomly select fun ones! Always a line that goes quickly.

As I sat on my couch a few years back watching Anthony Bourdain consume a bacon covered maple bar, I knew I was destined to visit this magical establishment.  Well, more than two years later, my wonder and excitement finally came to fruition, and I made this dream of mine come true, finally!

Boy, was the wait worth it.  I ordered the bacon maple bar while my girlfriend ordered the dirt donut, and we both thoroughly enjoyed our choices.  Although, she tried a bite of mine and was somewhat disgusted by it.  I, on the other hand, loved the combination of savory and sweet, but I'm a bit weird when it comes to strange food combinations.  I can never get anyone to try my peanut butter, pickle, and mayonnaise sandwiches.  Believe me, it sounds nasty, but it's delicious!

Anyway, Voodoo Doughnut is awesome.  I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Portland or to locals just the same.  I only wish they would open a new one further on up the I-5 corridor here in Seattle.  I'd make it a weekly treat if so.  Next time I'm trying the Triple Chocolate Penetration.  Yowsers!

Came here on our first day of our stay in portland.  Had heard great things and read many reviews and couldn't wait to try them out.  Came on a sunday morning around 11am and the line wasn't too bad.  We only waited about 15 minutes until we got to the cashier to order.  I have to say the donuts were very sweet but they were delicious!  They had some unique looking ones like the voodoo doll and mango tango is very good. Our kids like the bubble gum one.  Got a dozen and even after 3-4 days the donuts still tasted pretty good and fresh.  Must be the ingredients they use to make them stay fresher longer.  If you are in portland, this is a must stop place!

So I, like any other normal Donut connoisseur have a Loyal and deep loving relationship with my regular Donut shop. In my case, Don T Hut in Burbank, CA is my shop of choice. and though i would never have another donut shop take Don T Huts place, i had an opportunity to try this unconventional Donut funhouse while spending a few days in Portland.

I couldnt get around this place. From the minute we got to the airport, everyone mentioned it.

so i had to try it.

when we got there one saturday evening, i had the bacon-maple bar, and the captain crunch on a regular O with vanilla frosting and they were both... WOW.

Very unconventional and fun tasting but nothing i can enjoy daily. theyre more like a vacation donut from the norm. 

Voodoo donuts was like walking into Beetlejuice's snack shop if he had one. it was dark yet colorful, and filled with very interesting people.

But it was tasty and quite refreshing. its def a must have if youre in the Portland area.

If you have no patience then get someone else to wait in line for you the donuts are totally worth it. My first experience with the donuts was at a friend's wedding. Instead of a cake they had a donut tower and it was a hit.  Went on a Saturday morning around 10am. I think going to get the donuts on a beautiful Portland day makes the wait easier to get through. Don't forget their cash only and even though they have an ATM it's currently broken.

Growing up in Oregon and now living oh so far away in San Francisco, I still have cravings for  these doughnuts.  As a vegan it's almost impossible to find good doughnuts and these folks have mastered it. Inventive toppings and many varieties.

Who doesn't love this place? 3am and there is a huge line for donuts shaped like voodoo dolls or huge penises...this place is so Portland it is unbelievable.

I sometimes wonder if this might be one of the biggest tourist attractions in the city? It doesn't seem like anyone comes to visit without asking about it.

Voodoo doll continues to be my favorite, something satisfying about stabbing the hell out of it and watching the jelly (blood) come out. I might need a therapist?

FREAKING DELICIOUS! So, I went here hungry on a Saturday morning which was a huge mistake because I was starving, the line was long, and by the time I got up to the front I was so ravenous that I pretty much ordered one of everything. I took the two boxes of donuts back to my friend's house and was immediately swarmed by people with half-opened eyes who recognized the "Good Things Come in Pink Boxes" logo. The donuts were gone in under an hour and the only complaint was that we didn't have enough napkins to go around, and that I didn't bring coffee for everyone (seriously? The two huge boxes of donuts and 10 coffees I brought weren't impressive enough? Next time get your own coffee!). Their donuts live up to the hype: super creative, super delicious, super addictive, and super worth every extra mile on the treadmill. This place proves that a doughnut is not a doughnut is not just a doughnuts.. these are AWESOME-NUTS and no matter what you get, you'll love it. Enough said... I need to go finish the last one before someone else does lol.

Yup we stopped here during our most recent visit to Portland.
There was a line out the door (about ten people) but even the Arctic Chill 
(in the 20's) did not deter us.

The line moved quickly.  When we got inside there was loud music blasting.
Everyone in line had these happy, eager faces.  

The counter guys were all so sweet and patient as the drooling customers pondered about which donuts to select.  

When it was my turn I once again was completely mesmerized by those rotating
display shelves.  My eyes were as glazed as the donuts until my son poked me in the side, "Mom-c'mon it's your turn!"  

We ordered the same donuts as last time.

Frosted donut with Fruit Loops

Chocolate donut with nuts

Plain glazed Vegan donut

I also ordered a 

humongous chocolate covered donut with custard innards

A classic voodoo donut to bring home to a friend.

Are they the BEST donuts?  Debatable.  They are mighty tasty!

If you are of a refined, delicate nature Voodoo Donuts is not the place for you.
The inside of the store is well-organized cacophony of loud music, counter guys
shouting "Please do not block the door" every few minutes, donut junkies slowly
deciding what to order and some people singing and/or grooving with the music.

Definitely on my permanent list of things to do in Portland.

The pink box is great, but it is the flavors that really get you going.  Where else can you get bacon and capt-n-crunch on a doughnut at the same place?  I like going to the SE location because the lines are shorter.  Keep up the good work guys.

I'm like a fat kid in like well a donut store. I dream of these donuts all the time....seriously it's a must have when I'm in Portland! mmmmm not much more can be said...taste good sober, drunk and anywhere in between! Everything you have heard about this place is true!! sooooo tasty!!

Tastefully delicious. Thankfully, we managed to beat the line around 4 o'clock in the afternoon and the young man behind the register was both patient and helpful with our choosing of a dozen doughnuts, which were less than $20 by the way -- an amazing price for their gourmet and eccentric selection of delicacies. 

The best part is they have doughnuts for vegans too; thus, they know how to appeal to everyone's appetite for sweets. Go to Voodoo, even if there is a line, the end result is orgasmic.
Be ready for the line. My favorite cream filled donut in all of Portland can be procured here: the Portland Cream.
There are so many options to this landmark everyone said to visit. There were even Vegan options! Fun atmosphere and friendly staff.

Still the same great doughnuts and cool vibe.
We love the iconic voodoo doughnut, and my wife loves the bubble gum doughnut.
My kids love the cereal doughnuts and the maple bacon.
I know that they are in other cities now, but we still like to visit the Portland location because that's the original.
A fun place to visit. Lots of crazy dougnuts. We had a great time on our visit. Keep Portland weird, for sure.

If you love a genuine Portland type of food this place is for you. I always bring out of town visitors and they always love it! The atmosphere alone will make you want to hang out here. I love that they have vegan options as well as anything you could think of putting on a doughnut!! 
Remember to always bring cash, and try to tip at the register. The employees there really do a wonderful job and they deserve it.

Long line but it really goes fast. Iconic Portland tourist spot you gotta try. My husband and my favorite was the cereal doughnuts! Cap n crunch and fruit loops ones to be exact! SOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!! Maple bar and chocolate iced ones were good too! Loved it!

A trip to Portland is not complete without a trip to Voodoo Doughnut!

I had the chocolate, chocolate chip with chocolate frosting heart attack!  YUM!
I liked it so much I went back the next day to try another type. I will be back again as well!

No real review necessary. Just go here! I can see if you are a local this needs to happen only every once in awhile. If you are visiting, then it has to happen at least once. My suggestion is go early in the morning. The PDX doesn't really get moving before 9am, so you are good any time before then. It is open 24/7.

I thought the donuts would just be a gimic. Kind of a "thing you do, place you go." I was pleasantly surprised. The donuts are fantastic. Some locals will say there are better ones, but I don't care. In my mind this is the spot.
Delicious, a definite portland staple. I could live off of the diablos Rex and McMinnville cream. I have gotten all my friends and family into this place because it is the best in Portland.
Attention all Portland visitors Voodoo Donuts is a must. The lines are long so bring plenty of water.  You won't be disappointed.

A-W-E-S-O-M-E-N-E-S-S is VooDoo donuts. Omgosh the best vegan donuts ever. This is the only reason why I'm glad I don't live in Portland, I think- if I did? I would probably get fat because of this place. Or have heart issues. Hm. Yum.

I saw this place on the Food Network and I just have to check it out when I was there visiting my family... My brothers & sisters told me that the place is super busy and they have a line out the door... I guess I was lucky that day I paid a visit because there was no line at all. I order the one that cost around $30 and they pick the donuts for me. The donuts are yummy and I will pay another visit when I'm back in town.

Yea, it's a doughnut, but it's Voodoo!  Maybe you can find a better baked doughnut, maybe not, it's not about that. It's about the Voodoo Experience. On top of that they're good people.  Clearly treat others well, are part of the community, help and promote and treat employees with respect.  That makes this shop great and that is the 5 stars alone. 

Take all that away, and the fact if you get some fresh from the oven, they're just great! Reasonably priced and tasty!  Remember bring cash, no CC allowed.  Good shoes may help, sometimes you need to stand a while.

If you are in Portland this is certainly a destination. If you don't want to come here because this place is too touristy and you aren't that person, GOOD; it will make the line shorter for someone else who wants to partake in eating a donut that could only have been created by the hands of a donut God!  We came here twice while on vacation in Portland. Both times there was a line, but it didn't matter it moved fast. This place is definitely unique and bedazzled at the same time. Yes, when you get close to the building you will see what I mean.  When I finally got to ordering the donuts, I went with the maple bacon bar, the chocolate donut with cocoa puffs, and the original Voodoo Donut. As the gentleman rang up my bill I was shocked at how cheap the fried doughy goodness was. This place, for its popularity, is alarmingly inexpensive.  That is what makes these donuts even better. I bit into that maple bacon bar and fell in love. If it was acceptable by society, I would have a relationship with this donut.  I really don't want to have another donut, because I have now tasted the best. Screw you dunkin' donuts! You are nothing! NOTHING!  Thank you Voodoo for showing me what creativity and dough frying can really do!

My first trip back to P-town in 5 years and it's nice to see that somethings still haven't changed. Voodoo is still casting a spell on it's patrons with wickedly delish donuts. 

Stopped by and got the Voodoo doll because I'm cliche like that and it killed...no not literally otherwise I wouldn't be writing this review. 

PLUS it doesn't hurt that you can buy these devilish things 24/7, well it may hurt your workout goals but that's just about it. One more thing ...CASH ONLY...so bring cash or be ready to withdraw cash at the ATM they have inside.

I have eaten Voodoo Donuts but this was the first time I'd actually been to the location.  What a fun experience!  I finally got the original voodoo doll donut and it was as delicious as I had hoped.  This has to be the best "weird" spot in Portland!

This place is a must if you're in Portland. I traveled from California and I was so excited to try this place. The weird combinations are what make the place and as I think back about how it was and doughnuts I've eaten since, VooDoo doughnuts are so good! I made sure I bought several and just took a couple of bites of each just so I could take advantage of these novelties. Just a note, they get stale the next day especially the ones with cereal, if you're thinking of taking some back home.

This was a must on our honeymoon checklist and we are so glad we went. We stopped in on a Monday evening and there was a short line. We got to see a couple challenges (to eat a giant donut in 1 min 20 secs) and all failed. The atmosphere was great though - everyone cheered the challengers on. We got a voodoo box - so the cashier picked our donuts except we ordered the maple bacon bar just to be sure! All of the donuts are amazing. The maple donut with custard filling has to be my favorite so far - the custard was light like no other custard I've had before.
Excellent donuts and much easier to get to and park at then the downtown location! Loved the "homer," "old dirty bastard," and the "voodoo doll."
I know these guys dont need my review but i have to give credit where credit is due.. AMAZING!!!  Could od without the long line though.

So coming to Portland, I knew that I HAD to come here! I'm not a big fan of donuts, but I was sure as h*#%ll going to buy a box to take home to my family. I spent like $40 in uber back and forth to my hotel in order to go here. Was it worth it? Most definitely! It's all about the experience! This is one of THE most famous donut shops in the U.S., if not the world! I can cross this off my bucket list now!

It is a smaller place than I thought and the line was so long, that I barely had a chance to enjoy the scenery. You have to come in and basically get out as soon as you're done with your purchase to make room for others. It was dimly lit, but it added to that whole "Voodoo" vibe. 

They don't accept anything but cash, so I unfortunately, had to pay $3 to use the ATM and zip back in line, so be prepared my Yelp friends! If you don't want to have to get out of line and don't have anyone to save your spot, carry cash! In a world of technology and cards to pay the bills in order to save paper, cash is still needed here, so after that little bump in the road, I finally got my big a$&% box of donuts plus some extras for a little over $40 and after some lugging around and smudging the voodoo donut faces (their fates were sealed once I bought them anyways, luckily I took cute pics of them beforehand), they were quickly devoured by the fam bam. 

They were day or so old donuts by the time I went home, so if you're a donut aficionado, definitely enjoy yours on the spot. If you don't mind day old donuts, I was told that u can buy a bucket-full for only $5! I might have to do that next time so my donuts can be better protected instead of having a smushed box. That, and save myself like $30... But again, the experience was worth it, all so I can say that I've been to Voodoo.

Upon first entering this establishment after the 45 minute wait I was greeted by 'Warpaint - Beetles' playing as their ambient music.

I just smiled and thought that was a brilliant song to play to fit the vibe of that place.

Donuts are good, but not at all something to rave about.

Just go to say you have been.

Automatic 5 stars for the experience.
Don't miss this place! It is worth the wait. BEST donuts ever! You will be drooling over them. Make sure to pick up a bacon maple. Friendly staff.

Best. Donuts. Ever. There is a donut here for everyone. Just pick a bunch and go to town! My favorite was the one oreo toppings, but all of them were so good!! A must get is their signature voodoo donut, quite fun to stab and rip apart :p

Famous for:
- Bacon Maple Donut
- PLENTY of others

I tried:
- Bacon Maple Donut
- Cap'n Crunch Donut (don't know official name)
- No Name Donut (Choc glazed, rice krispies, and peanut butter)
- Apple Fritter
- Voodoo Donut

I want to try:
- Dirt Donut
- Portland Creme Donut

Quick Disclaimer: This is my first 5 star; however, it is not because it's the first place to impress me. I have a backlog of hundreds of eateries, and several of them are 5 star...I just happened to be in front of my computer while trying these out.

I'm not a donut lover. My brother in law is, but I'm not. Krispy Kremes are great, but I also think Dunkin Donuts isn't too far behind. That should tell you how uncivilized my donut tastes are. But, despite the disclaimer, I can assure you, I have never had better donuts than these!

First is the Bacon Maple, their signature. When I heard about it, I wasn't as disgusted as most people get. Think about it, how many times have you gone to IHOP and had pancakes or french toast or something and took a bite of pancake and ate bacon at the same time? It happens often! How often has your syrup bled onto the bacon? I bet just as much. This taste really isn't a foreign concept guys; however, kudos to Voodoo for actually putting it in donut form (which is a foreign concept). The maple frosting in and of itself might have been too sweet, had it been by itself, but the salty bacon really does the job to, not even it, but compliment it. And it's not a gentle compliment either, it's not yin and yang, it's a Big Bang of flavors to really show you the impressive distance between salty and sweet.

Next, to settle down a little, the weak link of the show, the Cap'n Crunch (I think it's called O Captain my Captain or something). It's a white frosting with Crunch Berries cereal topped on it. My Crunch Berries have definitely been out too long, because they're not that crunchy anymore. This donut was pretty unimpressive. The taste of the Crunch Berries really outweigh any other flavor, whether there was supposed to be any flavor in the dough or the frosting. The frosting merely adds more sugar to the already sweet Cap'n Crunch. I didn't not like it because it was too sweet, I didn't like it because (not-so-crunchy factor aside) it just tasted like Crunch Berries.

Now, back to the pre-grand finale...The NO NAME donut. What made this stand out was the peanut butter. Don't think I've ever heard of anyone putting peanut butter on a donut before. Chocolate frosting, rice krispies, and a drizzle of peanut butter. Since it's a drizzle, you don' t expect too much PB taste, but man oh man, believe it or not, it's the first thing to hit you! You take a bite and you hear your teeth crunching the Rice Krispies, and you feel your teeth sliding through a good 1/2 centimeter of chocolate frosting! You go numb for a fraction of a second in anxious expectation waiting to see what you're gonna taste, and like the initial bang of a firecracker, you get the peanut butter. Then just like how you see the BOOM before you hear it, you're suddenly smacked with the super intense chocolate flavor. Right ; however, the flavor rushes in all directions sort of giving you an outline of how big this flavor is gonna be, and then right after, it colors in between the lines as the chocolate sweetness just fills everything in between. It's so sweet it hurts your teeth! After it's over, as dessert (lol), you can lick your lips and you get a quick light encore of Peanut Butter.

And last but not least, the grand finale. The mega Apple Fritter. This is my benchmark. Every donut shop I goto, I make sure to get one of these. First, the thing's huge. The diameter is about 1 1/3 iPhones (the long way....it's my only measurement right now). It's at least 1.5-2 inches thick. It's heavy, and it's goodness through and through: 
1) Coating - The sugar coating around it is thick, as it should be, and when hard, should make a nice knocking sound on the table. You should be able to tap it with your fingernail...check!
2) Crisp - The outer layer of this thing, since it is deep fried after all,  needs to have a slight crisp. Plus, once you're chewing it, it needs to crunch in all the places where you're getting the coating....Check
3) Flavor - It has to have the perfect mix of buttery inside with the sweet coating on the outside, and also a hint of apple cinnamon. 
4) Donut Air - All the sweet donut goodness makes the air around it smell like heaven. When you cook a donut like this, you trap air inside (I'm pretending like I know what I'm talking about). When you chew a decent size portion of this, you should be able to taste and almost swallow donut air. If you don't know what I'm talking about, oh well. 

In the end, if you don't have a sweet tooth, this may not be the place. If you don't ever like supersweet food, don't ever come here. If you have the occasional urge to gorge on decadent sugar...this is it!

Well, I'm about to explode now.
It's perfect for late night doughnuts. They taste good. They have milk. The employees seem happy. Touristy or not, Voodoo doughnuts is a solid investment of cavities and weight gain.
30+ options!! And lots of vegan options! Honestly, vegan ones were the way better than others! My favorite definitely Portland Cream! Ah it was so good!

There's not much to say about Voodoo that hasn't been said before.  Get yourself there and if you don't want to wait in line for the SW version then jet over to the other side of the river for a less busy experience.

I have only had two things at Voodoo:  the signature voodoo doughnut and the maple bacon doughnut.  They are both awesome.  The voodoo doughnut is a little guy with raspberry blood filling.  He is tasty and cute.  It is kind of like eating bento, because you are too busy staring at it and wondering at how cute it is that you can forget to put it in your mouth.  Unlike bento, you will get chocolate on your fingers.

 The maple bacon doughnut is just the best doughnut flavor ever.  I know people that are vegan except for the maple bacon doughnut at Voodoo.  The maple bacon doughnut is an excellent reason to break your vegan vows - it is just that delicious.  

If, like me, you ever order bacon with waffles or French toast or pancakes or what have you, then dunk your bacon in the syrup before eating it - Voodoo has turned that into a doughnut.  And it is wonderful. This doughnut is the reason I have not eaten anything else at Voodoo.

TIP:  Sometimes Voodoo runs out of doughnuts, so don't go too late at night.  Although, if you do go after they've run out, the store is set up perfectly for you to moon them after they've told you so!

What a fun place.  When we came here to visit (before moving here) we insisted on coming to voodoo.  Now when we have people come visit us we take them to voodoo...and its the same excitement everytime we visit.  I love this place.

Great place to go if you have family in town. Their donuts are always delicious and the prices are so great for what you're getting. 

I personally prefer the one on the east side, just because the lines are way better, but the atmosphere is great at either one.
Bacon...Maple...dounuts. 'Nuff said.

This is the go-to donut shop in Portland, no matter what magic others may claim to have.

Quality donuts at decent prices. Always a fun assortment to chose from, though I always go back for my faves.
Fun! The line moved quickly, service was great, the donuts were yummy.

For unique donuts this is the place to go. The only problem you will face is if you don't know what you want, the workers will rush you or push you aside. Its so busy at times, that it makes it hard to stay in line. I still recommend this place. Before you go visit their website and read all the variety they have. My Favorite is the Diabolo hex and the Voodoo doll. My wife loves the Marshal Mathers.
Best doughnuts anywhere. Krispy Kreme WISHES they were Voodoo.

I brought my friend from Australia here!
We got two voodoo dolls and a regular glazed donut, i had to come back for the maple bacon donut.
Best donuts I have ever had! They are so fresh and the fillings aren't too sweet!
I love this place.

Who could say no to a Tang dough nut?  Me.  Or how about a Fruit Loops dough nut?  A Coacoa Puffs dough nut?  Ok ok but for sure you'd want vegan dough nuts right? Yay!   Five stars for novelty and making me laugh!!!

We went around 2pm, so the line was only about 6 people deep. We did our homework before going, so we had a pretty good idea of what we were going to get. I'm so pleased to say that I took a bite out of each one and they were equally different and equally delicious, and they lasted overnight!!! The place is cash only so the homeless people are common in that area. Definitely look at their menu before going, and tip the staff!!! They are nonstop, and surprisingly pleasant!!

VOODOO DOUGHNUTS, I LOOOOOVE YOOOUUU!
When the topic of Portland, Oregon, comes up as a tourist destination, the first thing I always tell people is, "Go find Voodoo Doughnuts. You will thank me later." And most usually do. 
Then again, I am a doughnut fiend and miss good doughnut places in Boston like we had on the Left Coast. Oh well. Voodoo's attempts to try new things beyond the traditional doughnuts (and then being able to make it work) is what I love about this place. Regardless of the amount of alcohol you've consumed, this is a must on any trip to the land of ports.
My Butterfinger doughnut was the jam! I'll definitely come back to try some other flavors!

I am a HUGE Voodoo fan.  I don't even care that you have to stand in line, or that they're cash-only, or that the location gets a bit sketchy after dark.  I love them, and I love the original location even more since the remodel.  They're also pretty close to the Max line, so I don't even have to drive downtown to indulge! 

I disagree with reviewers that say the doughuts aren't quality and people are only into it for the hype.  Every doughnut that I've had there was amazing -  I love the unique varieties and the fact that the doughuts are always fluffy and moist.  I've never had a dry or a stale doughnut and I wouldn't waste a whole days worth of calories on crap junk food - this is the real deal.  I love the cereal-type varieties: the Triple Chocolate Penetration is my fave (chocolate doughnut with chocolate icing topped with coco puffs!).  The Voodoo Doll is also a must try (I could eat the filling by the bucket full), as is the Cock and Balls - its enormous, just as it should be!  As far as doughnut shops go, this place is a bit on the pricier side, but its worth it for me.

I've always had to wait in line no matter which location I go to, which day of the week, or time of day. I guess I've had bad luck.  I'm jealous of those that have been able to walk right in.  

News you can use: 1. Be prepared to wait the longest on weekends, especially during the months that Saturday Market is happening (and remember its Saturday and Sunday), since its just about a block away and the tourists come a runnin'!  2. The menu at the register doesn't describe each doughnut - so either decide BEFORE you get there by looking at the menu on their website, or bring your smartphone with you so you can pull up the menu while you're waiting in line.  You'll thank me.
Portland's original Doughnut shop.  You have to check it out.  I drool every time over those "Dirty Bastards."

I always thought that donuts are just donuts....well not anymore :) 

Thanks VOODOO DOUGHNUT for reforming my donut belief! 

I am now a believer that Donuts......are spectacular! 

Lovelots,
K

PS 
I want my Penis Donut!

WORLDS BEST MAPLE BAR! Poor Voodoo and its undeserved bad reviews. I discovered the secret: everyone hating on it & saying its "too sweet"--you ordered wrong. Here's the deal. If you don't want a donut that's "too sweet", maybe don't opt for the one covered in fruity pebbles and captain crunch and Oreo crumbs and drenched in icing. That is some people's thing (a very small minority, I imagine) but props to this company for being so innovative & the only ones to get weird with it. Judge this place based on the staples: like a maple bar, or a blueberry cake donut. Not gonna lie, voodoo wasn't even on my list bc all the reviews made it seem like it was too over the top and experimental...but they have normal donuts too and OH MY GOSH DO THEY DO THEM WELL. Hands down the BEST maple bar I've ever had. The donut was perfectly made, soft and doughy with a sliiiight crunch, and the icing was unreal. Maple is usually too sweet for me after a couple bites, but not this one--the consistency was unreal. I've never loved icing on a donut this much. Blueberry cake was reeeeally good too. If you're going, but don't think you would like a donut covered in sugar cereal, you probably won't and probably shouldn't order it. Stick to the basics, I honestly dare you to try and find a better maple bar.

Who'd a thunk a business model centered around middle school  inuendo, cereal, peanut butter, bacon, the phallus, and feeding drunkards after midnight could be become a Portland institution. 

Oh wait. 

Much (too much?) talk has been paid to the signature bacon maple bar, while overlooking what is (IMHO) Voodoo's true gloire: The Apple Fritter. It's gigantic, it's decedant, it's um - apple-y?

Beyond being a dirty little gem, Voodoo rocks as a vendor. Their products are consistent, delivery drivers are on time and friendly, and the products sell.

The line up outside on a Saturday before noon was half a block down. Thankfully it was dry in the morning compared to the raining cats and dogs weather the day before. This tiny shop is very colorful inside. Nothing matches. It's the kitsch that actually works! I first heard of this place on a Food Network show called "Strange Eats." I can't eat anything here due to certain dietary restrictions, however, it was still cool to stop into a donut shop that is a trademark in Portland. I did have a bit of the donut of the guy I am dating but not a full donut.

The Line up was an hour, however, the line was made faster 'cause we bumped into a guy named Jake from Alabama so we had a bit of a comedy hour between him and I about stereotypes that made most in line laugh.

The donuts are in a show case that spins like a high end jewelry show case....but better 'cause these rings can be eaten (or put on the finger). 

Each donut is uniquely decorated. It's all your favorite junk foods and things in your pantry on a donut. 

The magic is in the hole....they even have cream filled donuts where the real cream magic is in the hole (yes I totally went there).  

The guy I am dating was in heaven with his maple bacon donut...fit for a Canadian. 
The donuts themselves taste like any other donuts, however, you come here for the donut art and fun.
Can never have a regular donut again, this place ruined me by how good their donuts were. We got a dozen and they were gone within the hour. Try every kind of donut you can!
Kinda loved this place, weird creations and a fun vibe. Enjoy the ODB (Oreo cookies and peanut butter) or the maple bacon bar. Delicious.

Two nights in a row.  Friday night- 10:40p - NO line.  Get a taste for the cinnamon blunt sticks.  
Sat - LINE of course, dozen sugar monsters.  So much color and delight.
Long line but who cares right??? I'll stand in it again for that kind donut. Yummmm. They have the best donuts. I thought back east was great at dunk n donuts ? This beats it
Punk rock doughnut shop. This place is tits, come put something weird in your mouth.

Definitely checked this place off our food bucket list! Line wasn't bad. Worth the wait. We had the maple bacon, Portland cream, and dirty bastard. All unbelievable! Coffee was average in my opinion but my husband loved it.

This place is definitely worth the wait. There is usually a line outside. The selection is great and you can always find something that fits your taste. The doughnuts are a little on the pricey side, but worth it. Check their website for flavors before you go, this will definitely help you once you arrive.

STOP!  I'm screaming this in my head!  WHAT?! I guess this is why I work out, to indulge in VOODOO, heck, I'm planning my next DIET and TRIP to Portland just to head to VOODOO.  I'm a freak when it comes to good donuts aka doughnuts.  Canada's Tim Horton's has NOTHING on VOODOO.  Best creative variety of sugar, gluten, sugar, food colouring and oh, SUGAR. 

Favorite thus far, besides the VOODOO donut, the BUBBLE GUM donut!  STOP!
I'll go back!   Even if I have to line up AGAIN!

Bacon-licious. That's all I have to say....but then that wouldn't make much sense would it. I'll explain. 

I don't really like doughnuts. I don't know why and people generally think I'm nuts, but I just don't really like them. I have more of a "salty tooth" than a sweet one I guess. 

But there I was, at around 1am in Portland, pretty drunk after a session at Kells (aka the best Irish pub in North America I'm sure) and someone suggested Voodoo doughnut and a "cock and balls" doughnut. This I had to see.... We miraculously managed to find our way on foot and came upon the aforementioned doughnut-erie with people spilling out the door. When I approached the counter, what did I find? Lo and behold, there was a doughnut - a maple bar - draped with a slab of bacon. Bacon! Every slightly drunken neuron in my brain drooled a little and so did my mouth. Seriously. I dribbled spit on the front of my shirt. But anyway, the bacon-licious maple bar doughnut was YUMMY!

The cock and balls doughnut turned out to be a maple bar with two round (possibly cream filled) doughnuts at the top, all glazed together...Pink.  

Oh, and you can get hitched there as well.
The donuts here are the most creative! It is hard to pick what you want because there are so many choices. The "no name" is my go-to when I can't decide to try something new.

How can you not love a place that puts bacon on a doughnut? 

From the quirky decor to the cute punky employees, to the glistening sugar glazed doughnuts speckled with fruit loops and m&ms, this is a place you absolutely cannot miss when you take a trip to Portland. 

If you are feeling particularly romantic Voodoo Doughnuts also doubles as a Wedding Chapel!

oh quirky favorite, how do you come up with this crazy stuff?  I love everything about this place, except the line.   Voodoo Doll....Bacon Maple... love it.   Don't know if the NE store still has a patio of ridiculous chairs but it is always interesting.

I take my kids all the time to voodoo doughnuts. It is fun and they love the doughnuts, specially the ones filled with jelly. If you are visiting Portland , this is one place you must go. My family lives in California and everytime they visit, we must go to Voodoo doughnuts.  Check it out !!!
Always a delight to go to, they have a wide variety of Doughnuts not to mention cool shirt designs (and underwear haha)

Why this place would get anything other than a 5-star review is beyond me. The doughnuts are delicious and the flavors are incredibly creative. I walked up and there was no line on a Monday morning at 10:30AM. 

Maybe that's part of what made my experience so great, but I honestly would have been just as happy if I had to wait in line for 30 minutes. This place is worth checking out.

I had a hard time finding this place because I was on foot and a bit put off by the surrounding neighbourhood. But I'm from Stockton so I can hang...anyway we finally stumble upon Voodoo and there is NO LINE. We went right in and purchased a few glazed, an apple fritter and a Gay Bar. My son wouldn't share the glazed (I'll remember that when he wants something later teehee) but the apple fritter and Gay Bar were yummy. 
Definitely worth checking out and we will definitely be back next time we are in Portland.

This is a really fun place that has taken the ordinary doughnut and made it Portland whacky and fabulous. The first time we tried, the line was too long so we went back the next day. They have a variety of doughnuts, including vegan, and they are larger than the typical doughnut. They also have a variety of accessories available to add to your sure to become cult-like addiction. These include stickers and 45 rpm records. The cute doughnut shaped like a monster has jelly filling, so know that before you bite in.

I was skeptical at the glory of this place when we first moved to OR, but now after several more stops - I can hardly leave Portland w/out stopping by for the Dirty Old Bastard.  Best donuts I've ever had!  Must try this place!  :-)  Try vodoo #2 to beat the line!

Years ago my mom brought a couple of these doughnuts home and they were fantastic. The maple bacon doughnut blew my mind and the concept of a voodoo doll doughnut was brilliant.  Out of nostalgia, I had to go when I went to Portland myself,  and I was not disappointed. The Ain't That A Peach Fritter was amazingly gooey and delicious. My boyfriend gobbled down the Old Fashioned Maple Doughnut and Maple Cruller. The doughnuts are worth the wait in line, don't let a long line deter you!

Oh my!  On the plane coming here the guy next to me suggested this place and he was so right! Yep, there was a line even at noon on a Thursday! It was hard to decide what to get but everyone is line is so nice and willing to share the names of their fav's! Can't wait to give them to my 25 yr old son but of course will have to have a bite of each! The Portland with cream is what I have tried so far, and it's pretty awesome!

This was my first time at voodoo doughnuts and I was very pleased! The line wasn't too bad, either! I went on a weekday afternoon! The donuts were delicious, decorative, and fun! We got a half dozen to try a couple different ones!
By far, the best was the berry hibiscus, but Miami vice was a close second!

We really, really, really love Voodoo Dounut. We have to stop every time we come to Portland. The doughnuts are amazing and the people are always so nice. Both locations are great. Thank you so much for making each trip to Portland just fantastic.

Best doughnuts I have ever had.  I would say best in the world but there are a few countries known for doughnuts that I haven't been to yet so I will withhold that title. Line can be long but moves quickly.  I'm confused why this isn't at least a 4.5 star. You will have a few sophisticated folks that might not like the somewhat sketchy location at night but not giving vodoo a 4 or 5 is disrespectful.   Cash only so hit the ATM before you go. They have one inside but you know how the fees can be at places that manage their own ATM.

Went last night around 8:30pm and it was not busy at all. Went straight to the cashier and order the Voodoo doll, and it was amazing! Very cool, weird, different place that lives up to all the stories people say about it. A must stop in Portland every time

How does this not have a perfect 5 star rating? It doesn't matter how long you have to wait in line or the type of doughnut you get... that pink box of amazingness is perfect and worth it! It's not just for the name... it tastes so good!

Just go. No excuses. Just walk it off so you can have another. The donuts are great, but the staff give it that extra bit(e). It was my first trip to Portland, so I made sure to see lots of Portlandia to get ready. Not sure if it's art that transcends life or vice versa, but getting yelled at for blocking the door while waiting in line made my day. Thank you!

Way more interesting and tasty than any doughnut place out there!

We have Psycho Doughnuts in San Jose which everyone raves about but this is 5x the experience.

I had the classic voodoo, ODB, and the bacon maple.  Doughnut overload but each one was distinct and highly recommended!

Must stop here while visiting Portland.
ohhhhh, yesssss!!!! I love it but dont want to ever stand in the long line. I only eat it when I can get it with out waiting in a line.
Great and unique selection of doughnuts! The dough was super soft. All of them were so yummy :) definitely stop by here if you have a sweet tooth.
Went to VooDoo at 2:00am. Great doughnuts, staff very friendly and fast!!! Thanks so much.

Who doesn't love Voodoo Doughnuts?!
Being vegan, I never thought I would eat a doughnut again. That is until I moved to Portland and experienced some Voodoo! The vegan Voodoo doughnut has to be my favorite too. Crazy and fun shaped, decorated, and named doughnuts! 

The line is always out the door, going down the street. The location on Davis Street usually has a much more manageable line!

A few people told me that this place was overrated and that I should try other donuts in Portland but I'm glad I didn't listen lol and tried them out because Voodoo didn't disappoint! 

We had six donuts and all of them were amazing! The classic sprinkle cake, Voodoo doll with raspberry filling, the old dirty bastard and a Maui Coconut I believe it was called. I love all of the cool, unique varieties to choose from..not only did they look great but tasted even better!

The only complaint I would have is the area that the shop is located in, it isn't the greatest at night because it does have quite a few homeless people hanging around outside but I would definitely come back here when I visit Portland again! Just probably during the daytime lol.
Props for continuing to be amazing in general and also for one of your employees who was proactive and came out to deal with a homeless person who was harassing customers.

What can I possibly say that has not already been said? I am NOT one of those people that stands in line for much of anything. But Voodoo is the clear exception. The sugar high is truly impressive and you will reel for weeks. But there is just something that is all right about a case of sugar plums with bacon on some of them. I can never decide on just one but always manage to force it to just two. Try a different pair each time. 

Oh ya, and buy a dozen for your office worker!  They will never know they did not make it to the office!  Just don't tell them that you really did have good intentions.

We stood in line for 40 minutes but the passersby gave us lots to look at. While we waited the owner came out and let my kids take a picture in the voodoo doughnut sign. He wore some hot pants too. Lol

 I chose the portlands best which was scrumptious. My kids had a bacon maple. The cashier was nice and it was all reasonably priced. Worth the wait. Ya gotta visit VooDoo Doughnuts if you're coming to Portland!!!! You're a loser if you don't.

While I was initially looking forward to Blue Star Donuts more given reviews of Voodoo saying it's overhyped or over the hill, Voodoo has still got it! Really amazing and creative donuts, especially the cereal-type donuts like the Cocoa Puff donut which was unreal. More pictures are at http://adventuredaze.com/traveling-to-portland
If you are in Portland you have to go here! Unique donuts that are creative and fun to eat. They are open 24 hours which usually has a line waiting.
soooo yummy my guilty pleasure!!!  24 hours too!!!

Great atmosphere, hip and rich with Portland culture, get there if you can around 7:30 or 8 AM to beat the line cause it can get pretty gnarly as the day and night come together. 

We got a taste of as many as we could without going into a full on sugar coma. 

Maple bacon was key, the bacon is cooked perfectly and it splits right down the middle providing you with a hearty slice of bacon and that amazing doughy donut. 

Nothin better than a donut and some coffee before the Saturday Market and the Jazz Festival.

I have to give this place a 5 star rating because it's so unique, such a hot touristy site and they make awesome 'thinking out of the box' doughnuts. A vegan doughnut?   Thank you!  Bacon on a doughnut?  My son thanks you!

this place was a complete stereotype of, well, itself. it kind of reminded me of the vegan biker bar asylum in adam's morgan in DC. badass with identity crisis? maybe, but i dig it. it's got it own style and attitude- tiny shop, open late-night, tens of donut flavours including (i counted) 9 vegan ones available at the time. i had the glazed vegan donut and the oreo cookie vegan donut and both were delicious. they had an old-fashioned-style donut  base with their respective yummynesses on top. nowhere to sit, but didnt need it. we were solicited for change to "save the smurf" by a young woman pointing to a small stuffed smurf in glass jar, on our way out. perfect.

Best doughnuts ever! I got a maple doughnut with a mustache, a white sprinkled doughnut, and a glazed. The customer service was great too! Just passing through Portland now. Cool place to hang out at on a beautiful sunny Oregon day.
Loved this place, fun atmosphere friendly staff and delicious doughnuts!! Love the variety, can't wait to go back!!

This place is fabulous. I've been here a bunch of times, and I'm always impressed by the wonderful customer service. And despite the always-funky decor and definite local decor, it's always spotless. They also go with the Portland tradition of pure, wholesome ingredients.

Voodoo donuts!!!!! Be still my beating heart and Lordy save my hips abs waistline!! I came to Portland from the Midwest for a work trip. I had always heard of Voodoo donuts, so I went, I tasted and tasted and tasted. Two donuts!!!!  After being here for a few days, I heard several locals express their preference for Blue Star donuts. So, I had to try just to see how much better these donuts are compared to Voodoo. Sorry, but absolutely no comparison!!!! I much prefer Voodoo!!! These are amazing donuts with attitude. I leave Portland a Voodoo donuts fan!!!!

(06/07/2010) Crazy and crazy delicious donuts in the Portland area.  They are open late night, for all those with the after-going out munchies as evidenced by the line around the block at 2 am.  They've got a donut for any and every sugar fix might be your fancy (bubble gum, Captain Crunch, maple bacon, grape soda, etc.).  Their attitude may be too cool for you, but don't let that deter you from joining in the sugar junkie feeding frenzy.
We waited in line twice in 24hrs. Yes they are great doughnuts. I redommend the raised ones, not cake doughnuts. Dozen doughnuts are $8.50

YUMMY! 

I normally do not eat doughnuts (my other favorite doughnut place went out of business), but for Voodoo I make an exception. Their doughnuts are creative, fun, and of course delicious. Make sure you have some crisp bills since it is cash only.

This was a very interesting stop and would have to vote the donuts worth it! It most certainly is a novelty type of shop. If you are looking for "healthy" food, this isn't going to be the place for you. Their large and very sweet donuts have many flavors to choose from. The atmosphere here is upbeat and energetic. You will likely be waiting in a long line, but wait time typically isn't outrageous. I'm not a huge donut fan, but these were pretty good and I'd recommend to anyone visiting the area. If you haven't had Voodoo donuts before, try them at least once!

My friend and I were visiting Portland and this was one of the higher recommended places to go, but we heard the lines were a bit ridiculous, PLUS there is a Universal City, CA location.  So we weren't set on going and standing in line but we randomly walked by after dinner and the line was decent, so we went for it.

Only took maybe 15 mins, which wasn't bad.  We both decided to share the oreo "dirt" donut.  It was delicious and we both were very happy.

My boyfriend and I came here on my birthday after years of watching profiles on the Travel Channel.  We came in the middle of the afternoon so naturally we had a lengthy wait (as this now seems to be one of the biggest tourist draws in Portland).  The line, for all of its scary, scary length did move relatively quickly, so that was good.  

When we finally reached the front of the line, we ordered quickly and with purpose (we had been waiting for this and had educated ourselves about our choices appropriately ahead of time), and filled up a box of doughnuts to sample.  The doughnuts we tried that day included: 

Bacon Maple Bar
Memphis Mafia
Dirt Doughnut 
Mango Tango
Miami Vice Berry
Dirty Snowball
Old Dirty Bastard
Voodoo Doughnut

These doughnuts totally lived up to our expectations and were absolutely worth the wait (at least to have our little doughnut fest once).  Look, if there are people who can find much better doughnuts (as some reviews suggest), then I surely envy them, because these are quality doughnuts.  They are sweet, but not the overpowering sweet of something like a Krispy Kreme.  They have good texture and consistency and good flavors.  The whimsical names and toppings adds an extra element of fun that is lacking from most other doughnuts.  We were very happy with our sampling right up until we entered a sugar overload that lasted well into the next day (evidently there can be too much of a good thing).  

I would definitely recommend checking it out and encourage them to open a store in the Bay Area (so we can get some more!).  

Thanks Voodoo Doughnut!  It was fun!

If you like doughnuts, so.. everyone, you need to go to Voodoo Doughnut. You don't  have to have bizarre taste or be a hipster to enjoy this place. My personal favorite is their apple fritter; boring, I know, but deliciously boring.

But perhaps my favorite thing about this place is that they will give a bucket-full, or bag-full, etc, of doughnuts to they city's homeless for $5. How sweet.

There aren't many words to add to the awesomeness of this place. It is definitely worth the line up for these doughnuts. Awesome to pair it with the stumptown coffee which they also serve there.

Here's my Vlog of Voodoo Doughnut

https://youtu.be/eQVHaVEPmLE

Have been to Voodoo Doughnuts so many times. Love this place. Great doughnuts and great employees. The waiting in line sucks but oh well that's why they are so good. Everyone loves them. I wish they had another location but its cool with the 2 locations. Can't wait to go back and get some more doughnuts. Yummies!
Had the O.D.B. bc peanut butter, felt the voodoo. The hype on all those travel shows is real!! This place is awesome, right down to it's golden glitter bricks.

If you're in Portland, one must go here. An institution. Place was small and dumpy. Small  line... people were saying they've never seen the line this small. I think the line takes awhile because the yahoos don't know what they want and they take a long-ass time looking at the menu and doughnut display. Them clowns need to do their homewrok and know what they want when they walk in. Seriously, the gal at the counter was fed up (in a nice way) and yelling "Who wants a doughnut?" I stepped up and got me a bacon maple bar and a monster. Fabulous. Besides being weird, the doughnuts really are delish.

This place is an institution.  Like Powells bookstore, you can't go to Portland and not swing by on your way through or on your way home.  It's just a MUST GO TO PLACE in this city.  They have every kind of donut you could possibly imagine.  My personal favorite is just the classic jelly filled donut, and I must say the one from Voodoo was just perfect.  Keep an eye out (or an eye on Twitter) for the Voodoo Doughnut food truck around Portland.
actually not that great, but i would rather keep the tourists lining up here than going to the good spots and making me stand in line.

Voodoo Doughnut is always a treat since I am a donut fiend. I prefer their NE location as the lines are smaller. I have a handful of favorites including Grape Ape, Mango Tango (?), Miami Vice Berry, Dirt doughnut, and of course the Cock N Balls! I also love the atmosphere! Very Portlandia :)
When I felt bad and we had just moved to Portland, my daughter bought me some of these. I ate them all day. Awesome!
As far as donuts go, they were good! The Maple Bacon was excellent. The line wasn't as bad as everyone says. All in all it was a pleasant experience !!
An institution, indeed! The line doesn't get any shorter either. Dough is always fresh, soft and never too doughy. I'm especially fond of their Fruit Loop Cereal Bar with Cream filling. Yum

I'll say this - although the donut shop is entirely overrated, the donuts really are pretty good. There is a crazy long line, but if you're going for the novelty of it then I think it's worth it! The prices aren't terrible. If you go early in the day, they have $5 buckets of leftover donuts from the previous day. Most are gross but some are good and you can't beat $5 for a bucket of donuts!
Great variety of doughnuts. Best I have had so far! Bacon maple bar is to die for!

The line is super long! The lemonade doughnut was worth it! My boy friend got an ole dirty bastard. We got a couple others with funny names. This was a one time thing for me. I can't handle the over 30 minute wait. Worth going to at least once!
Oh so delicious and the variety is unusual and creative. Friendly staff and the long lines move quickly.

Totally a tourist spot, but by far the best doughnut I've ever had.  The place has all the weirdness you would expect from Portland and there was a long line when we went on a Monday night at 10pm.   It was worth the wait.  It's not something I would eat everyday, but it was quite an experience and got a good taste of Portland by visiting.
best donuts everrr. the experience is pretty cool!!

There is little I can add to the existing reviews or photos.  This place is amazing beyond all measurement.

Well, to be fair, the doughnuts are not the best I have ever had in terms of quality, but they're pretty good, and the sheer variety and novelty is what matters.

There is a lot of hype about voodoo doughnut! The hype is much about the consistent great doughnut you get every time !  The crowds this place attracts is sometimes BANNANNAAAAS!  But the wait is well worth it ! 
 
My Favorite doughnut would have to be any of the fritters ! They are quite killer! They have one with Peanut butter and chocolate chips ! NOTE! This doughnut is HUGE! ! I would recommend sharing this ! 

Also try to go at there off times so you dont get caught waiting ! Waiting for Sweets is the WORST ! All in all i love this place !
Great variety of choices, there is always a delicious donut.  It is worth the wait.

I have waited in line downtown with the many for one of these doughnuts and while very tasty and interesting options I don't think  I would go back to the downtown location.  Thankfully there is another option right off sandy that is much larger.  Just remember that this is a cash only place!

Yes, the lines are long and yes, this spot is mainly for tourists but the doughnuts are fresh and delicious! They have fun names and great flavors. If you are visiting, you should definitely carve out some time to go get these goodies. 

I'm pretty sure there is always a line but it moves relatively fast and it's cash only but they do have an ATM inside.

I got the cock and balls donut as a joke from here. It tasted pretty great!! I love this place for donuts. Sometimes there is a huge line infront of it especially on holidays. I don't think you could make a mistake with any donut from this place

Unique experience to say the least. It is a very famous establishment if you haven't been here give it a try. it won't be like any other doughnut experience you've had before. The doughnuts are so creative and unique not to mention tasty! Voodoo doughnut is truly a one of a kind place, I'm sure a few places have stolen some of their ideas but voodoo is the original and the best! We went on a Sunday afternoon and the line was pretty long but it wasn't a terrible wait and it was totally worth it! The line may seem a little off-putting but well worth it in my book (I'm sure weekdays aren't as busy) I will say that our order was a little messed up but I had ordered quite a few donuts and had omitted one and got a different one. The cashier told me I ended up with an extra but I think it may have been one of less value, I can't say for sure if maybe it was intentional or by mistake because the place is incredibly busy my only complaint but even with a wrong donut or two it was still a great experience. Tasty tasty doughnuts and some of the most unique around. Give voodoo doughnuts a try, you won't regret it!
Yummy donuts. Cool atmosphere! Friendly staff and service. Definitely should check out if you're in the area.

The only good thing about Voodoo Donuts being in Portland as opposed to where I live in the Bay Area is that I'm not going there everyday to get my donut fix. If I lived in Portland (never happening) or they opened one in the Bay I'd bloat up to zeppelin size in a matter of days.

So far I've had the Grape Ape, Oh Cap'n My Cap'n, Ol' Dirty Bastard, No Name and the almighty Bacon Maple Bar. They were all great with the exception of the Maple Bar: it's without a doubt, far and away, not even close, I couldn't even be more sure of it, hands down my favorite donut in the world. And I don't even like normal maple bars. But add that bacon and Voodoo has successfully created a whole new drug for me to go crazy thinking about when I'm 500 miles away from it!

Seriously, there should anonymous support groups for people suffering from Voodoo Donuts addiction. VDA

Made my second visit to Voodoo the other day, while waiting to drop my bro off at the Train Station.  So, I had to take my bro here so I could get him a maple bar with bacon on it.  Also wanted to pick up a dozen donuts to take to work the next day (man, my co-workers are so lucky to have me!). 

My dozen donuts ran the gamut of craziness.  I had a spicy Mexican donut, a few Voodoo Doll donuts ( i like the pretzel which is stuck in them, and how they are filled with a red filling---which looks blood-like), and some blue, orange, and purple donuts.  

The funkiest ones I grabbed would have to be the "cereal donuts"!  I mean, c'mon now!  One of these donuts had some Cap'n Crunch Berries all up in here!!!  Then there's the Fruit Loops one, too!

Now these donuts didn't ride so well all the way back to the Tri-Cities and 24-hrs after they were picked up.   The icing was a bit melted & mushy (and I hear the Fruit Loops were also a bit soggy).

My only regret---not tasting any of these donuts for myself.  I let my co-workers partake in the Voodoo-ness!

Lived up the HYPE! We were not disappointed! Being new to Portland we had to stop by for a bite, we walked from downtown waterfront to VooDoo. I know craziness but we wanted to explore Portland. Well worth the 45min + walking adventure. We stopped in on a Thursday afternoon around 2-3pm and on Friday 13th around 1-2 NO LINES! I was preparing myself to wait for hours but no lines out the door. 

First round we tried only one it was the ODB : Old Dirty Bastard Doughnut Raised yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, Oreo's and peanut butter. Sounds crazy but it works so well together! I don't know how they come up with these flavors but please don't stop! It was 88 degrees outside but we devoured that donut before it even had time to melt outside.

Round two day two in Portland. We decided to order a few to go this time. It's Friday 13th we had to get their classic raspberry filled voodoo doll donut, Butterfingering Doughnut: Chocolate cake doughnut with vanilla frosting and Buttefinger crumbles, No Name Doughnut: Raised yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, rice krispies and peanut butter!, and last but not least the Memphis Mafia Doughnut: Fried dough with banana chunks and cinnamon sugar covered in a glaze with chocolate frosting, peanut butter, peanuts and chocolate chips on top! I'm not a fritter fan but the mafia was amazing with the banana chunks. It's pretty messy but which donut isn't messy! We loved every donut!

I've bookmarked this location 3 times it was one of the highlights on our Portland trip!

Let me just start by saying, yes, there is usually an obscene line. However, the wait is absolutely worth it. This time, I was in Portland for a bachelorette party, and needed a special order. Parking was a bit of a pain, but honestly I wouldn't have gone anywhere else. We decided that instead of the traditional male genitalia cake for a bachelorette party, we'd get a dozen "cock n balls". They were so accommodating and hooked us up with some special "bachelorette" versions of the specialty. I don't know if there are words adequate enough in the English language for me to sing their praises. I love everything voodoo.

Most delicious doughnuts we've ever had!!! Yes we waited 45 min but we came from Seattle for the day so we had to try voodoo! The bacon maple bar and the captain crunch ones were our favs...and the staff was very nice and friendly...LOVE!!!

Wow. This section of town is weirdo central. Meaning the clientele are definitely colourful to say the least!
At first glance, it quickly becomes apparent that this is NO ordinary donut shop!-Aside from the unusually charming name, it appears somewhat like any old donut shop, but that is where the regularities cease! 

My cashier, is apparently a former HOMELESS person, who then chose to literally SPECKLE his face with homemade blue pen tattoos, but again, I try not to judge, and proceed to give him my order...which sounds something like " Yeah, Um 'hi', I've never been here before, so I guess I will get a PINK one, that BLUE one, 2 Maple Logs, a "Cock N Balls", an Old Fashioned and The Oreo Cookie one". and with a mouthful of syllables...I was DONE! That was probably the start of Diabetes as well! 

The place is INCREDIBLY popular, my friends on FaceBook all recommended I go there, so of course, like a mule...I DID!

They are open 24 hours a day (Thanks YELP for clarifying that!) and have 4 locations.

They were sold out of t-shirts (Thanks Tourists! Oh yeah...I was one too!) so I couldn't get one sadly to commemorate my adventure at this circus side show section of town filled with an odd assortment of locals!

This place is a little intimidating with the long line but they are beyond efficient.  Best donuts out there. I would definitely recommend if you are in Portland you need to come here at least once.  I wish that they had fat kid shirts but they recommended me to go online to their website store. Love this place.

Was so excited to have multiple vegan options to choose from (cake and raised alike). I had a chocolate glazed raised and a peanut butter oreo vegan raised donut. While I've heard (and read) several comments that this place is a just a tourist stop, these are probably the best vegan donuts I've stumbled across. I don't think a non-veg patron would be able to tell the difference.

Also worth calling out - if you go during the week or early in the morning, the line is significantly shorter (if there is one at all).

OMG, AMAZING DOUGHNUTS. Such an awesome place. It's been so long since i've been here, but the last time was amazing.
You can't go wrong with any of the donuts here.
The only thing problem is the line for this place, it can get pretty long during different parts of the day.

Every donut is there own signature! Service is spot on and love going to the one on Sandy. Some of my faves are the classic, and the bacon topped maple bar! The helpers are fantastic as always and go out of their way to make sure u are truly satisfied.
In love with the maple bacon bars but every doughnut that I've had I've never been disappointed so far. all so moist and just scrumptious

Great tasty donuts! The line seems daunting but it goes really fast- I mean they're just putting donuts in boxes. 

Prices do vary but keep in mind most are super fairly priced. Like about 1-3$ each, only the larger ones are 5-6$ (like cock and balls and Memphis fritter).  

Would come back here again with my vegan friend. Everyone is welcome here!
I love the grape ape donut  please open in Seattle please please  my heart hurts every day that I don't eat the grape ape donut. It's better than every other donut in the world probably
Too much fun.  Vegan donuts available too, excellent stuff.

Its sad to see the biggest tourist attraction in Portland is a doughnut shop. But this place is AWESOME!

The history about this place is hilarious if you know the story. I took some underground tour in Portland and they were talking about the history of this place and the doughnuts they use to have. 

Anyways I tried the Bacon Maple and Portland Creme! I was VERY IMPRESSED with the Bacon Maple. Very interesting combination but it tasted great. The Portland Creme was ok for me, just tasted like a regular cream doughnut. The staff members were great at crowd controlling the line when it was out the door, and they gave great recommendations. I love the decor inside the shop. Its really small but there is outdoor seating with lots of room to eat.  Prices were cheap about $2 a doughnut (Cash Only!). Not bad as you can't really get these anywhere else (except Seattle I think..)

Wish they got rid of the homeless people asking for money to the patrons in line outside and all the street performers, but thats what you get when you got the biggest tourist destination in town!
No line, and you had all kinds of vegan donuts! And they were delicious. What more could we ask for?

Creative, and although people less willing to give it more stars, I'm still liking it as it's before! Three favorites are: maple bacon, the oreo, and the voodoo doll. If you have less than 30 min and you see the line goes until the end of the pink queue border, don't bother to try - you won't make it.

OK...Totally amazing donuts!!! I do have to say it doesn't matter what time of day or the day, you will wait in a long line. So, relax and enjoy it because it is well worth it!! I know the Maple Bacon is the favorite but we decided to go different. Axel (my husband) went with Triple Chocolate Penetration and the Memphis Mafia...both were great, but he couldn't finish both in one sitting and almost went into sugar shock (in a totally good way) :) I had the Arnold Palmer and the No Name... the Arnold was as light as a cake doughnut could be and the No Name was great with it's real peanut butter drizzle on it!!!! We loved the doughnuts, but defiantly to be enjoyed one at a time :)
Doughnuts are delish!!! The choices of doughnut types was overwhelming, but our cashier helped us pick out several different types. They also serve Stumptown coffee. Breakfast of champions!
Long line but went by fast. I got the voodoo doll doughnut so cute! The chocolate was so good and the doughnut was fresh and soft!  Definitely a must and so worth it from coming from la!
I am not a doughnut person. But these aren't real doughnuts, they are made of dreams! Maybe I'm a donut person now...

Excellent doughnuts, no matter if during the day or 1:30 AM!!  I cannot get enough of the Triple Chocolate Penetration and the Old Dirty Bastard!  My friend especially loved the Bacon Maple Bar, saying it was heavenly.  
Sara had the VooDoo Doll doughnut that you can stab and raspberry jelly in the form of blood comes out, fantastic!

The only drawback is not having working bathrooms when you have to stand in the mega line......not cool, but I guess it is worth peeing in your pants for to snag a bite of these awesome doughnuts

The vegan donuts are amazing! There was a line of course but even in 26 deg weather it was worth it. They have a whole shelf of vegan flavors and they are open 24 hours a day. I highly recommend the vegan apple fritter. It's helpful to check out the menu online before going.
Awesome as always. We went to Voodoo II for the first time and they were really nice and donuts were great, as always. We love the Maple Bacon Bar, the fruit loop and the voodoo doll donut!

CASH ONLY CASH ONLY CASH ONLY
ATM inside but with a fee of course

I go to Voodoo probably once a week downtown, and once a week to their eastside location. 

If your not from Portland you'll be shell shocked when you go to the downtown location. It's great seeing the tourists but here's some advice.

Just get a VooDoo Dozen because you can then try 12-13 of their donuts instead of taking foreverrr to figure out what you want!

I love the TexAss but my new favorite thing is to get the "tip donut" (whatever they made up) at their eastside location. If you want to sit down, go to that one. If you want a Portland exp., go downtown. I think the Portland Walking Tours even goes there. 

Always gonna be a line so don't complain and please, please, please, if you're not from our city, don't gawk at the homeless and hippy crowds. They're awesome and usually provide a great conversation. Buy them a donut. KEEP PORTLAND WEIRD

Awesomely little qwirky place that makes odd combinations of doughnuts.  Open 24 hrs, cash only, and underground hip hop played while you're waiting.


try the "old dirty bastard", chocolate covered with oreo's and peanut butter ontop!
Love this place! The chocolate donut with coco puffs on top is a personal favorite, but I love the classic maple-bacon bar. Open 24 hrs which is handy for beating the long line.

Worth the wait. Best donuts ever had. ODB, Grape Ape, Very berry hibiscus, mango tango ...perfect. If you can't decide go for the voodoo dozen where they pick for you but seriously these donuts are lit

We went for dessert after dinner & got the Portland Cream donut. It was delicious - very solid cream filled donut. The shop was very cute as well. Enjoyed our visit & wish we could have come back to try more flavors. Next time we visit, we will definitely be back!

The doughnuts are delicious.  There was a line but it went very quick.  It is a small location and they take cash only.  There were lots of choices and although unique names all the donuts we have tried have been scrumptious.
My son had Too Doo donuts instead of a cake at his wedding reception.  Everyone enjoyed them!

On fait un peu la queue, carrment meme,

un samedi soir de juillet.
(A la fois Portland c'est tellement cool que meme une queue pour un doughnut c'est d'la balle).

Aprs, il faut choisir! Des noms rocambolesques pas toujours comprhensibles pour des non natifs, vulgos et bien dlires, quand on se fait expliquer, on regrette que la France ne soit pas plus audacieuse dans ses parfums et noms de beignets...

et l, tu manges ton doughnut, et juste le reste de la terre n'existe plus.

Tu prends l'quivalent de 10ans de graisse et de sucre, mais tu t'en fiches parce que ton doughnut rable bacon, et ta Voodoo Doll (une petite poupe au chocolat avec un stick en bretzel que si lui ouvres le bide elle saigne de la confiture) , ben ton doughtnut, l, il te restera en mmoire pour le reste de ta vie. Et une fois quitt Portland, tu veux juste faire aucun autre voyage que de retourner lbas. Et de manger ces putains de beignets.

La petite boite rose inoubliable. Un grand moment dans ma vie.
Et dans mes cuisses aussi !
Whoever decided to put bacon on a maple bar is my hero.  It doesn't get any better than that in the donut world.  I would make the two hour drive to Portland for this alone.
so they have a maple glazed donut topped with bacon! can you believe it? also oreo cookie donut, coco puff donut, chocolate cake donut...if homer simpson was a person this would be his donut store!

BACON MAPLE DONUT!! nuff said.. 

or if you want more words, magical donut in my mouth... the voodoo donut was good too!!

Yes, it's worth the hype. Yes, doughnuts are bad for you. Yes, you should have one anyway.  I am suspicious of places that sell a massive quantity of any one food. How can they keep up with quality? The simple answer is voodoo does doughnuts  & they do them well. Extra cool points to the staff for giving a 5 gallon bucket FULL of doughnuts to a guy who had been trying to get a doughnut for weeks but kept encountering a massive line. They rewarded his persistence handsomely.:-)
