If all they sold there were those stinkin' maple bacon bars, they would still receive 5 stars from me. I was only in town 4 days, and managed to go 3 days out of the 4. This place is visually and gastronomically stunning. 

A must when in Portland!

We came here and bought a ton of different types of doughnuts and decided to try the bacon maple bar first. OMG it is the BEST doughnut I have ever eaten in my life. The combination of sweet and salty went together perfectly. 

We also got...

Voodoo Doll- ours looked extremely sad, probably because there was a pretzel stabbed into him. Poor voodoo :( He was yummy though MUAHAHA!

Portland Cream- filled with Bavarian cream. It was ok but I'm not big of cream filled doughnuts.

Grape Ape- tasted very grape-y. 

Dirt Doughnut- tasted like cookies and cream, yum! :)

Maple Blazer Blunt- didn't taste as good as it looked but it was fun to play with before eating.

Marshall Matters- m&m's on a doughnut? Yes please!

Old Dirty Bastard- I'm not a big fan of peanut butter so I only thought it was ok but the others loved it.

Miami Vice Berry- it was only ok.

No Name- I had a bite without peanut butter and I liked the rice krispies and chocolate flavors together

Apple Jack- I heard it was a one day only thing. It was maple and apple jacks. It was pretty good, minus the fact that the apple jacks were stale because we waited a few hours before eating this one (that was dumb of us lol).

We ended up waiting about 40 minutes on a Saturday morning but it was well worth the wait. If the line wasn't so long, I would have gotten back in line to get another bacon maple bar. I'm sad that I live so far away. :(
Must stop if you are doing a Portland tour, line is long, but thats because they are so good!

Dear Voodoo,

I thought you were going to be all hype and not deliver. You delivered. You conquered my belly. We walked into the 3rd street location looking for a yeasty donut. I ordered the wrong one, but you were so nice to offer me the one I came in for without any hitches. I wanted the Raised and I accidently ordered the Old Fashion (or something like that). For that lesson, I will never forget. It was not overly sweet, which is highly important in my donut experience. It was not overly mushy, like Krispy Kreme. It was substantial and delicious. You are definitely no hype... we'll be back and we'll bring friends! Did I mention... open 24 hours? I love that!
These donuts are the best I've ever had, anywhere. I like the vegan ones especially, and I am a meat lover!!

Open late or early relatively.

Bigger chewier donuts.  colorful flavor combos as well as all sorts of yummy traditional types.

What not to love?
A Portland must. At least once. I do belive their are better donuoughts in the Rose city, but Voodoo is a quirky staple to every hipsters diet. Delicous all around.

You had me at Grape Ape.  If it were not for that....well, and the Memphis Mafia I'm not sure...oh, and the Peach Fritter (I digress) I'm not sure I...oh, right honorable mention for the mango, um...where was I?  Right...in dire need of a doughnut fix right now.
Very long line in the afternoon. We went early in the am and only had to wait 10 min. Doughnuts were amazing and all the over indulgence you could ask for
Wow!  After eating here, I wish I could eat doughnuts every day!  I'm sure I could but geez how big would I be then.  Stop in and get the biggest glazed doughnut you've ever seen in your life!

I've lived in Portland for many years and grew up just over the river in Vancouver, WA and I really love Voodoo despite many Portlanders saying "Blue Star is better". To be honest, they're completely different. Blue Star is awesome if you want mostly plain donuts, but if you're seeking something as weird as Portland is Voodoo is the place.

Though I've been to Portland tons of times I only just moved here and I ONLY just had my first voodoo this past week. A cock and balls, generously suggested for me. Not only are the doughnuts delicious, but they're fun. Go here. Forget about your regular doughnuts.

We came here 3 times of the 4 days in Portland. The donuts are sweeter than the other donut shops. Yes. They are amazing. Yes. You will go home and think about them. And yes. You will come back for some more. I've tried about 5 variations, favorites being the Apple Fritter and plain donuts. Get some cash. They're a little more expensive but worth it. Staff could try to smile every now and then :) 
Get in line. And be amazed.
Just Wow! Weird stuff, but oh so yummy! Staff is friendly, but bring time for the long line outside the shop. Oh and cash only. The Portland cream is excellent, rivals Boston creme.

Voodoo Doughnut is a funky place with a   w i d e   assortment of funky doughnuts.  We opted for Bavarian cream filled doughnuts, one with maple frosting on top and one with chocolate frosting.  We were pleasantly surprised by the excellent quality of our fare -- light, fresh, with a lot of cream filling that is very good, and frosting that is not overly sweet.  Nice place!
After seeing them on the Food Network I thought it might be a tourist trap by now. Holy smokes the Grape Ape Donut alone was worth the wait!!!
Not overrated. This doughnut shop has fun for the whole family! No matter what your pallet fancies, this place accommodates. From old fashioned to eclectic...don't be afraid to experiment!

Awesome donut shop. I got the vegan chocolate one. Delicious! No line when we went around 8:30pm on a Thursday; score! I only wish they had the donut ingredients posted in the shop or online for people with food allergies. 3 donuts for under $6.

Yes, it's worth the hype.  This isn't just a tourist trap - the doughnuts are damn good.  Emphasizing the "dough" in the name, the raised yeast doughnuts are thick and fluffy, you can actually "feel" the calories before you take your first bite.  We ordered a dozen and it took us about 4 days to eat them all.  My favorites are the Portland Cream (thick, tasty doughnut with real yellow cream filling, semi-sweet chocolate icing, and two simple little eyes staring back at me) and the Bacon Maple (thick slices of bacon atop a maple bar - I've had bacon maple donuts before, but Voodoo has perfected the taste combination, balancing salty and sweet at just the right levels).  I appreciate the inventiveness of the Captain My Captain and the Loop, but I'm not a fan of commercial cereal on top of a donut, so I let my family scarf those down.  Shout out to the Gay Bar for a perfect combination of cream and white icing (even with a few fruit loops on top) and the Voodoo Doll and its shockingly sweet raspberry filling.  This is a definite must-try in Portland, and I'll be back, as soon as my pancreas recovers...

I was told this place is a must go to when your in Portland. I live in So Cal and they have one in City Walk.  But since in Portland I might as well check it out.  Small line at first like 5 people in front of me.  Then next thing you know when ordering the line went outside.  The doughnuts are good.

So glad i saved this place for last on my trip. Because had i not i would have been stopping by daily!!!

We got the original vodoo donut which had a combo filling of rasperry and cream yum! The decadent chocolate icing was so on point i didnt care that i had it all in my beard when i was eating it at the airport. I made alot of foljs envious in the terminal for sure.

We also got two other of the dougnuts, one was an oreo and chocoloare glaze that was good however still no match for there original.

These bad boys pair so well with a black coffee.

This is a must stop when you're in portland. The donuts are amazing. You can smell them a mile away. I fell in love with these donuts so much I brought a box back to California with me. It doesn't matter which donut you get you won't be disappointed. The staff was very friendly. The lines are always long but it is well worth the wait. Definitely coming back here!

I guess I'll just leave this photo of tasty looking doughnuts here because I think all words have been said to describe how much people love the taste and flavors of voodoo doughnuts! 
DONT FORGET TO GET THE OREO DOUGHNUT. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT
Got up early and there was hardly a line.  Went with chocolate coconut and vanilla sprinkles.  Dynamite!

Portland is full of food you must try, and everyone says that about VooDoo Doughnuts because its true! There was a short line when we went, it was about lunch time on a weekday, but it already smelled so good from the outside. 

We couldn't decide what we wanted to get, and wanted to try everything amongst a group of us, so we got the Voodoo dozen that we we got to sample a bunch of them. All were excellent! The one with the rice crispies and peanut butter and the grape soda one were very good!

Ummm how is this rated lower than Blue Star. I had a Blue Star and wasn't a fan (it's more of a thicker breadier donut). I'm more of a Dunkin Donuts kind of person. These are Dunkin Donut style donuts with a lot more interesting toppings and flavors.

Got a half a dozen and probably going to get more.
Favorites:
* Grape ape: This tastes like a grape laffy taffy exploded over the top of your donut. Get it.  
* Voodoo Bubble: Cream tastes like a delicious piece of bubblegum. It always bothered me that I like those little double bubble gums but could never swallow. This fulfills my childhood itch.

Okay on:
* Old dirty bastard: Oreos with caramel topping. Pretty good. Weird texture.
* Voodoo doll: Okay I got it because it was cute. It's an alright donut. Standard raspberry filled donut with chocolate glazing. Just cool looking.
* Maple bacon: Was good amount of salty-sweet and I can see how someone would like it... but I don't like bacon very much. Just wanted to try it. 

Didn't like:
* Fruit loops: Ugh. The fruit loops were stale and I didn't like the texture of the two together. Stale fruit loops suck. Threw this donut away. 

Oh and the line is hilariously long. There's a line that wraps around... and then there's another extra thing for the spillover line to wrap around (more tightly) four times or so. Came on a Sunday afternoon (4:30ish) and it was ridiculous. Ended up going around 9 pm on Sunday and it was more tolerable.

Voodoo, you are fun and I enjoyed you.

Your mouth just waters as you stand in line. They have an endless variety, and it's so hard to simply choose a few! I would say go in and buy dozens. It's worth it and they really hold up well the next day! Who doesn't love sweet surprises in pink boxes?!

The voodoo donut was so charming. He had a pretzel stick sticking into him, and oozed red jelly when you bit into him. The maple-bacon donut is YUM YUM YUM. Love everything here and wish I could try more!

The line though. It's worth it!

bacon maple bar doughnut! enough said !

Really though this location is open 24 hours we went the 1st time NO LINE ! around 11 am.. second time around 5 pm  the line was out the door and around the corner !!! IT was worth it though we got like 13 doughnuts for like 18 bucks .. I wish they had one in the bay area =/
Best douhnuts ever!! These guys are so awesome and friendly and their food rocks! If you haven't been here you really should because they are the best!

This place deserves all of the accolades it receives....The doughnuts in the glass case are a feast for your eyes....colors, creativity, and a bit crazy for food...it's no joke! I had the creme filled raised chocolate donut...can't remember the name, "Portland's Official Doughnut." I'm so glad I live in Seattle, otherwise, I'd be in trouble!!!

5000 reviews can't go wrong. We traveled to portland from new york on july 4th weekend. We got off the plane at 11pm, and checked in at the hotel then drove to voodoo at 2am, line wasn't bad, like 20 minutes wait. We got the bacon one, voodoo, lemon cream and blueberry, I couldn't stop eating the bacon with maple glaze. Oh my god. We are stilling talking about their donuts even when we are back to ny!! Amazing is not the word to describe it. We've never tasted something this good! Ughh I want it now!

Waited 4 years and finally came here! Voodoo was awesome, waited in the rain and in a huge line but the donuts were totally worth it. Many people said voodoo was over rated, but I disagree. Fav donut spot in Portland. Best fritter for sure. 9/10

Great place for awesome donuts.  My two favorites donuts are, Mango and the dirty snowball.  Even though the line was extremely long, it was worth the wait.  They do their best to work as fast as possible and make sure that your happy.

If your looking for 5 star donuts, then this is the place to go!

I love this place! I mean who doesn't love that you can get married in a donut shop? The people working are awesome, they have good prices. I love the bucket deal they have! Only thing that bugged me was one of the guys in the back was being rude to the lady giving the order and she just walked off and yelled at him which meh we all have bad days. i'll be back again!

This is another place that I go straight to when I visit a city.

After picking 3 of my favorite doughnuts, I wanted a 4th one that I haven't tried yet, but I couldn't decide what I shall try.

The nice, sweet lady at the counter suggested that I try the mango.

I'm glad she did because that is another one of my new favorite.

Also I think the mango doughnut is quirky because only Voodoo doughnuts have a mango doughnut.

In addition to mango doughnut, I had the voodoo again.

And dirty old man again,

And the big ass fritter with chocolate chips and peanut butter.

Again of course.

I'm coming back again.

(Of course!)

OH! one more thing, don't order their coffee. I don't think it's that great.

LOVED this donut shop. It was so crazy and unique and the fact that I was able to get donuts after a night of drinking was amazing. Other negative thing is the few staff members I came across. They were rude and pushy whenever my friend would ask questions. Other than that, this donut shop is amazing!!

your crazy if you don't love this place! The maple bacon bar is one of the best things ever. I don't get people bitching about the line or cash only. They could punch me in the face when I walk in the door as long as they hand me the maple bacon bar
Awesome food, awesome employees, and awesome owners! Great place and its always open!! Try the portland creme, or maple bacon bars. So good!

I don't like donuts, I love the taste but I always feel sick afterwards...its like eating a Big Mac.  
I also thought their was a limited spectrum of good donuts.  VD has changed me for the better.  Its not simply a matter of putting whatever on the top of shaping the dough into a penis.  Its about a damn good f'ing donut.  Bacon maple bar was insane!!!!  Who doesn't like bacon let alone sweet and salty????
We got lucky and only waited in line for about 10 minutes.  


We also went to Top Pot Donuts the day before in Seattle and was super surprised on how it was normal coffee and normal donuts with no idea what people rave about, except for maybe a $2 donut!  VooDoo is really good and a tourist spot but more so is really good!

While visiting from California I was told by many friends I had to visit Voodoo Doughnuts in Portland, OR. So I made the stop on our trip and these Doughnuts have some very Interesting names but are very tasty doughnuts. These donuts are so worth the "hype" and totally worth the long wait in line. Give them a try if you never been. You won't regret it. ;)

Third times the charm. I have been telling my kids about this place and have been promising for months to take them. Back in January, I found myself with my daughter and a window of time to stop for a donut. As we approached, the man with the coffee mug filled with money that hangs out front asked me for a dollar. I told him I don't carry cash. He yelled out to me as we walked into VooDoo, "Good luck getting your donut!" I didn't quite get that.
We stood in line for 15 minutes, while my daughter drooled over the case and made plans for an orange donut with sparkly sprinkles. We get up to the front, she orders her donut. As it is being handed to her, I ask in panic if they take cards. The attendant practically ripped the plate from my crushed little girls hands, and replied "no". We left in tears and hit Stumptown.
Flash forward to two weeks later. My daughter has been talking non-stop about that donut. I grab some cash, and both kids. I drop my daughter off at ballet and promise her she will have her donut today (big mistake). My son and I run to VooDoo real quick for the donuts. Apparently VooDoo had been featured on Food Network that week and the line was around the block! There was no way we would be able to get back for the end of my daughers class and have donuts in hand. Another day with crushed kids.
Another week later. I come up with another plan. Lots of cash, lots of time, both kids, and no fear of lines. We got our donuts! YUM! Well worth the wait. 
BTW, not that you don't already know this. The maple bacon donut rocked my world.

I love this place and go everytime I am in Portland. Like everyone else I am a fan of their bacon maple bar. However, I haven't had one of their donuts that I didn't like. So I usually just order a dozen random. I bought my girlfriend the 'cock n balls' and it was hilarious..yes, its huge and yes its filled with vanilla cream. One must also get the voodoo doll donut and stab it with the pretzel stick and watch it bleed. Wander up the street and enjoy your pink "the magic is in the hole" donuts with a hot cup of Stumptown coffee.
The staff were energetic and friendly when facing a seemed never ending lineup of customers. The donuts lived up to my expectations. Great job!

Everyone I met in Portland recommended Voodoo Doughnuts. I went around 8am on a Wednesday morning expecting a huge line wrapped around the building but I got lucky with no lines. :)
I ordered 2 dozen doughnuts. 1 for my coworkers and 1 to bring back home. My favorite flavors are cotton candy, maple bacon bar and of course the voodoo doughnut. Kya was extremely friendly and took the time to describe each doughnut and used pink tape to close my precious Voodoo doughnut box. 
I'm addicted to these delicious and unique doughnuts and will be back for more.

One word - AMAZING!  These donuts were probably the best I have ever had and I loved that they tasted just as fresh 24 hours later as they did when first purchased.

Upon approaching the small donut shop, it was a bit daunting to see the long line but it moved quickly.  Above the registers, there is a sign on the wall with all the donut choices so while you are waiting for your turn to order you can figure out what you want.  I was very impressed with their efficiency.

I ordered a glazed cake donut, apple fritter and Portland cream doughnut.  Can't say that one was better than the other.  Each donut was so full of sinful flavor and fresh.

Probably, a good thing I don't live in Oregon - Voodoo Donuts could easily bring me to the darkside.

Awesome staff!! Gave us lots of good suggestions. Went with the Voodoo classics: maple bacon bar and Voodoo man worth the wait even though we didn't wait long this time.:-) And you get to soak in rip city culture with some of the rad locals whilst awaiting a beautiful treat for your taste buds
Usually a long wait but this time was only 3 minutes   Just ordered 2 Portland Creams which was nice ate one right away and saved the other for later.

This place deserves all the hype it gets!

The line was a bit long but moved very quickly.

The menu is filled with unique, tasty, and quirky donuts. They definitely have anything you're craving and donuts you never would have thought existed.

I had the Classic Voodoo Donut with chocolate icing and pretzels (it was so cute) and the Old Dirty Bastard (chocolate, Oreos, & peanut butter--all my favorite things!)--I took one to go, ok?! :)

The vibe inside is so weird and fun--you should definitely take a moment to look around and soak it all in.

You can't hang out in Downtown Portland without stopping by Voodoo.

Wait in line for what...? Well exactly. The doughnuts are worth the experience even if the panhandlers call you names and every one else is snapping photos and uploading to their choice of social media. "Keep Portland Weird" found across the street. Oh. The doughnuts are good. You don't need napkins. No oily fingers to be found.

It's about the experience, it really is. Such a fun place to try out. Good thing I don't live in Portland or this would do me in for my attempts at healthy eating. The line, the doughnut names and the twist on the types of doughnuts, the neon colors, the popularity. Voodoo Doughnuts in my mind exudes Portland culture. Some say it's overrated, I say they are probably missing the point.

They had me at chocolate, peanut butter and banana doughnut. Then they continued to hit me with the Portland Cream, Maple Bacon doughnut and the vegan Apple cruller. My hips will hate me later but man, what tasty doughnuts. 

This spot is the jam. I didn't want to believe the hype but I'm glad I did.
Ladies - all you need is a jelly filled Voodoo donut. He will serve as a good, reliable, temporary boyfriend... until you rip his limbs off and devour his insides.

I was so EXCITED to come here because I had heard such good things about this place. I came from LA to visit my dad and came here on my first day in Portland. We came on a Friday afternoon to find there was no line, which made it even better! We got seven different donuts and I honestly don't know the names, but they were good! Cry sweet but I personally love sweets. So happy I came :)
I always bring my friends who have never been to PDX to Voodoo. Hot workers and good treats. Love Voodoo.
If you like jelly donuts, or donuts with stuff on it, these novelty donuts hit the spot. Pretty touristy location so be prepared to wait in line.

If you're not from Portland you may not have heard about Voodoo.
They're a staple in Portland and you MUST go here at least once if you're in Portland! Everything is delicious!
Make sure you plan ahead of time to wait. They are typically so busy the have a line down the block.

Exquisite, refreshing, soft, delicious, gooey, radiant, unique, astounding, tasty, delightful, fantastic, excellent, gratifying, tempting, astronomical, thrilling, surreal, yummy... 

I could go on and on for days and days and days. 

The donuts are wonderful. They taste better than any other donut I have ever had. The flavors are unique - unlike anything else you will ever see ever ever ever. 

The line might be long, but its quick! And the staff might not be the friendliest, but I can understand their frustrations!

DO NOT PASS THIS UP. EVER. ALWAYS GO INSIDE. ALWAYS EAT A DONUT.
These are high quality doughnuts and they're delicious as well as fun to eat. The wait in line is worth it, and the line moves quickly.

I can't help but think these donut's played a role in convincing my spouse that the Pacific Northwest was the place for us to move. Now we live in beautiful Washington state and look forward to a happy tree life. Thanks Voodoo Doughnut!

I have never seen doughnuts like this. They are big and really good tastIng. Me and my dad came to Oregon for vacation and decided to try it. We waited in a line maybe 10 minutes, the apple fritter is really good but the menphis mafia is insane...

We got 4 specialty donuts. They are about $2 a piece. The Oreo cream one was amazing and so was the peanut butter Oreo donut. Overall, we really loved them. We went at an off time, around 4:30pm and there was no line. Definitely recommend trying this place.

I got caught up in the hype of this doughnut shop.
Saw them on TV, read about them in magazines, heard from friends, heard about it from enemies....
So I had to try them out while working in Portland for the week.

The doughnut chain that purposely misspells doughnut and implies you should "dunk" your doughnuts has always been my standard of a raised doughnut...until now.

Voodoo has both cake and raised.

The raised is superior in my opinion. They are denser than my old standard. This is a huge plus to me. If I am going to waste my caloric intake on a doughnut, I want it to be worth it.

Bottom line.... they meet the hype!

p.s. Beware of people who try to cut in line! I cannot comment on how I really feel about them. If I did, Yelp would disable my account.
Uhm... YUM!! Craziest but most flavorful doughnuts! The mango tango was an experience like none other. Perfect pairing!

Really, when I visited Portland I knew I had to go to Voodoo but thought it may have been overrated. It really is as amazing as others say. I went two nights in a row to try different donuts as many as possible. My favorites were the Old Dirty Bastard, Triple Chocolate Penetration, and of course the Maple Bacon Bar. Also for the bachelorette in the group, you can't go wrong with the huge cream filled penis donut personalized with "Mr. Right" and the pictures that followed of her eating it as fast as possible were priceless. Amazing. Cash only. Also be aware carrying the pink box around will get a lot of attention, leave me and my donuts alone!

Not since Gibson's Donuts in Memphis have I found a destination doughnut shop worth going out of your way for. My BF and I made a detour returning from Seattle to Los Angeles and it was the best part of our trip South. Returning here is tops on the list for every subsequent trip to Portland. The texture of their raised yeast donuts was superb and the frostings and fillings were out of this world. Still waiting for my donut fix in the City of Angels. You guys are tops on the Best Coast!

Doughnuts topped with Fruit Loops? Doughnuts shaped like Voodoo Dolls? Doughnuts with BACON on them!?

They have doughnuts for everyone. Are you one of those weird vegan people? They've got you covered too. Reasonable prices, excellent staff, great ambiance, and the best doughnuts I've had in a long time.

What more could anyone ask for? (besides being able to pay with a credit card...)

If you're in Portland, you MUST give Voodoo a try. You won't regret it.

Because this is the only place in the world you can get a chocolatey shot in the mouth from a cock and balls doughnut. This place is awesome, and every time I roll through Portland I have to stop by. Being a vegan myself, I'm told that I cannot truly experience the joys of the maple bacon bar and whatnot, but...I'll live. Their vegan doughnuts are awesome enough to send me into a diabetic coma, and best of all, they are open late, which is great for insomniacs like myself.

The place itself is a hole in the wall, though once you walk in, it's like its own little world. There's nothing quite like heading into an area as cramped as an apartment bedroom, packed with people, with awesome bluegrass being played by a band sitting on the ledge in some mystical second floor that I have resolutely decided to get to at some point in my life. It took awhile to get the front, but I didn't mind the wait, as that was half the adventure.

The staff's pretty cool themselves, and when I don't have a giant line hounding me from behind, I try to chat 'em up a bit while enjoying my deep fried goodness.

And the doughnuts themselves are some of the craziest combinations known to man. With the vegan rack, it's a little tame, but just looking at all of them makes me have to wonder who exactly buys them. What sort of personality makes one buy the various creations.

In all, it's a requisite road stop, and a joy whenever I head to Portland.
Super cool donut shop.  A must stop by place you are in Portland.  The maple bacon donut was awesome.

I had been wanting to try Voodoo's vegan donuts for quite some time.  I was surprised and impressed that they were all yeast raised donuts and perfect!  (My boyfriend compared the vegan to non-vegan and even thought they tasted the same!)  We had to wait in line outside in the rain to get these donuts, but it was totally worth it.  I cannot wait until my next trip to Portland!

Late night?
Unsure of where to go?
Another club? How about a doughnut?!

Yes a doughnut!
I was skeptical about how doughnuts can be, but they are mouthwatering and worth the wait. 
Feel free to indulge yourself with all the flavors. I recommend coming with a friend so that you can share a small piece of the warm delicious pastry!

You really cant go wrong in what you order, unless you are allergic!

Next time I am back in town. Doughnuts baby!

Go super early in the morning to avoid the crazy lines. Good music, friendly service and yummy donuts. 
There is a outside seating area to enjoy your donut and the Portland homeless at its finest. 
I wouldn't wait in line for a donut here it's not over the top amazing it's simply a donut.
We got lucky and did not wait in line too long. The staff was super friendly. The donuts tasted great! Definitely and must go to when in Portland

I'm from California, so of course I am going to stop here! That's always what I do when visiting and always love it. I even bring some home for the family when I head home. This place is great, Portland weird and best of all has great doughnuts. Remember to get cash...they don't accept credit cards and the ATM they have on sight is a rip

I do not actively seek out doughnuts, but when I was in Portland, I decided to indulge in their glorious products. I believe that my group polished a dozen doughnuts in a matter of minutes. Seriously, these are the best doughnuts around, as evidenced by the reviews and appearances on the Food Network and other television shows. The line was long when I came here, but I am the type of person that will wait as long as need be in order to get good food.

This is deffo the place to Eat fat, and die yum! If you're in the area this is a tourist trap and place to visit. I've heard that Blue Star is preferred by the locals, but whatevs. Unless you're an ultimate food critique who knows their difference in flour texture, Voodoo is a fun place that packages their donuts in bright pink boxes. I ended up getting:

1. Voodoo Doll
2. Gay Bar
3. The Loop

Super photogenic place to take photos of food and if you look right across the street you'll see a massive sign that says KEEP PORTLAND WEIRD.. well unless you don't care to even look, you might miss it
BACON MAPLE BAR!!! Don't listen to any bad reviews in most case they come from whiny people about nonsense. If you want amazing fresh original doughnuts this is the place.

We actually planned a trip to Portland to visit this place along with others and of course while we were finally there they opened on in LA.  Didn't stop us from visiting the original in the early morning before our long drive back home.  The staff was friendly and the donuts speak for themselves.  They were fresh, soft, and delicious.
Amazing donuts! The voodoo doll was so fresh and soft and perfect amount of filling and frosting! Worth the wait! Super fun place.

Worth the long wait. Highlight of my Portland visit. Highly recommended.  Fat guy friendly place.  If on your to do list -mid morning was a good time to go.  Stayed a week in Portland and went here three times.

Hell Yeah! My daughter waited for this trip to EAT SKME VOODOO DONUTS!! She loved em!! (Me too). They are fresh, open 24 hours, were in walking distance to our hotel and came in all flavors, shapes and sizes!  I gave in and got me a black voodoo mug!! Love!!
It's a Portland staple, with some of the yummiest, most unique doughnuts I've ever seen! I take all my out of town guests here because it's an absolute must-see in this city!

Best Donuts in the area for sure!  My personal favorite is the Maple Bacon but the Voodoo Doll is pretty hard to beat as well.  Creative menu and Plenty of selection.  The prices are pretty much like every other donut shop as well.
So many vegan donuts that are a great reminder of how you don't need animal products to make amazing food! Their oreo, peanut butter donut was so good, I regret not getting more than one.
This place is a weird and Portland as it gets. Probably where keep Portland weird slogan started. Donuts are fantastic and service is good. Long lines though as this place is extremely popular.

Great place.  Good doughnuts with an infinite variety of unique delectable doughnuts as well as the normal doughnuts you would find at an ordinary place.

One bad thing about Voodoo is the fact that it's hard to park and it's in a bad part of downtown.

Not sure why this place has such bad reviews. I came here at night around 7or 8ish to finally try it! 

I forgot what donuts we ordered, but they were both good! The consitinsy and the way the bread tasted was really good!

A MUST DO in portland.  This place could not be more fun.  Even if we're just driving through town, and dreading the calories it's worth it.  At first I was horrified especially at the bacon on a donut (they should call it the heart attack) but it was the best donut I've ever had.  This place is shocking, fantastic, and tasty all in one.  The line moves pretty fast, and if you hit it on off hours you can miss the lines entirely.  Never had to wait more than 20 minutes or so, even when the line is out the door.

It's like a little slice of New Orleans quirkiness has been crammed into the back room of a strip club...with donuts.

Somehow, Voodoo slipped off my radar when I was doing preliminary investigative work on our impending Portland trip. Thankfully, some friends of mine from back east happened to be coming into town at the same time we'd be there, & they redirected us.

I didn't get a chance to try the bacon maple donut (yes, BACON MAPLE DONUT), but the voodoo blood donut was incredible (a little donut man filled with raspberry jam & stabbled through the chest with a pretzel rod).

From what I can tell, Voodoo is a Portland institution. Let's hope there's no other place in the country quite like it.

Voodoo Doughnut is one of those experiences that everyone tells you have to do if you are in Portland.  And they are right. Its located in a very cool area downtown.   On the Saturday morning we went in they were having one of their farmer's markets/bazaars and Voodoo was the start of our morning adventure.  While there is a solid wait (about 30 mins) the line moves quickly.  And your likely to have a musician or street performer entertaining you while you wait.  There are so many interesting doughnut options that you will probably need all 30 minutes to decide what you want.  We certainly did.  My gf and I ended up sharing a voodoo doughnut, the lemon doughnut thingy, and she got the Homer (pink donut that Homer from Simpsons always eats).  Voodoo was very fun experience and the doughnuts were delicious.  The voodoo doughnut in particular was wonderfully fresh and tasty.  Time well spent!

Yummm these doughnuts are the best! I'm a big fan of the maple bacon, the dirt doughnut and the rampant sexual innuendos throughout the store. It's also great that I can choose from a carton of milk or a Rogue Ale to wash down the yeasty deliciousness. The only downside I can see is the egregiously long line that can stretch around the block during tourist high times, but with good company the wait is never too long.
Please come to DC. Please please please. These were the most amazing donuts I've ever tasted and I've been craving them ever since I've left Oregon. I love you guys. Don't stop being amazing!

Cash Only!

Anyone who gives this less than 4 stars doesnt get it. Yes there is often a line. Ok, go  to voodoo too on the east side, or dont go when its busy! There plenty of times you can walk right in. 
 

Their shop is gimmicky of course, and has a ton to take in. The donuts themselves are creative works of art, and each seems unique. High quality ingredients, and they are always very fresh. 


Go there, eat donuts.

Had to stop by here on a short visit because of how famous it is, even on the East coast! We got a classic voodoo donut and a grape donut. The classic one looked hilarious and tasted delicious. The grape donut had a very strong grape candy flavor that I've never tasted from a donut before. Both were addicting and scrumptious!

I was only in Portland to check out places where Twilight was filmed and the place we were staying at said we had to visit VooDoo doughnuts if we were going to Portland. When we got here we seen there was a line but it went pretty quickly. The sign outside and decorations inside and outside looked pretty cool. They have the funniest names for their doughnuts. Loved the menu. These are just a few of their doughnut names on the menu, cock-n-balls and Tex-ass. They had doughnuts with different kinds of cereal all over them too. Every doughnut I took a bite of was delicious and it's a fun environment. If you are in Portland you gotta stop by this place.
Bomb.com so goooood and even funnier my boyfriend ordered the gay bar but I don't think he knew it since he just pointed to it
This place is great and lives up to the hype.  The lines are always long but they go pretty quick.  Most of the staff is nice even though they are popular enough that they don't have to be.

I am so disappointed to see that Voodoo currently shows only 3.5 stars right now.  What's going on people?! Have you lost your minds???  I was one of the hesitant people that didn't want to like Voodoo, I really didn't.  With all of the hype and discussion about it being a tourist trap, I just assumed it would be a waste of time.  I am not even a doughnut person, although I have tried many.  Well, I am now.  One evening, when out with a good friend, we were in the area and saw a short line, so we went for it. She had lived Portland for a year, and me, less than two months at the time.  I figured I needed to check the box.  First of all, the doughnuts are complete eye candy.  For anybody impressed by funky designs and bold colors, they are a feast for the eyes.  There are so many to choose from as well, and it can be overwhelming, especially if you're hoping for a perfect match.  I settled on a cake doughnut covered with white icing, topped by crushed Oreos.  All I have to see it was heaven at first bite.  I couldn't believe it.  Before I could exhale, I was nearly finished.  I just couldn't help myself.  I went back another time with an out-of-town guest that was recently visiting.  I made myself try something entirely different.  It was a marshmallow-creme filled doughnut, topped with a chocolate frosting.  Again, I thought I died and went to Nirvana.  Every bite, every morsel was perfect.  I will go there again and again, proud Portlander that I am.  Now, if you are not the kind of person that likes your desserts incredibly sweet, this is not the place for you.  But in all seriousness, I have eaten many Krispy Kreme, many a Dunkin' Doughnut, as well as a few Blue Star Doughnuts (which are good in their own right), but nothing, and I mean NOTHING comes close to the epic doughnuts that come out of Voodoo, without question.  Oh, and it's affordable.  Not something you can say for many of the overpriced eateries in Portland.

Who can resist a doughnut in the shape of a cock! And not the kind of cock that wakes you up in the morning...

Expect long lines, but the donuts are worth it! Get there early if you're looking for your fave doughnut, otherwise you might be out of luck!

Sh!t I can't beelive I haven't rated this place yet, of course everyone else in the f@cking city has. Of the 3 times I've been here, I purchased, the voodoo, the purple whatever, and the maple bacon bar twice. All without even a 2 minute wait, boooooyahhhhh! But is it worth a wait, YES! It's a poster child to Portland food character. You're a stingy Mcdonalds throating douche to not try this place once. I heard they taste great with a line of coke but that was a transient talking.

I have never had such delicious donuts in my entire life. The wait was 30 mins long, but it didn't feel like an eternity. I would do the line again, even if it was a longer wait. These donuts have been a gift to humanity. We ordered 5 different donuts and each one was perfectly baked. We ate them over the next two days, and they were still as delicious as the first day! I will be craving these for months now!
Luckily line wasn't too long and moved quickly.  We got the old dirty bastard, voodoo man and the maple bacon bar.  All very delicious but hands down my favorite is the maple bacon bar!
Awesome affordable and delicious donuts. Definitely a great stop for a Californian. The art style and the donuts are all a fun and enjoyable experience.

Portland Institution. GO! 

Stand in line for an hour, order cock and balls, carry your pretty pink box around, eat more doughnuts, fall into doughnut coma, wake up, eat a dirty old bastard and keep repeating the pattern until that box is gone.
It is a requirement that I must go here every time I'm in PDX and buy bacon maple bars. The whole concept is sickeningly sweet and bacon-ly delicious!
The Maple Bacon Bar was awesome! The Memphis mafia was so huge I was embarrassed to be seen eating it and tore off chunks at a time out of the bag, while riding on the MAX

Fun, creative and delicious doughnuts to please pretty much everyone out there.
Line was long, but moved fast.
I love this place, if you love doughnuts this is probably one of the better places in Portland!

It's a Portland must! The lines are long but move quickly. We arrived and left in nineteen minutes. We first went to the original location but left for the Voodoo Doughnuts Too location because the line length and parking were long and impossible at the original location. 

The Voodoo Doughnuts Too location had it's own parking lot (free) and the line was a bit shorter. The two locations are only about a mile apart. 

We ordered multiple: voodoo dolls, old dirty bastards, pot holes, and raspberry jesscakes. They are all returning home with us to Los Angeles. Several people have offered to pick us up for a share of the spoils. Nothing like a great BRIBE to get a ride home!!!

Reasonably priced, creative, Tasty donuts. Friendly service.
Parking, pink boxes. Cash only but there is a/an ATM
Try the bacon maple...I am not a doughnut fan at all but trying this one and this flavor made me a fan! A must if you visit or heck , if you love here!
Way worth the drive down from Tacoma, WA! They are so unique and delicious! :)

Great spot! Line was long but was going down fast.. did not wait that long.. i'm not a vegan but it was nice that they have that option.. they ran out of regular doughnut so i got the vegan version of the cock doughnut.. actually was pretty good.. the chocolate wasn't too sweet nor was the filling inside.. i recommend visitors to try this place..

I love everything about this place! Donuts are original and delicious. Coffee is rich and nutty. A new, very large, phallic shaped donut with intriguing designs was available this morning. I went more mainstream. Bring cash or use the ATM inside coz they don't take cards. Downside: the folks waiting outside in need of financial assistance can be a bit aggressive since they know you have change from your purchase.
It has been a long time since I went but the customer service was quick and respectful. The donuts were very delicious and worth the stop. Taking my daughter there in a couple of weeks!

How do you do the Voodoo that you do? 

Long wait in line + smell of donuts= eager anticipation
Looking at long list of donut menu + seeing donuts in spinning case = drooling
walking out of voodoo with donuts in hand and soon to be in stomach = PRICELESS!!! 
Sugar high? Oh yes! Want more? Oh yes! 

GO GO GO!

A must visit because of the great variety of he traditional favorited but done he voodoo way.
Go early at 9 am and the line up is only 15 min long

I love the Portland cream, voodoo doughnut and maple bacon.

This is the best doughnut shop! I personally like going to Voodoo 2 by the fran's break factory. I think its up on sandy. The parking there is really good. The lines are long but there service is fast and I like that. The food is really creative and yummy! I love the voodoo man.. He is the bomb diggity.

When I made it out to Portland for a night on my journey cross-country, I met somebody who knew the downtown area well. They brought me to Voodoo Doughnuts after dinner and drinks. I think it was the best doughnut shop I've ever been to.

People travel far and wide to try their gourmet offerings. I got a Bacon Maple Bar. It is every bit as delicious as it sounds. Certainly a runner for best doughnut in history. 

My companion for the night recommended I take a 6-pack with me on my travels. I'd get to enjoy the iconic pink take-home box they put them in, and I'd have a great conversation piece on the train trip. Each doughnut was unique and delicious.

The Voodoo Doll - a doll-shaped, raspberry jelly-filled doughnut, with chocolate frosting and a pretzel stick in it's heart.

Diablos Rex - a chocolate doughnut, chocolate frosting, filled with chocolate chips, and sprinkled with a vanilla frosting pentagram and red sprinkles. Certainly the most formidably chocolate creation known to man.

Dirt Doughnut - this one was covered in vanilla frosting and lots of Oreo chunks. 

Bacon Maple Bar - I had to get another, it was like eating the best breakfast in the world.

Miami Vice - a doughnut with vanilla frosting, half-covered in blue raspberry powder and half-covered in pink sprinkles. 

Old Dirty Bastard - a doughnut with chocolate frosting, topped with Oreo chunks and peanut butter drizzle. Possibly my second favorite.

Those were my six, and I enjoyed them all (unfortunately) on my train ride through the country. I need to lay off the sugar now. Your weakness for sweets will surrender completely to the large variety of doughnuts they have on stock at any given time. You should check this place out if you're ever in the area.

It was one of the best stops on my entire trip. No wonder they show up on television. Five-stars!

Maple Glazed Donut topped with STRIPS OF BACON.
youve got to be fucking kidding me.

The Magic is in the Hole :D Yes it is!!!
By a stroke of luck I ended up in Portland.. I had no real plans to do anything but go to bed but fate intervened and took me on a journey that started at Voodoo Donuts. Note you will need cash...and there's no need to go hunting for an ATM because there's one tucked in the back corner of the store. 

There was a bit of a line and Nick H. thought it was nuts to wait in a line for donuts...I told him it would be worth it. We finally made it to the front...Nick H. ordered the No Name and I got the Maple Bacon Bar. Nick H. insisted that I share his donut with him even though I had one of my own. Man was it good!  
The Maple Bacon Bar is pure evil incarnate. It is the perfect amalgamation of sweet and savory. My hats off to the genius that invented this perfectly decadent creation. If you ever find yourself in PDX...be sure to stop by Voodoo!

After about ten minutes of waiting in line, we ordered a dozen of donuts, which in retrospect was a bit too much since we ended up not really eating the last few. This place definitely has personality, and it was entertaining to look at caskets and other gothy stuff while waiting in line. Each donut is priced slightly differently, but the 12 we ordered came out to just over $18. To be honest, most of the donuts were pretty basic, but the cleverness and quirkiness of the place and the donuts names really made for a fun experience. My personal favorite was the Marshall Mathers donut, which was a vanilla donut with tons of miniature M&M's on it [a reference to the rapper Eminem]. I also really liked both the name and the amazing flavor of the Arnold Palmer, which may be the best fruity donut I've ever had. It was tarty and sweet and chunky and delicious. If you're near downtown and want something sweet (and don't mind a potentially long wait if you come during a rush), I'd highly recommend.

A must do when visiting Portland. Yes, there is always a line but I enjoyed that there was still very good customer service. The staff are patient and attentive and generally happy people. Just don't block the door! 

I tried the bacon maple donut which is beyond delicious. There are plenty of other funky creations so the world is your oyster there. Love the topical doughnuts like the "A Doughnut has no name" from Game of Thrones

anyone who doesnt give voodoo doughnuts a five star review is probably crazy. YES their is almost always a huge line in their NW location, dont like the line? drive maybe 5 minutes further to the NE location and voila NO LINE, EVER!!
I'm in love. This place lives up to the hype!!! Best employees too, all very kind and entertaining while waiting in line.
A badass doughnut shop, they have all kinds of crazy concoctions to choose from.  However, I think just a classic plain maple bar tastes amazing here.

The coffin/death vibe was a little creepy, service was mixed, the neighborhood was sketchy, the cash only policy was inconvenient, the lack of a/c on a 100+ degree day was almost unbearable. The doughnuts, however, made it all worthwhile.

From the "must have" maple bacon, to their absurd fruit loop topped variety, to their basic glazed, Voodoo offered the best doughnuts we have ever had anywhere in the U.S. Their one miss in a box full of delights was the one with mini marsh mellows and lemon icing. Our teenager reported that it tasted like toothpaste.

Important note: we did not have to wait at all. It was so hot, it's likely that no one wanted to stand in line.

Really, VooDoo Doughnut? REALLY? Bacon? On a doughnut? You've turned this Southern-Living, Krispy-Kreme loving, Bacon worshipper consider moving across the country for another taste of sweet-salty deliciousness. 

According to google maps it'll only take 35 days for me to walk there... hrm... it's almost worth it!

I went here on vacation last year and bought 2 dozen donuts all to myself. I gained 11 pounds in 7 days. Eff my heart and body this place provides soul.

Note: The rampant homeless around Portland that live to keep it weirder also are quite violent so bring your prison A-game while waiting outside if you are male. Females don't need to worry - the transients seem chauvinistic and don't assume you have money. --personal experience

If your in Portland this stop is kind of a no brainier. The lines are long during the day but I did go at like 9 am and it wasn't busy. There doughnuts are fun and whimsical and they even have vegan options. The captain crunch doughnut is favorite!
There's a line, but it moves fast. The doughnuts are delicious, the bacon one is my favorite.
Love this place and have for 29 years. Dessert after eating at Dan &Louis Oyster Bar.

When I first moved to Portland, I remember hearing of this place often.  I thought it seemed kind of crazy because after all, just doughnuts, right?  Well, I didn't check it out for the longest time because the lines always seemed crazy.  Just this past year, I had a friend visit from out of town.  Thought we'd check it out.  Well, found out a great time to go is on Wednesdays around 6pm.  There was no line.   Oh my.... I can't believe how amazing the doughnuts are!  Seriously!  Now I understand why people love it so much. : )

YAYAYAYAY!!!! the yummiest yummiest donut ever
I had the Old Dirty Bastard - chocolate, crushed Oreos, drizzled with peanut butter. 
I was LITERALLY in heaven. Hea-ven!!!!

I think that everyone has said just about as much as you can say about this place, but I will say this: about half of the people I talked to said that it was a must to go to Voodoo on my trip to Portland, and the other half said it was overrated. I wasn't necessarily planning to go, but we found ourselves in the area and decided to go for it. The line was quite long, but it only took about 10 minutes to get through, which is nothing for someone who lives in New York and is perpetually waiting in lines. The doughnuts were cheap (we paid $12 for 8) and really, really good. The apple fritter was the winner for me - it was as big as my head with a lovely crispy outer glaze and a soft and fluffy interior, dotted with fresh apples. I also tried the lemon chiffon, which was bursting with lemon flavor, and the Oreo doughnut, which was a bit much for me but it's not like I turned my nose up at it. It was a fun experience and I think that if you're a tourist, it's not necessarily a bad thing to do "touristy" things. Just keep an open mind and have fun!

My sweet, sweet voodoo. How I miss you so. After leaving China town I don't see you as often as I would like.

There is nothing better than a Maple bar after a long night at the tube, or Dante's. 

Or making the trek down from the pearl after a pretentious, over-priced, and over-rated meal.

Thank you voodoo maple bar, for being delicious, filling, and dependable. 

Thank you for giving me dozens, and dozens of yummie doughnuts for a great price on my birthday because my friends got too drunk to make me cupcakes.

You're lifesaver, almost every Saturday night.
Surreal atmosphere, cool staff. We renewed our vows here, came to Portland for the donuts, stayed for the atmosphere! Thank you for making two kooks happy on their 20th!
Great place. Excellent doughnuts. The combination of sugar and the right amount of oils make their doughnuts "to die for". The place is highly recommended.
I love Voodoo Doughnuts. So fun and delicious!

All I have to say is.....

A Bucket (and yes I mean bucket) of day old doughnuts (that still seemed fresh and delicious to me) for only $5.00!!

There had to be at least 30 doughnuts in this bucket of all different varieties! 

This is just a deal that you can't beat!

The best damn doughnut shop ever!!!

The apple fritters!
The bacon maple bar!
The voodoo doll!

These are some hot moss doughnuts!!!!!
If there is a place to go for comfort food, this is definitely the place to be. Love these donuts and so will you.

Voodoo has some really great donuts. They have a lot of options and everything is very delicious. I went very early in the morning (about 8 or 9am) so the line wasn't very long. It took about half an hour to 45 minutes for me to get into the shop. The good part of that is everyone in line was very cool and easy to talk to if you go by yourself. 

The only thing that caught me off guard was they Voodoo Donuts ONLY accepts CASH. Wasn't expecting that, but thankfully I had a 20 on me. They also sell coffee and there is a cute coffee shop right across the road. In the alleyway beside Voodoo they have a little sitting area set up with tables and umbrellas for the fair skinned or anyone trying to avoid the sun. It was a very relaxing morning. 

It's definitely a must for donut lovers, but I definitely wouldn't wait in a line wrapped around the block. Plus, it's 24/7 so it will always fit into your schedule. 

Stop in, get a donut, do some shopping, and walk along the waterfront!
WARNING!  Do not go here.  They place a spell on these deliciously delectable doughnuts; the further you are away from here, they more you you crave them.  DAMN YOU!!

I was lead to this lovely establishment by a co-worker who proclaims "If you didn't go to Voodoo, you didn't go to Portland." 

So, we waited in line. 
25minutes. 

Rain drizzling on our heads while looking around at the cloudy mecca. Once inside, I suddenly felt like a child, getting into a theme park of some sort. 
There were quite a few options and random combinations. 

In New York, we have donut shops everywhere, but nothing like this. I can see why people flock here. I am unsure if the people in line actually live in Portland, as this would be an unnecessary line to wait in a city of this size. 

But, the experience was worth the wait, and the waiting in line, made me soak in the rain, people and experience Portland on a deeper level. 
When usually I would walk away from such a wait. 

Side note, I found out you can get married in this place. And people have done so, very interesting. If I lived in Portland and had visitors, I would take them here. 
Well done guys. 
You are unique. 
Just like Portland.

"Good things come in pink boxes." Especially with Voodoo Doughnut printed on the outside. The hype is real. And well deserved. 

Get it while it's hot - or just warm, fluffy, and slightly crispy on the outside. The glazes? Out of this world. Just say no to waxen, lackluster and blas glaze you're used to and experience the rich, fudgy or fruity, crisp or crunchy, sweet or savory fresh flavors of all that makes up a VooDoo Doughnut glaze/frosting/topping. Each doughnut tastes distinctive and different from the others. This isn't really a "same dough, slightly different glaze" kind of doughnut. Each doughnut is an experience in itself. My favorite? The VooDoo Doll, the Mango filled doughnut, and the Cap N Crunch doughnut. Excuse me!

Will there be a line? YES. 
But aren't they open 24 hours? YES. 
Wait but seriously...there's a line at all hours of the day? YES.

Look, this is an obvious landmark in the Pacific Northwest, so if you're anywhere in the vicinity my advice to you is this: buck up and wait in the 30-40 minute line (there's no way around it, not even during the 24-hours that the shop is open).  Walk out with a box full of freshly made doughnuts and the kind of self-satisfaction that exists only when others look at you with wide-eyed jealousy as you walk down the street with a pink box of not just good, but GREAT things: voodoo doughnuts.

So last January I came from Seattle Wa via train to Portland Oregon. I went down to Portland For only these doughnuts.   Boy was it worth it. The doughnut Balls are cheap and regular amazing doughnut is a Dollar and 95 cents but that may change when u read this review . Omg- I bite into the Mango tango Doughnut and it made it all worth it. A fruit filling that tasted like I was biting into a mango and a piece of heaven . omg.  I bought 3 dozen doughnuts to bring home to my family and friends . I bought every none cream or cereal doughnut possible. They were all amazing from the grape ape to the bacon maple bar . The legendary Bacon bar has 2  whole strips of bacon on it.. I wish Yelp would let me post pics of the doughnuts . The doughnut are also creative. you wont find a more creative doughnut  shop m  in the USA.  They are better then top pot or krispy kreme ect. Just promise me one thing after Reading this review you will go to voodoo doughnuts and you will get a doughnut. you got to try the voodoo doughnuts

I'm not a huge fan of donuts, but the unusual flavors that they have at Voodoo draw me in.

Don't let the long lines dissuade you from waiting.  They move pretty quick and are worth it.  I've waited in lines there several times and have never waited for more than 15 minutes.  And there's plenty to look at while you are waiting, so the time flies by pretty fast.  Don't let anyone tell you that you will wait for an hour.  The line would have to be a block long for that to happen.

If you aren't set on going to this location, try Voodoo Doughnuts Too, which is just across the river.  They have a private parking lot and shorter lines.

Yum.  Yum yum yum yum yum.

Yes, it seems silly to stand in that massive line for a doughnut, but oh boy is it tasty.  

I got two doughnuts, one to eat immediately and one to save until after dinner.  The Portland Cream was absolutely delicious.  The doughnut itself was perfectly fluffy, as all yeast raised doughnuts should be (though often fail to be) and delicious.  The filling wasn't painfully sweet or overly thick as some doughnut shops interpret the word "cream" as "leftover frosting."  

The next one I got was called no-name, which was peanut butter, chocolate frosting, and rice krispies.  Deeeelicious!  I am a sucker for all things peanut butter so it's not a surprise I loved this, but the combination of chocolate and peanut butter with neither overshadowing the other in combination with the varied textures of the light doughnut and the crispy cereal, it was great.

Plus, the doughnuts are a lot cheaper than other places would offer for such "gourmet" treats, and come on, it IS a portland landmark.  It's for tourism! Calories don't count for tourism, right?
Too many choices! Delicious but super sweet. Stayed fresh a couple days so use Tupperware if you want to keep longer.
This place is a must see and must have....everyone should try it at least once! My favorite is their glazed donut which is gigantic and the M&M donut is what I got their for. Best donut shop!!
Bacon Maple Bar. That's all I need to say... this was the highlight of our visit to Portland.

Going to Voodoo Doughnuts is one of the top ten things to do in Portland. With the "Keep Portland Weird" motto on a nearby building, you can order a Voodoo doughnut (a zombie shaped doughnut with chocolate icing, raspberry filling, and a pretzel stake) or a Portland pothole (chocolate icing, Bavarian cream filling, and Oreo crumble so).

We have been to Voodoo twice while visiting Portland. Always a line but fast moving. We really like the donuts! They are cheap in price but they are large donuts with lots of glaze, icing, toppings. Their chocolate frosting (on the voodoo doll and others) is perfect in my opinion. It's thick and chocolatey, Not thin and watery like many chocolate frostings. The raspberry filling tastes so fresh. We love them all!

It's your sweet tooth's dream come true.  

Remember all of those foods you begged for as a kid?   You know sugary cereal, candy bars, marshmallows, and cookies?  Well, they may not have made the cut for your mom's grocery cart, but they seem to have found a home at Voodoo Doughnut.  Along with the staples of sugary upon sugary goodness, come some oddball doughnuts like maple and bacon, to keep your taste buds guessing.  

Stop here if you're in Portland.  Half of the pictures I took while visiting Portland for the weekend were of doughnuts, so that should say something..

A trip to Portland is complete without a stopping into Voodoo Doughnuts.  I recommend the maple bacon bar and the rappers delight (you get three doughnuts with the rappers delight for less that $5). Try and go in the late morning morning or early afternoon and then go have a cup of coffee at stumptown in the next block. After your all hopped up on sugar and coffee go take a photo next under the "Keep Portland Weird" sign next door.  
Oh yeah and bring some cash as its "cash only", but they do have an ATM.

Loved the mafia madness, peanut butter, banana, chocolate, and peanuts in fritter form.  Very rich and filling.   The maple bacon was tasty too.  Long line on a Thursday morning, but it moved quickly.

I'm very critical of doughnuts because I basically do not like them. I usually get heartburn. I find them basically similar everywhere I have had them. Until now. I must confess to finding these doughnuts incredibly good. Fantastic in fact. And no greasy doughnut gut or heartburn experienced after consuming two of these gems. So I highly recommend a trip to this place. I enjoyed a chocolate peanut and a glazed old fashioned. Really enjoyed them.

Great things come in pink boxes! Voodoo truly has the best chocolate iced doughnuts I 've ever had! I don't know how they do it but the icing is creamy chocolate and tasty fresh!! They have a great variety of doughnut choices.  The maple bacon bar is also delicious! They are so popular in Portland though the lines are always long and we usually visit on the weekend after a night of movies and cocktails at home after a midnight nap so about 3 a.m. seems to be the no line time lol  Its truly a Portland experience all should take part in!!
Mmmmmm doughnuttttt... Even better Hommer! It's Vodoo doughnut!

Bucket list, CHECK! I've been dying to come here for years and finally made it on my West Coast trip from LA to Portland. Went at midnight and the line was out the door and snaked up and down the sidewalk. Waited about 20-30 minutes to get in the door, but it was well worth the wait! 

The Maple Blazer Blunt was my favorite-- I'm a sucker for anything maple flavored. I recommend getting the "Rapper's Delight"-- you get an Old Dirty Bastard (Chocolate, Oreos & Peanut Butter Doughnut), Marshall Mathers (M&M doughnut) and Maple Blazer Blunt (Maple, Cinnamon Sugar, Sprinkles) for only $4.20 (lol at the price)! 

Side note: There are a lot of homeless people in the area accosting patrons for cash. Be smart! Voodoo Doughnut only accepts cash, so these people know you have some!
Just what you want! Yummy donuts shaped like weird things. Yes, they were sweet but it's donuts people!  Embrace the experience and prepare for a sugar high.

This has become our first stop when we visit Portland!  The line is always so long so we make sure to stock up.  It's cash only!!!  We learned that the hard way after waiting nearly 1.5 hours in line.  The good news, the donuts are so reasonably priced, we didn't much cash to get what we wanted.  Aside from their creative appeal, these donuts are equally delicious!!  Don't be the only person walking around Portland without the pink box.  Nobody wants to be that guy :-)

Oh and they are open 24/7.  At around 2am, they'll start selling 5 gallon paint buckets filled with donuts for $10!!  

Enjoy!!

Ok, so I know I'm the umpteenth Yelper to write about VD.

I'll keep it short and sweet.  A group of were out and about last Saturday night and at about 2:00am we thought that Voodoo Doughnuts sounded just right.  Even at this wee hour, the line was well out the door.  It moved swiftly however, and the lot of us were soon placing our orders.

I spied a pink glazed, Fruit Loop covered, orb of tastiness immediately and made my choice.  Oh, it was good.  My mouth loved every bit of it, my stomach did not.  (I had not had any real food since about 6pm the night before)  The following tummy ache was not awesome.

This does not deter me in the least from returning though; I will just remember to eat a bit beforehand.
I honestly dunno which is better crispy creme or voodoo donuts. I love how they bake them there the line is worth the wait. The one in Eugene sucks but the one is Portland is the best go there.

Best doughnuts ever.  It's ruined me for the doughnuts I used to buy at the market which is good for my waistline because I live too far away to get a voodoo doughnut very often.  The purple pixie dust, portland creme and ol dirty bastard were all delicious.  Nothing like passing around half a dozen doughnuts with your friends to wrap up a night out downtown.

Yes its been over-hyped, and yes some of the doughnuts are more than a little wacky. But at the end of the day what says "Portland" more than walking out of this place with a big pink box full of sinful treats? If I lived in Portland I might not come every day, but since I am an occasional visitor I wouldn't miss it. And in case you were wondering, the maple bacon doughnut really is amazing.

BEEM ME UP SCOTTY!!!!!

out of this world!!!!  I love this place
BACON doughnuts!!!!!   crazy mad styles!!!  

the long lines are worth it.  anytime i have friends from out of town i always take them here.

Vegan donuts --- what can I say?   I ordered the "vegan dozen" (12 bucks) and was pleasantly surprised to find they were all great --- including the creme filled ones.   The dozen are selected by the counter clerk --- and my order was long on chocolate ones, but I enjoyed them all.   The clerk was very pleasant.    Parking is a problem, so my husband held the car while I ran in.
There is almost always a line here, but it is definitely somewhere that everyone should try.  Delicious and unique donuts. My favorite is one with bubblegum flavored sprinkles.
Always get the same thing Glazed and maple bacon. Always the same. Great job on standards

Voodoo doughnuts us one of the main things I had to look forward tp regarding my first visit to Portland. Line out the door, and for good reason. Fast service, great music, seating, and decor! A great selection for vegans as well. I had a vegan oreo doughnut and it did not disappoint. Perfect volume, density, gooeyness, and flavor. Only complaint is that I may gain 10 lbs off this place before my vacation is over!
These donuts are the bomb! Worth the wait. I tried a jelly filled and a chocolate eclair, both were very good,
Totally worth the wait. Not only were the donuts delicious, they were unique and fun. The ambiance of the place is upbeat and fun and we totally understood why it is a top place to stop in portland.

What can be said about Voodoo Donut that hasn't been said?
1. My friend David works there. He is very special person. Worth it just to go chat with him. 
2. We went in on Saturday after a funky wedding. One out of town guest who had been before, 2 who had no idea what this Voodoo Donut thing was all about. One of the 2 didn't look at the menu or the display case before placing his order, but said "Do you have any meat-flavored donuts?" (somewhat facetiously)

 Of course, they gave him the bacon-maple donut, and he was suitably impressed.
Great doughnuts, all kinds of crazy combinations, Fritters are just melt in your mouth fantastic!

Lordy Lordy.

If I lived in Portland I would live off these.

One of the many epic places we visited on a trip earlier this year after watching the infamous man vs food.

The choice of fresh amazing donuts is out of this world! Mental flavours and such a cool place to visit. The bacon maple we had on one occasion was mouthwatering.

Do it!

It looks weird. Tastes great. The perfect words for the heart of Portland sweetery. The doughnuts are cooked to a soft perfection, and their diverse yet unique flavors give voodoo an outstanding rep for being the best doughnuts to many people. Just look how often the long line is!

If you're anything like me you were thinking "yeah, yeah, yeah. maple bacon bar. big whoop. I get the novelty. Next." But, I'll tell you this...you're dead wrong. This thing isn't like "The Watchmen" or "The Strokes"...it completely and totally lives up to the hype. Color me impressed. I can't believe SoCal hasn't jumped aboard the wacky donut train yet.
A true Portland donut shop which I'm super proud of! The variety is endless and flavors are super yum! Voodoo all the way ( never going to a Dunkin' donuts or Krispy Kreme again).

This place was a lot fun. Lots of cool doughnuts to choose from. Luckly when we went we didn't have to stand in a long line. It was cool to see all the art they have on the walls. I even got a t-shirt because I thought the place was so awesome!!

I've waited for years to come here, and I finally made it. Let me just say that it did NOT disappoint. I got way too many doughnuts and was completely satisfied with every single one. The unique flavor combinations were incredible. The line was a bit long but it was well worth it. I would definitely recommend.

Great donuts!

My hubby and I had a hard time choosing a donut each but I chose the Bacon Maple Bar and he went for the Texas sized ring donut, which served as late night snack and breakfast the next morning! Check it out when you're in Portland!!!

Definitely worth the wait! The locals told us that Blue Star Donut was 100% better, but Voodoo took the cake. The Portland Cream and Captain Crunch doughnuts were to die for. I'm just sad we waited til the last day to come!
Love the variety of doughnuts and people.  Can never get enough!  If you visit Portland, you need to visit the Voodoo :)

Must Stop / Drive to place in Portland - NOT OPTIONAL !

Some would refer to oddly flavored donuts  . . . I prefer : creative lovely little cakes of heaven
If you like donuts, there's no place better. If not, Voodoo most likely won't change your mind.
The sleazy neighborhood only adds to the charm! Our whole family loves the doughnuts. We all have our own favorites. The Mango Tango is my must-have.

Super cool doughnut shop! They have the craziest doughnut choices and it's just down right awesome. I'm a big doughnut lover and these are some of the best. The maple bacon long john is the best. I also had some of an old dirty bastard and while it was good it was so rich that I couldn't finish it. There also wasn't a line when we went which was a pleasant surprise!

TOTALLY lives up to the hype. I had the bacon maple bar which was f'n scrumptious. Also one that was a chocolate doughnut with peanut butter, chocolate and rice crispies all over it...delish! If you're in the area this is a must try for sure. (p.s. the way overpriced beer in the pink bottle is nasty, don't do it.)
Delicious, as always. I was sad they ran out of the special Rose Festival crown doughnut though - I guess I'll have to go back!

After crossing the Burnside Bridge and heading into downtown, from the corner of your eye on 3rd Street, I'll guarantee that you'll see a huge line that almost touches the corner. And that, my friend, is the line that leads to Voodoo Doughnuts. But don't be discouraged by the huge line! The doughnuts that you get afterwards are totally worth it the wait. It may be a little pricey for a donut, but every single doughnut has a unique taste that you'll always remember. Perfect spot for any tourist looking for a Portland experience.

I visited Portland with our relatives and on our way back from the airport we saw the sign for voodoo around 3-4pm ish and there was no line! I love the creative doughnut flavors and there super good! I got the voodoo doll and it was amazing perfect texture, perfect taste, and sooo many flavors. Overall a pretty fair priced place and a very touristy place. Super fun. (;
Amazing selection of doughnuts- definitely worth the wait, just bring your rain coat!

Bring on the bacon maple doughnut!

The line up is totally worth waiting in for those delicious, scrumptious donuts.  I won't lie.. we bought six donuts between the two of us and they did not last the night.  I couldn't resist or wait.. they had to be eaten.  Nom, Nom, Nom...

I can't wait to go back and try some more. I will have to workout and then go.. that could be the no guilt way to go and perhaps or try and keep it to just one donut.  Really though, knowing me that so is not going to happen. How can one resist all of yummy donuts.

If you're thinking, how good can a donut really get, you're kinda right. That said, these are some of the best donuts I've had. I think by this point, this place is a must-stop in Portland. The huge variety and the visual awe of the donuts here alone are worth the visit. They're so pretty and whimsical (oddly, the one I like the most might be the simple giant donut), and the spinning display cases make it look like a toy store. Other things I LOVED about this place were the super friendly staff and the authentic, almost grunge look of this place. It's not a sheeshee fancy pretentious place, just an awesome donut shop. And they never close! I came really early in the morning so was lucky to not have to stand in line. I had the bacon maple bar and it's really great. The hype aside, this is a shop worth your visit.

Love this place everytime i hit Portland i stop by here. The bread of the doughnut is amazingly fluffy and tatsy. I get the glazed its my favorite! Lines go by quick. Havent had  a rude or bad experience

The maple bacon bar literally brings tears to my eyes. I have never had a better donut anywhere in my life- Top Pot literally tastes like dirt compared to this place. I'm pretty sure that someone once sold their soul to satan to open up this donut shop and I am extremely grateful for that sacrifice. 
Also they give you a free donut on your birthday !

Amazing donuts - I don't even like donuts much anymore- but my husband and daughters dragged me here. I got a plain glazed and it was amazing.   The apple fritter was too sugary for me.   The maple bacon accd to husband was really good.  Daughter had the blueberry and loved it.

My first time experience went extremely pleasant. The line wasn't all that long surprisingly! When I went in I didn't feel pressured to order right away and my helper Jordan even gave me a complimentary doughnut! Lucky for him the coconut guava jam was delicious and I will be back for more so don't discontinue it please! AND it was national doughnut day, lucky me

Coming to Portland for the first time, I can't say that I knew of many "must-do's" to hit, but Voodoo Doughnuts has consistently made it on many "most popular" lists. Pair that with the many, many reviews it has on Yelp, my husband and I figured it was certainly worth indulging as tourists for the weekend.

The line outside went back and forth once, and we waited about 20-30 minutes. This is a Saturday morning so I would think that's bad, but some locals tell me it can get up to 90 minutes in summer months. 

When we got inside, I can see why the line was long. The employees work very quickly but between the quirky decor, and the many doughnut choices (and a photo booth we didn't go to) it's hard to move along quickly. They have the classics, some specialty doughnuts, vegan doughnuts, and more. 

The doughnuts were actually pretty tasty. I don't know if I'd typically wait 30 minutes for any doughnuts, but if you love doughnuts you won't be disappointed. Part of the experience was waiting, and knowing you're hitting a "must try" spot, so all in all it was good. My favorite was the Portland Cream (chocolate covered filled doughnut). My husband got a cake doughnut with chocolate topping and it was really soft and moist. We also got the obligatory voodoo doll, a special guava colada, a buttermilk bar, and a classic glazed doughnut. All we're very tasty, but the voodoo doll was more for looks. 

I think if we came back and the line was shorter, we would probably visit again because doughnuts with coffee made for a perfect end to our morning.
Lives up to the hype. This place rules. Not enough junky vegan donuts in the world! My only complaint is they don't have any other milk alternatives.
Fun place, nice benched area to enjoy your doughnuts!

Donuts here are amazing! My son tried couple of their varieties and loved all of them.

- they accept only cash!!
- there's usually a line (we were there on Monday evening, roamed in the area for 2 hours and the line was always moderately long)

The bacon and maple bar doughnut ... how can something so wrong taste so freakin' good?!

Oh, the one with fruit loops is pretty yummy too.  

There is so much stuff on the walls to look at, you almost miss the glass display of doughnuts spinning around on the left side of the counter. 

Next time, I packing a baker's dozen on the plane ride home with me!

Five stars for creativity and sticking to the theme.  Five stars for delicious concoctions like the maple bacon doughnut and that one with cap'n crunch.  Five stars for the music they were playing. Six stars for the cute lady selling the doughnuts. Minus ten stars for that area of portland being the hardest place to park. Five stars for the cockfest poster, was that real?

They still get more than five stars. MMMMM

I love apple fritters.  This place has amazing apple fritters.

I never had a cherry fritter before.  They made me take one instead of an apple on a late night.  It was amazing too.

I love cherry fritters.  This place has amazing cherry fritters.

The rest of the doughnuts?  Stab is ok - if you like jelly.  I'm not a huge fan of the grape.  The fruitloop one has stale fruitloops, if that's your thing.  The cocopuff one has stale cocopuffs, if that's your thing.

Stick to the fritters and the glazed and the maples.  You'll go home happy.

*EDIT*
