UPDATE UPDATE!  I came here and I tried the PEACH FRITTER.  Uhm... You know, I didn't believe it was possible to make a fritter more awesome by adding cream cheese frosting.  What the???!!  It looked disgusting.  But it was amazing.  I kept stuffing it in my face.  I wanted to puke.  I couldn't stop.  Fritter + Cream Cheese Frosting = *!#@!*#!*

I love this place. I always bring my out of town guests here and it is always a hit. 

Good thing it is "out of the way" for me or I'd be in serious trouble all the time.

Voodoo doughnut is everything you would want in a alternative doughnut shop. Its Weird and quirky you can get novelty , ones with bacon on it, but also ones that are that are just high quality traditional. 

Also a lot of vegan choices.

It's worth the hype. Yes, it's touristy. Yes, there's a huge line most of the time, there's a reason for that. Staff is super friendly and the quality of the product is worth the wait. Highly recommend!

I get super excited every time I see the pink pepto bismol colored fencing. It's a bit like Disney Land. You wait in a long line knowing something worthwhile and magical is at the end. The donuts are pretty scrumptious for the most part. I've tried 6 and I liked 5 out of the 6. I got the funny voodoo one and that was okay, but it was insta pretty for me. It's cash only, so bring those dolla dolla bills yo. 

After you can take a stroll along the water and if you're lucky go to Portland's Saturday Market and make everyone mega jealous! WOO HOO!

I always eat here in the middle of the night, so I've never had an issue with the line. Seriously, don't factor in the line into your rating and review-- people stand in it VOLUNTARILY.

Had a Voodoo Doll and an Old Fashioned Chocolate doughnut. Washed it all down with some Stumptown Coffee. My mom got a doughnut covered in rice krispies with peanut butter and chocolate along with a maple bar. Lovely experience every time I visit!
It's a really funny themed doughnut place. The doughnuts taste like you would expect. But the true thrill is the humor in the marketing. Pure genius playing off of Portland's innate weirdness.
These are the absolute best donuts in the whole world. Got my pink box delivered here in California! If you go and have to make line you will not regret it, trust me!

OMG! Yum. 
Apple fritter is a must! It's huge! Triple chocolate penetration, the joint doughnut is awesome! Can't go wrong with it!!!

Voodoo is no joke! Seriously if you haven't tried maple and bacon get over there now and prepare to have your mind blown. Oh and if your in the mood for a shotgun wedding, the Voodoo Doughnut in Portland has an ordained minister on staff!

We went to this place on Saturday evening and I was surprised to see the queue in front of their store. It seemed I was standing in front of an Apple store on the day of iPhone launch.
This is the only place in Portland where could find vegan doughnuts.
I bought 14 doughnuts and ate 12 of them in 2 days.
This might give you a hint if I liked their doughnuts ;)

Not to forget their interior is pretty cool too.

P.S. this review was for their SW 3rd avenue location.

Most importantly... the doughnuts are incredible.  We LOVED the "Old Dirty Bastard" and the Cap'n Crunch topped (even though the cereal was on the stale side).  I agree with others that it probably annoys them (and it seems like it does) that it's filled with tourists and has reached uber popularity.  We showed up on a Friday morning and waited in line for about 5 minutes (we drove by on Thursday night and the line was down the block).  Don't let the haters turn you off to this place though... it's epic.

Sweet and savory.  Two distinct ideas that stand very well on their own but combined...OMG...when combined it's like getting into heaven after committing a lifetime of sin.  SALVATION!  

If you've read my other review of Voodoo you already know what I think of this joint so I finally tried the Bacon Maple Bar and it BLEW MY MIND!!!  I've had sweet and savory flavor combinations before but this mix of sweet maple frosting on a raised donut and the salty crispy slice of bacon exploded in my mouth leaving no prisoners.  KABOOM!!!  

My tongue is STILL recovering from shock.  My advice to all of you, especially if you love bacon and have been known to let the syrup from your pancakes violate any bacon that might be on the plate...TRY THIS!  GO NOW!  If you can't go today then go tomorrow but please do it before the end of this week because I guarantee that if nothing else puts a smile on your face and gives your tummy a warm fuzzy this week...THIS WILL!

I LOVE PORK!  I LOVE SWEET!  I LOVE VOODOO'S BACON MAPLE BAR!

A HUI HOU!
Wow! So good. Worth the wait in line for these. I can see why they are world famous!!!

I can't even begin to figure out how to put this delicious review into words. Their doughnuts are amazing. I often find myself driving the 30 minutes to Portland late on a Friday or Saturday night just in search of a fix of these doughnuts.   Parking is always a pain in downtown.  And it is a bit troublesome to stop remember cash, but never fear they have an ATM inside.
Despite all that I have happily stopped at the ATM, parked blocks away, lined up in the bitter cold, and been harassed by drunk men just for a Triple Chocolate Penetration. Or a No Name. Or a Portland Creme. Or how about that strawberry one.  These doughnuts are awesome! And well worth the walking, waiting, and drooling!

Line? Yes. Worth it? Yes!! These donuts will change your life. Or....just satisfy your sweet tooth. lol Their selection is amazing, and their names are fabulous. Be sure to get a few extras for your friends!

This place is def worth checking out, esp if you're a tourist like me. The wait is long, the shop is small and oddly decorated, and the doughnuts are unique. Never seen anything like it. My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I convinced my bf to get a dozen of their picks. They picked some interesting ones, such as oreos, peanut butter, and cereal. I shoulda listened to my bf-way too many doughnuts and sugar overload. But it was fun to take a bite of each. Each doughnut had their own distinct flavor and texture. I wished I lived in Portland so I can go down their menu and try each one!

It's Voodoo Doughnut. It is, what it is. A major- must- stop for Portland, even if it is just to say you did it. I have to be honest in that, a doughnut is a doughnut to me but it's the ambience and the experience that you go for. I actually saw an impromptu wedding take place at the one off of Sandy. :)

A Portland icon and deserving of the hype. The line was fun b/c of a great busker and the donuts were DELICIOUS! Probably so fresh b/c of the high volume of customers. Cheap, and fun - lots of double entendre. I wanted the coffin of donuts for $100.

...is the greatest ever and I am not a fan of doughnuts usually... ever...
except for just made Krispy Kreme's.  My favorites are the Voodoo Doughnut and the bacon maple bar. For real-  They are godhead.  This tiny  place is great for making fun of drunk hosers late-weekend nights.
For donuts, you can't beat Voodoo. I'm a Memphis Mafia, then blood sugar spike kinda guy

I love this place.

Great doughnuts, quirky ambience, good concept.  It's an institution - and  popular with tourists.  So expect a line especially at the original location (Voodoo Too is less manic).  

My favorites - the oreo doughnut; the coco puffs and the so called gay bar - vanilla bar with creme filling and fruit loops (of course).
Whenever I want a yummy treat, I always choose Voodoo's to eat.lol I always try to choose something different and have never had one I didn't like. V.D. ROCK'S!!

You don't know till you go . I've had a better doughnut elsewhere but it's to say you've been there.  Mount Rushmore is just a mountain with faces carved in it and the redwoods are just trees but you've been there. It's a local business and it's a Portland icon and it's a tourist attraction all those things said the doughnuts don't suck they are good the line is crazy and the service is rushed but what did you think was going to happen? Did you think a waiter was going to seat you and show you a wine list? Or were you expecting the doughnuts to jump up and dance for you maybe give you a back rub? It's an icon . If you're in the mood for a premium doughnut go wherever you liking takes you but don't be disappointed if you go to a popular place and find it crowded and busy and rushed and expected it to live up to its own legacy.  It is a legacy and your aproval isn't needed. You want cheap buy cheap. You want your favorite buy your favorite.  You want to say you went to voodoo doughnuts than go to voodoo doughnuts
Another place to visit when in Portland! I only had the chuckles and it was delicious! Glazed doughnut with cocoa on top sprinkled with chocolate, caramel and nuts.
I put up with the ridiculous wait because they offer vegan doughnuts.  Bless you, Voodoo.  Thank you for filling me with cock and balls at 3:00 a.m.
Took A Vegan friend, he was impressed with the selection of donuts, he could eat. Getting to sweet for me but I still love the maple bacon bar!!

Bacon maple bar. It's the best damn thing ever and not just the salty crispy bacon, or the just sticky sweet enough glaze- the dough is tasty, too. 

Tech tip:  

Get some apple fritters (any of their varieties work).  More than you can eat.  Let 'em set until Sunday morning, then slice them an inch thick on the bias, soak briefly in a basic egg/ milk wash and make 'em into french toast. 

Yes, that's right.  Apple frickin fritter french toast. It's ridiculously delicious.  You are welcome.

Better than the shops in Colorado. The customer service is identical but the selection is incredibly fresh and the wait is never like the shops in 'Rado. I've been to both more than a handful of times and I gotta say Portland Voodoo wins hands down, every time in almost every way. 

I cant visit this incredible bakery without getting the Oreo doughnut. The new Homer Simpson doughnut is pretty delicious too, and identical to the pink, sprinkle-filled cartoon baked goodness.

I wanted to write a review for this rectangular box of culinary confection on SW 3rd and finally got to it - because every good business deserves a shout-out - after the delightful gal let me snap a pic of my niece's Flat Stanley next to my beloved Maple Bacon Bar. This place is not your ordinary donut shop and why should it be? We're in Portland.

Where do I start? The concoctions are different yet there are the traditional jelly donuts. Arnold Palmer - sinks me every time. However, I keep going back to the Maple Bacon Bar; it's like the bad boy ex you swear you'll never see again, but you keep going back and it just makes you want it even more.

When you tell people about the maple and bacon combo, some cringe. Why? Didn't they love dipping their slices of bacon in their pancake syrup as kids? Some eateries got carried away with this classic (albeit different) combo, but Voodoo's had this baby on the menu longer than most places have been in business.

I'm not a big donut fan; I can count on both hands, if not one, the number of donuts I eat every year. But, when I need to get donuts for friends or family is visiting from out-of-town, this is where I go. Oh, just make sure you bring cash or you'll need to use the ATM machine.

Husband and I waited for about a half hour in line (expected from such a popular donut place). We ordered a dozen donuts. My favorites from what we got are the dirt donut and the vegan cake donut with chocolate frosting (the vegan was our sons absolute favorite). Service was quick and friendly. I loved the atmosphere. Unique experience. Fun place to make a pit stop in if you have some time to wait.
If you like/love donuts, this is the place.  Just plan on standing in line to order! It's part of the fun.  The pink box is always a giveaway where you've been.  Too many favs to note.

No Portland trip is complete without trying Voodoo doughnuts. Small line when my girlfriend and I got there in the afternoon and so we only waited 10-15 minutes which wasn't bad at all. When we got inside, my eye immediately locked onto the Blue Moon Pie. I haven't eaten a doughnut in years so I was really excited to try it.

One of the best doughnuts I have ever eaten!! I knew I was in for a treat when I took that first bite and the doughnut was so soft and fresh. As I kept eating, my mouth was bombarded with all that chocolate, the over abundance of graham crackers, and to my surprise, so much marshmallow fluff inside! Once I hit that fluff, it was all over. It was like a s'more on steroids with each bite overwhelming me and my taste buds into sweet sugary ecstasy. HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting the Blue Moon Pie!

As good as the b&m their mobile truck rocks, got down to cartlandia to visit my favorite bacon/maple doughnut its been a while, but better than ever, not sure exactly when they are down there (Cartlandia) but i will keep my feelers out for them as for know followers enjoy & Keep Portland Weird and Eat At The Carts, tell em TheFoodCartGuy sent ya.

Of course it's over-hyped. They're doughnuts not a 10-course tasting menu. People love them some doughnuts and by people I mean me. But for anyone who loves food, it's about the adventure, the story, and yeah, how they taste. We got super lucky and waited only about 10 minutes as a line quickly formed behind us. I'm actually glad we had that time to look around the shop and stand in awe of the rotating display of doughnuts. 

You have to admit how impressive it is to put together the sheer volume of doughnuts they do every day. I think they are priced just right and are worth the wait. I ordered the Voodoo Doll donut, which was essentially dessert for breakfast. I also tried the one with coconut, chocolate and caramel. It kind of looks like a Girl Scout cookie and was actually my favorite of the two. 

The pink boxes are fun. The employees are friendly. And the line really doesn't take that long. I heard a story that they started by selling donuts with a shot of Benadryl in the middle, a "voodoo" spell, if you will. 

I loved everything about our experience and wouldn't call it a tourist trap. It's not like you get there and it's a crap time. They're delicious doughnuts where you're surrounded by other enthusiasts and just soaking up the experience. 

Note: They only take dolla dolla bills. Bring cash.

Voodoo Doughnut is a popular Portland tradition and we decided to try it out.  We went early in the morning to avoid the lines, but guess what?  There was already a line at 7:00 am.  The good news is that the line moves quickly.  We were inside after only 10 minutes.  Remember to bring cash because this place doesn't accept credit cards.  My wife and I bought a dozen assorted donuts and they were incredible!  My wife also bought a Voodoo Doughnut T-Shirt.  It was a fun visit and the doughnuts are excellent.
Great doughnuts!  They have began and regular doughnuts. I had the cotton candy it was amazing. I love that they are open 21 hours a day!!

Staff there were so awesome! Very friendly and helpful. Explained stuff and even with the crowd of people stayed relaxed and just focused on people being served. Needless to say how great the donuts taste.
It is the most exciting place to go, sugary goodness and a historic Portland feel. Plus, it totally fits into my schedule and my route to work.
Great presentation and awesome location. Could use some deep cleaning just to keep all bugs away. But besides that they have very cool and unique donuts to sell.

My friends kept telling me I had to go here, I had to go here. They wanted to get me a "cock-n-balls" and I didn't care what it was as long as it taste good lol. That sounded way too funny.."as long as it taste good" This place is so small and had people waiting outside. I wasn't one of the ones outside in the cold. But I was amaze of how many people wanted doughnuts from here. So when my turn came they ran out of the cock-n-balls oh too bad for me.. but I looked it up it has Bavarian cream inside topped w/chocolate frosting..boo hoo I didn't get to try it. But I did have there maple bacon doughnut yummy!! 
The decor is interesting there shirts lining the walls and the panties (how cute). But the inside smells so good. I wanted to stay and just savor everything and try everything.. but then again.. I wanted the doughnut my friends were raving about. So definitely another trip will have to be made.
It isn't really worth the wait, but if you can make when the lines are short...the donuts are top notch! Cash only!

I kept wanting to go here, but did not feel like waiting in line. Finally I gave in and waited all of about 15 minutes? I got the Homer Simpson doughnut. Worth it. I've apparently gotten use to Grocery Store doughnuts, so I wasn't expecting the hefty weight and fluffiness. I'd go back.

Best donuts I have ever had!
While visiting OR we HAD to stop by the famous Voodoo Donut.
Fast friendly service and delicious donuts!
Favorites: Chuckles, Oreo white frosting and the small Blueberry (dnt remember the name).

The magic IS in the hole!

A Maple Bacon Donut ? ? ? ? You have to try this. Whenever I say this people usually say, "ewe" but when you think about breakfast (maple syrup and bacon) it starts to make more sense. No matter what you like - you have to try it. By your third visit (yes, 3 visits in 3 days in PDX) you'll realize you might love some of their other donuts better - like the Capt'n (Captain Crunch on top), or the Grape Ape, or ODB - I want to try them all.

When you visit Portland, OR - you must get your Voodoo Fix!

Look, I'll be honest..this place is not for everyone. If you don't have an open mind, if you don't like bacon,& if you don't like long waits...you're not gonna like this place.

If you don't give a rats ass about how you look, or how smelly the homeless man beggin you for money while you wait in the cold is, swing by! Enjoy the wonderfulness of VOODOO Doughnut cause it is good.

I dream of maple bacon bars all day. Salty, sweet, crunchy, doughy, and truly undeniable.

The cashiers aren't the friendliest of people so don't dilly dally; they could care less about your needs. Bring cash cause that's all they accept.

Best donuts and a fun place to go !!! Been to the original one in Oregon and the location at City Walk. 
Highly recommend both locations

SUGAR! SUGAR! SUGAR!

I'm not a huge dessert eater but I'm a sucker for fried dough, donuts in particular. I got the maple bacon donut--delicious--and a peanut butter coconut cake donut--mediocre.  I had a few bites of an oreo icing donut--very good.

I probably haven't had this much sugar in one sitting since childhood. I had too much energy. I ran a block with my girlfriend riding piggy back just to burn the energy.

This place has a great alternative selection of donuts. Check it out.

We live in Az, so when we visit Oregon VooDoo is a MUST! They have the BEST fritters anywhere!!  Their Buttermilk (old fashioned?) Is amazing!!   For the amount of business they do, they have great quality and consistency.

TOP TIP: The filled donuts are a-okay to get through airport security.
Gotta make this the last stop of every trip to PDX before heading home!

Voodoo's employees are the only thing that you can't be sure of.
I've had some employees that are rude when I'm choosing donuts (when i'm not super slow and it's 5 AM and there's no one waiting behind us) and then I've had super friendly ones that are patient when you take 2.5 seconds to chose the last of your dozen out of a huge variety.

The portland cream is my favorite! They use fresh custard and it makes a difference.
But anything here is really good.
The pothole was slightly too sweet for me, but if you share it i'm sure i'll be good.
It's real cereal toppings so you'll want to eat it ASAP.

They're donuts, they're good, and they have buttons!

Now, when Blue Star gets brought up...
Blue Star donuts are good. They offer unique and experimental flavors and combinations that Voodoo doesn't, but Voodoo is very novel and tasty. I'd much rather have a blue star donut one or twice in a trip to Portland, but ALWAYS bring back voodoo for friends and family. Blue Star is okay to have for funsies, but Voodoo takes the cake. hehe

I came to this location after going out on a Tuesday around 1:30am and there was no line at all. The donuts were delicious and the inside was very interesting.  I Ordered the voodoo donut, coconut donut, sprinkles cake and old dirty bastard. My favorite was definitely the voodoo donut. The cashier was very helpful with recommendations but the only bad thing is the location. Outside there were a lot of homeless people and you don't feel safe walking around or eating at the tables there.

Man I never knew doughnuts could taste so Good! Lines move fast plus it gives you time to think about the surrey  of choices. Fritters are great(Memphis Mafia), mango tango, etc. If you're in Portland and do not go there you messed up!

It's a great local place and a must for tourists!!  

I used to go here weekly. Unique donuts but I stuck with the basics.  I liked every one I ate and miss being within range of the place now. You will stand in line BUT that should tell you what the experience will be like.  The line moves quickly!

 Keep Portland Weird!! Lots of good places to eat!!
Wide selection of typical and creative doughnuts. You could go the vegan route, but we went the custard-filled-maple route. Delicious for $1.75.
Outstanding donuts. Crazy selections. Worth the time to get downtown and find a parking space to get some.

Best doughnuts ever!!! My boyfriend and I went to Portland and stayed the night at the Benson hotel on Broadway (very nice, btw). We went both days we were in town. We got:

Old Dirty Bastard - Ok, very sweet.
Maple Bacon Bar (2) - SOOO GOOD.
Captain my Captain - Good.
Butter Fingerring - BEST DOUGHNUT EVERRR.

Good prices too!

The Memphis Mafia doughnut was the best experience with a doughnut I have ever had. It was delicious and everything I was hoping for. The line was a little long when we showed up (and there perpetually seems to be a line), but it moved quickly enough, and it was worth the wait. Do it.

Voodoo Doughnut lives up to all the hype!  There was a line when we were there, but it moves quickly and the people taking orders are all polite and didn't make us feel rushed.  Doughnuts were delicious and decorative and looked so lovely in their bright pink box.  Lots of people looking like they'd been knocked around by life in the neighborhood, my Mom and I wished we had gotten a couple of extra doughnuts so we could have given them some while walking back to our hotel.

The doughnuts are just as great and unique as the vibe. Creative toppings (i.e. Captain Crunch, M&Ms), fun designs (voodoo doll doughnut), & great service too (long menu, indecisive customers [us], & patient cashier even with a long line).

First off:  Dang, I've not seen so many Yelps for one place!!  (and most of 'em are hella-positive!).  

I've known about Voodoo for a while (saw it on The Amazing Race, and some food shows), but regretfully never made it there....until now.  

Walking up to Voodoo, I knew I was in for something special seeing  there was a line almost around the corner.  I quickly got in line.  I chatted to a few other patrons.  There was a Seattle couple who were newbies like me, but who were excited to have a Voodoo experience.  There was the "regular" couple who goes all the time, and still go even after moving 30-min further away.  

While waiting in line, we'd see people come out w/ pink boxes and big grins.  "Don't open that box, unless you want to start losing donuts!" said a person in line to a group of people walking out w/ a Pink Box.

All in all, the wait was about 30min.  Inside, there's a small area where one can read the menu and see what's in the rotating donut display.  Oh, it should be noted they don't take credit cards.  They do have an ATM in this room though.  

Back to the donuts---decisions, decisions, decisions!  They all looked good.  I ultimately went for the Voodoo Dozen.  It's a dozen donuts they pick out for you & its all for a very reasonable price.

Now I had seen some crazy donuts, and the one which was craziest to me was the maple bar with some bacon on it----YES, bacon!!  I had to get one.  So, since it wasn't included in my Voodoo dozen, I ordered one extra.  I also ordered a couple of the Voodoo doll donuts as well.  With that I was set (my co-workers were in for some treats---I'm waaay too nice!).

As for the Bacon Maple Bar....it was actually really good!  The maple icing was evil (i.e. really good!), and the mix of the icing with the salty bacon-y goodness....well, it's something I know Homer Simpson would have loved.  If it's good enough for Homer, it's good enough for me (well, in moderation).

5-stars:  BAM!!

"Good things come in pink boxes"....YES THEY DO!! I make sure to try at least one donut spot in every town I visit so when I had the chance to try Voodoo I flipped!! Yes, we waited outside for 45 minutes at 1pm on a Friday just to step inside, but it was worth it. This menu is absolutely crazy; it's jam packed with delicious flavors like the "Marshall Mathers", "Dirt Donut", and "Cock-N-Balls". You can't go wrong with whatever you choose because all of the donuts are extremely light and airy, fresh, and HUGE!! 
I'm contemplating buying a ticket to Portland just to get some more!

My husband and I visited Portland over the weekend to spend our anniversary in some place other than Seattle. Every travel list recommended Voodoo Doughnuts, so we obviously had to try it.

EXPECT LONG LINES! This is an extremely well known place, be prepared to wait for a little while.

They have a bunch of creatively decorated (and named) doughnuts in a rotating stand. We ended up getting a box with a dozen doughnuts. We just pointed out which ones looked good.

Expect lots of sugar on your sweet treat! Cocoa Puffs, Captain Crunch, Fruit Loops, Pixie Stix, Sugar, Chocolate, Peanuts! Everything you can think of, they have it!

They also have vegan options for all of the non-byproduct consumers!

Very inexpensive, delicious doughnuts with a very friendly staff. They are cash only, so bring cash ahead of time!

I would definitely come back to get another box, or three!

I absolutely love this place. I've only been twice but of course I haven't been in Portland all that much. Amazing doughnuts, the Portland Cream is AWESOME. open 24/7, what else could you ask for? awesome.

I had to update this because the other night I walked in easily around 2:30am and there was no one there! On Fourth of July! I was expecting to wait in a huge line but thank god I didn't have to! I'd been reading reviews to find out which doughnut to get and of course I had to try the Maple Bacon Bar. and HOLY SMOKES. everyone is right, this was easily one of the bets ones I've had there. WOW. I won't eat it too often but oh my god. so so so so so so goood! god i love doughnutssssss!!
love their GRAPE APE donut!  best raised donuts, their voodoo donut with raspberry in the middle is good as well!  weekends are the busiest and you will have to wait in line.
I love waking up early before work to grab some Voodoo.

You Know You Want to Decapitate a Donut!

The place is small, the line is long, and there was a rather aggresive person asking for money... but with all that said, Voodoo Donuts is among my favorite must-haves for Portland.

Everyone will tell you they have a serious selection. If you are someone who likes to know what you are ordering a head of time, I suggest looking at their website for the new limited time or classic options.

Since I was new to Voodoo we opted to have the staff pick out a dozen... I loved the cake donuts and the maple with cream inside.  But  it is really a fun time to sample these bizarre yet delicious treats.

This place was fancy. The lines were too long. We stood in the cold to try out different doughnuts. Well worth the hype. The doughnut as such was not too good but looked fancy. I will ha e to give five stars for the price and the weirdness that this place offers. Cannot ask for more from a tourist.

Heroin donuts. 'Nuff said.  But in the good, delicious, I have to take a bite of each one before I get home, then sneak one in the middle of the night kind of way.

I also enjoy the sexy dessert names....all good things come in pink boxes, amirite?

Fun place to visit.  This is the original location.  

I tried the Voodoo Doll and the Portland Cream doughnuts.  The were both very good. 

I especially liked the chocolate frosting on the doughnuts.

There was a little bit of a wait to get in.  They only accept cash.

The only thing better than doughnuts is FUN doughnuts!  I'm happy that these people have gotten a lot more attention reciently but I'm not stoked I have to stand in a 30 minute line now. I will stand in line though! It's worth the wait!!

This is an amazing place.  There doughnuts are everything they are suppose to be and more.  They have creative idea's and great products.  For me the best doughnuts I have had.  Dirty old bastard and Maple bacon are two of my favorite.  A must stop

Great and unique donuts make this place a portland staple. There might be a line but it is well worth the wait. Donuts for adults and kids. If you are staying in portland this is a must stop on one of your morning adventures. Just remember that the magic is in the hole and good things come in pink boxes.

Love the donuts. Go get them. They are special. Great service.
Very Portland. Very cool. That is my review ;)

As the saying goes, "KEEP PORTLAND WEIRD" this is the place. No where in the world will you find donuts that will blow your mind. If you travel to Portland or just haven't visited this place. IT IS A MUST.

Voodoo Doughnuts is by far one of the coolest shops I've been to. All pop culture aside, the donuts are fabulous. Freshly made, good portions, and a decent price! The downtown location is so unique. You can't miss the building--classic Portland landmark really--and though the line is probably going to be long, it goes quick. It's cash only, but they have an atm set up right inside so you don't have to worry. I recommend getting the Mexican Chocolate donut and their version of the Boston creme. Trust me, you won't regret any trip to Voodoo.

Upon moving to Portland, I was told that Voodoo was the best place to get a doughnut and so we finally made the trek to downtown Portland. We went early on a Sunday morning and there was already quite a line. It moved pretty quickly though and I think we only waited about 15 minutes. I truly was not expecting more than an over priced doughnut and I was pleasantly surprised. Their prices, while more than your average doughnut, were not too crazy. The doughnuts are super tasty! You can taste the freshness and you can tell that they are fried in clean oil. I recommend Voodoo to everyone I know. Only thing that's a bummer is you have to pay cash.

How dare you?!?!! How dare you be so damn good?!?!! The boy kept talking about voodoo, all my favorite tv shows kept mentioning voodoo, and then suddenly the boy and I head to PDX for the weekend and all I want to do is sleep with my mixed voodoo dozen and forget about the boy. 

Seriously. I think my next game plan for voodoo is to spend two weeks in PDX so each day I can stop in and try a new voodoo doughnut. There are so many choices but it is easy to be too overzealous and eat too many at once and then lie on the bed in the hotel and wonder how you lived before voodoo....not that that happened to me or anything...

It's just too good to be true.

Half the experience of Voodoo is standing in line. Over the weekend I had out of state visitors, and I had to take them: I had more fun watching them take in the scene, talking to people, taking in our gorgeous city- and especially watching as their eyeballs bulged out when they saw what we had been waiting for. Before we got in line, I bet one of them lunch that they wouldn't be able to leave without buying a box of donuts. 

I didn't pay for lunch.

Mark my words, donuts will be the next craze to sweep the country.  

First, it's cheaper than cupcakes.  With most options ranging between $1.25-$2.50, Voodoo is half the price of Sprinkles and Georgetown Cupcakes.  Second, it offers the opportunity for more complex toppings and flavors.  Cupcakeries are too conservative to offer a maple bacon cupcake?  Granted, should someone bake it, I shall eat that too.  Third, donuts offers a more balanced treat than cupcakes.  The unsweetened fried dough is a foil to its sugary toppings unlike the unadulterated sugar-on-sugar combination of cupcakes.

Tourist Trap or not, Voodoo Doughnut is one place you shouldn't miss.  Plus, it's open 24 hours so you can beat the crowds by coming in at 5am.  [Original Visit: December 18, 2010]

Death by PDX - An Extended Weekend of Eating #4.

Now I know what the fuss is all about with these donuts! They are for real good good! Some many special custom donuts to choose from and they're huge. So far my favorite is the Oreo and the Captain Crunch donut. Super sweet frosting on top and so much tenderness in the inside. It's a must to get the voodoo dolls. Although, I'm not much of a strawberry filling donut kind of guy. It's still really good. They do have vegan options, but they're a lot smaller than the other donuts. Definitely worth the wait, luckily there wasn't much of a line on a Monday morning. I recommend checking out their website for the menus before going to know exactly what you want to keep the line moving. Keep in mind they only take cash and they're open 24/7! They do have an ATM Inside, so no worries.
I always say the allure is waiting in line for an uneasy amount of time then being hit in the face with more donut options than your senses can handle.

These doughnuts were one of the highlights of my trip to Portland a few weeks ago.  I was a little unenthusiastic about waiting in line for nearly an hour (it was pride weekend so I think under normal conditions the wait wouldn't be so long), but my travel companions were adament about getting some voodoo doughnuts.   These doughnuts were well worth the wait, not just for the taste, but for the experience as well.  This is a gothic, bad ass doughnut shop.   We got a dozen doughnuts so we could sample many kinds.  Highlights were:

Bacon maple bar - Better than I expected it to be.  High quality, thick cut bacon, good dough, great maple flavor.
Dirty Ole' Bastard - Peanut butter is one of my favorite foods, so I am a little bias towards this one.  There's Oreos on this pastry as well as peanut butter.  Oreos didn't add a ton of flavor, but did add great crunch to the peanut buttery taste.
Apple Fritter - A giant doughnut, fed about three people.  We got one of a fresh batch of these so it was warm and still slightly gooey.
Buttermilk bar - This is a simple doughnut, but buttermilk and old fashions are my favorite doughnuts.  This one didn't disappoint.

The dough for all these doughnuts was what really made them outstanding.  Anyone can slap some frosting or glaze on a pastry and make it sugary and sweet, but the chewy, fluffy consistancy of the dough made these doughnuts stand out.  I know waiting in line sucks, but if you have time to kill, these doughnuts are worth the wait.
The staff were super friendly and the lines were long but moved fairly fast. The doughnuts were amazing!!!!! I have to go back!

OMG........................the staff is wonderful, particularly the head manager tony. The individual customer attention and service given by him is beyond words.
There aren't many restaurants you can visit where the manager actually comes around to each and every table to make sure everything is to the customers liking. DEFINITELY will come back again and again.
Thanks again to Tony and his entire staff for a fantastic experience !!!!!
I first thought people were waiting in line to go inside a club... but then I discovered the best doughnut I've ever had in my life, the Oreo! Soooo worth the wait!
Yes!  Wacky crazy delicious doughnuts.  I want some right now but live too far away.

Ok, true story: went to Portland to get my Mercedes serviced in Woodinville. We stayed at the Embassy Suites downtown, always a good time to be had. Woke up the next morning and we just couldn't leave without trying out Top Pot for the first time ever. We waited in line (thank God it was a short one)in the rain of course got our dozen of donuts and put them on the back seat of our loaner car. Went back to the dealership to turn in the loaner and get our vehicle back, ended up leaving with a new 2018 and in the most of all the excitement,  we LEFT our donuts on the back seat!!!!! By the time we found out, we were already back in Washington. OMG, we wanted those donuts so bad and ended up with none.

Pink walls, heavy metal, glitter bricks, and sugar all in one place? Sign my ass up STAT.
While the captain crunch donut wasn't as mind-blowing as I thought it would be, the original voodoo was awesome (ugh, that jam filling they use-I could eat that alone). Your best bets are to go in the off times, which since they are open 24 hours, I have no idea when they are since there was always a line. But it's definitely an experience....

A wafting smell of cake batter, trash cans and the grungy Hentai theater next door - only at Voodoo donuts! 

The Line Experience: Winding crowd of about 30 people, located next door to scandalous, butt-checky Hentai (anime porn) theater and business hotel (trashy and scary sign from the 60's advertising nightly or monthly rooms for rent).... While standing in line for about 30 minutes to get a hold of these scrumptous sounding donuts with quite possibly ever verison of Portland's chain smoking emo/hipster lined up along with us, Misty managed to procure a screwdriver from a local bike guy (complete with roiling B.O.) to change her expired CA plates out for her new Washington ones. Legal and composed, we invited the bicyclist to cut in line with us and offered to buy him donuts. 

Decor: Voodoo skulls, giant donuts, Disneyland-esque chandaliers and pink walls...I was seriously ready for the Mad Hatter to jump out and serving tea. 

Donuts: THEY WERE OUT OF THE VOODOO MAN. :( I'm very sad, as this one of the main appeals of the place. I was looking forward to jabbing him with toothpicks!

The Grape Ape doesn't melt well, but otherwise delish, Dirty Snowball was f* amazing even though I hate coconut usually the peanut butter gave it an awesome edge. Butterfingering...well it had Butterfingers crumbled on top with a perk of minus the sticky teeth syndrome, and I can't say I have ever had issues consuming a Butterfinger. Vegan donuts tasted like banana bread, probably as they are trying to make up for the texture with lack of diary? Don't get me wrong, they're really good, just not something I'd eat all the time. 

Staff & Service: Not too amazing...the girl was nice enough who served us, the usual apathetic college undergrad/grad, but she did make some amazing suggestions (however, all lacking excitement or pizazz, just simply grabbed donut and threw in box).

My Favorite Part: Receiving my cute pink underwear, complete with phrase "Good Things Come in Pink Boxes." I spent quite a lot of time debating on the black "The Magic Is In The Hole," but figured the pink was more appropriate....
Awesome place!  Everything is awesome... It looks like a voodoo shop, with even a voodoo doll donought. You can even get married here if you want to.

I'm a dork, I don't care. But Voodoo Doughnut has been one of my fat-girl obsessions for the LONGEST TIME. When I finally had a chance to go there during my super ridiculously short trip to Portland, I was so excited, I almost puked. Fortunately, my belly behaved long enough for me to enjoy my Bacon Maple Bar. Salty and sweet almost always go well together, but it seems like that beautiful combo was created just for this heavenly concoction. Soft, fluffy, almost cake-like base with crispy bacon pieces and a layer of maple goodness to hold them together... FRICKSTICKS! I wish I lived in Portland...

Wow. Finally able to try this donut after a five year wait and it was everything I could have ever imagined. 

The last time I visited Portland in 2012, no matter what time it was there was always a line. Fast forward to my visit in 2017 and NO LINE.

There are about a dozen different flavors your can choose from including Oreo, sprinkles, frosted, etc. I opted to be as basic as possible and went for the glazed donut.

It reminds me of a brioche donut. Light, fluffy and the perfect amount of glaze. The only bad thing was that I only ordered one and not an entire dozen!

Do experience this if you're ever in the area

Wow ! Just wow ! Am I in heaven ! I think so ! This place is amazing ! The doughnuts are sooo good ! Voodoo Doughnuts usually has a long line, however it's worth the wait. They have so many options. Warning  Sugar overload  when I come back to Portland I will be stopping by again and I will be bringing my friends. I love all the art work in the store ! This is a very magical place !

BEST DOUGHNUTS EVER! Now, I love doughnuts, and there are some really good family owned places back home that are hard to top, but Voodoo Doughnuts are freakin delicious. One of the main reasons we came to Portland was to check this place out and it lived up to our expectations fantastically. I had the Mango (with some cutesy name that I cant remember) and it was so fresh and flavorful. The sugar sprinkle stuff on top tastes just like those candy peach rings. My friend got the oreo chocolate peanut butter one and it was also sublime. I snagged their classic voodoo doll shaped doughnut to snack on later and Im 100% positive it will be just as good as the others. I would recommend this place to everyone and I will definitely being coming back here the next time Im in Portland!

Trick is to go in the morning if you are from out of town. No line at 9:00 am on a Sunday. Got a voodoo dozen. Plus 2, Maple bar with bacon and the classic voodoo donut. The donuts where tasty, If I come back to Portland I will be making another stop. This location is seeder then I thought it would be, Next to a adult Theater.

The doughnuts here are FRESH and delicious every time. Last time I was there I stood in line for almost 30 minutes just to get my two doughnuts and I HATE to stand in lines for food. There slogan is the best, "The Magic is in the hole"....you gotta LOVE that!

I love all their flavors.  Where else do you get cotton candy doughnuts and bubble gum ones- complete with real gum?  Bacon doughnuts.  Doughnuts topped with Captain Crunch.  Their delicious signature voo doo doughnuts.  Grape doughnuts.  Peach fritters.   I love stopping by this place for all the fun and odd flavors they offer.  You do usually have to wait in line, which can be significant.  Also bring cash unless you want to use their ATM.

Must Order: Voodoo Doll

I hyped up VooDoo Donuts in my head for at least a couple years. I knew I loved it before I met it. Now actually being able to get there it lived it to my doughnutty expectations.

I went to the original location and since it was a Monday it really wasn't that cray. I was overwhelmed with my options really wanting one of each. I settled on 6 donuts-- hey that's me holding back!

We got outside and I was able to get a mocha from the coffee stand across the way. Also, I think the founders of VooDoo were there doing an interview and I was SO tempted to foodie-geek out and take a picture with them. I wish I had grown some balls and just did it because I'm seriously regretting it now!

The Voodoo doll was yummy with the chocolate frosting and raspberry filling. It was my favorite of all the donuts and I was very surprised! I liked the maple bacon and I even ate the remaining bacon off my doughnut while I was having late-nite cravings. I really wished I had the Portland Cream but that one went home with my dining mate. Sad face.

Anyway, I really can't wait to go back and try some more! I would willingly travel long distances for food and this will be one of those places. Also I learned that for $5 you can buy a bucket (no really a huge BUCKET) of day old donuts. You just don't know what you would get.... I may just do that. 

Don't judge.

Finally got the chance to stop by Voodoo Doughnuts while in Portland. The first time I drove past, the line was super long, my family & I were on a time crunch to get back to Seattle. Luckily, I was in Portland on a weekday, so there wasn't a huge line going out the door. There's a bunch of doughnuts to pick from that spins in a glass case. The doughnuts are unique in their own way, I would definitely stop by another time when I'm in Portland!

I was told I just HAD to try this place since it was my first time in Portland. OMG. They have two cases with all their donuts just spinning before your eyes. We had a butterfingery cake dougnut as well as a much larger risen doughnut covered in oreo bits and peanut butter drizzle... SO GOOD!!

Fresh from having lunch at Edelweiss, my friends and I scooted over to the questionable part of town where strip bars are a plenty and street performers are in full force. We were of course not interested in any of those things, only DOUGHNUTS! 

There was a manageable line outside the original location which has been the subject of many food shows and documentaries so we joined it and started people watching. Every size, shape and color wanted to partake in what has been described as an euphoric journey into the doughnut world and I don't blame them one bit! Of course I looked like I belonged in the line with my pot belly and under-dressed attire for the weather (shorts and t-shirt). While waiting we were talked up by one of the Voodoo Doughnut denizens explaining some of their creations, offering up suggestions and revealing what's really inside the c&b doughnut (can't say what c&b stands for because I might violate some terms or something, look it up!). I'd have to say with all those distracting factors in play, it seemed like the wait was nothing at all.

Finally we whipped our way inside the small doughnut shop only to be greeted by pink walls, a few chandeliers and decor that seemed to belong in a museum of the macabre. Yes it was odd but I was seeing much much more behind the counter on countless rolling racks. I was finally called up to the counter and reluctantly gave my order because I wanted them all but didn't want to look like a complete sow! I asked for a "Grape Ape", "Arnold Palmer" and a few t-shirts because I was not about to bring a dozen doughnuts on a plane as I was requested to do by family.

The doughnuts were amazing in their own special ways. First off I sunk my teeth into the Grape Ape, it was like grape soda was mixed into the frosting without the bubbles while grape powder and grape sprinkles adorned the top. It was literally one of the best doughnuts I'd ever tasted! I should've waited a while to partake in the Arnold Palmer but my inner and outer fat kid said NO WAY! The Arnold Palmer was such a treat too with its lemonade frosting and powdered iced tea mix sprinkled on top, it truly was like drinking an Arnold Palmer!

I'm really glad I experienced one of many culinary delights in the Pacific Northwest's weirdest city!

Stopped by on my way to the airport and picked up a box of donuts to take all the way back to LA.  The line was long but moved quickly.  Prices were decent.  Ordered the bubble gum donut which was surprisingly good; the grape donut reminded me of grape cough syrup; donut with chocolate, oreo and peanut butter was fantastic. Worth the trip and the pain of carrying them all the way home.
Awesome place for breakfast. I still dream about the Maple Bacon doughnut and my husband craves the "Old Dirty Bastard." We waiting in line for about 30 minutes, but it was definitely a MUST visit!

The other day I said to myself, "Self: where could I find a donut that looks like a trouser snake to satisfy the deep-rooted penis envy Freud waxed about years ago?"

In came Voodoo. Never has a donut shop made me a believer. I am not a huge fan of donuts, and ever since Krispy Kreme moved to the west coast I have tried my hardest to eradicate the little monsters of dough from the face of the earth. I'm glad I'm about as good of a leader as Bush was because this little gem would have been gone for good.

I heart you VooDoo, I really do...

at first, i thought this place would be pretty gross, but it turned out to be amazing. my friends and i had the vegan one with oreos on top, the triple chocolate penetration with cocopuffs, and the famous maple bacon one. the bacon one sounds disgusting at first, but it is nothing like you would expect. it tastes like eating pancakes and sausage. seriously.

Portlands Motto? "Keep Portland Weird"! Well done Voodoo Doughnut people you've done it. You've kept it weird while introducing a damn fine and creative doughnut to PDX. Well played Voodoo peeps well played. I will be personally be a repeat offender as often as the craving hits. Being open 24/7 just made 2 am war path that much bigger. I don't like to play favorites but if I did I'd be the signature Voodoo doughnut. Who doesnt like Raspberry filling?! BOOM!

If you come to Portland, you HAVE to come to Voodoo Doughnut. It doesn't matter if you don't like doughnuts because you've never had a doughnut like this. There is a flavor for everyone. Like breakfast cereal? There are doughnuts dipped in kids cereal(Coco Puffs, Captain Crunch, etc.). Like candy? There are doughnuts dipped in candy(M&Ms, Butterfinger, etc.). Like hilarious sexual references with your sweet treats? Some of the names include Cock and Balls(it's shaped like...well...you get the idea) and Triple Chocolate Penetration. DO YOU LIKE BACON?! THEY HAVE A GODDAMN MAPLE GLAZED DOUGHNUT WITH 2 STRIPS OF BACON ON TOP!! Come on! DOUGHNUT EUPHORIA! 

The only downside? This is a tourist trap. You will wait in line, but the line moves fast. And the outside of the building is covered with glitter, so you feel happy while you're waiting at least. Just make a trip here. You won't be sorry.

THIS PLACE IS SO AWESOME!!!!

A 24-hr boutiquey donut shop? YES PLZ.

My twin told me about this place 'cus it was featured on the Food Network, so on my last visit back to my Alma Mater I had to stop by and see what all the buzz was about-- fit perfectly into my sched considering its 24-hrness. Loves it.

My bff Bob and I decided to try a few, Bubble Gum, Cereal, and Plain Cinnamon and sugar are the ones I tasted, he tasted more. The Bubble Gum was pink-right up my alley, and really tasted like bubble yubble or whatever they include in the hole of the donut (see pics), the   cereal woulda been better if it was JUST Cap'n Crunch and not those weird pebble things, and the C&S was devine.

Only downfall was they only take cash, which I NEVER have on me- so thanks Bob!

This is a definite must for anyone in the Portland Area, I don't even like donuts and I really enjoyed everything here!

I was on to Portland had insomnia. This doughnut shop was open at 3 am. The people are amazing and the music is great oh ya the doughnuts like the say THE MAGIC IN THE HOLE. If u don't go here u won't understand Portland.
Great service and food! The maple bacon doughnut takes like breakfast. Do it!

Heard about Voodoo Doughnuts so I was lucky enough to visit twice during my trip to Portland. Selection of doughnuts is huge to say the least, but it's the taste that will blow you away!  When you coming to Palm Springs Voodoo?? Until you do, I guess I have to take the 2 hour drive to Universal City to handle my new doughnut addiction!

Always amazing! A true  'Portland' experience, first stop after picking friends up from the airport! ODB is my favorite.
Worth the wait which is never as long as the line appears.
Hahaha... well.... where do I begin? It's pricey but worthy. Long lines but well spent.  Weird options but tasty.  Cash only is old and sucks but... can't steal with credit cards.  :)

Add me to the long list of people who think Voodoo is worth the wait and deserving of the "hype".

Those were some good doughnuts.

Always here when I come down to Portland! 
My boyfriend and I love grabbing a box for our family and friends. My favorite is the Homer(pink doughnut w/ sprinkles) and my boyfriend is the Oreo(self-explanatory). This part of downtown has a lot of character and many small places to eat, with little bites. I would come in this area with an empty stomach and cash! CASH ONLY! One box(dozen) of these wacky doughnuts are 16.50! Expect long lines bring a friend
OMG. The doughnuts from this place are effin' delicious. Is it a tourist trap? Yes, but, really... who cares? It was great to see fellow Seahawk fans in line with us.

Great place to grab a one of a kind doughnut! Be prepared 9/10x there is always a line. You can't really miss it. The range of doughnuts is simply amazing. You can stay traditional or you can get a pretty extravagant doughnut. They also offer vegan options which is great for those of us with a dairy intolerance. 

Voodoos is an cash only facility so make sure you have some on you. If not there is an ATM Inside to get some cash from. 

The prices are not to bad. The vegan doughnuts are a little more expensive then the others but that would make sense since the substitutes are more expensive to buy. If you're in the area visiting. This is a place to stop. You can't come to portland and not leave without having left voodoos with a pink box full of delicious treats.  You know what they say "great thinks come in pink boxes".
Yummy! I literally made mhmm sound as I ate them! Stick to the classics and you won't be disappointed. Favorites were voodoo and old fashioned.

If you are looking for a place that really "Keeps Portland Weird" this is a place for you!  Quirky, cramped and a long line most of the time, for the doughnut junkie in all of us, you have landed well!!

There's already 400+ reviews for Voodoo Doughnuts.  Not at all surprising, considering that any time of the day they have a line going out the door.

But I just went there for the first time and wanted to gush about the coolness of it all.  Here are my favorite things:

1) The Portland Cream.  Wonderful!
2) The pink boxes the exclaim "Good Things Come in Pink Boxes"
3) You can get married there!
4) They have vegan doughnuts!
Fancy donuts. Good price fun to eat with family. Cash only but has ATM machine inside. Worth a try if you're in Portland

When there are already almost 4,000 reviews of a place, I guess one more won't hurt too much...so I will make this short and sweet!

Voodoo Doughnut should be rated five stars just for it's name alone.  Add the great old funky location in downtown Portland, near China Town and it is worth the trip...at least for this Midwestern gal!  Early on a Tuesday morning there was no line and I don't know whether I was glad or sad about that...but not having to wait made Hubby really happy as he stayed with the car while I went in.

Of course I had to get a  Bacon Maple Bar and I knew Hubby would want something chocolate (my choice for him was a Double Chocolate Doughnut) then I asked my absolutely adorable 50s inspired server what her favorite was and got two Buttermilk Bar Doughnuts to fill out my little sack.  NO, the sacks aren't pink like the boxes but it was stamped with their logo...they really might want to invest in pink bags...

Doughnuts are really best when fresh, so I stopped at four but at least I got to fulfill one thing on my bucket list for a visit to Portland.

Oh yes...that Bacon Maple Bar was amazing!
BEST DOUGHNUTS EVER!!!! enough said. you don't need to know anything else. just go.
Their was a line all the way outside, the wait time was about 5-10 mins. Def worth the wait. The bacon maple bar was my fav

see pics-- each one is worth a thousand words.

bacon and maple doughnut was awesome. i loved the salty flavor and crunch of the bacon (fried HARD) with the texture of the ultra sweet maple doughnut. the bread itself is somewhat more doughy than light and melty like krispy kreme, but significantly lighter than old-school doughnut shops. it'd probably be better if the bacon was spread throughout the whole doughnut, but that's just being nitpicky. 

the place is small and whimsical, with an mel n alice type of cake curio highlighting the different kinds of doughnuts they offer. they take cash only and parking is a cinch. be sure to tip since portland doesn't have sales tax anyways. please don't be an asshole when this place offers such great treats for your stummy!

the SO got a chocolate doughnut and didn't feel like explaining the pros and cons of it. BUT, she did finish the whole damn thing in less than 2 minutes so it must've been good. plus, she shakes her legs and bounces in her seat when she eats something good (kinda like a baby) and this trip was no exception.

i wonder if they cater weddings? *shrugs* hell, if cupcakes can be chic, so can doughnuts. yup, this place caters to everyone-- not just homer simpson and anthony bourdain.

For goodness' sake, make haste and go!

Leave your Visa or Mastercard at home......cash only.
Yum, yum, yummy!!!!! Super fast service even when the line is long.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Did I mention the maple bacon doughnut???

Voodoo Doughnuts is a Portland institution.  If you're visiting from out of town, you should definitely put it on your list of places to try.  The quality is excellent, and it's as fun an experience as a trip to a doughnut shop is likely to be.  

I do have to admit, if I'm honest, that I don't quite see why the place has such a draw from around the world, but it does.  When I first moved here in 1996, my friends all said, "OHMYGOD, WE HAVE TO GO TO VOODOO DOUGHNUTS."   So we went, and it was delicious, but tiny--just a few feet across--and then we kind of sat there with our doughnuts saying, "What do we do?"   That has changed since then.

They remodeled and expanded a few years back, and that improved the place dramatically.  It's now a major attraction, and rightly so.  They have a great selection of doughnuts--everything from standard government-issue varieties to phalluses (you've been warned) and cereal-covered concoctions--so you'll have no difficulty finding something that's to your liking.  

Worth mentioning to tourists is that that bit of downtown can be a bit seedy late at night.  Not bad, necessarily, but it's definitely noticeable, and you should be prepared for that.  And have fun.
Donuts were worth the wait in line ! Donuts are amazing and I also like their apple cider. Unique atmosphere. Dirt donut is my favorite !!

What more can be said of this place. It just doesn't get any better. I have never had a bad doughnut here and the employees are great.  Hell one time we came here and they were actually closed. A guy met us at the door saying they had an employee party to go to. I was crazing them so much and the guy went inside loaded up a box of doughnuts and just gave them to me.

This place will forever be my favorite doughnut shop. I love how they moved in to the corner place . Its nice not having a line that is quite so long on the street anymore. I do have to say though as weird as this place is there is a new girl up front who looks nothing like anyone else there. No tattoos or oddly placed earrings who is a total B!tch. I was surprised she even worked there. I came there with no line and for some reason was rushed like crazy with my order. Regardless of this one crappy employee this place is and always will be a 5-star doughnut joint in my book. 

I recommend Mango Tango, or cock and balls, even the tex-ass challenge is amazing. Oh and you can't leave without at least once maple bacon bar.

If ever in Portland, one must go to Voodoo. Is it the most incredible donut you will ever eat in your life?! Probably not but they their selection is impressive, creative and just plain delicious. 

Depending on the time of day you may encounter a line (generally late afternoon and evening). If you're not feeling the wait, just come back in the morning.

Open 24 hours! doughnuts with bacon on them! Thank god you're not in Seattle, otherwise I'd turn into an even bigger fatty! But if that's what you're going for, try the Fruit Loop covered one.  And not to be a hater, but I think the voodoo doll is a little over rated, maybe cuz I'm just not the biggest fan of jelly filled doughnuts, I'm more of a cream filled guy, but EVERYTHING is delicious! I'm sure you'll be satisfied with whatever you choose, even the 10" cock 'n balls, any guesses if it's cream filled?

Being a tourist in Portland, it's pretty much a tacit experience to go to Voodoo Donuts. It's the kind of place you see on Food Network and hear by word of mouth by everyone who has ever been to Portland. And I know, not everything advertised heavily is automatically great. Being from Boston, I am used to hearing highly of places I wouldn't even look twice at. But I have to admit, Voodoo is worth the hype its given.

Granted, the line is very long. But if you don't mind waiting a bit (and it really is only a bit, since they have three cashiers at a time cycling through the line), then the pay off is rewarding. Once inside, you see an expansive menu of donuts, from something as simple as a "maple bar" to more "out there" varieties like the "gay bar" and "giant peach," both of which we sampled, as well as the "voodoo doll" that they are famous for--a chocolate glazed, ghost-shaped donut with a jelly center that is being stabbed by a pretzel stake. Awesome. Every donut listed shares space on rotating pedestals where they are showcased to the line, and from there you can see how different and complex some varieties are. Because the menu is so developed, these really help to narrow the options down. It also led me to choose the "Homer Simpson," a simple strawberry-frosted with sprinkles, a nostalgic novelty with great icing that tasted like Dunkin Donuts if they were still independently owned.

We only waited about 15 minutes or so and ordered smoothly, getting a really cute pink box with their logo and five delicious donuts inside. They all tasted fresh, taken from the array of racks in the back of the store, where employees were working on them behind the scenes. They had a homemade feel to them and didn't leave a sinking feeling in my stomach like some other donut shops have the capacity of doing. Overall, very pleased with the selection and flavor of this notorious shop.

This 24hour donut store is pretty awesome. They have so many interesting donuts worth trying. 

When I visited Portland, I noticed locals were buying donuts by the dozen and just taking them home. I was confused at first, but after I tried their Maple Bacon doughnut and the voodoo donut, I understood. 

I recommend checking this place out if you're new to Portland.

This place is simply awesome.  I never was a doughnut person but when I visited Portland for the first time, my girlfriend said I had to see this place.  Wow what a great variety they have.  My favorite was the voodoo doll.  Jelly filled doughnut with chocolate on top, also a small pretzel stick stabbing the voodoo doll shaped doughnut.  Good thing I'm lactose intolerant or else I would have a lot of these.  Also helps that I don't live anywhere close to Voodoo Doughnut. HaHa.  This place would be, in my opinion, on of Portland's hidden gems and a 'Must-visit.'
I just love this place. Giant pillowy sweet donuts served in crazy place.  Uniformly great.
love the atmosphere. the voodoo donut was amazing. a great one stop shop for gourmet donuts!

I stopped in here on the recommendation of a friend who grew up in Portland. I didn't get anything fancy. Just two donuts: raised chocolate glazed and chocolate cake glazed. The raised one was delicious. Just like the donuts I remember getting as a kid, before all the chains drove the mom and pop stores out of business. The cake was also scrumptious: dense and moist and just the right amount of sweet. Childhood memories came floating back.
I visited this location in the middle of the day and only waited 5 or 10 min to order. Staff was very friendly and patient with each customer. My next visit was to the location in the NE. Same delicious donuts. Same courteous staff.
Now for a tip: just get the basic donuts. And if you can, get a small box of 6 to go the day you leave Portland. Mine traveled well on the plane and were enjoyed greatly by my 10 year old daughter. (I might've eaten one on the red eye home. Shh)
do that voodoo that you do so well. local loving local food. its more than a place, its a movement. ps- look for the pink truck at bella organics during the october season and you wont be sorry.

I didn't think that a doughnut could be something that I'd wait in a long line for, but I was wrong. I gotta give credit for this place's creativity. Their doughnuts come in all shapes, sizes, and flavors. A definite must see if you're in Portland.
Turn up your nose at VooDoo and go on and on about Blue Star you hipster bastards!  They're still the classic.
Wow never knew donuts could be so much fun and so celebrated but in Portland they take their donuts seriously dude and they are well worth waiting for when we went twice by the way

Friday afternoon, POURING outside, maybe this was the key to getting a voodoo doughnut in less than 5 minuets. 

I was really fully from eating at lunch, but me and the wife still wanted to try voodoo, I went for the captain crunch and it was pure harmony in my mouth. Such a good combination! My wife had the Bubble gum one and she really enjoyed it. We had another one, forgot the name wasn;t that impressive. 


Recommend checking this out, but not worth it if line is snaked out the door.

I visited Portland, and Voodoo Doughnuts, in 2008 and it is still on my mind. I tried various flavors including the Maple Bacon and the Fruit Loops. Delicious! I wish Columbus Ohio had a place as awesome as this!

PS: I also tried the Rogue beer named after you guys--very interesting and perfect resemblance to your bacon maple doughnut. Congrats on that!
I always make it a point to come take a quick stop by here to get a very unique donut experience. The chocolate, peanut butter, and crushed oreo donut is amazing. Its a fun place to go to.

A place that has seen the likes of Anthony Bourdain, place that is an icon of an area, so well known that your friends and coworkers talk about it as if it was a mythical creature - that place deserves a visit regardless of weather conditions and time of day. Or night. 

And so it was. After an unfortunately botched, then saved dinner, we made the pilgrimage across 15ish city blocks to VooDoo donuts. And even at 11pm at night (yes, this place is open 24hrs), there was a line wrapping around the corner of the building. Cash only is not a problem when there are a) signs everywhere and b) an ATM right there, at the reach of one's hand.

And then - the hard part. Deciding which donut to get. Wide variety of vegan options, too..I went for something random. First something kinky, which they were out of, and then just some random-ass, delicious, masterfully crafted donut. And boy, did it taste great. A must-go gourmet destination for all those visiting, traveling by or living in Portland.

Totally lives up to the hype. The lines are sometimes ridiculous and it is touristy to a T, but why is that a bad thing? Just adds to the excitement when you make it up to the counter and feast your eyes on the delectable mix of colorful treats aka DONUTS. Maple bacon is a classic, as are the cream-filled zombie looking ones. Where else are the zombies cute and delicious? Nowhere, that's where. YUM. You will not be disappointed. 

p.s. All the locals will tell you Blue Star is better...but don't believe them. Those donuts are "fancier" and lighter. These are sinfully delish. You won't be disappointed.
Valeu a espera na fila na chuva, muito saboroso e ainda por cima barato! Cerca de 2 dlares o doce. Lugar bem famoso em portland.
Great experience! Amazing doughnuts!! I have never seen a line for doughnuts at 10:00pm but it goes very quick!!

Ok, so I know there tends to be this Voodoo vs. Blue Star donut thing going on.. but I'm sorry, I think Voodoo wins by far! My co-workers who live in the area also agree.... so there must be a lot of people who love dry donuts out there and prefer Blue Star... lol. Voodoo donuts are so delicious and chewy, and moist... as mentioned blue star tend to be on the drier side, which is terrible! I did have one good donut from BS, but with Voodoo, I think they are all good, AND they are good the next day which is rare!!! I don't get the super crazy ones because for cereal or cookie topped donuts, no one beats Cafe Dulce in Japantown Los Angels... they have the right salty sweet combo for them. Those types of donuts tend to be overly sweet anywhere else.. what I LOVE from Voodoo is there simple ones, my faves are the semi tangy ones, Grape Ape... it's seriously addictive & Mango Tango! The filling is perfectly tart - along with the Tang topping  - YUM!! I still need to try the hibiscus one! My kids always get the Voodoo doll of course... it's got yummy raspberry filling... I'm always a sucker for a filled donut!!! Nom.
A maple doughnut with bacon?!  OH YEAH!  In the shape of a "little dough boy" too!  OH HECK YEAH!  Soooo good.  Not to be missed.

I don't even like doughnuts that much, but this place is awesome. Their doughnuts range from crazy to down right absurd in terms of creativity and flavor. The line was long when I went, but worth the wait!

Gotta love that Old Dirty Bastard. When I met my husband I told him that I hated donuts. Now, thanks to VooDoo I love them. Can't get enough of them. Very happy when they opened their second location within walking distance of home. Great stuff.

I was in Portland on a business trip and was told I must stop by Voodoo donuts.  I went on a Friday afternoon and only had to wait about 10 minutes.  The staff was so nice, so funny and made the experience great!  I ordered the cock n balls donut (cream filled....obviously ;)) and the dirty jokes were flowing. It tasted so yummy! My friend had the classic voodoo jelly-filled donut.  We sat outside and enjoyed the donuts and the setting.  The funky vibe of the place and the whole experience was just as great as the donuts! A fun place to check out while you're in town. :)

As far as doughnut places, this place is the best!  Now I can honestly say I am not a doughnut expert, but anyone that makes a "Maple bacon doughnut" has to rock in my book!  A definite MUST, even if you have to wait in the line!

I very much enjoyed my doughnut experience here (with the exception of the grape, that's just weird).  If you like chocolate you will probably enjoy the chocolate cake doughnut with chocolate frosting, and cocopuffs.  

Only order as many as you can eat at once because they do not keep well.

Disclaimer: I am not a tourist, I've lived here for a long time and I remember Voodoo when they were just the little shop that was open all night. Hell, I used to hang out at X-Ray Cafe when Tres owned THAT (look it up kids). 

I am writing this review after enjoying another spectacular bacon maple bar. They are like a massive sweet-salty-mapley-smokey hit directly to the pleasure centers of the mind.  I have had other attempts at bacon donuts and none touch the original. I'd recommend a brisk walk after eating one to ease the rush, but damn, they are superb.

What makes it great? Thick, quality bacon and no skimping on it, great maple frosting, and the doughnut itself: excellent lightness, chew, and the wonderful yeasted flavor a real doughnut should have.

Other hits on the menu - the ODB, anything fritter based, to name a few.
It was everything I was hoping after seeing on tv, reading in mags and heard from coworkers

It's only good if you know what flavor to get. I went midday on a Thursday and there was no wait. Skip all of the "topped" donuts... cereal, cookies, etc. I've been there twice and both times the toppings were stale. Go for the classics and you won't be disappointed. Their standard glazed is out of this world! Fluffy, perfect amount of glaze, and huge! Their prices are also reasonable.

What can I say that hasn't been said already about Voodoo? They're amazing! The Bacon Maple bar is a must in your order! I also tried the Old Dirty Bastard and the Voodoo Doll...pretty tasty! I went on Sunday night during Labor Day weekend and luckily the line wait wasn't that long (about 30 mins.) - my hubby was happy that I brought him some home and he LOVES the Bacon Maple! Next time, I think I'll bring 1/2 dozen of just the Bacon Maple xD

How did I not know they had vegan donuts! Awesome surprise for me! Had to take my son. My grandparents used to bring us here and it was always filled with great memories. My son had a great time picking out the donuts he wanted. 

Why did we buy six donuts for the two of us?!!! Oh well donuts tomorrow!!! 

What a great way to start the morning, old and new memories, great pictures, yummy donuts. Yep!

Great staff! Reminds me of the soup nazi episode on Seinfeld, NEXXXT!!! So have cash in hand, have an idea of what donut you want and if you can't decide just pick a damn color, you won't be let down. Also stop complaining about the line, if you don't want to wait in it no one is forcing you.
The best thing I've ever eaten comes from Voodoo: bacon maple bar! Two crispy, salty strips of bacon over a lucious, sweet, maple bar. I would drive back to Portland just to eat it again!

This place is worth the wait, even when it's raining. The line moves quickly because the employees in the small interior keep things flowing. Just know what you want by the time you get up to the front! 

The interior is funky and fun! We ordered The Dirt, The Homer, Voodoo Dolls, the Portland Cream, and a Bacon Maple Bar. They were so soft and fresh and the frosting did not overpower the doughnuts. I normally don't love berry fillings but theirs is AMAZING. We will likely go back again before we leave Oregon despite the high volume of calories!

This place is hyped up for a reason! Don't let a long line deter you as it moves very quickly. They only accept cash though but it's also cheaper than I thought it'd be for these fancy lookin donuts. The voodoo donut was soooo yummy n cute and it was $3 and the other peanut butter Oreo donut was $2.50. Both were really awesome. Good and fluffy yeasty donuts. When I pulled parts of the voodoo donut apart, I could see the dough stretching--amazing! The raspberry filling was also so so good. I'd definitely make a stop here if it's in your way!

Typically this place has a long line......try going at 5am and it wont be a problem......Maple bacon bar and the glazed were very good....Please be mindful of the homeless population in the surrounding area.
It's worth the hype! Midday on a weekday is the best time to go in my experience, but as a visitor, it was worth the wait that first time for the experience!

If you're in Portland, this is a must-try!! It is basically the kooky essence of Portland :D Right when we got to Portland on a Friday, we decided to walk around Tom McCall Waterfront and check out all the other places; we passed Voodoo Donuts and decided to try it on a Friday rather than the planned Saturday. The line was not long so thank God. (came back Saturday and the line was craaazyy long!! It was because of the Portland Saturday Market tourists, too) I loved their dcor and its ambiance was very interesting. They also sell Voodoo Donuts shirts and all the other miscellaneous stuff. 

We tried four different donuts--the Maple Bacon one, the Neapolitan Doughnut, Double Chocolate donut and of course, their Voodoo Doll donut! They were all delicious!! We really suggest the maple bacon and the Voodoo doll. The maple bacon had a balanced flavor of sweetness and saltiness, it was very yummy. I can taste it right now as typing this review. 

Although the line gets long, the whole wait tends to be fast depending on the customers' order. The employees were helpful and patient enough to manage all these donut lovers. There is also a cute little spot outside where you can hang out and eat your donuts. So pink and purple :D three different locations in Oregon, and one in Colorado (which I didn't know of, interesting) and they're all open 24 hours. Yes, GOOD THINGS COME IN PINK BOXES ;)
If you are visiting PDX you definetely have to go to VOodoo donuts, decoration is beautiful, everything is so creative and tasty, staff is amazing. Only downside is the queu lines on the weekend.

When we landed at the airport, a woman helping us with a car mentioned two things we needed to try while visiting Portland. Local coffee and Voodoo Doughnuts. I'm glad she did. After a morning of hiking the Hoyt arboretum, we needed a snack and a pick-me-up. I got a "Portland" cream and my wife got a blueberry cake to start. These are some of the best doughnuts we've ever had anywhere. We didn't even get morning fresh ones and still thought they were perfect. The doughnuts were so good, we bought more to have for breakfast the next day and wish we'd bought even more for snack times too.

I love that Voodoo Doughnut was open late! I stopped in after bar hopping on a Thursday night and was surprised by their variety! I was very pleased to find out that they offered vegan donuts too. I got the chocolate circle and thought it was delicious! Just as good as my favorite vegan donuts back in the Bay Area!
You can't go wrong with Voodoo Doughnuts! There's something for everyone!
Great decor. Great donuts. The cashier/staff was super helpful. Worth checking out while in Portland.
Best plain glazed EVER. In addition to all the doughnut bling, it's also the best place for a doughnut purist like myself. :)

Selling everything in mom's house could have been horrid, but PATSY WALSH made it painless and even pleasant.  Her pricing, sales, and cleanup crews were friendly and efficient.  When it was all over, the house was empty and ready for the next steps to sell it.  I cannot praise Patsy enough.
Omg this place is the shit! They have a maple bar that is out of this world!!!! you must try this
Portland's main attraction. Delicious and I never liked donuts!

I simply can't say anything negative about this place because for starters, nobody spit in my face (or my donut) when I placed my order and also I've yet to meet a donut I didn't like. Taking these two things into consideration, these guys surely beat the day-old stale from a 7-11 pastry container and also there's the fact that their variety is more creative than any grandiose review I might be able to pen. 

Open always, but oh so far away, Voodoo, I'll dream of you tonight.

ok.... so i needed an iconic place in Oregon to take a picture so i could cross the state off my list.... i was told to come here.... and it was actually pretty cool..
 only complaint are the begging not homeless people who dont take no for an answer.

the inside was bright and lively.. once u get inside... therw was a bit of a line.

 ALSO... THEY ONLY TAKE CASH... 

Donoughts were actually pretty cheap, all things considered.
. would def come again

I am a huge fan of this place.  It feels like such a Portland staple and landmark.. I love the decor.
