If you bring your own coffee cup they'll fill it up for like a buck twenty five - the coffee is good, standard donut shop coffee!  I love the maple bacon bar - but then again, who (except vegans) doesn't!?  I really love the Old Dirty Bastard, but it's tough to finish.. since it's so sweet and rich.  

I guess the only thing I would change about the place is that I kinda wish they weren't cash only.  I've been lucky and have had some cash on me each time I've been to VD, but if I didn't I'd be paying those crummy ATM fees!  :) 

It's SO GOOD!

Pastry Innovation at its best!

Voodoo Doughnut is a must for any visit to Portland. Just be ready to stand in line for these tasty treats (but it's open 24 hours and the doughnuts are always fresh).

The variety is amazing, ranging from your basic frosted cake doughnut to the raised doughnuts the likes of Grape, Bubble Gum, Tang, etc.

My personal favorite is the salty and sweet Bacon Maple Bar.

Came here just because it seem obligatory for every tourist to come by and visit this place. Ordered their famous voodoo donut, which I might say is actually really good, especially with the juicy jelly inside. Place is small and the staff seems nice.
Me likey! Although I haven't been since I moved here.

Unfortunately I have never even been to Portland, so I've never actually been inside a Voodoo Doughnut... but last night was the 3rd time I've had one inside.

My friend brought me bacon maple bars for the first time last summer, and I lucked up a week later when he went back to Portland and came home with a whole dozen for everyone [which I ate 4 of the 12 in less than 24 hours]. And lucky for everyone he went back again this weekend and came home with a pink box full of treats.

Even cold and old and airplane infested those doughnuts are still amazing.

One day I know I'll get up there to have one hot & fresh... and I'll probably end up marrying it because it will be so stupidly delicious... and because I heard they actually perform wedding ceremonies at the shop if you're interested.

FRIED DOUGH COVERED IN SUGAR WITH BACON! ALL AMERICAN DECADENCE! 

This is an experience- standing in line with crazies waiting for some donuts - Life is good! The shop is cool cool cool, take some pictures to savor the experience later! They have the baddest ATM machine ever! Oh- on to the donuts, they are ok ok ok - I got 6 of them and tried a little of each and gave the rest to some street people. The best ones were the fritters! They did rock- They had a blueberry fritter with maple and bacon. The freaky, but extremely nice, guy behind the counter told me it was a limited production??? It was still warm and it was good! I did eat this one whole- no sharing here!

I think the best time to go would be around 2AM with a good buzzz!!

Esposa and I stumbled upon Voodoo Doughnut early on a Saturday morning.  We had never heard of it, but it's obviously a Portland landmark.  The crowd barricades (think 1980 The Who concerts) hinted at something other than your ordinary donut shop.  We figured out the that we beat a huge line as we strolled by this place the next day!  The variety of donuts is mind boggling and the flavors are varied and downright weird.  As we waited in line, one customer was noshing blissfully on a bacon-and-something creation.  All I could hear was him grunting and breathing heavily.  Hmmm, I guess we found something good.  The line moved briskly and soon I found myself at the counter with nary an idea of what to order.  I eyed a cream-filled chocolate glazed beauty that soon found its way to my hands, mouth, and stomach.  The texture was soft and cake-like, closer to Dunkin than to Krispy Kreme.  The cream was, well, creamy.  The chocolate icing divine.  I'm not a donut aficionado or snob, but can honestly say that it was THE BEST donut I've ever had.  Next time that I visit Portland, I'm gonna get me a fix of Voodoo.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

This place is a perfect example of Portland, weird but great. I have enjoyed many of their doughnuts and I haven't had one that I haven't liked! The only complaint I have is that they got rid of my favorite one, the Miami vice. Bring that amazing piece of heaven back and I will continue to come back for as long as I can!

its a must stop whenever in Portland. Line can get a little out of hand but goes quickly enough. There's even a vegan option. My family got carried away and bought a dozen variety of all different types... that's what happens when I'm not there to control their sweet tooth cravings. I do have to admit they were all good and uniquely flavored. Even a couple days later it was still tasting good!

took my brother and his friend here because it was a portland to-do.  maybe 11pm isn't the best time for a old fashion glazed donut (it was small, frail, and i inhaled the whole thing at once, call me a fatass if you want cuzz i'd only call myself one if i just read that.  

my second donut (again, i'm a fatass) had was the fruitloop topped one.  the cake part itself was chewy and yummy, however my fruitloops tasted stale.  friend's triple chocolate penetration (the name sounds better than it looks) was topped with cocoa puffs, which was also stale-ish. his mango filled donut was yummy, but a little more on the lemony side (yeah i had to try his, and do i need to remind you why?)

EDIT:
finally tried the maple bacon donut, and i was speechless.  how does it melt in your mouth and hit the right spots on your tongue so well?!

MAPLE BACON DONUTS, HELL YEAH!

If you are in Portland, you should go to a Voodoo at least once. Yes, you will wait in a long line. Yes, there is a likelihood of rain during said extended wait. Yes, they really do accept only cash as payment, so please don't be that person who ignores the signage and claims only to have a card after they've boxed your order up. Their "good things come in pink boxes" and "the magic is in the hole" packaging, along with doughnuts like the cock and balls (two bavarian creme filled rounds and a twist, covered in either dark or light icing) and the bacon maple bar have given Voodoo its uniqueness. It's a tasty uniqueness.

So amazing!! Like the motto " the magic is in the hole" I had the bacon maple bar and  the actual voodoo doughnut, both were amazing...like nothing I had ever tasted before! I will totally recommend this to my friends anytime and I will bring all my none rose city acquaintances here regardless the wait time.
Great Unique Donuts My friends and I can't get enough of Voodoo when we have the chance to go

Seriously where else would you end up at 2 AM with a group of hungry party-goers? The best donut known to man kind is the cocoa puff one. It's frickin' awesome- I mean it really rocks your senses, and it's just enough donut to enjoy without too much sweetness.

Warning: Crowds will incur as the night goes on. Don't drift in the back- be proactive and jump in to order when you have a chance. Many people are enthralled by the case of glory, and don't order for minutes while others are ready. If you know what you want, dive into the crowd.

Inhale, Exhale, I just got a Doughnut in the Mail!  No really, I did.  So I haven't actually been to Voodoo, but a friend of mine FedExd me an Old Dirty Bastard (ODB) today and wow ODB would roll over in his grave and then make his way to Voodoo to hit that Doughnut.  The ODB is truly amazing and I can't wait for the next time I'm in P-Town so I can get one hot off the press.  In short, I highly recommend this doughnout.  Chocolate, Oreos, and Peanut Butter.

I've been a customer since the beginning of time. When they would deliver to the bar late night after we all slanged drinks to downtown Portland. Or would come around with free 5 gallon buckets of donuts. Or you would only be able to order from a tiny little window hole you had to knock on to get some service. It's nice to see a place grow and expand and earn some national tourism credibility. They creativity and marketing is top notch. The taste combos are superb and fascinating.
A must see destination if you're in Portland.  Prepare to wait in line, but it's well worth the wait.  I highly recommend the maple bar with bacon!

Coolest donut shop on the planet!  Located in downtown Portland, in a "rougher" part of the city.  This is a destination shop for it's novel assortment of donuts.  From the famous vodoo doll with a pretzel spike and raspberry jelly filling to the bubblegum donut, with a piece of bubblegum and sweet pink frosting.  This is truly unique and fun.
I waited for over an hour to get my donuts, so you will plenty of time to make decisions on which donut to order.
Not your kids shop, as there are mainly adult themed decor and signage:  the magic is in the hole.

I hate when places sport style over substance.  When I went to Voodoo, I thought that is what I would find, a bunch of weird donuts that just taste ok.  

However, I LOVE their donuts.  I am an apple fritter, raised with chocolate kind of guy, and neither disappointed. The chocolate frosting they use is unbelievable.  Also, though not usually a crueler guy, their lemon crueler is awesome.

My favorite though is the voodoo doll.  Basically a jelly filled raised donut with chocolate icing.  YUM!!

Bring lots of cash because they are not cheap, and the don't take credit or debit cards. (Though they do have an ATM)

Let's just say that it was worth the drive. 

My ultimate favorite is Marshall Matters. I'm a sucker for M&Ms. So putting them on a frosted doughnut is like heaven to a girl like me. 

To name a few more I've also tried the Voodoo Doll which is definitely for raspberry jelly lovers and of course the Bacon Maple Bar which is a genius idea.

This is everything I thought it would be. A line up out the door even when the sun is down. It moved so fast that we didn't even have our minds made up. We went a little overboard for sure and had to try so many. Old Dirty Bastard was our favorite. Tip: don't leave the fruit loop over night. Cereal clearly gets soggy. Not sure what I was thinking. We got the last apple fritter and the gal was super sweet.

If you don't mind standing in line for 30 - 60 mins, it's a fabulous doughnut place. Every kind of doughnut I've gotten has been beyond delicious (and not to mention, super cute & creative) I'm not a big waiting in line type of person, but it is always fun. You get to meet a lot of nice & interesting people. Staff is always fast, super nice, & friendly.

Bacon Maple Bar is a must!  My go to doughnut when we're in Portland.  I like the sweet & salty combo.  My husband usually goes for the Voodoo Doughnut (jelly doughnut).  It's a cute little voodoo doll shaped creation but a little too sweet for me.  If in Portland, this spot is a must do no matter how long the line is.

Let's Go recommended Voodoo Doughnuts and when I saw that they offered Swahili lessons before 9 a.m. every day, I certainly couldn't argue with them.  So we roll up to Voodoo way after Swahili time (and that's okay) and we walk into this kitschy wonderland where the spinning carts display doughnuts with fruit loops, neon orange and purple sugar, next to rubber rats and plastic toys.  There is a giant plaster doughnut hanging on the wall and all kinds of semi-intriguing art pieces and trinkets covering the walls.  Though I was enticed by the Triple Chocolate Penetration Doughnut, I just wasn't in the mood for cocoa puffs, so I took the girl's suggestion and got an Old Dirty Bastard, fried dough smothered in chocolate icing, crushed oreos and...peanut butter.  Listen, don't scoff til you tried it. 

The complaint I have is that the staffer seemed like she was high or she was just completely spaced out.  She got my order wrong twice and she was far from aggressively serving the people, you know?  I sort of chalked it up to the experience though.  I mean, what else can you expect in eccentric doughnut land?  

I also loved the pink to-go boxes stamped with something that says "Good Things Come in Pink Boxes" and the underwear on sale that says "The Magic is in the Hole."  Does that give you an idea of the place's vibe?  In any event, if you're in Portland, you probably should check it out.  I had a good time.
Donuts !!! They are delicious !! Can't go wrong , wish they would accept debit cards , but still amazing !

So, I Will not stand in line for  twenty minutes for a freaking donut , or a woman unless she is an insane redheaded actress..Wait, my the-rapist said go to Portland and taste a maple -bacon donut...and I did . It was pretty good but it would have been better if it had been filled with a touch of mayo..Nuf said I Live in Portland now...and there is a great titty bar just up the street....

As expected, there was a line, but it wasn't out the door. I had been on an eating binge all day, so I "only" ordered 3 doughnuts: plain glazed, glazed with raspberry filling and an apple fritter. I keep it simple when it comes to my beloved doughnuts -- DO NOT put a bunch of crap to deter the taste buds from the simple sugary goodness. They were all on-point! An unexpected fave turned out to be the apple fritter, which had the right amount of crisp on the outside and soft and giving on the inside.
I'm the 818th review with a 4 star average, so there isn't much to add here.  Very unique donuts,  very unique place, all around awesome.  I loved the bacon maple bar.

There is like always a thing that you must do when u travel to different cities and states! Here in Portland hittin Voodoo doughnuts is one of those things! Yes the line wraps around the block but the wait isn't that long! I a few and got a few dozen to take back home with me! Damn good doughnuts though.....so many different types to choose from! I guess at first glance I was thinking how in the hell does this go with that and still be edible lol! Great ideas, great doughnuts!

Been visiting Portland a few times from California. And for the first time I saw the line at  it's shortest(less than 50ppl not counting inside). So I HAD  to try it..being from California and having donuts shops in every corner, the donuts are actually really good. It's one of those spots in Oregon that are on the bucket list

Expected huge crowds and high prices based on some of the lower reviews, but I thought it was great! Donuts are creative, around $1.50-$2 apiece, and we waited in line for no more than 1-2 min. Granted, we visited on a Tuesday, but we loved it!

As a person who can't eat dairy, I go for the excellent vegan doughnuts. Most of the vegan/dairy free stuff out there tastes like it was made out of U-Haul boxes, but Voodoo's vegan stuff is fantastic.  I highly recommend the vegan raised donuts.  If you want to avoid the line, go to Voodoo Too off NE Sandy.  They have their own parking lot, more space, a shorter line, chairs/tables, and arcade games.  More square footage = more awesome Portland weirdness.

You do a Voodoo!! Yes! So amazing, more amazing than I had even thought a doughnut could be.  I am not a big doughnut eater but if I lived in Portland that would probably change, quickly... I had the jelly filled voodoo guy... Holy lord, made me a believer!  Do you think they'd deliver to Seattle?

Waiting in line outside the Flagship location is a MUST for any visit to Portland. My favorite is the signature menu item- the Voodoo Doll doughnut. I prefer it with raspberry filling. There are so many other choices though. Whether your taste buds long for their version of the traditional Portland Creme or a more adventurous variety sprinkled with Tang, they will not be disappointed!

I finally get it.

In the past, people would send me to donutteries in various locales far and wide, claiming that I would see the light. Nothing ever clicked. Invariably, the conversations would go something like this:

Donut Enthusiast: "You just have to go to $PLACE and try the donuts! They're phenomenal!"

Me (returning later): "They tasted like donuts."

There is a good reason, folks, that the queue at Voodoo Doughnut stretches out the door and down the block. The donuts here are like none other I've ever had. The texture is just airy enough, but has a nice chew to it. The jelly in the voodoo doll is sweet, but not cloyingly sugary. The lemon cruller, simply put, is perfect.

I have found donut religion, and it is Voodoo.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ga0mZehXRMw
Lives up to all of the hype. Incredible donuts. We bought over a dozen just so we could sample each one. A must-visit when you're in Portland.

so worth the 20 minute wait if the line is out the door! the doughnuts are absolutely delicious and the names comical. I personally love the "Oh Captain, My Captain" and the "Dirt" donuts. They're really delicious and definitely fill you up in just a few bites!

Portland is Crazy, Weird and lovable ! 
This place screams organic hipster with an "i don't give a @#%" vibe to it. 
I really didn't know what to order so I listened to what the couple in front of me ordered and copied them. Bacon Maple donut log and Memphis something (concoction of chocolate and peanut butter on a giant donut). 
OK about the Bacon Maple thing.... 
I know it doesn't sound very appetizing, but this was seriously one of the best things I have ever tasted. Such a great combination I wonder why none of the chains ever thought of introducing something along these lines, food fusion at its finest! 
The Memphis donut was huge I had it for breakfast the next morning (well only half of it ) and it was still moist and filling... very filling. yummy chocolate and peanut butter and moist cake-like donut ... heavenly....

So the donuts lived up to the hype! Delicious!!!! We went after a basketball game and were there about 11pm in December - let me say, the folks around the area were, well, interesting. Never felt particularly unsafe but certainly entertained! Went past next morning and the area is much tamer by daylight!

What an iconic Portland place. The lines can get long, but it's worth it for the unique doughnuts and the Portland atmosphere. My personal favorite is the doughnuts with oreos (both with peanut butter and without). The cock n balls is also good, if you don't mind eating a phallus shaped donut. The lines get long sometimes, but if you go late enough at night on a weeknight (try 2am?), there will almost never be a line.

I've seen Voodoo Doughnut on every type of travel/food show for years  so I was very pleased to finally try it. 

Additionally, after receiving many pictures of delicious doughnuts accompanied by  "OMG THIS IS SO GOOD"  via text from my fianc while he was out in PDX, it was my turn to feast on these gems.

We got a box to share and eat over a few days: the original Voodoo Doll, the Bacon Maple, the Dirt Doughnut and the Old Dirty Bastard.

Each one truly lived up to the hype and I would go back in a heartbeat and wait in line for them.

Why wait in this line when you can go across the river and not wait in line. At all?
Same donuts, same service (maybe even better service across the river), and same flavor.

But, Voodoo Donuts is really delicious. The smell - it's absolutely amazing.

Bacon maple bar and the Cap'n Crunch doughnuts were my fave.  There was something sinful about the airiness and melt in your mouth texture of the doughnut, but the icing and toppings takes the cake.  I would recommened getting a dozen to try as many of the varieties as you can and sharing.  This is definitely worth the drive to try!

Worth the line! Voodoo was a must for our Portland trip! Only had it once before when a friend brought it back and it was fun designs and delicious flavors! So when planning my Portland trip I knew this was a must! We went on a Saturday late afternoon... there is a parking lot across from voodoo that is actually pricey! I would look around a little more and find a cheaper one! However, the one across from voodoo has the "keep Portland weird" wall mural which is a must take picture with if you are planning doing everything Portland! The line went pretty quick and the crowd was fun. Once we got in it was cash only but they do have an ATM inside of you need to get money. We got 2 dozens... one dozen we specifically picked out which is around $26 and the voodoo special they pick and its around $18. Loved the maple bacon and the maple blunt the best! All their raised donuts were so soft and fresh. Will be back next trip to Portland!

Doughnut joys! Amazing and crazy varieties! If you love doughnuts like I do then this place should be your Mecca! The lines are long, but to me it was well worth the wait and I liked every doughnuts in the dozen I got each time I was there (and the second time there wasn't even a line.

Portland, OR is a great city for food and Voodoo Doughnuts is one of the real gems.

Definitely worth all the hype! We got the butterfinger cake donut, the captain crunch one and their newer one with graham cracker cereal filled with marshmallow fluff (seriously tasted like a s'more!). And the absolute best part - less than a 5 minute wait on a Monday around 10am!

Was not dissapointed. The doughnut was good and covered in fruit loops, the wait was not too bad but definitely longer than I am used to waiting for a doughnut. Definitely dig their style and got a bumper sticker for my friend back home that insisted I go here. Service was friendly. I'd probably go back, but not when there's a crazy line.
The No Name... Best donut ever.

Best donuts ever!! Get there early to avoid long lines. We chose the voodoo dozen where they choose 12 of their most popular donuts at a decent price. Cash only! Will definitely come back when we're in Portland again.

Best donuts in the country

They ain't cheap but you get what you pay for. I dare you to take a box of these to work on a Monday and not make some friends.

And for those people who think the staff here is rude. You might want to stand off to the side and figure out what you want before you step up to order. They have a lot of donuts and there are a lot of choices to be made. You don't want to blow donut day! And when it is your turn to order, standing there with a glazed over look (pun intended) isn't going to put anyone in a good mood.

If you figure out what you want first and order smoothly, you'll find that the staff here is just fine. I have been here many times over many years and I have never had an issue with the staff. That's because I know what I want and don't waste any time when it's my turn at the counter. 

Don't blow donut day!

This place is a scene- anywhere that opens at 10pm is a hot spot. There is even a little attic upstairs that has a piano in it. I've never seen it in use, but I don't put it past the guys at Voodoo for trying. 

They have VEGAN donuts, which seemed impossible, until I stepped inside and discovered that anything is possible. They even hold weddings there, included in the price is a plane trip and of course donuts for all. 

Update- apparently Voodoo is now open ALL THE TIME... so watch out 

There are a lot of reasons why I keep my donut intake low, however this place could just be the downfall of all that. Plus, who doesn't like to play with their food-aka donut voodoo doll?
The only thing they make is donuts!!!! And it's perfect because THEY DO IT RIGHT!!! Try the voodoo, maple and bacon, glazed cherry filled...all awesome!!!!

Oh holy maple bacon donuts, batman!!
 
Once you have one of their donuts, you will not be able to stop talking about it for the rest of your life. 

The purple kool-aid donut was the only "off" one we had. The rest were divine. 

Oh, Voodoo what did you do, now me LOVE you?
Stood in line for 30 minutes in a light Portland mist. Portland cream doughnut. Would do it again every day if possible. Jesus Christ is this an amazing doughnut.

Great tasting donuts!!!  The caramel & the chocolate frostings are perfect flavors!!!!  Great service this morning at 6:15 AM!!!!  So many varieties, I bought extra to take back to my neighbors out here in the boonies!!!!
Note - do NOT believe those awful social media stories/conspiracies!!!!!

OMG OMG OMG OMG I'm giving myself a mild coronary just thinking about the Voodoo. 

Voodoo, no one does it like you doo. 

We rolled up around 2:30AM after exasperating ourselves at the Greek and the Acropolis ( I guess you could say my friends were giving my bf and I a 'welcome (back) to p-town you dirty Greek' night of disco dancing and dirty strip clubs, respectively). The alpha wolf-man and pack of tall women were hungry so we ordered the grab bag box. We got lucky cause ours was filled with: the Grape Ape (vanilla with grape powder on top), Triple Chocolate Penetration (chocolate cake donut, chocolate frosting entrenched with coco puffs), TANG (sprinkled with the magical orange stuff), maple bars galore, and the Fruit Loops one. 

OOOOO SO GOOD! stuffed our pie-holes, downed a gallon of 2% milk and called it a night. 

Voodoo Doughnuts is making my wedding cake! (Yes they make wedding cakes sans the sticker shock) . Boom!

If this review is solely on their donuts, solid 5 stars! I'm not usually a sweets person but voodoo has so many different options that can make anyone enjoy a donut here! Their selections are amazing - anything from gluten free to a giant men's nether regions the side of your head.

We had the chocolate voodoo man, dirty bastard, blueberry, and butterfinger donut. They were all so delicious but as a huge fan of peanut butter and Oreos, the dirty bastard stole the show.

THE LINE IS LONG, but you already knew that. I would also say don't come here for the hype as blue star donuts are just as good. But people told us that and we went here anyway, just as you are going to!

SYOY,
Jess

I'm in love!
After a very long 11 hour drive from California my boyfriend and I decided we were gonna stop at Voodoo Doughnuts for our desert stop before we reach Washington. And it was well worth the drive! 

The doughnuts were very moist the frosting was not to overbearing and not extremely sweet which I hate! They also had very quirky doughnuts that would make a grown man blush. 

PS they sell VEGAN doughnuts!! 

I just wish they had a closer one to me

Since my first visit I discovered the McMinnvile Cream doughnut.

OM$G

Quite possibly one the greatest foods in the world.  Hey I like a good doughnut!

I left Portland a year ago, but friend from Portland is visiting me here in N Cal in 2 weeks and I am ordering a dozen for him to bring.  I can't wait!! :)

They have so many imaginative and incredible creations I suspect every doughnut lover will find a favorite.

VooDoo proves that is not "Just A Doughnut", when it's a VooDoo Doughnut!!  And no I did not get paid to say that, I just happen to think VooDoo takes doughnuts to the next level.

go get some..

Soo much fun! The cock-n-balls that cream, the jelly filled voodoo person, the bacon wrapped maple bar! The dough is super doughy with delicious frosting. Portland easily has some of the best food I have eaten in any city. I think its the water!??

Easily the best and most eclectic donuts I've had.  Of course, I had to try the maple bar with bacon and see why it's so popular.  Definitely a meal onto itself.  Also tried the Memphis Mafia which was very good as well and had the Marshall Mathers, which was good as well.  Only gripe is the area the store is located is a bit seedy, especially at night, but fighting off the transients for the donuts was worth it.  Definitely a highlight on the Portland portion of the vacation.  Glad I don't live there or I would be Type II diabetic...

Some people will say that anyone can throw cereal or bacon or any other wild ingredient on a donut and that in fact is very true but none will taste quite like Voodoo Doughnuts. The toppings are awesome but just the plain donuts are amazing as well. Of course there is a line out the door but anything worth having is worth waiting for and these doughnuts are definitely worth it. I had the Maple bacon doughnut and the bacon was cooked just right...not soggy, not too crispy. I also had the Old Dirty Bastard which was a doughnut with chocolate frosting, Oreo's with peanut butter drizzled on top and that was just as good as the maple bacon. The Oreo cookies were crunchy and the peanut butter atop sets that doughnut off. I snuck in a few bites of my bf's Captain my Crunch doughnut and again, another amazing concoction. Its a doughnut with a white glaze, covered in Captain Crunch Cereal. I had a plain maple doughnut as well which was made perfectly. I have only had a few doughnuts off their large menu and I have no complaints about any of them so I can only imagine how great the other's are. This location is a popular tourist attraction because of the fact that it has been on several different shows on the Food Network channel. If you are worked into the idea of going to the location seen on TV and don't mind waiting in a line, then this is the location for you. If you don't have a preference, there is a second location outside of downtown that only locals know about and there is a smaller line. Whatever you choose, you'll be happy with any doughnut selection.

Quintessential for those who are visiting, or just those who love a specialty donut. There's typically a line of some sort, but don't be put off. Just hang out, take in the awesome decor and sweet aroma. There is a rotating case up front to show off the different types of donuts, but you really can't go wrong with an employee-selected dozen. They accept cash only, but there is an ATM in the lobby. 

Go! Now!
Despite the line, I have always enjoyed my experience here. It's worth it.

Love this place! Every time I come back, the donuts are consistently delish!  I am never disappointed.  I would recommend this place really for any of the donuts, but my group loved the bacon maple bar, apple fritter, oreo donut, voodoo doll.

Are you kidding?  This place doesn't need a review.  They kick ass, take names, and then do it all over again EVERY. DAMN. DAY.  I'm very glad there isn't one in Corvallis because I'd find a way for them to be my 4 food groups. Seriously.
Really Awesome and a fantastic menu! excellent communication and very friendly customer service! Their donuts are the concoction you wish you came up with, deliciousness!
I love their donuts. They probably have every kind of doughnut you can put to imagination. Awesome place to go if you have a sweet tooth and the munchies.

awesomeness...
yummy donuts...scummy atmosphere...but scummy in a good way... a sid vicious way...cool donut names and innovative combinations for a pretty tame breakfast item hehe
i bought two dozen in four day stay in portland... had to try all the fun kinds and share them with friends in seattle!! yumyumyum!! i will be back when i am in portland... my favorite had to be triple chocolate penetration and i liked the voodoo doll idea... very cute... the ones with oreos and candy on top are awesome but seriously cause a sugar coma afterward... that's the best....all the donuts are really well made and tasty regardless of the fun names... i was kinda expecting a hoky gimmicky thing with just so-so donuts but they are actually very good quality donuts...so even if you aren't into the punk rock vibe the donuts are worth it...

Best apple fritter we have ever had!!!! We just happened to go when there was no line at all!!! Not sure how that happened. It was at 10 pm at night. We thought it was all hype but nope. Good donuts!!
skip breakfast and make this lunch!!!   hahaha.... good stuff!!!!!

-hm yes donuts
-7:30am on a tuesday = no line!!!
-vegan voodoo doll, gay bar, portland cream

i should've taken a picture of my voodoo doll to post on here with the 8 billion other pictures of voodoo dolls but i inhaled it :((((((

yums
OMG I love Voodoo Donut! The Grape Ape is the best. Worth the wait in line. Fun place and really fun to order donuts with quirky names like Cock and Balls. LOL
Rainy day, lucked out with no wait. Ordered a big box and they lived up to their reputation. These donuts were the talk of our entire vacation!
What can I say that hasn't already been said??? the donuts are freaking amazing and the crappy bathroom lock and cash policy is worth the visit!!!
Delicious and fun! I don't know why the locals have been putting it down. I'm a born-and-raised Oregonian and I still love Voodoo. :)

Oh the Voodoo that you do...voodoo doughnuts!

You guys are crazy fun and the doughnuts while not the best I have ever had get an "A" for pure creativity. I really enjoyed visiting this spot and encourage everyone visiting Portland to get in that line (we waited 45 minutes) for your opportunity to get your hands on these crazy doughnuts. No a picture is not enough...you have to experience it!

We carried a huge "pink box" home with us and our friends got to see a little piece of the creativity but we had the "total experience".

After reading all the reviews for this place I had to go here since I was in the area. Upon walking in I did not expect it to be so small and cramped. The smell of bacon fat is palpable.

What I noticed right away is that there are a plethora of donuts to choose from, but only 1 menu is being passed around to help give you some visualization to go with what you are about to order.

I ordered the Bacon Maple Bar and the Chocolate Glaze donut, but the latter was sold out so I could only enjoy my bacon maple bar, which was delicious.

As I walked out of there with my friend we both agreed that, that place was kinda weird. We also both agreed that if we had to listen to that music all day we would go crazy.

The music def sets the mood for the place, but it would become very annoying after awhile. Hopefully when you go there won't be a long line so you don't have to deal with the music for too long

Tex-Ass, cock and balls, triple chocolate penetration, just to name a few of the ridiculously named donuts. Anytime I'm in Portland I have to stop here and get a donut. It's a hole in the wall, and sometimes a band plays up in the corner, I won't explain you just need to see it to believe.

We came here on our visit to Portland after seeing it featured on No Reservations.  I love Bourdain and I'll take his word for it if he recommends a place.

We waited in line for about 20 minutes on a Friday morning at 10am.  The line was crazy, but we were on a mission to pick up doughnuts for our whole clan (the whole family was in town for a wedding) and were willing to wait.  

The maple-bacon doughnut is crazy good but so were the regular cake ones, the boston cream and the dirt doughnut (with crushed oreos on top- good idea).  We sampled a little bit of each one.  I don't have the patience to wait in line like this normally for a doughnut, but I'm glad we did.  It is a fun place, very creative, and the doughnuts are very good.  I'd go back if I'm ever in Portland again.

A Portland mainstay, if you haven't been here for the donuts you don't know what you're missing. The colorful names, the delicious creations, it's all here. Just make sure you bring cash! If you forget, there's a well-loved cash machine.

My girlfriend took me to this place while we were visiting for a convention. What can I say? It a punk-driven, hole in the wall little shithole donut shop in the middle of an impoverished and dingy downtown-esque area....

AND I LOVE IT!

Outside was a small parade of bums. Inside was a line that curved around the shop twice and settled outside in front of previously mentioned bums. The waitress (brandishing many tattoos and other marks of awesome) was super patient with the kids pointing to the various colorful donuts long after I would have punted the brats out the door. Finally, we sidle up to the bar and begin the childlike requisition process.

Pink panties saying The Magic Is In The Hole, out of stock. Donuts with tang and grape flavored drink, in.

As I sat there in horror and disgust, trying not to back away slowly and fade into the crowd, the assortment of baked confectionery items collected in the simple pink box. My girlfriend smiled and laughed (and mocked, the brat) at my horror at mention of a mango filled donut. Till I had a bite.

This place is the perfect marriage of chaos and function. They need to open one in Seattle so I don't have to drive all day to get another...
As good as the hype...fast service despite the long lines...
Why are you checking Yelp to see if you should go here? This place is iconic. If you hate donuts, then don't go here.

Who doesn't love voodoo??? Where else can you find a doughnut with your favorite cereal or candy on it? The downtown location is small and parking is always hard to come by, but if you park in Chinatown and are willing to walk a couple blocks to get there then it's no biggie.

The only downside to voodoo is probably the staff. I've never gotten a friendly vibe from any of them, which is probably just because they are always so incredibly busy in there.

To showcase some of their more interesting doughnuts, all of which I have tried and loved:

Old Dirty Bastard - a raised doughnut with chocolate topping, crushed oreos and peanut butter drizzle

Bacon Maple Bar - yes... it's real bacon. Your standard maple bar with two lovely, crispy and fresh strips of bacon on top. Get over the weird and get with the bacon... this is amazing

Cock n Balls - this is your basic raised doughnut with chocolate topping.... cream-filled, of course! They will even put custom writing on top if you want. It's like $5 and could feel a family of four. Go for it!

Then, there are various raised and cake/frosted doughnuts with toppings such as oreos, Captain Crunch, Cocoa Puffs, Rice Crispies, pixie stix, bubble gum, marshmallows, and yes.... even Tang.

One big word to the wise.... they only take CASH... so come prepared. Prices per doughnut range from about $1 each to $5, and I think a dozen is around $15 if you pick them out yourself. I highly recommend this every time you are in Portland.

They are located next door to a porno theater and across the street from a strip join on the edge of china town. Probably not so savory for children and I wouldn't feel comfortable walking around there alone as a single woman, but with a friend or two I say go for it! Right off bus route 20.

This place is as great as everyone says it is! Believe me! Waiting in line isn't bad...there is ALWAYS a line, sometimes its longer and then you have a choice to come back another time or suck it up to get that tasty treat! What I love about Voodoo doughnut is that they have a creative and tasty menu. Must try the bacon maple bar. Just go.
Awesome doughnuts. Very creative names for the doughnuts themselves. I highly recommend it if you are in town and would like to try something different.
Are you kidding me? A must visit place every time I'm in Portland. Bacon maple bar and a cream filled cock and balls!

Come here for the atmosphere and take pictures of the sign!  That alone is worth 5 stars!  The wait staff was nicely tattooed and pierced. (I appreciate nice body art)  Staff was very helpful too.  I had the basic glazed doughnut, a maple bar, sampled various doughnuts with different fillings (had fun poking holes in the doughnuts to see what the filling was!) and of course, the infamous voodoo doll donut.  I didn't care about the wait or the stupid carbs and calories that day.  The tasty doughnuts I had was a shock to my system but was worth every bite!  Saw a lot of people carrying the pink Voodoo Doughnut boxes onto the plane at PDX.  When I arrived at my destination and was in the luggage claim area, people were grabbing the doughnut box instead of hugging the loved one who came to visit them!   I recommend you stop in and see the place next time you are in Portland.
Portland landmark must visit for any foodie. Some of my favoirtes are maple bar with bacon, the ol dirty bastard and the tex ass. Bring cash no plastic here cash money only

Just amazing, that's all there is to say about Voodoo. They offer Vegan doughnuts as well, which taste amazing. My recommendation would be any of the banana cakes... And for the rest of us, Bacon! Bacon Maple Bar. Every time i fly to Portland, I haveeee to eat one. its magical bacon maple syrup taste gives me a reason to live haha. just make sure you hit them up in the morning or early afternoon, or else you may find yourself waiting in line for 20+ minutes... And it just gets worse at night, ive stood in line at 1am in the rain for these amazing doughnuts. But trust me, it is definitely worth the wait...
Don't like doughnuts but had to see what all the excitement was about.  Long lines.   It's a Portland landmark so everyone should see it once

My boss flew into Palo Alto from Portland and brought boxes of donuts from this place. 

I had the Ain't That A Peach Fritter doughnut 
Peach fritter topped with cream cheese frosting with pink and orange sprinkles! Which was fantastic in flavor, juicy, and loaded with cream cheese frosting. 

I like the different combinations of toppings. Definitely want to try this place again.

So... This place is one of the best doughnut shops that has ever existed in the concept of... well, ever. 

First, let me warn you - you will NOT be met by a 20 something blonde Barbie at the counter. Tattoos, dreads, pink (blue, purple, name it) hair, and loud music to go with the heavenly smell of doughnuts.

I live very close to the Eugene 'outpost', but have been to both of the Portland anchors. Eugene, no line for your doughnut most of the time. Portland, there will be a wait, but it's SO worth it.

There will be doughnuts that will test your 'sensibility' boundaries if you have them, but seriously, you've been warned.

Want a test run on offerings? Get the staff mix dozen.

On my first trip to Portland, I had to make a pitstop at Voodoo Doughnuts. 
The line did go outside the door but it went very quickly so don't let that deter you. 

Their menu is very quirky with a voodoo doll doughnut that oozes 'blood' (raspberry sauce), a homer doughnut, cereal topped doughnuts, and more! I got the "Oh captain, my captain" which is topped with vanilla frosting and cap'n crunch cereal. It was super good!! My whole family also ordered their own doughnuts (some got 2!) and everyone was very impressed by their doughnuts!!  

The store is very small so when it gets packed, I definitely recommend eating elsewhere.
Favorite location is in Eugene. Lines are absurd in Portland. I mean, they are great donuts, but standing in line for a half hour for donuts? Arent Amerikans fat enough yet?

Very interesting variety of donuts!!!! If you're in Portland, this place is a must!! I understand why some may review it poorly here but these donuts are just not for everyone. Give it a try and decide for yourself.

CASH ONLY......leave your cards at home folks.....tucked into a corner of an alley that also has a strip club, voodoo donuts is the mecca of sugary sweet high to get your day started....it is a 'bucket list' place if visiting Portland......is it slightly over priced?  Maybe, are there homeless people outside roaming around asking for spare change?  Sure.  Are the staff as funky and interesting as the donuts?  You betcha!  Are the donuts ANY GOOD?  Darn tootin!!! Coffee is great too.....staff was friendly, easy to park, and ample seating outside.....a definite must stop if visiting Portland (especially for us east coasters!)....5 stars for all the above!
Love this place...bacon maple bar is one of my favorites. Definitely hands down my favorite donut place.

I love Voodoo doughnut!! Sure it's a bit kitschy, with some crudely named/shaped doughnuts. There is one register, it's cash only, and the wait can exceed 30 minutes, but I still love it. It's weird in a way only Portland is. For me it's a tradition to come here on those late nights after shows, when I'm craving less than healthy food that I would normally be ashamed to eat. I don't mind waiting in line, even in the rain. It's part of the experience. Why be in such a hurry all the time anyways? 

The no name, dirt doughnut, bacon maple bar, etc. all these are a bit odd sounding at first, but they are amazing, especially after those nights when you've had more than a couple drinks. By far my favorite is the bacon maple bar. I try to get something I haven't tried when I come in, but the sweet, salty deliciousness of the bacon maple bar often wins me over. It's good like when you mix your bacon with your pancakes and maple syrup. 

I'm not a doughnut person really, but when I'm downtown I always make an exception for Voodoo. This place and it's unique take on doughnuts has put a spell on me.

Very good doughnuts. Fun names for the doughnuts. Interesting people to talk to while in line. I'm glad we went to Voodoo Doughnuts. The maple bacon bars are amazing! The kids get a big kick out of the voodoo doll doughnut. Their favorite flavors were,  bubble gum and the cocopuffs. I enjoyed the Portland cream and the apple fritter.

Bravo, Voodoo Doughnut, for such creativity and supplying the drunken clientele with late-night next-day-regretting snacks.  

The decor, staff and doughnut options (Blazer Blunt, anyone?) are so Portland.  The maple bacon draws in the most attention and deservedly so.  I used to think I only liked this place because I was so wasted that any unhealthy food sounded good as long as it was served quickly, but I've enjoyed these doughnuts in sobriety as well.

Only get the fruit powdered ones (Mango Tango, Grape Ape) if you're craving the super-sweet.  The cereal topped treats are great, if you like that particular cereal, that is.

Thank you, Voodoo for my Blazer Blunt, the titters over the Cock and Balls, giving my friend his Mango Tango and just for being there for Portland.

OMG OMG OMG OMG, that's how i felt when we finally made it to portland! it's quite small inside but who needs a big space when all you are waiting for is a tasty donut? mmm, i had the ol dirty bastard, a concoction of a donut with chocolate icing, oreo cookie crumbs on top and a drizzle of peanut butter! they also carry vegan donuts too that i must try on my next trip out there! i heart you voodoo.... *sigh*

ummm seriously... the novelty of the entire experience is unparalleled. I have gone to Voodoo on a Saturday and waited nearly 40 mins for donuts and I've gone at 2AM with virtually no wait... no matter the time of day nor the length of wait, you will not be disappointed. There is something for everyone provided you've not gone the way of gluten, grain and sugar free living as I have now... thank GOODNESS I visited beforehand!  The maple -bacon is a MUST.

Had the bacon maple and it may be the tastiest thing I have ever eaten.  I don't know what everyone else is talking about but I had great customer service.  In and out fast and the lady behind the counter was very nice.

ahhhmmmmm (drooling)...doughnuts.  I can't say anything else that hasn't already been said about the famous Voodoo.  So I won't.

We were out with friends and being near decided to get some goodies for later.  The enticing aroma of sugary fried dough drew us to this hole-in-the-wall place like a moth to a flame.  A VooDoo dozen later and  the rest is history.  I'm just glad it's not close to home.  It could be a very bad thing...

Best. Doughnut. Ever.

Overrated? Get out of here man. This place checks off every box. UNIQUE. DELICIOUS. UNREAL VIBE. I loved it man. The maple bar was terrific and the Voodoo Doll was the weirdest donut ever...which is what makes it awesome. This is one of the best donut shops I have ever been too.

I love and hate this place. 
Sometimes the cereal bits on top of their doughnuts are stale.. but nothing beats just picking them off. I do love the grape ape! I do forget its cash only every now and than.. Its a tiny place with a huge crowd. oh random fact for everyone.. there is a place right beside it to watch hentai.. which is a nice conversation whenever I bring non portlanders over there. XD

24 hour donut shop, AND they're not stale when you pick up a few in the middle of the night?! Yesss! This shop is the definition of Portland - complete with hipsters and smokers alike standing around outside. Voodoo is a tiny little shop so don't be surprised if there's a line extending outside the door. It goes by super fast unless you're stuck behind an indecisive donut eater. Voodoo is conveniently located next to a big alley filled with tables and plenty of seating if you want to eat your donut right away. 

They do have a ton of options here, might as well get at least a dozen! All of their flavors are listed on a chalkboard on the wall, but some of the uniquely named ones don't have descriptions, so you might just have to wing it. There's a rotating donut case too if you want to decide by looks instead of description. I didn't want anything crazy but nothing boring either, so I went with the Portland cream donut, nicely described as "Portland's official doughnut." Sounds good to me...and it was! It's chocolate glazed and inside there's a custard-type of cream... it almost reminded me of a Boston Cream Pie. The donut tasted dense and fresh, no wimpy grocery store donuts here. I also tasted my boyfriend's Voodoo donut and the Mango Tango donut. The Voodoo donut is more for its looks - since they decorate it just like a Voodoo doll. Tasty, but it's basically just a chocolate frosted donut. The Mango Tango donut was really good though - packed with mango flavored jelly and topped with a thick glaze. That was probably my favorite of the three, since it was the most unique... you rarely see a Mango donut at your neighborhood donut store! And we didn't eat it until the next night, and it tasted just as good.
we always HAVE to bring friends from out of town to Voodoo. Interesting trivia, In 2009, "Voodoo Doughnuts" was the 9th most searched for place on google. The bacon maple bar is my fav!

I know it's weird...and a little scary...but it's totally worth a visit!

The Doughnut with Maple and Bacon was to die for! 

This is a MUST if you love doughnuts....and wanta try something new and just a little bit weird!
Cock and balls! Cock and balls! Heehee. My inner 8th grader loves this place. If you don't know what I'm talking about, stop by and find out.

8 months went by as a transplant to the rose city and I had yet to visit VooDoo Donuts. So where was the first stop on the list after I swooped my friends from the airport? You guessed it! And wow we had some good luck. They brought in the sunshine. We found parking right on burnside and third. The line was barely longer than 7 people ahead of us! 

This was setting up my first VooDoo experience for a knockout. And wow! Sometimes I hate to buy into all the hype but damn these donuts are good! Super happy to have the time to finally stop in. We got about 6 different donuts. Their apple fritter is light and airy. Sweet but has that fruit flavor. Some of the other choices were massive on the sugar count! Oreos, peanut butter, homers oh my! 

We left with huge smiles and maybe a rounder belly.

The Magic is in the Hole!! :)

Donuts usually aren't my thing, but when they come in the shape of a man with a pretzel through his heart, I am immediately intrigued! Growing up in PDX must have spoiled me to expect eccentric, unique, wonderful places like Voodoo Doughnut. They [used to?] carry a NyQuil and a Pepto-Bismo Doughnut, and I'll bet you can't find anywhere else that serves up a Bacon-Maple doughnut, Vegan doughnuts,Dirty Snowballs, and many other *eh,hem* colorfully named doughnuts.

This place even does wedding packages...I'm not sure why you would want to, but hey - if opportunity knocks...

If you are in Portland, this is a must-visit location sure to please!
Dozen donuts for cheap! Vegan selection! Delicious!!! Can't wait to return.
This location is not as crazy busy as the other one. Came on a Saturday morning and no line! My favorite was the Oreo peanut butter donut... AMAZING.

Cool place and doughnuts are very funny! Make sure you plan to grab doughnuts in the morning, because there's a line out the door in the evening. You'll pay $27 for a bakers dozen, but they're cool doughnuts...snap chatable! As far as taste...they are overwhelming made with tons of sugar and toppings! Buy two/three and split them.

Stopped at Voodoo Doughnut not expecting them to taste as good as they did! I love the experience of waiting 20 minutes in the rain. LOL! (part of the charm) We had already been to Blue Star Donuts the day before and we thought Voodoo were much better.  I think it is worth the wait. The vegan selection is great.
it's tasty and fun to have the challenge for a super huge donut within 80 secs.

I admit, I live in Seattle but have never been to Portland till recently!  Came to our neighboring PNW city for a little weekend getaway.  The last day there made sure to check out Voodoo, which is all anybody raves about.  My boyfriend and I are neither sweet or doughnut fans, so decided to stick with a 4 box.   It was so difficult to decide on 4 droughts because everything looked so good.   Luckily Yelp lists all the doughnuts with descriptions, so we were able to narrow down our decision afte waiting in line for 30 minutes outside.  Here is what we went with:

-Maple Bacon: Sweet and Salty.  We agreed this will be in our mouth everytime we vist PDX
-Voodoo Doll: Cherry filled doughnut designed like a voodoo doll with a little pretzel wand. 
-Portland Cream: Typical bavarian cream filled doughnut.  Loved
-Dirt doughnut : Vanilla frosting and orea topped doughnut.  It took us the whole trip back to Seattle to finish this because it was so sweet.

We both agreed that for not being doughnut fans, this is the top of the top.

Possibly the very best donut shop I have ever been to. I had some kind of Satanist donut which was devil's food flavored (naturally) with a pentagram on it...and frankly I would sell my soul to the devil to have another. Fuck the crossroads, I want another Satanist donut.

I had a 3 hour layover in Portland so my friend and I thought "Why not check out this place?" It turned out to be a very yummy idea.

We had dinner then headed over. The line at first sight was a bit intimidating, especially since we had a flight to catch. But after asking someone in the front of the line how long it took, they said about 10 minutes...and they were totally right. The wait wasn't too long considering how long the line was. We got our donuts and holy hell....they were fricken out of this world. Definitely live up to the hype!!

Even if you have a 2 hour layover, go check this place out! Worth the trip!

So we had heard that Blue Star Donuts was better than Voodoo, so we were going to try them both. We got our donuts at Voodoo first. And then went back to Voodoo later than same day to get more. Never made it to Blue Star :) So, the Voodoo Doughnuts store is quirky, bright, and fun. The doughnuts are the same. We tried several kinds, and they were all delicious. Our favorite though was the Tangtastic (cake donut with vanilla frosting, Tang dust, and marshmallows). We got one, and fought over it because it was so good. That's why we went back later, to get more of that one :) We will probably go back before we head home to Utah and get a few for our kids (hopefully they keep well through a 12 hour drive). 
Voodoo Doughnuts lives up to the hype for sure!

It was a nice rainy day in Portland and the line was out the door. They were nice enough to pass out some coffee and donuts to those of us waiting. What great donuts, awesome experience and service to go with it

The line is hilarious.  It's so long, you'd think all these people are waiting to get into a hot nightclub but no, we're all waiting for our Voodoo Doughnuts!  Don't worry though - the line actually goes by pretty fast and it's well, well, WELL worth the wait!

I was most shocked by how GOOD the prices are at this place.  As such a hyped up, must-see Portland attraction, I expected the prices to be overpriced but they weren't.  I don't remember the exact prices, but there were many doughnuts that only cost around a dollar each.

I ordered a "Voodoo Doll," which was great!  It's a doughnut shaped like a little voodoo doll, with a little pretzel stick you use to poke at it and see the jelly filling ooze out.  I also ordered a Portland Cream which was amazing, and a glazed French Crueller, also good.

I'd give this place SIX stars if I could!  BTW, remember to bring cash.

When in Portland...

Vegan donuts = Win

We got lucky and visited when there was really no line. We had the namesake Voodoo doll donut and the chocolate/Oreo/PB donut. They were both delicious, decadent and fun. 

The creative decorations and flavor combinations make this place worth visiting again!

It's a small shop and I can imagine it must be kind of crazy when the lines are long, but the employees were really friendly and pleasant. The only downsides are the kind of shady area with people begging and having to pay for parking.

Loved this place!  You will have to wait a long time outside because it's a very small shop with minimal space, but it's worth the wait.  There is no seating to eat them here, you will have to take your doughnuts to go and eat them elsewhere.  But that is fine by me!  My favorite was the voodoo doll doughtnut :)  I couldn't bring myself to try the bacon maple bar one, even though everyone says that it's good.  If I do eat bacon, it's turkey  bacon.  And on a doughtnut, bleh lol  I can't imagine that.  If you're visiting Portland, definitely make it a point to stop by and try the place out.

Picture three teenagers.
Drunk. 
In the middle of the night.
In the rain.
Trying to find Voodoo Doughnuts. 
With a dying I-Phone and no idea where they parked their car.
It became life or death that we found this place.


And I am so glad we did.
I actually am well known for my absolute HATRED of doughnuts. 
Doesn't everyone know that they are just old bread, deep fried, covered in fake colored fatty sugar? Bleh. Never enjoyed a doughnut. Not once.
Until I met youuuuuuu (that is Mr. Voodoo)
Oh goodness, why do you have to be so far away Portland?! I suppose I could go to the one in Eugene, but I'm still looked at a good 10 hour car drive.
Get one of these doughnuts. But make it easy on yourself, keep track of your car, charge your phone and try and stay optimistic about the line. It goes fast, and even if it doesn't your about to have the best doughnut of your life

-Signed,
the supposed doughnut hater.

this was fun and yummy.  it's like being 5 again when you look at the spinning display.  'OMG DONUTS WITH CEREAL???'  .. !! A doughnut man with a stake in his heart!! luls.   

also..

COFFIN FULL OF DONUTS.

Oh, don't tell my doc I was there!  Oh my goodness, FoodTV got it right!

Fun, great selection, wild, and REALLY GOOD donuts--good things really do come from pink boxes!  Their staff was patient, friendly...and helpful....even after probably answering the same tourist questions 200+ a day!

Can't wait to visit again!
Excellent doughnuts, art and prices!  Worth a visit and small wait in line.

Voodoo Donuts is one (of many) reasons to visit Portland. Exceedingly unique concoctions that will overwhelm you and intimidate you in landing on one or two flavors to enjoy.

I ordered the most yelped about Maple Bacon Bar. All components deliver... the light raised donut, the intensely sweet and maple icing, and the cold crisp and salty bacon. Sipping a cup of 8oz Stumptown coffee helped cut the sweetness.

I ordered two donuts but stopped at one. I saved my Triple Chocolate Penetration for later.

This place was one of a few reasons why I relocated to OR from CO.  They have the best doughnuts in the world ... EVER!.  The Bacon Maple Bar, the Voodoo Doll, and the Portland Creme are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!.

They also cater weddings (yes ... weddings) and bachelorette parties (or so I have heard with a customized 'cock and balls' doughnut filled with creme)

Both store locations are open 24hrs .. woohoo, but the one drawback is that they are a cash only sales business, they do have an ATM but there will be fees I imagine to use it.

Stopped in on my way back home from Portland and ordered a chocolate donut with crushed butterfinger topping.  Best donut ever.

A pair of down-on-their-luck panhandler dudes camped outside said hello to me on my way in, which I must have just ignored.  On my way out, one of the dudes stood up and petulantly muttered "when someone says hello to you, you should say hello back!", and then stormed off down the block indignantly.

My GF and I just laughed it off.  We're from a city south of Portland that is infamous for it's abundant homeless population, and no, we don't feel obligated to greet every panhandler we see with a smile and warm hello.

I guess we're just assholes that way.  :)

so..... I walk into work one day and there is a doughnut on my desk.... it looks like a maple bar with bacon on it..... my boss smiles and says eat!!! I looked at him confused because it is a maple bar...... with bacon...... I say....but I hate maple bars..... his response.... I know.... but you wont hate this one. It took me ten mins to gather up the courage to try this......not because of the bacon.... that was fine... I just REALLY hate maple bars lol. I finally take a bite ...... the heavens opened up and light for a moment seemed a bit brighter, the noise in the office went away, my cares.....what cares???? the next thing you know...... I am sitting there empty handed because I no longer had a bacon maple bar in my hand.... it had mysteriously disappeared..... I have been told I ate the whole thing lol.

so I have tried some of the other doughnuts before but my fav (other than the bacon maple bar.....) is the voodoo one with raspberry filling and a pretzel stick thru its evil little heart!!! 

I often get the bucket of leftovers to bring into work to feed the masses..... it is always a treasure hunt as we unpack them to see what goodies we have gotten. 

I also hate fritters.... I always have, a friend gave me a bite of hers and oh holy bageebees..... it was actually good ...... so they have now gotten me to like 2 types of doughnuts I previously hated...... (I dont know if that is actually a good thing or not lol) but the only place I have found that I liked them was the voodoo....mmmmmmmm (I am having a Homer Simpson moment) mmmmmmmm doughnuts......

Finally made it to the infamous Voodoo Doughnut!! Yay. The line was pretty long but moved pretty  fast. I feel it was well worth the wait. The young lady that helped us was friendly and very patient as this was me and my boy friend's first time here. She explained in detail the prices and what types for into each box depending on what pricing you wanted. We didn't get a custom box. I chose the raspberry filled and hibiscus doughnut. My boyfriend chose the raspberry filled and lemon filled. Would have gotten more but there were so many choices and we didn't want our eyes to be bigger than our stomachs especially since we were on a road trip and don't want to get a bunch of doughnuts only for them to go stale. Good doughnuts. The right amount of filling and very moist cake. Can't wait to return.

Fun place to buy very fresh donuts.

In Portland, had to stop, glad I did. 
If nothing else, then menu will make you smile. 
I went at 9pm. There was barely a line and I assumed that I was going to get some pretty old donuts. I was ok with it, just to say I tried it. 
I got the bacon maple bar and a regular old raspberry jelly filled. Both were spectacular. Perfectly soft and just the right amount of chewy. Even the bacon on my maple bar was perfectly cooked. When you bit through it, it  broke through just right. It didn't shatter or not separate all the way, causing you to pull the whole piece off as you took your bites.

Voodoo Doughnut is sweet...literally!

I was taking a few photos of the "Keep Portland Weird" mural when I felt my blood sugar drop...right across the street is Voodoo Doughnut.  I typically avoid tourist traps, but when hanger knocks, you must answer.

The shop itself is like old school punk meets 50s bakery...there are glass displays of every doughnut concoction available- including some covered in Froot Loops and Cocoa Puffs...and a decadent pastry covered in crunched up Oreos and peanut butter.

That particular doughnut is called the "Old Dirty Bastard", named after the late great rapper.  I ordered the ODB along with the "Raspberry Romeo", which is similar to a Krispy Kreme jelly donut (glazed on the outside).  

I equalized my blood sugar with the Raspberry Romeo, which was nice...lots of real raspberry jam in the middle, and the donut itself is very moist.  I saved the ODB for the flight back home.

The ODB is one of those things that need to be eaten in two sittings because the Oreos and PB makes the pastry profoundly HEAVY and DENSE!  That said, it was incredibly delicious and filling.  I wish I had gotten a dozen of those.

The service is a bit brusque, but not such that I wouldn't come back.  When I come back to PDX, I'll make a return visit...and yes, on a weekday afternoon, as the lines aren't as crazy then.

Hi, this is Chel and this is a reviw about Voo Doo Donuts in Portland, Oregan. Say VOO DOO. Say VOO DOO. Best donuts i ever tasted! :) Many awsome donuts to choose from! It's worth to eat it after a very long drive! Blasts of fruity flavors and very swwweeett flavors after taking just one bite. I try to savor the whole donut.    I really hope you go to this place. Bye bye for now.

I've been wanting to go to Voodoo doughnuts for many years now after seeing them featured on food network. The hype did not disappoint. These doughnuts were worth the half hour wait, and then some!! My favorite was the Memphis mafia!!

You have to go: all your friends mentioned the maple bacon bar before your trip, or you read about it in Chuck Palahniuk's Portland book, or a trillion positive reviews just can't be wrong, or you're getting a spur-of-the-moment doughnut-themed marriage: you have no choice, so it doesn't matter what I say here.

Two very awesome things about my first visit to voodoo donuts! 1. It was actually "National Donut Day" who knew that existed?! Thanks social media! And 2. The line wasn't that long!!!!! I've read the other reviews about long waits and such, but I stood there for 10minutes. 

Here is a rule of thumb for places like these. You know, the places with long lines and a quick come in and out atmosphere. KNOW WHAT YOU WANT. You're gonna stand in line NO MATTER WHAT. Use that time to look up there awesome donut menu. It's just courteous.

That day we went with a peach fritter, a maple bacon bar, capt crunch, and the staple voodoo donut. Everything was so good! Some of the frosting was a bit too sweet for me, but that's my only real "complaint." The bacon on the maple bacon bar was so crispy! I couldn't get over how good the bacon was. But my favorite had to be the peach fritter. It made me feel "healthier." ;p 

Order allll things donuts! I didn't get to try them all, but I'm sure ill be back one day!

Oh yeah, CASH ONLY.

Great and delicious doughnuts. Different designs and themes on the doughnuts. Quite an experience. There is always a line of customers just waiting to get this awesome doughnuts. Cannot leave Portland without trying them.
So many options and they're all amazing! My personal favorite, ODB, so good! These are hearty doughnuts, just one will fill you up but we tend to get a box so we can share the love with friends :)
Great fun, True Portland, And great donuts!

499 reviews??!  Damn, Voodoo.

A local institution that's [rightly so] received a TON of buzz, I wanted to simply pop in and see what all the fuss was about on my most recent trip up to Portland.  Instead of just gawking at the glorious treats that were on display, my tour guide told me that I had no choice but to get a delicious doughnut if I were to continue to hang out with him that night.

The pressure was on.  My eyes were on the verge of popping out of my head as I stood and stared at all the delectables within the revolving display case.  While I don't eat doughnuts with any sort of regularity, when I DO indulge myself with a fried carb concoction, I'm generally a purist and just adore the taste of French Crullers [though I didn't see any in sight].  Plus, I figured, "...when in Rome, go big or go home" and when it was our turn to order, I decided to get what resembled a maple bar.  To my surprise, when I bit in, it was filled with something white 'n' fluffy 'n' downright tasty!

"What the eff?!!"  You are so delicious, Mr. Cap'N Crunch!  And Oreo Encrusted Delight?  I love you!  Between the two of us, we polished off three doughnuts in a matter of ~85 seconds.  Mmmmm.... I'm a fan.

What's the point of reviewing a place that's been rated by 3,016 Yelpers? I don't know, I just loved these doughnuts. Two steps above anything at Krispy Kreme, three steps above Dunkin's best. These donuts are positively...gourmet? Not to mention playful.

Would recommend: Portland Cream, Oreo (w white cream), Mango Tango. The donuts are big and rich - beware the comedown off the sugar high. 

Go on a weekday afternoon to avoid a double-backed line. Still, it moves quickly. And for anyone complaining about the line - there's a reason the line is this long, people!

It's nuts to wait in line that went out the door, down the street, and around the corner. We walked by several times in hopes that the line would be shorter and it was always the same. We accepted the fact that there is not a slow period and got in line ... it was worth the wait! 

These are awesome doughnuts! We only tried half dozen different doughnuts. Captain My Captain, The Loop, Triple Chocolate Penetration were fun but the cereal was not crisp and crunchy. To die for doughnuts: Double Chocolate, Mexican Chocolate Dutch Cake (a little spicy) and Cinnamon Sugar Doughnut.

Help!  My husband brought back Voodoo donuts from a trip and I can't stop eating them.  I'm in some kind of sugar trance.  I have been taking bites out of Old fashioned maple, old fashioned chocolate, no name, old dirty bastard, dirt doughnut, bacon maple bar and ain't that a peach fritter with an emphasis on the salty and sweet I get out of the bacon maple bar and ain't that a peach fritter combined.  I can't stop.  Maybe I should move there to continue my sugar trance?  Highly recommend.  Awesome goodness!
this 5 star review is for the boston cream - i am afraid to try others for fear i wont leave!

They put oreos, chocolate fudge and ******* caramel on a fresh, soft and god-awfully chewy donut and serve Stumptown coffee from a few doors down. 

This is the donut I want in the post-apocalyptic new world order.

Whenever I mentioned to someone that I was going to Portland I'd hear, "you have to go to Voodoo Doughnuts!" So of course we did the tourist thing and went.

Having recently switched to eating a vegan diet I assumed they would have a couple of boring doughnuts for us to choose from. The people in line even shouted something like "who the hell would order a vegan doughnut?" Um...me. Turns out there are PLENTY of vegan options and they are delicious!

We only had to wait about 15 minutes, which anywhere else would have been bad, but I didn't mind waiting for the experience.

We got five doughnuts for about $10.45. I loved getting the little voodoo doll doughnut. I took it outside and took a photo with it and the sign across the street that says "Keep Portland Weird." Seemed appropriate.

If your visiting Portland definitely stop by. We walked there from our hotel. I would recommend going during the day if possible.

Vegan doughnuts! I must be in heaven. Don't know why anyone would ever bother with butter and eggs when they taste so good without. Top Pot really needs to step up its vegan game, Voodoo Doughnuts is where its at!

Have you ever had a spiritual awakening via a doughnut? A moment so pure, beautiful and redeeming and positively magical that you wanted to jump in place, smack your own ass and yell, "Thank you Lawd Jesus!?!?!" 

No?

Well clearly you need to get your ass to Portland ASAP and partake in a maple BACON doughnut. Yeah, I said it, a maple bar so soft, moist and ready for devouring that's then topped with not one, but TWO strips of BACON. I don't think I've ever experienced anything so incredibly awesome that it seriously rendered me speechless...well except for a slew of, "Oh...oh....my....oh....wow....wow....wow....oh..." utterings.

Bacon doughnuts. 

My life is now complete. 

So life, do with me what you will, because I have seen the light and it's blaring from Voodoo Doughnuts at 2am. Oh to the fother mucking YES!

Doughnut Heaven! YUM... Well worth the wait in line. First time there, I was expecting an overly trendy place with mediocre tasting doughnuts but I was pleasantly surprised when I tasted my first but certainly not last one! We bought 2 dozen to bring back to Cali with us along with a cool sweatshirt for my daughter :)

Good things come in Pink boxes..
ahhh YUM!  waited in line, watch amazing low riders make their cars jump, ordered incredible delights and enjoyed them plenty!
Best Doughnut place you will EVER visit. They have an amazing selection, very creative! So worth the long wait!

I thought I left you behind... years ago when I walked home from school and stopped at Quality Pies to get cheap donuts... I loved you and you abused me... or I abused you.  I can't tell anymore, time has blurred all memories of having a sweet tooth that could never be satisfied and force me to leave the donut world forever.

But now I am back.  I was excited at the time that Krispy Kreme was coming to Portland supposedly bragging the best donuts around... they lost in my book as there is actually a King of Donuts or shall I say a Shamen (Voodoo) of donuts and he has welcomed me back in to the joy of deep-fried food.  I venture into Voodoo Doughnuts with the interest in getting the "Memphis Mafia", the "No Name" and any other imaginative concoction that have displayed in their revolving case, my LA friends can't comprehend the complexity of Voodoo Doughnuts ---  why anyone would add bacon to a maple bar.  I laugh at them and look out on the ever expanding LA freeways that attach donut shop to donut shop and I dream of you...

Oh hell yeah!  This place would be dangerous if I lived in Portland.  Anyone who gives this place less than 5 stars is crazy!  The highly publicized Maple Bacon Bar is insanely delicious.  We also had the Mango Tango which, despite not being a fan of jelly-filled doughnuts, blew me away with the refreshing combination of mango and orange flavors.  The Memphis Mafia Fritter is freakin amazing too (and gigantic!).  Also had a chocolate cake doughnut with chocolate frosting and Coco Puffs on top, which was good too (sometimes cake donuts are too dry, but this was perfect).  Fiftenn minute wait in line at 9:30AM on Saturday, but def worth it for some of the best doughnuts I've had.
The Maple Bar with Bacon was DELISH!  It was soft, warm, sweet and salty -- a perfect combination.  The balance of salty and sweet was perfect.  Definitely going back when I go back to Portland.

Huge selection including lots of vegan options, and great vibe.  Interesting dcor, playful and fun doughnut creations, and somewhat of a cult institution.  

There were long lines at night at times you'd think no one in their right mind would be eating doughnuts, but we found 7 am to have virtually no line, at least on the weekday we went.

The vegan doughnuts we had were all damn good, including the Gay bar, Portland cream, and the Voodoo doll.   And the carnivores reported great satisfaction over the maple bacon bar, so you probably can't go wrong.

The magic is in the hole, baby.  No I'm not sure what the hell that means (and maybe I don't want to know).
Fun place! Total Portland.  A must visit for any out of towner! My kids love all the crazy different donuts.  The maple bacon bar is a must have.

Sent my wife here to bring back a box of yumminess for me...I'd come home with the pink box a couple times and family knocks most of it out. Wife was running an errand in area and agreed to pick up some. She gets out post-it note and takes orders....marshall mathers for kid1, voodoo doll for kid2.....what's that CnB on list? Wife doesn't know until she gets there and asks for a CnB and the guys busts out laughing at her.

I'm not sure where the negative reviews came from, but I found these donuts delicious. Sure its a touristy and gimmicky place and the line is stupid long, but its worth it for the huge range of delicious donuts. The Oreo peanut butter one was delicious and not just the toppings, the dough was great too. The line and cash only was a bit of a pain but worth it. Great stop in Portland.

24hr donut shop in Portland...pure awesomeness. 

3 words. Maple. Bacon. Bar. 
Get it. You won't be disappointed. 
Think about how good it tastes when your maple syrup gets on your bacon when eating breakfast. Its the best salty n sweet flavor combination ever ! 

Stopped in at 2am and this place was poppin ! 
Too bad they were all out of tshirts. 
Metallica was playing and folks were lined up for donut bliss. 

The raspberry filled powdered sugar donut is also good and the oreo donut wont disappoint either. 

A must do hot spot in Portland. Keep Portland Weird !

Today was my first time having a Voodoo Doughnut. I thought it wasn't going to be a big deal. I've eaten donuts before ;), but these are unparalleled. I had a cinnamon and sugar doughnut and a glazed. My husband really liked his maple bar, and my Grandma said her apple fritter was perfect. Yummy, yummy.

I went to Portland for about 5 days and the amount of donuts I ate in that short amount of time far surpasses how many I've eaten in the past year. And I don't even particularly care for donuts. They were really that good. There was always a bit of a line whenever I went, but it's well worth the wait. Try the bacon maple bar and the voodoo doll if you really think you can eat just one or two.

Love the place. Donuts are amazing!
 workers are a blast! We go in at 2 am or noon and the donuts are fresh and tasty. Great variety and people seem to come together when they're there. Portland staple for sure! Visit!

These are the cutest donuts I've ever seen. Most places have your typical round glazed plain looking donut. Well not voodoo, aside from the fact that they are adorable to look at and the names given to each are just hilarious, they taste soft and pillow-like. It's not overbearingly sweet and they don't leave that nasty donut after taste that many places have. The one thing I wish they'd fix is the wait, the long line will feel more like you're at Disneyland than at an actual donut shop, but the interior is weird enough to earn the right to the name Voodoo. I nearly ran after a pink truck that had the Voodoo logo on it, and people...I don't run .

Two of my favorite things in the world, a maple bar and bacon. This was by far the best donut I have consumed in my life. The bread was nice and thick, the icing was gooey and the bacon was just delish. Standing there eating it outside in the sund caused the frosting to melt making this the most gooey donut I have ever consumed. The best!

This is obviously a must visit when in Portland! I'll admit that I am not a fan of doughnuts... usually when people bring that iconic pink box into the office I stay away. But when in Portland, do as the Portlanders! We got the iconic voodoo and Oreo peanut butter.
