The filling in the voodoo was so good- tasted like real raspberry compote and not some fake brand name jam.
Iconic doughnut shop. Waited in a long line for more than 30 minutes but worth trying

The Inn and Spa at Parkside has great new owners.  So now it's perfect.  Wonderful old building, interesting art, super comfy bed, delicious breakfast, great location and friendly folks to take care of your every need.

There was a gorgeous flowering tree in bloom outside our window on top of that.

Absolutely nothing to complain about....

My husband and I saw the lines... we didn't care to wait there for hours when we only had 72hrs in Portland so we passed by there a few different times of day and I'm sorry to say there was always a line... Always.

The place is 24hrs so that's kinda amazing that there's always a line but that also means the product is always fresh which I looooove.

I let dear husband sleep in and went alone Sunday morning to check out the portland rock n roll race as well as exercise my patience in line for our highly anticipated voodoo breakfast.

The line was zigged & zagged 2-3x over - probably 30 people in front of me, but it went pretty quickly since the order process is really not too complicated. 

The best part about the line was when the side door to the kitchen bust open and out came a voodoo-crazed cook with a banana/chocolate/peanut butter concoction - a one off - just an experiment they wanted some feedback on. Obviously I love free, I love sweets and I loooove giving my feedback so I was all over that!

So nice of them to know the lines annoying but show their gratefulness for your presence by handing out free creations!

Once I was full from that hot deliciousness, I ordered a voodoo man (the hubs looooves jelly-filled) and the Oreo cookie topped one - I forget what it's called but it was magical. 

They know what they're doing and they deserve the hype!

Its allllll about the Portland Creme if you like custard donuts. 
Thick chocolatey frosting and a delicious smooth vanilla cream/custard filling....SO GOOD! In my opinion, their custard donut trumps that of Blue Star. Also tried the captain crunch, apple fritter, oreo, and blueberry cake donut, but my favorite was the Portland Creme....Ate it too fast to even take a picture of it!
Delicious! Came here thinking the donuts would just be pretty but they were also damn good. there can be a bit of a line but it moves quickly. Cash only if i recall correctly.

Amazing!!! Cant say one thing bad about this place.  Coco Puffs, Bacon, captain crunch, and oreos ..all on doughnuts how can you go wrong. My favorite is the Memphis Mafia peanut butter banana choclate all fried goodness. My 2nd favorite is the old dirtys bastard a doughnut with a peanut butter frosting dipped in oreos! If our passign through you have to stop here....and maybe get married!
Crazy delicious. Its just that there is always a line around the block... except in the middle of the night. That's probably the best time to go. But wow its good.

Wonderful waited 45 min in line worth every minute. They were the lightest tender dough ever have we eaten in donut. The toppings were all great loved Homer Simpson and chocolate with Oreo and peanut butter. Captain Crunch was also great.  Wish they had one in our city.

all I have to say is YUMMO, but unsure what is my favorite, the grape ape or the bacon maple bar!! 
The only issue is that you have to eat the yeast dougnuts with in 24 hrs or they get really stale very fast! but the cake one last for days.

Do I even have to wright about why this place is awesome?????? If you're in Portland and for some crazy reason haven't been to voodoo yet, stop being a bozo and go right now! I'm serious, get up and go!!

No wait. Soft fresh donuts even at 10pm on a weekday and I ate blue star and did not like 
Voodoo is way better

After standing in line for 45 minutes, I was hopeful that the doughnuts would live up to the hype... and they did. So much so in fact that I have been telling all my friends about them (this is rare as I'm not the biggest doughnut fan).
Makes me wish I didn't live so far away although for my waist line perhaps that is a blessing. They are fantastic as a treat but I couldn't eat them on a regular basis.
Oh and the building is painted in glitter... how cool is that?

FROM MN NICE TO PORTLANDIA NICE!! I love it! I thought what is this BIG hype bout doughnuts..boy did I get a little concoction of I LOVE VOODOO DOUGHNUT! I was VERY LUCKY to not have to wait in line..no wait and service was SUPERB! I enjoyed every bite of my Mexican HOT chocolate and it was HOT!  I loved it so much I also bought a t-shirt to sport it in MN! 
- CASH ONLY, but does have a ATM inside...didn't mind it too much because the doughnuts were under $2 so it was pretty AWESOME!
Maple Bacon is the best doughnut I've ever tasted. Naughty and delicious. Worth the wait.
If you dont mind waiting in line for a hour its a great place to go.

The perfect  doughnuts  
Whenever I'm visiting Portland must get my to go voodoo doughnuts. The long line waiting is worth it for sure. Will definitely be back soon. Love from Seattle.
My daughters and I love to get VD together and I've taken many friends visiting from out of town to get VD too! Always a deliciously good time! xoxoox

Checked out the place after seeing it on Tv and it was way cool, the food was good, not a doughnut lover but they do taste fresh.  I was in Portland on vacation and this is for sure a place that I enjoyed.

Be warned they do not take credit cards but Voodoo Doughnuts is like a religious experience. Muslims go to Mecca, Catholics go to Vatican, Christians go to Jerusalem, Mormons Salt Lake, and all the cool kids go to Voodoo Doughnuts. When I first arrived in Portland I saw a line of people down the street and around the block. I later found out it was for voodoo doughnuts, the same place I was told was a "must-see" in Portland. I arrived around midnight. There was a line of about 60 people. I was like no way, any doughnut is this good. So I could say I did it I waited in line. It was a blast. The decoration inside were artsy and weird just like my beloved Portland. They had insane doughnuts every size, shape and flavor. They even had a monster doughnut as big as the head of the guy waiting on us. You have to try it. But we warned they do not take credit cards.
Thanks goodness the lines are so long, or I would probable live on these donuts. Man they are so good!!!!

Having a pink box gets a girl a lot of attention!

As do Voodoo Doughnuts innuendos.  And they are very well marketed; the magic, IS indeed in the hole.

My top 3 favorites are: 
Maple Bacon Bar- those flavors go so perfectly together.
Gay Bar-  There are fruit loops on this donut. 
Grape Ape- lavender and grape!  Oh yes yes.  I love these flavors together too. 

The best thing about these donuts is the fact that they are always FRESH.  The dough practically melts in my mouth.  

Today it was raining and there was absolutely no line.  Usually I can see it from a mile away.  I call it the VDL: Visible Doughnut Line.   But today- none.  I had reached Mecca.  Through the wind and the rain.  Donning a broken umbrella.  And it was worth it, every step of he way. 

Best conversation from strangers: 
Homeless Man: "You have a pink box." Me: "I am well aware." Homeless man: "You have some sugar on your chin." Me: "I was unaware, but I think I'll just keep it there. Thanks, though." Homeless Man: "Have a great day."

Second best conversation- Lady on hotel elevator: "Oh my! Voodoo donuts! I hear all about those on the food network! Is it worth the walk? How far is it? How many donuts are in that box? Do you work for the airlines?" Me: "Yes, .7 miles according to my phone, 13, yes."

Needless to say, I love this place.  It sends me to Donut Nirvana.  

PS-  How do you spell doughnut/donut?

Nobody does doughnuts like VooDoo. Since they are so cool, I magically assumed they didn't have hydrogenates in their doughnuts. I was out with med student one night who was adamant about not putting any free radicals in her body. I said, "nah get a vegan one, you'll be fine". I was wrong. She asked - yep, they've got hydrogenated oils.  I'm not a doughnut scientist, so I'm not clear if there is a way to make a doughnut without hydrogenates. But it's VooDoo's hex on me  that makes me willing to risk cancer every now and then for one of these delicious treats.

Donuts were as good as I expected them to be.  Please remember CASH ONLY here folks.  Don't be caught off guard like I did.

Anyways, the donuts were surprisingly not as sweet as I thought it would be.  From the toppings, it should have been overly sweet (like krispy kreme) but it wasn't.  Very nice texture.

BTW, saw tourists taking pictures with their donuts in front of the door.  When you have a following like that, enough said.

Highly recommend if you are in town.

Their donuts are pretty sweet, but amazingly delicious.  If you are visiting Portland, stop by and check it out at night some time.  It's right in the heart of a "bar area," so it's great to satisfy some late night drunken hunger pains.  Not to mention all the great shape and sizes :)....... where else can you get a penis shaped donut?  That ACTUALLY tastes good...haha.....This place is definitely a Portland classic, and I hope it stays around for a long time.

One of the most beautiful things about Portland is Voodoo Doughnuts.

I am not in or from Portland, so I knew I had to buy a dozen to take home on my last visit. I only tried 12 of the doughnuts... so check their website for more variety/the cream filled ones (since those don't tickle my fancy).

The Voodoo Doll : This guy is a chocolate covered glazed raspberry jelly doughnut, with a pretzel rod jammed into it. This one was pretty tasty. It was a little much having it both glazed and covered in chocolate, somewhat of a sugar overload, but the raspberry jelly was so good. Now I wouldn't leave the pretzel in for too long... after my long plane ride home the pretzel had gotten soggy and weird. This one was one of my top picks. I think it was partially because of the jelly. That stuff tasted like real raspberry jam.

Maple Bacon Bar: You know that saying "don't judge a book by its cover"?... the same applies to this doughnut. You cannot judge it until you try it (unless you are thinking, DAMN that looks good). This one was by far my favorite. It was like a hearty breakfast of pancakes with maple syrup and bacon. Bacon makes everything better. The doughnut was deliciously perfect, the maple frosting was not tooo sugary, but just enough mapley-ness, and the bacon was not greasy at all so its saltiness complimented the sugar quite nicely. My mate denied trying this until my begging/nagging/high pitched squeals of persistence annoyed him enough to try it. As much as he wanted to hate it... he loved it. The rest of the tasting gang truly enjoyed it too, even though some were hesitant at first. BOOM. so take it from me and just trust the bacon.

Dirt: This little munchkin is a regular doughnut with vanilla icing and Oreo cookies crumbled on top. They made sure not to skimp on the Oreos, which was nice. Dirt was pretty tasty. This one topped the hubby's list of favorites. It was simple, yet fun enough that your mouth had a good time eating it.  Having a glass of milk nearby also helps. Overall I would recommend this one for future guests.

Old Dirty Bastard (pardon my french): This fun concoction is comprised of: a doughnut, chocolate frosting, Oreo crumbles, and peanut butter. This was a richer version of the Dirt doughnut. It was tasty. Nothing I would exclaim about, but definitely worth a try. The peanut butter was a fun addition.

Butterfingerling: I really liked this one. I think it has something to do with the fact that I liked Butterfingers... but who knows. This doughnut was one of the smaller more condensed versions of the regular (instead of those big fluffy airy ones), with vanilla frosting and crushed Butterfingers. YUM. This wasn't overbearing in the least, and small enough that you don't feel too guilty combining 2 desserty things into one.

No Name: Regular doughnut, chocolate frosting, rice krispies, and peanut butter. Unfortunately I found the cereal to be stale. :/ It was a bit of a disappointment since I was really looking forward to a nice subtle crunch to compliment  the soft doughnut. The flavors weren't out of control, but if the rice krispies were crunchy... it would have been a whole lot better.

Diablos Rex: a little condensed chocolate doughnut, with chocolate frosting, a vanilla star design, chocolate chips, and red sprinkles! I love sprinkles. They make everything better... just like bacon. The chocolate chips were a super fun addition. I would give this one a go if you are into the whole chocolate thing.

Triple Chocolate Penetration: You would think with a name like Triple Chocolate Penetration that it would be a mouthful of chocolatey goodness. Nope. Although the doughnut itself was chocolate, with chocolate frosting, and coco-puffs, the coco-puffs were stale, and ruined the whole experience. I think Voodoo has to buy this cereal stuff in bulk, so more often than not their cereal infused creations will be stale. Heartbreaking. Crunchy chocolatey coco-puffs on even more chocolate sound like a dream.

Captain my Captain: This vanilla frosted, Captain Crunch encrusted doughnut would be a hit... but the cereal was (all together now...) stale. :/ so this was more of a bummer to try than anything. If you are a huge fan of the cereal though, I would just keep ordering it until you get non-stale encrustments. It looks pretty delicious otherwise.

The Loop: The Loop was the same as the Captain doughnut... except with stale Fruit Loops. If only I had known!! I would have saved myself the agony of trying all these tasty sounding doughnuts only to be sad I spent 2 bucks on each :( 

Marshall Matters: The eloquently named M&M covered doughnut was a hit! I love M&M's and since those cannot get stale, I enjoyed eating it very much. It was a simple doughnut with vanilla frosting, but it tasted and looked good! If you like M&M's then this one is definitely worth trying.

Raspberry Romeo: a powdered sugar, raspberry jelly filled doughnut. IT IS DIVINE. Anything with that raspberry jelly is worth it.

MmMmMmmm donuts....
My mouth is salivating just thinking about VD.
I had a chocolate, voodoo doll, and old dirty bastard. The ODB was the best.
Next time I am going to get some of the underwear they sell and wear it while eating my donut it'll be totally sexy.

Maple Bacon bar. One of the best doughnuts I've ever eaten.
Leftovers even taste good the day after too.
One of a kind.  Learn Swahili, get married and try the infamous cock n balls (it's a donut people), all after midnight.  This funky, tiny shop personifies portland.
Cash only. Line was very long...but donuts with fruit loops. That is all.

I visited this place twice in one day.  The first time I visited was around noon and there was a long line around the corner.  Not worth the wait as I wanted to explore more of Portland.  Came back again around 11pm, no line this time.  For two people we ended up getting the No Name, Old Dirty Bastard, a regular glazed doughnut, and the maple bacon bar (my favorite!!!).  Of course, we didn't eat it in one sitting though ;)

Always Good! The people I've met in line have been pretty amazing... We've even gotten Free doughnuts from a person in front of us paying it forward. So we did the same! GrapeApe is our family favorite!

get the "dirty old bastard", you won't regret it!:) I tried the maple syrup bacon donut that Anthony Bourdain went crazy over, and I can't say i iked it. It was way too sweet. maybe if they made a "bacon and eggs" donut w/ a salty flair I'd like it! how bout that voodoo??

Waited in line for 20 minutes to get an apple fritter and a maple bacon bar.  They were both delicious, and I thought it was worth the wait considering it was my only morning in Portland this year.  If you have a morning in Portland and want an apple fritter I would totally recommend getting it from Voodoo.

This place gets a ton of hype. Maybe one of the most widely known eateries and certainly the most widely known donut shop in Portland, when my roommate and I took to trip to the city, we knew we had to stop there. 

We shared one donut, sorry just weren't that hungry but it was great. The interior of voodoo is worth checking out regardless because it's so loudly decorated on the inside and is just fun to see! It's also in a great little area that's near a massive farmer's market on the weekends so you can also check that out while you're in the area!!

This place is just too fun! There are so many assortments of flavors and they all look so yummy! Definitely love love love the bacon maple bar, it's a must-try. You can't have a maple bar after and not wish there was a piece of bacon on top. The doughnuts are still good the next day if heated up, except the cereal-topping ones (the cereal gets stale). 

Only disclaimer is the likelihood of waiting in line for 15ish minutes, but welllllll worth it!

When Anthony Bourdain says you should try something, I'll go for it. 

Three words: Maple Bacon Doughnut. Yes, I said maple bacon. This sounds gross, but I've got to tell you that it was quite amazing.  The saltiness of the bacon brought out the sweetness of the maple. Yeah, Bourdain got this one right. 

Another thing he got right was the fact that these are highly addictive. I went back the next day for another. It was a staple of my diet the short time I was in Portland.

There's not much to say about Voodoo Doughnut that hasn't already been said. Awesome doughnuts (my favorite is the Portland Cream), good coffee, friendly staff. The only downsides are the long lines (I refuse to wait 20 mins for doughnut and a cup of coffee) and the fact that there is nowhere to sit indoors.

If you're from out of town this is pretty much a "classic Portland" venue that needs to be checked out. Wait in line, grab a pink box and a Stumptown coffee, and walk outside to the park benches to enjoy it.

I mean of course it's amazing...its VOODOO DOUGHNUTS!!!!! Yes wait in line, it is worth it!! Quite possibly the best DOUGNUTS on earth...hence the long line....ALL THE TIME!!! Not only are the donuts amazing, but the quirky atmosphere makes it an experience worth waiting in the rain for!!

I went in thinking these donuts were just all hype, but they were deeelish!   I got a glazed donut with white frosting and crumbles of Oreos, it was very sweet and tasty.   This was our first time in Portland, so we just had to visit.  We were lucky enough to get a parking spot in front of the store and there was no line (it was around noon on a weekday).  What a great little tourist spot.  And those pink boxes are just perfect!
Went here on a Wednesday night around 10 pm and there was no line. I had the Portland Cream doughnut and it was delicious! Light and fluffy and really fresh.

Came here as a tourist from Washington and my relatives raved about this place. The first time we went, the line was about an hour wait, but we came back maybe 2 hours later like 7pmish and the line shrunk. The line was still existent but extended within the store. I can't be harsh on the customer service, especially serving all those customers must be tedious. Now for the important stuff, the donuts. The donuts were delightful. They offer a wide range of donuts from small to big, vegan to meat (bacon), plain to creative. Get the voodoo dozen and they'll serve you a random eclectic dozen of donuts. Along with its unique history, this had by far been the best donuts I've EVER had.

PS-Called them and they said they're 24/7

I walked into the line thinking I'd just get a donut and keep moving. By the time I got to the front, I couldn't help but get two, as well as a sticker for the road.

Brave the line - it's worth it!
Excellent doughnuts...   Even when there is a line outside waiting.. it moves pretty fast.  ENJOY

Donuts were soo good. 

Must try:
-Maple Bacon
- Oreo crumbled with chocolate and peanut butter.
-M&M covered donut
Keep Portland Weird! Only complaint...LONG LINE.  I usually keep driving, but when I do brave the line, it's always worth it.  Love the vegan choices.  Cash Only, FYI, but they have an ATM.
There's a ton of hype, but with the relatively cheap prices and unique flavors it's worth a visit! The line moves very fast! I recommend the Old Dirty Bastard.

O. M. G. 

I went into this place with an already well-developed LOVE for doughnuts. When I heard there was a doughnut place that was on the food network and supposedly exceptional RIGHT UP THE ROAD from where I was, there was no stopping me. 

The doughnuts are Freakin delicious! Mmmmm. So bomb. 

They get an extra star for creativity, with doughnuts such as bubble gum, captain crunch, the Gay bar, and even Cock and Balls (although I more than likely would never order it) I thought it was funny.  We got a "Voo doo Dozen," which consists of the counter guy randomly picking different doughnuts for you.  With all the choices, that made life much easier, because I thought I'd never decide. :)

The actual inside wasn't much to speak of. It is a tiny little hole in the wall. They only accept cash, but have an ATM inside. Next time I go to Portland, I for sure will go back for more doughnuts!! I love it when a place lives up to it's reputation.
Fun, quirky place. The lines are usually long but they are work it and quick moving. The doughnuts taste amazing and fresh.

Totally worth the hype, 150%.  I am a donut fanatic, and these were the best I've ever had.  We got the best-seller dozen, which had yeast and cake, filled and unfilled, jelly and cream, and everything in between.  All of the ones with maple icing were BOSS.  I also really liked the cake donuts - they were the perfect texture, and the icings and crazy toppings were right on point.  Even though we understood that the shelf life was pretty short, we kept some of them around till the next morning (hey, even four of us couldn't polish off 12 Voodoo Donuts in one sitting), and they were still really good.  Should have brought some on the airplane...would have helped with the delayed flights and 7+ hour layover...

A doughnut topped with bacon? A doughnut Cock 'n Balls? It's all here. Unfortunately I haven't had the chance to eat them there in person.

I visited Portland one July 4th weekend a couple years back. Our doorman at the Benson Hotel suggested we visit Voodoo Doughnut, and we stopped by two different times to find them closed (I think it was a combination of going there after midnight and going on a holiday). It wasn't until I got back home that I discovered how awesome they are, and the cult of Voodoo Doughnut. How can you not love a place that offers wedding packages that includes coffee and doughnuts for 10?

Recently some friends of mine returned from Portland with a dozen Voodoo doughnuts that they were nice enough to share with me. These were some of the most bizarre doughnut concoctions I'd ever seen. Among others there were: 
Glazed Cap'n Crunch
Cocoa Puffs on a Chocolate Doughnut
Chocolate Rice Krispies and Peanut Butter

Also available:
Their famous Cock 'n Balls
One that's topped with bacon 
Voodoo doll shaped doughnut with a strategically placed pretzel stick

I LOVE DOUGHNUTS! And this place is fun! It's so hard to choose a favorite. I really like one with the chocolate, peanut butter and rice crispies! Go in earlier on a weekday to avoid super long lines.
Oregon is an amazing and beautiful state full of crazy-yet-fun folks. Whenever I'm in Portland for business, I make it a point to visit Powell's and Voodoo doughnuts.
Great Place. Funky and cool and great doughnuts!  What more could you ask? As portland as it gets.

I don't even like donuts, but I gotta hand it to Voodoo--they know how to make a damn good donut!  The Kruellers (sp?) are legit.  We go here when we are in portland and feel a fried dough and frosting craving.

Decadent. 1st day we dropped in about 4pm  with a 0 minute wait. Service was helpful as we explained this was our first visit. You feel a sense of over-stimulation of sugar just breathing. How do you decide which donuts to buy? 

I went for the stuffed donuts with Marionberry jam that melts in your mouth. Luscious. I don't think I uttered a word until I finished

Upon some coaxing of Dads wallet and donut suggestions from the cool donut guy kids succeeded in buying a pink voodoo box of 6.

Kids went for the voodoo stuffed with chocolate and other assorted donuts and $25.00 Tshirts. 

We returned 3 days in a row because it was the best donuts we had. Seriously look at the donut display case!!
Just one word - legendary! A must-visit. You probably haven't experienced anything like this before!
It's a must visit! The staff was really friendly and helpful. Donuts were super cool and creative!

Line up looked long but we passed through in about ten minutes. Cash only. We got the hibiscus , grape , pb and j, Memphis mud, maple bacon and the maple blunt. The dough was really good, the icing flavourful and I felt like even though the doughnuts looked gimmicky, they were delicious.

Surprisingly tasty doughnut for apparently being more about the design than quality. I got the classic voodoo shaped doughnut man with jelly inside and had no complaints! The line wasn't bad at all, and the shop was unique and interesting to look at the different toppings! Would go only once to see the hype, but would go to a quality shop after that if I had any cravings!
Some of the best donuts I've ever had. So many unique types and flavors. Can't wait to try more soon!

Found easy parking on a Friday morning right in front, and experience was great except for the rude guy who parked next to us and practically ran down my daughter to get in the shop first. We did basic donuts: chocolate with chocolate icing, maple bar, and a plain glazed, and they were absolutely fresh and delicious. The pink bakery box, even for 3 donuts, was gorgeous. I'm craving them already and I'm not a donut freak. Definitely one of the best donuts I've ever tasted, but recommend eating them fresh, not hours later as they loose the freshness by then.

I see another poster was upset by the neighborhood in Chinatown. Yes there are homeless people, but it wasn't shady.
The donuts were so good. We had the maple bacon and the Portland cream. Be prepared to wait in line though which at times can wrap around the building. Lots of homeless around so be careful...
Amazing place lots of fun! The doughnuts were excellent and really large. Like nothing we ever had before.

Today in church... (yes...this IS a review about Voodoo Doughnut)...

As I was saying - today in church we introduced a new pastor. He and his wife just moved up from Pasadena, and when asked about what they loved best about Portland thus far, they mentioned:

#1 Running Trails
#2 Voodoo Doughnut...with a sly grin.  

I'm not sure whether I'm more in love with the awesomeness of VD or my church at the current moment, but I do know that he divinity of Voodoo has been reestablished in my mind. And may the deliciousness of their doughnut-concoctions soon grace you as well. 

Amen.

I'm a tourist. 
I like doughnuts. 
I go to voodoo in SW. 
much satisfied. 
Voodoo doll + cock n balls. 
No better combo. 

Nice people 2.
Solid donuts at a cheap price. Can't beat it. There was no line when I was there, but there are guardrails for pretty long lines. The ODB donut lives up to the hype.

New location not nearly as freakishly cool as the old, but still a one of a kind joint!

Lots of strange, however tasty, treats in here. Try the McMinville Cream and you will never want a plain maple bar again!

I just had to come here because I've heard about it forever and needed to see for myself! I'm not a huge donut fan but figured this would be one of those occasions I eat a donut.  We arrived around 9am on Saturday morning and the line was out the door but not too long.  We waited and were in and out in about 30 minutes.  I ordered the voodoo doll and my boyfriend had the maple bacon donut.  He said it was really good and the bites I took of the voodoo doll were pretty delicious as well.  I would come back again and try another kind if I'm ever in town or at another location!
yum. this place definitely lives up to the hype. love the no name and the captain crunch donut. the wait is worth it... most of the time.

When I found out my family and I were going to be flying into Portland I told them we had to go to Voodoo Donuts after hearing so much about them.  Once we found them there was already a line and we heard one person say the line was about 45 minutes currently.  Well we decided to stick it out since it was probably going to be the only time we would be able to come here.  It did end up being about an hour wait and the line never got shorter behind us either.  We bought almost 2 dozen donuts to take on our vacation. One dozen was chosen by the employee and the other by ourselves.  All that I personally ate of them were very good.  Very fresh and creative.  And most are huge donuts which turned out to be great for sharing so everyone could try the huge variety they sell.  Definitely recommend if you don't mind waiting in line!
Best doughnuts in town! If your visiting Portland I would definitely recommend going to this place!!
i was visiting portland before we move there and the donuts were delicious and the staff was very friendly.  i would absolutely go back again.

I hate donuts to the max but really who makes all these awesomely weird concotiions!? That I love so much! I wish we had one in Hawaii! So I had the oreo donut. I love oreos so I thought why not. It was very rich and over powering but very good for a late night bite if you wanna become chubs like me! Also I just had the voodoo doll cuz I love chocolate and there was blood in it! :D or aka raspberry jelly. That was to die for. and it was cute cuz it had a pretzel like it was being stabbed in the heart haha. Location was super shadey cuz it was next to an adult cinema.  Which I didn't like because you know if your with your bf or husband you don't know what they are thinking while waiting in line.
We picked up from a food cart. Every choice looked very delicious. We chose a few doughnuts and were definitely pleased as far as a doughnut goes.

Portland cream was a standard Boston cream-- just much more sweet.    Walked across town to see what hype is about.... pretty standard doughnut, just standout toppings and marketing.   Glad I stopped though! Coffee not too shabby-- beats Starbucks .  Cash only... ATM is available if you need though !

Sometimes the hype is justified. This location has a ton of hype and notoriety through the Food Network. Had to give it a try. After a 30 min wait out in the cold and a 5 min inside decision making wait inside, we got our donuts. A maple bacon bar and a glazed old fashioned. Over all not a bad donut at all. Great flavor and feel. The price is high, due to hype, but it's a fun novel thing to stop and try.

Best doughnuts I have ever had in my life, bar none.  Must get the voodoo doll!!  What do they put in that chocolate?  YUM!  We also ordered the ODB and the maple with Bavarian cream.  Great choices all around.  Wish we had one in LA!

the donuts were absolutely delicious. I got the Maple bacon bar. The salty bacon mixed with the sweet maple --- DELICIOUS. My friend got a vegan cock n balls. Chocolate frosting, chocolatey and creamy. The vegan donut dough was really good. If I wasn't with him, I wouldn't have known it was vegan. In the top five of my favorite donut shops.

I get to travel often to the northwest for work.  This is a go to place for me and any other colleague from our portland office.  The long lines can really suck if your not used to the weather, or if your in a rush... but during the downtime it is sweet heaven.  You have to try the maple bacon bars... that's my favorite!

I heard Voodoo was too touristy but we went and there's a reason why it's so good- there are so many donuts to choose from that are extremely fun and memorable. They also all taste freaking good. The atmosphere was enjoyable and our cashier was awesome. Overall, going back again tonight to get another load of donuts! 
Go here for your donuts in Portland - you won't forget this honest, pure, amazing donut consuming experience.

So is this the only reason to visit Portland?  (besides camping).  I'd say YES.

So is waiting in a 30 min line worth it?  I'd say Indeed!

The line is long, but there is lots of entertainment.
 - Casual convo with strangers
 - Balloon animal man
 - Trying to not make eye contact with "campers" out front.

Maple Bacon Bar - Jackpot.  Not as melty in your mouth as I was hoping, but no joke, mad good!
Amazing selections of doughnuts...hope you have a sweet tooth and maybe a glass of milk.  Lines are long but as a tourist, it was worth the wait.
A Portland original you just have to experience for yourself. So go fill your doughnut hole!
Damn!  I wish I could order something other than the bacon maple bar, although I have split a cock and balls before.  Damn!

My four friends and I split 2 dozen of everything you could think of in this crazy place. We had the craziest doughnuts on earth for munchies all weekend. theres nothing better at 3 in the morning with your head in a daze! I heard so much about it from TV and friends in Portland it was awesome to finally experience it. The maple bacon lives up to the hype! This place is insane! Who wouldn't give it 5 stars?

I admit, I don't even like donuts, but this place is like divine intervention for me.  They're especially tantalizing late at night, when it seems there exists a veritable magnetic energy to the place.  Like most patrons, I'm usually drunk when I go, trying desperately to find a wadded fiver in my jeans or begging my hubby or friends for cash.  I've heard people say this place is "sketchy" and whatnot because of its location, but I feel right at home, even with the homeless people outside.  Shoot, I'll buy 'em a doughnut, if I have enough cash.  My favorite doughnut is the classic Voodoo:  a human-shaped,  chocolate-glazed monster with raspberry jelly filling...they even stick in a pretzel for jabbing "blood" from my victim.  Makes me giggle every time!  Also the maple bar with bacon...mmmm.  

I saw an episode of Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations" where he visited Voodoo.  He seemed emphatically impressed, although he went first thing in the morning, which is not ideal, in my opinion.  I doubt he's ever had a better doughnut, though.

I went here on Sunday, and even though the line was out the door and around the corner, we held out for some doughnuts.

We decided to order the Voodoo dozen for $10.50, where the cashier gets to choose a dozen doughnuts for you based on their preference. When we ordered it, the girl gave us a devilish grin and asked "my choice?" and looked like she was packing the box of doughnuts on fast forward, glancing up to give us a couple more evil smiles. Once we got the doughnuts, we had a variety of everything and all the doughnuts were so soft and fresh and delicious. My favorite was definitely the orange tang powdered one.

The Voodoo dozen is my favorite thing to do here because they have so many weird doughnuts and it's just fun to try them all and try ones you probably wouldn't have chose on your own.

Love love love!
Friendly staff, great, creative, fresh donuts-
Love the vibe. So fun. 
Always a fantastic experience. 
Long lines, because awesome. 
Only take cash.

I put a spell on you
And now they're mine.
You can't stop the things I eat.
I ain't lyyyyyin'.

Ohhh.... It's been 300 minutes
Since my last Voodoo Dougnut
Now I am back!
And need more cash to pay.

I waited in line for you....
And now they're miiiiiine!

Hello, Portalnd! My name's Bryan, what's yours?

Man don't you just love Bette Milder. But seriously, you have to go here. So many great combinations, variations, and Voodoo experiments gone awry, you will forking over that cold hard cash for doughnuts all day long (and might I suggest saving some time and going for a box of them). It's cash only (my Credit Card is sighing in relief), so be sure to bring $10 or more, cause when you wait 40 minutes in line, you better believe your gonna by more than just one doughnut.

If you get there and the line is doubled around to about where the door/sign is, you have about a 30 minute wait.  But it was worth it for the whole experience of getting one of those highly anticipated pink boxes filled with donuts. 

First, this is a CASH only establishment.  I was pleasantly surprised by the prices.  I assumed it would be outrageous but the prices were pretty reasonable.  The "classic" donuts were only about a dollar.  The super fancy ones were about $3.00, but were much bigger and fancier than what you would get at one of those typical gourmet cupcake places.

I had tried the creamed filled chocolate donut.  The cream was rich and smooth, but not too sweet.  The cake batter is light and fluffy yet the exterior of the donut has a bit of a toastiness to it.  I was so full after eating my donut, that I will have to try the rest tomorrow morning.

What can I say about the Portland landmark. When you walk around the city on a Saturday morning and see people with those pink boxes, you know where they came from. Voodoo Doughnut! 

Amazing doughnuts and great tastes. Who would ever think of a maple bacon doughnut? It's their must try. People who visit this city must make one stop here to at least try one of their many different creations.

I always pick up doughnuts for everyone I visit during work trips and then I bring some home after for locals.  It is interesting to see all of the pink take out boxes in the airport.  They will allow you to take these through security, something most airports won't allow.  

I brought these back to a stone brewing event in San Jose and I easily could have taken $5 a pop but I kept them all for my crew!  I am not sellout.
The vibe and atmosphere is unreal! The donuts are by far the best I've ever had! Will be back for sure!
The funkiest donut shop you have ever seen.  Strange donuts with odd ingredients... definitely worth a visit.
Great vegan options! We got the vegan Oreo one and the vegan cream filled. They were on point! I was sad that they didn't have the chocolate one but its okay!

I was up in Portland on business and had dinner with an old college buddy I hadn't seen in year. He had relocated to the area with his wide and kids.

After dinner as he was dropping me off at the hotel, he asked if I wanted to try a dooghnut. I thoug, OK, fine, a doughnut. I hadn't heard of Voodoo at all and when he explained it to me, my eyes lit up. I was already full from dinner but, let's try it.

I got the Voodoo doll. Chocolate covered with raspberry filling and a pretzel stake through the heart. All I can say is, awesome. When I head back to Portland, it's going to be the bacon maple bar next. This place rocks!

I don't know how many people come here because it's the best doughnut they ever had.

You come here for the EXPERIENCE. 
Where else can you get married and then celebrate by eating an anatomically correct cock-n-balls doughnut?

Even though it's open 24-7, I would recommend coming late on a Friday or Saturday if you'd like to electrify the night. There will for sure be a long line but people-watching is such an attraction at a place like Voodoo! While I was in line, the guy in back of me sang Whodini's, 'Freaks Come Out at Night'.

Willy Wonka would give Voodoo an A+ for creativity for their doughnuts, location, ambiance and staff. See for yourself.
Old dirty bastard is the best doughnut out there. Portland Crete is good. Mango tango for a twist

Sure the donuts are gimmicky, but they're good!  I'm glad I waited in line.  

Voodoo Doughnut just proved the theorem that bacon is good on anything.

It's hard not to find something you like about this place. Too bad they don't have their medicine donuts anymore. If you like bacon, oreos, cereal, or pretzels on your donuts, you'll love this place. They have everyday classics as well.

I love Voodoo Doughnuts. I must confess, while they are not the best doughnuts I've had, they are the most fun (and hey, they still taste very good). Whether you are getting something traditional or smothered in cereal or cookies, or even a doughnut baked into a profane shape, if you have a sense of fun you will have a blast at Voodoo Doughnuts. A lot of love goes into the presentation and the atmosphere, giving this shop a weighty sense of character. And if you're vegan, you will have PLENTY of options, which is more than I can say for most bakeries. The wait at this location is long, and it is worth it.

It's everything you expect! Delicious donuts, long line (it moves really fast, don't be discouraged), and it's so cheap! It's cash only, the ATM is in the lobby but charges you $3 to use it. Worth the wait! They even accidentally grabbed the wrong donut so I got one for free! The Bitterfingering, Old Dirty bastard, and Voodoo Doll can do you no wrong! I'd recommend at least making a stop to see this Portland landmark!

I don't know what to say about Voodoo Doughnuts that hasn't already been said. We waited in line for 2 hours (yes, 2 hrs) on a Sunday at about 1pm, nearly froze, and wondered if it was worth it. 

I was hesitant to get the maple bacon donut as I figured its too much of a 'thing' and probably not worth the hype. Totally wrong. It is worth it and and the hype is deserved. I thought I've had good bacon donuts before (Nickle Diner, etc) but this beats them all. 

We also split a chocolate donut with cocoa puffs and the orangeatang which was tart and pretty good. 

If I went back, I'd try something new - along with the bacon donut, of course.. Shame the menu board doesn't really tell you what's what. Cute names for each donut, but if you don't know what it is, then I think it slows down the ordering (see above, the 2 hr wait).
Great Doughnuts, Semi-adult concepts. I recommend the cock and balls, it's freaking delicious. Or the bacon maple bars.

The most creative donuts I have ever had the pleasure of consuming. Apparently, Voodoo originally opened as a late night spot that filled its donuts with Pepto Bismoll (hence the pink boxes) to help all of their inebriated patrons stomachs feel a bit better. While the FDA squashed medicine filled donuts, Voodoo lived on and continues to make ingenious and sometimes provocative donuts. The cotton candy donut was super sweet and delicious. The Heath Ledger and Mexican Chocolate were dense and chocolately. The king of them all was the maple baconator. Anthony Bourdain was not lying when he said this was to die for. The bacon is super thick sliced and goes amazingly with the maple frosting. The glitter covered walls can or homeless people begging outside can always entertain you while you are in line. Once you are inside you will be overwhelmed by the number of choices you were never even aware of. Heck, you can buy a coffin full of donuts! Do not miss Voodoo if you are in Portland!

Sooooo worth the 2 hour wait!  My husband and I drove to Portland for a post-Valentine's Day day trip and we just knew we had to visit here.  It was incredible!  We planned on just getting a doughnut each but after driving 2 hours and waiting 2 hours in line, we came home with a half dozen and they were worth every single, delicious calorie!  We got 2 Portland Cream, a McMinnville Cream, a Voodoo doll, a Maple Bar and an Apple Fritter.  They were all great!  We will definitely be going back on our next visit!

I accidently found Voodoo Doughnuts, we were walking to a restaurant and we walked passed it.  I told my sister we have to go there after dinner.  Goofy me even called them to make sure they were open.  DUH, they are open almost all the time.  

When we come back there is a line out the door and down the sidewalk , a line to get doughnuts!  The line moves really fast and it is fun to listen to all the drunk banter.  The doughnuts are totally worth the wait and don't limit yourself to one, buy a bunch and just take bites of every one of them.

If I didn't already get married at the Graceland Wedding Chapel, you can bet your last dollar that I would be getting married at Voodoo Doughnut.  I heart Portland.

i don't know why this gets 5 stars...well, i do, but you can decide for yourself.

i had been traveling from the east coast since 1 that morning and hardly got any sleep, hadn't eaten anything for awhile, and needed something sweet (admittedly i kinda cheated, because i had already planned on going to voodoo). 

when i got there, i noticed the decor right away. it seemed random, yet it seemed so fitting. the girl looked at me with a curious look (to be expected because i had my backpack that was at least as big as me) but was extremely nice. she helped me decide what i needed and i sat down on the bench to indulge. i was ready.

the doughnuts (yes two, but i forget the names regrettably) were exactly what i needed. the dough was very soft and luscious. the frosting wasn't that too-sweet-i-can't-eat-more-than-one-bite kind; rather, it was that i-want-more kind. it hit the spot to say the least.

the whole time i was there, people were coming and going (even though it was about noon on a friday). the people were all nice wondering what my travels consisted of. if you're craving a crappy doughnut, don't go to voodoo. if you want a doughnut that you'll always remember, go to voodoo.
Best donuts in Portland.  I know people say Blue Star is the best, but my money is on Voo Doo!
Doughnut are great. What's not to like. Yum. Doughnuts were fresh, and very reasonably priced. Highly recommended for hungry people.
Everytime I go they have fresh doughnuts, never are out of anything, always taste good, and i love that they have a secret bucket option! :)

All their doughnuts are very creative and down right delicious.  Some are basic like a classic and the rest almost over the top with all the toppings so it's a mouthful. Their is usually a line for these doughnuts as its featured in many areas.  Many people from out of town come here for those doughnuts in the pink boxes.

This place is a must and great for one of those weekend or late night sweet cravings. The line is a bit of a pain, but thank God there's more than one location in Portland. After the wait, you'll be satisfied with your purchase of cavity creating doughnuts. I recommend the dozen, because who would wait all that time for one or two doughnuts? The Grape Ape, Maple and Miami Vice are the best.
I wish this place had one in San Diego. A lot of donuts that dont look good but taste awesome!

Ok, true story: went to Portland to get my Mercedes serviced in Woodinville. We stayed at the Embassy Suites downtown, always a good time to be had. Woke up the next morning and we just couldn't leave without trying out Top Pot for the first time ever. We waited in line (thank God it was a short one)in the rain of course got our dozen of donuts and put them on the back seat of our loaner car. Went back to the dealership to turn in the loaner and get our vehicle back, ended up leaving with a new 2018 and in the most of all the excitement,  we LEFT our donuts on the back seat!!!!! By the time we found out, we were already back in Washington. OMG, we wanted those donuts so bad and ended up with none.

When I went to Voodoo, they had a crazy line all day/night. Once I saw it dwindle I went and stood there for a little while (it wasnt too long of a wait once there's a lull). The employee that took my order was extremely friendly despite being so constantly busy. He dealt with me while I tried to pick the perfect twelve doughnuts, haha. 

Great doughnuts, great service. Definitely a must if you're in the area.

Oh, and get the Captain Crunch doughnut....its the best one :)
Such a fun place. Everyone needs to try this at least once! Great environment.. open late and delish donuts!

Fabulous gourmet donuts! I had a donut that combined my two favorites: maple bar eclair.  Mmmm. My husband had the maple bacon bar...it was only ok.  He also had the Big Fat Bastard...something with oreos, chocolate & peanut butter.  It was so rich that even 4 of us nibbling on it didn't finish it.  My father in law had the apple fritter which was huge and very good.  My mother in law had the voodoo classic, which she seemed to enjoy. Out of all the donuts I tried, the maple eclair was my favorite.  We waited about 10 minutes in line, and paid about $2.50 per donut- a reasonable price for a gourmet treat.  Sketchy part of town, but don't skip it if you are nearby.
Voodoo is a Portland staple and is absolutely worth the line. I think they are hilarious in their creations and design. Whenever I see those pink boxes it puts a smile on my face.

Got there at 3pm on Monday afternoon.. waited less then 5 minutes... then was in DONUT HEAVEN!!! 

I wish they had pictures with descriptions to look at rather just the round donut carousel. I'm not a sweets person at all....I love savory....but the BACON MAPLE donut is just OMG OMG OMG sweet savory love in my mouth!  

If anyone knows what kind of bacon they use.. I would love to have it with my eggs for breakfast....MMmMmMMMM =D

This is a MUST for any doughnut lover. With their wacky off the wall creations, names, and atmosphere, it is a place any and all can enjoy. You can even get married there!!! Prices are decent, however, if you use the downtown location it is a bit of a tourist trap and you can expect to wait 40mins + just to get in and order. The mid-town location is much quieter and is a bit of an adventure to find but well worth it if you dont want the crowds.

Voodoo Doughnuts, I was weak, I was desperate and in need of a friend....and you were there for me. I stumbled in with one eye open after a night of drinking and a tragic turn at the strip club. I just needed some yummy sweetness to take to bed with me (since the talent at the strip club was neither yummy nor sweet) and you were there. 

I had me a little foursome with a Miami Vice, a vanilla frosted and a traditional glazed and it helped me get through the end of a crazy night. 

Fortunately more was to be sampled the next day. I hate, Hate, HATE maple syrup, maple donuts ANYTHING maple. But add a doughnut and some bacon and hot damn, a might tasty treat.

You guys are seriously a pothead's dream. Where, oh where were you when I was in college?
I Loooooooove the maple bacon doughnut!!!! The perfect choice for sweert and savory. We did seem to order to many! opps.

I was blown away by the line outside the door - in the rain! But it wasn't a long wait, and omg was it worth it. Honestly the best donut I've ever had in my life. Something about the dough makes it fluffier and more satisfying, and the frosting tastes rich and creamy instead of just sugary. Absolutely recommend to any Portland visitors!
This place is cool. Open 24 hours, crazy doughnuts, weddings, and Swahili lessons. 'nuff said.

People say the line's too long...and it is, but these workers are used to it and the 20 minutes of waiting will be entirely worth it when you sink your teeth into the delectably fresh, soft, chewy doughnut of your choice... What do I choose when there are so many options, you ask? My favorites...the mcminninville cream with its maple frosting and bavarian cream center, and the chocolate frosted, rice crispy and peanut butter drizzled, "no name". Nom nom nom. There's a reason why, when walking around with one of those bright pink boxes, people will ask you if you "need a hand", "have any extra", etc. It's because they know...these are stellar doughnuts. Even for people who don't like doughnuts.

I don't ever eat doughnuts. I rarely eat carbs, preferring to only drink them. Yet, after riding the drunken buzz of the Fanfarlo show, my friends and I headed to Voodoo for some sickeningly sweet goodness. You can smell Voodoo from blocks away, with it's aroma rising above all the urine and feces that surround this area.

I love all the vegan options that they have and the rotating wheel of candy coated, diabetes inducing concoctions. Through the recommendations of the guy behind the counter I got some ghost shaped doughnut with jelly filling. I know we also got an apple fritter that was the size of my head and some other chocolate doughnut. Oh my god, I only wish I had bought a chocolate milk to enhance all this tastiness.

Voodoo doughnut helped make my night pretty much perfect! I don't think I would make this place a staple of mine to go to in town, but I can see my drunk ass ended up here more than a few times in the next couple of months.

Now I wouldn't have gone to this place if it wasn't for the few shows on the travel and food networks...

Anyway...

I love this place! I like the cute little hole! i almost missed it as I walked by until I saw a large "Voodoo Doughnuts" logo painted on the outer wall.  There was a long line that spills almost to the end of the block. That was at about 10p!

I decided to  limit my doughnut consumption to only during the morning, thinking the line would be much shorter after the rush hour. I was wrong it's still there as if it ever have been made short.

I ordered the pink doughnut with the bubble gum topped off, dirty old man, the huge ass fritter with chocolate ships and peanut butter, voodoo doughnut, M's, cocoa puff, The Maple bacon bar, cocks and balls, and maybe a couple more I might have eaten...

It was good....

Not the best but worth the money for its creative, whimsical, quirky doughnuts!

LOVED the hibiscus donut! Also tried the chocolate cake style donut- that was good too. But the Hibiscus, oh man, that almost had me running back for more! Lovely staff by the way, very patient with all my questions. Also, pretty cool grunge/artsy ambiance- very Portland!

Re-reading my old review I crack up. A lot changes in 5 years! 
Well not my love of this doughnut. Even when I'm sober.
Seriously, there's a hype for these doughnuts because they are THAT good. 
Hey can you guys fed ex one down to me now?
Yes, this is just as good as everyone says it is. Gives me a food boner just thinking about it.
This is my favorite place to get doughnuts.  so fun and the service is fast.  My only knock is that it is still cash only, and this isn't the 1990s.

I've been to donut bar in SD, and I just want to say that voodoo exceeded my expectations. There's some kind of voodoo crack in their dough that had me coming back both mornings of my stay. Definitely worth the visit, not your typical donut

It's a doughnut shop that's a genuine tourist destination. People were standing outside taking pictures. You can buy Voodoo t-shirts and stickers to remember your visit.

The inside of the shop was really dark like a speakeasy, which seems strange for a doughnut shop, but Voodoo is no ordinary shop. The interior is quirky, with a giant doughnut on the wall and miscellaneous voodoo related artifacts. 

The 3 tier rotating donut display is properly illuminated. The donuts aren't labeled and the names (e.g., dirty old bastard) don't help out much either (plus the menu board was hard to read in the dim light). Donuts start at 95 cents. They have regular donuts, vegan donuts (many of these) and crazy donuts, like ones with Tang, M&Ms, Froot Loops, bacon, marshmallows, etc. http://media3.ct.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0_p3XI8OQfwKXzXEfd7r9g/l

* Butterfingering doughnut: Chocolate cake donut with vanilla glaze and crushed Butterfinger bits: the donut was fresh and fluffy, BF adds this lovely crunch to the donut, really fabulous

* No name doughnut: Raised yeast donut with chocolate glaze, rice krispie treats, peanut butter drizzle: the cereal was not that crunchy, PB makes it interesting, rich, a little salty.

* Dirt doughnut: Raised round yeast donut with vanilla glaze, broken Oreo cookie pieces. The cookies weren't that crispy so the contrast wasn't there, super sweet so consume with a beverage...my least favorite.

Cash only.

AWESOME! Once you get past the line (expect to wait thirty or more minutes) you are in for a treat! They have so many awesome donuts! I would recommend the Maple Bacon Bar, its by far the best! Also the classic Voodoo Doll donut is a must as well! And they have vegan donuts!! 

Only downside is they ONLY have donuts, no healthier alternatives, but I guess it is a donut shop at its core, so that's understandable.

If you like donuts, you'll like Voodoo Doughnuts. 

What is there to say about this place that you haven't already heard?

Yes, there is a bacon donut. Yes, the lines are very long, especially at the original location and ESPECIALLY during Saturday Market hours.

Things that surprised me though were that although Voodoo is a special doughnut shop, the prices are very reasonable. It's not the cheapest, but it's a pretty good deal to buy donuts, especially by the dozen. 

When my friends and I were in Portland for a day, we decided to share a Voodoo dozen which is an assorted box of their custom donuts that are picked out by the worker - no requests. (The famous bacon donut is not included and needs to be ordered separately). Some were better than others, but since Voodoo lines are really long, rather than getting jeered at for taking too long to decide, do yourself and be a kind soul by just ordering a Voodoo dozen.

One aspect that should be known is that this place is cash only. There is an ATM inside though.

Voodoo donuts are mighty decadent...  Due to my new healthy lifestyle that I started over 10 years ago, donuts are mostly off the menu for me now.  However, I do indulge albeit extremely rarely.  But if I'm going to have a way-too-unhealthy-for-you item like a donut, it darned well better be a good one!  And in that regard, Voodoo never disappoints.

Portland has a few smallish-bakeries that offer really good donuts (if you think KK makes good donuts you are seriously out of touch).....  but even compared to places like Blue Star, Cannon Beach bakery and the Beaverton Bakery, Voodoo is pretty much the best there is.

Now I'm hungry :)
We bought the penis donut (huge. cream filled.  naturally) and absconded with it to the photo booth.  A night I will always remember fondly.

Had to give this place a try while in Portland and was not disappointed! Everyone says there is a line, so we just went in the morning (about 8am) on a Monday and BAM! No line. Amazing. The doughnuts tasted fresh and delicious. We got the blueberry cake doughnut, cock n balls, grape ape, voodoo doll, and maple bar. They were all great! I thought the cock n balls was hilarious. And the grape ape sounds weird, like, a grape flavored doughnut? But trust me... it's very tasty! Loved all the bright colors and decor. I'd go back if we were in Portland again. The only thing I wish they would change is the "cash only" policy. It seems so silly. We came prepared, but I'm sure not everyone does. And I hate carrying cash!
DELICIOUS for sure I am addicted excellent service and personality there enjoyed mt time there and afterwards

Lived up to the hype! Only stood in line for about 10 minutes and shared six donuts with two others. Loved the Homer Simpson, Lemon Crueller, Oreo and Chocolate with Vanilla Custard center. Not quite as impressed with the cake donuts (toasted coconuts and coconut with the peanut butter center). Would definitely be back!

24


,,,,

If you didn't have Voodoo Doughnut,
You couldn't say you ever come to Portland
I heard that,It's the most donuts taste in the world.
I wanna have everyone....

In addition to the Portland downtown store, 
if you're luck you'll meet cute donuts car 
BUT Portland Only !!!!!

I had been trying to get there since forever. I  had to try them no matter what. Simply the best!!! They have a huge variety. That's why we decided to get a huge box filled of them and try as most as we could :) All are great!!!!!
The line was very very long. About an hour under the sun.
They only accept cash but they have an ATM inside. There's another nearby.
They have tables outside but they are usually crowded.

This is by far the best and most interesting doughnut shop I have been to.  The combinations of ingredients are different from any other kind of doughnut.  In a good way!  Where else can I get my favorite cereal as a kid on a delicious pastry?  There are so many choices that whenever I'm in town visiting, my friends and I are always make a point to stop by...

These are my favorite doughnuts in the world. There is much hype and it is all completely valid. I've made ridiculous side trips to go through Portland for these doughnuts, waited in line exhausted, and they're freaking worth it. I would recommend the doughnut with the oreos on top as a personal indulgence, but they're all amazing.

AND! there is a crazy selection of vegan doughnuts! They blow my mind.

I don't even like doughnuts and we loved this place.  We arrived on a (hot) Saturday early afternoon and our wait from the time we got in line until we left was 35 minutes.

After waiting so long we decided to order another doughnut that was advertised, The Pothole (covered in Oreo cookies with a white frosting line down the middle) in addition to the Bacon Maple Bar.

They both were great.  As I ate the maple bacon one in the charming alley along side Voodoo, many people stopped and asked me "is that BACON on your doughnut???!!"

I think half the fun was all the nice people in line we met, chatting it up, and there was a singer entertaining us that had a pretty decent voice and sang songs we liked.  The people working here were friendly and patient.

We came back the next morning, on a Sunday at 8ish and it took over 20 minutes because there was just one clerk.  We bought the apple fritter this time.

November 12, 2017 Sunday 4:25 afternoon

Bought three maple bacon and one Oreo topped with white frosting whichnsure sounds like the pot hole we bought before but it looked   The wait was 15 minutes, total time to get in line, order pay and leave the store.  Maybe 30 people in line ahead of us

October14, 2018  Sunday 6-7 pm

Three maple bacon and one Marshall Mathers (Eminem) which was vanilla with vanilla frosting and covered with a bunch of mini M&M's. It was really good. We loved it. But as always the maple bacon are all time number one fav    About 40 people ahead of us

The Maple Bacon doughnut is by far the best thing I ever eaten! I am not from the area, so I decided to take a dozen home. I was surprised at the amount of attention the Voodoo pink box received while I walked through the airport. I love the concept and the creative choices. A must try!!

If you ever go to Voodoo, you MUST try the apple fritter! It was the size of my head and baked to perfection. The ideal balance between crispy in some places and soft in others. I also had the Old Dirty Bastard and it was good too, but a bit too sweet for my taste. They only take cash, but luckily they have an ATM there so you won't be out of luck.
Maple Bacon Bar....nuf said! Oh yeah, got there at 8:15 am on a Saturday morning and only waited 5 minutes in line! Go early!

What an experience! The doughnuts are as good as the hype. Prepare for a sugar fest of enormous doughnuts. This is not for the health conscious or even those who seek moderation. But the choices are creative, endless and enticing. The service is also great...aside from the fact that they don't accept credit cards. I love it here!

Totally worth the drive. Why doesn't every dough-nut come with bacon? Then I hear that you can get married there. Hilarious. Don't miss the keep Portland weird sign near the store. Don't bother going if you take things too seriously. After buying our box of dough-nuts, we noticed a line forming behind us that wrapped outside the building. Too crazy.

I think my favorite part of the Voodoo Donuts experience is actually the line. It sounds crazy, I know, but I meet the coolest people from all over the place and I've made some awesome connections. The donuts (the Old Dirty Bastard more specifically) are also delicious and so fun because there's a MILLION different flavors. Something important to note is that the Gluten Free options are so much better than you'd expect!

I was speechless when I head that you can actually get married at Voodoo Doughnut. When I learned that one can actually say "I Do" naturally, I had to check this out for myself. I have never, ever, seen a doughnut place this packed at 10:45 p.m. I absolutely loved my little voodoo doll (chocolate glazed doughnut body with Raspberry filling for guts) and I wished I bought a whole dozen. The decorations are definitely weird, but fun and entertaining ( they totally fits the funky vibe of this shop). The selection of doughnuts is memorizing! Where do they come up with some of these concoctions? Creativity is absolutely key to their success and I am so pleased with the result! Keep it up, Voodoo!
The Captain Crunch Doughnut was delicious.  I loved the frosting that tasted like milk.  We will be taking all of our friends and family to Voodoo Doughnuts.

Very cool place to get wacky donuts, it is nice when your drunk and not really into making a decision to ask for the Voodoo Dozen which are 13 (baker's dozen) donuts picked by the counter person.  Guaranteed to get something tasty.
Yes they're good but people it's just a doughnut. I don't understand why people wait in the line for 45 minutes for doughnut but I guess weed is legal in Oregon now so enjoy
yummiest evahhhh! :)

These doughnuts are pretty good, they have tons of different kinds like jelly filled ones (which are my favorites) they have great service and they usually have a long line but there worth the wait! If you're looking for a good doughnut shop around Portland their the ones for you!

We never eat doughnuts- except when In Portland! Voodoo doughnuts is a must have!!! They have a huge vegan selection.  And an ever huger all over selection.  Unique flavor combinations.  Good quality.  I can't believe they don't have 5 stars!!

Waited 30 minutes for melt in my mouth deliciousness. 
I got the maple bacon doughnut with a little trepidation and boy was I thrilled. The perfect combo of salty and sweet, and the bacon was thick and crisp! 
I also got the cream filled- I think the Portland special or something. It also was great 
I'm not huge on doughnuts, but wow we're these impressive
Best selection of vegan donuts ever! I highly recommend this place, not because its trendy but because they really do have awesome donuts! -SVJ

Lines out the door! This place is killer and delicious. I'd say doughnuts are either good or bad, they either taste good or not. This place is great and one of a kind.

My fave is the maple bacon one with the strip of bacon! When you get the doughnuts fresh they are soft and chewy, just how they should be. 

The outrageous-ness is totally a conversation piece...for example, chewing a warm glazed phallus in your mouth is the perfect way to walk into work. Don't spill your coffee on your ahem. That makes things more interesting.  

There's a second location outside of downtown that is less busy, but the line is worth it.

I love this place.  It's so much fun to get your hands on these. I love the cotton candy one and a few of the others. These are so funky and unique you have to go at least once... but probably 1000 times more.

They could get by with fun on the outside and so-so on the inside. But nooo. These darn things are as delicious as they come. VooDoo has a quality product with quality guts. And that is saying a lot for a doghnut these days.

Voodoo never disappoints. Whenever I get a chance while in Portland I always stop by here. Last night I went here with my man after dancing it up and thankfully there was only two people in front of us when we got there. (usually we have to wait a while) He got the Voodoo doughnut and I got the Cap'n crunch which we were both very happy with. The people working there were friendly and ready for the clubs to get out.
Voodoo is a Portland staple. Any of their locations are fun, creative, and obviously delicious. Thanks for keeping Portland weird, Voodoo!

Ok, so the five star rating isn't just because I've had some of the most awesome donuts I've ever had courtesy of Voodoo.  In my opinion it is one of the reasons behind the "weird" in the saying "Keep Portland Weird".  I also give them a five star because they're not afraid to be daring and try really outlandish ways of turning a boring donut into something obscenely tasty while keeping the prices reasonable.  Prices range from $1 to $5 per donut.    

So far I have two favorites at this joint.  The first is the Triple Chocolate Penetration.  No...it isn't a porno title, it could be...actually it may have already been used but in this context...it isn't.  At Voodoo it is a chocolate cake donut with a coat of chocolate glaze topped with Cocoa Puffs...yes I said Cocoa Puffs.  The fine people over at Voodoo have a penchant for taking glazed donuts to new heights by topping the glaze with various cereals, cookies, candies, and even bacon.   You may have just asked yourself, "Did he just say bacon...on a donut???  Blasphemy!!!"  Yes, the infidels at this hole in the wall on 3rd Ave top one of their donuts with strips of bacon, but more on that later.  Let me go on to my second most favorite donut...the Marshall Mathers.  This donut is so named because it's topped with mini M&M's.  Do you get it?  Beneath the M&M's is a white glaze covering a vanilla cake donut.  Sugar overload?  Yes, yes it is, but I love it!  We ordered several dozen Slim Shadys for our son's birthday party last year instead of doing the traditional birthday cake and they were a hit with the keikis.  The crazies at Voodoo even made a chocolate version of the Marshall Mathers (yes, I've thought of a funny joke or two about it).  So instead of the standard vanilla they sub it with a chocolate donut with chocolate glaze and then the minis.  These guys and gals also do custom donuts.  In addition to the 5 dozen Eminems, we had them custom make a Nemo (Finding Nemo) donut.  They melded several yeast donuts into the shape of the cute little fish and got artistic with some orange glaze accented with black and white here and there and Presto Change-O, FISH DONUT!  The finished product looked just like the little fishee our son loves.  We were thoroughly impressed and highly recommend them for special events.  

Now there are so many other donuts in the arsenal to try at this spot and I've only had the pleasure to sample a few.  I would love to sit down sometime and try them all but I also don't want the next Half Ton Man special on the Discovery Channel to feature yours truly.  So...I will have to choose wisely the next time we visit the place.  I really do want to try the Maple Bacon Bar, but I hear it is best to get it when the bacon is still freshly cooked.  Timing is everything.  I like my bacon crispy thank you.  The Memphis Mafia is another one on my hit list as well as the Dirty Snowballs.  The Memphis Mafia is an Elvis inspired creation and is larger than life like the legend himself.  The Dirty Snowballs...well, I'll just let your imagination run with it.  I will consume each in due time my friends, in due time.  I will be sure to update as I dispatch the sugary sweet prey.  

They opened a second larger location a while back just off of Sandy and Davis but the one on 3rd Ave in Old Town is open 24 hours.  Be warned...this doesn't mean they're making donuts the whole day.  These things are best sampled when they're fresh, especially the cereal topped ones.  Depending on the time of day, expect a line.  They don't take cards, cash only.  I believe there is an ATM inside, but of course it'll charge you a significant transaction fee.  Bring cash, spend the fee on a donut ;o)

As always, don't take my word for it.  Go out and try the place.

A hui hou!
LOVE IT! If your new to Portland then you need to go here. If your not then you still need to go here. The donuts are amazing!

It was a typical day in Portland; the street was covered with giant puddles as rain drizzled, the sky was dark, and people struggled to keep dry for no one had an umbrella. I was on my walk back to my hotel room as I saw a light at the end of the tunnel. It was not an abandoned umbrella (though that would have been really looked down upon regardless) but rather it was the neon sign that indicated I had reached doughnut heaven. I had always been lucky with the line for it was never crazy when I waited, but I have witnessed it when it was over 30 people. Once I got to step inside, my eyes fixated on one specific shelf of the many rotating displays. In a large black-sharpie written note was the word "VEGAN". I had to clarify with the staff that it was indeed vegan for never had I seen such a large variety of non-boring flavors. From bavarian maple to berry jam filled doughnuts, the selections for an egg, dairy, and meat omitting person were vast. It was like being a kid in a candy store only worse; I was a doughnut deprived vegan in a vegan friendly doughnut shop. 

Several months down the line and I officially moved to Portland. I was finally able to fill the missing element in my life: vegan doughnuts. From the day before orientation, to the day I moved into the dorms, to a very drunken night at Reed where I found a bucket full of these vegan perfections, to the day where a selection of maple bavarian creams, gay bars, and jelly filled passed through security with me on my way to New York ( I actually cared so much about the doughnuts not getting ruined that I accidentally left my computer in the scanning machine), the Doughnuts from Voodoo Doughnuts will always have a special place in my heart.

Does Voodoo Doughnut really even need my review? The line has almost always been out the door when I go, and with delicious doughnuts like the maple bacon, how can you go wrong? My favorites are the Old Dirty Bastard, the gay bar, and the maple bacon.

Upside: The doughnuts are super good and the long lines are worth the wait. I am not a doughnut fan, but I waited in line for 20 minutes.

Downside: Its in Portland

There are so many things I love in one place: doughnuts, glitter, outdoor seating, and funkiness. Seriously, even the outside walls are glittery.
Yes the line was long, but the wait was absolutely worth it, and I get why people say it's a MUST when visiting the area. 
Could you eat doughnuts from other places? Sure. But would you be lost in thought on the drive home about the one that got away? Absolutely. Do yourself a favor, don't skip this place.

My ONLY complaint with Voodoo Donuts is that I can only eat 2 before my heart explodes and my head caves in. It's as though my body is in a race with itself to die from pleasure: Will the sugar rush it into a diabetic coma before the butter/fat/etc. brings on the kind of spectacular coronary that struck my grandfather dead while mowing his lawn 8 years ago? Who cares! I'll still die happier and fuller than gramps did! Except for that third donut I'll never eat...

Voodoo had been so over-hyped to me by the time I got there that I was a little disappointed: Dingy homeless-chic decor, surly (*pre-caffienated?)hipster counterstaff, and the donuts look kinda... sorry, sad, malformed? but tasty? Nothing so slickly produced and attractively-manufactured looking as a Dunkin'-type. No, these little guys are delicious-looking special needs children made with lots of sloppy love - maybe ganja-fueled sloppy love? Now that I think of it, why doesn't Voodoo have a Mary Jane donut? That'd certainly start MY workday off right... Oh, damned laws!

I digress.

I echo all the donut-specific comments made before now - particularly the bacon-maple bar - so bacon-riffic it could test the will of the kosherest of the khosher.

Oh, Peaches loves Voodoo! She's right there on the wall. Any friend of Peaches is a friend of mine.

This is a fun little donut shop that's not for the light of heart. I ordered the Memphis mafia fritter. This fritter is topped with chocolate, peanut butter, peanuts, and chocolate chips. If you have a sweet tooth and love the mesh of pb and chocolate, then I would recommend this as the donut of choice!

There's typically a long line rounding the corner outside the store but it's worth the wait!

I'm down with ODB, and the voodoo doll and the Maple Bacon bar and most of all the Memphis Mafia. 

If you happen to drive by and the line is short always stop and get a box of doughnuts. If you happen to drive by and the line is long, then man up, stop and get a box of doughnuts. If you complain about how long the line is, and whine non stop while you wait 20 minutes for your bag or box of sugary bliss, then you are a cry baby and I don't like you. If you happen to plan a trip then make sure you bring along a little thermos of milk to go with your goodies. 

PS. Voodoo is known for curing hangovers.

I have to give them 5 stars simply because they have a donut with bacon on it.  Bear in mind, this is the quintessential Portland place; if you like one thing here, you'll love it all.  The inverse is also true.  I agree the wait staff could be a little friendlier and if you order too many donuts the people behind you kind of groan but that's all part of the fun!  Hint: if you need *a lot* of donuts (like Friday morning in the office) hit the store over on Sandy ... unless that's the day I'm going over there then don't.  Same donuts, same service (irony here) but none of the wait.  I love this place and even if Krispy Kreme acquires them I'll still go there.  Portland all the way.

A must-visit attraction in Portland! The boyfriend and I beat the long line by coming here on a late Monday afternoon. We ordered the bacon maple bar donut because anything with bacon is a sure-win. At first I was a bit skeptical, but the salty, crunchiness of the bacon and the soft, sweet donut provided both textual and flavor contrast. Can't beat that!

Want a doughnut covered with frootloops, marshmallows, nerds, chocolate syrup and twizzlers all on top of one doughnut? Then this is the place for you, Homer!  Their concoctions are so weird... well, maybe not as weird as on the one I just invented, but close enough.  For the straight-laced, they also do carry plain glazed doughnuts.  For the health-conscience, they have yummy all-vegan doughnuts (a healthy doughnut?! who would've thought?!).  Don't let the hard, tough image of the place intimidate you. There's something here for everyone and every taste bud imaginable.

This was a fun experience. The line took about 30 minutes. At some point, a worker came out to greet everyone waiting (in the rain!)...This made me realize they are thankful for their success vs. taking it for granted. People in the line were clearly excited about picking up some donuts. I'd say the line was a good mix of tourists and a few locals. 

Upon entering the actual bakery, I all of the sudden became perplexed as to what I should get!! The woman at the counter was extremely helpful and put me @ ease, even with the huge menu and giant spinning case full of different types of donuts staring me in the face!

I ended out picking a nice selection to bring back home. While it is relatively expensive, they are pretty big compared to most donuts and are quite good!
