Best donuts in Portland! I tried blue star and pips. Hey don't even come close. These are true, decadent, fluffy donuts you crave. The voodoo doll was my favorite with the thick chocolate frosting and soft fluffy bread! It had a jelly filling but only a tiny bit which was good because I'm not a fan of filled donuts. The butterfinger and hibiscus were my second favorites. All the options are amazingly delicious and you can't go wrong! We tried 6 different ones and I was not disappointed with any! You have to have cash which made us have to leave and come back once because the ATM was not working inside! There was a long line but it moved really fast. Amazing donuts and the place is a lot of fun!!

Nom nom! 

Yes it is a touristy place.... and yes I was a tourist. 

It was about a 30 minute wait. But I hear thats on the low side. We each got 2 donuts. Yes it's a touristy place, but the doughnuts were not only creative but very tasty. 

We each ordered the little voodoo guy as our second donut and saved it for the next day when we were on the coast. It was delicious even a day later!

VooDoo before the renovation was awesome. VooDoo after the renovation is awesome too but doesn't have that same unrefined quality about it. The doughnuts are delicious for sure. I am always a little overwhelmed when I come here. I don't want to be the a-hole holding up the line because I didn't think to peruse the menu while I waited in line so I always end up pointing at the first thing that looks good.  Fortunately, everything I have picked has been dang good.

Good things: Doughnuts. Duh. Who doesn't like a doughnut and especially in the various ways that they make it. AND they're open late. You can get a doughnut, or 6, take a seat in one of those lovely picnic benches they have set up in the alley and people watch while drinking espresso from the cafe across the street OR imbibing on an alcoholic beverage from one of the bars in the area. Oh, idea!!!!  Note to self: Spanish Coffee and the maple bacon bar would go wonderfully together. 

Bad thing: The line. As super cool as VooDoo is, it has gotten touristy and why not?  They deserve that recognition. Still, that doesn't mean I like standing in a line that wraps around the block. ALL THE TIME. A line isn't really a bad thing.  I'm just an impatient person. I want my doughnut now!  

If you haven't had the VooDoo experience, please, do stand in line, marvel at the glitter covered bricks and get a box of doughnuts. You're in for a treat. Once you've done that a time or two, then you can bitch about the line like a local.

I know, I'm just one of over 6,000 reviews, but I had to put my vote in and share that the doughnuts are super creative and the flavor combos are so exciting! Coco Puffs crusted doughnuts? Yes please! Favorite is The Old Dirty Bastard. Chocolate frosting, Oreos, and wait for it... Peanut butter drizzle!

WE stopped by here when we were in Portland for the holidays.  I know it gets a bad rap as a tourist trap, but whatever...  the donuts were tasty as hell and the line wasn't so bad.  Yes, it was out the door, but it only took about 10 mins.  We tried 6 diff end donuts and each was good.  I personally like the grape one.  The Cap'n Crunch one was OK, but really sweet (almost too much).  

These really aren't the simple donuts you'd eat for bfast, but if you're in Portland and wanted to try it, it's worth it.

Yumm! Craziest, original (and most delicious) doughnuts I've ever had! There was a fairly long line when we arrived, but we decided we HAD to wait it out. The line moved fairly quickly, and it was definitely worth the wait. I had the Dirt Doughnut, which had vanilla frosting and oreos. It was to die for! I also had the Old Dirty Bastard, which had chocolate frosting, oreos and peanut butter which was also out of this world! My boyfriend had the Bacon Maple Bar, which sadly wasn't very good.  I suggest you check out their menu online so you have some sort of idea what you are going to buy. There are soooo many doughnuts so it's a little overwhelming when you get to the register and have to choose. I also thought the prices were reasonable.
Love this Place! Dont be shy to try anything from here, taste buds scream of excitement with these donuts!

Really awesome doughnuts ... Wish they expand to Southern California T.T. I waited in a really long line but the line went really fast! Very hip atmosphere. Great selection of donuts. The Flavors were amazing! It was fluffy and soft. Drooling just thinking about it! I got the captain crunch cereal doughnut and fruit loop cereal doughnut! Definitely recommend!

Yummy.....  First visit was last night, and I waited outside for about half an hour on a mild Saturday Fall evening.  The doughnuts were fantastic!  I loved the Voodoo Doll doughnut, the bacon one (delicious!), and the one with chocolate and peanut butter was tasty too!  My four year old loved the bubble gum version.  The shop is small, but the staff members were quite friendly.  I will be back when in the area!

Voodoo Doughnuts Downtown Portland is the best!!  Customer service is outstanding!!  A manager there took my special order of a king cake.  We are from south Louisiana:  Lafayette and New Orleans, and needed a king cake in Portland for my son who now lives there.  Shipping from Louisiana was ridiculous so I called just to ask Voodoo Doughnuts if they made King Cakes.  With a name like Voodoo, you'd think so, right?  So, a clerk said they didn't but gave me to a manager who was totally open to taking down the order and spent a good while with me on the phone discussing it so to get it right.  She even had me send photos of king cakes in an email and describe the contents and consistency.  She truly cared about it being authentic.  
We didn't know what to expect.  But when my son picked it up last Tuesday, he said it was spot on.  It was gooey and creamy and Mardi Gras colors and shaped correctly and delicious!  
WAY TO GO, VOODOO DOUGHNUTS!!  I'm very impressed with you!

Heard about this place and it was a must ! I stopped in before a two hour drive south for an Oregon Ducks game (didn't know they had a location in Eugene) but it was amazing. Got the mango tango, maple bacon bar, old dirty bastard, capn my cap'n and one other it was EPIC. Took some home with me on the plane and thought I was gonna get jumped. Even the flight attendant said "oh thanks for bringing me some Voodoo" and about 12 other passengers made remarks about being jealous. It was a 15 minute wait maybe but it goes fast and you're in and out. If you ever are in a city with voodoo GO. Bring cash also it's cash only. They have an ATM but I'm sure the free is crazy so bring cash.

Okay so I told myself before I got to Portland I wasn't going to end up a donut shot in Portland! I was wrong I ended up here twice! After I was drunk !!! There donuts are so good the line isn't out the door for nothing!

So the BF went on a business trip - to OREGON, fo all places.  Before he left Monday morning, I chanted over and over again, "Don't forget to bring me back some cheese!"  I dunno.  Oregon sounds like it'd be farm country to me, and farms equate to cheese in my not-so-worldly-wise head.

I called him this morning and asked, "So... When are you coming back?"

"Tonight," he said.

"So did  you get me any cheese?"

"No, honey.  I asked and asked, and apparently, Oregon is not known for cheese. They're known for salmon, and you don't eat seafood."

"People in Oregon fish?  I figured they'd farm."

"No, honey. Fishies, no cows."

"Frick.  I guess happy cheese comes from happy cows, and happy cows come from California. Sucks."

"Don't worry.  I'll get you something authentically Oregonese."

Now, I might sound like an ignorant prick from the conversation above, and I don't deny it.  I've been living in a bubble of ignorance.  I've never denied it, and I've only sometimes lamented it.  Tonight, though, when BF brought me back my "gifts,"  I woefully banged my head against the wall and screamed, "Why have I been left ignorant for so long?!  How could I have missed out on this experience?!  How come I just DID NOT KNOW?!"

Bacon Maple Doughnut.

I know.  It sounds gross.  When I opened the bag, I eyed it dubiously, too.  But tsk tsk.  Let's all remember to have open minds.

This bar of freaking delicious goodness blew my damn mind wide open.

Hesitantly, I took a bite of this strange hybrid doughnut.  WTF is this, I muttered in my head as I chewed... and...

IT WAS AN OUT-OF-MY-MIND experience. The sweetness of the maple, the saltiness of the bacon, and the fried blandness of the doughnut itself...  Who'da thunk it?  UNBELIEVABLE HARMONY OF TASTES!

It's like... pancakes with bacon and maple syrup.  Or a Bacon, Egg, & Cheese McGriddle.  Or.. SOMETHING.

Frick.

I finished one in 0.7 seconds.  I have two more left in my precious white paper bag.  I folded over the top very securely, gave the BF the evil eye and announced, "I'm going to put this in the fridge now.  I'm going to eat it for breakfast.  You cannot eat this.  It is mine."

Selfish?  Heck yeah.  But it's just that damn good!

I've never ever ever harbored any interest in visiting the square state just north of my own, but now?

I think I need to book myself a one way ticket to Portland.  Preferably an air drop just in front of Voodoo.  If you don't hear from me for a few days, please send the paramedics to the front door of Voodoo.  I may just be lying there wasting away from a diabetic coma and multiple clogged arteries.

Bacon. Maple. Doughnut.  Please bury me with a few dozen.
Bypass the line for a good time... Waited in line less then 2 mins. Now in a food coma.

These doughnuts are amazing. Great fresh tasting doughnuts. I've heard about this place from a friend. Now we both live in nyc but on my visit there the past few days made me bring back some great doughnuts. Love them all

Wow, doughnuts shaped like a voodoo doll of my X, or that mean lady on the plane to Bali or Teddy the bully that used to tease me in high school then came on to me at prom!!!

I don't even eat doughnuts but when in Rome.....

This place truly epitomizes the quaint, kitsch that Portland reveal's to all that are truly looking.

Great doughnuts, enough flavor variety to satisfy just about anyone and any age group!

Bring cash and plan to wait a while in line. They do not accept debit/credit cards and generally you should plan to wait 15-20 minutes in line. The community knows and supports them and they're worth the wait!
Always amazing, always buy extra to take home.  Make sure you take cash no cards accepted.  A staple in portland!

Each time my husband and I visit Portland - or any city with a Voodoo, for that matter - we plan to stand in line for these delicious donuts. Other reviewers talk about the experience or the "tourist" factor, but I honestly think they're worth waiting for! This go round, we went with the No Name, Grape Ape, Dirty Snowball and Buttermilk Bar. I prefer the raised yeast varieties in general, but the classic Buttermilk Bar put up a fight as one of my favorites!

Note that this location is still cash only, and they have an ATM if you forget. Also, they offer a huge variety of vegan donuts if that's how you roll!
It is as good as they say. A popular place in Portland is naturally going to be disliked by some in portlandia.

A Portland staple!  Go on a weekday evening for shorter lines.  Their frosting does a great job sealing in moisture so even if you're not getting them right out of the fryer or have some the next day, they're still great.  A lot of the donuts are HUGE so I would bring a friend if you have a small appetite or order small.

I'm sure there's nothing else to say about this that hasn't been said, but I love the flavors of the donuts and the staff seemed upbeat.  Sure, it was a total bitch to stand in line for 45 minutes listening to dirty hippies sing/insult people in the line, but the donuts were worth it.  Protip:  I would recommend getting a raised yeast donut instead of a cake donut.  I tried both and the raised yeast was significantly better and bigger.
Holy mother of pearl these doughnuts are good. Must try if you are in Portland.
I think I might have moved here entirely for these doughnuts...They really are the best and make an excellent breakfast lunch or dinner ;)

Loved This place!!

This cult favorite was a wonderful surprise on a recent tour we took of the area. Our small group stopped in around 10:30pm on a Monday night end of summer and there was still a continuous line of about 15-20 people so I imagine the line can be around the block at peak days/times. I would suggest getting your morning doughnuts the night before in off hours or you will be waiting in a line around the corner. They are open 24 hours a day so pick a good late night time for your quick stop in.

We saw quite a few people walking out with full dozen boxes so clearly this was the right thought. Our tour guide suggested that the lines were the reason the immediate traffic lane next to the building was permanently roped off to auto traffic to accommodate the lines. There was also a security officer quietly hanging around the area so it seems well monitored and safe even though there is a huge transient population that hangs around the area. 

Out of the mixed box we got we tried the Grape Ape and The Loop doughnuts. The Loop was a fruit loop covered doughnut that was quite good but I have to say the unique flavor of the Grape Ape was the kicker for us. The doughnut has a grape dust on it that surprisingly had a sour candy taste to it that although shocking was really good. The doughnuts were perfectly soft, spongy and thick. I almost couldn't finish the one I had so they are very filling. 

This place has unique designs too that are perfect for parties such as the famous Voodoo Doll which is raspberry jelly filled and often has pretzel sticks to simulate the pins on a voodoo doll, and the enormous "Cock-N-Balls" bavarian cream filled doughnut. 

I thought this would be more of a tourist trap and a novelty but the unique creations were actually REALLY good. Recommend you try every flavor =)

Unfortunately they haven't figured out a way to ship their doughnuts yet otherwise I would be a repeat customer! Will have to wait until my next trip to the area. *sigh*

This is a fun, famous, goofy Portland institution. Are the donuts better than other donuts? I have no idea. The folks that work here are friendly. No snark. Yay for that.  Everyone pretty much agrees that donuts aren't the best thing for you, too much sugar, but as a once-in-a-while treat they're a lot of fun to look at, to order, and to amuse out-of-town recipients with. To Voodoo's credit, they strongly discourage shipping their donuts since the process greatly degrades the donuts. Fresh, fresh, fresh. The kids in my family enjoy choosing donuts and also putting themselves into a sort of a donut-coma every once in a while. No complaints. The east side store (NE Davis and Sandy) generally has shorter lines AND tables for eating-in.

I need to borrow more thumbs for the ODB donut coz' my own two are not enough! :D

Walked 3 blocks from our parking spot to wait in the ridiculously long line. Totally worth it. Drove home to LA with 4 pink overflowing boxes of delicious diabetes and heart attacks.

#heifferforever

Run! Don't walk! Wait in the line. Try them all! So f&:$/ing great!!! A Portland staple and must visit! Some of the best, most interesting, donuts I've ever had. They were still extremely fresh (freshly made!) at 6 pm... unlike some other less awesome donuts spots.

I have been a fan of Voodoo Donuts since the first time I traveled to Portland in 2011, and can safely say that the hype around this establishment is real. They make some of the best donuts in the world, and have dozens of different vegan options daily. Conveniently open 24/7, this original location is placed in downtown Portland, steps from many hotels, bars, and restaurants. The interior is colorful and kitschy, painted bright pink and decked out in cute donut themed art. The available flavors are displayed in large rotating cases, providing a whimsical browsing experience. 

Regardless of their 24/7 hours, Voodoo is a busy place that nearly always has a line. I typically come here late at night and have never waited more than 20 minutes, but apparently mornings and weekends can be extremely hectic, so plan accordingly. 

While I have enjoyed every vegan donut that I've tried from here, my favorites are the vegan Voodoo doll, and any variation of their chocolate cake donut. The cute voodoo doll shaped donut is a classic vanilla raised filled with strawberry jelly, and topped with a rich chocolate ganache icing. Their chocolate cake donuts are moist and light, with an authentic cocoa flavor that is never overpowered by whatever topping you choose (sprinkles, ganache, Cocoa Puffs, etc!). I will continue to come here every time I am in Portland, and highly recommend you do the same.

Give me more... VOODOO DOUGHNUT! This place is legendary amongst locals and tourists to the Portland area. Open 24 hours, this is a great breakfast place or late night venture if you're craving some sugary goodness. The doughnuts are all creative, unique and inspired! I had the Bacon Maple Bar and the McMinnville Cream Doughnut. You can either buy doughnuts individually or by the dozen. They also feature my favorite - Stumptown Coffee which you can get in small or large and find your own sugar and cream by the exit. The staff are characters and were all really helpful in identifying the perfect doughnut experience.

Yelper Challenge: You can actually get married at Voodoo Doughnut. Look into this venue if you're looking for the most unique matrimonial setting!
Delicious, creative, cheap and delightful. No one does doughnuts better than Voodoo.

I am not accustomed to eating doughnuts, but wow was this a well worth it stop!

The line is long but goes by quickly- don't let it scare you away. 

My recomendation: the sugar powdered doughnut with the lemon jelly filling- wow!!
Yummy donuts and fascinating decor! The long was long at first but it moved very fast. The staff was very friendly when we had a question about what kind of donut was that.

Street level but!! There is a huge azz line!! But well worth it! Cool place to hang out and chill while getting your sugar fix! Sooo many to choose from?? U won't go away sorry just that u got more!!! Counters right chair height! Good luck order and go!

I've been dying to come to this place for years. Who doesn't love delicious donuts? As someone who has eggs every single morning, this was a treat during my Portland vacation.

3 of us got a dozen and finished the box within 2 days. My absolute favorite was the Miami Vice Berry; a raised donut with white icing, one side with blue and one with pink crystal sprinkles. It was delicious and I will most definitely get it again.

There was quite a line when we arrived, but I didn't care. It was well worth the wait.
Best variety and fun doughnuts!  Always fresh and unique. Fun family experience.  Took my Son and his family and they were blown away with the selection and types of doughnuts.

"Let me live 'neath your spell. Do do, that voodoo, that you do so well.."

Yes, I've heard the naysayers but I think Voodoo's doughnuts are unique, fun and tasty.  Yes, other places have good doughnuts too, but do they have a maple bacon bar or a voodoo man doughnut that squirts out yummy red, "bloody" filling?  I think not.  And the mango doughnut with tangy powdered topping is to die for.  I've also enjoyed the large apple fritters. 
I have warm memories of a former roommate who was vegan and used to bring home a half dozen of their vegan doughnuts and we'd wolf them down.  Not the healthiest dinner, but it was fun.  The vegan style treats are more like cake doughnuts, but I love that and they're super tasty. 
Of course it's a touristy place, it's fun to go to a place with wacky doughnuts and wait in line for something special.  I've also discovered if any doughnuts happen to make it home with you, a good trick is to warm them up for 30 seconds or so in the microwave and wow, do they taste good heated up!
Bacon maple doughnut is awesome.  Love the remodel so you can sit outside.  Fast and efficient.  Gotta order the coffin of doughnuts at our next party.

Ummm... OPEN 24 HOURS???

I would have bypassed this establishment had it not been for the crowd of people munching on obscene-looking donuts on the streets of the Saturday Market on Sunday. I thought, but on Yelp the hours posted said until 2pm... I was wrong! Yelp was WRONG!

It's open 24 hours. Even on Sunday.

BTW: Maple Donut with Cream Filling is TO DIE FOR!

I stopped by today, and a nice lady behind the counter gave me a free voodoo doughnut. I tried to offer money, but she refused. And she was cute, to boot.

Delicious doughnuts, cute girls.. what else is there to life?

Delicious! I can absolutely see why this is a must-do when you're in Portland. But be prepared to wait! My friend and I went around 1:00 in the afternoon thinking there wouldn't be a line, and boy were we wrong. We stood in line (in the rain no less) for 15 minutes. Totally worth it. I had the Captain my Captain and a cinnamon cake doughnut. Equally awesome. Also a nice bonus: they are open 24 hours a day. Though from what I can tell, there will almost be a line. Check this place out! It's delicious!

Pretty cool place for a Doughnut shop, Out of the ordinary and old school.

My friends Hyped this place up a lot before i flew out to VooDoo. I like it
Great ideas that no other doughnut shops have. I mean come on now. who has fruit loop doughnuts, oreo cookie doughnuts, Cotton candy doughnuts, golden graham doughnuts that you know of?

Minus the 45 Minute wait in the Cold i had a great time, there a cash only place so make sure you bring cash.

I had the Maple Bacon Bar, Oreo Cookie Doughnut, and Fruit Loop Doughnut, that was way more than enough for me.

It was Delicious and Yes i would totally do it again.

Place is a little over crowded kinda reminded me of waiting in line at Disneyland for Cotton Candy.

The scenery is really cool, Old school mix-up 

parking is a little difficult, you have to park on the street. 

Would definitely recommend this place to check off your to-do-list.

Although there's always a line, the wait is definitely worth it. As you wait in line, shiny gold bricks welcome you to the magic of Vodoo. Once inside, there are tons of savory donuts to choose from. The Vodoo donut is a fun classic. My favorite is the Portland cream with cocolate and maple. Cute and funky decorations inside. The hype is definitely real.

Voodoo Doughnut???? Heck Ya! Lets do a road trip from Los Angeles to Portland so we can try Voodoo Donut!
So after a 22 hour drive, we made it to Portland, Or... First stop! Voodoo donut... So my husband and I had to order the Voodoo Doll (filled with raspberry jelly, chocolate covered and stabbed with a stake) yum. Bacon Maple Bar -- just so we can say we tried it and of course my favorite the Old Dirty Bastard! (oreo and peanut butter) nom nom nom... The Old Dirty Bastard was sooooo good and soft --- I wanted more! 
I'll be back! Voodoo!!! (Oh and there is a big seating area right outside the store so you can munch on the goodies).
It was amazing dount, they have the freshest custard dount  i will pay them visit soon

There is a whole cult around this place. The donuts are great! I recommend the raised chocolate doughnut but the others are all good too. I say try the famous maple bacon bar doughnut! They're good. I also recommend going to the one on Sandy Blvd. The one in downtown Portland is a nightmare to get to and the lines are around the block.
Fun, kitschy, edgy, delicious. Worth the wait. And definitely a unique offering that Portland has to offer.
Love this place!! Now granted the lines are outrageous and its cash only.l... There is a second location and highly recommend that once your past PDX experince of the original!

I don't even like doughnuts, per se... but throwing bacon on the maple bar BLEW MY MIND!  It was so good!  The line looked really long, but didn't take long to get through.  Even if it had, it would have been well worth the wait (and the calories!).  The only downside is that they only take cash--no cards.

I think the perpetual 'bad attitude' you hear about the staff comes from people not tipping... maybe? Maybe.

There was a teeny tiny line when I went to Voodoo Doughnuts. And the price, not bad. We got a Voodoo Dozen (which means they pick and that knocks the price down, plus, they throw in the cool doughnuts!), a Voodoo Doughnut (which is the man with a pretzel in his tummy), and a Cock and Balls doughnut for around $15. Not bad considering the fanciness of the doughnuts. You don't get plain doughnuts, or maple bars, you're paying for the creativity. And in my case with the Cock and Balls one, an insanely giant doughnut that took me 3 days to eat.
And the lady who gave us our doughnuts, was nice. Gave me a huge smile when I gave her a tip (the two people in front of my didn't give her anything so I threw in an extra dollar a piece for them) and when I nearly knocked my Cock and Balls on the floor (because I am clumsy, no fault of theirs) she tried to help me catch it and said the signature line my friend and I repeated for the rest of her trip, "Careful with that cock now." With a sly smile.

I love Voodoo Doughnuts. Read reviews with a grain of salt, but visit it yourself at least once.
Worth the wait, even for my 4 year old. Get a sword balloon at Saturday mark on sunny day and create a lifetime of memories.

The vegan doughnuts are better than many of the regular ones, there's pinball on location, and I like that it's cash only because it means I can only stop in when I have cash on me, which is rare. If they took cards, I'd be there constantly and my teeth would crumble.

I was told I HAD to try Voodoo Doughnuts while I was on vacation in Oregon. Can you say AWESOME?! I loved the fact that ALL the doughnuts have their own theme! As a Simpsons lover I couldn't pass up the chance to order "the homer", I also ordered the captain crunch!! They even offered Vegan donuts! Very cool.
I did find it to be a bit strange that that restroom was not in the actual building.. but rather in a small "shed?" Like building in the parking lot...I didn't have to use it but I heard an employee tell a woman in front of me.

Ok, so I am not a huge fan of donuts, but I love Voodoo donuts!!! Thank goodness I don't live in Portland or I would have a serious problem. I think what I like so much is the variety and how fresh the donuts are. 

My favorite is the Mexican chocolate donut. It is actually a bit spicy because of the chili powder on it. They actually don't make it everyday so it is hit or miss when you can get it. My husband loves the maple bar with, yes BACON on the top. Our son loves the glazed with sprinkles or fruitloops or any of a half dozen other interesting toppings on it. 

They also have an excellent Vegan selection. If you ever find yourself in Portland I recommend picking up a donut or two or a bucket, yes they sell the day old ones in a bucket!
Great donuts! Fun atmosphere! If you are visiting Portland you have to stop by.

Since I live in Portland and it's on the Food Channel and Travel Channel every other week, I feel like I need to review this place. So here goes...

The donuts (or doughnuts - I prefer the shorter one) here are wicked good. When you go, you have to try the Maple Bacon Bar. "What is that you say? Bacon on a donut?!" Yes. And it's amazing. It is the perfect breakfast combo, you get your pancakes, maple syrup and bacon (bring your own orange juice). I have had many friends of mine turn down the Maple Bacon Bar and it makes me sad because I was doubtful too, but it's a must try. My other favorite is the one with Oreos on it (not the most creative I suppose, but still delicious). Oh...and the Memphis Mafia, that's really good too. 

As noted in some earlier reviews, the people who work here are not always the friendliest. I don't hold that against them though because they deal with tourists all day and the name of the shop is "Voodoo Doughnut" not "Rainbow, Sunshine and Sprinkle Doughnut". Since I live in Portland and have been here several times, I would never wait in a long line because that's just silly. There are often long lines here, but it's hit and miss. Sometimes I drive by and there's no one there. Sometimes I go by and I ask myself, "What's with the line? Are they giving donuts away for free? How come I'm always the last to know?" 

Other things to know..it's cash only, tip them (it's the kind thing to do), the shop is tiny so don't expect to sit in there and eat your donut, coffee is good, and they're open 24 hours a day!

Dear Voodoo Donuts,

People say you're overrated.

People say you're not worth the wait.

People say the organic bakery on that other street is better and that you're just all talk and no action.

I DISAGREE.

I experienced plenty of action.

Your sweet, sweet holes were totally worth the wait.

Well I suppose the holes were just air, but by golly the pastry around the holes was unforgettable.

You were the only request by my husband, and while carrying a giant box across the Pacific is not my idea of a jolly good time, I acquiesced because I love him.  And because I really wanted a reason to order 18 donuts.

And order I did.  18 random donuts off your gloriously packed but non-descriptive menu.  I left it to the universe and magic and faith because I was in Portland and in Portland people are wild and FREEEEEEE!

I then dragged your pastries back home to Hawaii with me where they began to sweat a little bit, and by the time we ate them it had been nearly 24 hours since their purchase.

But OH the glory.  The Maple Bacon had the most mysteriously crisp and delicious bacon strips.  The grape donut was bizarre but wonderful.  The everything-else-we-had-that-I don't-know-what-they-were-called were amazing taste explosions.  Except for the Captain Crunch, which wilted terribly on the trip over, but that's not important.

What's important is how you've ruined me.

How you have ruined us.

How we are now unintentionally donut monogamous but ALAS, true to a bakery over the mother fricking sea.

Damn you.

Damn you and your not overrated deliciousness.

Good thing I'm not supposed to eat gluten anyways.

We love you.

Love,
Angela

Voodoo is a fun, eclectic bakery and the donuts did not disappoint. The wait was relatively short, just about five minutes.

I tried the no name donut (peanut butter, chocolate and rice krispies) and the maple bacon donut (self explanatory and had actual strips of bacon on it).

The donuts had a great texture and consistency, soft and chewy.

It's a good thing I don't live in Portland because I would be eating these donuts a lot more often.

Friday night and feeling melllooooooo this is it.  What is better after a hard night of partying and feeling that overwhelming desire to eat an entire fridge.  Settle for voodoo doughnuts instead its the bomb.  Bacon and maple mmmmmm  mmmmmm. Don't forget to get a doughnut for a bum or suffer the curse.
love this place .waiting time is to long but dont care it is  best doughnuts

A must visit when you come across Portland!!! DO NOT MISS IT 
One of our coworkers brought 3 full boxes of mixed Voodoo Doughnut :) 
I did not try all of them. However at that day I had the chance to try three of them I will list them form the best to the worst he he 
First position is The Loop with 5 stars I will get some before I go back to Cali. I will call it falling in love from the first bite :D
The second position is Captain my Captain   with 4 stars 
And the last one is Chocolate cake with three stars. 
I gave it 5 stars for the LOOP, the first human-donut love :P
enjoy
Everyone loves Voodoo! It's a long wait so be prepared but they're great to bring back on the plane and give to friends.

Voodoo doughnuts are by far the best doughnuts I have tasted.  The doughnut itself was fine blend of airyness and cake like texture.  Now the toppings were just wickedly out of this world.  A must try if ever in Portland!
Fun!!!   Definitely buy a dozen and eat as many as you can.    Definitely better than I imagined.    Thank you

Just another thing that I love about Oregon...Voodoo Donut! This was one place that I had on my agenda as a must do since I missed it the last time I was there. I first tried the original location on SW 3rd Ave. However, the line was waayyy to long so I went for the Davis Street location. Score! The line wasn't too bad at all. I felt like a kid all over again as I looked into the big window looking at all the different donuts that I could pick. By the time I got up to the counter I was so ready to order....I went for the Bacon Maple Bar and also the Memphis Mafia donut. 

The Bacon Maple Bar is as good as it sounds. The crisp bacon offered up the perfect texture and flavor to the smooth sweet taste of the maple bar. Honestly, I could have eaten around 5 of these in one sitting. 

After wolfing down the Bacon Maple Bar, I dug into the Memphis Mafia donut which is a huge donut reminiscent of an apple fritter, except this delight has chunks of banana, cinammon, peanut butter. chocolate, chocolate chips, and peanuts. There were a lot of tastes going on, but it was insanely good. It was so sweet that I couldn't eat it all at once. However, in all fairness I did start eating this right after the Bacon Maple Bar so my body was probably in shock from all the sugar. 

Both were good, but my favorite was the simpler Bacon Maple Bar. They have an extensive menu so the next time I am up there I am planning on giving the Voodoo Doll donut a try, and of course I have to get that Bacon Maple donut again.

Should you go? YES! Just remember, if you don't want to wait in as long of a line consider the Davis location. There is also a parking lot in that location as well.

I love you Voodoo Donut.

Though I have never been to Voodoo Doughnut, I have been lucky enough to try one of their delicious donuts thanks to a friend who visited. My friend ordered a dozen donuts and brought them back to LA with her and I was lucky enough to try the maple bacon donut.

First off, I am extremely impressed with how well the donuts traveled. The box was in perfect condition, as were the donuts. This is a great tip for all who visit -- donuts make excellent souvenirs for friends and family! Second of all, even though the donut was a day old, it tasted as fresh as could be. I was shocked at how delicious and moist the donut still was, after the time and travel. 

I loved my donut! It wasn't too sweet and the addition of the bacon was a wonderful touch. Next time I am in Portland, I will visit and try all the other cool looking donuts they offer!

Amazing doughnuts!  Not much of a sweet tooth person, but one bite of the ODB (Old Dirty B...) confirmed to me what most people have said so far.  Even eating it a day old was still good.
The store is pretty small and the line seems to be long a lot...but they are very quick in getting people through.  Also, I can't believe it is open 21 hours (6am-3am)!

A trip to Portland is not complete without stopping here. Is there anything left to say about these doughnuts that haven't already been said? Probably not. So I'll just let you know that I love showing my Voodoo Doughnut pride by wearing their tees. You do not even know how many eyebrows are raised when I wear my "The Magic is in the Hole" tee.
These doughnuts never disappoint! Always a must visit when in Portland!  So many choices, and all were wonderful!!

The line was pretty long but I went at 10:30 on a Sunday morning and I only waited about 15 mins! Super fast and friendly service. I'm vegan so I was a little afraid that they wouldn't have any vegan options but they have plenty! So happy I stopped!

Yeah, this place lives up to all the buzz surrounding it.  It is all of what they say and more.  The line is long but the wait is worth it!!!  We got a variety but my favorite is the glazed and the grape.  OMG.  The dough they use to create these pillows of heaven in your mouth is out of this world.  The servers were so delightful and friendly.  I love this place.  Why can't California have places like these????  Business idea - California people...  Get a voodoo donut in Cali stat!!

Yes, I was coming from a bachelorette party. Yes, I was enebriated.

Nevertheless, I have never tasted donuts like this in Texas. There was a smooth, buttery texture with just the right amount of sweetness. On a Thursday night, the line moved quickly and I actually used my credit card to pay, so not sure why some people had to pay cash only.

The Homer Simpson donut ruled them all. I threw the rest of the donuts at a person during a fight later that night.. Don't do that.

The line was a good 20 minutes, but I was so fascinated by the decor that it went really quick! It's beautiful in there!!! I had no idea what I wanted, but the sweet woman at the register did not rush me AT ALL. She gave suggestions and didn't ask me to hurry even though there were so many people behind me. They had so many options! Everything is made fresh, they ask for your order and take the box to the back & pack your stuff in. Comes in this cute pink box! She even told me how to wrap it so it would stay fresh on my plane ride to NYC. It still was amazing after my long flight! Very, very impressed. Even the art in the bathroom was beautiful! I really want to go back to Portland just to head over there again!! And oh yeah, they have Vegan options! Love it there! 

It's open 24 hours, so you have no excuse!! Make your way over! So worth it. Just keep in mind, cash only!

The donuts were amazing, especially the bacon maple bar.  It is a MUST when you are in Portland.  There was a long line but it moved really fast and it gave you time to pick out your donut (or two...or three).  HIGHLY recommend it.
Have one in Orlando Florida so knew would be good. We had to get something from there so we could say we were there

From the first moment I heard someone tell me that when I go to Portland I need to stop here, but careful because the line is out the door, to now years later where I have made it a ritual to go to Voodoo Donuts every-time I'm in Portland, I love these donuts. Though some of the quirkier and hilarious ones may not be the most tasty to me, I would bring the "Voodoo Dozen" back to my co-works near Seattle and they loved them all. My favorite is the dense sprinkle one. I'm not even sure of the name but the batter is exquisite. 

If you are first timer here, well, enjoy because even if you don't love the taste of donuts, the novelty is amazing. This place is unique and like I said, it is now tradition to grab a donut here every time I go to (or through) Portland. So, go check them out!

Love the donuts here and would go back at anytime.  Donuts are absolutely worth the wait that you have to get in the door.  I love the dynamic in the shop and the attitude of the staff is wonderful.  I really like to stop through whenever I can and will continue to do so!

Went for a midnight run to avoid the line. Doughnuts were as fresh as you can hope at 12 AM. Staff is super friendly. 
Must have before you leave Portland.
Cash only. Seriously.

The line was quick. It only took about 15 minutes to get through the line that was out the door. I was expecting them to be mediocre, with the main attraction being the presentation. That was not the case. The donuts, while all comical and decorative, were actually DELICIOUS. I ordered the Portland Creme, which was delicious. And the Dirty Old Bastard, it had AMAZING chocolate creme like I've never had as well as Oreos and a peanut butter drizzle.

If you like doughnuts then you owe it to yourself to try this place ! Not only is it unique and unusual but their doughnuts actually taste fantastic ! They are some of the best I have ever tasted. Be prepared to stand in a long line outside but it's worth it. Besides, it's Portland.... there is always something to watch or see while your waiting.
I highly recommend giving this place a try at least once.

I had to stop by the original Voodoo while visiting Portland. I'm not huge on donuts but I had to give it a try!
I don't regret it--enjoyed them both! Voodoo Doughnut really surprised me. I hate jelly filled doughnuts, but this raspberry filling was AMAZING! The hibiscus donut was a surprise too sweet then tart at the end. Big doughnuts you get your money's worth. Quick, fast service but be ready at the counter. I hear there is normally a line, but mid week, mid day very short line within the building still. 
Give them a try!

Best doughnuts ever? 
Maybe, maybe not. The doughnuts were great, but the difference between the worst doughnuts I've ever had and best doughnuts I've ever had is relatively small. Even bad doughnuts are still pretty good.

Most fun doughnut place ever?
Absolutely

Most family-friendly establishment to be adjacent to a strip club?
Almost assuredly

---

My girlfriend and I were visiting Portland, so we decided to stop by the famous Voodoo Doughnuts for a late night snack. The line was out the door but not quite as long as I was picturing that it might be beforehand. We only waited in line for about 10-12 minutes before reaching the front of the line. 

In the mean time, we were fortunate to see someone taking on the Tex-Ass doughnut challenge in which one has a mere 80 seconds to engulf a Texas-sized doughnut roughly equal to six normal-sized doughnuts. This man made the challenge seem remarkably simple as he proceeded to inhale the doughnut while the staff chanted "Eat that ass!" repeatedly and his children jumped up and down yelling their own G-rated words of encouragement. He made the challenge seem so easy, that I almost mentally talked myself into doing it, before realizing how silly I was. I saw that guy sitting outside afterwards, and the look on his face seemed to betray more than a little regret and perhaps an upset stomach. 

My girlfriend and I ended up ordering five different doughnuts:
1. Captain my captain doughnut - I really enjoyed the crunchiness of the cereal and the textural contrast it provided to the fluffiness of the doughnut. The vanilla frosting really made the doughnut incredible. This is what a complete breakfast should be. 
2. Portland cream doughnut - The Bavarian cream was rich and decadent. I think the chocolate frosting complemented the cream really well too.
3, 4. Marshall Mathers doughnut and the Diablos Rex - My girlfriend ordered these. I didn't try either one, but she said they were good.
5. Glazed doughnut - Overall, the raised doughnuts were light and fluffy. The glaze was sweet and simple. 

This place takes cash only, but there are definitely ATM machines around the area. 

If you are visiting Portland and love doughnuts (the second qualifier is probably unnecessary), you should check out Voodoo Doughnuts.

To Voodoo Doughnuts, I say: "Now go do that voodoo that you do so well."

Wonderful and delicious donuts. The staff was very kind and explained their COVID rules to us. The coffee wasn't ready but when it was the cashier brought it out to us. Do yourself a favor and order online. You'll get through the line a lot faster ;)

A Portland icon! I mean really, who thinks of the Portland food scene without thinking of Voodoo!? To be honest though, probably my favorite doughnuts around. They are some seriously good quality doughnuts.

Beyond the doughnut though, Voodoo is about the experience. You are downtown experiencing the city and ordering a Old Dirty Bastard? I mean who thought you would ever be politically correct by saying you want and OLD DIRTY BASTARD!? Well at Voodoo its the right thing to do. Enjoy the scenery and shop. There is no glam or glitter, just a bomb doughnut!

Bottom line-- I didn't put the Old Dirty Bastard in my review for fun, it's a must!
Really amazing vegan donut options. Loved the vibe and super funky decor, plus the donuts were so yummy!! I got the "dirt" which is cookies n cream and it was perfect.

I am not a huge donut fan but OMG this place is FIRE! Loved every donut i tried!

Try-chocolate voodoo doll(raspberry filled!), the homer, maple bar, blueberry cake. 

Take a box home if your from out of town, surprisingly there good a day or two after!

Visiting Portland we made our way to VooDoo Doughnuts. We were greeted by the best doughnut connoisseur to help us with our order. There was no line at 7:30pm on a COVID Monday night. We ordered 4 donuts, a water plus tip came to $11ish. The donuts are worth the price! The only thing, the merchandise stock was low & I could not get the shirt I wanted.
All in all, try the delicious & unique treats. There is at least one for everyone, even for the vegans!

If you want to skip the line, swing by in the early morning! Stopped in before 6am to get some doughnuts for me and coworkers to start friday off the right way.
The employees were very friendly and also pleasantly efficient so I was able to get everything I needed and got out the door to get to work which I appreciated. The doughnuts were fresh and tasty, with a wide variety to choose from. I always look forward to whatever seasonal or limited special doughnuts they have. Today I got the Hi Tea (earl grey with hibiscus drizzle) and was not disappointed!
A solid experience all around from the shop atmosphere to employees to the actual doughnuts.

This is more of a novelty doughnut shop, rather than a gourmet doughnut shop.

We walked by on a Saturday afternoon, and the line looked crazy, so we stopped by Sunday morning at 8:45 am, and waited for 45 minutes. Everyone was super chill, waiting to get their sugar fix for the day.

I tried their Bacon Maple Bar and raspberry-filled Voodoo Doll. Both were excellent and very satisfying. Most of the doughnuts are sugar bombs, so be warned.

Tip #1 - View their website beforehand to see what doughnuts they have. They have QR codes posted outside the shop, so you can pull up their menu while you're waiting in line.

Tip #2 - A friend gave this piece of advice afterwards. You go in and buy a bunch of doughnuts and just have a bite of each. I guess that means you can give the rest to some of the homeless people in the area. The doughnut shop is in a seedy part of town.

Remember, it's a silly doughnut shop. Don't take it so darn seriously.

This place is very touristy, but definitely worth the visit if coming to Portland. Open 24/7 but husband came at 6:30 am and there was barely any line. Otherwise it stretches out the door. 

The decor and donuts are very visually stimulating. We got a voodoo donut (filled with raspberry blood?), chocolate glaze, regular glaze, old dirty bastard (peanut butter Oreo), maple bacon. He thought the chocolate glaze was the best he's ever had. I really liked the old dirty bastard. The voodoo donut is a novelty. The maple bacon was the weak link. 

Overall a very fun, cheap, necessary tourist spot. Five donuts plus a coffee = $10. Just be aware the location there are a lot of homeless outside.

WOW I thought going here that I was simply paying for the sign and tourist trap area but man oh man these donuts were something else. After hearing mixed reviews I can safely say that these are the best donuts in Portland wayyyyy better then blue star AND a better price too! I got the voodoo donut, the butter fingering, the Homer Simpson and the Memphis mafia. And ALLLL were awesome the Memphis Mafia was about the size of a small pie and is LOADED with chocolate/caramel, the Homer Simpson was fluffy and a great frosting on it, the voodoo donut was STUFFEd with jelly and the butter fingering had such a great texture.

I am really sad to see this is place is getting less than four stars with NEARLY 10,000 reviews!

I was told on my visit to Portland I needed to stop in and try this place. 
The interior, and exterior, is super eclectic - famous icons in stained glass, hilarious donut names, including the Cock n Balls! - and they sell Voo Doo Donuts underwear... The inside is really neat and funky.

Served immediately and presented with a menu while the girl behind the counter asked me what flavor profile I typically like - I went with the maple bacon bar because people raved about it and I *love* salty sweet combinations and *I HAD TO* get the voodoo doll, filled with strawberry preserves and a pretzel stick in his check, just for a photo op and to try. I brought that home to my travel-mate and we ate some after a night of drinking wine. Hah!

Anyway - that maple bacon bar was legit one of the most amazing donuts I have ever had. Crispy, fresh, non-greasy, bacon on top of a maple glazed long john. GOODNESS GRACIOUS... I need VooDoo to ship those bad boys to St. Louis or I need someone here to try to do something similar!

Enjoyed the experience - must see if you are headed to Portland.
It has a cute atmosphere and a large selection of donuts. Even with a line we got our donuts very quickly. Definitely worth a try!
We were lucky to get in with no line.  We ended up having way more doughnuts than what we went in for...oops.  They were all very delicious!

I showed here in the late afternoon and waited about 15 minutes to order.  This place is uniquely decorated and has some outrageous flair.  The showpiece here is the cock-n-balls doughnut that obviously shaped and is filled with Bavarian Cream.

My group picked two donuts (doughnuts) a piece and ended up with the following: Grape Ape, Bacon Maple Bar, Voodoo Bubble (2), Old Dirty Bastard, Chocolate Ring, Dirt doughnut and a powdered sugar jelly-filled.  I personally ate the Grape Age (it has Grape Kool-Aid mix in the frosting) and the maple bacon bar.  I really enjoyed both of them.  I thought initially that crumpled bacon would be better on the bar but the bacon strips across the top were perfect.  Everyone else also enjoyed their items.

The product was very good and priced appropriately.  I initially thought that these were a little expensive but my mind was quickly changed after a visit to Blue Star.  Just a tip that the surrounding area has an abundance of vagrants that will sing "Somewhere Over the Rainbow" in the deepest, scratchiest voice possible for donations.

A lot of people might say this is a tourist trap - I still loved it! I love the funky decor, fun names, and donuts are tasty! It's got character and the made me think about opening a fun donut place in Michigan.

I got the "gay bar" which was custard filled and vanilla icing with some fruit loops on top. I also got one with chocolate icing, oreo cookies, PB sauce. I liked the second one more! Usually oreos get kind of stale on top and keep falling off but this was so perfectly done. Fresh and nicely balanced. I would definitely want to try more kinds of donuts next time!

When in Rome, right? 

I'm aware that this place is quite touristy and may not be the go-to doughnut shop of choice for locals, but I had heard about this place for years, and I had to come to the original when the bf and I were in town a few weeks ago. The lines are long, and most of the people that will be waiting on line with you will probably be a tourist, like yourself. The lines did move steadily enough, though, but it would probably help you and your fellow patrons if you had made up your mind about what to order before getting to the register. Which really baffled me: people would be waiting on line for 20+ minutes and only at the register, start to think about what to order.

Anyway, this location seems to be a doughnut churning factory. The bf and I ended up getting one of their voodoo dolls, of course, along with a bacon maple bar, a Oh Captain, My Captain doughnut, and a buttermilk bar. I also got one of their coffees, which was a pretty good cup of coffee. We saw at one of the tables outside the establishment as the inside was way too packed with people to try to even eat our treats at. I tried the voodoo doll first, and it was a pretty good doughnut: the dough was fresh and yeasty, and the frosting, while being pretty sweet, paired well with the jelly filling. The bf loved his bacon maple bar, and the other two, we had the next day. 

Was it the best doughnut I ever had? No, but it was still pretty good. It's silly and maybe a bit overrated, but it's pretty darn Portland-esque, and if you're really bothered with the lines, you can try to go really early in the morning as it is open 24 hours on most days. I enjoyed their silliness and would tell other tourists to come swing by if they happened to be in town, too.

Voodoo is a Portland institution if you ask me. 
Back when I was in high school Voodoo used to be open from 6p.m. to 6 a.m., and they used to sell doughnuts filled with pepto bismol and nyquil. On my last trip to Portland I stumbled into voodoo late, and it was like nothing had ever changed! My personal favorite is the no name: peanut butter, rice crispies, and chocolate sauce. It's awesome! Though the one with coco puffs is a close second. 
They say it best: "The magic is in the hole"

Finally got to try Voodoo Doughnut in DT PDX on a visit. We tried the downtown location on 3rd. No line, no wait. 

As we walked inside the bright colored wall paper immediately got our attention followed with a rotating display of their signature doughnuts. Although they do have gluten free options I decided to try "The Homer" and my friend tried "The Old Dirty Bastard". The Homer is a glazed doughnut with pink icing And sprinkles on top, which was mouth watering, and the Old Dirty Bastard was a peanut butter tasting donut with Oreo pieces on top. These were pretty good and tasty!

Also tried their hot chocolate which was a good option considering how cold it was. Would definitely come back to try some of their other donut options!

La magia de las mejores donas y su local original. S, Voodoo Doughnut es lo mximo, de las mejores donas que vayan a probar en su vida, las cuales nacieron en esta pequea pero genial esquina de Portland.

Este es el primer local de la marca, sper copado pero tambin chiquito, aunque tiene una mesas en la vereda por si quieren comer y tomar algo en el lugar.

Para los que no las conocen estas donas son una delicia, encima tienen una enorme variedad de gustos y hacen todo tipo de donas especiales. La Portland cream es la gloria. Eso s, cash only.

The doughnuts were awesome. The music was fantastic as well. Fantastic atmosphere in the store. 
They have a large selection of doughnuts in all shapes and all colors. I'd definitely come back here when I am back in Portland.

Oh, they were also shooting a commercial right outside of the store as we were in there which was also cool.

Yeahhh. Cool cool cooool

This was a must stop for us on our trip to Portland! We woke up bright and early to beat the huge rush on a Saturday morning. We were thrilled that we were able to walk right in and get our doughnuts! We ordered several of their famous Voodoo doll and a variety of various other doughnuts. All were delicious!

I was visiting Portland from North Dakota... you can't stay in Portland without checking out VooDoo doughnut!  We went to Voodoo mid-morning on a weekday and were able to walk right in and order.  They had a great selection of delicious looking doughnuts (they all looked so good I didn't know which ones to have!).  I finally chose the famous Voodoo doll doughnut and a blueberry doughnut.  I thought they both were delicious.  They have many types of doughnuts so you won't get bored going back there again and again... needless to say, I can't wait to go back!

Lines lines and lines. This place is so popular, get ready to wait in line for one of their crazy donuts. They were very quick with their service though when I think about it since most people were ordering up to boxes and boxes of donuts for the entire duration of their trip. I'm not a donut person. I don't particularly like them much at all but this place offered me a variety I couldn't refuse. I wish I had the ability to try them all but I just couldn't. So I went with what was called the memphis? Yummy banana fritter with chocolate and peanut butter drizzle topped with chocolate chips. It was crunchy on outside and super fluffy on inside. I had to take it down in three days because it was so sweet and huge. I really wish I had the ability to try more. Please visit this place. I highly recommend.

This will be my 3rd location of a Voodoo Donut I've been to across the US and glad it's the OG! There was quite a line for a Friday afternoon but service was good and friendly, and was super patient with my indecisive partner. Things Voodoo does better than anybody as far as I'm concerned: maple bacon bars have the greatest balance of bacon and maple frosting, and their non filled donuts are always perfectly textured. I got the Grape Ape, WHICH I LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVED!!!! Not for the feint of heart but if you love the taste of Grape Ape or kind of artificially sweet/sour grape flavor, this is your donut. I still maintain their apple fritter is downright the best thing they make and will definitely get next time in addition to a maple bacon bar and Grape Ape.

We'd heard a lot about VooDoo Donuts and their famous C n B donut.  It might be the best thing I saw in Portland ! My friend and I got six donuts and we loved them all!  The C n B was awesome!  She's from TX, so we had to try the Tex-Ass.  Oh my gosh, it was so airy and fresh.  It was also the biggest donut I've ever seen.  We ate on it for two days and it didn't get stale.  I love their pink boxes too!  We heard there would be a line, but on Tuesday morning it was easy to get in and place our order and get out.  There were even vacancies on the patio right outside, with pink tables!  It is famous for a reason.  Voodoo Donuts is crazy good!

Hard to beat these guys.   They have so many varieties of donuts that it takes awhile to figure out what you want.   Everyone ends up standing around the display cases drooling on themselves and they forget to order.  As a result, the line moves really slowly.   So take your time, grab a napkin to drool, and have patience in the line.    Only drag is that there is no place to sit down and enjoy.   Unless you take it to stump town next  door and graB a coffee.

Last week, my boyfriend and I were in Portland for vacation. I've been to Portland once before a few years ago, and I knew from that trip that I had to take him to Voodoo! We went on a Friday afternoon and the lines weren't bad at all. We just got a classic glazed doughnut and then of course a voodoo doll doughnut. Considering how popular this place is, we thought the doughnuts were really reasonably priced and totally worth the hype. They were delicious! 

The inside of the store is really cool as well, and the staff were super friendly. I'm sure I'll come here every time we go to Portland :)

Shockingly, we walked right in. There were only a few people in line. This was at 10 am on a Wednesday. The place is adorable, of course, with a huuuuuge selection of vegan donuts. The cashier could not have been friendlier or more cheerful. Donuts were fabulous. We need one in Philadelphia!

As a Portland visitor, I would recommend this place as a must-go for any tourists! For natives, well, I'm damn jealous of you because my city only has a Krispy Kreme. I love Voodoo donuts for their creative R-rated theme and grunge/punk vibe, and also their creative and delicious donuts.

I'd say the prices are a little pricier than your average donut but Voodoo's donut is worth it because its Damn good and creative. There's also cash only but no fear, they conveniently placed an atm right inside the store.

Funky tourist stop in Portland with to die for doughnuts! 

We stopped by Voodoo Doughnut about 11 AM and missed all the lines which was great. I love the quirky interior and the fact that the "Keep Portland Weird" sign is right across the street. 

Next, on to the food--- my Oreo doughnut was delicious. The interior of the doughnut was so moist and fresh --- pair that with the crunchy Oreo topping and I was in absolute sugar heaven! YUM! My two daughters also loved their doughnuts and enjoyed taking some touristy photos.

Cons-- If you're looking for a sit down full on breakfast, I'd go elsewhere as they're just about doughnuts. In addition, lines can be long here, and it's best to avoid peak hours.

Pros-- Fun atmosphere, delicious sugar laden doughnuts and cute photo spot for tourists.

PS - They are CASH ONLY.....

Stopped by here just because every person I talked to recommended trying Voodoo Doughnut when visiting Portland. It's located right near the "Keep Portland Weird" sign, and luckily when I got there the line wasn't long at all. But after purchasing my donuts, the line was already going out the door.

Although I received many recommendations for the "maple bacon" donut, I just couldn't get myself to try it haha. A lot of their donuts are a bit off, but are apparently delicious. However, I decided to play it safe & get the cap'n crunch & homer simpsons donut. They were both actually so tasty & so full of flavor. The bread wasn't too soft nor too hard, and I definitely enjoyed both of them. 

The cap'n crunch basically consisted of white frosting topped with cap'n crunch and fruity pebbles. A bit of a mouthful to bite but I loved it. The homer simpsons donut is just like the pink donuts on the tv show, with sprinkles on top. It was simple & delicious. 

I don't think I'll go out of my way if I visit Portland again for Voodoo Doughtnut, but I guess it's just kind of a "yeah I've tried Voodoo Doughnut before" kind of hype. Probably worth trying at least once if you're a tourist just like me!
I used to live in P-Town and was missing these, a friend brought some back on a road trip and they were as good as I remember them!
You must have one in your lifetime! Don't forget to bring cash though, thats all they take for payment because they are so darn busy!! Well worth the wait in line which moves pretty quick.

I was so pumped to finally go to Voodoo Donuts!!! 

We waited for 5 minutes in line and when we got to the front we saw a sign that said Cash only. UH-OH.

We walked back to our hotel, disappointed but not devastated because we had a plan! Which was for us to grab our debit card and return there to use their ATM machine and get some donuts! 

My hubby, being super duper sweet, let me stay back in the hotel room while he went back to get donuts while I watched a new episode of one of my favorite shows.

He came back with a Butterfinger donut and an apple fritter for me. First off, the fritter is the size of my face. Almost too large for a donut. I took a bite and realized what the fuss was about. SO GOOD! I couldn't eat more than a few bites and saved it for the next morning. STILL GOOD.

Stop by on your next P-town trip and REMEMBER to take CASH!

This place has a great fun atmosphere and offers a nice outdoor seating area! Depending on when you come, there may be a line. It moves pretty fast though. They have delicious donuts that don't break the bank. I got 2 donuts for around $4, one being the famous Voodoo Doll. Some of the donuts are huge! Our group tried the Voodoo Doll (choc icing with raspberry filling), Maple with real cream, Maple & Bacon, Coconut Mango, and Plain. All were really good!

Definitely a must visit! Store is so cute and all the donuts are great  Just get the voodoo dozen and trust them to choose for you bcs they won't let you choose but me and my friends were all happy with every single one of them :D

Came to the DTP location with my girlfriend and could not/would not share!! The donuts are that good... you won't want to share  totally recommend and worth the wait. There will be a line out the door but I'm telling you it's worth it!

Stopped in on a Saturday morning and we were lucky enough to get there when the line was short.  The selection of doughnut flavors was creative and it was definitely difficult to choose which one to try.  We settled on the cherry filled with lemon glaze and the Portland creme.  Both were delicious, not too heavy or sweet.  Wish we would have made it back a second time.

Fresh and creative as usual. Stop by every time we're in town from Cali. 

The High Tea was DELISH! And the Peach Mango was killer!

Lived up to the hype! Only stood in line for about 10 minutes and shared six donuts with two others. Loved the Homer Simpson, Lemon Crueller, Oreo and Chocolate with Vanilla Custard center. Not quite as impressed with the cake donuts (toasted coconuts and coconut with the peanut butter center). Would definitely be back!
I'm not usually a doughnut eater but I make an exception for Voodoo.

I've wanted to visit voodoo donuts for years, so glad I finally crossed it off my bucket list and it did not disappoint! I've seen photos of the long lines, but on my two visits I had wait time of less than 3 minutes! The menu is huge and overwhelming but so unique. For example, I've never considered a guava donut to be a thing, but it was delicious. So good and not sickly sweet. Their plain glaze was no joke the best glazed I've ever had. It was the perfect amount of sweet, so fluffy and it melted in your mouth, amazing! I don't think the area is as "rough" as others say in the comments, I felt perfectly safe and my first visit was at about 10 pm.

Worth the hype. Super fresh yummy donuts with good flavor. I got the voodoo doll and hibiscus donut. Soooooo good. When I went it wasn't super busy and I didn't have to wait. It is a small shop though so I imagine it gets pretty crazy during the busy time. I thought the donuts were pretty decently priced for how big they are and how well known the place is. It is cash only!! Would definitely go back. It's a must stop for tourist. But keep that in mind, although local, it's very touristy.

When you are in Portland this is somewhere you have to stop by. They have so many unique donuts that you must try! My favorite is the maple bar and maple bacon oh soooo good!! You also have to try the penis donut which is humongous! It's like 3 donuts in one. The line gets kind of long so don't go on a rainy day..

I know doughnuts. I eat them all the time. Doughnuts are my guilty pleasure and there is nothing better than a freshly fried doughnut. Voodoo didn't disappoint. I ordered the mango tango and the apple fritter. The fritter was the best I've ever had. Light, fluffy and not too dense and greasy as many are. The mango tango was sweet and tropical. We went back a second time and I ordered the same 2 again. I would have went back again but they were closed our last two days in Portland...12/25 and 12/26.
Great donuts and even better service. Always a pleasure. Whether going with a premium donut or a basic, you can never go wrong! I prefer the cake donuts. Keep up the great work!
From Los Angeles to Orlando to the OG spot in Portland you can't go wrong with Voodoo. Complete perfection. My new favorite is definitely the Graham Slam, just like S'mores. Yummy!!!

Very mix of flavors, of donuts. Not ur orginal chocolate glazed
 The funkiest place, with the most unthinkable medleys of creative taste
 I ate mango tango... so good
My hubby ate shuckles (I think the whata ot call) but it was eating a ice cream drumstick on a donut... pretty cool.
Fun, quirky, and a nice sweet pick me up for some silly donuts. Everyone was rad, people were having fun, no issues. Will return again on a future trip!

I'll start by saying, I never really understood the Krispy Kreme craze ... Any doughnut will be amazing if it is piping hot out of the fryer.... But, these Voo Doo Doughnuts were still delicious hours later... I had a maple bar with a slice of bacon & a chocolate bar shaped like a ghoul from an old Betty Boop cartoon! Too delicious .. I also adored the pink pastry box with a skeletons and Voo Doo inspired artwork. Well done Voo Doo!, also fun to stand outside and see the Keep Portland Weird sign across the street ... I hoped the cast from Portlandia would come bouncing by and I would end up an extra in the background .. Alas, that didn't happen but, we enjoyed the rare Portland sunshine in March , city sounds and tasty doughnuts .

This is not my first time at Voodoo Doughnut but it is my first time at one in Portland! I love their extensive selection of doughnuts and how cool the place looks. The Portland location wasn't very busy at the time we went (6:30pm on a Wed.) but I know it gets busy at other times because they have metal barricades that make a long line outside the front door. The location is kind of near some bars so it is probably common for drunks to grab a doughnut before going home! I got the chocolate peanut butter raised doughnut which was really good. My family got the Froot Loops, maple bacon log, and the Oreo vanilla raised doughnuts. I would love to go back and try more flavors! The prices are a bit high for doughnuts but then again these are fancier doughnuts then what you'd get at a Dunkin'. They are more like desserts then a breakfast meal. Overall, I highly recommend trying this place out!
Voodoo Doughnut is a must when traveling through Portland! ARRRRRRR matey, the best Doughnuts this side of the Atlantic so don't hesitate. Wait in that line, bring your cash YAAAAAR

I'm not a sweets person, but these are some seriously good freakin donuts.

We came pretty late at night so there was almost no line, otherwise we would have went to the less famous location. I got the Gay Bar: raised yeast doughnut filled with Bavarian cream, topped with vanilla frosting, and some Fruit Loops. Also the Cinnamon Sugar cake. Top notch, fresh, moist, perfectly sweet. This is worth the hype, these might have been the best donuts I've ever had.

We had leftovers we kept in the box, and put them in the car when we drove to go hiking the next day. Someone spotted us once we got there and came over to yell at us: "Voodoo Doughnuts?!?! You better hide those! A mugger will take those before they take your wallet!". I really enjoy you Portland, thanks :)

It's been a month and I'm still drooling just thinking about these donuts. While I was pretty boring and only tried two of their flavors while I was in town, they blew Blue Star donuts out of the water, and their chocolate glaze is the best I've had. I came three times (in three days, impressive) during my trip, and each time the wait was never longer than five minutes. The staff was neither helpful nor rude, a two minute experience doesn't matter to me when you're handing me freshly baked goodness that I'll only get once every three years or so. I brought a box back for my parents and my professional chef dad who usually criticizes everything said it's the best donut he's ever had and it was "perfect." Wow. 

Parking can be annoying as all of the spaces surrounding the area are not only metered, but most likely taken. I suggest parking it around the corner to avoid the marked-up lot across the street. Please do yourself a favor and come while you're in Portland.

Yes, yes, & yes.
I don't know what these haters are talking about.
I know there is a HUGE hype about this place, but it's still some bomb ass doughnuts. Comparable to the softness, warmth, and deliciousness of Krispy Kreme.
My first doughnut was the Bacon Maple Bar. So damn good! $3 and well worth it.
My second was the Old Dirty Bastard which had caramel, PB, oreo, and I think one other thing. It was the perfect doughnut. I'm salivating.
Lastly, I got a box to go and had another Bacon Maple and the Captain Crunch.
The staff is HILARIOUS and so great!
It's CASH ONLY! Go to the ATM. EAT a doughnut here. Don't be so snotty.

Oh and the lines are not bad at all. Ten minutes was the longest I waited and that was on Sunday after dinner time. That can be expected anywhere.
Great place for outrageous sugar and carb rush. Get there and expect to wait with all the others seeking a sugary high.

A unique Portland experience delicious varieties of donuts but you can literally get my 5 gallons bucket yes the line usually goes out the door but it is worth it and you will meet lots of interesting people in line
Ok, don't give too many 5 stars but Voodoo Doughnuts is worthy!  When in Portland, this is a must stop!  Over the top doughnuts.

Wow!!! By far the best doughnuts we've ever had! We tried seven different kinds and they were all amazing! The Portland cream was our favorite with the maple cream a close second. The restaurant itself was so cute! The line went fast and they're open 24/7! Must eat here while in Portland! We wish they shipped, we'd eat them all the time!

Classic tourist stop! We pulled into the shop completely empty around 5 in the morning on a Saturday. I asked the worker (I think his name is Will) what donut he would recommend filled. He recommended the David's star and I also ordered the mango tango. The David's star wasn't over bearing raspberry filled, good for an everyday order. The Mango Tango was filled with mango jelly, vanilla icing, and tangy sprinkle topping. The service was amazing, the store was clean, and the doughnuts were fantastic!
Great place! Waited a max of 10 min but totally worth it. The donut was yummy. Totally recommend taking pictures and enjoying a voodoo doll on the patio

This was our first stop after checking into our hotel. We must have been lucky with the timing because we didn't have to wait in line very long. I wasn't prepared in what I wanted to try but the cashier was super helpful. My husband and I picked a few donuts to try. Our box contained an apple fritter, a blueberry cake, captain my captain, a traditional cream filled with chocolate icing and a chocolate cake donut with butterfinger. All of the donuts were unique and true to their flavors. My cream filled donut was awesome. The cream was super smooth and filled the entire donut. The chocolate icing was a nice compliment to the cream filling. They also offer the cream filled donut with a maple frosting. The butterfinger cake donut was a traditional cake donut with crumbled butterfinger on top. The crumbles gave you a nice butterfinger taste with each bite. My husband tried each of the other three. He really enjoyed the captain crunch topped donut. It was a super fluffy yeast donut with vanilla icing and captain crunch cereal. He ate the whole thing. We couldn't actually finish all of our selections so we have snacks for later now.

So many places are overhyped that it's always a joy when the food you're eating actually lives up to all the hype.

-- Bacon Maple Bar: The best doughnut ever!  This might actually be the best fried food ever (and that's saying a lot).  The bacon was super crunchy, and it went oh so well with the fluffy yeast doughnut and maple icing.  Imagine eating pancakes, syrup, and bacon - sort of like that, but all in one easy to eat doughnut.

-- Blueberry Cake Doughnut: Very, very blueberry.  Right up your alley if you love blueberry muffins.  Especially light and moist for a cake doughnut.  This definitely beats out the Top Pot version.

Minor complaints: Cash only and no place to sit down and eat.
It has a cute atmosphere and a large selection of donuts. Even with a line we got our donuts very quickly. Definitely worth a try!
Thank goodness our favorite donut place is open 24/7! So lucky to snag the mascot with the pink eyes. Haven't decided if the fun is trying to decide which donuts to select or actually eating them.
Voodoo doughnut was cool. It wasn't the doughnut, but the people who where hella down to earth and pretty good.
They are NO LONGER cash only!! Come even if you just have debit/ credit cards with you.

Phenomenal. Just phenomenal.
I woke up and walked to this placd in the morning from the hostel. Nice little walk. It was early, only about 5 people there. They had tons of vegan options. And REAL donuts, not cake donuts. I cant even recall all the flavors I got... bit remembering that my day was just starting and I didnt need a whole box! My favorite was still simply the white with chocolate frosting. Outside I met another Canadian who was passing through and had headd this was one of the places you have to come. I think this place is open like all night. I went back to get more the evening I left for my plane home. The place was packed!! Definitely a spot you must check out if in Portland. Im still having cravings!! #vegan
Excellent! Portland cream filled the best!  Definitely worth the wait.  Reasonably priced!
For a donut place, who can't rate Voodoo one of the best.  They are soft, fluffy, and have style and a personality.  Always a line to get a donut.

I mean, it's Voodoo. This place is a Portland institution, and at this point, it's basically a cultural icon. I personally think that Blue Star has a better dough thanks to its brioche recipe, but Voodoo's fun offerings are always a treat. I usually order the voodoo donut and a cock-n-balls; I've never been disappointed by either.

If you're visiting later in the day or on a weekend, brace yourself for a longish wait.

I recommend grabbing a seat on the picnic benches on the side of the building to enjoy your donuts in the great outdoors, then wandering around in the Old Town area.

The hype is real about this place and I completely understand why. We were visiting Portland for one of our best friend's weddings and happened to be with another couple we are also best friend's with. My friend just kept telling me how we HAD to go have Voodoo Doughnut and how it's basically a staple of the the city. 

Boy, am I sure glad we made it a point to stop here. The line was out the door and almost wrapped around the building. I HAD to have it now. Even though the line was long, we didn't wait too long to order. I had the doughnut named after Eminem (not sure the name of it, but it was very catchy). It had a bunch of MnMs on it (very punny, something that really gets me).

Here we go. My first Voodoo Doughnut. Was it going to be as good as they say? Heck yeah it was! The doughnut was sweet but not too sweet that I couldn't finish it. It was SO GOOD! The hype was real. 

We even saw a couple people on our plane home that had boxes of doughnuts they were taking home. And I just smiled from afar and totally understood.

Second visit here, the doughnuts are such fun and are pretty good!!! Finally got the blunt, last time it was sold out. LOVE the maple bacon though 

I've been lucky and haven't had to wait in a long line, but the wait I did have, wasn't bad and the employees are fairly quick with their service. 

I've been to their other location too, the other has places to sit.

Always a must visit when coming to Portland. Of course when we went on a Saturday afternoon, the line wrapped around a fewww times around... I honestly lost count. I think the best time to come is late late at night (: happy travels!
This is my third time going to Voodoo donuts (been to the restaurant at Universal Studios) and always delicious!! I love the Loop donut the most.

Like so many things in Portland Voodoo is a unique experience. I'm glad I live far enough away it's inconvenient or I'd have a serious addiction. Everytime they raise the "weird" bar it just makes me want to jump higher!
Donuts! Not expensive and very very tasty. We got a box full and ate them all day long. The fruit loop one was my favorite. The Portland Creme pretty tasty too.

Believe the hype! The doughnuts at Voodoo are awesome.
