Our kids were talking about how they don't leave the filmy residue on the roof of your mouth from the frosting that other store bought doughnuts do. We agree. The combinations are killer, and unique. Everything about Voodoo's doughnuts are superb.
I came to to iconic donut shop and it's so retro and cool. So glad I came here for the first time ever I had the voodoo donut and man was it the best donut I've ever tried, WORTH IT

Definitely touristy spot. Tried going yesterday (Saturday around 12) and line was around the corner. Went this morning (Sunday 8a) and the line was only AT the door and made it through line in about 20min. On the way out the line started to wrap along the side of the building. Looks like the earlier the better.

For $18 you can get a dozen donuts (voodoo dozen) - they pick your flavors but you really can't go wrong.  So many delicious flavors and it's kinda nice not having to choose.  All the donuts we got were flavorful and I'm not really even a fan of donuts.  The homer donut was a nice strawberry flavor and the one tasted like orange tang.  Can't remember the name but it was good.  The cake donuts without frosting were also tasty.

EVERYTHING I EVER DREAMED OF AND MORE!! Trying something I've watched multiple times on the food network, I can die that much more happier. The doughnuts do not disappoint & neither do the workers, so sweet

I had heard so many good things about this place. So when I visited Oregon for the first time, Voodoo Doughnut was on my "must go" places list.

I bought two doughnuts: the voodoo doll and the bacon maple bar. Yes, bacon on maple bar. I had the bacon maple bar right away. Bacon and maple actually were good together! The bacon was thick, perfectly cooked, and not overpowering salty. Maple bar itself was just GREAT!!! Man, writing this makes me want one right now!!!

The maple bar filled me up, so I saved the voodoo doll one for the next day, which was still good. It didn't get rock hard. It was still soft. To be honest, it was too sweet for me and I'm actually a big sweets lover. The voodoo doll was covered with chocolate and filled with A LOT of jelly. I couldn't finished it. Well, maybe it was because I had it for breakfast.

If I ever had the chance to go back to Oregon, I will definitely make a couple of stops at this place to get more of bacon maple bars and try some other items.

The tiny thing I don't like about this place...they charge $0.25 (or was it $0.10?) for a cup for water. Why?

Such a cute place!! Got myself a mug for my bday and a voodoo doll doughnut 
Staff was super friendly too. I had been wanting to visit this shop for a while now and finally got to Oregon! Thank you for a cool experience!

No need to get a whole box of cereal on your donut, go plain and you will not be disappointed. Theyre famous and popular, and for good reason! They are open 24/7 and are a great treat when there is no line! I do highly reccomend these over blue star.  They also have vegan options. Dont forget to bring cash.
Actually great tasting donuts and affordable! I would go more if it wasn't for the location and the line. But actually really good and worth the wait.

Before Oh Doughnuts opened in Winnipeg, I spent a -- shall we say -- "reasonable" amount of time craving real doughnuts minus dairy. So, naturally, Voodoo was on my radar as an example of what is out there in the world, and *could* be where I was, if only someone were so inclined to make such magic happen. This is all preamble to say that, despite my keen interest in the place, I had not made plans to visit when I finally visited Portland because my partner is allergic to wheat and they don't have gluten-free options. But while wandering through the city I spotted it from across the street and I knew it was meant to be. The line up was totally worth it!! At the recommendation of the person working the counter, I got the vegan Old Dirty Bastard. I haven't had anything that sweet in ages (it took me a couple of hours to eat it in small increments, actually), but I'm glad I got to try a little bit of vegan doughnut history from the place that makes the wildest and most memorable creations =-)

First experienced Voodoo in Eugene Oregon as we passed through. Was happy to find them again in Portland as we walked the food truck areas of 2nd, 3rd and 5th. Such a fun place with such a unique atmosphere. I had never had a buttermilk bar before visiting the west coast and now I'm obsessed. Regardless of your feelings about donuts, this place is worth a visit just for the experience.

I love a good doughnut. And although this may be considered a tourist trap it still is pretty good and they do have quite big portions. I got the voodoo doll and it was filled with jam- pretty good. I think the best part is that they offer both cool fancy doughnuts as well as plain ones! Either way I recommend and I was happy to have gone in the middle of the day, around 6 and there was no line!

I usually end up not liking places that have too much hype.  Voodoo managed to win me over!  Cool spot and fun display cases.  The donuts were fairly well priced and delicious - let me repeat, delicious!!!  You can tell that there are some quality ingredients (mango flavoring was amazing and the coconut tasted fresh) and they aren't killing you on price.  Service was pretty good.  I would definitely return.  For once I can honestly say I see what all the hype is about!

I visited Portland, OR for a couple of hours and this place was in my list of MUSTS!!! And it was totally worth it the visit. Apparently there's always a line but it goes by fast while you're deciding what to get. I tried the Dirty Old Bastard just because I love Oreos, which by the way I've never tasted them with Peanut Butter and by my surprise I was like O-M-G!!! I totally recommend it if you're undecided, it won't let you down. No dejes de visitar este nico y original lugar, sea que vivas en Portland, vayas de vacaciones o, como yo, pases solo por ah un par de horas.
A sketchy area to get donuts in as a tourist but well worth it. Very cute, very sweet, short lines, and prices are alright considering how trendy this place is.
I know this place is all about the tourists but... The donuts are priced more then fairly.  They are also HUGE and Delicious!  This was a great after Bar stop in the early morning hours.  No line!

Wow, what delicious, crazy donuts! A must-visit if you're in Portland. I like that there are vegan options. Despite the crazy, fun donuts, my favorite was the plain ole cake donut with chocolate frosting... Delicious!

I really loved voodoo doughnut. I didn't feel like it was in the best part of town but the doughnuts made up for it completely. Sometimes the more touristy attractions aren't about the quality but I thought that the doughnuts and the experience were great. I got the captain crunch doughnut and the voodoo. SO good. Classic donuts with a twist. Super decadent and worth it. It was busy of course but that's expected and the line moved quickly.

Best donuts I have ever had. Blows Krispy Kreme (can anyone say overrated?) out of the water.  Why anyone could rate this place less than 5 stars is beyond me.  

The donuts are inspired, creative, cakey, and GOOD!  Donuts elsewhere are over-glazed, or merely fluffy-nothingness.  What other donut place would have the audacity to make a NyQuil donut, merely to have the FDA tell them to pull it from the shelf?  (urban legend alert - I cannot confirm this story).  Blazers Blunts? Cock N Balls? MnM's on donuts? Bacon on Maple bar? Tang flavored donut?  Oreo Cookie and Peanut Butter topping?  YUM!!!!

The place is tiny, dirty, and funky.  They have random spoken word nights here, Swahili language lessons, poetry readings, and other random-ass performances.  The place is open odd hours, going late into the night, and often closed in the middle of the day.  There's nothing like a fresh apple fritter at 3am when you're drunk.  Especially when you are in a confined space with a bunch of other drunk or crazy people while scarfing it down. One night I was in there at 230am, and there were ~20 drunken clowns (the big shoe, red nose, white face kind of clowns) running around and causing general chaos.  Only in Portland... only in Portland.

I have never met anyone who, once they have tried VooDoo, thinks any other donut is nearly as good.  As usual, the locals in PDX put the bullshit national corporate chain food to shame.  

Bring a Dozen (13 donuts chosen at random by the staff  - $8+change) to work in the pink box, and your co-workers will have a new-found and undying respect for you!

Keep up the good work VOODOO!!!!

Oh, and they have VEGAN donuts too.

If you are new to Voodoo Doughnut, order the classic voodoo doll, and you will get a nice glimpse of what it offers. The only problem is that you probably had to wait like 1 hour in line, and buying just one doughnut would not be the best idea. So go on and order a full box. 
I have tried a lot of flavors, but my favorite one is the plain vanilla (followed closely by the Old Dirty Bastard).

Really amazing donuts  and a must do in Portland. I loved the cake donuts. I didn't like all the homeless people that were right outside of the restaurant but I realize they can't do much about that. All of their donuts are beautiful and there are fun bars to go to for a drink afterward.
So i am not a huge fan of donuts, but this doughnuts make me want to eat them alll day long. The amount of friendliness and kindness is outstanding i will of course be going back
All the hype was accurate. Fun place to go. We had a fun time waiting in line. Met a nice couple from Philadelphia. We are from California.

I have a confession to make.....

Never in my wildest dreams did I ever picture myself waiting over an hour for doughnuts! 

"Doughnuts!!! Nahhh!!! Did you see that line?!"

I always thought of myself as a sophisticated cupcake connoisseur, so when I saw the line for doughnuts, I hesitated a bit, but after a few minutes of research on my smart phone, I learned they were recognized as one of the top 10 doughnut bakeries in the U.S., which made me suddenly crave a bite of one of their customized voodoo doll shaped delicacies bacon eclairs.

As I stepped into line, I thought to myself, "How am I going to withstand a full hour wait?", but it was quite easy because right outside the line was a street folk/ hillbilly inspired band. I watched a young woman strum on a hardware saw with a bow, and the music created was heavenly to my ears. I recommend you drop a dollar for them. They seem like they work hard.

The line went by quickly, since I was playing Temple Run on my cell phone, and as I entered the store, the visual displays were appealing. There were all types of doughnuts-- the classic glazed ones, jumbo ones the size of your face, Oreo drizzled delights, doughnuts covered in cereal, and a few covered in bacon. My favorites were the bacon and oreo ones. They are quite heavy but worth the money.

If you come here, please bring cash! They only accept cash! Also, don't be afraid to be experimental. Everything is delicious here. Also, if you plan to buy a lot to fill a box, be careful because everyone stares at you like you have a load of cash in there! I got so many crazy hungry looking stares as I walked the street with one of their pink boxes.

This place is a highly recommended place for anyone visiting Portland! A definite tourist attraction and classic hipster hotspot.
Have not tasted our loot here yet but the vibe and the employees are really nice and the place is super hipster so I'll see if the donuts tastes as good!

Their donuts are delicious. I would recommend you stop by and try one. There may be a line when you get there, but its worth the wait. Their creativity  with all the donuts leaves you a bit overwhelmed on what to get. Their glazed donut never disappoints.

What kind of people would wait 30 minutes in the rain for a donut?  

Me!

It was certainly worth the wait.  At Voodoo, they must place a hex on the customers, with a huge selection of delicious donuts... it's really hard to imagine going wrong!  

I would strongly recommend the Portland Creme donut.  It's the one with the two eyes!  It's filled with a delicious Bavarian cream, and covered with a great chocolate coating.

Not surprisingly, in 2008 the sitting Mayor of Portland, Tom Potter, declared it to be the "Official City Doughnut"!
Being from cali, We have Donut shops on every corner.. None compare, Voodoo lives up to the hype :)..  Bomb, bomb. Can't wait to have it again.

These donuts are as good as Portland is weird! As in they're crazy good! It's almost mandatory to stop by voodoo doughnuts if you come to this city. They're famous for crazy over the top deliciously sweet doughnuts that are "worth the weight"- (as they have advertised). I can't get enough to be honest, the doughnuts are made fresh- with hipster bumping heavy metal in the back kitchen which is viewable thru the windows guarded by metal bars and golden glitter painted brick in the line. 

This place has such character, the chandelier interior with doughnut stained glass with the choc board menu full of hilarious items that taste ooo sooo good... gotta wipe the maple frosting off my fingers as I type this out. The menu will consist of funny names such as "old dirt bastard"
Which is basically crack, it's a doughnut with a Bavarian cream like filling topped with crumbled Oreos drizzled with a maple frosting-- lemme just say I can't get enough. The wild ones they have are: "the blunt" a soft warm twisted dough covered in cinnamon and topped with frosting at the tip that makes this thing lit on more then one accord.

The grape ape it's another one on this menu that is something you can't get anywhere else- but goes with how lit this place is. Some hilarious items on the menu on top of all the other creative cereal covered (captain crunch, fruit loops, coco pebbles) is the cock and balls. Yes you read that right. For a fun surprise for my girlfriend definitely brought her back the cock and balls with some of that Portland cream ;) and let me tell ya that isn't the only thing that'll be creaming once you get your significant other some of these hot deserts! Lol 

All jokes aside this spot represent all things Portland and you simply have to get out there cuz "the magic is in the hole ;)"

People coming here expecting something quick will be sorely disappointed (I'm looking at you, fellow Californians).

That aside, the wait here is worth it. It is a unique experience.

We actually lucked out as the shop was closed for a staff meeting for 40 minutes or so, so we had no line in front of us (score!).

The donuts themselves are unique, and tasty. Bring the family and make it a family trip or snag a box to bring back with you on the plane ride home. Actually saw one couple do that on our return trip.

Can't wait to come here again.

Since we had a guest from out of country, we finally went to Voodoo Doughnut. Weekday before lunch time, no lines or crowds. Very smooth! Rotating display was helpful to decide which ones we would like to order before we get to the cashier. 

We were not sure if they sell coffee or not so we first stopped by at Stumptown Coffee to get a cup to go. Well, we found out Voodoo sells coffee too, Nossa Italia kind. One doughnut per person was enough for us but we got a few to share so we could try a few kinds, sitting outside the store. Very friendly yet fast cashier without too much chatting. 

Very happy to have finally been to one of the famous places in Portland!

Honestly, I hate 'touristy' spots.  And waiting in long lines is never fun BUT this place is a great donut spot.  A lot of other donut places are popping up and try to be just like Voodoo and to no avail.  Weird, funky flavors that just work on perfectly risen yeasted donut.  People try - but they are no Voodoo.

I didn't always love Voodoo this much, I think for a couple of reasons.  It only accepted cash until this year & I am a millennial cash is not something I ever carry around.  And unless you went at 7AM you were waiting in a 15 minute line at least.  I think the lines have gone down because Voodoo isn't just a Portland thing anymore its expanded to other cities so if you're in Portland it's not a MUST anymore.

But their donuts are always so fresh and perfectly risen, the icing is on THICK not that runny stuff, and their flavors are unmatched.

My favorites:
- Any of the maple ones because they have the best maple icing in the land - could eat it by the spoonful (bacon maple bar, maple cream, regular maple bar, etc.)
-Guava Colada
-Blueberry cake
-Apple Fritter
-School Daze

Get in there & enjoy.

This place lives up to the hype and not only has inventive flavor combinations and cute names for every donut, but they also fairly price the stuff and keep the stock FRESH and super tasty. (Listen up, copycat Psycho Donuts)

If I lived here, I would be a regular - which makes it good for my waistline that I do not. One tip is to make sure you have CASH. There is an atm in the back, but there is a fee and you lose your spot in line.
Place rocks! So cool in more ways than one. Variety in sweet donuts. Line is not too long.

Well voodoo is a must go see for anyone visiting portland. This spot has become deeply embedded into the Portland culture. It's open all hours so you can come by with the late night munchies. They just recently started excepting cards here. Their donuts can be anywhere from plain and basic to naughty and silly. They offer a pink box which is also an emblem for the store. Make sure to take a picture with your pink box full of donuts, it's a classic must do! The location of this store is not in the best neighborhood so try and ignore all the homeless people outside asking for change and cigarettes. Across the street from here is the classic "Keep Portland Weird" sign which is another photo opportunity!

Great Portland classic! I like that they now take credit cards! They've always had so many great choices for donuts and I honestly think they are wayyyy better than Blue Star (that's a big rivalry in Portland! ;)) 
I love that they have outdoor seating in the summer!

I recently moved to Oregon and I have been dreaming of these doughnuts since I arrived. I finally went yesterday and I was not disappointed. The doughnuts were fresh, moist and fluffy and the flavors were fantastic. There was a long line, but it moved quickly so don't let a line scare you away from the awesome doughnuts.

I knew this was of the famous stops for when you visit Portland, so I tried to avoid going to popular hours. I walked by on a Saturday morning and saw a line out the door, zig-zagging back and forth. I can't even imagine how long those people must've had to wait! I went on a Thursday afternoon, around 3, when it was super hot out. Unpleasant weather and off hours - a 10 minute wait. I was surprised to see that they also still have a large selection of donuts at that hour. 

I got a voodoo doll, because obviously you have to, and a glazed cruller. Crullers are my weakness, and this one was no exception. The voodoo doll was also super good. It's huge, though - super filling! The bottom half is filled with (raspberry?) jam, which was fantastic. I love jelly filled donuts! 

I understand why this place is such a famous destination. So worth it!

I popped in around midnight on a Sunday and it was packed! It was worth the wait, though! They have the most interesting and fun donuts. My favorite was the Simpson's donut with pink frosting and sprinkles but their apple fritters are amazing, too! Got a huge box of donuts for only $17. I thought that was a great deal.
Just get the bacon maple bar. Amazing. Worth the line and the wait. Go on a week day if the line bothers you.
Best Doughnuts in Portland! A must see for anyone visiting the city!

Whats not to like!? Not only are these people still serving up the best donies this side of the Willamette, but they're doing it right in spite of a global pandemic. Every. Dingle. Donut is worth trying and so is this Portland institution. Go. Like yesterday.

Gourmet doughnuts that are as unique as they are yummy! Clean and friendly establishment. Always a line but worth it.

I have been here several times and have never been disappointed. I have had some of the weirder cereal doughnuts, the classic voodoo doll donut, and of course my personal favorite, the giant penis doughnut (some times cream filled for your pleasure lol)! 

Also my favorite - they offer to host wedding ceremonies should you and your significant other want to tie the knot while visiting the area.

Exciting atmosphere! Located in the heart of downtown we were surrounded by tons of people who were having a good time during the late night hours on Saturday night.  Line went quick and the staff was badass! Couldn't help but grab up the phallic style, captain crunch and fruit loop donut. A must visit !
Always a hoot to get some donuts, coffee, and people watch

If you want to enjoy the best Doughnuts in the great North West. Don't waste your time at the other donut stores. We got there at 4mins til 10pm. We were treated like Royalty. Always great and now in Colorado, Texas, and New York. What a story of success. Thank you Voodoo!!

Amazing. Me and my husband always get doughnuts here and out of the 20 times we have came we got a little bit of a doughy donut which it was a huge one. Told the assistant manager and next time we come in we get free ones. Always a great group of workers.

Amazing, this is as percect as it gets. Let's talk about the glaze they use. I don't know how they do it, I am a chef and I can't replicate what they do. I am happy to say that this is my 1st stop when I am in town once a month. My ONLY complaint is that they are always busy but that is only because they are so perfect, so I will not knock them for it. Keep up the amazing work!
Amazing as fuck!! super tasty love everything about it except the line. wish i could eat them every morning and not die of a heart attack.

Definitely a very unique doughnuts, we grabbed half a dozen just to try a few of their offerings, the loop, triple chocolate and the voodoo doll were the favorites from our tasting, fluffy and warm. There's was a bit of a line when we visited (stretched outside of the store) but it moved super quick (less than 10 minutes), really worth the stop.
Peach fritter forever. This place is the bomb. Some people don't like it, and that's fine. But it's delicious, and fun, and an experience with having. And did I mention the peach fritter??!! Get it.

As an out-of-town donut fiend I was entranced and bewitched by their selections. And vegan donuts too? Oye. THE BEST.

COME AND GET A BOX YOU CAN'T PICK JUST ONE OR TWO!

It seems like just about every city has one iconic place that garners all the reviews and entices all the out of towners to visit. Quite often these places are clich, and the locals love to hate on them because they become too popular, and it's always cool to talk about how something that was once awesome no longer is. If you hate on Voodoo though, you better have a damn good reason, because they do live up to the hype, even after sitting in the rotating wheel (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4327453148/) of doom for hours. Sure, if you pay $5 for the giant chocolate smothered, crme filled, phallic monstrosity then you kind of deserve what you're getting (take that however you want), but if you actually branch out and try a variety of their other combinations (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4327418724/) you'll see this place is worth the visit.

The interior of Voodoo is unique, to put it mildly (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4326754065/). The assortment of donut (sorry, I don't care for their spelling) paraphernalia is unrivaled, and augmented in many twisted ways by the other random accessories adorning the walls. In fact, there are probably even more unrelated items on the walls than there are donut themed, many of which are quite comical. The donuts themselves come in every color unnatural to man (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4326692527/), many of which take you back to flavors from your childhood, with several of them being cereal themed. They've even got vegan donuts (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4326732447/), if for some reason you enjoy mixing pleasure with pain (all kidding aside, I've actually heard from several vegans these are quite good as well).

Since it was already 12:30, I had been eating virtually all day, and had to drive 3 hours back to Seattle and wake up around 7am for work the next day, I figured the best option would be to just get a couple dozen (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4327505570/) donuts to take into the office so nobody questioned me as I passed out at my desk that day from a Portland overdose. I decided just to let them pick the donuts, because at $8.50 for a dozen if they choose that's a pretty sweet deal in my mind. He did let me add a couple that I wanted too, which made it all the more worthwhile. One box was heavily loaded with crunchy toppings (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4327526780/) and basic options, while the other featured a lot of cereal based (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4326805005/) donuts along with some sweeter toppings like coconut. 

Throughout the week we ended up piecemealing the donuts bit by bit among our team, everyone taking bits of various ones as they walked by each day. As a result I got to taste almost everything, and although I can't recall the names of all of them, I definitely really enjoyed about 75% of all the ones I tried, a pretty hefty percentage considering how much they play around with toppings. Obviously the maple bacon bar (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4326698991/) stole the show, and rightfully so. This thing is like magic. It just hooks you, and you suddenly want several dozen of just that one. I would have never guessed such a simple combination could be so amazing, but it's true. I was also a huge fan of the "dirt" donut covered in Oreos, and the Portland crme pie (http://www.flickr.com/photos/wedoitforlove/4327448502/) which is as fun to eat as it is to look at. Pretty much anything with coconut on top was a hit, although if there was anything I didn't care for too much it was the cereal based donuts, with the exception of the peanut butter glazed donut topped with rice krispies.

If you're knocking Voodoo my guess is that you didn't have a maple bacon bar, and if you DID have one and you're still knocking it, well then I can't help you. Some things are idyllic for a reason, and Voodoo has created their own little slice of fantasy out on the West coast.

Voodoo Doughnut re-instated my passion for doughnuts.... 

As a native of LA, I wasn't sure what to expect -- because guess what? We have everything! Great cafes, bars, bakeries, etc..

But Voodoo definitely is something else...unlike any other place.... 

We ordered the random dozen which was AMAZING... and on top of that, we ordered the COCK AND BALLS doughnut which came highly recommended by the hipster girl behind the cashier. Let me tell you something -- COCK AND BALLS did not disappoint that night.... it took us all the way to heaven and back again....

If you are a tourist in Portland, then VOODOO needs to be on your #1 list!!!
These donuts are sick!! Went here with a friend for the maple bacon bar, was hesitant with the hype, but it was worth the wait. Thanks for taking be bro.
Came midday on a weekday, no line. Fair price for their gourmet doughnuts, less than $3 for the voodoo doughnut. Instagram worthy AND delicious!

I mean how could you miss voodoo doughnuts when in Portland?? I just ordered their glazed blueberry doughnut cause they were out of a lot of the original ones. But I went late so if you go earlier they'd have more. But the doughnut was delicious. And it's just one of those places you have to visit.

Heard great things about this place, and was not disappointed!

Very few places have mastered the art of the "cold donut" but I think Voodoo has done it. Huge menu to fit anyone's sweet tooth. Tasty, fresh, and super sweet. Outdoor seating is a nice touch.

Really, what can be said about the most-reviewed establishment in Portland that hasn't been said already?  OK, I'll try:

It's a keyword and it's been said before but it bears repeatin' now: "Bacon Maple Bar"

I recently stopped in at midnight and a guy next to us told my friend, point blank: "Deewwwwd, it's the best THING you will ever have"

Note how he phrased that, not doughnut, not snack, not food..."THING".  Your first love, orgasm, and child have nothing on Voodoo Doughnut according to this herbal-scented, pink-eyed sage of the night.  Listen to him.

On the walk home, my teeth had headaches.  Epic.


Appendix:
+1 Funfact: Voodoo has been busted in the past for making these delightful bags of fat and sugar with the aid of over-the-counter drugs, awesome.

+Protip: like many of the other most-hyped, well-known places in Portland, this place is very good...and VERY bad for you (I'm looking at you Pinestate).  Enjoy these places responsibly, use in moderation.  If you have heart problems are pregnant or may become pregnant, consult your doctor first.

+1 If you want to win local-points don't call it "Voodoo DoughnutS", it's "Voodoo Doughnut"

+1 Also, one of the rivers running through Portland is pronounced Wil-LAM-et

+1 The state is Or-uh-gun, not Or-uh-GONE

This has got to be the best doughnut shop ever! The line on a Sunday afternoon was insanely long though and moved really slowly.  I couldn't figure out why it was moving so slowly until I went in myself and saw all the cute decoration and huge doughnut selection inside.  I think people were getting held up taking photos and picking donuts.  I ended up waiting about 1hr and 15 min, but it was really worth it! I would wait again next time I'm in the Portland area. 

My friend and I actually ordered the same donuts, and both agreed that they are simply amazing! Here's what I tried:

- VOODOO DOLL : It's so cute! It's really nice how each voodoo doll is a little different, giving them some character.  It's a yeast donut so it's nice and fluffy, and filled with a raspberry jelly and chocolate frosting.  This was the cutest, but actually my least favorite because it tasted more like a common jelly donut.

- BACON MAPLE BAR : My favorite~ This was so delicious, that I'm just drooling right now thinking about it.  Bacon and maple frosting sound like a really weird combination, but trust me, it works! The salty bacon was thick and crispy and it went really well with the sweet maple. It's another yeast donut, so it was very soft and fluffy.  Mine actually just came out of the fryer, so it was still warm, making it even more delicious.  
 
- PORTLAND CREAM : Bavarian cream with chocolate frosting is uber yummy.  I love bavarian cream in cakes and donuts.  The two eyeballs on the side were really cute too.

- MEMPHIS MAFIA : This was a massive donut in size and weight.  It's one of the sweeter, denser donuts, but somehow it was still crispy.  It has chocolate chips with peanut butter and chocolate frosting. Since it's not a yeast donut, it tastes just as good the second day.
Awesome, beautiful tasty doughnuts. My line 10am nice weekday in July was quick. Service and presentation were great. Worth our 15 minute walk.

I always go here when the tourists aren't around. The donuts are best I've ever had. Voodoo donuts is famous for a reason. It's even worth standing on line. If you live in Portland and have never been here, what is wrong with you? This is a must for tourists.

We went here because I had seen it on the food network before. We went at night so we barely had to stand in line. I got one of the box deals that they have. The donuts are so cute and were good! They only lasted a couple of days in our house. Lol.

Voodoo is iconic for sure. I hadn't been there in years and my son and I stopped in for some Voodoo goodness while we were in town for a concert. I expected the quality to have diminished with the fame. It's super busy at all hours and has only really grown in popularity. My son marveled at the sparkling brick and clever menu and I knew bringing him for his first voodoo experience was a worthwhile venture even if the doughnuts were only sub-par now. He excitedly snapped pictures to his friends telling me how awesome the shop was. We were total tourists grabbing hoodies and a dozen. We wandered through Saturday market for a while after we got them, another stop I hadn't made in many years. He was a walking Voodoo commercial with his hoodie on and his pink box and got a lot of smug comments, but he totally didn't care at all. We walked to a park bench and split a couple donuts. They did not disappoint. You guys have maintained the quality in your baking and I applaud your ability to be iconic and worthy. Your staff is friendly and efficient, your doughnuts are fantastic, and your menu is a variety of cleverness that actually tastes good. Enjoy your well deserved fame, Voodoo! We  you and you have a new loyal follower!

I've been to the Voodoo in Orlando, but I have yet to visit the original location! Now that I travel to Portland frequently for business I got the opportunity. I was not disappointed. Located in the heart of Old Town you can't miss the glittery bricked exterior of these world famous donuts. The line as expected was outside of the building, but that is just a day in the life of Voodoo. The service is so efficient you shouldn't be intimidated. I was inside within 10 minutes and had my Voodoo dozen in hand in less than 20. It is well worth the wait. The Voodoo dozen is where the employee picks 12 donuts for you and this is a great way to go. For only $18 you get a great sampling of what they do. 
I will definitely be making Voodoo a regular stop on my travels to Portland! FYI - the best donut in the place is the Old Dirty Bastard!

This is a super fun and super trendy and popular landmark in Portland. It is a small place that serves up some truly creative donuts. They all looked amazing but we settled on a chocolate one and one with Captain crunch on top. I preferred the chocolate one best but they were both delicious. There are some benches outside, and we hung out there for a bit. With sugar coursing through our veins, it was a really fun time. You can view the types of donuts they have on a picture menu outside and you can see them in real life inside. The staff was super friendly and very patient with our group as we debated which ones to try. A few of us got boxes to go. I can absolutely see how and why they have such a cult following! I believe they are open 24 hours too!
Really liked this place.  So many amazing concoctions!   Very fun and yet still tasty!  So glad we took the time to stop by!
Supremely delicious!! Line was long and worth the wait. We got too many donuts and it was not a problem... wish I woulda bought their cool shirt. Guess I'll have to come back next trip!

What can I say! Hipster place to have YUMMY unique donuts. I had the  Coconut Vegan Doughnut & it doesn't taste like vegan at all. Although the donuts were too sweet for me, I really enjoy the bread part of it. It's soft & melts in your mouth! This place only accepts CASH so be prepared! Friendly peeps here.

Okay...I've been to Portland several times and keep hearing about donuts, but I always passed because I'm not a donut person.  My husband insisted we go and made me swear on my life that we would stop by while we are in town.  The line was not too bad and it moved relatively quick.  We got a dozen and it was pretty reasonable.  We of course had to try the maple and bacon, we also got the blueberry and chuckles.  My friends and I did a blind taste test comparing voodoo's maple and bacon with another donut shop near by and voodoos won hands down.  We definitely were not disappointed and were happy we stopped by!
As an out of stater, this place was a blast!! Lots to look at. Wonderful "Weird" Portland people at every turn. Best part was the donuts tasted as good as they looked!!
Grape Gorilla baby!!! This place is cool. Oregon loves donuts and I love Portland. Cool stuff to try and they have gluten free of course. Very tasty!!

I popped in around midnight on a Sunday and it was packed! It was worth the wait, though! They have the most interesting and fun donuts. My favorite was the Simpson's donut with pink frosting and sprinkles but their apple fritters are amazing, too! Got a huge box of donuts for only $17. I thought that was a great deal.
Awesome donuts! Guaranteed that the long lines are worth waiting through! Any time I pass through town on road trips it's a must stop location.

I've finally made the pilgrimage-voodoo donuts. The place my friends and I used to fantasize about making a 15 hour road trip to back in high school. So, when ur girl had a 12 hour layover in PDX, what else is she to do but venture out of the terminal to trek out to this iconic place? It did not disappoint. I arrived on a cool Tuesday morning around 6:45am. There was NO ONE in line and only a couple of customers munching on goodies inside. GET THE VOODOO DOLL. It is iconic, and the jelly inside is magnificent-tastes like it's made from scratch raspberry filling complete with a few crunchy seeds. No jelly will ever compare. The raspberry paired well with the chocolate and it was incredibly filling. Go grab one and take a stroll along the nearby water (even if you have to risk missing your flight in doing so).

I can't believe these guys only have 3.5 stars.  Yes, it is off the wall, eccentric and a bit pricey, BUT what do you expect?  You come for the experience.  If you want a plain $.50 cake doughnut, go elsewhere.  Voodoo is a Portland Iconic spot.  When you visit, you have to get a doughnut (or a dozen, whoops).  Last time I was down here I didn't bring my son and accidentally took a bite of each doughnut before he got home. This last time around I planned on only getting 6...again walked out with a dozen and the kiddo ate a majority of them this time.  I bribed a few bites. 
Anyways, there is generally always a line out the door but it moves quickly, use the time as a good touristy photo opp!  Once you are inside the doughnuts are displayed in rotating cases, each cashier also has a menu for easier viewing.  There are so many fun flavors, combos and names, it is definitely an experience.  I do highly suggest getting a variety and sharing so that everyone can try some of each.   
Warning.. there are a few with vulgar names, Cock and Balls anyone?! We find them humorous, others may take offense.. again, it's all in the experience.

Unquestionably a popular tourist place! Their pink boxes can be spotted anywhere in the city, and lines can extend down the block. Trick is to come early morning to skip the lines.

I was entertained by the rotating donut display, and it was super helpful in deciding which ones to pick! Donuts are indeed filling and sugary, but still tasty in my opinion. In contrast to Blue Star Donuts that is creative in flavors, this place sells the iconic donuts but in an artistic form.

This place used to be cash-only (explaining the ATM inside), but now they accept credit and debit cards.

Come on a weekend, you get a long ass line.

Come on a Monday morning, you are the only customer!

We arrived in Portland Sunday afternoon and stopped by this place first but because it was cold and the line was long, we decided to skip it.  I was seriously sad because how can I be in Portland w/o trying Voodoo?  

I did see a sign that turned me off: cash only. 

The following morning, we were due at the airport no later than 11am.  We had breakfast plans already but after we left our hotel, he asked his mom to make a stop by Voodoo for me... 

I didn't have any cash on me but his mom gave me a few bucks.  I ran into the store w/ him and the first thing I did was check in (of course), took pictures, and when I came up to the counter, I asked the guy what he recommends for a chocolate lover.  After a few suggestions, what he described stuck to me like a leech: Old Dirty Bastard... almost like a regular glazed donut w/ Oreos and peanut butter.  There are 2 things that I love: Oreo's and peanut butter.. if you put the 2 together that means it's a definite "Tram" selection.  

I was fearful of the donut being dry but this wasn't the case.. for $1.25 I couldn't have asked for a better snack before breakfast.  I devoured it in less than 3 minutes, about 5 bites total, maybe 6 tops.

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=nVITo-w3CKgegEbQfmRQMw&userid=0QeJC2inz6P-OVzROU_LNw

You can't look at that w/o wanting to lick the computer or smart phone screen.

I will definitely come again.

Omg. Who wouldn't love Voodoo. Not only is it a fun experience with all of their amazing variations but the doughnuts are the bomb! I wish we had one closer. If you're in Portland you have to stop by!

It's hard to not love the place that is arguably the most famous for fun and eclectic donuts, as well as some great double entendre in their marketing!

The original voodoo donuts is kind of a Mecca of sorts. Definitely the sort of place that anybody who enjoys carbs and/or frosting needs to visit. One of the most convenient things about this place is that it's open 24 hours per day. We were visiting some friends in the Portland area and they're a little guy decided that he wanted to hang out at about 4 AM. By 5 o'clock it was very apparent that he was not going back to sleep, so I decided it was time to go get some donuts! By the time we got there, he was asleep, and I came back with plenty of options for the remaining folks at home.

The donuts run between one and two dollars apiece and they've got an incredible variety! Everything from relatively simple donuts with fancy frosting, all the way to cereal covered donuts and jelly filled donuts that looks like the gingerbread man being stabbed... Quite lovely!

The most fun thing that I learned during this trip is that for $130 you can get a handmade coffin with three dozen of your favorite donuts inside. Definitely a crowdpleaser!

If you haven't been here, you definitely need to go. There's really no excuse for not visiting this iconic donut spot in the heart of downtown Portland!

Oh yes.  Maybe the donuts are just donuts.  If you were blind eating here, you might think that.  But really this place is an experience.  I've never seen such a collection of such gloom and goth in one place.  And wait till you see the donuts!  Yes, that's me in the picture, eating a blood filled voodoo donut.  And yes, the inside of this donut shop looks like a dusty cellar decorated for Halloween.  And while this place is opened late for the post partying munchies, I was here for the Rose Parade and happened to stop in.  Maybe Voodoo Doughnut is just a 3 star donut hole, but it gets an extra star for character and another star for creativity--you're simply not going to find another Voodoo Doughnut.

They have a lot of fun donuts. But there's always a line. I was there with my granddaughter in the line didn't disburse when the rain started. I had her stand on it under a nearby umbrella while I waited in line.  The staff was friendly and helpful even though they were very busy.
We purchased six donuts and the bill was about $18.  
I would return but not when it's raining.

It's kind of upsetting that some reviews call this a tourist trap. Don't get me wrong, seeing that this is at the top of every "Must Do" list for Portland, tourists definitely come here. But the doughnuts are actually amazing, and the shop is very cool. There will for sure be a line, but you have to just expect it and maybe be flexible with what time you come -- it is open 24hrs! I came on a Friday at 1pm and there was a line, but it moved extremely fast. Portland has a ton of amazing doughnut shops, so you really can't go wrong no matter where you choose to go, but the doughnuts at Voodoo really are worth the hype. They're also huge! So I recommend buying a few and sharing with your party so you can try a bunch.
Great doughnuts with great prices!! What a great selection to choose from too!! I will definitely be returning with my family again!!

I thought I'd have to wait closer to an hour because I got in line way out by the street, past the outdoor seating. But it only took 20 minutes to get to the front of the registers. They have a list of flavors outside, but you can familiarize yourself with the doughnut names on their website. When you get to the register, they have a list with photos of their most popular flavors. There are also some displayed in a rotating case. 

I think the doughnuts are pretty affordable. It's a must try when in Portland. I love that they're open 24/7! This place is super hyped, but it's got that vibe. The music is good, the employees are excited to help you, and artwork is fun. 

I actually anticipated just getting one doughnut to try (because I didn't want to ruin my appetite before lunch), but I walked out with half a dozen! My favorite one was the Voodoo doll. The raspberry jelly might get messy, but it was so good! My second favorite would be the Grape Ape. I love the subtle tarty taste. The Mangotango was very similar with the sprinkles/"dust". I got the Dirt instead of the Dirty Bastard because I didn't care for peanut butter, and it was a good standard Oreo flavored doughnut. Portland Cream was actually filled with custard. I expected whipped cream or something to that extent. It tasted good, but it good too sweet too quickly. Lastly, the Maple Blazer Blunt was just alright. It was coated in sugar crystals, and there was maple frosting on one end. I just got it because it looked fun. 

This location is really close to the farmer's market that is open on the weekends.
Their donuts are fun and the classics(ex: glaze donuts and buttermilk bars)are delicious. OBD and Portland cream is a favorite of mine.

Best donuts ever! There is such a wide variety of donuts to choose from - even a whole range of vegan options! 

The maple bacon donut was light and fluffy, and the apple fritter was filled with bits of apple - perfectly crispy and not greasy at all.

A hip donut shop with all sorts of hip donuts.  The donuts were colorful and fun looking.  I tried the one with the vanilla frosting and oreos, while the boy got the one with peanut butter and oreos.  Both were really good.  The atmosphere is half of the appeal obviously, and it made me a Voodoo believer.  It's an obligatory Portland stop for sure.

This is a great location, RIGHT downtown, the building isn't very big, but it doesn't need to be, there's PLENTY of seating outside!!! Good doughnuts, beer to go, what more could you ask for??? LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

Yup. I know it's overhyped. But we had to come here. Portland has a donut culture. But after visiting the Chinese Lan Su Garden, you know we were going to Voodoo. 

We ordered three, the Voodoo Doll, the blueberry and the Dirty Bastard. My favorite was the first one which was filled with jelly. But all three were DELICIOUS!  And the best part, no line!  Maybe because it was raining. 

Five stars.

I have a donut maybe three times a year, so I'm no connoisseur, but they tasted fresh and delicious to me. I had the Voodoo doll and the Viscous Hibiscus. The voodoo doll was my favorite, chocolate frosting with raspberry filling! Each voodoo doll has its own unique design which is fun. Really fun and unique donut designs, you have to see for yourself. I was surprised at how low the prices were, for some reason I thought they would all be like $5 each.

Maybe it's my midwestern roots but I could have gone for a glass of milk on the side. The Jones soda options kinda made me cringe thinking about washing down sugar with sugar water. 

It was about a 15 minute wait in the rain, and I'd probably do it again. If you're just looking for a glazed donut like another Yelper mentioned, then yea - maybe skip the line and go somewhere else.

I was visiting Portland and had to stop by this iconic chain -- it was pretty worth the stop. There were so many wacky flavors and different styles of donut that I think anyone would be satisfied! 

I got "The Loop," a fruit loops covered donut which filled me right up. The crunch of the cereal balanced well with the donut, which was raised and airy and didn't feel too dense. We sat on the outdoor patio and enjoyed our donuts in the daytime, which was also really nice!

Must try for any tourist! Their doughnuts are so tasty my favorite it's the Oreo one! The staff is always so polite and patient since there are like a million doughnuts to choose from! Love my voodoo doughnuts

Simple as this. as long as your willing to wait (if there is a line) it is totally worth it. If you like to save money like myself and your with a big group. take a second out of your trip on the way there to buy a gallon of milk (as close as possible so it is still cold) and have milk for everyone for $2.00 insted of paying for 5-7 milk cartens (small as can be) at $1.50 a peice!!!!!
great desert place!!

While on a morning stroll, I decided why not start it off right with a donut or two.  There was a lot going on for choices but the maple bacon was an obvious move to be made.  The maple cream and a staff suggestion of sweet + savory (something with purple icing) finished the trio.  I swung by Stumptown and then back to the hotel to take part in the pleasure.  I can only describe it as what I imagine biting into a cloud must feel like. When you top it off with a perfect maple icing and crispy bacon, no other donut could compare. The only disappointment I suffered was not being able to eat the others as one was enough. I will say, I'm eagerly looking forward to my next breakfast or late night snack though :)
I can't stand my time is spent in Portland but this place has been a shining light in my experience here, never lets me down not once!

So I went to Voodoo Doughnut Too on a previous trip to Portland because the line at the original spot was just wayyy too long. On this most recent trip, for whatever reason, the line was pretty short, lol. It was maybe just a 10 minute wait. 

Honestly, these donuts are pretty damn amazing! We've ordered the assorted box each time, and each one was delicious. Definite sugar rush for sure, lol. And the decor inside is very quirky and charming. 

Yes, this is definitely a touristy place to visit, but it's a fun place to visit. Every once in a while, a place truly lives up to it's hype, and this is one of those times, lol.

These doughnuts are amazing. Their monthly special was very yummy. Even though the line was quite long, it moved rather quickly. All the doughnuts we bought were delicious. Even the "basic" doughnuts tasted delicious. But you don't go there for those...you go for the special ones.

Sure it's touristy, but they are damn good doughnuts and a fun stop during any visit to Portland.

Can walk there from the Saturday Market, plenty of nearby parking across the street, easily accessed via light rail. 

The original is such a cool place. There's a line, but it moves quickly. Great photo opportunities. A revolving display of doughnut options. Open 24 hours!

I got their legendary Bacon Maple Bar (WOW!!!!) and their Captain O'Captain (Captain Crunch on a glazed donut), and they were incredible. Maybe not the healthiest food you'll ingest, but unforgettable.

Get your doughnuts, walk around with one of the their pink boxes, and you'll be happy that you visited.
Reminiscent of my childhood today. I ordered the chocolate ring and the raised glaze donuts. The second best donut I've had in life!

Well, we obviously HAD to make a stop here while in Portland. Duh. We were so surprised to see BARELY any line, which was extra awesome because I don't even really like donuts (I know, GASP!). My fianc tried a few different ones- a regular sprinkle donut and the one with fruit loops. I tried the apple fritter and it truly was likely the best one I've ever had. 

I probably would have passed it up if there was a long line, but I'm so glad we didn't! It's a Portland staple.

Visiting from Phoenix, Az.
We "had to" come try Voodoo Doughnut!
The line to order was about 10min, but glad we waited because the doughnuts were on point and there was a good variety to choose from.
Definitely will come again on the next vacation

Very good doughnuts! I came here on my Cheat Day when visiting Portland, and it did not disappoint!! You can even buy a handmade miniature coffin filled with doughnuts. I found that odd, but clever and funny--like Portland itself! Take note, there is no inside seating.

This place is a MUST if you're on Portland. Everyone talks about it; it was on the Travel Channel, and Foodnetwork Channel. We were in the area so why not.

I love doughnuts but I rarely eat them. The BF and I had just picked up our dinner and on the way back to our hotel is Voodoo Doughnuts. Our plan was to get doughnuts the next morning but since it was open 24 hours and there was no line at 12:30am, we decided to just go on in. 

We arrived at 12:30am and there were a few people in the shop but the line wasn't out the door, thank goodness. I couldn't decide, there were a lot of different flavors! The BF and I decided two each so he ordered the bacon maple bar and the maple blazer blunt and I ordered the grape ale and orangatang doughnut. The four came out to be like $10? Expensive for doughnuts but so worth it.

The bacon maple was so freaking good. The bacon was cooked perfectly and the maple glaze wasn't too sweet. The BF and I split this one, although I could have eaten the whole doughnut by myself. The orangatang was refreshing. It tasted like an orange doughnut. The grape ale was similar. It was refreshing with a strong grape taste. The orange and grape were really good and different than your typical flavored doughnut. Sadly, we didn't get to try the maple blazer blunt because we were so full.  So bummer.

It's cash only! Go, eat, enjoy, and be merry :)
A Portland staple, and a must-try. The creativity in the donuts is the fun part. It was fun getting a dozen and trying different flavors to share. Worth a try at least once in Portland!

I've been wanting to go to Voodoo  Doughnut for about 9 years now! ha ha I remember I first heard about it right after I graduated high school there was a girl that went to Oregon for college and she took a bunch of photos of Voodoo Doughnuts and I thought it was the coolest thing!

I don't know if other yelpers feel this way but when you have a place bookmarked for soooo long and you finally get to go it's such a great feeling! Especially if the place is super far from you, or if it's a super hyped-up place it adds onto the excitement. I felt the same way about going to Caf du Monde in New Orleans last month.

I never had a reason to ever head out to Portland but low and behold my sister ends up marrying a guy from Vancouver,WA so my family spent Thanksgiving this year with the in-laws. My brother-in-law and his mom drove us here on Wednesday and we came around 10:15am. I always heard about the super long line that wraps around the corner. Surprisingly, when we came the line was short and did not even extend out the door. We got to order our doughnuts within 5 minutes. They play oldies music inside which my dad loved!

We tried the most popular flavors: Voodoo Doll, Bacon Maple Bar, The Loop, Oh Captain My Captain, and Dirt. In all honesty, the doughnuts taste like an average doughnut. The only thing that sets it aside from other doughnuts is the decoration and toppings. Other than that if there were a blind fold test Voodoo Dougnut doesn't taste special. It's still super fun to get to try a world famous place! 

I don't know when I'll be back in Portland again but I would like to come back and get other flavors next time!
These donuts are so light and fluffy!  Best donuts ever!  Bought a bunch.  So far, I've only eaten the one topped with cap'n crunch, and that was delicious!  Can't wait to try the rest!
Nice cool place lol I like the voodoo doughnuts  special had lots of interesting choices
Incredibly large vegan doughnut selection and the service was amazing! We waited in line for a while, but the staff ensured it moved quickly! Wicked vibe.

This place was fun.   You will see people all over town carrying their pink voodoo boxes.  I was sad the satanic donut was temporally replaced with a USA donut.     But I enjoyed a voodoo, cock n balls, homer ,bacon and the one with a mustache.  All were great and still fresh three days later.    I personally think long Lines are stupid but it went by pretty quick.

I AM FROM CALIFORNIA! Let me say this! IT LIVES UP TO THE HYPE!!!!!

THis doughnut shop is fire! Like it's goooood. Idk how to say it but dude the flavor and quality is unreal. Best doughnut probably! Doooo go here!
I stop here whenever near Portland... Wish they'd open a branch in Sammamish, Washington. Even Seattle would be great!
I love all the different assortments and at a reasonable price... The Portland cream and the Raspberry Romeo is my 2 favourite picks. But always trying different every time I go.

Oh, Voodoo! I've had your first donut back in 2015 at your Eugene, OR location. 
It was just aiiight, tbh.

For the 2nd time, I was able to visit the ORIGINAL Downtown Portland location - and well, it was aiiight - but the location was so-so. I wasn't impressed that it seemed sketchy when we went (probably because we went at night - it's not advisable, just go in the daytime!) | parking would be better at night, though - you could snag a spot right close to it, but there would be some panhandlers near you. Stay safe & sound!

On another note, I was blown away & taken aback by the creativity and variety of selection, however the taste - not so much. It seemed that with all the glitz, and glamour, and dazzle of each donut & how it was made/decorated - it simply fell way below my expectations of how it's originally in Portland & what's it made it famous & quite popular. It does meet the average doughnut expectation, but if you're asking of the freshness of the quality & the distinctiveness of Voodoo Doughnuts from other donut shops/chains, it just wasn't there. It seems odd I'm still giving a 5-star review, but, for the sake of its uniqueness and weirdness, then why not?! The other plus side, is their workers are SUPER friendly and accommodating! Having stepped in around 10 or 11 p.m.- ish on a weekend night, the workers didn't show no sign of being lazy, or having ignored us once we stepped inside - but rather, catered to our needs & asked us what we wanted! Good customer service is always a good sign for quality service, wish I could say that about their donuts LOL.

Overall, it's just all for show, and nothing quality about it - I guess it's truly about quality NOT quantity. It really is all about the hype here at Voodoo. If you haven't eaten a doughnut here, you aren't missing out on much. You can simply go to your local grocery store, pick up a box of cereal, grab a glazed or chocolate doughnut from your local doughnut shop, and throw everything together. That's just how i feel. Overall, it was a good experience visiting both locations.

This place has been on my bucket list since I was a little kid. I was nervous to come in thinking that it might not live up to the hype. It was better then I expected. The donuts were amazing and staff was friendly and helpful. We came in at a good time where there was no line at all. I cant wait to come back to portland and eat some more donuts

Maybe it's a tourist trap or whatever...all I know is I saw it on the travel channel forever ago, I love donuts, I'm a tourist, and I'm in Portland, so...I went.  I  Boston Cream donuts and the Portland cream was amazing! The voodoo doll isn't just a gimmick it's a delicious donut. Tourist trap or whatever, I consider myself trapped and extremely happy about my tasty experience. If you find yourself in Portland and you like donuts, just do it!

Voodoo is a must see in the "Welcome to Portland" Tour.  What other city can brag about an all-night hole in the wall donut shop that proudly carries bacon donuts, educates the city with free swahili lessons, and periodically hosts donut eating contests?

Expect a bizarre crowd in Voodoo on any given night during the late hours.  It's a wonderful place to people watch while scarfing a gut-busting late donut.

Vegan friendly, too!

What hasn't been written or said about Voodoo? 

Visited Voodoo on Christmas Eve. Surprisingly, the line was small, and we got through in five minutes. Service was great. On the recommendation of the cashier, I got the Memphis Mafia and my wife got the Raspberry Romeo.

I was surprised by the flavor of the Memphis. Think apple fritter but banana with a drizzle of peanut butter and about a bag of chocolate chips on top. The romeo was also good and the filling was great.

What's great about this place (other than it's overall aesthetic and character), is that they offer vegan options. Check out the bottom of the carousel. 

Even if the donuts were bad, you'd still pay them a visit, but the donuts are good, so buy a box. And maybe some water. The sugar really kicks in halfway through.
Gumball doughnut and the maple bacon bar were a huge hit!
Absolutely delicious!  There are many tasty reasons why this place always has a line outside it.  Thanks for making my first trip to Portland, OR so great, Voodoo!

What can I say?  Definitely a tourist trap but a fun one at that.  Only about a 10 minute walk from the Kimpton Monaco Hotel, this place is fun and only slightly inappropriate.  Donuts with names ranging from the simple Bacon Maple Bar to the Cock and Balls there should be the donut to suit every taste . If you are ever visiting Portland it's a must try.
When Emma favorite donut places. There's usually a wait but it's well worth it. Great donuts always fresh.

A must stop when in downtown PDX. From exotic to simple, I kept it simple this time... Glazed Old Fashioned and a Maple Old Fashioned, perfect with hot black coffee on a cool day! Something for every taste...
Greatest donuts I have ever had! I voodoo donuts are super delicious! You gotta try it for yourself if you have had a voodoo donuts!

What's not to love about this quirky place? We ordered the Voodoo dozen ($20) and did have to wait in line for 1 hour but it was worth it. Now i'm not a doughnut snob but I do eat my fair share and these doughnuts had flavors i've never had before! The strawberry was my favorite and the captain crunch one was my second favorite. It was just amazing and these doughnuts are super yummy the second day too. It did not have any type or artificial flavor after like when you get grocery store glazed doughnuts. It was far from that.
Just as great as the world says they were.  Big fluffy pillow like doughnuts with tons of great toppings. The ODB was our favorite of the bunch though.

These doughnuts are legendary so it's not a surprise that we make it a point to stop by when we're in town. I'm also very happy that they have amazing Vegan doughnuts (since I was vegan at the time) and I was able to enjoy the classic chocolate covered donut. The one pictured here is my husband's and he thoroughly enjoyed it! Meaning - it was gone in the matter of minutes. Can't wait to visit when things settle down
Awesome donuts. They have all kinds of toppings and icing for the donuts. Sometimes there's a line but it's worth it. Right next to kit Kat club too so thats a plus

Oh how my office loves "Stoner Donughts". They smile and laugh every time I bring them in, which is about twice a month. 

The maple bacon bar is my personal favorite. One of the guys in the office said he liked apple fritters, so the last time I went to Voodoo, I got a little smirk on my lips and ordered a Memphis Mafia (Banana fritter drizzled with chocolate and peanut butter with sprinkled chocolate chips and chopped peanuts). He laughed and was not able to finish the whole thing as it really is as big as your face. 

I was in there the other morning and gave serious consideration to buying a bucket o' donuts. Just remember to stop of the bank first, cash only but there is an ATM inside.

Wow is all I can say. We came here specifically for the vegan doughnuts and were amazed! We tried the apple fritter, sprinkle cake, maple bar and jelly filled and all of them were incredible. The line was well worth the wait and the service was efficient and friendly. Cash only FYI. Definitely worth the stop!
Masterful classic. How can you say no? Definitely a tourist trap but at times worth the wait if you have friends in town. My only gripe is no good coffee at the 2nd location on Sandy.

I can't believe I spent a week in Portland and didn't get one of these. So this based on last months visit and sampling. 

VooDoo has crazy long lines and quite the following so my expectations for taste and quality weren't super high. 

However the donuts, as donuts go, are pretty amazing and worthy of the caloric splurge. 

Maple bacon and Captain Crunch were my favorites. (Don't judge I was here for a week)

Cash only!

We ended up here as our last stop on our doughnut tour. Fun place to go for a different type of treat. Let me tell you the maple bacon doughnut is AMAZING. The bacon on top is perfection, I actually took all of the bacon off my husbands as well! The seasonal needs pink lemonade doughnut is sweet, but of course delicious. Overall we will be coming back.

I was in Portland for a week and saw people carrying boxes of Voodoo Doughnuts. I choose one cake blueberry doughnut. After eating it I experience a carb crash and fell asleep for a few minutes while watching Die Walkure. Eat with caution (I am 6ft and 128lbs, vegan, and not on any medication)

Price is okay about 1.50 - 2 for a doughnut and they only take cash. but worth it. They make a good doughnut. Even the plain doughnuts are fantastic but the specialty ones will knock your socks off. I had low expectations for this over-hyped doughnut  that I had to stand in line for 20min to get but they won me over with their taste. 

The old dirty bastard doughnut is heaven.
Great late night treat. The location in NE doesn't have the longggggg line that downtown has.

I was surprised to see this location had such a low star rating!

I enjoyed my experience at Voodoo very much so! The staff is very friendly and inviting. I'm just a girl from NJ trying to get some famous Voodoo Doughnuts! A dozen (bakers dozen 13ct) cost me $17 but lets remember these are not regular doughnuts these are extravagant XL doughnuts.

I've heard the line goes down the block on the weekends, I happened to visit on a rainy Tuesday afternoon and had no wait at all. Situated on a corner, the storefront is very small and grunge is the vibe. This is not your average cutesy bake shop. 

This is *HARDCORE DOUGHNUTS* the magic is in the hole.

Loved it especially the simplicity of "The Homer" strawberry frosted doughnut. 

Until next time, 
Tara B.

Voodoo Doughnuts did not disappoint! I've  heard there can be a really long line, but went on a Monday afternoon and did not have to wait at all. So many flavors it was hard to choose! The main doughnuts are pretty big definitely good for sharing, but they also offer smaller sized options which is nice. Service was friendly and sarcastic, in a purposeful way, to the fun theme
Must try in Portland. Long line but moves fast. I had the Portland Cream. It is a bit sweeter than Boston Cream pie, but delicious overall. Interesting interior, friendly staff. Fun! (Cash only)

I don't care if others say that this place is overrated and they have better donuts elsewhere. Those donuts were delicious and they were the closest thing to Randy's Donuts that I've tasted. Definitely worth the visit!

This donut shop was definitely the highlight of my trip to Portland, Oregon! I had more fun picking out all of the donuts than eating them, (but I had plenty fun eating them too).
My favorite was the Simpsons donut! They have the most creative, and funny donuts it's great 
I loved this place so much I sometimes contemplate making a trip out to Portland just for them! 
There can be and usually is a wait to get in the shop ( I waited roughly 15 mins) so come when you're not in a rush, and make sure to bring cash with you because that is all they take!
Happiness in a pink box
Love this place! They have a separate shelf for vegan donuts which is a plus! Come here!

Alright. I visited a friend in Portland and obviously have to do all the tourist things. I draaaaaagged my friend and her boyfriend here to wait in line (her boyfriend was really skeptical of the wait), and it actually moved surprisingly fast! We had our donuts in less than 20 minutes.

Obviously, the donuts were amazing. I tried the Grape Ape since it's kind of a must-try- it was a little weird to have koolaid grape flavor on my donut to be honest, but I ate the whole thing! My favorite was the voodoo donut and the maple bacon one. God but you really can't go wrong, so delish!

Thank you Voodoo Doughnut for sending treats for the Legacy Nurses at Good Samaritan IMCU! We love to have a sweet treat and we especially appreciate you reaching out to show us you care and are thinking of us during this time. 

Thank you for putting yourselves on the frontlines in our community by continuing to offer delicious doughnuts that not only bring us comfort but a little much needed fun! 

We are so proud of all the sacrifices our community is making right now! Thank you! We will get through this together!

Sincerely, 
The Nurses from 3NW IMCU
Stay Home & Save Lives

Sure, locals may say it's overrated and perhaps it's not THE best donuts, but it's a Portland icon, the donuts ARE fantastic, and at ~$1.50-3.50/donut it is reasonably priced!

Highly recommend the Memphis (an apple fritter dipped in chocolate and covered in peanut butter sauce) and Mexican Chocolate (a chocolate donut coated with sugar and chili specks-yes, it IS spicy). Didn't like the Portland Cream (not enough cream and the cream wasn't cold). Next time I'll try the signature voodoo (jelly) and hibiscus frosted.

Arrived at 7pm post-dinner on a Wednesday and had a 15min wait but the line was quadruple that on Thursday morning around 11am.

The stantioned pink line is probably not wheelchair accessible and the shop itself is crowded.

They sell a variety of stickers around $3 each.

Note to management: Wish you sold milk, empty boxes, and patches/pins of your signature donuts and neon sign!

Fun touristy thing to do. Long line but it moved fast. Shop was small inside with cool and creepy decor. Chocolate frosted donut was pretty amazing. Blueberry cake was average. There were purple tables outside of place to eat your donuts. Down the block were some cool looking shops and an outdoor market near the water.

LOVE the donuts at this place. We get Voodoo donuts as often as we can because the donuts are yummy as heck! My fave is the maple bar with the bacon on top; OMG! Ive seen it often imitated but never duplicated. I also LOVE the huge classic donut they have, so yummy!

If you're reading this, you're either a tourist or new to town. It's kitschy, but you should go. Go at 12:05 on New Years Day in 2014, and try to convince a group of drunk folks looking for a friend that he went another way (don't worry, they found him). Go at 9am on a weekday morning and grab a donut on your way to wherever. Go at a busy time and wait in line.

It's a relic that has become a tourist trap that will always end in a fun story to share with your friends. My buddy likes the voodoo one, I like the oreo one and the captain crunch one. The maple bacon one is a classic. Nothing they do is wrong. Just go get a donut already.

Donuts were bomb! There was no inside seating but we went during the day so it wasn't that bad, only waited around 15-20 minutes. I got the Marshall Mathers, voodoo doll, and Memphis Mafia.  Favorite one was definitely eminen!

The biggest and tastiest donuts around. I love the outside of the building. It is very eye catching. I also like how you can see all the donuts they have to offer spinning around before you choose. This is my new morning stop.

I don't bother touching most doughnuts, but I love excellent doughnuts and this place has not only excellent doughnuts, but an unusual array of very different ones.  From what we had, and we have had many of their doughnuts, the "different" ones are not only singular, but really successful and this is particularly true for some like the maple bar with bacon.  

It can get really busy, with a long line, but for doughnut lovers, I highly suggest sticking with it for a try.  Moreover, sometimes there's no line at all.

Definitely thought this place was all hype after reading that donuts are average but you go just to say you went but I'm so glad I didn't skip this place because of that because they were soooo good. We ended up going to VooDoo's 3 times in less than 48 hours. The Homer (strawberry with sprinkles) was my favorite, the Grape Ape (white icing with purple sprinkles and grape koolaid sprinkle on top) was my SO's favorite - least favorites: Honey graham (has creme filling) and the original with normal rainbow sprinkles were just average.

Although I hate waiting in lines more than anything, I will wait for some Voodoo Doughnuts within reason. 

On my second trip back to Portland, we learned the best time to get in line for Voodoo Doughnuts is sometime during the work day Monday thru Friday or Late Night on the Weekends. 

And those doughnuts are the sugar BOMB. Crazy combinations with cereal and candy and pretzels, jelly filled. My eyes are growing as we order up a whole pink box of them. 

We head back to our hotel, for some naughty good doughnuts before bed. We look forward to Doughnuts in the morning, not a long long line.

always had good luck with the donuts. The voodoo Man and the French crullers are my favorites, while my kids like the cereal and mm donuts. staff is always quick and even tempered even when the line is out of hand.
My favorite is The voodoo doll, very soft and filled with a delicious sauce. It's sometimes crowded, but after parties is a good snack.
A go to place every time we are in the area. They're doughnuts are unreal. Fun flavors and lots to choose from. There's always a line but it's well worth the wait.

I'm a vegan and buy their vegan donuts for myself. They are so good that I tested switching the ones with animal product with vegan donuts. And, to my surprise my non-vegan family ate them all and couldn't tell the difference. Voodoo Doughnut is one of Portland's must visit bakeries.

Errr mer geerrrd Amble Bacon doughnut... *Droooolllll*

If you don't like awesome don't bother... otherwise it is worth the short wait in line.
Love it here! The blueberry cake doughnut is my all time favorite! They now take credit card which is awesome. Make sure to go on the weekday to avoid the line.

During our recent family trip to Portland, we went to this place twice in a row.  There are huge selection of varieties, from traditional to novel flavors.  We tried Portland Cream, Grape Ape, Old Dirt and School Daze. They were all sooooo yummy!

I thought this place was worth the hype! Anyone who has visited Portland has been told to go visit Voodoo Doughnut so obviously I received the same recommendation. Thankfully I we visited on a Thursday so the line wasn't too long, took us about 5-7 minutes until we placed our orders. The place is small and you order your doughnut, coffee and walk out so opt for a nice day if possible. There is an alley with some picnic tables ans chairs next door where we took our doughnuts and cold brew coffee. Easily the best doughnut we had was the Maple Bacon! Literally breakfast in a doughnut, I loved it! Paired with a slightly bitter cold brew made for an ultimate mid day snack and pick me up. I tried the chocolate cereal doughnut as well and it was OK (made for chocolate lovers!). 

Voodoo was worth the hype for me because the wait was normal and the doughnuts speak for themselves. Not sure about other people's experience but my family and I loved our 30 minute doughnut experience and would love to go back.

#protip:  If you want to avoid the lines, get there when they open!  

After slaloming through the abundant urban camping population in the area, I was able to grab a couple of donuts for breakfast (and what turned out to be a very tasty snack on the plane home).  I got a Captain, My Captain and an Old Dirty Bastard.  They were so good, but had enough sugar to make my teeth tingle.  Pair with a large cup of coffee, pretty much heaven.  if you have a moment, check out their donut descriptions.  pretty colorful, to say the least.

#protip2:  cash and carry.

Mark you're lit!!! My boyfriend and I pulled up to voodoo for a late night craving and we weren't aware they closed at 9 pm!! Mark just happened to be leaving and gave us a free box of doughnuts  thank you so much! You're awesome! Funny thing is we haven't had a doughnut in years and had a craving. Awesome experience, thank you 



-thoughtcloud leo & Charlette

The magic is in the hole! When in Portland, we always visit VooDoo Donuts. Line is long, but usually fast. But if the downtown area is not your scene, they have a 2nd location with plenty of parking ad practically no line.  My favorite is the Boston creme filled style and the famous maple bacon. Good things come in pink boxes!

Unique shaped donuts. I recommend Maple Bacon bar, The Loop Doughnut, Voodoo Doughnut, Grape Ape, and Old Dirty Bas. To avoid waiting in a long line I recommend going a little later during the day. 

Open 24 hours
Best donuts!! I wish they had one on utah! If you're even close to one, you gotta go!!

I've never been to a doughnut shop that has over 100 varieties to chose from, and that alone is worth 5 stars! There's plenty of vegan options or even some topped with bacon, m&m's & Captain Crunch, so whatever you're in the mood for, I'm sure they have it. I went with one of the most popular and classic choices: the Portland Cream. It was super moist and filled with delicious pudding and topped with a chocolate frosting. They've also got a similar option called "cock and balls" if that's you're kinda thing haha! They also have some bottled beverage options and only accept cash.

Fresh, lightly oiled, donuts with just the right amount of sweetness! Excellent ratio of dough and sugar. Great variety of toppings and combinations to stir your food imagination to curb that sweet tooth anytime if the day-24/7 operation! Super nice staff but hands down an awesome donut shop for all ages. A must!
We got married here last week. Pretty effing cool. Best wedding, ever. Super punk rock place!

Worth it!! I was skeptical because I've already had these doughnuts .. there is a location in north Hollywood ...but when in Portland and after eating and trying the place... I ended up falling in LOVEEEE with the doughnuts and even though the flavors are like whatttt ummmm noooo I don't think that sounds good ... IT ISSSSS GOOD!! 

Just go for it and try it
The line moved fast on a cold winter morning and the place right across from the shop  is called fuse... u can get a delicious latte from the pretty baristas :) 

Something about having these doughnuts fresh ... it just tasted wonderful!!
