I love the maple bacon ... the bacon is a nice cut cooked perfectly to a crunch and the doughnut sauces and fillings are like no other!! It just taste sooo good!! 
I also recommend the "Portland doughnut" I usually don't care for filled doughnuts but it is delicious!! 
The voo doo doll doughnut is also really good!! Again the filling isn't your typical expected filling .. tasted like homemade jam!!! 

Next I want to try the coconut guava filled doughnut ... it's looks so cute with its Hawaiian umbrella!! 

If your visiting Portland you gotta come try the voodoo doughnuts - it's totally worth it

Love me some voodoo  they now except cards which is a huge plus. Be prepared for lines that look long, but don't be afraid! They go by super quick. The crowd is alway a bit sketchy around the area and there are beggars right outside the door, but that's expected for a major city, just be aware if you're not used to it.

Visiting Portland for the first time, Voodoo Doughtnuts was a must try for us. The place was quite small but the people were friendly. I was so surprised at how inexpensive the donuts were too! 

We got the captain crunch and the voodoo one. We liked the captain crunch more than the voodoo one.

Check out my ig @linhtvo for more photos and places to check out in Portland!

I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious these donuts are. Honestly was not expecting anything spectacular due to the hype, thinking they probably don't try as hard anymore since they're already popular.. Happy to report I was wrong! We got a dozen donuts and every single one was as delicious as the last. Soft, cakey, fluffy, moist, sweet... mmm mmm so yum! Tasted so fresh! The jelly donut I got tasted so good, the jelly was so fresh and nothing tasted artificial. Super cute inside. Love the theme. There's a bunch of 5 star reviews and here's another one. Definitely give this place a try!

"The magic is in the hole" - it really is. If I could ever dream of a concoction of magic, creamy, addictive, sweet, savory, and orgasmic.. all in one hole.. it really is Voo Doo Doughnut. 

Really, the line to wait for Voo Doo Doughnut on a Saturday morning over Labor Day weekend was 75 minutes long. Seventy-Five-Fucking-Minutes of my time that was entirely all too worth every damn second. Yes, it was worth it. Would I wait in that line again, probably not. But visiting Portland, everyone has to try this place at least once. The magical question of the 75 minute wait was "do these doughnuts have drugs in them?" These people go crazy over a cracked out doughnut?

So no, there are no drugs in the doughnuts, but you really feel like it when you have a 5 minute long moment of euphoria and tingles all over your body after consuming a maple bacon bar or ODB (Old Dirty Bastard). 

-Cash only
-Vegan doughnuts available
-Stop by Stumptown Coffee on your way over for a beverage to hold you over
-Try the maple bacon bar no matter what.
Love these donuts!! Can't believe how long people will wait on this line!!!! My favorite in the city. You know we had to bring our visiting friends here.

Had to check this place out while in Portland- I enjoyed it very much! I went on a Thursday early afternoon and did not have to wait in much of a line,  however as I sat outside at their picnic tables, a pretty substantial line formed out the door. The mango doughnut was INCREDIBLE, with tons of cream filling. The hibiscus was another favorite. I wish I could go back for more.

Very nice an original place.
Home made doughnuts with very weird but awesome flavors.
Of course you should try the one with bacon on it

Wow.

My brother and friend weren't kidding when they said "You HAVE to hit up Voodoo Doughnut in Portland!".

"Old Dirty Bastard"...damn are you good to me! Oreo encrusted doughnut drizzled with peanut butter for $1.75. *drool*...Devoured in...matters of minutes...

And this is just ONE out of over 20 different very unique flavors they have for you to venture. Creative, and totalllyyyyy not PC named. Hah. Check their site for details.

The place is a lot smaller than expected (pretty much a hole-in-the wall), and is located in a very ghetto/janky area of Portland, but I think this is what makes the experience so much more authentic.

It isn't all decked out or clean looking at all -- in fact, on the contrary -- it's really dirty looking and there are vagabond-esqe people and scruffy dogs sitting in front and all around the block. 

But that's what makes this place SO cool and so genuine.

Also, they're opened until really late (2 or 3am) and open ridiculously early - so you can come practically 24/7!

If I lived in Portland...I definitely could see myself coming back here for a good splurge very often.

Be aware though -- parking is really hard! (Atleast on a Friday night..)

Line out the door, but the pressure was on to hit this popular tourist attraction. Our family got a variety "dozen", I think it turned out to be 14, and they were delicious and different. The atmosphere is a fun scene of heavy metal, turning doughnut indulging, into a more exciting and rebellious experience--which at 44, it is . The mango doughnut is insane. It was actually heavy. Wouldn't recommend eating it while driving.
Tons of donuts!! Crazy and old fashioned. Don't get anxious about the line. It goes quickly with 5 cashiers at the counter!

Go early to avoid the long lines! I went for the bacon maple donut (no brainer) the French press coffee next door washes it down perfectly.  You don't need a reminder to go here you see tons of people walking around with pink boxes.  Did I mention this City is nuts and I love the eccentricity.  I look up to see a ratted out truck playing circus music pass by while operating a dog puppet, Now I know where Triumph the insulting Comic Dog came from.

Still classic. Yes, it's where EVERYONE wants to go when they visit, and there are great options. But the staff is friendly and the donuts are terrific. Formerly sleazy Burnside skid row. Not too bad now. Go during the week. Sit outside on a nice day. Weekends? Especially Saturday market? You might want to rethink. The. Coffee is only ok, and iced coffee comes in a bottle. But the donuts are great

This is a great donut Landmarc in Portland! I was visiting in town and you know I had to stop by to try a doughnut! It was the day of the Super Bowl I can see in my photos they had video donates to stick pretzels in depending on which team you want to win. It's little details like that that make you want to come back to a nice Portland landmark!

Amazing donuts!!!!! OMG! We came here a bit after our friend and she suggested that go to voodoo to check out one of Portland's pride jewels. Not kidding, it was foodgasm and I don't even like donuts. I never eat donuts. The thought of doughnut has never been appealing to me. This, my friends, was seriously mind blowing. 
The place is open 24/7, which is good if you want donuts after a night out partying, for breakfast or just for no reason at all because you are a free human and if you want donuts at ungodly hours you might as well get them!!! 
We ordered 3, and it was hard not to order more for 2 adults trying to not gain a million pounds while eating our way through Portland. The lady behind the counter was so kind and helpful (and she had a great style) helped us narrow down the sugar bombs that would become ours. We ordered 2 dough-y ones: a dirty old bastard with vanilla frosting, cookie crumbs and peanut butter drizzle and a dirt one, vegan I believe with vanilla frosting and crushed Oreos. We also ordered a cake one, much smaller and more reminiscent of your traditional donut, with crushed up butterfingers on top, our Voodoo representative's favorite! 
Have I said OMG yet?!! While all 3 of them were to die for, the big ones were our favorite. The texture of the dough was very light and fluffy, it reminded me of a delicate brioche bread. The toppings were decadent and outrageously amazing. It's the bomb. 
I have heard that there is a rivalry for the best donuts in town between Voodoo and the Blue Star, and Voodoo definitely takes the medal by miles! (We compared... haha). 
Go, go, go! Even if donuts aren't your thing, it's a fun food experience and it's totally worth it. TOTALLY.

Always love this business for a great cup of coffee and fresh donut.  The staff always take their time with the patrons to make sure they always leave happy.  Not to mention the quality of the sonuts but they are Infinite Universe FAMOUS so I won't go into too much detail.  ENJOY.
I like it but sometimes time line too long in the weekend but they have many kinds and it is delicious doughnut.

The experience of Voodoo doughnuts was exciting from start to finish. The little corner shop has exiting variety of doughnuts that include the good ol Cock and balls, a voodoo doll, and cereal doughnuts! I got the classic glazed and Oreo peanut butter doughnuts that come in a pretty pink voodoo box. The feel of this place keeps the excitement of the city and it's passion for the weird all in one place!

I live in the SF Bay Area always wanted to try voodoo Doughnuts because that's all I hear about. And those pink boxes add to the suspense. Anyway my sister recently took a trip to Portland and she brought a box back..... they're D E L I C I O U S. The Boston cream pie was awesome! The maple bacon was to die for & the captain crunch one was good as well. If and whenever I make it up to Portland I'm definitely stopping in.
Good doughnuts. I like thier old fashions. They have 10 dollar buckets of day Olds...show up at 4 am and your almost sure you can get one.
Yummy, the only downside is it gets real cold, windy, and snowy or rainy in Portland and the long line is usually outside.  Great and wonderful food.

Sweet baby Jesus. This place is awesome. I've never seen such a selection of donuts before in my life. Choosing was super difficult. This is coming from someone who doesn't like donuts. 

My review is basically for one donut, the blunt donut. It is a cinnamon donut dipped in maple and covered in sprinkles at the end. Get this donut. 100% awesome.

It's definitely a tourist thing, but you can't leave Portland without getting one of these. Cash only. But to my shock, two donuts came to $2.30. What the hell? I came with a $10 and was expecting not to have enough money for two donuts. When she gave me over $7 back I thought there must have been a glitch in the matrix. I'm used to Georgetown Cupcakes where you pay $3 for a small cupcake. Here, you can get a giant donut for a dollar and some change.

One tip from a coworker who tried two donuts is that their regular doughnuts are definitely better than the cake ones. Mine was a regular and super fluffy and awesome so I don't think you can go wrong with one.

TL:DR - Long lines but wait is short. Voodoo mascot donut and mango donut are great. 

I recommend the mango donut because it's bursting with flavors inside. 

There's a line but the wait was short. There's four cashiers helping. When you're lining up outside, you can see what kind of donuts are on the window with names and photos. After you get inside you can see what the donuts look like. 

They have souvenirs like shirts, finals, and stickers you can purchase. We always got the voodoo mascot donut and tried a few others.
Line was the shortest I've ever seen! We went around 7pm on a Sunday. Delicious and fresh and still had a wide range of choices!

Voodoo Donuts is popular because it has an amazingly large variety of fresh donuts.  It is also an exciting, fun place to buy donuts.  With New Age music blasting in the background, excited conversations and laughter of people in line, we all know that we are in for a tasty treat.  To avoid the long lines, go during non-rush-hour times.  We went at about 11pm; there was a short line that started at the door and wound around once.  We were served in a few minutes.  We bought donuts and a t-shirt.  Love Voodoo Donuts!

If your in Portland this is a must amazing , came around 9:30am and there was no one , and the service is amazin. Although there are a lot of homelessness around the area. Don't be afraid. I love all the little decor and the chandeliers . The bathroom smelled really bad ;(

I heard that Voodoo gets pretty busy. Showed up at 9:00am on a Saturday morning and there was only a few couples in front of us (wasn't bad at all).

It is a popular spot as more and more started to show up and people were seated outside enjoying their donut.

Huge variety - unlike any donut shop i have been to before. I always get the Bavarian cream and it was on point. The coconut guava filled donut was also excellent and so was the earl grey donut. 

If you're a fan of donuts or want to try a very very good donut - check out Voodoo
This shop has the most unique and cheeky doughnuts I've ever tasted! A visit to Voodoo is always a must when I'm in Portland.

We came here during Covid and the riots. Most of downtown was closed and boarded up but this place was opened! I was happy to visit a hotspot while in town. There was a long line but it moved quickly. The line was organized with gates like how they have it at the clubs. There are pictures of the donuts on the windows by the line which I think is great so you can decide what you want in advance and not stall the line. We pretty much knew what we wanted because of the pictures. It's a great visual for kids too so they can just point at which one they want. The public restrooms were closed due to Covid so good luck finding a restroom in downtown Portland cuz it's basically impossible. I think I paid with Apple Pay. The donuts were fun to eat. I am not a donut person so I can't say I loved it because I don't really like donuts in general lol. I like Krispy Kreme though lol. My kids liked the donuts here. They were very fun to eat and unique looking. I think we have Psycho donuts back home but it's nothing creative compared to Voodoo! Overall Voodoo is a must hot spot if you're visiting Portland! It's right by the KEEP PORTLAND WEIRD sign! You can hit two hot spots within minutes!

I donut want to sugarcoat it, so I'll tell you the hole truth and nothing but the truth...VooDoo Doughnuts is the bomb! All the blood, sweet and tears of waiting in that line for maybe a half hour at most was worth it. Donut forget to bring some dough because it's cash only (they do have an ATM if you forget, but batter safe than sorry)! All my friends were jelly.

They offer a wide variety of doughnuts and I wish I would've tried more flavors but I'll definitely be back another time! My favorite was the Bubblegum one; the taste was close to that of the Double Bubble Gum and if I took those blindfolded taste tests, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference! Well besides the texture obviously, which was so fluffy and soft! Even the normal glazed ones tasted amazing. You can tell it was fresh and beats the average doughnut chains out there. 

Donut worry, be happy and enjoy the sweetness of life through some doughnuts! Life is too short to count calories when you could be counting blessings.

Delicious donuts! I had a glazed old fashion (my favorite go-to) and a hibiscus pink and chocolate sprinkle glazed donut (wanted to try something unique). Both were awesome. What a cool place! My cousin recommended I go to Voodoo years ago, but it took me all this time to make it to Portland. Voodoo is a Mustdoo!

This is a tourist trap! But I see why! This was my favorite place in Portland when we visited. People don't hate me, but there was no line on a Friday morning. I was planning on coming on Monday morning but on our way to Stumptown Coffee, we saw there was no line and ran in. I'm glad we did because on Monday, there was a line and we didn't have time to wait. CASH ONLY.  I'm sure if there was a line, I wouldn't have been as happy, but ease of our experience and the great tasting donuts makes this 5 stars! We got the $24 dozen and had them chose. I ate a bite (or more) of each and throughout the rest of the trip, they stayed good and I nibbled on some every morning. It made my day. The box itself was cute!

Atmosphere: 4/5. It's cute and neon-colored. I get a trendy/punky vibe from this place.
Service: 4/5: Quick and efficient

Let's move on to the stars of the show, the donuts. 
Donuts: 5/5 Honestly, I was glad I had them pick, because I wouldn't have been able to. I would have shied away from the crazy looking ones. There were a few I didn't like in the box, but that was due to personal preference, not because they tasted bad. 

They were each unique and actually very delicious. The donuts (old-fashioned and not) batter was good in and of itself outside of the craziness on top. If I didn't like the donut toppings, I'd just pick at the bottom because the donut was so fluffy and delicious. It would be impossible to list them out. 

Notables:
-They look awesome in photos! Be jealous, my friends of my beautiful box of colorful and crazy looking donuts!
-Grape-flavored donut (the purple one!) was so intensely strong so if you like grape-flavored things, get this! This was unique.
-Voodoo donut: So cute and unique. Tasted good too!
-Oreos on donut: My personal favorite! But then again, I also love cookies and creme ice cream.
-The old-fashioned batter (not chocolate) had nutmeg in it which I love!

Cons:
Cereal was stale. Was that on purpose?
Peanut butter chocolate wasn't my taste preference
Maple Bacon was okay, but I'm not the biggest bacon fan. The bacon seemed old.

Didn't think I could write this much about donuts... XD. I don't even like donuts that much, but this is something you can't find anywhere else (that I know of). I'll stop here before it becomes a novel.

Today was my first time coming to Voodoo Doughnuts with my partner and we loved it! we're visiting Portland from California and we made sure this was our first stop !
the service is nice & quick. we didn't know what to get so the cashier helped us a bit (: 
can't wait to come back soon !

Really delicious! Lived up to the hype!!! I was told to visit the competition. I did a taste test of the basic glazed. Voodoo had a light and perfectly glazed doughnut. The competition had taken the glazed so far from it roots it was Hard to consider it a glazed.

Was skeptical at first because of all the hype- but definitely worth it! We tried the Portland cream, earl grey with hibiscus drizzle, and the chocolate cake, as well as a few vegan options. All were delicious. Staff was friendly and there was no wait!

I could try all these doughnuts but I don't think I'll ever be able to step off The Homer. I really can't put into words the event that happened in my mouth yesterday. That sounded bad. It was the best... I'm going back today to make sure it wasn't a dream. I would recommend this. In fact it's going to be the first stop when friends come into town.
Absolutely the craziest and most creative donuts EVER!

There's a line.   A long line.  

And It's not because this place has been on Man V Food, Triple D, and a host of other food channel shows.

It's because they make dark and nasty deep-fried dough with all the double or triple sinful shit you'd ever want or dreamed of from childhood delights; served up all..night...long....

Shiites.  It's like sex.   Sweaty, hard, dark, passionate, forbidden, vaguely violent screaming sex.   Bad, good, sinful.  All. night. long.   

And you fantasize about what can be done with bacon, fruit loops, peanut butter, and...doughnuts before.   And a long time afterwards.

Heaven help me.   I'm under Voodoo's spell.

So much history to this iconic Portland donut shop. Open almost 24/7 you can get you fix anytime you want. They have classic Maple bacon and My favorite the Portland cream. But what makes this place really cool is the culture and history behind it.  The voodoo which doctor play really well with the history it is said that they originally had donuts that were considered remedies and cures for such thing like headaches and stomach aches there has been pesto bismo, tums NyQuil and other wacky ingredients which led to this place getting so much notoriety. Ive been given a penis donut on from here in my bday. People come from miles around to check this place out and the lines ate often around the block. I'm pretty there is know in Disney now.  anyway I highly recommend checking it out just for a bucket list item and donuts are actually really really good. Another one I like which is kind of a seasonal flavor was Guava Colada sweet and delish

We tried Voodoo Doughnuts based on word of mouth from friends.  We ordered the bacon maple bar, memphis mafia, and triple chocolate donuts.  OMG!  They were all amazingly delicious donuts! We couldn't resist trying these donuts as we visited Portland.

This place has straight up the best donuts I've ever had. The dough is soft and fluffy and melts in your mouth and the variety and combinations of normal, slightly different and crazy flavored donuts you've never heard of before is seemingly endless. (plus the names are fun to order too!) My personal fave is the Old Dirty Bastard. The only problem I've ever had with this place is trying to decide what I want to get. Give this place a shot,  especially if you're a donut lover-you won't regret it!

Bow-Down to Voodoo Doughnuts as they created all the craze in the Doughnut world across the country, there's a reason for all the other Doughnut Copycats who try.........I had the pleasure of treating myself to sweet delights while on a visit to the city weird "Portland" as I say...... and oooohhhh how heavenly it was. 

The flavors were deliciously decadent and had me salviating........ they were fresh and simply splendid and live up to all the hype that indeed the Magic is in that Pink Box.

The best thing in Portland. 
Try to get here early in the morning weekday because every other time there will probably be a line out of the door. 
Excellent unique topping choices and you can taste that they make everything fresh daily. Most donuts can be ordered vegan if that's your style. 
cash only! plus points for being open 24/7
I ordered the sample platter which is one of everything and I loved every donut on there with the following exceptions. 
 the grape one (it tastes like cough syrup) and the blunt since by the looks of it there should be some kind of filling in there but there isn't. 

You can't go wrong with any other choice which is a rare comment from me especially for donuts. My goto: the signature voodoo doll donut.

Yes to donuts always but this place does it right! These are light, fluffy and airy and give you that perfect donut taste that you crave when you want a donut. Because the actual donut is perfection, whatever topping/icing/flavor combination you choose will only take your donut to the level. Meaning, it is not possible to have a bad donut here. 

The line can get rather long because again, this place is perfection. Do not fret, it moves fairly quick. Also, cherish the time you have in line and figure out what you want on the menu. The line moves quick and once you are up there I felt a bit rushed because they have so many people to tend to. So check out the menu before hand, look in the glass case to confirm and place your order quickly. 

They are also open 24 hours a day! This is good and bad because I am not sure when they put out fresh donuts but I can tell you mine was super fresh and was not in the slightest stale so maybe this isn't even an issue. 

I went with the chocolate dipped original. It had chocolate icing on top under that perfect donut. 10/10 recommend. My boyfriend had the cookies and cream. Also, 10/10 recommend. These are fun, beautiful and tasty donuts. 

We did the challenge where we tried a competitor donut and voodoo. Voodoo stole my heart because I do not prefer cake based donuts which is what the competitor offered. This place is a must!
Apple fritter and the blueberry one are my fav! Super soft and moist. I tried the peanut one and it was our least favorite, not too much flavor just taste of peanuts.
Nice service. Great donuts. Recommend stopping by
love love love the grape ape and mango tango

Pros: See my Voodoo Doughnut Too review, add outdoor seating and people watching

Cons: Cash only, long lines

So this is the first time I've been to the original Voodoo Doughnut. I went after a long night of bar hopping. Don't know if it had an effect on me or something, but the donuts tasted great. Even better than the ones at the other location. Line was not too bad, but it was after midnight. It was fun to eat outside and people watch. All in all, great to munch on after having a few drinks.
Favorite Doughnuts! Stop by every time I'm in Portland. Lots of cool choices. My favorites would be the Voodoo Doll & the Maple Bacon Bar

Incredible donuts, awesome names.... the Gay Bar? Hell yeah! And yes, it's worth it to stand outside for half an hour to finally step inside, get a whiff of all that sugar... Loved standing next to the glittery gold brick wall. I sang the "Follow the glittery brick wall, follow the glittery brick wall..." until the people around me started muttering unkind things. The second shop on NE Davis is almost as cool, but lacks a wee bit of the cachet. The only downside is that it's a cash-only business, but they're kind enough to provide an ATM for your convenience.

This is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in downtown Portland. At first I was grossed out by the though of the bacon maple bar. Although I decided to give it a try and it was pretty good! I think aside from that, the apple fritter is my second favorite.

The Bubblegum tastes like bubblegum!
The Grape Ape tastes like grape!!
The Maple Bacon tastes like PURE GLORY!!!

death metal music blaring for me and vegan options for the dirty hippies of Portland......
This place rocks 5 STARS

The hype is true.  This really is a doughnut shop like very few others in the world and worth every second of waiting in line in downtown Portland for.  But not just for doughnuts, for baked goods in general.

Sure they make their living here with doughnuts but of the menu items that I tried, their apple crueller was actually the best.  They do not skimp on the apple fillings and the thing is absoultely huge.  I could have eaten the thing for a full breakfast for sure.  The sprinkle doughnut was above average though, yeah, just a doughnut.  But the price was surprisingly reasonable considering that this place could charge literally anything and people would still come through for treats.

Of course the allure of this place relies mainly on the ambiance and while it would be great to focus attention on the doughtnut chandelier for longer, I did appreciate how quickly the staff moves people through the lines at the register.  I can only imagine what drunk people do with the dozens of doughnut choices late at night and what they have to put up with.  But they were no jaded at all upon my visit.  They had the Portland niceness down pat.

And the seating is surprisingly good if you don't mind making new friends at picnic tables and there's no rain.  I know that's asking a lot for Portland's weather.  But I couldn't ask for any more from their dessert scene after eating here.

Voodoo doughnuts were very tasty. They have a vast selection of flavors, types and styles. The pricing is decent and though there is a very long waiting line, it is very well worth to see the big attraction. Customer service is very polite and kind, and the decor is funky. Definitely a sight to view and a taste to try.

This is a MUST GO!  There's a reader they line up and wait to get in and order one or a dozen donuts.  Want to have people on the plane look at you with envy?  Take a dozen home on the plane that you picked up fresh before going to the airport.

If your a tourist definitely stop by here. It's worth the wait, long line, and the COVID customer wait due to minimum capacity inside the bakery itself. It's donuts left me speechless. High donut expectations start at places like this. It's definitely a gem.

Awesome donuts!!

We've been to Voodoo in Austin and we had to try it in Portland while we were there. A lot of our friends recommended Blue Star over Voodoo and we definitely disagreed. Blue Star was good... don't get me wrong... but they had like 5 flavors. Voodoo had TONS! And they were more creative. 

We got 4 donuts and they were all REALLY good. We definitely ate more than we should have.  I don't remember all of the flavors but I know we got a hibiscus one and a peach one. I think the chocolate one was custard filled and the one with powdered sugar on top might have been lemon or key lime filled. Anyway, they were all really freaking good!!
Maple Blazer blunt and strawberry donut are fabulous choices. And huge! Grape ape is also a great choice and unexpected!

I was here when it was a one room shack. My friend did a one man musical show on top of the bathroom (makeshift stage on top of the bathroom back then). I like that this place has survived, not many businesses can. Their stuff is the best! I can't remember (it has been a long time since I have been there) what the one with purple powder (grape) topping was called but it was my favorite. I was there when there wasn't even a line to get stuff. Back when the Church of Elvis was still around. Back when Umbra-Penumbra was still around. And Ozone Records still was around and selling tape cassettes of local bands. And The Big Bang was selling used 18th century gothic dresses to the upstairs crowd at the city nightclub 13 nw 13th. It's hard now to go to the downtown location without a crowd. But there is a NE Portland address that is less busy: 1501 NE Davis St, Portland, OR 97232.

The first time I came here I was not overly impressed. But I waited half a day to eat my Doughnut. Second time came with a couple others and we all shared. I had the Homer. It was great and we had a chocolate one it was very good as well. I love another place with a Star in its name best. But my gf who had both places in one day liked the yeast doughnut best from Vodoo. So don't be afraid of being a tourist or appearing to be one and hit the line, they are worth it.
really creative styles. not all are as good to eat as they are too look at but the maple bacon bar is enough to keep me coming back for more!

Are there any words, adjectives, expression left to describe these gems of air & sugar?
This isn't hype. It's not just a tourist destination. 
These things are really good. I stuck to the standards & was blown away at the texture, freshness & authentic flavors. No cereal encrusted donuts for me! The raised, glazed raspberry jam filled was REDICULOUS.... In all it's splendid simplicity.
& of course what man doesn't like his bacon & maple glaze? My man devoured his- leaving a devilish grin on his face that would do the VD donut crafter proud.
CASH IS KING HERE.

We were told we had to go here, I was like it's doughnuts not that big of a deal. I was WRONG! We tried 6 different ones; maple bacon, mango, strawberry poptart, Memphis, apple fritter and old sorry bastard. OH MY LANTA amazing. The service was amazing, the decor and atmosphere!!!

First time real donuts 
We went to the Vancouver side no lines like the Portland one, all pink building 
Thought just a gimmick to attract people but once we went back to the hotel and start tasting the donuts, it is much better then any donuts I had before
I'm visiting Portland for a week. And every sense I seen Voodoo Doughnuts on Man vs Food, I've been dying to come here. AND I DID!!!!!!!! AND I'M IN LOVE. I highly recommend

So glad we waited! Love donuts and never been much of a fan of the crazy fad kind but really enjoyed the humorous selection. Tried the bavarian filled and it was so delicious. Even splurged on a sweatshirt too!

Superb customer service from miss STAR! Friendly, helpful, funny-what more could you ask?! She guided us through the many variations of doughnut choices. I really appreciate her taking the time to go through the menu with us and being patient as we contemplated on our order.

I was thrilled and shocked to discover the many vegan options offered by Voodoo Doughnuts. I thought the doughnuts would be gimmicky, pretty in pictures but horrible in taste... however to my happy surprise, they tasted !!!!DELECTABLE!!!! I found myself reaching for too many bites at a time.  My favorite is the Old Dirty Bastard and DIRT. I didn't order too many as I had my reservations but next time I am ordering boxes like everybody else!

A++ for Star's customer service, friendly security and manager
A++ for yummy treats and a short 15 minute wait. Only looks long because of the 6 feet distancing but they are great about herding the line.

Probably not much to add that hasn't already been said by others about these donuts. But this is truly one of those destination items that you make a special trip to try if you're a donut aficionado. Part of what makes Voodoo so great is the creative and unique flavors they come up, but the other half is great execution where yeast donuts have the perfect amount of chewiness and cake donuts have just the perfect firmness. The flavors are all on point and not overpowering as well. This is all offered at a reasonable price, but almost a great bargain if you consider the satisfaction ratio to cost -- compared to other gourmet donut shops.

I love Voodoo Doughnuts. Unfortunately, my favorite is the large glazed doughnut (it's HUGE) just for the bread inside, but I also love the Voodoo Doll doughnut. My husband's fave is the bacon maple bar.

There are some whacked-out conspiracy theorists a la Alex Jones who say Voodoo is involved in child sex-trafficking. These people are delusional and need to get mental help.

Whenever I have a friend visiting from out of town or country, Voodoo is at the top of the sightseeing list.  My Canadian friend decided to bring a whole dozen home on the plane to share.  The Voodoo atmosphere is alway a unique one.  I prefer the pink location for free parking and a larger seating area inside.
Great music, friendly staff, and delicious donuts! Glad we made the stop here. I'd totally recommend The Homer!
Some could say overrated but I enjoyed this place. I think it's part of the portland experience so I had to!! The voodoo donut was actually amazing.

What people talk about Portland, they talk about Voodoo doughnut. When people talk about Portland, they talk about keeping it weird. I feel that Voodoo doughnut encompasses all of that. I recently came here for the first time on the day after Christmas. I would say that it is also a tourist spot for Portland, specifically downtown Portland. I came over for a first time visit to Portland with my future in-laws on a day after Christmas Wednesday afternoon and it wasn't too busy and that line wasn't too long. I am not too sure where they are exactly located at but you can for sure google it. If you are traveling by car, there is paid/street parking around the area. You can tell that it is Voodoo doughnut due to the pinkness of the shop.

Regarding the doughnuts, they have all kinds of flavors, they have the famous Voodoo doughnut, maple with bacon, maple, etc. for my first time, I got a half dozen of old fashioned, glazed, and blueberry which were all pretty good. Their glazed doughnut is pretty unique and bigger than your typical and average one. I love doughnuts and Voodoo is decently interesting. I would come back to try others. The staff and customer service is good. They are helpful with any questions and what not. They prices for everything is pretty decent too and would say that it is pretty worth it for the wait and for the doughnuts especially. The shop itself is not too big but still manages to get everyone in to take their orders. Seems like there is already a system in place for all of that. They also have shirts and everything for souvenirs.
Dialed in process for getting donuts during covid! I had the voodoo doll. I was a little sad at how it looked but it was delicious.

Voodoo Doughnut was a must on my to-do list for Portland -- even though there's a shop in LA, it just isn't the same. 

The Portland shop is considerably small, very pink, and quite busy. It's located in Old Town / Chinatown, which isn't the best area around. Still, it's worth the trip. Expect to wait a bit. The line moves quickly, but you'll be here about 10-15 minutes. Easy pink box to eat your goodies while on the move -- no extra charge for it, too. Friendly, efficient staff. 

Selection is extensive, and creativity is in abundance. I snagged the Dirt Doughnut (Oreo) and Butterfingering Doughnut. For both, it was about $4.50 -- amazing for the quality and size. I wasn't a huge fan of the Butterfingering (didn't taste much like butterfinger to me), but the Dirt was absolutely delicious. Soft and sweet, perfect to share or save all to yourself. For a couple of bucks, these donuts are well worth traveling for again and again. 

Keep in mind this establishment is CASH ONLY. They do have an ATM, but you'll have to pay a fee to use it.
Delicious and worth the wait.  Gauva filling with shredded coconut on top!  Maple cream and just so yum!  It's totally touristy and fun.  You gotta go!

Voodoo Donut, you did not disappoint! 

Not only was there a plethora of options, but extra points must be added here. The staff was incredibly patient with everyone who was in awe of the delicious goodness within reach at this location. With so many options we ended up getting a half dozen. We picked out our donuts, I have to say it was around $14-give or take. 

When you approach the building you can tell from the exterior that the interior wouldn't disappoint either if you're into the eccentric details. The brick walls outside had glitter painted over them. (in the best way possible, of course) Inside, the ceilings were adorned with golden chandeliers and a large donut in the ceiling too, pretty neat. 

There was a bit of a wait outside but they kept the line moving rather quickly. The donuts themselves were rather tasty. A lot of people would say that donuts are simply donuts, however,  Voodo is an exception to this statement. Not only are they very creative with the decorations, but some of these donuts were HUGE! A plus in my book. I think these donuts were above average. Everything we got was fresh, just the way it should be. 

Overall this was a fun experience for us and I think it would be for you too.

Such a fun doughnut spot that is open 24 hours when you need that doughnut fix. They have a fun selection like the Dirt (Oreo cookies), the Loop (with fruit loops), Oh Captain My Captain (Captain Crunch), the Homer (think Homer Simpson), and so many more. 

I got a small sprinkle donut (anyone who knows me would not be surprised by this), a small M&M donut, a Oh Captain My Captain donut, and the Raspberry Romeo (raspberry filled). You can tell they're fresh and Voodoo is just pumping out donuts all day long. I would highly recommend if you're in for a laugh along with a delicious donut fix.  They also come in these cute pink boxes!

Totally worth the hype and hike I took to get here! The line wasn't long at all and it was so hard to choose! I ended up with the maple blazin' blunt and a nossa familia coffee donut. Both were absolutely heavenly. So fluffy!

The line is crazy during the day but 10pm is a good time to go. I tried the vegan double chocolate one which was very "cakey" which I liked but it didn't remind me of donuts. I had a bite from the oreo vanilla one, it was crazy good. Although I am not a donut lover I would definitely go back again and try a none vegan one.
They only take cash, so make sure you have some ready.

Not too bad of a wait, tasty doughnuts, excellent service, cool trendy music, funky decor. 

Parking:  Street parking seemed to be nearby.  I walked here from my hotel.   

Service: Friendly, efficient, and helpful. I thought I would be annoying by asking numerous questions, but the cashier was helpful and answered questions.  

Doughnuts:  Tasty, fresh, and decent prices for such a famous place.   I ordered the voodoo doughnut (yeast doughnut with chocolate icing and a raspberry filling), a cake doughnut with strawberry icing and marshmallows, and another cake doughnut with M&Ms and icing.    

Atmosphere:  Fun, trendy, hip, with weird decor.    

Cost: Cash only - so prepare!   The cost was very decent, compared to other bakeries I enjoy.
Crazy for the Glazed! This is so good! They dont rip you off either, so its decent place for the money

Cheap donuts, like $1.50 per. Went at around 10:00 am and there was not a long line. Many options of donuts, I picked Portland Cream which was cream filled chocolate glazed donut. I'd give it 9/10. Cool rotating donut platform inside where you wait in line allows you to see the donuts up close before you buy. However, I've seen this place from a distance around lunch and dinner time and there is usually a 30 person line out the door.

Large selection, fast line, good prices, and tasty donuts. I ordered the old dirty bastard; the peanut butter was a surprise but it fit well with the rest of the donut. Overall, super happy with my visit :)

fun, quirky and reasonable tasty doughnuts.

ok, the lines are long but the donuts are fun and interesting!

are these artisan donuts? hell no! if you're coming to voodoo to find donut nirvana, you're delusional. seriously people, they are selling donuts in the $1.50 range. if you want something fancy head to blue star and drop $4+

Believe the hype my friends!!! Freshest donuts in the biz. We didn't really venture far from traditional. We ordered maple bars, glaze, cinnamon sugar cake and a Homer. All absolutely amazing! Soft and fresh. An absolute must when visiting Portland!!!

Before Oh Doughnuts opened in Winnipeg, I spent a -- shall we say -- "reasonable" amount of time craving real doughnuts minus dairy. So, naturally, Voodoo was on my radar as an example of what is out there in the world, and *could* be where I was, if only someone were so inclined to make such magic happen. This is all preamble to say that, despite my keen interest in the place, I had not made plans to visit when I finally visited Portland because my partner is allergic to wheat and they don't have gluten-free options. But while wandering through the city I spotted it from across the street and I knew it was meant to be. The line up was totally worth it!! At the recommendation of the person working the counter, I got the vegan Old Dirty Bastard. I haven't had anything that sweet in ages (it took me a couple of hours to eat it in small increments, actually), but I'm glad I got to try a little bit of vegan doughnut history from the place that makes the wildest and most memorable creations =-). (ps. I wrote this in 2015, saved it as a draft and forgot to post it! Just saw it now *lol*)
We came down to Portland for a long weekend and visited Voodoo Doughnuts a couple of times, but this visit we went pretty simple! The ability to order ahead and pick them up was a nice perk!
If your in Portland this is a must amazing , came around 9:30am and there was no one , and the service is amazing .
The staff is super helpful for visitors. They talked me through it even though there was a line. I brought a box home on the plane and my son was ecstatic. Voodoo you didn't disappoint

This place is a must visit for people visiting Portland. The doughnuts are truly creative, funky, delicious, and one of a kind. You have to queue for a while, but once you step inside, you can choose from a wide variety of options from the menus. Note: they only accept cash.
This place is amazing can't wait till they open one up north jersey area definitely going to be there

I had to make my way to Voodo while I was in town.  The line was so crazy, out the door and stretching for miles but the donuts are pretty stellar.  I had to pick up the famous voodoo man donut which is a chocolate donut shaped like a figure.  

The service was outstanding and the line moved pretty quickly so I wasn't tripping.  The decor is really nice.  Its a bright pink interior that kinda makes me want to buy more donuts.  I couldn't walk to this one though so I had to take an uber, but its not too far from my hotel. 

Overall, the hype is real.  The line is pretty much like a Krispy Kreme over where I'm from anyways so it wasn't too bad.  I'll be back again for sure.

So yes this place might be overly touristy and hyped now due to the numerous food network shows spotlighting this spot, but it's still very worth the trip to check out. We went very early in the morning on a weekend, so avoided major crowds. There was only a few other people in front of us so it was just enough time to decide on which ones I wanted to order. 

I went for the voodoo doll (ofc), maple bacon and the chocolate creme  one with eyes. I was really feeling the spot so I also grabbed a souvenir pink voodoo cup as well. The doughnuts were pretty good! I love how kitschy and fun the shapes and flavors are. We ended up eating them throughout the day. It was definitely worth the trip!

The most unique donut place I have ever been to. I guess when you are in Portland, voodoo donut is a must go to place. Each donut has its own taste and flavor. My favorite is the original voodoo donut. I mean who doesn't want to eat a mini donut shaped like a human. :) The outside may look dangerous but you will be okay. Go with a few friends. The bathroom is dirty at times but it's a city.

Wow just WOW!!!!! Get there with plenty of time to spare bc these donuts are so good the line is always poppin!!! The energy outside voodoo doughnut is just spectacular, despite the line, everyone is happy to lucky and excited about their soon to come sugar fix. The staff is friendly and helpful and will yell encouragement to the peeps in line (in a nice way ). They have lots of delicious vegan doughnuts to choose from! My favorites were the voodoo and the maple cream . There's a fun market right near voodoo that goes Saturday and Sunday and is a great place to walk off the treats you enjoy at the doughnut shop. I highly recommend trying ANY AND ALL of their vegan doughnut options!
Interesting combo doughnuts! My personal fav is maple and bacon!. Funky area of downtown Portland!!

Old Dirty Bastard, wow that first bite of you was pretty glorious. I've tried the maple bacon, viscous hibiscus, and the apple fritter, but not one can compare. It was like a chocolate heaven that melts in your mouth. The peanut butter makes the melt in your mouth all that better, the Oreo adds a little crunch to the bite, the chocolate frosting a.k.a the best part was so rich and chocolatey that melts in the mouth, and the dough is so chewy and delicious and the perfect proportion to the many things that were on top. I will reminisce of the old dirty bastard for as long as I am away from Voodoo's. 

If you like peanut butter, Oreos, chocolate, or donuts, SERIOUSLY, the old dirty bastard is worth trying even if it is diabetes and cholesterol in one bite.
Excellent donuts as always.  I can't remember what mine was called but it was a banana fritter covered with chocolate and peanut butter.  It was amazing!

i have never seen anything like it.  the pictures themselves in the donut shop (can i call it that?) tell it all, especially the kid eating a donut twice his size...then you taste one.  enjoy them while you can because you'll need to a serious break until your next indulgence.  love the flavors love the goth
This place exceeded my expectations. There was absolutely no wait when I walked in. (We went around noon on a Wednesday). The donuts were delicious and the service was great!

I had someone I work with bring in voodoo doughnuts as a treat for everyone as she commuted from Oregon to LAX to Ventura. These doughnuts had gone a very long distance in one day, was it worth it? Yes! I was only able to get a couple of pieces of some of the doughnuts before they were devoured. I had a bit of a lemon filled jelly doughnut, a chocolate doughnut with chocolate and purple icing and a vanilla doughnut with m&m minis on it. They were all great. They were a big hit at the office and a very kind gesture for someone to do. Definitely give this place a try! Some of the best doughnuts I have ever had. You should open a store in the Ventura area! Everyone loves doughnuts and they are very popular here!

We had a great experience at Voodoo today. The line moves very quick - the staff have the process down and are quite efficient. Voodoo has a great selection of unique, fun flavors. They are certainly not your average doughnut. Also the prices are fairly reasonable. I got the Dirt doughnut and the Homer doughnut. Both were very good. I recommend coming to Voodoo when in the area.
Most delicious donut ever. Long lines even late night for a reason. Must have maple bacon and The Homer. Portland is a very cool town.
Loveeeee these donuts! So many vegan options. I'm never disappointed! The Oreo donuts with the peanut butter drizzle  SO GOOD!

Satisfy your sweet tooth with this Portland go-to. The line wrapped around the building seems intimidating but with four cashiers inside it moves quickly. Staff was friendly and the donuts were so good. Be aware, super sweet!

Omg I can't rave enough about this place! The donuts were so unique and all the ones we got tasted amazing! The prices were all reasonable as well. The line was out the door but well worth the wait. Next time I go to Portland I'd def try more. A must try when visiting Portland!

This is a "must stop" when coming to Portland. The service is phenomenal and fast. Even with a line you can be in and out in 5 minutes. The variety of doughnuts is amazing and they each offer a unique taste. There is a doughnut for everyone! Not to mention the cost is low for gourmet doughnuts. There is outdoor seating as well so if the day is nice, you can enjoy your doughnuts outside. Overall, a "must go"!!

Yum!!!! My husband and I stopped here on our way back to San Diego from Washington. I ordered a Voodoo Doll and a Portland Cream doughnut. They were so delicious! The Voodoo Doll was adorable and perfect for a selfie, hehe. I loved that it had a raspberry filling. The frosting on both doughnuts was amazing and tasted so good! The Portland Cream was so simple and yet so perfect. The Bavarian cream inside was so tasty. I will for sure stop here again the next chance I get.

We got super lucky with street parking, which we had to pay for. The line was only 10 people deep when we got in, so that went by quickly! The exit and entrance doors being right next to each other does make it a little inconvenient coming in and out of the store when there is a line of people.

We went in the middle of the night for some yummy donuts. There was only one donut left but we wanted two and the lady was nice to offer us the one in the window for free.  Lots of different options of donuts that it was hard to make a decision on on what to get.  I'll definitely be back for more on my next visit.

So this place is always a fun spot to satisfy a sweet tooth. Unique Creative always packed and fun little adventure. Buy by the box or singles or better yet ask about there bucket YESSS I said a Bucket one massive bucket of still fresh donuts are sold at discounted prices after each 24 hr period. You have donut sitting in a box for a solid week so this is still top shelf quality at great prices. Swing by and enjoy the vibes.

Stopped by earlier today and as always, they have an amazing wide selection. So cute from the inside. Lines vary in wait time. There surely is a donut for everyone. A must if you're visiting Portland.

The homer the homer the homer!!!! Ugh it's one of my favorite things in life and tastes like strawberry pocky! I have noticed that the freshness varies and isn't consistent but when it's good, it's so goo!

BOMB BOMB BOMB!!  Went around 8:00pm to avoid the crowds and got 6 different types of donuts. The raspberry jelly filled ones are top notch but I have to say the coconut creme-guava jelly filled donut was the best!!!!!! I love tropical flavors but in a donut? They made it work for sure! Only regret was not buying more.
This a must try place in portland, me and my hubby loves their bacon donut.

Whoever says Voodoo donuts is overrated is WRONG. It's popular for a reason! The line can be quite long but it that can happen with a popular place. The decor inside is super cute and I love the rotating display that has all sorts of beautiful donuts in shapes ranging from normal donut to voodoo doll to straight up Marge Simpson. 

The donuts were super tasty. I'm pretty picky on donuts - I don't like them too "empty" if that makes sense but also not straight up cake and I thought the donuts here were a great consistency and the icing was also super tasty. I'd ABSOLUTELY come back next time I'm in Portland.

If I could, I'd rate this place 50 stars!! Oh my goodness! I swear on everything holy that this place makes the best donuts ever!! I'm from Arizona and never tasted anything like this. 
I highly recommend the old dirty bastard and the mango tango.  please expand your shop to Arizona.

this place is a real tourist attraction and they have delicious doughnuts. We got the Maple Bacon Bar, the Gay Bar and the Voodoo Doll. All three were yummy and we were stuffed with three and couldn't believe all the people leaving with boxes full of Doughnuts LOL
Amazing donuts. I can never come to Portland Oregon and not stop by to get these delicious donuts. Ordering online is fast and easy.
The line was much shorter than the last time I came. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The maple old fashion is my absolute favorite donut from here. Sooo tasty.

I would watch a two hour movie about Voodoo Doughnut's bacon maple bar.  With its masterful combination of sweet and salty, crunch and porous yeasted dough, that doughnut is too sexy for TV.  I had high hopes for the notorious doughnut, and I'm no stranger to bacon with sugar, but this thing blew my mind.  The doughnut itself was fluffy with a good amount of pull, and the thick strips of bacon on top were perfectly crispy.  The maple frosting was dreamy, and with the salty porky top, the doughnut was downright indecent.  It was, I believe, the best doughnut I've ever had and one of the best things I've eaten, period.

It was worth waiting in one of the slowest lines I've encountered of late.  We showed up at 11 AM on a Friday and there were a couple dozen people waiting outside of the shop.  It took a good half hour to get to the front of the line, and when we did, we saw why.  The shop is tiny.  There was one person working the register and getting the doughnuts, a friendly and, I might add, very cute girl.  The place has a lot of character packed into its small space - there's voodoo kitsch and Voodoo Doughnuts merchandise as well as a chalkboard menu on the walls.  Doughnuts rotate in a display case by the register, and there are hundreds and hundreds more in the space behind it.

Though there were several whacky doughnuts to choose from, we ended up getting pretty standard doughnuts other than the bacon maple bar.  Matt B. is a picky eater and went with a sugar cake doughnut and a cinnamon yeast doughnut.  I asked the cashier to pick my second doughnut and she recommended a simple blueberry cake doughnut.  All three of these doughnuts were great, though not nearly as memorable as the bacon maple.  The cake doughnuts had a nice dense, moist crumb and the blueberry had blueberries baked into the cake as well as cooked into the glaze.  Voodoo can do solid basics in addition to its more out there creations.

I can't imagine that anything else in Voodoo Doughnut is as good as the bacon maple bar.  It is the proverbial Chuck Norris of doughnuts.  Voodoo was one of our last stops before meeting Michael K. in Seattle, and with great willpower, I saved him a few bites.  Hours later, when most doughnuts are well past their prime, Mike had the same slack-in-the-face dropped jaw reaction I did.  I am sad that I can't have this doughnut whenever I want, and any time I find myself Portland, Voodoo Doughnut will be a top priority.

Visited Portland and everyone recommended VooDoo Doughnuts, when I heard they had vegan options we had to go. I'm not a sugar person and usually don't even eat doughnuts (or sweets) but this was the exception. The doughnuts wear great and tasted amazing! Very sugary and worth it ;)
What can I say other than... its Voodoo Doughnuts, they never disappoint. The doughnuts were delicious. The line is always the downside, but worth the wait!

Was in Portland for work in 2016, a short walk from Voodoo Donuts. Hands down the best part of my trip. Made ample use of the shop and the food truck. Everything I was had fantastic, fresh, and served up by friendly staff who put up with all my questions. Some of, if not THE best donuts I've ever had. If these guys ever open a location in or around Washington, DC, I'd be a loyal customer.
Oh my goodness, what a fun quirky spot! You must check it out and get your sugar buzz on! Trying the Maple Bacon and Portland cream doughnuts today!

My wife and I recently visited Voodoo during out trip to Portland. I made the mistake of reading the reviews before I went. I almost didn't go because some of the bad ones, but my wife decided we should go anyway, and we're both really glad we did. 

Yes, this location is in the bad part of town. You're in a big city, so not every part is going to be pretty and affluent. We did see a few homeless people hanging around outside, but they did not bother us.

The line. This is what made me not want to go. After reading reviews, I thought we were going to have to wait hours for a doughnut, but there was virtually no wait. We went on a Monday night at 8pm and there were maybe 10 people in line. Between finding a place to park and being, we were there for a total of 15 minutes, if that. I think it really depends on when you go. 

My wife and I both got the voodoo doll. It was delicious and very cute. Personally, I thought all the doughnut flavors looked very unique and yummy. The atmosphere was unique as well. Very grungy, very kitschy.

Overall, I'm very glad that I did not let my judgement get the best of me. If you're ever in Portland, Voodoo Doughnuts is a must. And don't judge a book by its negative Yelp reviews.

A must!  If you find yourself in Portland for any reason, get to Voodoo.  Bring cash (no credit cards accepted), and have some time to kill (the lines can be a killer), but the donuts are worth it.

My personal favorite is the Old Dirty Bastard.  It is a plain donut with peanut butter icing, crushed oreos, and a peanut butter drizzle.  The Voodoo Doll is a must try, and for the adventurous get a cock'n'balls.  none will disappoint.

Years ago I saw some food show go to Voodoo. This was when I still lived on the east coast and never thought twice about Portland. Fast forward to nowadays when I live here and have heard from locals that Voodoo is overrated. I was excited to go but skeptical that it wouldn't be so great and that the line would be awful. I was so wrong. We took family visiting from Philly to voodoo on a beautiful Saturday morning and there was no line! NO LINE!? Then we were excited to see all the funky flavors of donuts spiraling around, hypnotizing us in their donut trance. The donuts we picked out were all very tasty and fresh. The flavor options are fun and they even have vegan options. The only bad parts: cash only (but there is an atm there), and outdoor seating only (there are coverings though!). The building is sparkly and the line set up makes it obvious they can get backed up lines but we did not have that experience. It was a great visit and everyone was happy and pleased with the establishment and the donuts. Will definitely be back! Ps everyone walks around with big pink boxes in the area so it's super obvious they make good donuts! People wouldn't buy that many and walk around with them if they weren't good!

I hit the jackpot! I mean when you arrive to this famous place on a Saturday night and there's only 2 people in line in front of you.. Yep I screamed with excitement! Ordered the new cannolos to try. They were oozin with deliciousness. The almond and raspberry were fluffy and not crispy as expected. They reminded me of a donut, in a hit dog form. Share with your bestie if you'd like or engulf all 3 on your own. 
Go try this!
Yes they are wacky but they are top quality as well. The best donuts!

I LOVE Voodoo Doughnuts! In my four years of living in Portland, I've only been to the store twice (the original SW 3rd and NE Davis locations), as most of the ones I've had made their way to UP. I've had the Grape Ape (with purple frosting, hence one of UP's colors), Boston Creme, Oreo cookies, choolate peanut butter, Bazooka, and Sweethearts candy topped ones. I know some say they are too sweet, but for me the sweeter, the better! Both locations did have lines, but neither were ridiculously long. My only compliant is that Voodoo hasn't spread to DC. I miss you, Voodoo!!

A box of Voodoo Doughnuts came home to Phoenix from Portland, as a gift. I enjoyed the Voodoo Doughnut and the Ring of Fire. Yes, I ate the pepper, so my actual ring of fire will come later.

The Voodoo was absolutely delicious. I loved the icing and was super surprised by the raspberry filling, accentuated by raspberry seeds which leads me to believe it's real -- not some red-dyed, sugared-up syrup. Yum.

And the Ring of Fire was superb as well. I loved the donut -- chocolate cake with sugar/cinnamon(?) and a dusting of cayenne. Super sweet with a touch of pain. Again, yum.

You don't have to eat the pepper. I'm an idiot.

When people heard I was going to Portland for the weekend, I was encouraged to check out Voodoo Doughnuts. 

This was absolutely not what we had expected. They had old school games, photo booth, and chandeliers which seemed as if they were taken from a haunted house. 

Of course, there were the donuts each individually displayed and uniquely named on a rotating plate. 

The donuts and coffee were amazing. I loved that Dirty Old Bastard! Anyways y'all got to check this spot out they open all day which is no excuse to miss out!

I'm not a doughnut eater at all... I'm actually Keto.  But I will go off my Keto for a Voodoo glazed doughnut! That's the only kind I've had, but I've had it MANY time. No greasy aftertaste like KrispyCream (yes, I had them a few years back).

At last, I have been to and eaten from the offerings at Voodoo Doughnut's original location in downtown Portland.  It is immediately south of Chinatown, across Burnside, and smack in the middle of the Old Town / Skidmore Fountain /  Downtown areas.

They are getting a 5 because of basic math.  I would give them a 5 if not crowded.  I will give them a 4 since it tends to be crowded.  So when are they NOT crowded?  I was told before 6 am.  Sorry, but the suburbs and a warm bed are more inviting at that time.  

On a cool late February day on which it was not raining, the line at about 12 noon took about 20 minutes to get into the door and another 5 minutes to order and pay.  This enabled me to make this doughnut run without having to feed a meter for which payment is required beginning at 1 pm on Sundays.

I had preselected 2 doughnuts based on looking at their website rather than hemming and hawing with indecision at the counter.  I opted for a Neapolitan doughnut and an Old Dirty Bastard doughnut.  The first is a more subtle chocolate cake doughnut with strawberry topping and some marshmallows and costs $1.15.  The second is an overload of  chocolate with toppings such as Oreos and peanut butter and costs $1.95.  Truth be told, the donuts were excellent.

Again, if the line was always long, and it often is, it can dissuade one from going.  However, a field trip every now and then is indeed worth it, based on what I saw and ate.  The time in line goes by fairly quickly because Portland's weirdness is on display, so even the people watching is pretty good.  Consider the neighborhood it's in and that there's a wall across the street proclaiming "Keep Portland Weird."
This was a fun place to be.  Never waited in line for doughnuts but it was well worth it.  So many different varieties and each one was delicious. An awesome twist on an all time favorite treat.
Not much to say here, but the best vegan doughnuts in the world. Worth the drive from California...
Icon and worth the wait in line.  Close your eyes and pick...your taste buds will reward you!

As a doughnut lover from Canada, we have to say this is by far the best and the most creative doughnut joint we have ever tasted. Our friends recommended us to eat here and it was certainly a joy!
We ordered the apple fritter and the signature voodoo doll! First of all, they are not overly sweet! We loved how they are so fluffy and soft texture! You might wait a bit in the lineup but once you get into the shop, it is a joy to see! Definitely would recommend everyone to check out this special and creative doughnut shop in Portland, Oregon!

The first and last place I visit when I'm in Portland.....

An orgazmic experience of sugar & flour from the gods! THANK YOU GOD!

My favorite mouth watering donuts are the apple fritters and coconut donuts with white frosting....

Do your mouth a favor and buy a dozen.
The best with the cereals and candy bar toppings and don't forget the mango and hibiscus ones. All perfect for all times of day. The pb& j makes a great lunch.

Loved this doughnut shop when we visited for my birthday weekend a couple years ago! Plenty of choices to select from and it was next to the "Keep Portland Weird" sign. My favorite was their kreme filled doughnut and the chocolate covered in nuts doughnut. I'm also glad they opened one in Universal Studios Walk in California  because I was able to try a jelly filled doughnut at that location and enjoyed it, too! The decorations were all fun to look at as well.

i know i'm supposed to have a lot to say since i'm writing a review, but i have no words other than..

best doughnuts ive ever eaten in my whole entire life.

ok. see ya!

So I'm not a huge donut eater.  I like them but carbs and sugar keep me away general. That being said I do know when something is yum, and these donuts are yum! The line outside was certainly long but it moved really quickly. The girls inside are running a well oiled system. You are in and out without feeling rushed and just the right amount of warmth and friendliness to make it a fun experience. I tried the traditional glazed ( doughy and perfect amount of glazed sweetness) and a Diablos Rex ( chocolate cake with chocolate chip, not too much chocolate frosting and sprinkles for good measure). Both were very good but I preferred the maple glazed doughyness. 

Was it worth the hype, yeah why not?!

First time at this doughnut shop and I've never seen a shop open all hours of the day and night! Unfortunately due to COVID-19 they have reduced hours, but it's all about the concept. I tried the Raised Glaze and Dirt doughnuts. My sister tried two others and we enjoyed one that night and the other during the morning. Loved the customer service and practicing social distancing. Highly recommend! Try some funky looking tasty new doughnuts!

Does it live up to the insane hype? Well what I can say is that they make good donuts for sure. I haven't had too many donuts and I am in no case a donut aficionado (I'm happy with some krispy kreme or dunkin lol) but safe to say these were yummy and unique. And the art and vibe is trendy, fun, and Portland-esque.

Maple Bacon Bar ($3.75) - DELICIOUS. The salty bacon cuts the sweetness of the maple frosting perfectly. 

Old Dirty Bastard ($3) - INCREDIBLE. The Oreos, frosting, peanut butter - just amazing.

Oh, there was a line when we went. I'm assuming that there's almost always a line.

These are the best donuts I've ever had! I'll tell you why: anyone can throw toppings on a donut and a lot of places have similar toppings- but VooDoo has the best DONUTS. My favorite part of a donut is normally the toppings but I was ignoring those just to eat the actual donut. It was not dry in the slightest but also not overly moist. It's ridiculous all donuts don't taste like this! The donuts are pretty large. We were 5th in line and it didn't take more than 15-20 min. They have the flavors on a moving display so once I was in the shop, I understood why it takes a little longer for people to order. We found a close parking spot but I can see finding parking to be difficult most days.
Always love an ODB and Grape Ape. The climate of downtown Portland has changed A LOT through the years but Voodoo remains an old, faithful friend.

I saw VooDoo on the food network and salivated immediately. My next visit to OR I made it my mission to get a VooDoo doll of my very own. I am not a doughnut person but the dolls were so tasty with the Raspberry "blood" filling and chocolate outside that just melts in your mouth.
We tried Captain oh my Captain which was Captain Crunch all over a doughnut and that was good too.
The bacon maple was intimidating at first, but surprisingly good!

Three words. Death. By. Donuts. 

Seriously yo. 

On the day I went to Voodoo Donuts there was only a 10 minute wait- not long by their regular standard. I've heard that people wait an hour in line for these delicious mounds of dough. Talk about Heaven in your hand! Oh and also talk about gaining 30 pounds from not eating just one- ummm IMPOSSIBLE. 

Ordered 4 different flavors and let me assure you, no matter what you order, your going to LOVE it!! Mmm, going into withdrawals right now just remembering the soft dough and yummy sugary topping... Chocolate, coconut, custard... Shlerrrrrrrrp! It's a good idea to get a couple different flavors and split them with someone, that way you can taste many flavors of their amazing selection. I mean, who wants just ONE doughnut anyway?? If your a Yelper, your a foodie so, eat up buttercup! These sweet treats are AWESOME!
Awesome doughnuts. A must stop for visitors as this place is iconic. And now, they accept contactless payment!

This isn't a tourist trap. It is a very cool and interesting place with unique, and sometimes, risque DELICIOUS donuts.

It is open 24/7 and I have been there at midnight and there is still a short line. It moves pretty quickly.  The area around the shop can be a little sketch and there seems to always be someone asking for money from the customers. But, you can choose to give or ignore just like with any other place there are panhandlers.

Prices were pretty reasonable.

Try the "cock n balls" donut with an anniversary message custom written on it (no pre order needed)........always sure to please.

CASH ONLY.

They have vegan donuts!!! Yep, if you're Lactose-free, vegan, etc, they'll have something for you. Don't forget it's cash only and you have to know what you want when you get up there. The place is kind of interesting with a spooky feel, but nothing too extravagant.
Best doughnuts in town not a debate. Never fails me
Very creative and awesome donuts! Location is spot on and convenient. Very cool that their open 24/7! Regular glazed donut and chocolate donut for me is good enough!

What blew my mind was the fact that their donuts were so incredibly affordable. I thought because they have such unique designs and flavor, it would be quite pricey, but we about a 6 donuts and a coffee for under $12. 

Remember that it is open 24/7 so try to find a time where you won't be waiting in line for hours. We went on a Monday night around 8pm. There wasn't a huge line, but later into the night more people trickled in. Keep in mind, when you do go late, they may have run out of some flavors, but they still have a lot available late at night. 

We had the maple bacon donut- YOU MUST GET THIS. It was sooooooo delicious and it is so worth the hype. The bacon was nice and crispy on top of a moist maple glazed donut. I enjoyed every bite. 

It is CASH ONLY!!!
Mouthgasm sweetness. Must try if you love sweets like doughnuts. Customer service was great and line moved pretty quickly. Doughnut goes well with Stumptown coffee which is only down the street.
Great donuts as always, and such an iconic Portland establishment. Keep it going!!  The Ild dirt bastard and the voodoo doll donuts are the best.

I went here last night after dinner with a friend and the donuts were delicious. It was a baker's dozen. Our cashier was so nice and accommodating and most importantly the donuts she picked were delicious! They have a great variety of donuts and have really improved, i think my favorites were the cake donut with vanilla frosting and M and M's and my other favorite was a simple vanilla frosted yeast donut. They put so much frosting on top which makes the donuts super yummy! All the donuts tasted fresh and were recently bakedI highly recommend voodoo donuts now! The service was top notch and fast, both pluses!

AMAZING, the bacon maple donut is freaking the best thing in the whole world.  I literally drove 1000 miles to try this place.  Part of the plan on my road trip was finding a way to get here, and by god I did!  Waited in line for about 30 minutes, but it was part of the experience.  The glitter paint on the exterior walls is so cute!  But yes the donuts are where it is at.  All were great.  The old dirty bastard, yum!  The dirty snow balls, delicious.  But the cock and balls, yes that was full of the most yummy cream and coated in thick chocolate.  I did get a dozen donuts to eat for the three days of driving it took to get home.  I may even consider mail ordering donuts for my sisters birthday if they do that.  This place is worth the stop, completely epic !

One of the first things I did when I visited Portland in December 2012 was to stop by Voodoo Doughnut. (By the way, I've noticed from other reviews that many others made Voodoo Doughnut one of their first stops while visiting Portland as well!)  

This eclectic donut shop offers a variety of oddities of the donut persuasion.  Since I am quite picky about desserts and absolutely DETEST chocolate, I decided to stick with the colorful Miami Vice Donut.  It was delicious and was a raised yeast doughnut with vanilla frosting, blue raspberry powder and pink sprinkles.  I was thoroughly satisfied with my donut - for the low price I paid, I got a big filling.

My friend decided to be a little more adventurous and ordered the Cock N Balls.  Yes, the donut actually does look like the male sex organs.  Being as I was in the midst of my man-hating phase and the fact that I do not like chocolate (the Cock N Balls is lathered with chocolate... ahahah), I decided not to partake in this pleasure.  But my friend did thoroughly enjoy her donut (and its interior, which was only appropriately filled with white cream) in all its phallic glory.  You're welcome, Christina!

The doughnuts are worth the hype! Large selection of scrumptious looking doughnuts. They taste as good as they look. I really enjoyed the Voodoo Doll doughnut.  

Staff was patient and friendly while we mulled over the selection.
I absolutely love voodoo donuts! If you're new to Portland or you just have a late night sweet tooth, then voodoo donuts is the place to go!

I give 5 Star because it's as I expected. No seating area and when we went around 10am on Tuesday there's no line. So with that I would say it's def a must (not sure if I would wait for an hour for these donuts tho). They have a good variety of both bready and cake donuts. They are tasty but I don't really see how special they are to wait in line for. Price is great too, and they have a bunch of merchandise. 

Super friendly staff cute but freaky decor. 

Remember to bring CASH tho!

Bacon on a doughnut? Why would you do that?
Why not!

Would recommend oreo doughnut, or the doughnut shaped like a voodoo doll, there's blood inside (it is jelly filled).  Also, the one that tastes like grape soda, not sure the name of the doughnut though.  Got some of my friend's grape doughnut on my bacon doughnut and thought,

"Bacon doughnut tastes like purple drank!"

Also, would recommend trying at least 2 or 3 doughnuts because you will be thinking about it and regretting the doughnuts you didn't try all day long after you leave. 

A must for anyone stopping by Portland or driving through Oregon looks for Bigfoot.

It's gotta be good when numerous native Portlanders get married at Voodoo Doughnuts p.s. CASH ONLY!!!

Worth the experience at least once as a tourist for the quirky menu and view of the stacks of donuts and mountain of pink boxes. Seems like there's never really a downtime, as I went around 2pm on a Monday and there was still a line out the door. Everything is clearly labeled as far as the menu and where to enter and exit, and it helps to know what you want ahead of time. I went with a classic Portland Creme and a cup of Stumptown. Generous chocolate frosting on top, plenty of rich Bavarian cream filling, and two eyeballs of frosting representing "the vision of Portland." Pretty good afternoon snack for $4. The service is loud, outgoing, and surprisingly patient to those who don't know what they want. But come on, who *doesn't* want to read a menu ahead of time to find out what's in/on the Gay Bar, the Ol' Dirty Bastard, or the Cock 'n Balls?!
This is my first time at a Voodoo donuts and I'm so happy I chose this location! I love all of the vegan options made available. The service is fabulous and my donut was delicious!

That maple bacon donut is something to be truly celebrated!

Me and my buddy got there around 10am on a Thursday morning and there was only 5 people inside. I see in a few reviews that this place gets packed so score one for us lol. As said in the beginning that maple bacon was awesome as its the perfect blend of sweet and salty...great flavoring! My buddy got the apple fritter and it was huge enough for 2 people to share...he said it was pretty good and that he would def get again. They obviously have a nice selection of donuts that look pretty good. I regret that I did not get a chance to go a 2nd time while I was in Portland, but I plan to go back sometime.

Cash Only!!!!

This place is alright with me
A wonderful place. Friendly people working there, delicious doughnuts and the owner and ceo are the most chillest people ever. I love this place I definitely recommend it to everyone.

Oh my god, Becky, look at those doughnuts. Seriously though, how perfect is this place? I was on vacation in my boyfriend's hometown and he of course made a stop so I could get to experience the pink box. I was pleasantly surprised to see no line when we arrived and awe struck at the beautiful containers of doughnuts when we walked inside. I went for a bubble gum and the fruit loop while the boy grabbed a variety- all damn amazing. I know this place has a lot of hype around it but as a semi pro doughnut eater I can agree with the hype. Kudos, Voodoo! I'll be back when I'm in the neighborhood again.

The queue seems daunting at first, but trust me, it's soooo worth it! I got a box of a dozen and tried as many as I could get my hands on...the Cap'n Crunch was my hands down favourite. Despite the craziness of the place, the staff were patient, friendly, helpful and fun. This is one of the few places where they live up to the hype.
So many yummy treats! Who can have a favorite??? BACON MAPLE BAR!!!

Are you crazy you haven't tried the cock and balls dognut? These donuts are so good people will carry the pink box all the way home and then share with their families.  Very cool tradition for the 2020 lifestyle of the "rich and famous." Recognize that some people actually have to set there cell phones down to carry this pink box.  And if you don't like the cock and balls try the maple bar kit cat!

The spread here is so unique and eclectic, it's hard to get bored! My personal favorites are the mango tango and the Portland creme, but they're all amazing. For example, the topping on the homer tastes like strawberry milk. The only reason it's not my favorite is because I'm not a huge fan of yeast donuts unless they have filling. 
Did I mention basically everything is vegan? Definitely double check beforehand to be safe but almost everything is good to go. 
Shoutout to Kitty for making my experience extra awesome, you're the best!

Doughnut lovers of the world: all of the hype you have heard about Voodoo Doughnut is completely justified!!! These are not only the best doughnuts in Portland but in the entire U.S.A. I've been to top shops all over the nation, so I have some credibility. 

A trip to Voodoo should be treated as a culinary adventure, not simply a tourist stop. My mother and I were lucky to be in line behind a nice couple from Olympia, WA who make a pilgrimage to Voodoo every year. Being Voodoo experts, they recommended their favorite varieties to us, so we had a crystal clear picture of the half dozen doughnuts to select once we reached the front of the line. We had to wait about 45 minutes but the time passed by quickly because of the fun conversations with fellow customers around us.

For our six doughnut creations, we selected the Mango Tango, Old Dirty Bastard, Ain't That A Peach Fritter, Voodoo, Maple Bacon, and Blueberry Cake. Each was distinctly unique, had tasty flavor combinations, and were really fresh.

Love live Voodoo Doughnut! And please put a location in San Diego if it's not too much trouble ;)

Great selection of donuts. They are always in stock and the line is always long. I like how they have a doughnut truck that goes out to the community when requested. Prices are good. I don't like that the location on Sandy only accepts cash..

I had pretty high expectations for this place... and I must say, those expectations were met!

Granted there's typically a 20-30min wait time, but that just shows how good they are.
When I finally entered the bakery, it definitely felt like the Hot Topic of Donuts.

I was so excited for the different options to choose from. They have a menu on the wall, & donuts in the display window. I wanted everything! 
If you're interested on trying different/multiple donuts, you have 2 options: buy an assorted box of your choice, OR the server chooses half & you choose the other half. 
In all honestly, I don't think you could go wrong with either option.

I finally made my selection. Some donuts were pretty normal, other donuts were out there (even some adult themed - which I didn't get!)
Everything was delicious. Bacon Maple Bar was my fav!!!

I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in Portland!
Order ahead for curbside pickup.  They have yummy donuts.  I love sweet stuff so this will definitely satisfy your craving and then some!

Best doughnuts I've had in a long time...maybe ever. Delicate, airy batter that somehow fills you up without feeling overly heavy. Artistic and fun presentation - so many delightful creations (beautiful but might also make you giggle). We tried the Vicious Hibiscus, Guava Colada, Memphis Mafia, and Maple Blazer Blunt. All hit the spot.

The VooDoo experience is a must do in Portland. We like to take all our guests there for the fun of it. Parking can be tough.. We usually have to pay.  I get DISAPPOINTED when there is NO LINE ... Because the line is cool people is an interesting component!
